Name: jillg232
Title: Watch out for rip unpleasant ‚Äúguides‚Äù
Review: This was a last stop after a busy week on a business trip. So we popped in but straight away a ‚Äúhelpful‚Äù man advised us to put our shoes in a safe area to be paid for to keep them safe.  He then followed us and insisted on telling us things about the Temple.  He correctly named which hotel we were staying in ( I suspect he had seen our driver!) but I was by the end a bit concerned. He was acting as if he was a staff member but it was obvious he was not.  He then wanted money for blessings and our family names.  Realistically I could see that this money was really for him, which I didn‚Äôt mind.  So I gave him some cash.  He supposedly went into the temple to hand over the cash. I just can‚Äôt see that he did but I didn‚Äôt expect him to. But then he carried on and insisted on more money at the end. When I refused he became angry and abusive.  It was pretty unpleasant.  Sad to say it‚Äôs a beautiful place but just don‚Äôt engage with anyone.

Name: ravi s
Title: A working 8th century temple in the middle of modern Chennai
Review: A gem in the middle of the city. Look past the congestion and typical Indian craziness to notice the inscriptions that date back at least a thousand years, and read some of the historical plaques dating this place to the 8th century. This is a working temple, and has been for all these centuries!

Name: Krishnan R
Title: A place you must visit before you leave Chennai
Review: Every trip we take to Chennai, we always visit this temple. Very beautiful from the inside and out. Architecture is very historical. Lots of space and shrines and even in the inside-most shrine for Lord Shiva, they even implemented an A/C, something many temples in Kerala are lacking. Plus, no strict rules like Kerala has on taking your shirt off in certain parts or putting anything in a cloak room. Only one little pet peeve is that there are stray cats & dogs around the place. Overall, a must visit if you come to Chennai. Don't leave Chennai without doing this.

Name: Andrew D
Title: Chennai's Icon
Review: A must visit temple you should never leave Chennai without. It is an icon and the tall, decorated gopuram is absolutely impressive!

Name: Phaneendra K
Title: Must visit temple in Chennai Kapaleeshwarar
Review: Very high energies and you can meditate in this temple. Inside the shrine you have to sit and experience the Peace and your wishes will come true.

Name: Marry Joy
Title: Large rooms
Review: The room itself so nice and high ambiance strongly suggested for cuples and family so amazing breakfast

Name: Rajesh Padmanabhan
Title: Divine Energy
Review: Divine feeling filled with emotions, fulfilment and thankfulness. Relatedness and feeling of purity comes when in front of the gods and an energy booster. üôèüèΩüôèüèΩ

Name: Cyrus
Title: A must visit place who worships Lord Siva
Review: Good place to visit. A must visit place for an orthodox person (more specifically who worships Lord Siva ).Temple is in center of the city (	Mylapore Chennai ) and having car parking with reasonable cost.

Name: Alexander Litvinov
Title: Discriminatory rules
Review: This temple is terrible and should be avoided.  Temple rules are discriminatory on religious grounds.  Only Hindus are allowed in the temple.  A shame!

Name: Shankar B
Title: Excellent place for worship with family clubbed with shopping around. Plenty of eatables available around the temple.
Review: Excellent temple in Chennai with all deities and facilities are great.you cannot see such type of temples with surrounding areas with shops and establishments. Not to be missed.

Name: niluanu
Title: Worth Visiting
Review: Kapaleeshwarar Temple is one the most famous Hindu temples in Chennai. Located in Mylapore, this is an ancient temple dedicated to Lord Shiva., The temple has several shrines and open from 5am till 12 noon and again from 4pm till 9pm. It is worth visiting both for the religious significance as well as the architectural beauty. Parking space for cars is limited  and entry to the temple is free

Name: Ajith sarma
Title: For calmness of mind
Review: A big Saiva temple.At the centre of the city, with main deities if ammal looking west and kaapaleeswar looking north.There are other deities, of Vinayagar , singaravelan and Subramanian.Very vast space to have calmness for mind

Name: Sanath Kumar
Title: Good place. Great temple
Review: Superb place to visit, with all the basic hygiene in place .. must visit All the spiritual feelings that once can get are found in this temple

Name: Mr. Kumar
Title: Historical temple
Review: Great place to visit and evening time it's always very crowded but it feels very good to visit regularly there. Must visit place üòäüòä

Name: Shivayogi
Title: Family visit
Review: We have visited Kapaleeshwar Temple at Mylapore, Chennai twice in the month of Feb 2021, after a gap of almost 20 years. We visited morning around 7-30 AM, which is very appropriate. This is an ancient temple and Icon of Chennai, we had very good Darshan of Swamy and Amman. Very nice, and satisfied visit after a long gap. Unlike other temples, priests behave very decent and doesn't expect anything from devotees.The area outside the temple i.e around is very crowded with lot of shops hence the cleanliness to be increased.ShivayogiBangalore

Name: JohnBenso786
Title: Traditional temple
Review: Must visit the temple in Chennai, an icon for Chennai. visit it if you get a chance "om Namah Shivaya"

Name: Preeti C
Title: Architecture and sculptures are worth visiting
Review: This is an ancient temple and I visited in the evening around 5 pm , temple closes from 1-4pm so plan your visit accordingly. The pooja ceremony is worth watching as is the beautiful architecture. This place is very popular for photography and shootings though clicking the idols is not allowed.I also like that there were no touts here.No head covering is needed .

Name: PradhanG
Title: Good visit
Review: Very nice and clean area around the temple. Good social distancing maintained inside the temple. Very safe.

Name: sudhakarn
Title: oldest temple
Review: after lockdown i wisit this temple i was happy and all the relive in this situvation  ..thank u onces

Name: Mohan S
Title: Traditional place
Review: This is one of the famous temples in Chennai. Holiest Hindu temple .everytime while we visiting it gives so divine and peaceful.

Name: anu_v
Title: Holy temple
Review: This is one of the most holiest hindu temples in the world. My relative recommended this temple for us to pray and win blessings. The priest offered us advice and told us to visit it when we are free.

Name: saurabh a
Title: peace all around
Review: First time I visited in 2003 then frequently in 2019 and 2020 , this temple does not need review, it's like you feel going there again and again. Go there to feel it

Name: eamesescape
Title: Kapaleeswarar Temple one of the most beautiful temples in Chennai.
Review: A Morning at Kapaleeswarar Temple Mylapore, ChennaiKapaleeshwarar temple, Mylapore is undoubtedly one of the most beautiful temples in Chennai.Dedicated to lord Shiva, this temple has magnificent gopurams and a tank in the west. Shakti worshipped Shiva in the form of a peacock (mayil in Tamil) hence the name Mylapore.¬†The temple was built around 7th century. October to January: This time is considered as the best months to visit Kapaleeshwarar temple. The weather is pleasant and comfortable to explore Chennai.

Name: Ananth 727499
Title: One of the padal petra sthalam in chennai
Review: This temple is in the heart of the Mylapore area.. it has a wide temple tank .There are flower shops in the entrance of the temple main entrance. Free shoe stand is also provided for the devotees.When you enter you could have Darshan of Lord vinayaga. Main deity Kalaleeswarar is seen facing west and hence this temple is considered to be " Sarva dosha Nivarana sthalam"..Ambal sannithi is very vibrational and you could find a chillness when you are inside the sannithi ..Do visit this temple..

Name: Sud D
Title: Heavenly
Review: This one of the oldest temples in Chennai and very historic. Beautiful architecture. If you have never been to a Hindu temple before, this one might be one you want to visit when you are in Chennai.

Name: pksubramanian
Title: A must visit
Review: This is a very ancient temple in Mylapore. One should visit this place for the architecture alone. The chief deity is Siva although there are temples for minor gods and goddesses. Sometimes non-Hindus are not allowed!

Name: Drone Destinations & Holidays (DDH)
Title: Kapaleeshwar temple
Review: This temple is situating in most cultural activities happening area of Mylapore in Chennai city. This Siva temple is one of the most devotee gathering temple in Chennai.

Name: Mansi Reddy
Title: Blissful vibrations
Review: Mylapore in Chennai is known for its temples and South Indian food. The very famous landmark in this neighborhood is the Kapaleeshwarar Koil. The temple stands tall and can be seen at a distance. The vibrations are very good and calm at this place.

Name: Ambrish L
Title: Bliss
Review: Beautiful place , You'll feel blissful when you enter it. Saturdays are usually crowded in the evening. Nice eateries around the temple.

Name: elvirabala
Title: Historic - unlike any other
Review: My family and I enjoyed our visit to this temple, with the expert and able guidance of our guide, Rajiv

Name: arvind1ahuja1
Title: Brilliant Architecture
Review: The minute detail on stone, the vast number of individual structures inside the temple walls, and the song and dance performances by young students, corroborated my belief that temples were originally meant for the artisans to build and demonstrate their talent, the local villagers to meet in the evenings, share thoughts and experiences, for the seniors to resolve disputes, men and women to be entertained, and allow the young to bond and play. Be ready to be enthralled by the aroma that wafts through the air.

Name: gowri selvarajah
Title: Blessed day
Review: I so love this temple. A must visit when I‚Äôm here in Chennai. My trip this time was so fun as I witnessed 2 weddings at that temple. One wedding, the relative gave me some flowers to bless the newly wed. What else can I ask for......

Name: Poopyscoop
Title: Shouted at by the staff
Review: I had a horrible experience visiting this temple. It‚Äôs difficult to get to because of all the traffic and people. We were told to walk down to the temple barefoot by our guide as people steal shoes outside. Never experienced this in India before. I was also shouted at by the temple ‚Äòstaff‚Äô. I didn‚Äôt know he worked at the temple and he started to shout, tell me where to stand and wait and was incredibly rude. It really ruined any ambience of visiting such a beautiful temple.

Name: Manasi
Title: Spiritual destination
Review: Very spiritual place. But too much of rush avoid the rush hour. But the temple and its carvings are beautiful to see

Name: Christine McMenamin
Title: Overcrowded and a bit underwhelming
Review: I visited the temple on a public holiday so it was really crowded with locals in long snaking lines. While it was colourful and unmistakably India, the temples did not hold any special allure. The most interesting feature was the stable housing Brahman cows - sacred to India - and the faces of the local people.

Name: Honisoiquimalypense
Title: Famous temple
Review: As you‚Äôd expect this is a classic Tamil Nadu temple - all bright and covered in statues. The entrance tower is over 100 ft tall and has hundreds of gods plastered over it, inside are a number of separate shrines. You can wear socks in in to protect your feet from the hot stone slabs! Photos are no problem either, except in the main shrine.

Name: Inspiration702340
Title: Kapaleeshwarar Temple
Review: It is one of the oldest shiva Temples in the world built in the 7th century. It has shiva worshipped as kapaleeshwarar and parvati as Karpagambal. It is situated in the heart of the city at Mylapore. It is believed that Lord Rama worshipped here and then waged war against lanka to bring back sita. The dravidian architecture of the temple is awesome. The vibes you get as you enter the temple is worth visiting again and again

Name: Nick L
Title: Serenity Architecture Colour and Religion
Review: A very spiritual place with amazing colourful architecture. Be prepared to give up your footwear for the experience and take some small bills for a donation for your shoes to be looked after. If you are into photography ensure you purchase a ticket that gives you permission to take photo‚Äôs. If you go prepared you will have a wonderful serene experience amidst the hustle and bustle of the city.

Name: Raguram R
Title: Beautiful Temple, divine
Review: Had been to this temple with family and simply enjoyed the visit. The temple itself is structured and neat and the Gopurams are all bright and colorful. Once you enter, you can feel the difference and the vibrations. As you enter, you will see Vigneswarar and Sundaresan and then as you go towards the right, you will see a big mandapa and on the right you will Murugan Sannidhi. The main deity's abode comes next and is in the middle of the overall temple area , Kapaleeswarar and Karpagambal are adjacent and you enter to see her first and then Eeswarar and then exit. The temple tank is huge and is worth seeing. There is water in the tank at low levels, nevertheless it is great to see it. There is a dress code. They ask that Half-pants and Lungis be avoided.

Name: Wil Chung
Title: Beautiful
Review: What a fantastic place to visit for anyone who is spiritual (you don't need to be Hindu) or just appreciates the spectacular architecture.First of all, you need to take your shoes off before entering the temple. You can leave them at the counter for a small fee/tip or just leave them.on the ground like most Indians. You are welcome to look around yourself - be aware you could be approached by guides who will give you a tour for a fee. There are specific parts of the temples where photography is not permitted and non Hindus (all clearly marked) A beautiful place to meditate and take in "life"

Name: Sai Kiran M
Title: A place for peace.
Review: Been here with family. Such a peaceful place it is. One can truly fill up their energy by visiting Kapaleeshwarar Swamy temple. Parking has to little bit more organised. Can find best food points of Chennai around this temple in Mylapore. Like Window shop Vada, Rose Milk, Karpagambal Mess, Mami Kadai, etc.

Name: Charles Haight
Title: Mesmerising
Review: This is an incredible temple with a surreal ambience. So much is happening here and yet there is tranquility. The sculptures on the pillars are pretty neat

Name: Deadman17
Title: Divine and peaceful
Review: Kapaleeshwar temple is a divine temple complex and spending some time here gives you mental peace. There are different temples inside and once can visit all of them one after another. There are pujas for various things that can be done. In addition, during festivals, various commnunity programs happen here. One can sit in the verandah and spend some peaceful time.

Name: Gavin J
Title: Not sure what the fuss is about ....
Review: It‚Äôs a working temple and quite interesting with a few interesting bits dotted about, but it‚Äôs very built up and there are the usual phalanxes of guides and touts telling you that there is more in life than money - before trying to extract a lot from you.   The guides give you the usual ‚Äúpay me what you think it‚Äôs worth‚Äù Line but expect 1,000 to 1,500 and a contribution to the temples ‚Äúfund for the poor‚Äù.   A mildly interesting place in a city with very limited interesting things to do and see.  Worth going but try not to get ripped off........again!

Name: jackharrybill
Title: Interesting tour
Review: Had a very interesting tour around the temple. Learned a lot. The tour was arranged separately from visiting thr temple and without it would not have enjoyed it as much. Well worth a visit.

Name: Purnima09
Title: Mylapore sacred shrine
Review: It‚Äôs Lord Shiva‚Äôs temple.The temple is clean and well maintained.Wonderful and soulful place to visit.Great history,sculptures,tradition.Big temple with big pond,must visit temple when you are in Chennai.

Name: Vasudev68
Title: A must visit
Review: An Ancient temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, it's a big complex with multiple temples within the complex. The entry gopuram is awesome. A must visit for peace of mind.

Name: Sukumar
Title: Kabaleeshwarar kovil
Review: Good traditional temple... It is old temple and religious temple where you can see many god and goddess in one place... Near by the temple there is a pond... And traditional shops too... Good place to visit

Name: Dianne
Title: Worth a look
Review: Definitely worth a look . Magnificent temple and a place where the locals still come to worship . Allow no more than an hour and don‚Äôt forget shoes are left at the entrance

Name: Roger F
Title: De los mejores templos de Chennai
Review: Kapaleeshwarar Temple is a Hindu temple dedicated to lord Shiva located in Mylapore, Chennai in the Indian state of Tamil Nadu. The form of Shiva's consort Parvati worshipped at this temple is called Karpagambal is from Tamil ("Goddess of the Wish-Yielding Tree"). The temple is the most ancient one that has been built around the 7th century CE in Dravidian architecture.Templo Hind√∫ de muchos colores situado en Chennai. Los aleda√±os son agradables y hay tenderetes al lado tipicos de India.

Name: Mikan999
Title: Hectic Colourful Shiva Temple
Review: With the usual multi-statued, multi coloured gopuram standing out in bright sunshine against a blue sky the entrance to this temple is spectacular. Inside it is buzzing with people worshipping, walking around, sitting in large groups chatting and generally having a great experience. There were three wedding parties when we were there, all with huge accompanying families. The biggest had set up a ‚Äúphotograph the Bride and Groom‚Äù session with an array of professional lamps and defusers - inviting everyone to join the party. There was also the serious bit of walking clockwise to pray at the numerous shrines. So many beautiful saris! The temple decoration with a seemingly infinite display of Hindu deities is wonderful. Leave your shoes outside, apparently there is a shoe store but we didn‚Äôt notice and simply left them at the gate with all the others. On leaving all the shoes were gone, but someone pointed to a large heap of shoes piled on the other side of the road, ours were deep within that pile. Photography is allowed inside the compound but not directly into the shrines themselves. You are not allowed to wear a hat inside.

Name: Vipul S
Title: Worth a visit during aarti time
Review: I always get a sense of satisfaction when I visit Kapaleeshwar temple in Mylapore. Almost every hindu lord's statue is present inside. This time we happened to visit the temple during evening aarti time. The atmosphere was quite energising during lord Shiva's aarti and Devi Parvati's aarti. They also distribute Pongal and tamarind rice as prasadam after the aarti. Both were very tasty üòÄ. There's a free shoe keeping service just beside the temple's entrance so we need not worry about them being stolen.

Name: kparashivaiah
Title: Kapaleeswara Temple of Chennai
Review: This the famous Kapaleeswara Temple ( Hindu Temple) dedicated to the Lord Shiva. The Temple is located at Mylapore, in the Heart of Chennai City. The Temple is very ancient said to have been built in the 7th Century by the Pallava rulers. Lord Shiva ( Kapaleeswara ) & Goddess Parvati (Karpagambal) are the Main deities in this Temple.

Name: Muthusuresh
Title: Solo
Review: Long time plan and dream to visit my Lord Shivan temple. No words to say..I spent a long time here in the evening.Temple side area was fully crowded

Name: prakash
Title: Nice temple but.....
Review: Its a beautifully maintained temple and nice to visit to pray but they habe the stupid NO NON HINDU rule which means if you are visibly non indian like a white person, you are not allowed in to pray. How the temple officials can identify non hindus baffles me. So my husband who is white and hindu cannot go into the temple to pray with me. I pray from the outside now as well. Many other temples dont have this rule and are more welcoming

Name: Suma S
Title: Serene
Review: An old temple where Lord Shiva is worshipped. Pooja items are available outside. Easily accessible. Rush is there but manageable.

Name: justbliss
Title: For people who like exploring beautiful old Temples
Review: Come here to meditate in the temple corridors where you‚Äôll always be able to hear a group of people chanting mantras . Light a diya just to experience happiness and closer to the divine .

Name: 435kutty
Title: Historic temple
Review: Wonderful place of worship. Full of peace & divine vibrations. Centrally located. Powerful puja and blessings. Closed between 12 noon & 3 pm. Early morning visit gives you a sense of peace. Minimal crowd in the early hours of the morning.

Name: LAQLD
Title: Wonderful ancient site
Review: One of several staggering beautiful temple sites in Tamil Nadu.  We had a guide and I think it adds so much to the experience. Yes, visually it is awesome and you can see that, but a little interpretation fills out the experience so much more.  Try to be there in the morning, I expect it could be hot walking around in the open. You will have to remove your shoes. Wondrous place.  You can take photos in the complex ‚Äì just not within the shrines.

Name: Mrudula
Title: lord shiva's place
Review: Kapaleeshwarar temple is one of the famous temple in chennai with lord shiva in belief and known for it's architecture

Name: GRAM
Title: Beware of Scammers
Review: I am Hindu from the USA. I was looking forward to going to this temple for darshan while in Chennai. As I walked in, I was approached by a "guide" who works for the temple; he has a noticeable scar under one of his eyes. He claims that he is is a "student" and works at the temple giving tours. Initially, he seemed legitimate. But then, he took us to the kitchen and asked for 3,000 rupees to feed devotees for one sitting. It was almost as if he was bargaining, with no guarantee of where the money would actually go. Disappointingly, the same guide informed me that I was not allowed to go into the actual temple because I did not speak Hindi (despite being Hindu). However, he did request a donation to take into the temple and make on my behalf. After a quick tour, he requested 20 USD (at minimum) for his services and would not budge otherwise. After spending a total of over 60 USD, I was not able to partake in darshan, as I hoped. I am presuming all of the money I "donated" went directly into this man's pocket. Beware; these practices have no place in a house of worship. Utterly disgusting.

Name: AURELIO L
Title: nice temple
Review: nice temple,interesting,i suggest to you to go to see this temple,is the most important in the town so,if you have not time to see other temples to to see this

Name: %FastFlyer
Title: Incredible
Review: Most beautiful of the Davadian style temples. Large grounds. Camera charge to photograph outside features.

Name: Mohan Gupta
Title: Mohan Gupta
Review: A Holy place. Great vibes inside main temple. No entry fee and free prasadam to all. A must visit temple in Chennai

Name: Captain Shankar
Title: Wade through temple Labirinths
Review: Browse the web or wiki on this 7th century marvel. Temple festivities coinciding with the harvest festival of PONGAL in Tamil Nadu (Madras) make kapaleeshwar kovil a "must experience". Evening 1800 to 2000 hours for the next few days transpose you literally to ancient history of place... beehive of culturally charged activity,sea of devout/curious die hard humanity, millions of small-time folks selling village food/trinkets/wares pertaining to the Tamil Ethos, cacophony of wayside musicians/artists performing free their super talent, temple bells & ardent devotees of Shiva crying hoarse the God's neOmNamashivaya..... make our pores open out n hair stand in total awe. Temple perse is magnificent and has an aura of serenity yet vibrant in utter devoutness. Night time illumination of the temple is an eye catcher.Processions of the diety fully decked through crowded Labirinths of wafer thin lanes thronging with followers make for a unique sense of spiritual satisfaction. Shopping is absolutely nothing but the best thing that ever happens... value for money and taking home a piece of the visit to treasure the experience.

Name: Ansi
Title: impressive
Review: definetely worth to visit. Very impressive and  wonderful. We would definitely go again if we could. recommendable

Name: vertigoracing
Title: Beautiful Temple
Review: Great temple! High energy! A must visit in chennai! This temple is famous for Lord Shiva. Great place to meditate.

Name: laxman_iyer
Title: Temple
Review: Beautiful..lot to see with the help of a guide. Extremely crowded but worth the visit .It is worth paying 100 rupees to be in a shorter line.

Name: George Georgiev
Title: New temple
Review: It is a new temple, you do not expect to see very old buildings, we didi not go inside because of the barefoot requirement.

Name: HWPKG
Title: A great experience
Review: Beautiful temple - we visited on New Year's Day. Had excellent darshan. I love temples in Tamil Nadu. Security staff, pandits, everyone is better organized than temples in the North and they treat pilgrims and visitors with more humanity.

Name: Gizmoadventures
Title: Amazing experience
Review: I have visited many temples but this was an amazing experience.  The temple was busy with many small temples inside.  The traditionally dressed Brahmins were so special to see along with witnessing the different forms of worship movement for the different gods.  They have many holy cows living inside.It is a wonderful place to see.  There was live music being performed when we visited which added to the experience.

Name: Pushpinder S
Title: Tradition abound.
Review: It's a must see temple. Chennai heritage comes along. Check out the traditional bhajji shops and the prasadam at mandir.

Name: Pradyumna
Title: Serene temple, less crowd when we went
Review: The temple itself is big and accommodates many people. When we went during the mid day the crowd was less and we had good chance and time to see the god. Its also surrounded by lot of good eateries that are typical South Indian.

Name: Mark G
Title: Accessible temple
Review: Easily accessed physically and culturally. Remember to register cameras etc and to treat this very important religious temple with respect. True Indua

Name: Kishore
Title: "Kapaleeshwarar Temple - Very Pleasantful"
Review: Kapaleeshwarar Temple is a Hindu temple devoted to Shiva situated in Mylapore and It is One of the best temples in India.

Name: Tillai1957
Title: Temple
Review: Architecture, holy, and calm style. Visit dearly morning.Pray, meditate,just sit calm.you shall feel the nature.

Name: Wolfgang B
Title: Temple Visit
Review: The temple opens at 4pm and all visitors can go in. I recommend to look for guide as they can give you a lot of insights to the temple. It is a great opportunity to close your day with great impressions.

Name: Thotharij
Title: First visit
Review: No words to explain... Very old temple, maintaining  well. Shops are plenty around temple.. In one life time... Should visit temple

Name: Jody C
Title: Beautiful temple
Review: This temple have many buildings. You can go up to terrace to have a good look at the tall towers. The roof top is hot but there a area painted white and that's a cooler path to walk on.

Name: Marco B
Title: Nice but pollution in Chennai....
Review: I visited Kapaleeshwarar temple several time before, my last visit was in November 2019. I always enjoy going there, sit in the shade of one of the temple and watch the world go bye. Nice place to meditate and relax. Unfortunately this time around pollution in Chennai was so bad that after just 30minutes I had to go back to my hotel room. I think on November 5-6-7-8 they had the worse pollution ever recoded in Chennai. Thanks God I had with me protective air pollution mask but I felt awkward to wear it inside the temple. Please don't go to India without a air filtering mask, the best I found and that it is made with natural fabric is the metamasks.com Be safe, enjoy India, great country but challenging if not properly equipped.

Name: tsk0101
Title: A must visit temple in Chennai
Review: A holy place where you practically have darshans of all Gods in Hindu myth. I used to visit regularly, now whenever in Chennai where you can spend your time peacefully.

Name: satheesh
Title: Must in your itinerary
Review: The vast temple alley ways , ponds , the majestic structures aiding its beauty must be seen to experience the rich past and ita culture.50rs is charged if you want to see the deity up close which is good .

Name: Deba
Title: A beautiful temple
Review: Very well managed temple. In one temple there are different gods like Ganesh, kartikay. But I worshipped the kapleswar. The Shiva linga surrounded by serpent is unique. Get a ticket for 50 rupees to go near the God to do archana.

Name: jivpriya1101
Title: So divine...........
Review: First time visiting this templeSuch a huge templeBut you have to pay 50rupees for each person for the special prayers and its worth itSuch a wonderful templeWill go again if got the chance!

Name: julie_higgins
Title: Worth seeing
Review: We have seen many temples the last three weeks both in the North and South of India.This temple was very large with many side temples and set in rather sad grounds. Despite this it is worth seeing.

Name: S.E.
Title: Scamming
Review: The temple is nice to see. When I wanted to go inside a men hold me back.I am not allowed to go inside as non hindu. There was no sign or so. I need him as guide to be allowed inside. In the inside he came with a story that I have to give money to the poor. He wanted 500! rupies. I gave 200 in the end after long discussions and he did go with this money inside the temple building. I do not have a good feeling, may have landed in his pocket. Also the guide fee. He did not let me go until I pay 20!‚Ç¨because others do pay the same. We arranged something else in the beginning. He did not let me go, even wanted to scam me more with the currency exchange rate. This was my fault as well, but I have this was the worst experience here so far. + he wanted to arrange a tuctuc and a good place to lunch. He still tried These Things, even if we were quite discussing about the Rest...I think you are allowed to go inside the area, just not in the actual temple building. But there will be a sign!

Name: Nanthakumar Ganesan
Title: Very old shiva temple in mylapore
Review: Good maintainance.. Old temple.. You will good feel if you go to this temple.. Having more shiva statues in the form of lingam, having 10 cows and sri durga amman temple, Lord muruga.. If you go any festive season there, you can see Bharathanatya events.. Good

Name: nessiemark
Title: Interesting temple
Review: This is an interesting temple with a great history and some good photo opportunities. However we did get a little hassle by a man who wanted to show us around. Yes he was knowledgeable and interesting but despite us paying him 1000 INR and having already donated 2000 INR to assist feeding the homeless he was still demanding more so beware. However I would recommend visiting this temple.

Such a colorful and spiritual site, it makes you conscious there‚Äôs more than life, and you will already feel it when you get back in the taxi even if Hinduism is not your religion. What a great experience! Ps. Just don‚Äôt take the guide as he‚Äôs going to rip you off.

This is a Hindu deity worship temple and hence religious atmosphere prevails all around. The temple is clean and well maintained. Here It's peaceful, religious and calm that I observe..  Temple to be visited with family  The temple architecture is beautiful and well designed. The Lord Shiva idol is so nice and gives peacefulness to devotees.

Title: Dirty and you can‚Äôt swim

Name: Wandering Tales Travel Dreams
Title: A nice place to experience Chennai beaches
Review: Surprisingly, it is one of the cleaner beaches in Chennai.  There is a lot of patrolling that happens by police on horses and by foot... mainly to discourage swimming as the waters are not very safe.  A nice beach to get your fill of the sea side and walking in the  sand if you normally live in a place nowhere close to beaches.  Sunset time is the best time to visit.

Name: Mudit Sharma
Title: Visit
Review: Marina Beach is a primarily sandy beach, with an average width of 300 m (980 ft) and the width at the widest stretch is 437 m (1,434 ft). Bathing and swimming at the Marina are legally prohibited because of the dangers, as the undercurrent is very turbulent. It is one of the most crowded beaches in the country.The beach promenade in 1913Before the 16th century, there were frequent incident of inundation of land near the coast due to rise in sea level. When the sea withdrew, several ridges and lagoons were left behind. On the southern side of Fort St. George, one such sand ridge ran from the mouth of the Cooum River to the present site of the Presidency College. On the rear side of the ridge was a huge depression on which the college grounds were later developed. The ridge is the site of the present-day beach. When Fort St. George was built in 1640, the sea was too close to the fort. The building of the harbor near the fort resulted in sand accretion to the south of the fort and the harbor and the sea, which was washing the ramparts of the fort, moved afar at about 2.5 km away from the fort creating a wide beach between the land and the sea.Before the Madras harbor was built, the beach was just a strip of mud, teeming with mudskippers. The beach washed up close to the present day road for a long time until the harbor was built in 1881.Ever since the harbor was built, the area south of the port has accreted significantly, forming the present day's beach mainly due to the presence of wave breakers laid for the construction of the harbor, although the coast in the northern region has undergone severe erosion. Eventually, the north-drifting current widened the beach to its present extent. The beach was formed as a result of arresting the littoral drift by the port's breakwater. The area of the beach is increasing 40 sq m every year.

Name: Raguram R
Title: Great landmark, Spoiled by Administrative Apathy.
Review: Great Landmark beach, Could have been maintained better.  we went to the beach on a working day at 4:00 PM, Just to enjoy time at the beach. Let me outline my experience,a) Beach sand had a lot of garbage mixed, including broken bottles, plastic caps, plastic overb) There was a lot of garbage thrown back by the sea on the beach, nothing was cleared. There was barely any place right by the beach where you could sit down and enjoy. Too much of rotten stuff. I was surprised to see a mattress also thrown back by the seac) there was a mechanized sand combing machine that is supposed to collect garbage from the beach sand. It was just wasting time and money. It was doing nothing. d) We saw a couple pull out the diaper of their child and dump it on the beach. There is no toilet or any infrastructure where children can be taken care of.We just squatted there for some time and decided to bail out. Highly dissatisfied.

Name: Andrew D
Title: Don't visit during the daytime
Review: Maybe I made a mistake of visiting it during daytime, because there is nothing at all here. The beach itself is average with nothing to write home about, while the avenue with the statues are undergoing public transport renovation so you can't really see the statues right now. On top of that, the sun is too glaring with nothing else to do and see. Skip, or maybe try during evening?

Name: Shakir
Title: Black Beach
Review: This beach is definitely LONG. But that's it. It isn't pretty like the beautiful blue beaches we see around the world.

Title: Marina beach
Review: It's the second largest beach in Chennai and during Sunday fully packed with shops and games. Its very best place in Chennai for weekend with children's.

Title: Longest beach
Review: The second longest beach in the world which is Marina Beach. This is the main tourist attraction. Huge tourist visit here regularly. A large no of food stalls offers you variety of food. Mouthwatering juice, pokora, fish fry, corn or fruit chat can't ignorable. You can come here during sunrise or sunset. Horse ride is another attraction. The beach police is continuously patrolling. This Beach should be clean regularly. One drawback is there don't have any sitting arrangement seperaly in the beach. you have to get back 400 meter to sit.  A must visit place.

Title: Long Sandy Beach
Review: Marina Beach is India's longest beach and one of Chennai's prime tourist attractions.  It is a huge expanse of sand and you need to walk quite a bit to reach the sea. The sand can get quite hot during the day. The place can get quite crowded during evenings when many of the food stalls also open. The place is easily accessible by public transport. Parking is also available. Do carry water if you visit during daytime

Review: I went at 10:30am and was surprised to see the beach was empty. Even at 5:30pm, the snack sellers were just starting to come and getting out vegetables to cook. Policemen on horses were telling people not to go in the water as the waves were too high.

Title: Had a Really Bad Experience
Review: I visited the beach on our long layover in Chennai. Mostly this beach is visited by locals and so the vendors can easily distinguish between a local and an outsider and hence the price difference and everything clearly comes into picture.The beach itself is really huge with a huge expanse of sand....you could literally get exhausted from walking all the way from the road to the sea. We made a mistake here instead of going through the designated route of the shops, God knows why we chose a way which appeared a bit quieter. It was in the middle of the day and hence safety was not much of a concern for us (that is what we thought) . But soon we realized why this way was secluded and the other one was so crowded. The entire way till the sea (the secluded one) was full of poop (both of human and animals) and was super smelly. I have never seen such a smelly beach in my life. Now people might counter me saying the smell might be from the local vendors selling fish....but being a Bengali I clearly can differentiate the smell of fish and poop.And to make things worse two transgenders caught my boyfriend for money and when he denied started abusing. When we gave them Rs 10 just to shut their mouth they demanded Rs 50 and threatened to throw sand at us if we did not pay. At this I  got paranoid for a while....luckily my boyfriend grabbed my hand and got mingled in the midst of a local group who were relaxing in the beach.Not only that even fish shops overcharged us for the fish we bought for snacks. Now I might not be a local but most Bengalis can clearly distinguish which fish is what. So when he promised me pomfret and offered some other fish I understood in my first bite that I am getting conned. So my first experience in this beach was not at all good. I feel that you would enjoy this place more if you knew about the nooks and corners of this place....you should know what to try and what to avoid....what kind of cons are existing and all. If you can crack all this then you might enjoy here. Also try to go through the crowded ways which go through the shops till you reach the waters to avoid toxic smell as well as toxic people.

Name: Mano
Title: Long Beach with Pleasant view
Review: We went for a long walk on this beach. It offered an amazing view of the sunset and beach waves :). It was peaceful and relaxing to the mind.As we've been there during COVID items, we were able to witness the marina beach without the crowd.I appreciate that people were not throwing away the waste into the ocean or on the sand. I should say this the marina cleaning team are doing a great job and trying to keep the beach clean.

Name: Jayanta Mitra
Title: Highly recommended !
Review: When it comes to Chennai, Marina beach tops the bucket list. The beach is absolutely mesmerizing and beautiful. I  definitely recommend you to visit if you are coming to Chennai.

Name: Bette59
Title: Wide, expansive beach
Review: The beach area is huge; however the water was quite black and we were told people do not swim in ocean due to possible sewage contamination.

Name: megu
Title: Couples and families best spot
Review: 1. Go to the lighthouse top, and see a stunning view from there of one of the longest beaches in the world.2. Eat. Eat an entire city. You can find everything, beginning from Manga (Raw mango), to Boiled Peanuts, to Chaat, to Chinese (Look for Titanic food stall), to Bhajji (South Indian Pakora or Vegetable in a Gram Flour batter fried) to a Kulfi, to an Ice Cream, to a Coca-cola (or Pepsi to those who prefer sweeter cola).3. You can watch the Sunrise and Sunset. STUNNING!4. You can count stars in the night (Go before 11pm, after which you're not allowed to be there for "safety" reasons).5. Shoot a balloon, ride a merry-go-round (You feel too mature? Do it. Will make you feel like a little kid again)6. Ride a horse. Yeah, you can actually do that.7. Buy fish. Towards the right of the Tower.

Name: thevpanda
Title: Home of chennai
Review: The beach has always been close to the heart of anyone in Namma Chennai! What's. abeach trip without some Soan papdi or ice cream? :_

Name: James G
Title: cool respite from chennai heat
Review: Marina beach is a respite from the hot weather of Chennai. Its a lovely place for a walk in the morning or evening.

Name: Syed
Title: Good
Review: Best place to hang out with friends and family. It's awesome place to visit in Chennai because its India biggest beach best time to visit in sunrise or in time of sunset but need more cleanliness as its tourist place and its belongs to history of India.

Name: S&S
Title: Awesome beach
Review: One of the biggest beaches I have ever been. Avoid weekdays for overcrowding. Best time to visit will ne early mornings or seeing the sunset. During summers it gets hot - do carry water bottles which will be very handy.

Name: Mr. Kumar
Title: Good place but not more cleanliness
Review: It's awesome place to visit in Chennai because its India biggest beach best time to visit in sunrise or in time of sunset but need more cleanliness as its tourist place and its belongs to history of India.

Name: Shreesh
Title: Nice
Review: Nice but crowded.... the beach has amazing sales of street food... fans of fish fries should surely go and enjoy

Name: Companion25960627072
Title: Exam
Review: Nice hotel good service and value  money  to stay near by airport and airport drop     all   so free excellent huh

Name: Subbu K
Title: Mr
Review: Best breeze in the world .A place for relaxation and enjoy ment.The eateries are great. Smiling faces of the vendors and the mornings sun shine over the once British colonial building take you back in time.

Name: Nikita G
Title: Perfect view
Review: One of the best beaches to see in the world and a must do when you visit Chennai. Good places to eat too.

Name: anil1967
Title: A one time visit.
Review: Marina beach like they say, is the pride of Chennai being the longest beach in Asia.The Beach (water front) is a long walk from the parking area, and the approach is not a very clean and pleasant walk. They could do with a lot of cleaning up to make it more pleasant for the visitor.The Water front is nice and approachable.

Name: Raajeev Kumaar
Title: Good
Review: It was good to spent 2 hours there. You can walk around and buy some local stuff. Must bargain atheist for 50% if you want to buy some tjibgvatbthe beach.

Name: Repertoire Events & Mice Pvt Ltd
Title: Must Visit
Review: Beautiful views of Marina Beach, Bay of Bengal gives you another feeling of contentment. Start with a stroll, have a coconut water from a nearby stall and enjoy. I love the mornings on the beach you can opt for evening and see lot of couples and families enjoying. Eat dosa and lot of chennai delicacies on the stalls you will find a lot on the beach for breakfast or any time of the day

Name: giggle y
Title: Nice beach
Review: Marina beach is very beautiful to see,if Any body visits Chennai don't forget to visit marina beach, the atmosphere is too good

Name: AjitV
Title: Marina... a rare pearl in the crown of Chennai
Review: The length and the breath of this outstanding creation brings tears of joy to anyone visiting this beach... it has everything to offer from a toddler to a senior citizen... early morning and late evening‚Äôs is a great time to catch up with people in this place, some jogging, some exercising, some playing in the sand, some shopping, some spending time dipping in the waves... an awesome place to visit.. light house round the corner to watch, statues of dignitaries each of whom have a story to tell for generations... A distinctive pearl in the crown of Chennai...

Name: Nieraj India Unleashed
Title: An evening well spent
Review: My trip to Marina beach was quite good. However the beach was at quite a distance from my hotel. Beach was quite clean. With many activities going on.

Name: Abhijit verma
Title: Nice
Review: If you are visiting please carry one empty bag so you can collect all empty bottles and packets and can be kept in that (may be you add some good service to nature and collect some of these item thrown by other  people all over the place ) . I suggest to wear a sports shoes because it‚Äôs nice good long walk .

Name: SUKHVINDER SINGH RANA
Title: Nice n clean
Review: Good but visited only 15min... As I am not explorer to new place... Just had gone for few minutes and it near from ITC chola where we stayed.. So could not say exactly much more about as I was there only for 15min

Name: Hotel Paradise Mansion Mussoorie
Title: Keep Calm and Enjoy nature Creation
Review: If Anyone Ask me What you need a Metro City living or Living in Nature So will Choose Nature Living ..Same as When We get Chance to talk Alone Ownself near Marina Beach ..That Time is unexplained .

Name: ssnaren
Title: Chill out place
Review: Main landmark of Chennai, Asia's longest beach, evening chill out best place in Chennai.No lifeguards available so playing in beach water its very risk. Must visit place if u visit Chennai

Name: SREENIVASAREDDY M
Title: Beach with serene and peace of mind
Review: A beach with good serene and peace of mind to enjoy wave roaring of almighty ocean - The bay of Bengal"Suggested to walk little far from crowd so that even you can do meditation with calm and no bustling of co tourists or hawker shootings of offering their product.

Name: Swati S
Title: Beautiful Sandy Beach
Review: It is  the longest natural urban beach in the country.The Marina is primarily sandy. History of the beach dates back to  late 1870, when the governor of Madras  Mountstuart Elphinstone Grant Duff, who was captivated by the beach on an earlier visit , conceived and built the promenade along the beach in 1884 by extensively modifying and layering it with soft sand. He also gave it the name Madras Marina in the same year. Since the early 19th century, a number of public buildings were constructed fronting the beach.Since ,we were pressed for time, we visited the beach in the late afternoon...the sand of course was burning but the moment waves washed our feet, we felt refreshed ...It is definitely a place to visit.

Name: Siva Kumar
Title: Good place to visit at evening
Review: It really nice place to spend time at evening, even if are alone. Nice sea breeze u will get definitely

Name: Ahmed D
Title: Good Vacation
Review: Vacation was good. The rooms are big and nice but the condition in the room was not working. And there was not enough water in the freezer.The restaurant and the food was very good but its every day the same.The hotel has very friendly stuff. This made the vacation better.The beach ia good but there is no toilet.Wifi only working in reception.Communication with the reception is so hard (telephone in the room not working).The Hotel is very clean and the cleaning staff did perfect job.

Name: Muhammed Ramees PK
Title: Marina Beach
Review: My one of the favorite spot in chennai ever...the streetfood also nice..i think its asia's largest beach

Name: anu_v
Title: A day at Marina beach
Review: I would say anyone can say anything but Marina beach is the best one for any indian or expat. The place is so cooling and soothing. One can relax in the beach and watch the waves flow.

Name: Mani Karthik
Title: Best tourist destination
Review: Marine beach is the famous tourist destination located in Chennai city, Tamil Nadu state, India, The beach runs for over the length of about 13 kms. It is the longest urban beach in the country and second longest in the world, its all sides it surrounded by various interesting monuments and statues, providing it more fascinating atmosphere.marina beach is usually crowded in the evening and early morning , there are many attractions for kids and street foods available in the evening time , once can enjoy the fresh beach air and enjoy the tasty street foods and take a beautiful walk along the beach.

Name: Sud D
Title: Long stretch of sand
Review: This is not a beach to swim or sunbathe. This is an urban beach that is more a hangout for the people of a crowded city to relax in the evenings. Can get very busy. Used to be very messy. Cleaner these days. It has a carnival atmosphere in the evenings.

Name: Viji
Title: Beautiful
Review: We visited in feb this year & were shown the places around. Dunno but the market n places around were crowded much. May be cause if the proximity to the assembly or the roads adjacent but yes to be clicked the pics with the cutout‚Äôs of the Tollywood actors üòÉ was something to remember. Good place to be. Just the preachers nearby were lill annoying! Else ok.

Name: Hooray H
Title: Lovely long beach
Review: Supposed to be one of the longest beaches in the world.Very well maintained with good access & parking.Could do with some trees or shade.

Name: Sonu Rawal
Title: The largest beach of India
Review: The first beach I saw in my life was the marina beach Chennai in 2012, last year we visit this place 2nd time.

Name: TravelTime
Title: Must visit in Chennai
Review: A must visit in chennai for hanging out, eating street food. Water is not that clean, if you a beach lover then Besant nagar, Kovalam or Thiruvanmayur beaches will be better. For food lovers there are lot of options and there are small activities as well.

Name: Poopyscoop
Title: Long beach where you can see all the boats
Review: This is a beautiful long beach which unfortunately suffers from needing a good clean up. If you want to see the fishing boats and all the fish sellers it‚Äôs worth the trip.

Name: Anand M
Title: A Commoner's Paradise
Review: That Marina Beach is among the finest beaches in India is well known. It has an easy approachability being in the Metro city of Chennai. It has a depth of space like no other. It also has a light house in vicinity for a breathtaking top view. What is more, it is clean and has ample parking around. But what distinguishes it is that there is no high end rampant commercialisation. It is very affordable to visit. And you see only commoners enjoying at the beach. A line up of public institutions, museums, statues and university adorns it. Truly, a Commoner's Paradise.

Name: Manasi
Title: Serene place
Review: The time we went was of the evening. Walk at the beach was very peaceful. And beach is very clean. A must watch for all travellers coming here

Name: Ravi
Title: Nice Beach
Review: Very nice beach, car parking is available, there are small rides for children, many snacks shops are available at beach. We tried Panipuri and Bombay chat it was nice. Good place to visit with family.

Name: San
Title: Was a Great Beach, not any more
Review: Marina Beach at  one time was a Beautiful Place to relax and spend time with the family. How ever times have changed and so has the beach. It‚Äôs become too crowded and messy now.

Name: Daniel T
Title: Leisure fun
Review: It‚Äôs a good chilling place and lots of walking is good to get yourself pump up in that surrounding area.

Name: vineet1807
Title: Nice beach with dirty water
Review: I visited this beautiful beach in month of Jan with my family. One is few beaches in world to have such a long shore, but human activities have made even sea water dirty, water is not clean n clear, it's polluted.Otherwise administration has made nice arrangements in terms of large parking space & some food shops are available with local snacks and fried fish being everyone's favourite there.We really need to keep our surroundings clean & pollution free so that our next generations can enjoy this beautiful nature

Name: Ananth 727499
Title: Worlds second longest beach..
Review: This is a very famous beach and always crowded in the evenings..Many important landmarks are situated around the beach..You could take a leisurely horse ride and purchase itmes made of sea shells in the beach side shops ..Recently many tattoo shops are being opened and we could see many youngsters visiting the shops eagerly for their tattoos..Many evening shops are there for you to get fish fry and other ready to serve snacks..Nice and Excellent place to spend your time ..

Name: Rakesh
Title: Marina Beach
Review: Marina Beach is one of the famous beaches in the city of Chennai. When you reach the beach, you need to hire a camel or horse to reach the destination otherwise you need to walk alone around 500 meters on the sand to reach the water.

Name: Madelinde H
Title: Nice for a walk
Review: Nice place for an evening walk to see crabs, fisherman and evening waves. The Ghandi statue is impressive and do are the government buildings at the boulevard.

Name: Rohini
Title: Needs more improvement
Review: The beach got more construction on. But not well maintained  no cleaning is done on regular basis . Wash rooms are not good.

Name: Tigerlove50
Title: Viewed from the road
Review: We viewed this expanse of beach from the road. Plenty of Indians were walking about and I‚Äôm sure in the evening it is may be busy. We asked about Indians swimming and not many can so they avoid the use of it. Also I‚Äôm told the sea is used for removing untreated sewage and rubbish so best avoided but a great shame as magnificent if something was done about this.

Name: Vijay
Title: Weekend are valuable with the fun at marina
Review: Had a great time with my family at marina beach and activities available for interesting and economical

Name: Wil Chung
Title: Beautiful
Review: Huge beach in Chennai with many things to eat and do.We took a nice relaxing walk along the shore to take in the sights of Chennai Due to the weather, we went later in the afternoon/early evening.Very close to the Light house and Ghandi statue for more sights to see.

Name: Sai Kiran M
Title: A happy beach!!
Review: Beach with vibe is a perfect definition for Marina Beach. The entire area has a good parking facility(of course a bit hard to get place sometimes) with a lot of food stalls that once can enjoy while walking along the shore. This is a place one MUST visit if you are a tourist to Chennai. Coming to the waters, the shore is little inclined so have to be careful. Police patrolling(on horses) happens throughout(they watch us) the day which was the things I liked the most. They care and ensure every visitor goes back safe & sound. Good place!!

Name: Deadman17
Title: Good vibes, crowded
Review: the beach is one of the longest in the world and offers great views of sunrise and the calm sea.  there are various monuments of historical importance opposite the Marina Beach. There are various stalls offering street food. There is enough place for parking as well.

Name: SSekuri
Title: Best hangout place at no cost
Review: Keeps getting better attracting more crowd. With so many attractions around town, marina beach is best place for a get together and spending an evening for few hours. Eateries are reasonable and may not be good if you are health conscious.

Name: Jolly Traveller
Title: Marina Beach - I tried to love it
Review: Marina Beach is a Chennai must see destination but after visiting the north end of the beach I felt deflated.I didn't get to the lighthouse which I do think would be worth visiting so maybe start therr.I started my wanders st Madras University grounds (stunning architecture), then took the pedestrian underpass to the north end of the beach. I strolled through the monument grounds (worth a look but it would be best with a guide), up to the bridge (with its unique stink of backwater and sewerage) and cut through the quiet memorial park to the beach. From there a walk across the grass flats to the sand.As with Elliot's Beach, there is plenty to see but the plentiful garbage and for me the poor condition of some horses (possibly retired beach ponies) up the back made it a joyless visit. Have a look at my pics.I tried to love this beach for it's uniqueness but couldn't. My review doesn't include the south part of Marina Beach near the Gandhi statue - maybe there is more joy to be found there.

Name: Raymen S
Title: Nice Beach for families but over crowded
Review: It was a family outing and we have visited the beach, Yes, nice and huge space for the public, In my opinion, it could be much more. cleaner and utilize in an attractive manner to attract more. Parking was terrible. Lots of street food available. mush visit place.

Name: jackharrybill
Title: Sand. Lots of sand.
Review: We visited the beach on a Sunday afternoon. Lots of people enjoying the attractions, stalls and the sea. Still plenty of room if you needed it.

Name: Tanumita D
Title: Literally the longest natural beach in India
Review: The Marina Beach is so beautiful with clear blue water and you can see long stretches of sand on either side of you. I loved being there and will go back again in future for sure. It's calm, serene, clean and iconic. People need to be a bit more cautious about maintaining the cleanliness of the beach though.

Name: Anubhab Arko Dey
Title: Good Place, But Needs Cleanup
Review: the beach the main attraction of Chennai, indeed yes to some,I have certain different opinion regarding this,  authorities work on few points then its it could be.the cleanliness of this beach is Above average,The southern part ia comparatively cleaner everything than to the northern parts,so does the areas near the Promenade, The street vendors sells goods which are cheap and offer a wide choice. The sea is not so rough here, overall a good place to hangout with family and spend some time

Name: AURELIO L
Title: not so bad
Review: if you have so many time you can go to see the beaches but remember they are not so so nice and the most of them are so crowded

Name: Madan Gopal M
Title: Great escape.
Review: I never missed this iconic beach whenever I visited Chennai. Though overcrowded in the evenings, the energy,vibrant atmosphere,beach market is not to be missed. My favourite is quite sunrise and sip hot cup of coffee.

Name: Mikan999
Title: Fish market and fishing boats area is most interesting
Review: We preferred the southern end of the beach, past the lighthouse and along Foreshore Estate Promenade. This is where fishermen bring their boats onto the beach and their wives line the edge of the beach preparing and selling the catch from small stalls shielded from the sun by parasols. More kinds of  fish than we could identify. Everyone seems friendly and happy to allow photos and engage in hand-sign talk with non Tamil speakers like us. This is a working beach - covered in brightly coloured fishing boats, nets, fishing gear and assorted fishing related debris. We went late morning, we are told early morning is the really busy time. If you are visiting St Tome Cathedral then it‚Äôs a short walk to this area.

Name: Dwightcr
Title: Chennai beach with mostly fisherman
Review: This beach isn't really for swimming.  It's a fisherman's beach for fresh catch.  A bit dirty, but does offer some sea views.

Name: nozzlering
Title: Much cleaner now
Review: I was surprised to find it much cleaner, with decent public amenities. Must visit.Government has put in all efforts to maintain cleanliness. Although you could see some tourists littering the place.

Name: senthil
Title: Asia no one beach
Review: Good beach and neat and clean.well maintain by the Tamilnadu government and public also.Public also maintain the same

Name: justbliss
Title: Most Popular Beach of the town
Review: Having said that it also means this beach is the most crowded however you can always find a spot to sit and enjoy the view.

Name: Gaby
Title: Marina Beach üèñ
Review: A really wide beach with plenty of space for a good family time. Evening time, dotted with a number of vendors selling sea food, pakoras and snacks. The beach is not a swimming beach.

Name: Jaykann
Title: Worth a walk
Review: Second largest beach in the world. Beach is huge stretch and really worth a walk. Great place for morning walkers.It's too crowded in the evening and I would advise avoid evenings specially weekends. Lots of shops around the beach which makes it hard to maintain it. Somewhat clean but need more attention. Not advisable for swimming.

Name: scs-953
Title: Interesting place to go for morning walk.
Review: If you are keen to go for a morning walk in Chennai , then marina beach is the best place. The beach has so many interesting things to offer in the morning. You will find serious muting walkers walking on the beach , children playing , youngsters doing their exercises, and pop up vans selling special fruit juices. The sun rise is a wonderful sight. If you are lucky , you watch a fishing boat returning after a trip. Worth the effort

Name: Traveller G
Title: Bit dirty but a good walk
Review: Marina Beach in the Bay of Bengal. Longest beach in India, was a lot of building work going on when we were there. Sadly it‚Äôs pretty dirty with rubbish everywhere but still a fascinating sight to see and nice long walk. Be aware you‚Äôll get hassled constantly by people trying to sell you horse rides, plastic jewellery etc...

Name: Mrudula
Title: Urban Beach
Review: This is a very big beach in area and the second largest beach. it has all the varities to enjoy like horse ride, Fishes to eat, man made beads for ladies so many

Name: Ashwini1234
Title: Nice evening spot
Review: Its a vast beach . There is a light house which closes by 5 so we could not make it. but good place for a nice evening walk along the beach with friends /family.

Name: arnold ahmed
Title: Boring
Review: If you are local you might like it. Beach is quite dirty and very few activities available. On the positive side its long and big. No cycling available.

Name: Isabella
Title: Review of Marina Beach
Review: It was a beautiful beach.It is a nice place to come and relax.But the only thing i think is unfair is how long u have to walk to get to the shore.overall i would recommend it to all those summer people out there.

Name: devan2599
Title: An evening at the marina beach
Review: Lot more can be done to this natural treasure. Its advisable not to go swimming in the beach. If you are from overseas its advisable to take with you titbits and water.

Name: 1777NT
Title: This beach seems to go on for miles, even excersise your horse on it
Review: As the Bay of Bengal appears to have little tidal change, this beach is very wide, with little or no change due to high or low tide.  It goes on for ever, nice clean sand and it appears to be kept clean by machinery.  Lots of fish stalls at the Fort End and at the Lighthouse End, with plenty of working fishing boats moored around the Lighthouse end of the beach. Unfortunately, the usual Indian problem of plastic litter around these stalls/boats. No point the rest of the world trying to ban plastics...‚Ä¶..

Name: laxman_iyer
Title: Beach
Review: Too crowded..dirty.. not well maintained..garbage all over...does not have the beach vibe..waste of time and effort

Name: Milind Kshirsagar
Title: Ordinary beach
Review: Just another beach. Nothing great. Very far from main road. Rough sea waves. Go to Mahabalipuram instead.

Name: George G
Title: A somewhat dirty beach but it does come alive at night.
Review: A long, unexciting beach. It is dirty in many places and not a place to swim due to rip-tides and dirt. The rubbish is more near the areas used by the fishermen where the dogs run free. At night don't stray from the well lit areas near the stalls which come alive but as rows of predictable offerings with little originality. Old fashioned fair ground rides are quaint but not the same ones time and again.

Name: QWERTY098
Title: Long long beach
Review: Sand is grainy. Long stretch before one reaches the sea. Food joints and others add to the experience but thr vastness is brilliant.PDA is common here and largely unavoidable if one goes in late evenings.

Name: Ajay A
Title: Nice Beach
Review: Nice Beach near to Thiruvanmiyur. Quite neat and evenings are more good to visit. Have some street food options as well.

Name: Pradeep J
Title: It's nice and fun
Review: It's an famous beach in Chennai and it's has world famous church near. It's all lots Street food there.

Name: Munna Prasad
Title: Chennai's Best Beach with awesome food
Review: Also known as Elliot Beach but since it's near the residential area of Besant Nagar, it is also called Besant Nagar Beach.It is accessible by private and public transport but private vehicle is advisable as there is good parking fascility (weekends it's very crowded).There lot of accommodation options nearby the beach.There is a famous Church Annai Velankanni Shrine and Shri Ashtalakshmi Temple. Temple is very crowded on Tuesdays and Fridays.The famous broken bridge is also nearby this beach which is worth a visit only during daylight as it is not safe in the darkThe beach is very clean and well maintained, it is very safe as well. Best time to visit would be either evening or early sunrise.There are many activities to do such as skating, merry go round, shooting the balloons. Eateries like Murugan Idli, KFC, Wow Momo, etc

Name: Salomon R
Title: Beautiful place
Review: One of the best place to visit in the evening with your loved ones. Peaceful ambience with some shore restaurants.

Name: Balamurugan D
Title: Soul searching and peace beaches
Review: Best beach experience and activities like balloon shooting and well maintained one. It also has Mcdonalds, Murugan idly shop and sooperstar pizza shop.

Name: Anmol Katiyar
Title: Best beach in Chennai city.
Review: This is the best beach within the city of Chennai (far better than Marina). Beach is clean enough to take a stroll in the evening (but not worth bathing). Also, there are lots of restaurants in the vicinity of beach.

Name: Sunnywin
Title: great beach
Review: Great beach for people watching and catching the sea air in the evenings, lovely place for a stroll.

Name: M B
Title: Must see
Review: The weather was amazing when i visited the beach, the beach has a lot of eateries around it, be it local or well established brands, the beach in itself isn't very clean, but better than many that i have seenDo visit in the evenings or early morning!

Name: Vinay
Title: Beasant Nagar Beach
Review: It is one of the more cleaner beaches in Chennai. The stalls are on the beach spreading dirt and waste produced is spread on the beach. The people throw the paper wrappers etc on the pavements, roads inspite of dustbins placed for the same.Most of the cafes in and around the beach are very small.

Name: Sathish
Title: Wonderful beach to visit
Review: It's one the best and wonderful beach to visit with family and friends during weekends and in special occasions to have fun and enjoyment.

Name: megu
Title: Peaceful beach
Review: Talking about Besant Nagar Beach it is the chennai biggest and crowded beach of the state. The beach is very good and every year people from country and outside tourist comes to this beach to have fun with family and friends. The travel convince to the beach is very good and once can easily reach there. The accommodation and hotel and also present and nearby to the beach area and once can easily find a hotel in their budget. The local sightseeing is done with the help of local guides and individuals. Talking about the safety the safety measures are quite good developed at that area.

Name: Rakshith R
Title: Nice beach
Review: Nice beach to spend time with family and friends...also theres an elliott memorial here...very good to go in the early morning or evening times...

Name: Mr. Kumar
Title: Great cleanness Great ambience
Review: Great place to visit with family and friends it's very much cleaned and well maintained place. best time to visit in early morning or in evening.....

Name: Abhijit verma
Title: Nice and clean
Review: Very nice and clean beach , you can have a long nice walk in evening,good eatery and restaurant are in vicinity. Very nice shopping lane also there where you can pick up something trendy .

Name: Radhaharish B
Title: Marathon
Review: The beach has everything to spend time with your friends and family. I visited this beach at mornings and evenings also. I felt that the ambience at beach surroundings is more lively in evenings than mornings. Good place to spend time and explore the local feeling

Name: Vikram Pandian
Title: Decent beach - good to hang around with family
Review: Pleasant and neat place for families and kids. This location is always crowded in the evening and weekends. Lots of food options as well starting from street food to branded food shops. Evening time is the best time for all to enjoy this place.

Name: Sreya Reddy
Title: Beach
Review: Pleasent at night times on full moonday with good view where the waves were too harsh that we cant getin to. In the evening,it is good to chill yourself with some vendors around with seafood,entertainment games,horse ride,... it is not much crowded..that is the best part for the peace lovers

Name: San
Title: Beautiful but rough
Review: The beach is beautiful but it tends to be pretty rough for the most part. There is also the Shrine to our Lady of Health were people cone from mikes around to pay homage. It is a Roman Catholic Church but people from all denominations visit it.

Name: Rohini
Title: Decent beach
Review: You can find a decent beach . Neat platform to walk .parking area crowded. Better for early morning walk and view of sun rise.

Name: Ronak Gada
Title: One of the cleanest
Review: That was my first reaction. The beach is definitely one of the cleanest beaches I've seen. There is sufficient parking available for 2 and 4 wheelers. The eateries are located on 2 ends of the beach which makes it easier to maintain the cleanliness. There are bins located everywhere so that one does not litter. Beware of hawkers who tend to force you to buy things from them.The only downside is that there is no public restroom nearby which makes it difficult incase there's an emergency with the child.

Name: AjitV
Title: Family Chinese restaurant
Review: Great family Chinese restaurant... Enjoy your favourite fried rice and chilli chicken gravy... Don't miss the dragon chicken, chilly beef, fried ice here.... Great service, friendly and courteous friends who make you feel at home...

Name: Immanuel R
Title: Best place to timepass
Review: Nice time to have fun on Sundays fresh fish üêü stalls especially Jenifer fish stall you get good and fresh fish made of home made masala

Name: Cigin Kuriakose
Title: Lovely beach
Review: Clean, compared to Marina. Good eateries on the shore side. Also called Eliot's beach, it have a memorial monument on the beach sand itself.

Name: K V K
Title: Besant Nagar beach
Review: Besant Nagar Beach, fondly known as Bessie, also called as Elliot's beach is located in Besant Nagar, Chennai, India. It used to be  the end-point of the Marina Beach shore. But now  the beach shore line has extended  far beyond. This beach is named after Edward Elliot, who was the chief magistrate and superintendent of police of erstwhile Madras. The  Velankanni Church and the Ashtalakshmi temple are right on the beach shore. The Karl Schmidt Memorial named after a Dutch sailor who lost his life in the process of saving others from drowning is a very prominent landmark on this beach.Elliot's Beach is one of the cleanest and safest beaches in the city of Chennai  and is an extremely calm and tranquil place. It  is ideal for long walks.  For people who want to soak their feet in the splashing sea water and lose themselves completely in the arms of the nature, this is the place.

Name: YogeshGarg
Title: Very Dirty beach
Review: It is very dirty beach, fully crowded and you will not found any place to sit and enjoy, of you are beach lover it is no where.

Name: KARTHIKb87
Title: Chennai's one of important beach
Review: Its one of chennai important beach after Marina beach and we can visit and enjoy here. on seashore famous Ashtalakshmi temple siturated.

Name: Balz H
Title: Feel and enjoy typical local scene
Review: Enjoy an afternoon and catch the life of locals. Watch how fishermen bring and sell fresh seafood. See and talk with families having a day off. Enjouy this typical  local scene during sun set.

Name: moorthyns
Title: Relax in besanthnagar beach
Review: A nice place to visit and relax with children....pass ur time in the beach with hot and spicy bajjis and chaat items....

Name: AURELIO L
Title: nice place
Review: to see the beach is nice ,it s a way to see another side of the town,don t miss too much time but take a look at the beach

Name: Bibhu_PB
Title: Cleanest Beach
Review: Elliot‚Äôs Beach is a famous place to visit with friends or family. A pleasant and neat place for families and kids. This location is always crowded in the evening and weekends. Lots of food options as well starting from street food to branded food shops. Evening time is the best time for all to enjoy this place.

Name: AartiShankar
Title: Beautiful beach
Review: We have visited this beach N no of times and it's our go to place. It's beautiful and clean. Kids can freely play around. They have a huge giant wheel and few games for kids and families. You get corn, sonpapdi and other yummy treats. It's definitely a must visit place to unwind and relax.

Name: George Georgiev
Title: Incredible place
Review: The Breeze will was away all the smells and you will have beautiful time there, it is a nice place to get a walk, and take a dynamic rest.

Name: Parkins Daniel
Title: Fun with Friends
Review: This place is close to my heart. We have spent lot of time with friends. This place is surrounded by lot of shop and restaurants. We have a church and temple near by.

Name: ArpanPahm
Title: Very famous spot
Review: This is very famous and popular picnic spot to visit. I was there at evening time. Good location. I seat in beach area and enjoyed.

Name: drgarodia
Title: Clean and tidy
Review: Coming from Mumbai, first thing I noticed was cleanliness about this beach. Lots of activities to do and stalls to eat. Overall a good place for outing.

Name: Parth
Title: Its very nice.
Review: Very peaceful atmosphere  wonderful people... very nice food also... there are so many rides for kids also there.......

Name: Kani1710
Title: Great evening at the beach
Review: This is more quieter beach compare to Marina. Had lot of activities and rods for kids and adults. Great eateries at walkable distance from the beach car Parker, which was great for us when traveling with young kids. The only problem is that if you drive yourself... little hard to find parking.

Name: Punch-77
Title: Good to get some fresh sea breeze in the evening
Review: Many residential apartments, shops and restaurants have sprung up in the last decade and this makes the beach crowded. But it is being maintained to match the population challenge.

Name: sathish
Title: Besant nagar beach
Review: Awesome. Stress reliever. If anyone get angered, please go to there. It is really awesome place. This is the first visit of me. Seasore are neat than marina beach

Name: Vinodkumar G
Title: Beach view is awesome , but very crowded in the evening
Review: We went besant nagar beach by auto from our hotel. At the entrance of besant nagar you will find more restaurants to hang out.Beach view is awesome ,but it was very crowded when we reach at 5.30pm , it was about to sunset and we enjoyed fabulously reddish sky touching the sea

Name: satheesh
Title: Posh sister of Marina
Review: Now it had become synonymous with a posh lifestyle and the attraction had diverted from the beach to the restaurants

Name: seninthillu
Title: Serene beach
Review: Besant nagar beach is one of the important beaches of Chennai.This beach is supposed to be one of the cleanest beaches with a vast sand area.Just adjacent to this beach is Besant nagar which is one of the posh living areas of the city.There is a lovey walking track for the regular walkers.Quite a lot of famous eateries are there.The Velankanni church and the Ashtalakshmi temple are nearby.The serene feeling one gets in the beach makes you to visit the beach often.

Name: #amosamiyanayeküéß
Title: #üåä
Review: quit small compare to marina beach but nice and attractive place govt has provided WiFi as well as lots of food items available to byte

Name: Navin Kumar Askaran
Title: A great beach for the young crowd and old.
Review: This small beach is a nice place to unwind with friends and family.Over the years it‚Äôs become commercial but still retains its charm and tearfulness.The eateries and shopping around it are fun.

Name: Swami1939
Title: A CALM PLACE TO REWIND
Review: The Besant Nagar Beach in Chennai is a nice place to spend your evenings with family, Friends and children. This place is less crowded when compared to other beaches in Chennai. The traffic in this area is less. You can relax and  try a few eatables available in and near the place.

Name: Maria
Title: Calm and clourful
Review: This the best beach in Chennai. It is very clean and evenings are very pleasant. Kind can also visit the Lakshmi temple next to the beach.

Name: Subra
Title: Clean but could be cleaner
Review: My aunt used to stay here..so memories from 1980s are fresh in mind. Today it looks like it needs a lot of cleaning - and looks so crowded and commercial. Hey it was still fun!

Name: Anu
Title: Nice place to spend an evening
Review: Spend an evening with kids here. Many eating places and stays here. Burger man in very good and the corner shop as well. Quality is not bad.

Name: lakshmimenon
Title: A visit to the beach
Review: I and my children had a wonderful time at the beach.It was so soothing,the wind kept us to move forward easily,we could breathe in fresh air,everything was perfect.All of us enjoyed this trip very much.

Name: bipdish
Title: Cleanest & most happening beach in chennai
Review: Besant nagar beach is undoubtedly the best beach in chennai. The most happening  & good for family with children because there are a lot of activities for them.

Name: Srinivas P
Title: Keeping up fine
