Review: Still an iconic beach Lots of crowd in the weekend. Plan your parking ahead. Paid parking on the beach road. Side streets are free if you can find a spot. The corporation of Chennai is doing it's best to clean it and the vendors are doing their best to keep the corporation busy.

Name: NnKk
Title: Beach
Review: This is the second most popular beach in chennai. More frequented by the south Chennai people. Relatively smaller than the marina beach. But full of activity. I wish the authorities took away the vendors on the beach. Restore it to its old beauty.

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: Far from city but good and peaceful
Review: Its one of the must visit temples in Chennai. Love to visit the beach again  and again. Its a bit far from the city but like the beach very much.

Name: kungfupanda
Title: It's not a friendly place to go with children.
Review: The place is so dirty, who knows what kind of diseases you may get from here. I once saw a local guy pooped on the shore  early morning .It's better to go marina beach which is more beautiful and bigger than this. Dont recommend to anyone.

Name: Sai B
Title: Nice Beach
Review: Its a nice beach, but little crowded during weekends, if you visit during week days its good. But its not well maintained now a days. the sea water smell is horrible some times

Name: Himanshu A
Title: Garbage and plastic
Review: Garbage and plastic is thrown all over the beach. Litter is all that you will find in the beach. Marina beach is cleaner so do not waste your time at bessy.

Name: Abdul wahaab
Title: Small beach in city
Review: It is a small beach in the city but the environment maintained is clean. All the top level people's visits this beach and its most famous for the broken bridge Food essential outlets were available here

Name: Sathya
Title: Nice beach
Review: Never venture during weekends. Horrible crowd. Nice beach with food walkway and no ice restaurants and shopping areas

Name: Anu
Title: Small beach - not crowded
Review: Wonderful Beach. I had loads of fun for about 2 hrs and headed back home.Feel relaxed and calm. A good place to be.

Name: RoadToSky
Title: Average beach - very crowded
Review: When you go this beach, be ready to cross the way full of stinking fried fish. There is not much space there as it is over crowded and parking can also be an issue.

Name: Mukeshkahna
Title: Not much spl
Review: Beach is big but heavy crowd,notuch likable. Hope local crowds may like. It was my intrst to see...okkk

Name: Rajeshkumar C
Title: Visit to Besant nagar beach
Review: In life there are few things which make me more  than happy . I love being with nature and in particular I love to spend time in beaches with some nice music or a good book. My favorite holiday spot is beaches.Being in Chennai the biggest advantage is proximity to beaches , Marina beach, Besant Nagar beach, Tiruvanmiyur beach and so on..More than Marina beach I prefer to go to Elliot's beach since it is less crowded and cleaner than Marina beach. Marina beach is more commercial and Besant Nagar beach gives more privacy...This beach is more for the people those who prefer to be away from the commercial things and crowded space. This beach is a great boon for the localites to spend time. Most of the crowd is from local residential areas. Also lot of volunteer meets happen in this place in the weekends

Name: G Muralitharan
Title: Family Beach
Review: It is not so good sand and crowded during week ends. Children can enjoy little. Corn fry and sundal available. Compare to Marina this beach  Eliiots is ok.

Name: Dr P Nagaraj
Title: Nice Weekend Hang out
Review: It‚Äôs a nice weekend hangout beach Expecially with friends to Have calm beautiful wind as well loving the nature

Name: The nomad couple
Title: Lovely little beach
Review: If you bored or frustrated with the crowd in marina this is your go to beach. Not very rushed in a weekday. We had a great time enjoying in the water and the children enjoyed playing the small games close by.Lot of eateries around.

Name: Karikalan S
Title: Morning evening invariably a fabulous place to visit
Review: good for morning walk and evening walk. An excellent evening outing for the travellers and the whole family. It's unfortunate off late the skyline and the sea line is changing due to too much of commercial exploitation and it is pathetic the government agency is a silect spectators. The local corporators are the worst culprits. Still thanks to the police patrolling and the conscious local citizens are doing their best to preserve.With all odds the place is an excellent destination for the activity, for a breeze or for short eats and for spend time.

Name: psp
Title: nice place
Review: one of the place to hangout in chennai...very clean n over crowded during weekends...morning walk in this place was excellent, pleasure,  calm n enjoyable...

Name: AMUTHA KUMAR
Title: Great experience
Review: Neet beach Good for health Long walk and variety of spicy hotels at beach side Small rides Happy moments Super beach experiences

Name: lashmi menon
Title: Very nice beach
Review: Very nice beach in Chennai after marina beach it was fantastic  place u will different  types  of food and best kulfi will be thre it was best one with lots of nuts i seriously  recommend  it just 25 rupees or something  bt best one

Name: Samah
Title: Beach
Review: Among all the beaches, this beach has a little classy road, it‚Äôs not overcrowded near the water because there are many restaurants around this area is more know for the food walk near the beach it‚Äôs a clean beach and is very peaceful! There are so many options for food.

Name: Rangakumar
Title: Relaxed, destressing
Review: Marina beach has become crowded, Besant nager is not yet crowded you can go and have a dip on the beachfood also we have options form KFC to veggies pizza to panipoorisspring potato to gola icenice place to walk along with kidsgood to walk along the sea bed on the sandany time nice place, day time for secret couples....

Name: Cyrus
Title: Very nice for evening visit
Review: I went here with my family. Place is good, nice beaches very clean compared to other beaches in Chennai. Will get lot of street food to eat.

Name: Gairik M
Title: A pleasing experience
Review: I visited there on the evening of 17.8.2019. Compared to the Marina beach, it's smaller and crowded. However, the waves and the sea-breeze had a soothing effect. We enjoyed various food items being sold at the beach.

Name: Vanisha Krishnananthan
Title: Very dirty beach
Review: Extremely messy beach, lots of rubbish everywhere. Perhaps some rubbish bins might encourage a bit of civic consciousness . It‚Äôs lovely with games n restaurants but the cleanliness was not there

Name: Sanjay S
Title: Very nice beach front to stroll
Review: Visited this beach in the evening at around 7 pm. Nice place to stroll and relax. Plenty of snack stalls around. Had dinner at KFC right in front of the Beach road.

Name: Nish_Wish
Title: Better than Marina beach anyday...
Review: Quieter Calmer and more relaxing beach with better Cafe and overall ecosystem. Enjoyed our time there

Name: sathish
Title: Besant Nagar Beach - Best place to spend with families and friends
Review: It's one of the best place to spend weekend evenings with families and friends. It's has lot of fun filled places around the beach. We have many number of game options like gun shooting, ring throw around the beach. We have many varieties of local food available such as, popcorn, curly potatoes, mojito, colas, fish items such as prawn, crab, squid at reasonable rates. Bajji stalls are available in large numbers around beach, which is very famous here. We have varieties of rattinams available for both kids and adults. Horse riding is also available at reasonable rate. We also have commercial hotels and pubs around the beach which is bit costly. Overall it's a must place to visit for great fun.

Name: TravelDiaries_Pulkit
Title: As good as Marina!
Review: If you liked Marina, you will like this one as well. Ensure that you go during good weather, you will like the walk. Good places around as well.

Name: Gopi T
Title: Best in Chennai
Review: Comparing to marina Beach the water was clean and the beach was well organized when you visit in Chennai don‚Äôt miss out .before you go to Marina Beach visit here.Even in the night time you can play it‚Äôs a very good place for team outing.

Name: Mukund R
Title: Always relaxing
Review: On a slightly windy day it's best to sit and enjoy the waves crashing down. Lots of small eats available around.

Name: sundarjagalan
Title: Best in  chennai
Review: This place gives you full entertainment in the field of cinema. Good ambience, sound and cleanliness is also good.

Name: Sunil
Title: What a walk near the beach
Review: Very nice place to chill out especially in evening. Just you need to sit and relax and enjoy the ocean view .You get many things near by beach, cafe and other few restaurants.

Name: Singhan S
Title: Great place for walk
Review: Had a nice morning walk along the beach to refresh and get energetic. The soup being served on the roadside was simply ecstatic.

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: This one of the cleanest beaches of Chennai
Review: We had been to this beach several times and enjoyed playing and bathing in the water. Though we always used to travel by bus. Really nice beach üèñ unlike mareena Beach it's clean and you won't find much fish üê† smell here. Bus facility is very close there is a bus depot in Besant Nagar. So you reach most of the places easily.

Name: Deadman17
Title: Smaller but peaceful
Review: This beach is smaller than the more famous Marina Beach, but is much more peaceful, given that very few people visit it. the place is ofcourse not very clean because of the low attraction of tourists. Still one can easily take a nice walk along the beach peacefully. Would suggest people to go here if Marina beach is not for you.

Name: satyajitjadhav
Title: Good place to visit
Review: Good place to visit with family but need more cleanliness. Nice place to spend some evening time. Snacks stalls are available.

Name: idea614354
Title: Good to see
Review: this is a one best place to enjoy beach in chennai,   very big and good one. many movies are shooted in this.

Name: Rakesh
Title: A Great Early Morning Beach!
Review: Also known as the Edward Elliot‚Äôs Beach, it is good beach in Southern Chennai. The length and breadth of the beach is much small compared to the famous Marina beach. But, it is more peaceful and cleaner than Marina because fewer people visit and there are fewer food vendors and sellers.Garbage and littering can be seen here and there but still is less compared to the larger Marina.Early morning hours is recommended.

Name: jayakumar
Title: Great place but unclean place
Review: This place can be very organized and can offer disciplined clean practices by placing trash bins. Stall offer spiral potato where the sticks are potential risk to feet as these hidden objects in sand can get into your feet

Name: Mitesh Bhandari
Title: A Must Try For Anyone who visits Chennai
Review: This is on of the most popular beaches of Chennai. the area has some amazing restaurants and also local eat outs. With family/friends its the best place t kill time or get peace of mind. Sunday Mornings are usually "Car Free Sundays" here, and the best place for your morning walks.

Name: DSKTraveller
Title: For a relaxing evening or morning
Review: Unlike the Marina beach, the Besant Nagar Beach or Elliots Beach is more clean but shorter. Located in a slightly posh area, the Elliots Beach is a good place for morning and evening walk or a family outing. While the Marina offers hot bajjis and snacks, the road to Elliots is dotted with a variety of restaurants where you can have dinner. Some of these restaurants have seating arrangement in the open which goes well with the breeze. You can explore restaurants serving south Indian, tandoori and continental dishes. Sunday mornings are usually car free times so you can actually park your vehicles elsewhere and walk on the road along the beach sands. You also get to play games or participate in group activities during those few hours. Overall it is a less crowded beach and you can combine your visit here with shopping in the nearby showrooms.

Name: kovaiRavindran
Title: The Ugly Beach
Review: Once in my childhood this beach was a familiar one to me and no crowd was here comparing with Marina Beach.But now this Beach also condemned by the crowd.

Name: CK T
Title: Not as crowded as Merina Beach, very pleasant and comfortable.
Review: The beach is not as wide as Merina Beach, but you still have the same ambiance and easy access to the restaurants along the beachside. There is fish market nearby and a very grand church. Nice place to spend during the evening with the sea breeze.

Name: arnabc_iitm
Title: Shortest beach of Chennai
Review: Most of the Chennai Beaches are very long. This is the shortest beach and very close to IIT, Adyar. The food court attached with it also serves good food. You can spned a good evening in this beach for sure.

Name: Anjal s
Title: worst
Review: Should nt visit this beach with your girlfriend. Not so good people around. Very untidy all over the beach

Name: muthuvel r
Title: always my favorite beach in the world
Review: for besant nagar is nostalgia.with my friends we used to sit and have lots of healthy discussions.  lots of water have flown through the bridge . lots of changes happened  in and around the beach for last 20 yrs still its one of my favorite. now it has become little busier and commercial .

Name: satheesh
Title: The Posh sister Of Marina
Review: The beach lining with posh restaurants make it a great place to hangout with friends and family .Kids can have plenty of fun.

Name: Darshank
Title: Good beach
Review: When I visited Chennai I had been to this besant nagar beach. It was a good joyful experience I really enjoyed

Name: Ahamed
Title: Peaceful and less crowded
Review: Nice place to visit. It is most pleasant as it is less crowded than marina. There are lots of good restaurants around

Name: fransis
Title: nice
Review: best place to visit . will alwats come back to see this place .. amazing place to have a good time .

Name: TSinParis
Title: Interesting Enough
Review: Coming from Europe where there are so many beautiful churches and cathedrals, this one seems a bit ordinary.   However, in a city that does not really have too many stellar tourist attractions, this church is on the must-see list.   Moreover, it is interesting to note that Indian Catholics seem much more devout than European ones.

Name: TwinMamaNYC
Title: Beautiful and interesting Church
Review: Come to see the Church, where you will see Jesus on the cross robed in a distinctly Indian way.  Also there is a relic of St. Thomas the Apostle, and Our Lady of Mylapore. St. Francis Xavier once prayed in front of this image of Our Lady, when he was in Madras.

Name: Chennai Green Cabs
Title: CHENNAI GREEN CABS, CAR RENTAL, OUTSTATION CARS OFFORDABLE PRICE
Review: best place in chennai we visited shrine by taking chennai green cabs cabs from chennai, all went good

Name: Andrew D
Title: Exceeding expectation
Review: I am not usually a fan of churches, but this is susprisingly good. It is one of the only three churches in the world built on a tomb of a disciple. The building is imposing and it is lovingly located on the same street where a Muslim mosque and Hindhu temples can be found, talk about multi-cultural!

Name: Sunnywin
Title: History
Review: A beautiful church but wow what a history. One of only three remaining churches in the world built over the tomb of one of Jesus' disciples.

Name: Eileen108
Title: Must Destination when Visiting Chennai
Review: Beautiful church with a separate chapel where the burial and the relics of St. Thomas are kept. Peaceful place for contemplation. This is a must destination when visiting Chennai!

Name: Jayanta Mitra
Title: Tomb of Saint Thomas The Apostle
Review: Santhome Basilica is one of the three known churches in the world which was built over the tomb of an apostle of Jesus. It holds the tomb and relics of Saint Thomas The Apostle, a patron saint who had lived continued service to Lord till his last days. The cathedral is absolutely breathtaking and phenomenal. The architecture is really impressive specially neo gothic structure with white facade and colourful stained window glasses. The calm and comforting interior has an aura of peace to it, inviting all those who seek peace and tranquility. Indeed the most beautiful church I've ever been to. Definitely a must visit place if you are coming to Chennai.

Name: Bette59
Title: Beautiful
Review: It was moving to see where St. Thomas has tomb and church in recognition of his mission in India.  The church has beautiful altar.

Name: Karthik
Title: one of best Roman Catholic Church
Review: during the festive feast visited there rarely missed Bothuma, the tears cant control during mass, the architecture were surprised

Name: John Tenis
Title: Very Beautiful church in Chennai.
Review: A very Beautiful church in Chennai I have visited. I Gothic style of the church is loved by my family.A a very sacred tomb of Saint Thomas under the church.

Name: Mridul Ghosh
Title: Serene and calm
Review: The Santhome Church is one of the oldest churches of Chennai. Located at a very convenient location near the lighthouse of Marina Beach, it is easily accessible from anywhere in Chennai.The Church is peaceful and calm. The European architecture also encourages to marvel at the beauty of this beautiful church.

Name: Mani Karthik
Title: peace and calm
Review: San Thome Church, also known as St. Thomas Cathedral Basilica and National Shrine of Saint Thomas, is a Roman Catholic minor basilica in Santhome, in the city of Chennai, This church has the status of a minor basilica, originally the old church was built in the 16th century by Portuguese explorers and rebuilt again with the status of cathedral by the British in 1893, Touring to this Madras Santhome Cathedral Basilica church is pretty easy, as you will get auto rickshaws, 'call taxis' and even luxurious cabs. Auto rickshaws are the cheapest ones but bargain carefully before you get into one.

Name: Sud D
Title: Ancient Basilica
Review: This church is very old and built  by the Portuguese in the 16th century. It is connected with the legend of St. Thomas.

Name: Hooray H
Title: Stunning
Review: Perhaps the oldest Catholic Church in India. Amazing.Well worth visiting but the access is not easy. Always busy.

Name: Poopyscoop
Title: A little bit of tranquility
Review: Beautiful church and our favourite thing in Chennai. Lots to see and it‚Äôs a gorgeous building. The church is easy to walk around and it‚Äôs less chaotic than other places. A little bit of tranquility. I don‚Äôt think you need a tour to do this. Just book a taxi and go there.

Name: lily&glen
Title: Blessed to be there
Review: Its a beautiful Church, also known as St. Thomas Cathedral Basilica and National Shrine of Saint Thomas is a Roman Catholic minor basilica in Santhome, in the city of Chennai (Madras), India. It was built in the 16th century by Portuguese explorers, over the tomb of Saint Thomas, one of the twelve apostles of Jesus.

Name: Frank Calberg
Title: Beautiful church
Review: It was a wonderful experience visiting the church on Republic. The first things I noticed about the first were these: Great lighting. Happy music and much singing. The church was painted beautifully, and it was clean everywhere.

Name: Jijo
Title: Peace,Calm & Divine
Review: I have been with my Son along with my Junior.The church around so much Divine/felt the peace in me. Architectural of the Church is Aamzing.

Name: Swarna
Title: There are only three of them in the whole world
Review: Calm and serene, it houses the remains of one of Jesus's Apostle. There are two more cathedrals like this, but, in Europe.  A good place to visit on a tour to Chennai.

Name: _ritamanning66
Title: lovely building
Review: we arrived during a festival Pongal, which is similar to harvest festival . drawings are done outside churches , temples and homes. This is a very interesting cathedral but photos are limited inside.

Name: Deadman17
Title: Peaceful
Review: We went here on a Friday night and found that a wedding was being conducted. Hence we just paid our respects and came out. The building is magnificent and the beauty increases at night. The atmosphere is calm. The history of place states that St. Thomas one of the original Apostles was buried here and hence the name San Thome Church.

Name: PitoyAmpil1941
Title: A Massive Cathedral with a small Museum at the back
Review: a great place to visit during weekends..... the Cathedral if the seat of the ArchDiocese of Madras thru its ArchBishop... great Gothic architecture....  Sunday services in Tamil n English throughout Sunday mornings.... with a 6pm Mass in the evening

Name: SingaporeGirl
Title: Historical church, home of the St. Thomas Christians
Review: Much larger than one might expect with exhibition halls and venues, including a small snack shop, in addition to the main church. The underground 'crypt' with a relic of St. Thomas had a lovely very quiet atmosphere where many travellers and visitors stopped for a silent prayer. The apostle Thomas is not buried here, however, as the Portuguese apparently sent his body back to Portugal, but a small relic was kept. St. Francis visited the site in 1541 adding to its historicity. Plan a 30-minute visit. When we were there, we found a wedding in process--a real bonus!

Name: Alan R
Title: Beautiful church
Review: This is a very peaceful place to visit in a busy loud city. Extremely well kept in a nice neighbourhood.Well worth a visit.

Name: James G
Title: St. Thomas the Apostle in India
Review: A reverent site commemorating the work of St. Thomas and his sacrificial life. Note: you must remove your shoes to enter

Name: jackharrybill
Title: Very fine church
Review: This Catholic Church has some interesting history and is a fine piece of architecture. If buildings and particularly religious buildings are your thing don't miss this. One of only three Churches containing supposed relics of an apostle. Make of that what you will.

Name: delph1969
Title: Beautiful
Review: A very nice white church beautiful contrast in the decor of a city of chennai.Very well maintained.Nice stainglass work, beautiful wooden pieces, music , a peacefull place that everybody seems to respect.

Name: Siegfried S
Title: Peaceful Place
Review: It is a peaceful and relaxing place. For me as a Christian German it is very nice to see so many nice churches in Southern India.

Name: Mikan999
Title: Attractive Basilica
Review: This church is dedicated to Saint Thomas (the doubting Thomas of Jesus‚Äô disciples) and has a beautiful tranquil ambience. The outside is painted pure white and is a fantastic contrast with the deep blue of a sunny Chennai day. Inside the decor is quite plain but also spiritual. Signs say no photography inside but most Indian visitors were happily taking photos. Look closely at the framed paintings of the disciples on the walls - they are portrayed as if they were Bollywood stars. You have to go behind the church to enter the tomb of Thomas, even quieter and more spiritual. There is a small museum there too. We visited This Catholic church and Kapaleeshwarar Hindu temple in the same morning - it is fascinating to contrast and compare how the two religions have built and use their places of worship just 500m apart.

Name: KARTHIKb87
Title: Oldest church in Chennai
Review: Its called santhome cathedral basilica . Its considered as important church for christians in chennai and one of must visit church in chennai. Located near seashore and near to Marina beach .People will throng place on festivals.

Name: Manmeet k
Title: Worst place to have food & stay
Review: The worst food I‚Äôve had on the planet in the name of buffet is served by the roof top restaurant ‚ÄòAngare‚Äô.Wifi is pathetic that simply never works!Hand towel in the washroom is worse than a mobbing cloth. I am falling short of words to describe why the hell did I decide on staying here that too for 4 days & 3 nights....

Name: TravellingSands
Title: Basilica of St Thomas the Apostle
Review: This church is located on the Southern end of the Marina beach road. It has been constructed over the mortal remains of St Thomas the disciple of Jesus Christ.

Name: Missy L
Title: Very spiritual....feel the presence of Jesus! So blessed!
Review: The church is located in Chennai India. I took the photo in the evening. It‚Äôs called Santhome Cathedral Basilica. It‚Äôs built over the remains of Thomas one of the apostles of Jesus Christ! Thomas spent a great deal of time in Chennai spreading the word of Jesus Christ! So blessed to find this holy gem! ‚ô•Ô∏è

Name: AURELIO L
Title: colonial church
Review: don t miss this colonial church,this is a portughese colonial catholic church and it is important, i suggest to go to see this church because there is the body of st Thomas buried

Name: %FastFlyer
Title: Very holy spot
Review: A must see due to belief the St. Thomas is interred here. Beautiful chapel. Basement under the alter is where he is.

Name: Ansi
Title: a must
Review: definetely worth to visit. Very impressive and  wonderful. We would definitely go again if we could. recommendable

Name: Thaila S
Title: Beautiful!
Review: We went here through a walking tour and it was lovely.  I am Hindu and this was my first time here.  It is peaceful and tranquil.  I loved just sitting in the church in silence and contemplation.

Name: MsLiz
Title: A Grand Icon
Review: This beautiful old church with its calming atmosphere is a pleasant place to visit for peace & reflection. It‚Äôs well maintained and has many original features to admire. When visiting this building, please be respectful and remember it‚Äôs a house of worship. Noisy tourists taking selfies & talking loudly to one another are not appreciated.

Name: JeyT
Title: Grand Old Church with under ground prayer Hall
Review: Grand OLd church with an underground prayer room. Well maintained and quiet halls to pray. Need to remove footwear in certain places as a sign of respect.

Name: Alan J
Title: Cool space
Review: This church has a pleasant atmosphere without the aire of decay found in many of the colonial period churches. The development as a tourist attraction and museum has enhanced the visitor experience.It still shows military connections.

Name: Jerome Arulappa
Title: Awesome Church to visit in a Lifetime!
Review: I belong to this Parish and this Church is one among the Top Three Churches in the World where the Relic of the Apostle of Jesus Christ is preserved (St. Thomas‚Äôs Relic)üòä On top of that we have ‚ÄúOur Lady of Mylapore‚Äù who guards the people in and around Mylapore. I am feeling blessed to be part of this Parish! All the very best for your Future Trip to Chennai üòä

Name: CarolVimla
Title: Beautiful Church
Review: No words to describe the beautiful structure of the church and its location. Such a lovely feeling to attend Mass at the church. Loved every precious moment spent there.

Name: Sione Toumolupe
Title: Great history
Review: Come visit and take a look behind the church the tomb of st thomas and gallery of historical artifacts. Incredible

Name: #amosamiyanayeküéß
Title: ‚ù§Ô∏èüôè
Review: the most knowing church in chennai as well as it's one of the oldest church mass timing will be evening at every day at the same time the museum about st thomas,  just behind the church

Name: Adele Augustin
Title: St. Thomas Cathedral Basilica
Review: Beautiful cathedral. ‚ù§Ô∏è Be sure to visit St. Thomas‚Äô tomb and the museum in the back. Saint Thomas is one of the 12 apostles of Jesus.

Name: Wil Chung
Title: Beautiful
Review: What a gorgeous place to visit. Not really much more to say. Please ensure you are wearing appropriate clothing as they may not allow you in the cathedral - also, as much as it is beautiful, again be respectful as it is a place of worship first and foremost.

Name: MarkfromtheIsland
Title: Yet another church
Review: Stained glass? checkpews?  checkstatues of jesus and/or mary?  checkdonation boxes?  no checks - cash pleaseIt's a church.  If you're impressed by churches come see it.  You can see a box in the basement that supposedly contains doubting Thomas (if he ever really existed).  We walked through here in about 90 seconds.

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: Cant forget the church
Review: It was the first thing that I found in chennai because when I visited chennai it was the landmark that was mentioned to reach my office that is close to this church. It is a very big church and it is completely whitecwashed and well manintained. And also very close to Mareena beach.

Name: Nelsonjohn P
Title: Very good
Review: It's a beautiful basilica of St. THOMAS I have been here everytime I come to visit velankanni I visited the basement where st Thomas grave it's very adorable Shall visit again

Name: Andypandy
Title: An apostle of jesus is buried here!
Review: I was shocked to find out that there are only 2 other places in the world where an apostle of jesus has been buried and people in chennai do not know about the importance of this fact. I wish we celebrated this beautiful church more

Name: Anu T
Title: peace of mind
Review: it was my 2nd visit and it was the peace of mind.no religion bar anyone can go and visit and if you want can pray.we feel relaxed and get energy being there.

Name: Sandy
Title: St Thomas Basilica
Review: Beautiful church. Gorgeous inside. Absolutely loved the visit. Very well set up with write ups on the reason for the church.

Name: gupreen
Title: In Indian a true Apostle's Shrine
Review: I have seen this place twice and it is a delight to see all the glass paintings and excellent wood work. The shrine and the small museum are nicely maintained. There could have been some better description with the exhibits however. Unlike other monuments, the Church compound houses restrooms that are very well maintained (don't pick me on this one - I have kids!)

Name: William F
Title: visit
Review: I go to this church whenever I am in Chennai. Wonderful place to be, and historic. Be sure to check out the museum

Name: KVG55
Title: Pilgrimage
Review: Visited Apostle St. Thomas tomb, at Mylapore.Clean and well maintained premises.Prayed at the Church and visited the tomb.Museum is informative and historically interesting.

Name: Ronan P
Title: Very beautiful, surprisingly moving
Review: I hadn't intended to visit the church, but I had hired a driver who insisted on taking me there on the way to a Hindu Temple. I am very glad he did. This church is one of only three in the world to hold the remains of one of the original disciples, the others being St Peters in Rome, and Santiago de Compostela.St Thomas, he who doubted, was martyred in India, and his remains are held here. They have the lance heaad which killed him. Oh, I know the cynics will say "I thought they only came in packs of twelve", but it is very moving to explore the little museum, the basement chapel where the tomb is, and the church itself, a cool, beautiful oasis of peace in the middle of the bustle of Chennai. The original church was builtby Persian Christians in the 10th Century, but this fell into disrepair five hundred years later, so the Portugese built a church on the current site to hold the tomb in 1522. This building is from 1896, but the feeling of such long continuity remains. I loved visiting it, and found it very moving, more so than I had imagined.

Name: Richard
Title: Good visit to this Church
Review: I didn't know until recently that Thomas, He who has been given sainthood by the Catholic church and an Apostle of the Lord Jesus Christ, had visited India. I was pleased to visit and see genuine worshipers upholding their faith in Christ.  I did wonder what was in the safe in the wall and why it was open and highlighted.  I saws a group of people doing morning exercises in the yard. that was interesting to see at a church.  What was also interesting was the presence of a moderately large police contingent at the site. Hmmm..

Name: John O
Title: Wedding
Review: A wedding was going on, so we didn't go in far, but were able to sit in back. It is a very pretty church.

Name: Grishma K
Title: Must visit in Chennai
Review: Must visit for history lovers. Easily accessible. Do not forget to visit the chapel behind the church to see St Thomas's tomb. Great architecture built by the British. Lots of history attached to this place. Ample parking.

Name: Michael1052
Title: Woinderful atmosphere
Review: Whatever your religion, you will find this cathedral a joy to sit within. It serves the spiritual yearning by dint of its fine architecture, beautiful high wooden ceilings and sense of openness. Definitely worth spending a half-hour just sitting quietly inside.

Name: Krishnan P Sivam
Title: most memorable place
Review: Good one. Almost each hour prayer in different languages .. nice to sit and pray. In city traffic and loud noise environment, one can get a calm and peaceful place in centre of the town.

Name: Shyamala Abraham
Title: Must visit Church
Review: There are a lot of things to know about this place. It's first of all situated in one of the nicest area in Chennai, Mylapore. The Church is built on the grave of St.Thomas, a disciple of Jesus Christ. There arr only three churches in the world built on the grave of the disciples of Jesus and Santhome is one among them. A relic of St.Thomas is kept in the underground and a musuem is also there which depicts the old and traditional stories and the things. The Church has a great history behind. There is also a pole of St.Thomas behind the Church which was made thanking God for saving Santhome from the tsunami,2004.

Name: kurien2014
Title: Three Cathedrals in the world supposedly built over the tomb of apostles St.Peter's St.James  and Santhome
Review: Legend has it that among the 12 disciples st.Thomas landed up in India and lived in St.Thomas Mount and buried in Santhome the Portugese quarter in Madras. The three disciples over whose tombs Cathedrals have been built are St.Peter at Rome St.James in Spain and Santhome for St.Thomas. The fact that there is a 400 year gap between the time Jesus Christ was nailed to the cross to the time St.Thomas landed up at Santhome. However the interesting feature is this is one cross with Christ fully clothed standing in a lotus with two peacocks on either side

Name: Nicholas Mariarputham
Title: Santhome Cathedral
Review: National shrine, built over the tomb of Saint Thomas in 16th century by Portuguese explorers and rebuilt by British in 19th century is a must visit if one  has to give some historic preview  of the city to growing teenagers,  the architecture is neo gothic with large windows and colored panes and the interior is well lit naturally. It is worth attending a Sunday morning service and planning a short drive along the Marina beach and to a nice restaurant for lunch.

Name: Ganesh K
Title: Spoiled the nature
Review: Famous church located on the sea shore. Lakhs of people visit this place every year but maintenance is poor and staff's are total waste. Dust and garbage are dumped in around the church.small shops are occupying the entrance and it's very tough to enter. Because of this traffics are jammed. Raw fish vendor's are selling their products very nearby area's so stinky smell. Police corporation and the church management should take action to keep the decorum of the dividend place in peaceful. People should have responsibility to make the church as God's house.

Name: SashSo
Title: Calm atmosphere
Review: A very nice and calm setting for this church means that you‚Äôre able to get the best by not travelling far at all. There is also a small museum.

Name: Amit S
Title: Ideal Place for worship
Review: Very peaceful and tranquil atmosphere . Very near from Marina Beach. Exquisite architectural elegance all over

Name: J Roy
Title: Nice
Review: Wow place . This was first time that went to church to experience and to know things better. Really peaceful place

Name: robert_b_shaw
Title: What's to not like (picarking)
Review: Nice "gothic style" church (a light-cream "Notre Dame" (close). Lots of character. Take public transportation or Uber/Ola to get here. Parking gets filled very quickly

Name: macooke23
Title: A holy place in it's own way
Review: Had the good fortune to be at this church with my family from London  during Lent attending the good Friday service as well as the Easter vigil on Saturday night. The services were well organized in the true spirit of death and the rising of the holy spirit. Beautiful cathedral and very helpful prists and nuns. Our highlight was visiting the tomb of st Thomas which is located within the church grounds.

Name: SMOOZA
Title: Beautiful church
Review: Beautiful church which stands out amongst its colourful surroundings. Very busy with services going on inside and outside when we visited. Worth a visit especially if you‚Äôre in the area.

Name: neeraj2boby
Title: one out of three of its kind in whole world
Review: The other two are in Rome and in Spain. Built over  tombs of saints (total 12 saints of Christ) only 3 cathedrals have the honour and this is the one . The entrance to the crypt is from behind the nain church and can be missed if one is not attentive enough. Serenely and full of positive energy...must see.

Name: Anjal s
Title: Peacefulness
Review: Every time i visit this place i was kinda filled with some positive thoughts in my mind. Very good place for peaceful meditations

Name: Fredy J
Title: My most peaceful place
Review: It's really the most peaceful place inspite of traffic around....This church is being built on the tomb of St.Thomas ..One of the 12 apostles who lived with Jesus ...we are really blessed to have this church in our city...I believe we have only 3 churches in the world being built  on tomb of Apostle ..this is the one

Name: J. Benjamin Jacob
Title: St. Santhome church Adyar Chennai India
Review: When ever I go to Chennai if I fee I visited this church. Our prayers will spiritually strong us. We can feel the sprit of power come in us. Our dedicated prayer will be honoured by the God our Jesus Christ. The British government and the people‚Äôs biggest gift to the whole people of India. In this church we can see the power of God‚Äôs sprits.praise Jesus in our life.

Name: dinesh s
Title: The best
Review: Best evening ever . Thanks to all gavin alok Kapoor and everyone who helped us out . Would love to come again

Name: TE K
Title: Casual
Review: I visited this place with my friends. It is good. We can reach this place by bus or local train. It is near to marina beach also

Name: Kaviyanathan
Title: Name for Neatness ..!
Review: Even though it has its history, still today the kind of maintenance which this church is getting in the society is too high and it is worth going to the church and visiting the place. The sanctum is maintained to the core and you can also feel the energy and vibration which you need when going to a Church ..!

Name: Drboomer
Title: Awesome
Review: One of three Churches in the world built over the tomb of one Jesus's Apostles. I love going to Mass there when I am visiting Chennai and spending time in front of the Blessed Sacrament. English Mass at 6AM every morning during the week.

Name: netovanethan
Title: Wonderful Visit
Review: A truly remarkalbe experience in the heart of Chennai. A worthwhile visit whilst in Chennai, great history and a truly beautiful building.

Name: SriMayuri
Title: Beautiful
Review: Love the architecture and the super clean surrounding. This church is historic in more ways than one. St Thomas is buried here and you could see his tomb.

Name: snehatsamuel
Title: A beautiful church
Review: A beautiful church and must visit place to anyone visiting chennai. The architecture is so beautiful and the museum where St. Thomas's memorial is kept is well maintained with air conditioned environment. My second favourite church to go to..

Name: kathy b
Title: A beautiful place
Review: On a Cunard Cruise we were in Chennai for one day. It was Sunday morning and it was delightful to find ourselves at the back of the congregation singing hymns and saying prayers.  Just like home except for the wonderful mix of nationalities here.  We left our shoes and walked on the beautifully pristine white marble floor to see the tomb.  Quiet, peaceful and very moving. The church is nearing the end of some restoration work and very very pretty.

Name: hurricanekatrinarule
Title: On a tour
Review: This was very busy.  You are required to remove your shoes and leave them in a cupboard.  You have to walk down stairs into a basement section.  Photos are not allowed.  When you get to the tomb a lady tells you a few words about it.  You are then free to collect shoes and look in the museum.  This is probably of more interest to people who are religious.

Name: Lyndall J
Title: Historically Interesting
Review: The supposed site of the martyrdom of St. Thomas - interesting blend of cultures with Jesus standing on a lotus flower. Watch out for fake "tour guides."  You do not need one to see and read about everything.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Dedicated to one of the ten saints
Review: The place is built by saint thomas who is one of the ten disciples of lord jesus.since the body of the saint is buried here and one can visit cementry inside under the ground d level of the temple this place is world famous and one among the important five temples dedicated to the disciples of lord jesus.

Name: varun v
Title: Spiritual
Review: Its a very beautiful cathedral, of St Thomas,one of the 12 apostles of Christ.Nice ambience inside,can offer prayer peacefully.Architecture will attract you the most.Behind the cathedral there is a museum, there you can find the tomb of St Thomas.Its in Mylapore area of Chennai, approx 4km from marina beach.

Name: Thomas J
Title: Fresh painted and renovated
Review: Thank you God for this great basilica on the beach side . It was great to see where he walked even 2000 years later

Name: vashish_3
Title: Holy old Church
Review: Its a historical church building. You can sit and pray in this church. Half an hour is sufficient to visit.

Name: Thomas D
Title: Wonderful, whitewashed cathedral
Review: This wonderful, whitewashed cathedral is supposed to be the place where St Thomas was buried. Be aware that the tomb is not accessible via the cathedral, but from behind the church. The entrance to the tomb is via a small museum.

Name: Rasputin21
Title: A Roman Catholic church honoring St Thomas
Review: San Thome as it is known, is a pristine white church among the decaying Madras surroundings.  Unfortunately, it is currently being renovated and is covered in scaffolding making photography difficult.  On the left as you enter the grounds is a very realistic and well maintained grotto with luxurious foliage.  There is limited parking available.The current church was built in the 16th Century by the Portuguese.  It was built to contain the martyred remains of St Thomas the Apostle.  It must have been quite a feat for him to have travelled so far  in AD 52.  He was martyred on St Thomas' Mount and a diorama of the martyrdom is displayed in the crypt.The Church was rebuilt by the British in 1893.  The spire reaches a height of 155ft.The Portuguese influence is confirmed by the brass panels identifying the various priests of the church.  Even if they had English names, they were prefixed by "Dom".One enters the church through the side entrance and is immediately entranced by the beautiful gold chandeliers.  On the right is the simple choir accessed from the entrance.  To the left is the main altar with large statues of various saints.  What is unusual is that there are pews in the altar area as well.   To the right is the chapel of the Virgin of Mylapore where the Virgin is dressed in a blue sari.On the left is the Holy Sacrament Chapel.  Behind the church is a building that contains a museum and the crypt.  One has to remove one's shoes and climb down the stairs to the crypt.  No photography is allowed in the crypt.  Although the museum is on the ground floor one has to remove one's shoes to enter there too!Do visit and give a donation to the upkeep of this wonderful church.

Name: Tina
Title: Great mass
Review: The church is very peaceful, all in white, and what is more interesting is that at the time i went for the visit, there was a mass going on there.  i assisted the mass for some time, and it was very peaceful and positive.

Name: Khyati
Title: Peaceful
Review: This church is very peaceful place to visit and nice.. it's architecture is so nice that one would love to see it again..

Name: Ratnamalika
Title: Visit to Santhorme church with Storytrails
Review: This too was a great experience especially with Storytrails. They explained the importance of the church and the historical importance. The relic of St Thomas is seen here. You can see Our Lady of Mylapore, Mother Mary clad in a Saree. Must go especially with Storytrails. Join their Peacock trail for a visit here.

Name: Pickleinwimbledon
Title: The finger bone is in the crypt
Review: Pretty, well maintained church with a small museum and crypt. The church is built over the burial site of St Thomas. The crypt holds a plastic model of St Thomas and on the wall to the right of it is a glass case with a slither of his finger bone is in the middle. A cool and quiet place to pray or contemplate. No photography.

Name: Elaine M
Title: A must see!
Review: Beautiful cathedral. Very well kept peaceful place. Unique history to explore here as it is the place of St. Thomas, one of twelve 12 disciples.

Name: Shaji Joseph
Title: good old church
Review: A very good place to visit. It is situated near to the sea, The structural appearance of this church is amazing.  In side church is also will give a different feeling.  Also there is a underground silence pray hall should not forget to visit.

Name: When-on-me-travels
Title: 10mins only
Review: It's worth a visit and is nice inside but I don't see what the fascination with the place is - it's a church like any other. I had a quick look around and left within 10 minutes.

Name: JANET S
Title: Definite visit.
Review: Very nice experience.  Definite to put on your list.  Beautiful place.  Clean and nice.  Easy to reach and parking good.

Name: Alison F
Title: A little bit of England in India.
Review: The oldest Anglican. Church in Chennai. Clive of India ( Powis castle in mid wales) was married here. His offices of the east India company nearby. Plaques on the walls to soldiers and their families who died young so far from home.well kept and worth a visit. We saw so many impressive buildings in Chennai and New Delhi that the British built before independence.

Name: ntsven
Title: Good shopping mall
Review: Good place to shop. You have most of the Indian brands and few foreign brands. Food court is spacious and has good choice of restaurenta.Overall, it's a nice place to shop.

Name: Hertz Martin
Title: Nice and Near
Review: While there are quite a lot of brands (outlet and dining), it's funny that you have to buy a card when paying in cash. Beautiful Christmas display and attraction to the kids right at the center of the mall. Shops are comparatively smaller.

Name: Rahul T
Title: Good place to spend an evening away from city traffic and the heat.
Review: Good place to shop, dine and spend some time away from the hot climate and the traffic. For people going for first time it will be a treat for the eyes as well.

Name: OMO
Title: Just another mall
Review: Fairly modern and large shopping center offering branded shops as well as local shops.Has a cinema and a large food court on the top floor.There are also 2 basement floors which are accessible via the main entrance.

Name: Rajnikant
Title: Pathetic food#wow momo
Review: Mall is very nice but # wow momo food is very pathetic we ask for Darjeeling momo combo and order for pan fried momo and chicken thupka but the chicken was very stale and smelly  didn't have any flavour and veg momo was uncooked very disappoint with #wow momo express Avenue mall I'm a very regular of wow momo in versions places .

Name: Harish
Title: Best Mall of Chennai
Review: Almost all international brands are present in the Mall .The mall is very spacious and it is a pleasure to shop in this mall

Name: Abdul wahaab
Title: Best mall in Hotspot location
Review: Always a special place in the hot spot of the city and easily approachable from all ends of city. All the branded showrooms are available in this mall. Fun city and food court also available. Good place for couples, family, friends, kids too

Name: arnold ahmed
Title: Good enough
Review: Express and Phoenix mall are the best malls in chennai for me as they have shops of our needs but its always crowded.

Name: Siva Kumar
Title: Perfect place for shopping with family
Review: It is a perfect place for shopping & getting some entertainment for family. Everything is available in one place

Name: Ananth 727499
Title: Excellent place ..
Review: This mall has a wide area for parking the cars and there is a digital Board at the entrance of the car parking.. it shows how may places are vacant for parking..Almost all types of shops are available here.. toys, clothing, watches, play items,Pizza shops, virtual Game shop etc.. Good place to spend your time and purchase things ( make sure your wallet is full)..

Name: Hooray H
Title: New Mall
Review: I really dislike Malls & will only go to them when it's a quiet time & if the sales are on.Never in the evening. Who wants to be surrounded by thousands of people jostling you whilst you are trying to shop.The access is not so convenient & can be quite confusing.Lots of shops for you to waste your money on!Of course it's freezing cold so take a hat, coat & scarf.

Name: Jivi_Jebaraj
Title: All in one mall in the heart of city
Review: This place can be accessible by public transport also, for me parking is not a problem and the mall is planned with the same product in one area.

Name: Ambrish L
Title: Just Another mall with all the shops
Review: Its a mall, after all, You'll find most of the brands here, Its accessible from the LIC metro station, You should be able to take a 10 mins walk. Nice place to go shopping. There is a big bazaar(supermarket) at the basement which has almost everything.

Name: krish
Title: Top class
Review: We enjoyed our shopping in Expresses avenue mall  is good nice entertaining with our collection of dresses.

Name: Frank Calberg
Title: Clean everywhere
Review: It was clean everywhere at the mall which I appreciated. There is a good variety of shops. I found that products in the supermarkets on the bottom floor are well organized and presented. On the top floor, where there is a good view over the city, I had a strawberry fruit juice which tasted well. Thank you.

Name: Rohini
Title: Mall
Review: You will find most of the brand here .good customer service .escape as cinema .food court . Foreign exchange. At ground floor .was more helpful.

Name: Vijay
Title: Good weekend
Review: The mall had everything what is required for good weekend .. be it for shopping accessories, groceries, personal care etc. Great food court with options for various cuisine and to end with movie.

Name: Dcruz10
Title: A Relatively Smaller Mall
Review: This is called "E&A Mall" by its abbrevation. You find plenty of brands having their outlets here. It is situated very close to the Taj Clubhouse in Chennai. Chennai airport is just 10km from this place. There is a foodcourt on the top floor having several outlets. There is a centralized payment system to buy food here. You buy a recharge card & top-up whatever amount you want & then pay the many restaurants through this card. There are also some individual restaurants having separate enclosures on the same floor having their own payment system. We found the parking arrangement on the ground a bit confusing for someone coming here for the first time.

Name: Everlook
Title: Nice experience
Review: The entertainment portion of the mall very big. All brands shops and food court was very good. We had purchase the clothes and had dinner n food court vth friends and we feel at abroad. Enjoy the movie n theater.

Name: Suma S
Title: Pleasant shopping
Review: A nice place.  Max, lifestyle, hamleys , westside home centre etc have outlets. Nice place to spend time with friends to do window shopping.

Name: Mrudula
Title: Mall
Review: This is a vast mall in Chennai in wide range of varieties. The mall is the main attraction of the place with reasonable prices

Name: prem sagar
Title: Perfect Mall
Review: Perfect place to spend weekends with family: games, movies, shopping, etc.. Environment was so good.

Name: arnold ahmed
Title: Spacious but crowded
Review: Decent shopping mall with good collections of shops. Very crowded on weekends. The food court only accept their own card payment system which i find is nuisance.

Name: devan2599
Title: Shoppers Paradise for women
Review: Men and women dress is in abundance with its multitude of colors and style. We make an years purchase at west side, go colors etc

Name: Averyl78
Title: Best place to shop for good brands
Review: Situated in Royapettah is this big mall that has great brands under one roof.  They have many cuisines in the food court.   Home to PVR cinemas you can really spend a day with your family navigating through the shops, enjoying some good food and catching your favourite movie. Parking is expensive though.

Name: Linda A
Title: Nice.shopping complex.shops attractive.staff very helpful.gd choice of products
Review: Like 3 shop I big bazaar.favourite shops pantaloons Westside lifestyle.sephora.forest essentials.products in.f essentials r xcellent. Nice staff

Name: XPLORING
Title: Good shopping mall
Review: Quite sizable mall . Spacious and clean. Bathrooms are a bit unkept . A good variety of stores. Movies and food court with many options .

Name: Mohammed khan
Title: Very good place for shopping üõç
Review: Excellent food in mall , many international brands available, and big bazaar , money exchange are available in mall, if some my friends looking some money changing

Name: Rizly Salim
Title: Nice place
Review: Convenient and good location with all brands. Good bargains at Van Huisen. Food court is fine with all varieties of dishes.

Name: Anushka Jayasinghe
Title: Big mall in Chennai
Review: Big shopping mall in Chennai. Almost all branded items are available in this mall and you get good discount deals on weekends perticularly Sundays.

Name: PANDEY JI
Title: One of the best malls in Chennai!
Review: The mall showcases all the popular brands.I mean there's almost every brand present in the mall.The Movie Theater is too good, every audi has a different theme and decor.The food court is great as well.

Name: #amosamiyanayeküéß
Title: üõçÔ∏è
Review: quit lard and the simply best... lots of stores are there including pharmacy, just went for Windows Shopping best attractive was escape cinema from sathyam the loo was so neat and clean at the same gaming zone for kids it's just a small but qute

Name: Saji M. Abraham
Title: Expect more.
Review: This mall will surprise you with its world class facilities. Almost all international brands had an outlet in here. It has a vast lobby and clean washrooms. You won't feel like you are at Chennai, once you are in. They do have an effective food court too. Try it, you won't be disappointed.

Name: satheesh
Title: The New Spencer plaza of modern Chennai
Review: It has become the goto place and you will find that it will be always crowded, be it day or night.It attracts people of all ages and there in lies its strength

Name: Bala P
Title: Very good
Review: Shopping mall modern and new.  The stores include those from North America and London England.   High end mall that has a good food court

Name: Adele Augustin
Title: Best shopping mall in Chennai
Review: Nice shopping mall to have different lunch (different than indian food in local restaurants), espresso coffee (but not in starbucks) and escape the hot weather. Very clean toilets and washrooms.

Name: Aldrin J
Title: Nice mall
Review: Nice mall with many shops.Have an excellent theatre. Good for family and friends. Normally everything will be a little costly.

Name: lushenthree k
Title: What a joy
Review: We loved this mall. we stayed  close by so we went there frequently.we really enjoyed the kids entertainment.Big bazaar was my favorite shop.and the food choices were great.

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: We enjoyed watching in this mall
Review: We enjoyed every visit to this mall. You find all the branded stores under one roof. The mall close to city and Mount Road. Once you enter this mall you feel you are in a different world. There are food courts and all luxurious brands available in the mall. It's is one of the best malls in Chennai for shopping and entertainment like watching movies.

Name: SkrillMu
Title: Huge place, plenty of dining options
Review: This place was packed even on a regular weekday. Great variety of restaurants and fast-food chains. Good mix of international and home-grown brands within the complex.

Name: kungfupanda
Title: Shop all you can.
Review: I have been here several times and I enjoyed shopping in this mall.All Because they have my favorite brand "Forever 22" Always happy to visit while I'm in the city.

Name: Pamela Jane Katie
Title: Useful
Review: This shopping centre is useful but once inside, it feels like any shopping centre in Europe or mall in N. America. ATMs are on the top floor. Shop security guards in every doorway and they will check your purchases against your receipt. This is normal and should not be taken as suspicion. Also, in some shops they will take any larger bags from you for keeping until you leave. This is not a criticism, just the way that they do it. Very well air conditioned so a relief form the streets outside.  Easy to get a TukTuk on your way out, to your next destination. Opens at 10am for the shops and later for the cinema. They also have offices in the same building so you need to pa attention to which entrance door you need. Bottles of water can be bought at some of the cafe/food outlets.

Name: Abdul wahaab
Title: Very oldest mall in Chennai
Review: It is one of the oldest mall situated in teh heart of the city. Very near to marina and accessible with public mode of transport Though the parking fee is high ,we can find enormous amount of people here always

Name: mohamed ahraaf
Title: My stay
Review: A very pleasant stay.Nice hospitality .I was impressed by the service of Amit.The food is really good.It has really improved than the previous visit.

Name: Valavanur Natar... K
Title: A WRITE UP ON Emami Star Mark book stire on sevond floor EA mall Roayapettah,,Chennai
Review: A review of Star Mark Book Store in EA mall Second floor ,RoyapettahChennai¬†I had some time back reviewed oneOf Chennai's pride of book stores that stood the test of time from the British days in India namelyHiggin Bothams on Anna Salai.But there was another store called Land Mark ,that literally made its mark as one of the finest book store¬† ¬†in a very short span¬†of time .It was started by an enerprising couple Ms Hemu Ramiah and her husband Rangi ,who was also a fine hotelier .She expanded from one basement store in Nungumbakkam high Road to Spencer mall and then City centre mall and went on to open huge stores in Calcutta and Bangalore .Her hands on approach and deep knowledge in books , helped her organisation to grow leaps and bounds, in a very short span of time.Realising that on line book sales andKindle versions would affect foot falls in stores over a period¬†of time,¬†she smartly exited the business at the right time , selling her venture to Tatas who eventually closed it down due to poor generation of profits .Star mark id¬† now an ongoing book store in Chennai .It was Promoted in 1999 in collaboration with this Landmark I¬† mentioned¬† above , and is wholly owned by the Emami Group, Eastern India‚Äôs leading business house.In April 2007, Starmark merged with Frank Ross Ltd, a sister company of Emami, which is also one of Kolkata‚Äôs leading pharmacy chains.As one of the leading and fastest growing personal and healthcare businesses in India, The Emami Group has an enviable portfolio of OTC products used in¬† households.It was Established in 1974, and presently operates in more than 60 countries including GCC, Europe, Africa, CIS countries and the SAARCIt¬† is able to support the Star Mark¬† book store¬† ¬†to serve the literary community's¬† needs and also offer many consumer items and stationary items and toys.¬†They store books on wide ranging topics like education,science, fiction Cooking, Art and literature, Architecture and many more .They also offer journals and periodicals like Auto magazines.I would suggest thsse visiting¬†E A mall to visit this store¬† for at least browsing around if they have timevto kill ,and who knows they may even¬† pick up something they have alway wanted to buy and just did not have the time to do so.A hindu sponsored Coffee shop just opposite to star Mark store , willoffer one¬† an opportunity to enjoy a good filter coffee and browse a magazine or a book they picked from the store .Star mark also operated¬† a similar store in¬† Velacheri Phoenix mall .

Name: sekaran n
Title: Express Avenue
Review: One of the centrally located mall in Chennai. Had good brand outlets, decent food court and multiplex theatres. Have tried food at couple of places. OK type only. Avoid going on week ends due to heavy rush

Name: Sujay
Title: Not very organised
Review: using Google maps we went there and was trying to enter through gate 3, the security person there stopped is and told "sir.. premium parking.."i told ok.. as i entered inside i was told again by some other staff that parking fee for 3 hours is 170rs..i told ok.. and parked the car and noticed that there are very few cars parked..went inside tried to locate rest rooms but couldn't locate without asking a person there.. sold have been more sign boards... in boys rest room there is no separate urinal for kids and rest rooms are all wet..quite good number of brand outlets are there.. and few are throwing offers too.. kids play area, eateries and movies are in top floor.. went to have coffee.. but i was given a card first in which i have to to up money which can be used in the eateries..it might be easier for some but i found it cumbersome.. that card can be topped up at the kiosks where swiping machines are available or at the cash counters.. some shops like kfc accept direct payment..to go from one floor to another multiple lifts are there but people are waiting in queue for the lesser and more centrally located lifts..i advise to use more peripherally located lifts which are free...tried to purchase in health and glow.. they didn't accept google pay... had to use card...overall pretty average experience... there is a lot of scope for improvement..

Name: sukunaravee
Title: Holiday
Review: Good place to shop. Branded goods available and it is part of E Hotel. There were many dining places in the mall

Name: VATSALA04
Title: Mama Mia !! It works !
Review: So..we walked into this newly opened restaurant in the mall ( the paint was still wet.. no cobwebs...no sticky stuff under the table ..) expecting to grab a bite ( the bite away from home for my husband & I usually means a hearty Indian Chinese meal in Mainland China ) with no lofty expectations !! surprise surprise..we landed up spending over an hour ...not because we had the time..turned out a good feel place to be , noisy but in a nice way! loud colorful decor but in a lively way ! Food...  Not Indian Chinese ! But nevermind ! good tasty Pan Asian medley of Chinese, Thai. Japanese & surely Indian !! Tasty Tasty! Warning ! When you order one portion of whatever, make sure 3 to 4 of you share it !

Name: Nagarjuna
Title: Awesome experience
Review: Beautiful experienceOnly thing I request is follow Hyderabad modelWhen customer shows bill or movie ticketPlease provide them free parkingIncluding forTwo wheelersRegards

Name: Dr P Nagaraj
Title: Favourite Mall Destination
Review: This is one of my Favourite Mall Destination in the city with ample space beautiful scenic well maintained with major shopping and great cinema screens Food court located

Name: akeeneye
Title: Unclean wash rooms....
Review: How can we have a dirty unkept wash room in the food court area.The experience was what to say UN appetising.......

Name: dilshadkn123
Title: Charming mall
Review: Superbly built mall around 1000+ parking. Its a place one can spend 3/4 hours easily. Good branded outlets there to hang on. Coffee shops and food courts also in the list to enjoy.

Name: Jarevu
Title: Shop till you drop!
Review: Awesome place to shop. An all in one stop! Food, cinemas, groceries, fashion n more! Be sure to catch a movie there. I regularly shop at Fab India and Soch. The prices are reasonable and on par with the big stores like Saravanas with 10 times the service. Food Bazaar and fashion is another gem. Be surprised by the price. Also check out the home furnishing store and Westside. You can spend a whole day there easily! Check out the food court too

Name: vasuprofiles
Title: Express Avenue, a good shopping collection
Review: It was for a window shopping we actually went to EA. But it turned up spending a good chunk. üòäThere were quite a good variety of collections either in clothing, shoes, watches, sunglasses, mobiles, grooming, or entertainment.Children had some food of their choice and ladies had a good shopping experience. It is a decent place.The only challenge is that it is in the heart of the city and a lot of traffic is outside it.

Name: 2015Minnie
Title: Must visit mall in Chennai
Review: Ample stores and good collection. Has parking. Almost all brands are present in the mall. Must visit this place if staying in Chennai.

Name: Vaibhav
Title: Best Place for Window Shopping
Review: The mall has all the major Indian and international brands under one roof and a fantastic food court. The movie theatre is great too. The place has ample parking and a wonderful classy feel. It is one of the largest malls of Chennai.

Name: Suraj K
Title: Good mall
Review: Just like all the other new malls but in a cleaner state..lots of places to do shopping as well as kids entertainment area..

Name: Suruchi J
Title: Like any other
Review: All kind of shops and restaurants,  like  any other mall.nothing special .not many international brand

Name: Gairik M
Title: Grand mall in Chennai
Review: It's a big shopping mall harboring shops from a wide range of national and international brands. The food court present at the topmost floor serves fine delicacies.

Name: sherazz
Title: Wonderful, entertaining mall- a one stop centre!
Review: A one stop centre to shop, dine, watch movies, play games etc. Clean, not too crowded and well sized (not too big like Phoenix Mall), one is assured of a good time here. The Escape cinemas are modern and very clean with great infra. There are also a wide variety of places to dine, both in and around the mall, from fast food (KFC, Pizza Hut, Burger King etc), the food court with a variety of food and plush well known restaurants around the mall, like Zaitoon and Palm Jumeira. Would definitely recommend, as one would not feel time passing in this mall. Easy to get autos and ola taxis from here as well.

Name: anonymous
Title: Movie time
Review: Watched a lot of movies here It is usual like any other mall Nothing greatHad fun though Nothing is cheap der Even coffee is super expensive They have a very good parking area

Name: Ganesh K
Title: Last it's charm
Review: In the beginning it's charm and happening mall. But now maintenance is poor and staff's are total waste. Toilets are not clean. Lot of dust and looking shabby

Name: satheesh
Title: Became The Hangout
Review: EA has turned itself into the goto place of youngsters and is also successful in attracting crowds of all demographic and age groups. The various shops cater to all your needs but it is heavier to your pockets. Well connected with public transportation too.

Name: suria89
Title: Impressive
Review: I am impressed with the maintenance of this mall. It has all the international brands. The food court has amazing choices. Everything is clean and neat. They even have a game arcade there.

Name: Samy S
Title: Very busy
Review: Commercial place ,much busy. Inside many shop are there. But quwit expensive. Ok place for a visit. This place for young crowds

Name: Prabha
Title: Shopping
Review: The Express Avenue Mall is the best shopping center in the vicinity of La Wood Hotel. The displays put up by the various shops in the shopping center were eye -catching , presentable and attractive . The center has all kinds of clothing to cater to different age groups. The food court in the center serves a variety of tasty food .

Name: Dhakra
Title: Jonah‚Äôs masala fries
Review: We went to Jonah‚Äôs after a shopping trip to express Avenue mall. We totally loved the food. Kids ordered masala fries and totally loved it. For the price the quantity was good, fries were nice crunchy and delicious and I ordered veg sushi which was surprisingly delicious. The service was great and the manager came personally to ask if we enjoyed our food. Highly recommend!!!

Name: Docs
Title: Great mall
Review: The usual, kind of mall with the usual shops. Very conveniently and centrally located. Most shops are here and they do have a decent food court. Highly recommended.

Name: KMSMANIAN1049
Title: One of finest Mall in Chennai
Review: Express Avenue Mall (EA in short), one of the newest mall in the city, attracting mostly young crowd, but caters to various types of consumers.

Name: Senthilathiban
Title: Shopping Mall of Convenience
Review: Express Avenue Mall is centrally located in a parallel road to Anna Salai (Mount Road) and nearer to Central and Egmore Railway Station. One of the earliest malls in Chennai, it provides a coll place to shop with almost all branded shops located there. Nice eateries are always available to spend time and have good food. The mall has cine screens. Apart from the shoppers of Chennai, it is a good place for people travellers by train crossing Central and Egmore stations who have time to spend and are willing to do shopping at convenience.

Name: Flying Guy
Title: Express Avenue
Review: My recent visit to Express Avenue mall was a very nice one. Many branded shops available there. Very good for shopping. Food court was amazing. Good for shopping.

Name: shreyasjajoo
Title: Beautiful Mall
Review: This is one of the best malls of southern India. It has a plethora of restaurants to offer and also great shopping experiences are up for grabs here. The mall management is lively and has some or the other crowd engagement event going on continuously. The movie inside the mall looks real swanky on the outside. The staff is courteous and eager to help. It is a great place to chill if one is near Egmore.

Name: SELVARATHINAM M
Title: GOOD LOCATION
Review: This is also a big mall of Chennai city with many brands of clothing store to choose. This also had a multiplex of SPI cinemas which is really a good place watching movies in a relaxed mood with family and friends. There is a food court too. Good parking and easy to access

Name: TE K
Title: Relaxation trip
Review: It is located in Chennai. I visited this place with my friends.it contains shops and food courts and entertainment are there

Name: Meezanur R
Title: Love the big brands? Must go there
Review: If you are a brand lover for clothing and accessories, you must visit the express avenue mall. You will get all the renowned brands in a single boundary. At the main entry, you will see the Starbucks, have a coffee and enjoy the shopping.

Name: ROSHAN K
Title: Friendly visit
Review: I visited this mall on republic day and it was very quite and descent place to visit and it is a bit small mall compare to others and you can get everything right over there

Name: K V K
Title: Express Avenue Mall
Review: Express Avenue mall opened in the year 2010. It is a 3 storied building built on the cast land area belonging to Express newspaper right in the heart of the city. The building itself is about 1750000sq feet with about 90000 sq ft area dedicated to retail trade. The rest of the areas are used up for offices and theatres etc. All branded stores have their own outlet here. The snacks and food court variety is mind boggling.  A good place to spend your spare time and catch up with fashion. The top floor houses all the cine complex and also the food court. The only drawback that we can see here is the huge parking charges that is being charged by the hour, both for the 2 wheelers as also the 4 wheelers. The rates are specially high over the weekends. When we try to follow the foreign markets to suit our needs, we should do so fully and not selectively.

Name: Kandaswami Aravind
Title: Easy shopping
Review: Best place for shopping and hang out. With movie hall, food court, game palace. Nice place with easy packing in centre of city

Name: BhushanRangnekar
Title: Ok for a one time visit
Review: Express avenue mall is strictly ok with the usual shopping options available and a small food court. It has nothing out of the ordinary from other better malls. Visit this only if you have nothing else to do.

Name: 310dori
Title: Perfect- with a bit of everything
Review: It is a large mall, it has great options and it's not crowded. Loved the layout, that it doesn't fell congested at all, very clean. The items range from very affordable to very expensive and everything in between.You find local brands and international ones alike, such as H&M, The Body Shop, Fossil, Samsonite, Forever 21, etc .I liked it very much because the prices were fare,I wasn't charged more because I was a tourist and still I had access to a lot of traditional, ethnic items. The food court also offers a wide range of options- so it's the perfect combination.

Name: JumboMumbai
Title: Christmas revelry..
Review: We went at xmas time And found the mall vibrant and revellingIt was decorated well.. in fact very wellThe shops had offers too.. it has a good mix of brands as it isParking is very haphazard and also expensive which is true of all large malls here.. they need to see Mumbai charges and will surely fall off the chair

Name: shivjyot
Title: Exclusive brands
Review: A huge mall in the center of city with best brands for a happy shopping experience. A happening place with  cultural and promotional events almost every week. Luxurious theatre showing latest movies and a food court to cater to all taste. But high parking charges on weekends.

Name: Jivi_Jebaraj
Title: One of the best malls in Chennai
Review: The major advantage is the location very near to central railway station and not too far from airport.Ample parking place available.food court has many options. Most of the outlets are there.

Name: Soonkeum
Title: Too much like home
Review: Was hoping for local shopping experience but mostly brands you see in US.  Only ATM in entire all was on top floor and not posted on any of the mapsThe stores with Indian products seemed limited and we left after 30 minutes. Mall is huge and well maintained, but if you want a local experience this isnt the place.

Name: Khyati
Title: Nice place
Review: This mall is visited by locals as well as tourists.. nice play area for kids to food court to different shopping shops .. plus Cinema in this too..

Name: Dashers2014
Title: Overrated!
Review: Like any other big city mall. Nothing special. The prices are dear. Kept clean and a nice place to walk around.

Name: Shaji Joseph
Title: very good mall
Review: This mall is one of the biggest mall in Chennai. which is having all branded shoppes outlets in it.  This mall is maintained well full proof security system and having enough parking slots.

Name: niki dee
Title: One of the best malls in Chennai
Review: Well located. Offers a lot of stores including various branded standalones. Various restaurants offering local cuisines on offer. Also the food court includes various small eat outs. Escape cinemas in the mall is also a fun place to go for movies.

Name: Narayanj
Title: A very complete shopping mall with good food and entertainment
Review: A very regularly visited shopping mall in Chennai. Has most of the must have stuff with a wide range of food options. The food debit card expires evey 365 days!! A bit dated mall but still has new shops coming up.

Name: monicasharmaB
Title: Interesting!
Review: Thankfully this is one of those large malls, where you have a variety of shopping outlets. All the major brands of clothes, footwear, fashion accessories, food, etc had a good presence here. A well kept mall in terms of variety and clean floors, I was a bit taken aback at the slight bit of shabbiness in the ladies toilets section. I prefer the washbasin slabs to be perfectly dry, especially since there was a lot of staff chatting away but not bothering to keep the place dry.Other than this, the mall is every bit a great one!

Name: Drew H
Title: Western mall in Chennai
Review: My airline lost my baggage and I needed to find a mall that would have shops that sold clothing that I normally wear. This mall is very clean and easy to get to. They have many western stores like H&M, Adidas, Polo, and the like. I was able to get the clothes I needed without any hassle that you can find at other malls in the area.

Name: 892swapnas
Title: if you want to spend time
Review: I prefer to go to Express Avenue with friends for a leisurely time that may include watching a movie, and non-critical shopping

Name: Rathikaprashanna
Title: 1st world shops
Review: Visited this mall on February 11, 2019.  Its excellent if you are looking for brands such as h&m, adidas, etc.  They have a lot of American name brands. The top floor has a few quality Indian stores with some good selections.  Everything is a little pricy here.  There is also a movie theatre . They do need to make the washrooms more hygienic, and food court as well.  It‚Äôs a little grimy.

Name: Noor Ali Abbas
Title: Middling Mall of Chennai
Review: Express Avenue Mall is an extensive mall in the heart of Chennai city.The mall has more shopping outlets for fashion, lifestyle, electronics and other house hold items. It has Big Bazaar supermarket in which we can purchase almost everything for our home under one roof.Also, it has entertainments like cinemas, games and rides for kids. Most of the restaurants available inside the mall are very expensive. A vast parking area is available and the parking entrance is on the northern side of the mall which is difficult to find for most of the motorists.

Name: Harvey
Title: Good place to hangout in Chennai
Review: Express Avenue Mall has a wide variety of shops, good cinema and an array of eating places. It is a good place to spend a few hours or even a day in Chennai.

Name: Elspeth M
Title: Mall
Review: Lots of international shops throughout the mall.  Top floor has large range of places to eat.  Also has various markets during the year -When I was there they had a  vegan market

Name: umang p
Title: Weekend shopping
