Review: Big Mall in Chennai...The mall is well maintained and the shopping experience is really great. Ample parking space is available. Parking piece is tow wheel is 50Rs per hour and for car is 30Rs per hour ... The new Palladium mall is separate for luxury products. The seasonal decorations at the mall are really engaging with the public. Some time Evan will happen it will be good and enjoyable..,I personally love this mall for the way they are public-friendly.. cinemas big the theatre good experience .. good sound effects...you will enjoy you movie ...one of the place most visit in ChennaiThere are good restaurants in food court with variety of options to try. Lot of shops are available with good options in variety. There is movie theater is available inside. Overall good option to shopping and spend time.

Name: Valavanur Natar... K
Title: ALL THAT YOU WANTED TO KNOW ABOUT EA MALL
Review: Man or woman¬† is a social animal and in evolution after the basic needs are met he or she is always on the look out for emotional satisfaction coupled with acceptance in society. Recreation that began with procreation that moved on , as they were in constant search of ways and means to satisfy their social needs through various public venues that started with visit to weekly markets , places of worship,Beach and river fronts, cultural venues and later movie theatres .To meet most of these aspiration of society by and large in one big place a   new age mall culture came into being .Any¬† large shopping-cum-entertainment mall must¬† features ultra modern office space, world class shopping arcades, a book store departmental super market,  multi¬† screen cinema complexes¬† , A 3, 4 or a 5 star hotel, A food court and  family entertainment zone and much more.Locational advantage complete with all creature comfort like ac ,adequate parking facilities for all types of vehicles , large movement space , a huge sky light for natural feel and provided with adequate number of¬† lifts and escalators if they have multi levels and above all excellent security system clean and well maintained  sanitary facilities at all levels within easy reach is a necessity  to qualify as a good mall .If all above is provide by the promoter it will ensure greater and sustained foot falls and is¬† sure to succeed for a long time to come for It will witness many top brands signing¬† up to operate offices and shops that can turn¬† dreams into reality .Express¬† avenue¬† mall¬† promoted by Express infrastructure and managed by¬† Ms Kavitha Singhania , is all that and much more .The dream of Express estate came about thanks to¬† huge tract of land bought by Ramnath Goenka a freedom fighter and Newspaper baron in the heart if the city¬† before or immediately after the independence¬†EA mall built on¬† a 10 acre site with 1,750,000 sft with building covering 3.6 acres and balance covering car parking ,drive ways and garden .It has 4 floors that includes host of¬† corporate offices and a 4 star boutique E hotel¬† with 44 rooms and opened on 26th May 2010.Since then it has been a major attraction for Chennai citizens for both shopping and leisure in the heart of the city with close to perhaps million foot falls each month that's fantastic.It has a largest gaming arcade¬† that cost the promoter close to Rs7,500 million . They¬† have both permanent¬† outlets including international brand of tenants of above¬† 10¬† and over 200 services and other stores spread over a retail area of about 900,000 sft in 3 floors.¬†They have adequate parking in 3 basement levels in addition to priority parking on ground level .It abutts three main Roads nanely Pattullas Road ,Whites Road and GP Road .The visitors can travel freely on wife corridors or vertical using lift numbering in all 26 and 34 escalators and 4 travelators which ensures they can enjoy a great leisure will flooded with natural.light from.thr huge skylight in AC comfort .EA boasts of Escape cinemas that has 8 screen multiplex of total over seats 1600¬† run by Sathyam now owned by PVR cinemas and witg an area of 50000 sft is surely tge largest in Chennai city .Credit for its design goes to Giovanni Castor US designer.The 50,000-square-foot court, also called EA Garden, has 25 counters with several food and soft drink options that spans Oriental,¬†¬†south and North Indian American and Italian cuisines and includes KFC .Pizza hut and crispy cream outlets ..To conclude EA mall is almost like a fun city where children can indulge in their spacious play area and any aspiration of a visitor can be met here in comfort and style.¬†

Name: gentleman492001
Title: A well maintained mall
Review: On 13.01.2019 we visited the mall at 11 am to 2pm. visiting many shops and purchasing lot of things.

Name: abhinandn t
Title: Great Place To Visit And Take Blessing Of Sai Baba
Review: I Loved the visit Om Sai Ram, Here we visited at 2019 jan, after 10 years, and found many things have changed. I will visit here again.

Name: Chinmai Gupta
Title: Plan your taxi carefully.
Review: I went to Shirdi, from Delhi with my 70+ parents and 2 kids, aged 13 and 7, thinki g that it is a safe destination to travel to, for ladies.We had planned a 5 days trip, starting from Shirdi, to trimbakeshwar, then Nashik and then back to The hotel - Marigold Regency was wonderful- neat, clean, staff helpful , free pick and drop service to the Sai Temple.The only problem we faced in the whole trip was the taxi that had been arranged through a travel agent.We arranged it before travelling to avoid last minute confusions but it did not turn out to be so.The taxi driver was apathetic, had no desire to show us  nearby attractions even on repeated requests.Did not tie the luggage on the luggage carrier, so in effect we travelled in cramped seats despite it being a 7 seater.He took us to specific shops in shani shignapur and shirdi and compelled us to buy stuff from there, and had no consideration for my elderly parents parking very far away- saving his petrol and creating difficulties for us, which were avoidable.Even when requested to drive further he refused.On the third day of the trip, he started harrassing us for extra money- refused to follow the earlier agreed upon  itinery and created a lot of stress for me and my parents.To the extent that eventually we had to change out taxi.But this experience left a bad taste and made me to feel that even now, single females with/ without kids are not safe to travel.

Name: anu_v
Title: Holy Baba
Review: I visited this temple with my parents and friend. The place is quiet and holy for anyone who knows Baba. It is well known among locals and tourists.

Name: Nanthakumar Ganesan
Title: Calm place for medidation
Review: Good location and calm place near to VGP golden beach.. I liked ambiance much.. Very calm place and better place to do medidation

Name: Mansi Reddy
Title: Beautiful visit
Review: This temple located in ECR is so peaceful and beautiful. They have evening Aarthi and the atmosphere is very calm and composed.

Name: Mrudula
Title: Baba temple
Review: Shirdi sai baba temple is the best temple to visit and there are no restrictions towards any  religion and one can visit and spend some time

Name: OMKAR PAGADALA
Title: Lord sai baba
Review: This temple has a lot of significance. I have visited the temple with my family. Nice atmosphere to keep mind relax and peaceful.

Name: Gopi
Title: peaceful and divine place.
Review: I love this place. Every Thursday  I went to Saibaba temple. This Thursday I visit Shirdi sai baba temple. It was so nice and peaceful and divine.

Name: Geet L
Title: Piligram
Review: Hi. This is satish from vizag traviling to shiridi shell I visit 5 jyothirlinga Temples in one day from shirdi..???

Name: Sunitha Shenoy
Title: Divine and Peaceful
Review: The temple located in ECR the road after Food village and is spacious and is very peaceful. If you happen to visit other than Thursdays you will find pretty less crowd here.One can sit in the dhyana mandapam which is located below Baba's statue. Apart from that there is a huge space right in front of his idol.

Name: Akshay
Title: Shirdi visiting places
Review: Everyone should visit sai baba temple after completing the darshan in samadhi temple there is a place called DwarikaMai, the place where sai baba spent 60 years of life and the Dhuni is still burning in DwarikaMai.After that go to old shirdi a good place to watch and feel relax it entrance costs 125/person and it is 3km away from temple some of the photos below .

Name: RaviUnni
Title: a Sai temple off ECR located in spacious premise
Review: Located in Injambakkam on the left side of the road, coming from Tiruvanmiyur and soon after Food Village. Spacious temple complex with sufficient car parking space. Besides Sai, it has few Hindu dieties; separate structure where you can sit and meditate. theres a go-shala located in 1 corner of the complex. overall a very calming and peaceful experience

Name: mageshkumar712
Title: Best place for Peace of Mind
Review: I visited this place during the month of august,me and my friends visited this temple as we heard this sai baba temple was famous in ECR.So we decided to visiti this temple and it was so pleasant and we felt the peace of mind , when we come out of this temple.

Name: Kunal7086
Title: They have clean Blood Donor camp within the temple
Review: Good to travel very early in the morning in order to beat the traffic and also enjoy the sun rise.As we arrive, watch out on the guys selling pooja plates as you need to bargain. they begin with 1300 rs and can come down to 500 or less depending upon the items you want to present. In my opinion, even if you dont take any items, you will still be blessed :)they have broken down the process by extending the time taken to take the tickets and then join the main que, this will reduce the crowd and you will get decent time to perfrom your pooja.Enjoy and remember your reasons of goign to shirdi...once that is clear then all other small inconvenices will be irrelevant!

Name: Hariharan D
Title: Divine Darshan
Review: Baba's temple gives you divine aura and mental peace. You could sit at the temple for long hours to say your prayers and also make offerings at the temple. If you are keen you can also pay for the annadhaanam at this temple.

Name: Rangakumar
Title: Spacial temple
Review: Relaxed and peaceful dharshanlarge space to play around for kids and peacefull to have a chat with dear onesdiscuss important things in the temple premises

Name: Alina Z
Title: Heavenly
Review: Not a Sai Baba devotee here, but a long time meditator - my friends and I can testify that this is an abode of peace, brotherhood and unconditional love. Also, everyone we met here was really nice and helpful, and the temple grounds are very pleasant and well maintained. Do come for a visit, and buy the nicest garlands from the vendors right outside.

Name: Mahendra S
Title: Nashik tour
Review: I'm planning to visit shirdi sanisignapur aurangabad and pune in 3days my journey start from shirdi and in this tour I planned ajanta ellora ghrishneshwar and bheemashankar

Name: reubenranjanfern2017
Title: Holy Place.
Review: Such a beautiful place. And very well maintained and decorated. Beautiful. Offered my prayers Must visit for people.

Name: Deadman17
Title: Holy temple
Review: This temple is located close to the beach and one should visit it when one is in Chennai. There is ample space for parking. It is advised that people bargain while buying garlands and flowers. It is advisable to go with someone who knows the local language.

Name: Ganesh K
Title: Divine place
Review: All the citizens of the nation should visit this place once in life time. Once u step inn u can feel the vibration and ur mind will get tunned. Staying here and roaming aroind the temple u can feel baba is there. Wounder full feeling

Name: amazonfire
Title: Like a dream
Review: Beautiful temple and very well maintained. I come here with my family very often. Its located in a very nice place on the ECR. So Spacious and the car parking area is also big. The beach is right next to the temple. We always get a nice darshan.

Name: Vijayan R
Title: Beautiful temple
Review: Very calm and nice place along the beach. Great for family visit. The kids can enjoy the beach and play if you visit in the late evening.

Name: Arun Aggarwal
Title: Shirdi wale baba: a divine opportunity availed
Review: We availed this divine opportunity in March 2019 and we feel obliged to Shirdi wale Sai Baba for calling us to His temple suddenly.We had stayed in Sterling hotel who were having free shuttle service to the temple. Though temple distance was not so far. Bit this was a great facility.We used to pay our obeisance there twice a day to reap to the maximum. The temple is located in a huge area and one can see big rush always. But we were lucky to avail the facility of senior pass and pay our respects easily always.People visiting to this holy city and sacred temple should note that cab charges Rs 600 from airport to city. This rate is very high and fixed by the union. Airport to city distance is approximately 15-16kms only. The Shirdi airport is small but nice.At the temple, it is advised to bargain much for flowers, garlands and bouquets. They ask for almost 4 times high rates. They sell guavas add pomegranates also at exorbitant rates though fresh so you need to bargain.In Prasad, there is no binding and one can offer anything. Opposite to gate is the shop selling any type of Prasad. So but according to your trust and ability. No phones etc are allowed inside. So put them in locker at Rs 5 only. Keep the slip carefully with mobile number which is verified when you take phone.You can enjoy divine taste of tea at Baba's tea shop inside. This is small and always crowded because tea here is for Rs 2 only and coffee for Rs 3. Mineral water for Rs 10 only.If you are fast and quick then you can come out of the temple in just half hour. Rest depends on you.From Shirdi, one can go to Shani Shignapur also in non AC tempo traveller at Rs 150 only that leaves you back at Shirdi temple in the evening.Likewise you've chance to visit Triambkeshwar temple also. But you should plan it early in a cab. Travel agencies charge Rs 3000 or so for going and coming to Shirdi but a good bargain can fetch you at Rs 2100 only which we paid. One has to go via Nashik and is about 80kms away.Bon voyage!!üôèüôèüôè

Name: SumanaGanapathy
Title: Very peaceful visit
Review: Shirdi, is a belief. The place gives all the strength, peace of mind and turns spiritually inward. The place is commercialized a bit but with Sai as belief when the shrine is entered we can see Sai and only Sai...

Name: r_durai51
Title: Shridi Baba‚Äôs Blessings visit
Review: We went to PUNE to visit our relatives house during July last week & wanted to visit Shridi Baba temple the next day as our relative had arranged a cab for our Shirdi trip.But it was raining heavily at PUNE & he advised us to postpone the trip the next day. But we prayed Baba to make our trip possible to have Darshin of Baba. We visited Shridi the next day & there is no rain through out that day.We got accommodation at SAI Baktha Nivas Kshetra Trust near SAI Padam ashram, which can be booked from CHENNAI T.Nagar office through Aadhar card . The big AC room costs Rs 975/- per day inclusive of free Lunch & dinner for 4 persons.We went to temple & got senior citizens tokens (1+1) per Sr. Citizen & went through special que in counter 3 & got the Darshin & Blessings of BABA in 10 minutes.The next day also we got Darshin & Prasad through the same Sr. Citizen counter tokens , one for Sr. Citizen & another for who is accompanying. We got Blessings of Baba on both the days & returned to PUNE safely without any rain on both the days.

Name: Pradeep471606
Title: Nice place for worship.good food and nearby places nasik,ellora,ghrasneswar jyotirling
Review: Nice to visit with excision tour within 200km range.easy taxi and sharing bus ,tempo available ,no problem.

Name: Rajagopalan
Title: Shirdi--- senior citizens
Review: From Chennai we visited Shirdi by SpiceJet flight. Just 1 1/2 hour journey. From airport, Shirdi is around 15 km distance . Taxis are available. Sai temple is a very nice place to visit. For senior citizens, near gate 3, separate entry is available. But we have to obtain pass by providing proper age proof like aadhar card, voters id etc. Week days are advisable for lesser crowd. Thursdays, Saturdays and Sundays will be over crowded.

Name: K V K
Title: Shirdi Sai Baba temple Mylapore
Review: This Sai Baba temple is centrally located, very near to Mylkapore bus stand as also to the Metro rail station. A very calm and serene place where we can get solace and peace of mind. The crowd management is good. Another great feature here is that there is annadanam everyday.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Famous among the devotees
Review: The place is so define.devotees throng the place for evening aarathi.this is a temple dedicated to shirdi sai baba.the plaCe is well maintained, so clean, has enough parking space and is easily accessible.but since it's in the inner road of the busy ecr getting into this lane and coming out is a bit painstaking.

Name: Khyati
Title: Completely peaceful
Review: This temple of Sai baba is big and nicely made with simplicity and beauty.. peaceful plus very nicely maintained..

Name: labal
Title: Peaceful place
Review: Peaceful place off the East Coast Road in close proximity to the sea shore. Ample parking space is available. The temple gets crowded on Thursdays. Very peaceful atmosphere and good to visit.

Name: S M
Title: Very satisfying visit
Review: In spite of the crowd,  we could get very good darshan.   We had passes, and we were given special consideration as senior citizens. The atmosphere is very enjoyable with everyone saying "Om Sai Ram ", and do on.   You get a special feeling of happiness.

Name: Aarav K
Title: Peace and Beauty and Blessings
Review: Go visit this temple with your family once, because it is a very peaceful and beautiful temple. I was blessed by receiving the blessings of Sai Baba.

Name: rsraghavan6
Title: Nice place
Review: Ever thought of an evening in a temple? You get yummy hot prasadam. Only if there is a big crowd it's difficult getting a second helping !Go here Thursday evening for the best prasad in town !

Name: Rsanghi
Title: Calm and peaceful
Review: Visit this temple is you are looking for peace and tranquility. Is not crowded much and there are no priests to ask you to put money everywhere. Very serene

Name: swarna b
Title: Peaceful place
Review: Very Peaceful temple, Worth going once in a while for relaxing and topping up spiritually, Sai Baba temple

Name: rashmi k
Title: Peaceful temple
Review: Though this is a temple, this has more resemblance to any Ashram. It is so peaceful and quite. You can feel the vibrations of positive energy when you are near beloved Baba. Temple is too big with Chavadi and Dwarkamai similar to Shirdi. One can have darshan of all the Gods at one place. Too crowded.at Aarthi. Small shop available with some eateries inside the campus.

Name: Valavanur Natar... K
Title: Write up on  Shiridi Saibaba temple at Injambakkam
Review: begin this post with my eyes closed and  complete reverence in silence  recalling the words of Baba :I Quote"No one goes anywhere without a connection or relationship.Never drive away People or creatures  who approach you  receive them well and treat them with due respect. GOD will certainly be pleased if you give water to the thirsty and bread to those in hunger and attire to naked poor and a place in your home sitout for resting if they are tired .If  anyone demands money and if  you dont feel like giving it's okay .But do not bark at him.or her like a dog"  I have lived in Maharashtra Pune for close to 10 years but I did not have his grace to visit his last known abode Shiridhi until recently .But before I was  given a call to go there  a doctor  friend of ours ,  domiciled in UK celebrated their daughter's wedding at Shirdhi Saibaba temple at Injambakkam , a few years back .Its a sprawaling campus with huge car park And the temple itself is a grandiose .The statue of Baba in soarkling white marble is awe  inspiring to say the least. I was fortunate to pray here in peace abd witness the maha Aarthi .To appeal to the mind of all kinds of devotees specially Hindus many VigrahamsOf all gods and that of Navagrahas with sannidhis have been added here in this baba temple. The whole premises generates peace and harmonybif body and mind with abundant trees breathing oxygen for one's benefit.But while sitting in meditation at this temple I refected upon the simplicity and the life and times of  Baba.Shirdi Sai Baba, was an¬†Indian¬†spiritual master regarded by his devotees as a¬†saint, a¬†fakir, a¬†satguru¬†and an incarnation of Lord Shiva and Dattatreya. He was  revered by both Hindus and Muslims alike during  his lifetime and even After he left this world on 15 October 1918 in Shirdi,¬†then known as Bombay Presidency during British India and now ¬†Maharashtra.A Samadhi and a wonderful Mandir has been constructed  here and attracts millions of devotees round the year .My being an ardent devotee of KanchiShri Chandrasekhara Maya Swami , in whoseLotus feet , I am in perpetual surrender .My spiritual inward travel began in 79 when he gave me a unique dhiksha on a full moon night while he was doing his atma pooja at a  pooja  in Bhavani temple at Satara and I consider him reincarnation of Lordess Kanchi Kamakshi .He has guided me since then and all my grahastha and spiritual life and  experiences that followed .Visits  to holy places and meeting many Sat Gurus till date is all his grace. As a true seeker I realise what Baba preached about  the importance of¬† realization of the self¬†and to abhor ¬†love for perishable things,  while following  a moral code of love, forgiveness, helping others, charity, contentment, inner peace and devotion to the God and guru. Sai Baba did not have a  distinction based on religion or caste. But one thing that elludes me today  is :when Baba through out his life lived a life in simplicity and mingled with the poor why now his statue now  adorned in temples with such great pomp and grandeur when that money can be channelled for poor and needy that includes imparting knowledge to them to become self sufficient. I ask of all readers of this post this :When you visit a temple, mosque or church Of great importance and while  you stand in front of the diety and start praying the physical body responds to spirituality with both your hand coming to gather and eyes automatically closing .The truth of the matter is when you join hands you realise the fact that you and he have become one .You seek him inside of you and not on the outside of you .So grandeur of the statue or place of worship is of no importance. It is just a starting point in your spiritual journey ..I conclude with an ideal mantra            "OM SAI RAM "Om Being the universal Bhjikshara mantra Sai denoting the diety Ram  equates Sai of Shiridhi to Shri Rama of Ayodhya

Name: jatinder Pal
Title: Shirdi sai Baba ji Mandir
Review: Shirdi sai baba mandir is one of the well known place in state of Maharashtra. The mandir is 22 kns from kopergaon  railway station and 7 kns from shirdi sainagar railway station . The place is well connected from Delhi, Mumbai,Pune and Manmad and Nagarsul. People willing to visit from North India can board Jhelum express train starts from jammu, Ludhiana, Ambala, Delhi and reaches at 10.30 Am at  kopargaon station. People from all walks of life visit Saibaba temple and seek his blessings. Shirdi Sai Baba temple was built by a millionaire devotee of Baba named Gopalrao Booty, a resident of Nagpur. Saibaba was an Indian spiritual master who is regarded as  saint and incarnation,avtar,of Lord Shiva and Dattatreya and considered as Sa Brahma. Baba came to Shirdi at the age of 16 for the first time. He stayed for 3 years in shirdi and for one year baba left shirdi and came back in 1958 and settled in Shirdi and baba throughout of his life span baba did miracles by curing ill persons and solving their problems as stated in Saisacharitra. Baba always encouraged charity and shared happiness among peoples who vistar him.Mhalsapati priest at a local temple is believed to be the first devotee of Saibaba at Shirdi.Any person who visits Shirdi Saibaba temple once will feel like visiting again and again and his wishes will be fulfilled by grace if Lord Sai.There are good places of stay near temple includes accommodation provides by Sai trust, hotels , dharamshala at normal rent.Shubham aour Shani temple is approx 60 kam from Shirdi is worth place to visit to have Lord Shani blessings.Jatinder Angrish

Name: Sumoy Sen
Title: Wonderful temple
Review: Visited this temple quite a few times. It's on ECR Injambakkam, the bus stop is Sai Temple bus stop. You have to go some 600 mtrs inside from the ECR to reach the temple. Inside the temple a very large parking space is available. The temple campus is so big and inside you will find lots of different temples such as Lord Shiva, Lord Dattatreya, Lord Hanuman ji, Lord Murugan, Lord Venkateswara, Goddess Durga, Lord Jhule Lal just etc.The calm environment and at the end of the campus the sounds of sea waves will make you feel something different.Overall it's a great experience to be there. A must visit for everyone.

Name: mgmbrgm m
Title: Mesmerizing Holistic Experience
Review: Visited the temple last week and was lost in Baba's mesmerizing posture. We felt like baba is walking with us every step. The upkeep of the temple was excellent.

Name: Natesh Reddy
Title: Shirdi place
Review: In single sentence I would like to say as"one of the safest place in India". It is purely pilgrim place to visit BABA temple and durga.pleasant weather and you can see good people overthere.You should book your darshan tickets through online (‚Çπ200 per person). If you really want to go with normal darshan and it took 3 to 4 hours time. Separate biometric counter is there for old people.bring your ID proof along with you. Mobiles not allowed into the temple, you can handover out side mobile counter and they charge ‚Çπ5/mobile. Free shoes stand is there. Beware of brokers and agents. You should enquiry in hotel reception before start your day. You can find budget hotels through online or find by walk around temple area. Prior booking is advisable. Normally check-in checkout time differ from hotel to hotel but flexible. You will get good food in Punjabi,Udupi, Gujarat & south India hotels.i did break fast in Udipi hotel which is exactly opposte to gate no 1 and 3. Lunch is your choice. Do Bargainig before purchase.additional Laddu Prasad available out side temple counters ‚Çπ25/packet.they will give 2 packets per head.October to March is good season to visit Shirdi. I like temple right side area because of newly developed widen roads and luxury hotels. You can do morning/evening walk around there.Really love Maharashtrias hospitality. Every one look cool and friendly. Thank you.

Name: Saikat Adhya
Title: Holly Place
Review: Nice place to go for a trip with family. Go and visit that place. Sai baba will blassed uOm Sai Ram.

Name: gurugs
Title: Excellent
Review: Very good temple with lot of spa e and good parking. There is beach nearby which is also good for playing sometime.

Name: KRAMA200
Title: Peaceful and Divine Temple
Review: Shiradi Saibaba Temple on the outskirts of Chennai at Injambakkam is one of the many Saibaba Temples in the City. Apart from the fact that it is away from the City, The Temple located on a Sprawling Compound and is very neatly maintained. We went on a Thursday in the Morning and the place was Baba. Visit

Name: Anand S
Title: Unbiased Spiritual Temple - THE GREAT SAI BABA
Review: The statue is visible straight from the streets of Mylapore for one to visit this temple this is close to Mylapore tank we can say it is diagonally opposite to the mylapore tank.This temple treats all devotees equally.The special day for Sai Baba is on Thursday so you will see lots of crowd during these days. But you can take the blessings from Sai Baba just in 10 mins by lining up the queue.There will a lot of activities in the temple during Thursdays.If you want a calm praying atmosphere to visit the temple any other days than Thursday.The meditation place for everyone on the back side of the temple.Overall this Temple is a 7/10 for me.

Name: OzPerth2011
Title: Great place to go to meditate
Review: Clean nice place of worship. No rituals. Just go and see the pace, sit in a corner and meditate. It is a bit further from the city, but worth the travel,

Name: Madhutri
Title: Shirdi the devine destination
Review: Shirdi is on my favourite destination.I travel very frequently .From mumbai or Thane there various private buses are available .Charges are app. Rs.250  per person,which varies with festivals or long weekends .One can take flight also as there is domestic airport which has dikhta from Mumbai ,Delhi and all metro cities.Manmad is nearest railway station ,from station  you can take a taxi or bus for Temple.For stay there are many hotels.There rooms available at Shirdi Sai baba Sansthan at very cheap rate but this needs to be booked in advance.1 to 2 days are sufficient to see the Shirdi.Do visit to Shirdi to seek Sai Baba's blessing.

Name: Maa Ambe Travels Pune
Title: Most religious temple in Maharashtra
Review: Shirdi is best place for worship and place where one can feel god presence.Plan Shirdi trip during dashera festival.

Name: jsmurali
Title: Peaceful place for Devotees and Others
Review: Nice place for believers (even non believers will find the place nice, because of the serene, peaceful and quite atmosephere).

Name: Sharath power
Title: Sai Baba
Review: Everyone are Sai Baba temple is very peaceful place especially this place is very wonder I really enjoyed thanks god

Name: V GEETHA
Title: Peaceful and expansive
Review: The temple is in a quiet street and may not be well known to the devotees. It is big, clean and quiet.

Name: S Michael Ponnudurai
Title: Mr
Review: Had a good visit, though crowded, as management of the crowd was good. Airflow inside was maintained well. Weather was cool and pleasant.

Name: Dhavaljit R
Title: Spiritual Temple Tour
Review: It was our Family tour during Diwali festive season & it went so good.We stayed here overnight on Friday and had chance to visit the Holy Temple premises for two times which was a great experience.The temple campus is so huge but spacious, neat & clean. Atmosphere here is very calm & relaxing. One can find his inner spiritual soul here.

Name: cheetan
Title: Good meditation place
Review: The good thing about this temple is there is a huge place to meditate.. where u can meditate for fres

Name: Nanthakumar Ganesan
Title: Very nice place ecr and having all gods
Review: This is very neat and well maintained place...good to visit ..this place will give you very plesant big sai baba statue

Name: HappySheep
Title: Sai Baba
Review: Don't heve to be a devotee of Sai Baba to get someone out of this place, which has a good atmosphere.

Name: Vignesh G
Title: MUST VISIT DIVINE PLACE IN ECR
Review: Sai Baba devotees must visit this place once they come across ECR, situated next to Prarthana theatre with ample car parking space.Very neat and calm place to mediate on sea breeze..

Name: yy m
Title: Peaceful
Review: Visited this afternoon and found  the temple set in a large green and serene area. There is an arch on the  ECR road ‚ÄúSaipuram‚Äù on the same side as direction of travel if going from Thiruvanmiyur to Injambakkam immediately adjacent to prarthana open air theatre.Since the arti had finished for the afternoon, there were very few people. Sai is on an elevated platform making it practical for many to have good darshan even from a distance. Datta deity and meditation hall were indeed great.

Name: Priyanka S
Title: Nice shirdi temple...
Review: Nice spacious temple....good amount of open space, better to go in the evening...nice cool breeze....tried to make it similar to shirdi temple...but somehow looks artificial

Name: prabhakar
Title: SERENE AND DIVINE ATMOSPHERE
Review: Best Shiridi Saibaba Temple in Chennai. For a divine experience one should visit this holy place which is along the sea shore. A very peaceful and tranquil place spread over a vast expanse of land with trees and greenery  to be visited with  family and children. Very neatly maintained temple with Aarthis performed regularly.

Name: KMSMANIAN1049
Title: A big Saibaba temple
Review: An excellent , neat Sri Sairam Baba temple. Has shrine for all deities. Well maintained temple.  Built close to the sea shore temple.

Name: BUTHU
Title: Lovely
Review: The place is right in the centre of the city. easily accessible location. Serene and peaceful. One should must visit !

Name: Srimanigandan_V
Title: Divine and peacefull
Review: I went here with my family. The place is filled with blessings and silence. A must go place for all.

Name: Sunil761
Title: A divine experience
Review: This is a calm and peaceful place where you can forget your worries and get immersed in the bhajans or just feel calm looking at the magical eyes of the BABA,

Name: ankita n
Title: Our very first holy family trip
Review: Beautiful weather,peaceful place,one could easily spent his or her life listening to sai baba's songs his preachings at that place.u achieve something very gud to your heart while visiting shirdi.tea@2,coffee@3,milk@3,food@free,stay@free or min.amnt..what else u need in life from god.

Name: MausumiDatta
Title: Temple Visit
Review: Well organised and beautiful darshan for all devotees.Impeccably clean.The best part is that you are allowed to enter the sanctorum and touch Sai Baba's feet.Om Sai Ram !

Name: Priya M
Title: Must visit for Baba Devotees
Review: Its a must visit place for baba devotees. The complex is clean and i visited during afternoon harathi.

Name: nageswararao g
Title: Clean temple
Review: Clean temple constructed with Marble. It was very quiet and less crowded during our evening visit to the temple

Name: harshdd2006
Title: Om Sai Ram
Review: It reminded me of Shirdi ke Sai Baba, wonderful, calm, peace place, one should definately visit & should take the blessing of baba om sai ram

Name: Flyer180599
Title: Mesmerizing Peaceful
Review: A very divine and peaceful temple in Chennai. A must place in ones visit book searching for eternal peace.

Name: Sunil G
Title: Peaceful experience
Review: Its a large temple with good ambiance. I feel inner peace and forget all things around once i step into this temple.

Name: siva200
Title: Large Temple with Peaceful ambience around
Review: Large Temple with Peaceful ambience around and you would definitely get a peaceful mind while returning. when you are at low or feeling bad, then going to this temple with help you avoid all the negative vibes around and get some confidence. Baba idols, Calendars with Baba, Keychains, Fridge magnets, Diaries can be bought in the Souvenir Shop.Ideal for spending a saturday or sunday evening.

Name: Sai b
Title: Temple visit
Review: Rooms standard was not maintained ,we can see detoriate in aminites ,temple darshan very commerical aspects,pay extra money could have near and direct darshan, security of the temples  very worst corrupted,please management to look into it.what is use of online registration treating like animals,but mission to darshan baba,we compamise all this non sense

Name: Aks
Title: AK SINGH
Review: Very pious and sacred place. Darshan can be paid or free. Paid darshan @ 200 per person take about 1 hour on any day while free darshan take 4 to 5 hours depending on rush. There are many hotels at shirdi and are reasonably priced. Must see place for every one.

Name: Bibhu_PB
Title: Divine & Peaceful!
Review: Its a nice religious and very peaceful place.Very near to sea shore. Shirdi Sai temple located at a place called Injambakkam on the ECR road (Old Mahabalipuram Road) at Chennai and it is called Saipuram.

Name: srimurali1952
Title: Muralidharan Srinivasan
Review: It is a very nice and with full of piousness in it. The temple brings peace in the person who visits with full devotion.  I felt it when I visited in it. The tremer in side you is awakened and  you are being blessed by the Baba," Sai Baba"

Name: vasuji90
Title: Nice and elevating Place
Review: Its really nice experience being there.Its spacious and spiritually elevating place.There are various other temple for other dieties as well and there is a small shop which sells souvenirs as well.

Name: Manu_klm
Title: Shirdi Sai Baba Temple on ECR a wholy place in serene ambience
Review: Shirdi Sai Baba Temple Located on ECR Chennai Mamallapuram road. Beautifully constructed and well-maintained temple. Neat and clean, calm and soothing atmosphere. Good place for worship and meditation.

Name: kalpalatha
Title: Nostalgia
Review: Being a mylaporeian for  a long time my father used to stay upvas to baba every thursday eve.. and visit the temple.. The shrine used to be kept at the ground level then and we use to garland him touch him etc... i still visit the place periodically and especially when there is sanchalam in my inner self

Name: vmsatheesh22
Title: Good
Review: Shirdi Sai Baba temple, good and beautiful our first visit to  this type of temple, good atmosphere and best

Name: rinmee
Title: Pilgrimage
Review: When you go to Shirdi temple you will always find a peace of mind and fulfilment. A must visit for ever one

Name: sridharbsnleu
Title: Must visit Worship place
Review: The calmness and holiness empower you. Lovely temple and must visit Worship place. The orderlyness of queque should be appreciated

Name: Ski [ Senthil Kumar Iyyappan]
Title: Awesome place
Review: I visit this place every month / week if possible and time permits. A silent place good for mediation as well.

Name: bhuvana k
Title: Quiet and Serene
Review: We stumbled upon this place and it was close to 7 P.M and were tired. Butthis place brought us back to life. It was calming and peaceful.

Name: deepak n
Title: Shirdi sai, Sani signapur trayambakeswar tour planning
Review: Hi I am Deepak, I am planning or Shirdi I hope will be reach by train Nasik station 4 am thursday,then plan for Shirdi Sai after that I will go Sani signapur and return to Shirdi for night  halt next day Friday early morning I plan for trayambakeswar then planning for Mumbai my train from Mumbai 3 pm is it possible please suggest.

Name: Nagendra Prabhu A T
Title: Best place to relax
Review: Visited this place in the morning at around 6:00 AM. It is quite close to the beach. Very silent, with cool breeze. Best place to go sit and meditate. The temple is quite big.Really loved the place..

Name: Karthikrs6
Title: Holy Place
Review: One of the best place to relax your mind and pray to shridi sai. You will feel the silence and enjoy the infrastructure there.

Name: Keertan
Title: Good
Review: Hi friends, I have visited Shirdi Sai Baba temple one year back and this is very famous historical place and many people come here to visit and it is located in Chennai and there is bus facility to this temple from hotels and the rooms are also available under the maintenance of trust and they daily keep food for the visitors and it is very peaceful temple, in this temple we can find sai baba older pics in the form of photographs and the higher officials of the temple maintain the temple in a neat manner, and many devotees do help in the temple. Many people come on Thursday for visit and the rooms are neat, food is provided there with free of cost and they are running many trusts and they are helping many people and it is located in the city itself and accessibility is nice without any problems and the local sightseeing is excellent and this temple is surrounded by many rose plants and the accommodation, hotels are very neat and the safety is high on everyone

Name: Amol Mathur
Title: Peaceful place
Review: Been visiting since 2009-2010 and everytime I come here, I find myself at a satisfying peace. Must visit when in Chennai.

Name: JumboMumbai
Title: Inner peace and calm
Review: This is what one experiences when close to Sai.. it is a serene and calm temple a few minutes from the beach and very crowded...You can connect with Sai and experience peace...Good parking and also place to sit ensures one can soak the divine calmOm Sai Ram

Name: yy m
Title: Peaceful Sai
Review: I visited Mylai Sai temple with my elderly parents in Dec 2017 on Wednesday.there wa a long queue to get to Sai but the temple management makes provision for disabled elders to take darshan by avoiding the queue which is by helpful.I stood in the queue for about 20 minutes and had a peaceful darshan.Sai' s principles of anybody accessing him without intermediaries is  evident in darshan where a devotee can hug Sai .offer garlands etc.Both Sai bless and Poojya Sri BV narasimha swami bless us all.Lunch was excellent with sambar and curd rice.more than sufficient for an adult.

Name: Anand Nayak
Title: Shirdi, a devine place
Review: Great place, lot of satisfaction and peace of mind...Full of life and full of people from all sects , con and creed..

Name: JOTI1
Title: Calm and Peace
Review: A clean and perfect place to reflect and pray.  Well maintained,  Excellent  to visit in the morning or evening. Total Zen

Name: premila2018
Title: Awesome
Review: Very neat and clean.  well maintained. Wonderful temple and good location too... Must visit for all. Take blessings from BABA

Name: Agnes Raja G
Title: Quiet Holi Place!
Review: Located just close the beach with very quiet atmosphere, this is always been my favrorite stopping place while on ECR road. Must visit the meditation all below the sanctrum.

Name: Kesava R
Title: Kesava Reddy***
Review: A place where relief. My üíì. Excellent temple. Even though many gates no problem v can reach to temple easy and comfortable. Free prasadam given that is delicious I used to take 3+packets.

Name: Nirmala16
Title: Rejuvenating
Review: Shirdi Baba Temple is located in the town of Shirdi about 230 km from Pune in Maharashtra. It is well connected from Mumbai, Pune or Nasik by road or rail. For those who are Lovers of Sai Baba it‚Äôs a pilgrimage that is done many times in their lives. It‚Äôs a sacred and awe inspiring place and has a lot of sanctity.  For those who just wants to visit it it‚Äôs a very peaceful, calm and rejuvenating experience.  The temple of Shirdi is the main attraction of this town. It is extremely crowded on Thursday and Sundays. Tickets for the Darshan and Kakada Aarathi are available on the net. It‚Äôs good to book them in advance. There are many hotels around the temple which are pretty decent with good food and stay.

Name: vasan224
Title: peaceful place to worship
Review: one who wants peace during worship they can go sai baba temple which is located in injambakkam, it is nice ambient place with a full of silence, also have all the gods to worship.

Name: DipuKV
Title: Lovely area
Review: An area which gives you a peek into the quintessential essence of Chennai, it is worth visiting by day and night.

Name: Radhika Narasimhan
Title: Mylapore
Review: I am born raised in Mylapore. Now returning to the same place is Semma feel I should say. Yesterday I was crossing by Dr.Radhakrishnan street, Music academy side, my mind went back to the days as a child I have walked all through here. Now the whole place has walls filled colourful paintings, and green plants. My all time favourite woodlands, then freezone shop now elsewhere, anjaneyar temple, narda gaba Sabha, Nageshwara park, are some landmarks unforgettable spots according to me. More exploring chennai reminds me of more of chennai.

Name: Krishnan N
Title: Nostalgia
Review: I spent my childhood in Mylapore and  hence returning for a visit was nostalgic, although it has become extremely commercial and crowded. But walking through the streets around Kapaleeswarar temple tank and by lanes brought back memories, not to forget the relegious fervor of the Markazhi month

Name: Sureshraghuraman
Title: Temples
Review: A place packed with temples. Rather busy and crowded. But trust me a nice place to get great vegetarian food.

Name: James G
Title: Leafy neighbourhood
Review: Its a great place to stay in Chennai. The green cover is better than most parts of Chennai. There are wonderful restaurants as well as parks and bazaars. A few fascinating temples as well

Name: Susan R
Title: a good place to revive old memories
Review: this is the place i used to go when i was a little girl and now its so different all have changed and still the ideology is there and its a place for lovely craft and worship things to buy.

Name: ashlokan
Title: Saptha Sthana Sthalams in Mylapore
Review: The Saptha Sthana Sthalams are seven important Shiva Temples located in Mylapore.Most people worship Kapaleeswarar temple only. But there are six other eually divine temples around where the Saptha Rishis like Vasishta,Agasthya and others have  worshipped the presiding Deity in each of the temples. The Temples are Karaneeswarar Temple,Theerthapaleeswarar Temple, Velleeswarar Temple, Virupaksheeswarar Temple,Valeeswarar Temple,Malleeswarar Temple and finally Kapaleeswarar Temple. All the Temples could be visited in about 3 hours time.

Name: Deadman17
Title: An important part of the city and its culture
Review: Mylapore is an area with rich history and heritrage of Chennai. This is an area where there are multiple temples, eateries open since many decades and places where traditions even today mean a lot. The rich heritage and traditions do come alive even more during festival times.

Name: Road43021039128
Title: Visit to a place of peace and soothing mind.
Review: A place where you can buy anything and everything at affordable price combined with quality and your taste.

Name: KARTHIKb87
Title: Chennai important landmar/area
Review: Its important landmark area in chennai. Mylapore is one of important and busy area in chennai and had shrine of Myalapore Kapaleeswarar temple and some more temples. It also had Ramakrishna mutt

Name: Mrudula
Title: Known for temples
Review: This is neighbouring to chennai and known for most of it's temples chruches and monuments or architectures that it hold

Name: satheesh
Title: It can be anything you want to be
Review: Mylapore caters to all the section of people , be it a foodie, spiritually inclined , shopaholic everything.The kabaleeswarar temple is a major attraction . Apart from it we have Shirdi Sai baba temple which attracts huge crowd too .The food scene is awesome and you can find satiate your buds within the high rise restaurants are among the thatched roofs.

Name: tsk0101
Title: A must visit place
Review: One must visit Kapaleeswarar temple located in Mylapore and also have food in Nithya Amirtham. Worth visiting.

Name: Anusuya D
Title: Excellent holy place
Review: So many holy and ancient temple in and around mylapore. After worship, we can around in the streets of it for street shopping. Evening market is superb

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: Mylapore is must visit place in Chennai
Review: The best part in Mylapore is the temple. It's very big and it has koneru ( tank) beside the temple. There is  a metro railway station too. Youcan buy all puja items and Telugu books too. There is Ramakrishna Math also located in Mylapore. There are many cultural actives like classical dance programs are held on stages. You can music cds also here.

Name: KathiraveluG
Title: Temple visit
Review: Mylapore is famous for temple, traditional food, good place to buy temple or pooja items. Best place to get karnatic songs in CD or USB formats along with books on Hindusium.

Name: Past Forward
Title: Enriching Experience!
Review: This is my first heritage walk with the renowned historian Sriram V. I must say this is one of a kind walk where we get to walk with a educated group,listen to amusing stories, songs and ended with a nice refreshment. I went with my school-going daughter and she found it quite informative and interesting as well. She kept asking when will be the next walk?  Quite an enriching experience for all of us! Looking forward to more walks like this!

Name: ashokd2007
Title: Nice place to visit temple
Review: This is a good place for Hindus to visit the famous Kabaleswara temple. It is better to be early in the morning, since the place has very little parking around the temple

Name: KRAMA200
Title: An Important Area of Chennai( Madras)
Review: Mylapore is soaked with history and culture.The Kapaleeswarar Temple is aLand Mark.The Teple Tank and surrounding areas are dotted with shops of all hues.A visit to Rayar Mess is amust to taste their delicacies which are not readlu available elsewhere.December January is the best time to visit as there will be numerous Dance and Music Programmes in Sabhas (Halls) in this area,the most prominent one being Music Academy.

Name: sundarjagalan
Title: You get the best at mylapore
Review: food, temple, vegetable, market, flower, good pure ghee & oil, good people. You will get the best always at Mylapore.

Name: Shankar M
Title: Walk into history - Mylapore
Review: If you wish to see traditions of Madras (Chennai), take a walk in Mylapore or its surroundings. The streets around Kapaleeshwarar temple, Mosque on Kutchery Road, Santhome Church, Luz Church, Rayar's cafe, a Vasanta Bhavan on North Mada Street that serves a "Chinese thaali" on a banana leaf! Meander around the little streets to savour the scenes and smells of local life.

Name: Ananth 727499
Title: Very important area of chennai
Review: This area can be said as the cultural identity of old Chennai.. This area is also exposes the culture of Chennai for more than 1500 years.. This area also has a historic identity as the birthplace of the Great poet "Thiruvalluvar", who has written "Thirukural".This are also has historic evidences for keeping trade with Roman Empire receiving gold for exchange of pepper and other things.. Many important temples, parks and  shopping centres which sell things needed for temples, poojas and homams are present here.. Very good divine places like A)  Saibaba temple B)  Kapaleeswarar temple C)  Mundaka Kanni Amman Temple D)  Velleeswarar Temple

Name: scs-953
Title: Rediscovering the past. !
Review: Walking around the mylapore temple tank is an interesting experience. The old Brahmin houses have given way to new shops and show rooms. Most of the old houses are in a bad shape. But interestingly the best of chennai , may it be restaurants or jewellery shops or coffee places , are setting up shops around the temple. If you have time and enjoy walking around , then do spend an hour around the temple tank. Ratna cafe , one of the oldest restaurants in chennai has set up a shop and so has mylapore coffee !  Best time to go is around four pm when all the shops are open. If you go in the morning , then you will see the street vendors selling fresh vegetables and fruits.

Name: @TraveLover
Title: Mylapore Saibaba Temple
Review: The temple was clean and very divine. Baba was prominant and at the very entrance we can see his glimpses and started to have his dharshan. we are able to connect with baba from the entrance and while standing in the queue. Normal days the crowd will be lesser. but during thursday, heavy crowd will be there and you should prepare to spare ateast one or two hours to have close dharshan. we patiently waited in the queue and finally we reached the deity. we offered the flowers and permitted to touch his feet and to do the namashkar at his another feet. we got really freshened and felt like more positive. after dharshan we went around the prahar and offered prayer to other saints which is at the back of baba. we were offered theerth. there is a seperate place to deposit our chappels

Name: uma89
Title: Mylapore kapaleedwarar temple car festival
Review: Had a memorable car festival. This festival is unique and none would ever like to miss the kapaleeswar car festival during March of each year. Huge crowd. And it will be breathtaking to see the way the kapali's big car rolls and moves forward gigantic. Awesome experience. So many devotees pull the car and they feel that they are blessed to pull the carNo heat matters. No sweat matters. No pushing or pulling in the sense crowd matter to anyone. Kapali..kapali.is the mantra everywhere. On the sidea to Quincy the thirst many offer free buttermilk. Coolers. Water..Nice to see the unity in devotion. Every one wishes to have the dharshan of lord kapaleedwarar adored the car at the top

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: One of the pridest locality of the city
Review: This locality is very old and the important places with the famous good old buildings and temples of the locality speaks for itself.want to know the history of chennai just roam around d the place

Name: Anusuya D
Title: Peaceful place
Review: A holy place with so many famous temple like kapaleeswarar temple, velleeswarar temple, sai baba temple and so on. Walking around mylapore is also nice, refreshing and peaceful

Name: ashayfarm
Title: Interesting place to tour
Review: A walking tour around Mylapore makes an interesting afternoon followed by light refreshments - not sure about the coffee!

Name: shivshankarsingh
Title: Must Visit in Chennai
Review: This is cultural capital of Chennai and also food capital Chennai. One of the primary areas around which Metropolis grew; it has heritage walk too. Perhaps oldest and best Saravan Bhawan restaurant is located here. Everything here appears genuine and authentic.

Name: kvramani
Title: Oldest parts of Chennai city.
Review: 1. Chennai citygrew from a cluster of villages.2. Mylapore is one of the oldest village of ths cluster.3. Traditional and yet modern.4. Known fir many global recognitions like grand temples, beautiful beaches, busy shopping and markets.....5. Also a great cultural cente for music, dance and drama.6. Best explored by a walk all around the old parts of Mylapore.7. Be careful to avoid,butling traffic of all kinds.

Name: David S
Title: Incredible visit
Review: Visit the Kapaleeswarar Koil temple and stand in awe. How did they build these amazing structures ? The size and colours are just unbelievable. See and feel the old Tamil culture and such a great spiritual centre. The sights, sounds and smells are spellbinding.

Name: Nitesh Rajput
Title: Sooting place
Review: Its a great spiritual center where you can spend peaceful time and can spend whold day sitting idle.

Name: Ashish S
Title: Excellent visit
Review: It was a memorable place to visit. Very nice as the place was peaceful and clean. Would recommend others as well to visit.

Name: Muguncjb
Title: visit for temples and music sabhas
Review: Mylapore is meant for retaining old Tamil culture in Chennai. It is mainly famous for Kapaleeshwar which one of the must visit temple in Chennai.  The Kapaleeshwar temple and Thanjavur Brihadeeswar temple are similar.  Near to Kapaleeshwar temple is the Karpagambal temple. For a complete dharsan of all temples here more than two hours is needed.  Mylapore is also famous for Carnatic music sabhas. Lot of music programs will be organized especially during the winter month of December every year.

Name: Ramya S
Title: Calm neighborhood
Review: Mylapore is a spiritual centre and houses temples like kapleswawar, sai baba temple,mother centre,big anjanayer temple and nandalala temple. This is a calm residential locality with a lot of shopping options.

Name: Siu_12
Title: A very unique experience
Review: An ancient culture that has not changed for centuries in terms of global hi-tech innovations.  It's best to see the places by Auto(Tuktuk), to choose an honest driver.

Name: Aaqarsh Aiyyar
Title: Melting pot
Review: There is something about this suburb of Chennai. The temples, crowded streets, shopping zone and restaurants present a perfect blend of traditional and modern world. This cultural hub is a must-visit.

Name: kalpalatha
Title: My birth place
Review: My birth place... each visit even now is special to me... Kabali temple.. giri traders.. geetha coffee powder.... kalathikadai rose milk..karpagam mess.. velliswarar temple... vasantha bhavan... keerai or greens from the shop in front of the fund office... my little home there...vegetables from south mada street... shrividhya stores... vijaya stores... several reasons to go there... mmmm

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Nice Locality
Review: This is a prominent location in Chennai with lots of religious activities conducted here, Temples and churches are located here. This place can also be reached by metro rail.

Name: vasan224
Title: temple place
Review: mylapore a temple rich place in chennai, it has so orthodox familes to worship god, also in mylapore things for the pooja can get.

Name: plpalani
Title: Centre of Chennai culture
Review: I visited this area to visit the famous Kapaleshwarar temple.The place is full of South Indian temples and also eateries. Famous for Mylopore fine arts Sabha famous for music concerts.Worth a visit if you want to soak in chennai culture

Name: Ghiri T
Title: A Neighborhood with lot of Temples
Review: Mylapore is one of the must see location in Chennai. It is very beautiful location. Here we can see many religious sites. It is a good tourist spot. One can spend their weekend with their family here visiting temples and shopping.

Name: Keertan
Title: Good
Review: Good place to hangout with friends and family. Serene environment all around. Joyful atmosphere. Pleasurable moments to cherish.

Name: HoangHai_Hanoi_VN
Title: Must go if you are in Chennai
Review: Nothing specials, it's just a neighborhood packed with so much religious buildings, you can find here church, Hindu temple, mosque, ... etc. Really interesting.

Name: Mitesh Pathak
Title: Centrally Located place with lots of Tourist Attraction
Review: During my September 2017 Visit, I stayed in a Hotel which was located at Mylapore area of Chennai. Near by Famous Temple, Lake and many good restaurants are major attraction. Marina Beach is nearby. Metro Railway station is also an added advantage.

Name: Ram A
Title: You will love this place
Review: Travelers should not miss Mylapore-Triplicane when travel to Chennai . A lot of things you can get here .

Name: Minu Susan Koshy
Title: A lively place
Review: Used to stay there for a while. Loved to wander around the street near Kapaleeshwarar Temple. Lots of small shops selling trinkets. You get lost in the crowd and sway to the rhythms of the city.

Name: K R
Title: Market
Review: Near kapalishwar temple, there is a market. Now started mango season. Lot of mangos are there.  Lot of flower shops are there

Name: Radhika Narasimhan
Title: Ancient area of chennai
Review: The name Mylapore, is derived from Mayil Araparikum ooru meaning -Land of the peacock scream. Mylapore is also know as Thirumayil -holy sacred. A popular cultural hub of chennai, which is the oldest residential part of the city. It was known as Vedapuri. During 2nd century Mylapore was known as port of Mylapore by Greeks and Romans. During 7th century, there has been a mention, of Mylapore by the Saivite saints.Transportation to Mylapore is easy from any part of the chennai. MTC buses services are connected to Mylapore. Roadways are well laid and local trains called Parakum rail are well connected. Important places to see in Mylapore- Kapaleeshwarar, Ramakrishna Math, Santhome basilica, Luz church, Vivekananda college, semmozhi Pongal, Nageshwar Rao Park, Mylapore tank, Anjaneyar temple, Saibaba temple, velleshwarar temple, mundakani amman temple,kozhavizhi amman temple, RA Puram Pillaiyar temple, Ranade library, Mylapore club and kozhavizhi amman temple. Mylapore is called the cultural hub of chennai city. There are lot of Sabha, academy‚Äôs prevailing-Music academy, Bharathi Vidya Bhavan, Karthik fine arts, Narada Gana Sabha and Mylapore fine arts, are filled with cultural events and very during December-Marghazi month. There are lot of hotels and restraunants, that serve authentic South Indian food, while streetfood like Bajjis, Bondas, Vadas, dosas, with filter kaapi are popular. Woodlands, Hotel shelter, savera, rajpark hotel are popular. Luz market, Mylapore mada veedhis, thannithora market, Eldams Road market are famous places to shop. Besides the above, Citi Center mall and Express avenue mall are famous shopping centres around. Being a mylaporean for decades, the Mylapore I have seen, to the Mylapore I see now is completely different. It is an ancient heritage hub, that has a blend of modern world, which is clubbed with mouth watering South Indian delicacies to taste.

Name: psp
Title: good area
Review: mylapore was famous for many things especially kapaleeshwarar temple,  saibaba temple,  etc.. area around kapaleeshwarar temple was so good and clean... lot of shops,  vegetable market where u can get everything at cheap price... also u can get all pooja things in the shops around and near the temple... only thing about this area was lot of mosquitoes was there... u cant bear mosquitoe bites in evening time... especially the area near n opposite to mylapore railway station...

Name: chithambe
Title: That Mayilai wAs indeed the only Chennai in the beginning is the headline
Review: Can you imagine, TODAY, that this Mayilai Coast got its name becAuse of abundance of peacocks !? and nearby mandhai-veLi, becAuse of abundance of cattle-mandhais !God of Head/Mind is the name of God in temple in Mayilai !In search of the place which contributed to Jesus's aanmeega/spiritual embrace of all the three only possible Schools of religious Thought,(Jesus being from the deadly, jihAdhi, "Not One, but Two" Semitic School), the "doubting" Thomas, after verifying the rib of Resurrected Jesus, headed to IndhiA ! And met his death, not fAr from Mayilai, in a bushy Small Mount, due to a Peacock hunter's missed arrow, according to one version, imagining him to be a peacock in the bush around ! And "murdered" by locals, according to another version !! The main Road in the Chennai city wAs "(St.Thomas) Mount Road", and now ANNA Saalai ! The Road from Fort St.George, seat of Govt., to the Mount where is a quiet memorial to St. Thomas.

Name: Cindy S
Title: A walking tour of mylapore
Review: Remember to avoid the midday sun as it takes time to wander around and take in all the sights. A fascinating view of life in Tamil nadu

Name: Rohini J
Title: Home Long Ago
Review: Mylapore is one of the oldest neighbourhoods in Chennai then known as Madras to everyone. The houses and people are a bit old school but things are changing but the charm of the area stays the same. I have lived here for 23 years and cannot think of another place I would have called home.

Name: TravelSanchari
Title: Authentic South Indian items available
Review: The biggest attraction of Mylapore is the Shiva Kapaleeswara Temple which is a must see, both for devotees and casual visitors. The area around the temple offers the most authentic items required in South Indian homes and the collection and variety are unbeatable. Most stores now accept credit cards and prices are reasonable so shopping is hassle free. Of course, fruits and vegetables are best purchased from the chain of Pazamudir Chole stores around the city (avoid roadside stalls) - fixed prices, electronic weighing, clean and wide choice and helpful staff.

Name: Abdul wahaab
Title: Busy locality
Review: One of the busy locality in chennai. Lot of top hotels are available and we can enjoy all local taste of food ..but heavy traffic area

Name: Umang A
Title: Heart of chennai
Review: This is the center , the heart of Chennai which hold rich history, Temples, churches, colors, marina beach and what not...

Name: IvanOravec
Title: Beautiful tiny streets
Review: You cannot get lost in Mylapore. You can only get more and more immersed in its rich mixture of activity, smells and colors. So put away your guidebook and just stroll around its many narrow streets.

Name: Hilarian_Felix
Title: One of the Ancient place in Chennai
Review: Mylapore is one of the oldest places in Chennai and is famous for temples and churches.Its name is derived from the tamil word Thirumyilai wherein in the word Thiru refers to holy and Mayilai refers to Peacock. The famous Kapaleeswarar Temple,San Thome Basilica, Luz Church, Adi Kesava Perumal Temple are some of the important places of worship in Mylapore. The famous Marina Beach, Express Avenue Mall and Citi Centre Mall is also located in and around Mylapore. Very good access to buses and metro trains.In olden times peacocks have been fund flourishing in this area thats why it is called Mylapore.Mylapore is one of the places wherein you can see Brahmin sect people a lot.This place is ideally suitable for worship lovers.

Name: Muhammad A
Title: a piece of old madras
Review: lots of crowds over there with an interesting history.it was a good walk if you are interested to observe the local culture and see how people live their days. small shops, local food ...

Name: jawa13
Title: Crowded.Lot of shopping
Review: Mylapore (Kabali) temple is historic. Mylapore is centrally located with many great restaurants, stores, and hotels. It is also very crowded.

Name: S V
Title: Historical and  crowded centre of the city.
Review: This ever-busy and active place is important in the city of Madras(Chennai) for its historic temple and church.The  crowded markets and very old lanes with a touch of the past era and its own beauty with lots of religious  atmosphere.

Name: BBhusanMohanty
Title: Great Holy place in the central part of Chennai.
Review: Mylapore. Chennai. When it comes to mind ,Ten it is Kapaleeswarar Temple to Visit. The lively loving Lord Shiva as name in Kapaleeswar Living in Mylapore. Place accompanied by great food,Coffee,Shoping area.And the most and the best is Lord Saibaba;s shrine also near by.

Name: Tan T
Title: Local Street Experience
Review: Go back in time and wander down the shop and stall lined streets surrounding the old temples and get a glimpse of the local flavours, products and colourful people. Plenty of surprises in store definitely. Chennai people in their local neighbourhoods show their hospitality and friendliness. My morning spent there was quite a pleasant experience - cost me nothing, but definitely a fortune in memories of Chennai.

Name: GrannyMaa
Title: Lotus Flower Pond
Review: Literal translation of Mylapore - Lotus Flower Pond. The famous Kapaleeshwarar Temple is located in this area, so also the Shirdi Sai Baba Temple. Lot of Tamil Iyers, Iyengers and Brahmins live in this neighborhood. It is also the home for Sanskrit College.

Name: Rajendran P
Title: Grand old place of Chennai
Review: Shivaite and Vaishnavite temples are very many in this place, great place to visit and spend divinely time. Area is developed to catet to the visitors in terms of good traditioanal south indian eating joints.

Name: ulag63
Title: TRAIDTIONAL PATH
Review: The left over of old Tamil traditional practices can be viewed during festival time, especially during Car festival and Arupathi moover festival. Old tradition is being cherished during pre-pongal period.  Sivan temple is the ideal place to feel your soul and karma. Old Vegetarian restaurants still maintaining the quality and service.

Name: tickey2016
Title: Ms M Chetty
Review: There are many places of interest that one can visit in a day example the Shiva temple, Giris where prayer goods books CDs DVD brassware all can be purchased. INDRA Metals another good shop to purchase brassware and gifts. VIJAYA STORES is a favorite for foreigners as prices are very reasonable and service is excellent.Lots of shops to do shopping.Chola jewelers for excellent quality I shop there. All these mentioned above are walking distance and close by.then there is Hotel Saravana Bhavan restaurant for excellent food cakes  and sweets.there is do much to see and do in Mylapore.

Name: Shopkhoj
Title: The New Silk Route in Mylapore,Chennai
Review: The Mylapore saree trailNow that Deepavali ( Diwali ,the festival of Lights , is pronounced Deepavali in South India ) is fast approaching, there is a great shopping frenzy in Chennai to buy the latest sarees. It is a tradition to wear new clothes on Deepavali and ethnic sarees are a hot favourite .Deepavali is an occasion to purchase local silk sarees, which are the Kanjivaram pattu sarees, in Tamilnadu.KANJIVARAM SILK SARIS Kancheepuram /Kanjivaram is a small temple town in the State of Tamil Nadu in South India ,famous for its traditional silk saris. Silk is purchased from Bangalore and woven in Kancheepuram.Shops are busy advertising their new saree collections in new designs .The print medium and the online medium are abuzz with colourful advertisements. Movie stars and celebrities are roped in by the shops to advertise their wares. The radio is also one of the channels used to attract people in the remote areas. Chennai shopping for the latest designer sarees is the oft repeated slogan in all the channels.Until recently, the T Nagar shopping market was the much sought after market that one would typically go to for saree purchases. It was an obvious choice . The ‚ÄúNalli ‚Äù shop was the definitive shop for pattu saris in the newest designs in Chennai. There was a perpetual traffic jam in front of the Nalli store . Other popular shops for silk sarees such as Kumaran Silks, Kumaran Weavers , RMKV , Sundari Silks & Pothys, all near the Nalli shop ,added to the frenzy. Blaring horns, cycle rickshaws , autos, pedestrians et all was an everyday affair at this time .Buying that silk saree was mandatory for the south Indian women and there was no other Chennai shopping market with such a variety of shops. There was no choice .Introducing ‚ÄòThe silk trail‚Äô in the Mylapore shopping Market in Chennai.The Mylapore shopping Market now offers a choice for women.There are about 7 popular Chennai saree shops in a small stretch of road near the Nageswara Rao Park in Chennai . It is a relatively quiet residential area. It is about 1.5 km long. The range of sarees available here is quite amazing .It will take you about 1or 2 hours to visit all the 7 shops. Sarees in beautiful colours and beautiful designs are all available . It is roadside parking. But go there on a weekday .1. Let us begin our exploratory visit with Sreenivas SilksWhile this shop is not exactly in the Nageswara Rao Park stretch, it is about 1/2 km ahead ,towards Luz . This is a small shop in the Luz Market , opposite to the Luz train station. But step into this shop for an amazing collection of silk & cotton sarees. Light weight silk sarees in the most beautiful colours and designs at modest prices are available here.2. A little further down is a branch of the famous Nalli shopIt is in the quiet corner in Luz. You don‚Äôt have to scramble to go to T Nagar in Chennai to visit the Nalli store anymore . Just walk into the spacious ground floor .Silk sarees in a variety of colours and price range is made available . The basement has furnishings as also ready made pavadais for babies.3. Next stop is the Rangachari Cloth Store.This is a 70 year old store. The store is well known for cotton sungudi saris ,Venketagiri sarees from Andhra Pradesh and Mangalagiri sarees .4. Kanchi Weavers Shop for some stylish Kanchi cotton sarees and pattu sarees. Pattu sarees in pure & tested zari is available . This is a small shop . While the choice is limited ,the selection is good. It could probably help you to make quick decision5. Next is Palam SilksPalam silks has some cotton and jute sarees in the ground floor. Head to the first floor for the pur kanjivaram designer sarees. They are unique and you will not find similar ones elsewhere . Unusual shades and designs. Choice is limited.6.Tulsi SilksWe can assure you that you will not return empty handed from this shop. 3 floors of gorgeous saris and courteous service await you . Silk cotton sarees, sarees with cutwork borders, Benarsi sarees, georgette and crepe saris with sari work are all available here . But the best saris are on the top floor. Silk sarees in most unusual designs and unusual colour combinations . Pure sari saris and also the non sari sarees are all available for a price.7. Just 1/2 a km away is VaraMahalakshmi SlksThey started their showroom in Kancheepuram. Their connect with Kancheepuram is very strong. Sarees in a various price ranges in cotton and pattu are available here.So what is stopping you now from picking up the beautiful Kanjivaram saree for this Deepavali ? It cannot be the maddening traffic & noise in the T.Nagar Shopping Market definitely. So , go ahead and get that saree shopping going !

Name: thirumun
Title: In nutshell cultural core of tamilnadu. except plane and ship almost eveything is available here
Review: This places wakes up early,has century old temples.choicest authentic south indian food,sarees,sarees, dolls made of clay,china on the road side.One need to walk around the Kabali tank to see the splendour. Best coffee and tiffin;; visit and experience

Name: vikasmardia
Title: mylapore
Review: Mylapore is one of the oldest and traditional areas of Chennai mainly tamil dominated. marina beach and cricket stadium is very nearby. All famous eateries in mylapore.

Name: sugumar s
Title: kapaleeshwarar temple
Review: A must see place to get the feel of life at chennai. Right from the smell of the filter coffee to the bells of the kapaleeshwarar temple and the busy market place. Best to visit at evenings. the markets around the temple sell good souvernir's

Name: Anusuya D
Title: excellent place for shopping
Review: nice place for shopping the fresh fruits and vegetables from the vendors at nominal price. even fancy item and other small articles we can buy from small shops. temple crowded holy place

Name: sundara v
Title: Ethnic Area
Review: Need something ethnic in Chennai? Head to Mylapore! It is quite a busy area, so watch out for the traffic! From painting supplies for Indian art works to Handwoven Sarees, you'll find little boutiques and standard shops here! Some of these boutiques have the most exquisite hand woven sarees, which won't be found in the standard stores. worth the price!

Name: Chandrasekaran N
Title: busy shopping area of Chennai
Review: Mylapore  gets its name from peacocks. In Tamil peacocks are called MAYIL It appears some hundred years ago this place was flocked with peacocks. Very busy shopping area. You can get anything you want in this area from expensive items to less expensive ones..There is a very big ancient temple called Mayilai Karpakambal temple. Many platform shops are found around the temple. Many famous small restaurants catering tasty inexpensive food are available

Name: Arun
Title: A beautiful place with lot of small mess and temples
Review: This is a very important part of the city. You can find lot of famous old temples, small messes with awesome food. Also, nearby there are malls and theaters. It is a must visit place in Chennai for everyone.

Name: Travel with SK & GK
Title: Lots of memories with this place
Review: Mylapore is the place where I lived for good 3-4 years starting from 1999 - 2000 then 2005 to 2008 and have lots of teen age memories with this place, recently visited this place again with friends and refreshed all the memoriesThis place is very famous for Kapaleeswarar Temple as well as Sai Baba Temple, Visit both the temples and it's worth visitGood houses to rent out and local people to help you with regards to the sameMust try the fruit shake at Luz Corner which use to be my favourite once upon a time and still have the taste of the same and will never go away

Name: Ramgopalr89
Title: My second home
Review: Stayed in mylapore for my studies. A peaceful neighborhood. A bit crowdy near temples and market areas. Good accessibility for restaurant and transport.

Name: Angel_Traveler444
Title: Want to understand Chennai
Review: Mylapore is famous for many things local, be it the famous Kapaleeswarar Temple or the famous Rangachari stores. This place has lot of shops where you can buy or fix musical instruments. Though it is very crowded nowadays still its nice to walk and look around this place

Name: Karthik R
Title: Walk tours
Review: Walk tours is good in Mylapore. Take a cab or local transportation and get down near Mylapore tank. The Mylapore tank is a prominent place with lot of shops all around - petty things to markets to jewellery to road side eateries to temples. One gets to kill time here on anyday evening. It is well connected by buses and trains.

Name: ajaysu
Title: Mylapore
Review: It is very good place for temples there are so many beautiful temples and so big I it so much I want to go again mylapore

Name: Al B
Title: Foodies tour in Mylapore, Chennai
Review: Fascinating walking tour and culinary experience in Mylapore, led by Deepa who's a very knowledgable and friendly host. What a memorable experience to discover the ingredients for these delicious South Indian dishes and Tamil specialties - the spices, the vegetables, the history of cooking and dining - and get a taste of the local cuisine and how it is made. Expect a large amount of food to taste in local restaurants and food stands in this busy, bustling, vibrant part of Chennai, steeped in tradition and Hindu culture, and a walk through street markets where you will discover foods you have never seen before. Thoroughly recommended!

Name: VINAY KUMAR N
Title: About mylapore
Review: Mylapore is the one of the main place in Chennai city. mylapore is the place where lots of hotels,institutions.

Name: Praveen S
Title: Pleasant place
Review: Once you visit a mylapore, you will feel the pleasant odor of temple, especially Kabaleeswarar temple

Name: srrrr
Title: Nice place but not clean
Review: One of favourite temple is located in mylapore...So i used to go there very frequently...Famous temples like kapaleeswarar temple, saibaba temple is here... Environment around the temple was so clean and good...But the place opposite to railway station and around the station was very dirty....More mosquitoes in this area due to open drainage near railway station....Other than that place i like mylapore...

Name: SIVA S
Title: Cultural Area
Review: Mylapore symbolize for Hindus cultural area,there we have parthasarty temple and mostly Chennai Iyer community people occupied that area .lux corner is  busy signal and crowded area .we also having famous shops kumaran silks for dress.

Name: Dinesh_cbe
Title: Place for Temples!
Review: Mylapore holds huge number of temples within it and a religious hub in Chennai. Temples are rich in architecture and well maintained. Very busiest place with branches of all major restaurants, fashion stores and food chains.

Name: BananaLu
Title: Great area to visit, even better with Storytrail!
Review: I had been to mylapore many times when I was living in Chennai but this year I decided to do it with a walking tour called peacock trail with the company Storytrail. It was amazing! Mylapore is full of temples and history, it's a very old area and having a guide explaining so many stories was thrilling. There are also some nice stalls to shop and good lunch places. Don't miss this area if you happen to spend some time in the city!

Name: B R S
Title: Harmonious Neighbourhood of Chennai
Review: Mylapore can boast to be a Harmonious Neighbourhood of Chennai where the People live in peace.
