Name: Aarav K
Title: Must visit for your peace of mind
Review: It is old enough and yet beautiful. It is kept quite maintained and therefore its beauty has not yet gone. The peace here gives peace to you by entering your mind and heart. This is definitely a worth-to-visit temple.

Name: JANET S
Title: Approach with Reverence!
Review: Grounds are immaculate with trees and flowers.  A privilege to visit and meditate here.  Quiet and serene.  Not good to rush in and out.  Stay a while.  Take in the good vibes.

Name: ingvar
Title: Interesting place to visit
Review: Despite the name, it's not a place where usual krishnaites you know from Europe or US hang. It's a valid and beautiful Indian temple, looking slightly unusual from the Dravidian norm otherwise.

Name: vasuji90
Title: ‚ÄúTemple for Peace of mind‚Äù
Review: The Ramakrishna temple is a beautiful temple in Chennai. The temple complex is very well maintained and clean.Beautiful Hindu temple for worship and Meditation. Very clean and neat.Must visit if you visit Chennai next time. There are also various activities like Sanskrit classes and meditation sessions also conducted here. We found the place to be very peaceful and serene.

Name: jjramanairforce
Title: Temple for Peace of mind
Review: This temple is in Chennai, Ramakrishna Mutt Road, Mylapore. Beautiful Hindu temple for worship and Meditation. Very clean and neat. Must visit if you visit Chennai next time

Name: Mukta2016
Title: Ramakrishna Temple
Review: The Ramakrishna temple is a beautiful temple in Chennai. The temple complex is very well maintained and clean. There are also various activities like Sanskrit classes and meditation sessions also conducted here. We found the place to be very peaceful and serene.

Name: David S
Title: Good as ever
Review: As with all the various temples in this area it's really great to see and wonder at it in awe ! Well worth a visit. How did they build these wonderful monuments ? Great to walk around it in the lovely sunny day.

Name: Ramya S
Title: Peaceful
Review: One of the most organized temples in the Chennai City. I am a big fan of the bhajans held in the Ramakrishna mutt at Mylapore.

Name: arindammullick100
Title: nice temple
Review: When entering inside the temple..... you will definitely get the aura that will make your mind peaceful.....spend at least half an hour....

Name: BUTHU
Title: Spectacular!
Review: The building is huge and spectacular. The whole atmosphere is very calm and peaceful. I really liked the prayer room and the library.

Name: Siu_12
Title: A very majestic temple
Review: This temple was built in 1810, and located in Mylapore district. To this day it is well restored and maintained,  a very nice stroll in the garden around.

Name: Amitra78
Title: Feel like at Hometown
Review: Best place to visit at Chennai. Really awesome environment. Went during Dussehra Festival when there was Slokas/Bhajan for Sri Rama was being conducted. Neatly maintained campus.

Name: Priya M
Title: Big Temple Structure
Review: Its a big temple structure in Chennai. People from North and South indian origins throng this temple.

Name: nageswararao g
Title: Best temple to visit in Chennai
Review: Its the best temple complex to visit in Chennai. Neatly maintained picturesque place. I Always feel delighted to visit this place

Name: CharmDeepak
Title: Relax ,Meditate
Review: If you are interested to learn sanskrit/hindi , approach the volunteers. They conduct classes once in 6 months. You can learn sanskrit from PhD guy who has exceptional teaching skills.

Name: Karthik V
Title: Meditation and books
Review: Ramakrishna temple...I visited with family on a Sunday evening.The big hall with the silent atmosphere, people sitting on the floor mat , medidating and gettine ones mind together is such a peaceful place for a wuite and relaxing mind . The book shop attached to this mutt has numerous collection of the preachings and teaching os Ramakrishna, Vivekanandar and others. The kids too have mytholigical comics. The books are priced less compared to such quality books outside. Yoga books are a plenty here.

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Nice Architecture
Review: This temple belongs to Ramakrishna mission and has a beautiful architecture. This is a temple dedicated to spiritual worship and human well being. Nice place to visit.

Name: Sarma_nvny
Title: Temple of Silence
Review: Enormous temple with Enormous silence. Indulge in our self. Very decently maintained and well discipline organization working in the service of humanity. Nothing more to say but for experiencing is so much. in the center part of the city. very well connected by road. Devine experience.

Name: dheepika8
Title: Connect with yourself !
Review: This is a such a calm and wonderful place amidst the hustle bustle of Mylapore. It is a go to place if you want to meditate and connect with yourself. Beautiful architecture with a lush greenery transcends you in to a different world altogether. Even if you don't want to meditate, the environment is so calm that it takes control of you and relaxes you and makes you feel so calm while leaving the place. Both morning and evening visits offers different experiences. The book shop is also good. Must visit for the environment, music, lectures, aarthi, ambience and inner peace.

Name: Keertan
Title: Nice
Review: Ramakrishna Math was Built on the occasion of 150th Birth anniversary is Srimat Swami Ramakrishnanandaji Maharaj, A direct disciple of Sri Ramakrishna and the founder of Sri Ramakrishna Math .. The place is very silent and amazing .. Nice to try with family and friends ..

Name: vasan224
Title: peaceful temple
Review: in my childhood days we go this temple for getting blessings from Krishnan, in this temple daily they worship a god with different prasadhams which is so nice to see.

Name: Radhika Narasimhan
Title: An evoke of spirituality
Review: Located in the centre of the city, Mylapore, this temple was conceived by Swami Bhuteshanandaji Maharaja, the 12th president of the Math and the Mission. This temple architecture was designed by G.Venkataramanna Reddy. The old temple of this Math, is located near the new temple, which has a prayer hall and a place where Seva(Ritual service), to Sri Ramakrishna is done. The new temple has a beautiful garden and a walking path. The inside of the temple has a Meditation Hall, where absolute silence is maintained, and lot of peace is gained. A wonderful place to visit, to walk and to gain lot of inner silence and peace.

Name: Marwa E
Title: Awesome
Review: I recommend this place at 6 : 30 pm to listen to amazing music and see how Indian do mediation and custom of pray

Name: ACSquare
Title: Beautiful and peaceful
Review: A must visit place . It's both beautiful and spiritual . This is a must visit both architecture lovers and spiritual seekers

Name: 592abck
Title: Amazing piece of work
Review: Must visit place when you are in Chennai. Such a divine and spiritual place it is. Nice to be here and spend some time.

Name: Umang A
Title: Rama
Review: A temple build by followers of Ramakrishna. a simple temple but offer great escape from city noise and destination for meditation

Name: Ashish D
Title: Wonderful landmark in a busy locality !
Review: The Ramakrishna Math has built this temple during the last couple of years in lieu of the older temple, which still stands in its premises. Great landmark indeed !

Name: IvanOravec
Title: Silent refuge from the bustle of Mylapore
Review: This set of temples was built by the disciples of Sri Ramakrishna, who preached the unity of all religions. I offers prayer spaces and research publications on the world's largest religions, and is very well kept.

Name: Prasad B
Title: Symbol of spirituality !!!
Review: The place is highly simple and austere but has an aura of positive energy...A must visit for anyone who is religious enough and in search of peace

Name: meghashyam
Title: Sri Ramakrishna math
Review: Sri Ramakrishna math an oasis of peace , the old shrine which is more than a century old , lovely gardens , new temple with a soulful moola murthi in marble , maa Sarada Devi 's picture and swami Vivekananda's picture on either side . Evening arati at 6.30 transports you to a sublime level

Name: akhilchandu
Title: Beautiful temple
Review: In the midst of a highly urban and busy area of Chennai called Mylapore, the Universal Temple of Sri Ramakrishna shines like a lustrous pearl. It is a tranquil and cool place to meditate and pursue spiritual thoughts in the heart of the hustle and bustle of the metropolis.¬†The Ramakrishna Mutt Temple is part of the campus of the Ramakrishna Mission in Mylapore. It is a modern monument dedicated to Sri Ramakrishna (1836‚Äì1886), the 19th century saint and philosopher from Bengal and the motivation behind the setting up of the Ramakrishna Mutt, a monastic organization for men.¬†The towering white marble edifice is a symbol of Universal Religion. The temple‚Äôs architecture is reminiscent of the pink Belur Temple in the headquarters of the mission near Kolkata. It blends harmoniously with the traditional South Indian temple architecture.

Name: Abhishek
Title: Calm and Quiet
Review: Very good architecture, good place to just sit , meditate, relax. You will find internal and mental peace.

Name: Balasubramanian R
Title: Ramakrishna temple Mylapore
Review: Ramakrishna temple is situated in the heart of Mylapore in chennai city. It is managed by Ramakrishna Math whose chennai office is adjacent to the temple. It is a Universal temple. Books, magazines etc are available.

Name: Rajendran P
Title: A good place to meditate
Review: Located in Mylapore, a clean and silent place. It has a huge meditation hall where one can spend peaceful time.

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: serene place
Review: Its quite calm.People come here sit and meditate and no one disturbs others and its cool as well without artificial cooling.Must expereinece this for calmness

Name: Deepa876
Title: A must visit
Review: A beautiful and serene place. Great place to practice meditation and find inner peace.There are shops near the entrance which we can buy books published by math.

Name: Mahendra K
Title: Most Peaceful Place & Divine Feeling - Sri Ramakrishna Temple
Review: If anyone wants to find their inner self and meaning of Peacefulness in Chennai city go to this place and meditate yourself to discover your full potential. Most Divine & Blissful feeling every time i visit this Math.

Name: avithechamp775522
Title: Outstanding place!!!
Review: The environment nearby the temple is beautiful. Lots of people gathers here to have a look at this beautiful and am temple.

Name: iamlucky2017
Title: RK Math Chennai
Review: Ramakrishna Math. its a must visit place in Chennai. Sri Ramakrishna Math, Chennai provides books, magazines, audio/video, articles on Ramakrishna, Vivekananda, Sarada Devi, Vedanta, Upanishads, Gita and ...more

Name: Rossana C
Title: A peaceful oasis in town
Review: This is a wonderful place to find inner peace. You can meditate in the temple and benefit from the arati Chants from the monks. You can do activities like yoga and follow seminars and talks and spiritual matters. There is also a very good bookshop.

Name: VeerendraKhatawkar
Title: Beautiful & peaceful place
Review: Near Marina & kapeeleshwar temple it is very good place to visit, built next to Kolkatta & as beautiful as Kolkatta math.May attractions and shopping cenetrs nearby - incuding jewellery shops & hotels

Name: DSriVallabha
Title: Experience inner peace
Review: The temple of Ramakrishna Paramahamsa and Mata Sarada Devi. This is a good place to calm and soothe the mind. As you walk in from the busy Mylapore road, you will enter into a calm and peaceful world. Also has a book store with spiritual publications in English, Hindi and south Indian languages. Must visit for the spiritually inclined people.

Name: Subhagata C
Title: a must see temple
Review: i with my wife had been there and stayed at the temple for half an hour and worshiped nice to see and have a peaceful time inside

Name: Narayanan S
Title: A serene place to pray
Review: Ramakrishna math has been doing a great job - one of them is a place which is calm and one can pray with out any disturbance. The place is spacious and clean. The ambience motivates you to pray. I strongly recommend all to visit this place and their, hospital and their publications sales outlet To sum up it is just GREAT

Name: L R S
Title: Beautiful place. Worth a visit.
Review: Beautiful place established at the behest of Swami Vivekananda.  Well maintained, quite, divine place. Worth a visit.

Name: Partha C
Title: Holi place for meditation
Review: Ramakrishna Mission is a religious and spiritual place. Holi place for meditation.  They are running schools also. Ramakrishna Mission, Belur Math, Kolkata  are the  Main organisation.

Name: Narasimhan G
Title: Meditators mansion
Review: The grandeur , the peace and space make meditation a divine experience.Ramakrishna Math , Chennai runs it...Years back when i visited , I saw a jar said to have been dropped  by Shri Vivekananda himself , which seems to have now been  now removed to a safer place...If you are a meditator , you will traet yourself to a very divine experience...

Name: DrMurugesan R
Title: Great place to meditate!
Review: What a holistic atmosphere to cleanse our soul, after long hauls of mundane works in life!Never forget to join the bhajans in the evenings!

Name: Narasimhananda S
Title: Universal Temple
Review: Temple for all. An abode of peace, where hundreds are always meditating at any given point in time. The centre of religious and spiritual life.

Name: BRabindra
Title: Very Beautiful
Review: Very beautiful temple. Well maintained with clean. You will have peace in your mind when you enter this temple.

Name: Lakshmi Narayanan S
Title: A peaceful place in the middle of noisy city
Review: This is located in Mylapore near kapaleeswarar temple. A very good place to meditate. The environment is very peaceful. Bhajans happens in the evenings. This is a must visit place for foreigners and North Indians as they will like it more than South Indians.

Name: pranab655
Title: good place for cultural seekers
Review: This is a nice place for RK followers. Its clean and nice. serene, you can sit and medidate for a while.

Name: RAJARSHI BANERJEE
Title: Place of Ultimate Serenity
Review: The best place to visit in Chennai, according to me. The Place is so peaceful and beautiful that one can sit here all day long. It is close to Kapeeleswara Temple in Mylapore.

Name: Arun
Title: Peaceful and quiet place
Review: Ramakrishna Temple is a quiet and peaceful place. There is a big meditation hall where you can feel the silence and in the hall there is Ramakrishna statue placed for worship. Best time to visit is in the evening.

Name: EnjoyUrHoliday
Title: Peace of Mind
Review: This is worth for devotees of Sri Ramkrishna. People can spend hours in the peaceful environment. A perfect place for meditation and your prayer.

Name: Kaushik G
Title: Oasis of peace
Review: We had visited Ramkrishna Mutt located in busy Mylapore area during our holidays in Chennai. We had gone in the evening and were leaving after we had visited the bookstore and the old original temple dedicated to Sri Ramkrishna, then someone told us that the main temple was on the other side of the ashram. We were mesmerized to see the main temple which was a giant structure with beautiful decorated hall inside. We sat along with many others in the hall and listened to bhajans which was a very peaceful experience. The premises of the ashram are clean and well maintained with large collection of flowering plants and trees.

Name: SearchingSoulDev
Title: Spiritual Place
Review: It is a very good place if you are interested on Swamy Vivekananda and Hinduism. Well maintained and at a very good position

Name: Ghiri T
Title: A divine and peaceful place in chennai
Review: It is a divine place .it is a best place to meditate .there are many pics telling the life of swami Ramakrishna.here we can buy book ,photos etc.

Name: 815mala
Title: Feel the presence of the Master
Review: MUST SEE. Visited it in 2014 and July 2016. Amazing place - beautiful, clean and serene -ideal for quiet and meditation. Do not miss the book store.

Name: Vegnesh_Jawaharlal
Title: Heritage Monument in Chennai ..
Review: One of  the old heritage monument in chennai .. You can find various pictures and books with respect to vivekananda. Good for shcool children to gain some knowledge about preaches given by vivekanda ..

Name: kittyban
Title: A place that brings Tranquility!
Review: Ramakrishna mission temple is located near the Mylapore Tank. There are 2 shrines, old and the new one. We can spend hours meditating in this temple without the noise of the outside world. The premises has been very well maintained with lots of trees and flowering plants . They have a library where you can enjoy reading books; Also , you can buy books from the bookstall at subsidized rates . After spending about an hour, i felt such a calmness and mental tranquility .

Name: PacoYes67
Title: The Spiritual Oasis in Chennai
Review: Ramakrishna and the universal of religions....not only a gem of building but also a very special spiritual atmosphere, an oasis of peace in the noisy city. I recommend this place for people interested in meditation.

Name: Soumyadeep l
Title: Vivekanandar Illam, a must visit place
Review: Locally its called as "Vivekanandar Illam", no one knows this place as Ramakrishna Temple. You have to buy ticket to visit this place, but its very less, 50 bucks. A pictorial museum and visual representation of life of Swami Vivekananda. One light and sound show, one 3D show and yoga room will feel your heart and mind with peace. When you are in Marina beach then you must hit this place.

Name: Deepak R
Title: Calm and peaceful, and well maintained
Review: In the mid of crowded roads, an oasis of peace and tranquility - this very well maintained temple complex is a must-visit if you wish to have a few moments of peaceful contemplation and relaxation! The interior of the main temple is spacious, calm and well-kept, enabling a good round of meditation / contemplation. The outside is a flower and tree filled area, good to step away from the ruckus outside.

Name: Arvind
Title: Abode of Tranquility
Review: The mutt is located 2 min from the Mylapore tank and is an abode of peace. The old temple is a great place to meditate. The recently constructed universal temple is massive, and is a must go for anyone who loves a peaceful retreat. The temple reverberates with energy during the evening Arthi @ 6.30 PM. The entire area is spic and span and well maintained. This is certainly for people who love peace and want to take a leaf out of Swami Ramakeishna Paramahamsa and Swami Vivekananda's life and teachings.

Name: Shubhalaxmi
Title: A Really Universal Temple
Review: This place is at Mylapore, Chennai,just 2 mins from Mylapore Tank, 10 mins walking  from Lux corner( where a big  Nalli Shop is placed. )The Temple looks like a Taj- Mahal from out side ( Indo-Mughal Architecture) From inside it is like a huge gothic Church,with huge columns carved in a Hindu Style.The raised Sanctum Sanctorium  has a thousand petaled lotus carved in a marble on which Thakur ( Shri Ramakrishna) is placed. The whole place oozes with serenity,cleanliness  and a calm ambience. The place boasts of a huge liabrary, whrein anybody can go through spiritual   or light books. There is an old temple which was the 1st branch of Ramakrishna Math outside Kolkata, guided by the great Sw Ramakrishnananda, who rendered unprecedented service to Thakur. Between the old and new temple one encounters a huge garden, well-kept  and inviting with its multi coloured flowers and shrubs.There are classes teaching Sanskrit Language and literature in 2 leveis.THe most pondering time is at Aarati, which takes place at 6.30 in the evening during winter and goes on for nearly 45 minutes.( There is another one at 5 in the morning).All people irrespective of cast and creed are welcome at the temple and in the liabrary. One indeed experiences a sense of fulfillness at  this place

Name: ChennaiFocus
Title: Sri Ramakrishna Math Ordained by Swami Vivekananda in memory of his Guru Bhagwan Ramakrishna Paramahamsa
Review: A seat of spirituality and wisdom, Sri Ramakrishna Math is an ashram for followers of Swami Vivekananda. The math is social conscious and conducts various activities to help educate poor children, medical camps and more. You can find books published by Sri Ramakrishna Math here.

Name: rguptaggc
Title: Surprsing and Beautiful
Review: I was quite surprised to see the way this historic place is maintained. This is a well known place for those who believes in Great Swami Vivekanandji. A Small entrance fees is charged by the trust which i suppose to just maintain it.

Name: Pulak
Title: Very Peaceful Ambience
Review: Must visit for every Swami Vivekananda admirers. Very similar to Belur Math of Kolkata. Loved the place.

Name: Gunjan S
Title: Relaxing
Review: The speciality of this Temple is that, it does not discriminate if you are religious or not. People of all religions are welcome. The priests sing beautifully and overall a very relaxing and soulful place.

Name: Raven2012
Title: You have to visit if you are interested in Ramakrishna and Vivekananda
Review: I was pleasantly surprised at the way this historic building was maintained and the way the tour (on your own) has been setup. On paying a entrance fee of Rs.10 per person, you can get lost in the life of the two great teachers. The circular meditation room, where Swami Vivekananda stayed for a few days has a beautiful aura. The small book shop is well stocked and all the staff are very friendly.

Name: Deepankar B
Title: Best place to refresh memories of Raamakrishna Paramhansa & Swami Vivekananda
Review: Best place to refresh memories of Raamakrishna Paramhansa & Swami Vivekananda overlooking famous Marina Beach.

Name: Sarita_KL
Title: A gem in the middle of busy city
Review: A quite, serene and beautiful temple and meditation hall in the middle of busy city. A place for you to meditate and there is a small book shop with extremely reasonable price for spiritual books.

Name: andrewwray2512
Title: Peaceful
Review: The Ramakrishna Temple is a peaceful, quiet escape from the busy, crowded maze of streets surrounding it. There's not much to look at or photograph but if you want to empty head and lower your stress levels, it's the perfect place.

Name: Ease T
Title: A school to gain peace of mind
Review: My wife was then in her sick bed. I was left alone to take care of her during then. My mind was not in calm state. Knowing well about her destiny within few days, how do I live calm. But, then, I decided to go to Ramakrishna Mutt, Mylapore on each sundays and sit quiet doing Pranayama.It gave me strength and will power to proceed with my duty. Wonderful place, rather I would say the best place to learn meditation and come out of your worries

Name: RamGanesan
Title: The listing confuses people
Review: Let me start by telling that the Photo on this site is not of Ramakrishna temple but that of Vivekanandha house or the Ice house referred locally.  Please refer back to Vivekanandha house for details on that attraction.  However the Ramakrishna temple is situated in Mylapore, on the RK Mutt road inside the RK Mutt.  This place has a Ramakrishna and a Sharadha devi temple.  An awesome meditation center, a book store and spiritual discourses are the main attractions here.

Name: AyonTalukdar
Title: For one‚Äôs own salvation, and for the welfare of the world.
Review: We reached the Mission at around 10.20 am. It was very quiet and peaceful at the mission.A complete contrast to the streets we walked through on the way there. We first visited the temple/prayer hall. It was very peaceful inside. Then we went to meet the founder of the Mission who gave us his blessings and also gave us a copy of the book Karma Yoga. We then had tea  in the dinning hall.After that we were told about the history of the mission in Chengelpet and shown a tour of the garden/farm where we saw a variety of trees including orange, lemon, chicku, coconut and even a nagalingam tree. We were told that the earnings from the farm provided for the mission‚Äôs activities of providing schooling to underprivileged children and other activities.

Name: NIVAS R
Title: Small museum & Bookstore
Review: An extremely quick visit with a good bookstore to buy gifts and giveaways for people to take back home.

Name: Babu M
Title: Seeing the different form of Lord Krishna...
Review: ITs a huge complex to walk around and see the crowd this temple attracts. one cant avoid feeling the huge commercial side of this temple. The circle of life was an interesting observation in this temple......

Name: Sarkar
Title: We'll maintained Railway station
Review: Very nice and we'll maintained Railway station. Station is very clean also Retiring room is also very clean and we'll maintained.

Name: Radhika Narasimhan
Title: Chennai central view
Review: From childhood days this station has always been my favourite for it‚Äôs the only mode of transport I used to travel outside chennai. Yesterday I reached the station by metro train, and had the best view of this spot as I left the metro station premises. One of the popular landmark spot of chennai.

Name: Vedas
Title: Chennai Central
Review: If I  include a railway station in must to visit spots list of a place then would it be exaggeration.?? Certainly not, as MGR Chennai Central is worth spending  some time. The cleanliness  and hygiene they maintain here is worth praising including other basic facilities.

Name: Abhijit
Title: Livable AC dorms at MAS railway station
Review: The Retiring rooms/Dormitories at Chennai Central Railway station are well maintained with proper toilets and cleanliness well maintained. AC cooling is good with extra fans as well. Nice place to spend a night or so instead of spending heavily on the near by hotels which doesn't really justify the cost which they charge us.Highly recommend the AC dormitory!!!

Name: Siddhartha
Title: Nice station
Review: One of the oldest busiest and important railway station in Southern railway. This station is well connected with metro station. Station area is very clean. This station is well connected with all over India.

Name: Azooz
Title: Marina beach chennai
Review: Marina beach and Mahabalipuram‚ù§Ô∏è taj hotel is wonderful and lical sightseeng us cheaper autorikdhaw available evrywhere

Name: Tester Bugcrowd
Title: Awesome
Review: Really loved this place and able to connect with people quickly over the crowd in the covid situation.

Name: varghese
Title: {{dump(app)}}
Review: Pwoli saanam, ugran ahn eh stalam onnum parayan ila,must visit, if you are coming by train you will regret not visiting here.

Name: Drone Destinations & Holidays (DDH)
Title: MGR Chennai Central Railway Station
Review: Chennai Railway station is one of the busiest railway station in India and largest in south India. Previously the name was Madras Central and after renamed the city Madras to Chennai it also became Chennai central.

Name: Anand M
Title: Spick and span
Review: Chennai Central Railway station is an extremely clean, well ventilated station. Constant cleaning by the energetic staff is admirable. Lots of conveniently placed segregated trash bins. Easily available clean drinking water. No need to buy bottled water. Food stalls sell a variety of affordable food. The Retiring Rooms are well kept too.

Name: Rohini
Title: Train yatra
Review: Railway station and train needs more upgradation . No cleanliness dirty smell . Paying soo much of money no decent seat u get . Torn dirty seats .stinking wash room . Dirty fan, window. All over stinking .

Name: PitoyAmpil1941
Title: a GREAT  place to get your bearings
Review: Central Bus n train station is the transportation center to go almost anywhere in Chennai..... whether the suburbs at Adyar, the East Coast Road n Parry's .....

Name: Ddharaniikota
Title: Still Stinky
Review: The station supposed to be one of the busiest in India and one of the oldest, but the facilities and the maintenance has gone down tremendously - especially with the stink (may be due to freight - seafood) they should separate the freight zone from the passenger zone and try and make it more modern with more space too!!!

Name: ceenu1969
Title: Bus service at Chennai centeal
Review: People can board city bus starting from 6am till 11pm its cheap transport goes to different localities. Uf u have more luggage u need to buy luggage ticket

Name: Beryl
Title: Horrible Restrooms
Review: The restrooms are horrible at the station especially the western. Even the restrooms inside the trains are bad. Please do something. They are also getting money for using the restrooms but it's just waste.

Name: Jagan travels
Title: Trip
Review: Good and they maintain safety speed and friendly nature with the driver and easy to identify the bus location

Name: AURELIO L
Title: go to see it
Review: it s a nice example of victorian,colonial building,i think  it s nice to go to see it,even if  you don t go inside but take a look from outside

Name: 1777NT
Title: Another good example of the wonderful old railway stations in India
Review: Relatively clean & tidy inside, modern metro & commuter services as well as long distance expresses (meaning possibly 60kph) and with a good taxi system running from it.

Name: Explore13639
Title: Chennai Central madness
Review: Chaotic efficiency with throngs of people and entertaining signage. Such as:  "Cum assistance" on official booth in station area.

Name: Ivin David
Title: My journey to Chennai (Madras)
Review: When i last visited chennai it was quite awful but recently it's been so developed that it became a tourist attraction for some. The progression in metro has been tremendous.

Name: KARTHIKb87
Title: Chennai  railway terminal.
Review: Chennai Central is main railway terminal and one of the most important landmark in chennai. Is built in combination of  Romanesque structure and Gothic revival style on 1873 during British rule. Is painted in red and white and had clock tower in main building. It started with 4 platform and at present with 17 platforms. Its main railway terminal for all trains out of chennai except to south. Recently is named as "Puratchi Thalaivar Dr. M.G. Ramachandran Central Railway Station" on memory of Late MGR

Name: Kishore
Title: Chennai The Best City Always
Review: Transportation is very important in all the places and one of the best place is chennai central railway station to reach almost to other places and also there are trains available often. Both local and long distance trains are present at one place. Best Place!!

Name: Prem Kumar
Title: A old monumental station
Review: Chennai central railway station is now named a Dr.Puratchi thailvar M.G.R central railway station was one of the oldest and biggest railway station in the southern indian railway system.The station has around total over 10 platforms which was operational. The station was too big and the facilites here are ok. The station is one the dirtiest on the gauges but the platforms are kept clean. The station has restroom and waiting rooms which was improving every year. Food options the station was equipped with all the best hotels from chennai like saravana bhavan,A2B etc.

Name: Shail Singh
Title: Busiest Railway Station
Review: It has a rich legacy of colonial architecture. The railway station was built between 1868-72 in central Madras on the edge of George Town. It is a two-storey arcaded Gothic building with a clock tower and was designed by George Hardinge. Well maintained, clean and tidy railway station with lot of LED display.

Review: the most busiest point of the chennai it's the most oldest rail station, now the govt changed the station name even i don't what is the main reason behind

Name: Muzaffar A
Title: A Monumental Station unkempt
Review: This a very old Railway station which has a great history and millions of people transit from here to different destinations of India. Once you enter into the station platforms area, all the elation of having visited the monumental structure vanes on you due to the stinking smells around. It is agreed that sweepers are sweeping the premises 24x7 but the authorities have to put additional efforts to bring the station to international standards.

Name: mahbub n
Title: The majestic railway station
Review: Largest and first  railway station of South India in Gothic Revival style. It was builted in 1873. Central clock tower giving it a majestic look. Station is clean and well maintained.

Name: Dr Javed Rasheed
Title: The biggest railway station in south India
Review: Central Station  is the main railway terminus in the City of Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India. It is the busiest railway station in South India and one of the most important hubs in the country with the distinction of having the longest name among all stations on the Indian Railways. It is connected to Moore Market Complex railway station, Chennai Central metro station, Chennai Park railway station, Park Town railway station and is 2 km from Chennai Egmore railway station. The terminus connects the city to northern India, including Kolkata, Mumbai and New Delhi, as well as to Bengaluru, Hyderabad, Coimbatore and parts of Kerala.Opened in 1873 during the British regime it has a typical British type of architecture as it reminds you of Victoria Station in London ( I visited this place for the first time in 1986 ) and reminded me so much of central station or it should be the other way around ! I also do have fond memories of this place as I studied in Madras Medical College from 1975 to 1980 and then stated in Men‚Äôs House Surgeons Quarters which were situated across the road and one could hear the announcement of all the trains coming and going ! That was in 1981 and the house surgeons quarters have been demolished now to renovate the Government General Hospital. I also remember that we used to take the subway and go to the canteen situated on the first floor of the railway station occasionally to have supper there ! A lot of attention is needed as far as maintenance and cleanliness is concerned as   It‚Äôs very crowded and congested and little modernisation will help go a long way as it‚Äôs a pleasure to visit the railway stations in Europe !Dr.Javed Rasheed

Name: Anusuya D
Title: Linking to other places
Review: It is a very linking place to reach other cities, even states. Always crowded and with 10 to 11 platforms. Hence, we have to note inw which platform train will come, in the showing board

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: It is the biggest railwaystation in South India
Review: Chennai Railway station is one of the biggest railway stations among the stations in South India.you find trains to any place from here round the clock. Sarvana Bhavan restraunt is also vaialable in the station itself. The food is tasty but very expensive. You still feel like eating eventhough you spent lot of money on food already you don't feel stomuch full. that's the only draw back.other than that every thing is perfect.There are fruit Railway canteens, prepqid taxi counter in front of the station itself.if you are new to Chennai its always the best option to book a cab or auto from here. So that you can hire a vehicle for a genuine fare..

Name: Rajeev Kumar
Title: Beautiful Station in Southern Railway
Review: I am very happy during Chennai visited. Marina beach, tirupati temple and many more places visit. well knowledge get from TripAdvisor this places.

Name: srrrr
Title: Hve to improve cleanliness
Review: One of the biggest railway junction in Tamil Nadu...most of the trains to North India starts here...lot of shops available...only problem is cleanliness...it's also in hands of public...not only government responsible for cleanliness... public have to maintain it properly...lot of bus service to connect whole Chennai is available in front gate of railway station....

Name: Fritz Peltonen
Title: Busy place
Review: Took a train to Bangalore.  The terminal was extremely busy and I suggest you give yourself a extra hour.  Trains are fine and was nice to not to deal with traffic.

Name: Shwetha
Title: Nice and big railway station
Review: Very nice and big railways station...all the trains leave to other states leave and come at this point in Chennai . It has many platforms and digital boards at places which gives correct information about the time and platform of the trains . Many shops are there for eatables . It also have a Higgins and Botham ouylet if you wish to buy novels or other books .

Name: The Indian Hobo
Title: One of the Best Railway Station in india
Review: Chennai Central Railway Station which connects all parts of india. Its a one of the oldest Railway Station built by Britishers. It has all world class restaurant in this premises.

Name: Gopinath R
Title: Visit to Chennai
Review: We travelled from Bengaluru to Chennai through Shatabdi super fast train and back to Mysuru in the same train. It is really great journey. The Chennai Railway Station is formerly known as Madras Central( year1873) is a very old Station and has many shops and amenities, having 17 platforms. Here passengers need not have to cross any lanes to board trains, all platforms ends on the same line side by side. Bus connectivity to entire city is available in front of the Station.

Name: Nagarjuna
Title: CHENNAI flower market
Review: 5star rating.Variety of flowers.GarlandsClay ganeshasFruitsFood joints which are reasonably priced and serve tasty mini lunch etc.Transport facilities like buses.GreatOnly thing that is worrying is lot of ground. While purchasing one has to check and re check pocket so that it's not pick pocketed.And one more problem is one should know Tamil for bargaining.

Name: Basudev Dutta
Title: Best among otherd
Review: Chennai central railway station is best among other due to all facilities under one roof. Travellers are able to be confidence under chennai central railway station to travel to their destination. Law and order is very strict.

Name: Valavanur Natar... K
Title: A detailed write up on origin history and its present status of Chennai Central Railway station
Review: A detailed write up on origin ,history and growth of The Chennai Central station The century-old Chennai Central Railway Station was designed by architect George Harding in 12th-century¬† Romanesque architecture. It  is indeed one of the most prominent landmarks of Chennai that serves as the main gateway by Rail  to the  rest of the country along with Egmore Railway  station 2 kms away .These two stations are well connected by suburban and Road connectivity .The Buchingham canal built by the British to ferry goods by waterway upto Nellore in Andhrapradesh  lies to the west of this Station . The  suburban railways that includes MRTS and Metro has its main hub near  this central station .The Sub terrenian metro station and muti layered shopping plaza now under consruction will becomr one of Asia's largest .The headquarters¬†of the¬†Southern Railway¬†and the corporation ¬†Ripon Building.built during the¬†British Raj are to the east and west of this station respectively .To the south is the main General hospital .and Madras Medical college .To its credit of long history it has been renamed twice, from¬†Madras Central¬†to¬†Chennai Central¬†in 1996, in line with change if its city's name from. Madras to¬†Chennai, and then later to to¬†Puratchi Thalaivar Dr. M.G. Ramachandran Central Railway Station¬†in 2019, after the late¬†Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu¬†M. G. Ramachandran..Perhaps this name must be the station in indian network which has  the  longest name now .About 6 lakh  passengers utilise  this  terminus each  day, making it the busiest railway station in¬†South India togather with¬†Chennai Egmore.¬†Although the cleanliness is never a high point of Indian railways, Chennai central has the distinction of being one of the cleanest scoring over 180 points Out of 300 points bench mark .It boasts of 17 Platforms of which 12 is for long distance, & 5 for suburban commute  and  has 30 tracks for interchanging . Pallavan metro bus service connects this station by road to all parts of the city Historically speaking  when the Madras Railway Company began to network¬† South India¬†in 1856 the first station to be built was not this station but one at¬†Royapuram,(Now defunct) and it remained the main station at that time.With expansion of the Madras Railways network  this Madras Central station  came into being in 1873 , in  the open grounds that had once been called¬†John Pereira's Gardens, belonging to Joao Pereira de Faria  a¬†Portuguese¬†merchant  who had  settled in Madras in 1660.In 1907, Madras Central was made the Madras Railway Company's main station and  gained prominence after  Royapuram station ceased to be  a terminus for Madras .The Madras and Southern Mahratta Railway Company was formed in 1908 and took over the Central station from the Madras Railway Company.The station's importance  grew  after the  the headquarters of the¬†Madras and  Southern Mahratta Railway¬†moved to the adjacent building  ans soon came to be  known as the¬†Southern Railway in 1922The year 1980s saw further expansion of central station that saw the annexing of  the erstwhile Moore market complex that was devastated in a fire .The Railways built a 13-storied complex to house the suburban terminus and railway reservation counter. With open space in front  becoming  a car park..In 1996, after  the station became known as Chennai Central  and increased passenger capacity compelled  further extension to  the main building and a new building was added   in 1998 with on the western side with a similar architecture to the original. After this duplication of the main building, the stations 12 platforms became 17 platforms .The multi-storeyed¬†Moore Market Complex¬†then became  a dedicated terminus with three separate platforms for the¬†Chennai Suburban Railway system.In the 1990s, when the IRCTC was formed, shopping stalls and  food plazas were set up.In 2005, the buildings were painted a light brown colour, but Railways bowed down to  public demand through  campaigns and also to retain the old nostalgic charm it was  repainted back  in their original brick-red color.To its credit it became the first  station  in India to be placed on the cyber mapand on 26 September 2014, Chennai Central got  free Wi-Fi connectivity. The renovated station now  boasts of bookshops,  restaurants, accommodation facilities, Internet browsing centres, and a shopping mall. And an inadequate waiting hall that can hold  about just  1,000 people.But to be frank even though it has a chequred history and undergone so many addition and changes its still a far cry from any internation standardsFor railway station for it  lacks several facilities such as drinking water, medical & prominent ¬†display boards and above all cleanliness .There are passenger operated enquiry terminals and seven touch-screen PNR status machines in the station.The station has three¬†split-flap timing boards, electronic display boards and Plasma TVs that mention train timings and platform number.A passenger information center in the station has been upgraded with "Spot your Train" live train display facility, information kiosks and passenger digital assistance booths.The terminus, however, has only 10 toilets, which is grossly  inadequate for over 4  lakh passenger movement at any point of time .Four-seater battery operated vehicles available to cater to the needs of the elderly and the physically impaired is grossly inadequate for many comevto the general hospital acroos the road by rail forctreatmentvfrom all parts the country . It is a pain to get one easily .On 15 April 2013, a new emergency medical care centre was opened thanks to PIL and intervention by judiciary . The centre now  has three beds, two doctors on duty and another on standby, four nurses, a paramedic team, and a round-the-clock ambulance. The centre is equipped with oxygen cylinders, an ECG, a defibrillator and resuscitation equipment. The terminus is also the first railway station in the country to have facilities of an ambulance.The station has parking facilities for more than 1,000 two-wheelers and  1,000 cars .But The station still faces parking problems and with on going metro Rail work chaos is an understatement .Once the Metro works with underground plazas are completed the Chennai Central station atleast on the outside I hope , will take back its pride of place in chennai city scape with its dominating clock on the central Red tower .

Title: The Heart of Chennai
Review: In this big railway stations and its 15 platforms, millions of people comes daily across from the country.

Name: VijayTawker
Title: One of the best Railway stations in South India
Review: Even though this is almost always crowded, there are quite a good number of chairs for sitting. There is Emergency Hospital access; quite a good number of snacks and food counters; reasonably clean most of the time. Free WiFi.

Name: Sajjad
Title: Chennai Central the center of South India
Review: Me & my two friends started for chennai central railway station from Katpadi railway station, Vellore in order to visit Marina beach which is situated in Chennai.The  station has two terminal,one is for short distant places and another for long distant destinations.The entire complex has 17 platforms to handle long distance trains with 5 platforms exclusively for suburban trains.From opposite of railway station there are bus services which takes tourist directly to Marina beach.And very close to the station there is a suburban railway station which connects chennai central railway station with chennai airport.The place is very secured so tourist can room around freely.

Title: Good railway station

Title: Usual station for taking long distance train

Name: Sudhanshu Rajvanshi
Title: Chennai central railway station
Review: It is hot, humid, smelly, clean but not clean enough. Overall depressing. Retiring rooms are horrible and best avoided. No eating place inside the station however many kiosks are there that sell railway station type snacks. Outside the station there are a few good restaurants. Not pleasant to stay for more than half an hour or so.

Name: Sri
Title: Chennai Central railway station
Review: One of the oldest stations in India, maintained very well.We have so many facilities,foods are easily available and very cheap. Battery operated vehicles are there.

Name: Zinia F
Title: Functional and good service
Review: Tamilians can take a lot of pride in how they run their state, and railstation is no exception.  Effective and fast service for tickets arross the nation.However if you're looking to buy internatinal ticket that is Kolkata-Dhaka, that is only possible from Kolkata as they don't have the functionality set in their system yet.So beware

Name: mikhailv801
Title: Very good service
Review: Thank you very much for your service! But a lit bit crowded place! I will recommend to my friends to use their service

Name: Ananth 727499
Title: Unavoidable historic Landmark of Chennai..
Review: This is one of the much notable landmark of Chennai.. The front face of the building itself depicts the face of Chennai... Chennai central Railway Station has around 10 platforms.. Platform 1 & 2 has wide paths and a sweet Stall.. Coffee shop and food items are. Also available (of course, the cost of the food item is very high) ..Platform 2A 3 to 8 are next. In this way out you could see many stalls with food items, snacks, biscuits, tea coffee and Water bottles.. There is also an Aavin milk parlour.. Platform 9 & 10 are next.. You could see a very wiiiiiiide space for seating of passengers who were waiting for their train..Display board is always functioning with repeated continous announcement of arrival and departure of trains.. A book stall with all books and newspapers is there.. A water refilling booth is also there..  You could fill Your empty water bottles by paying very marginal cost.. An A/C waiting room is also present. You could stay there by paying 35 rupees for the first hour and then 25 rupees for the next coming hours.. 24 hours transport facility both by train and also to go Inside Chennai city is available for all the passengers..

Title: Chennai Central
Review: Chennai Central railway station is the main railway station of Chennai City. From here numerous number of trains leave for different cities in India. Local Subarban trains also leave from this Station.

Title: The main railway station
Review: This is the main railway station of the city and also the important one in the state.the railways  use the place as the connecting hub of the state with various states.

The stately entrance built at the time of opening, is still retained  with slight modifications. The erstwhile charm is still being retained

Title: Memorable Railway Station
Review: Entry point to chennai I would say. One of the very busy railway station in india. Once you land here, you can find people with inspiring culture

Name: uk555
Title: Great Exterior Facade, Unremarkable Interiors
Review: Okay, the building looks great from the outside. Once you are inside the Railway station, no remarkable eateries or stores or anything significant to watch or learn. If you want to watch the hustle and bustle of life in India, you could head inside. Otherwise, do not expect any railway history or murals or any interesting installations. For the population it handles, a decent job is made in trying to keep the place neat, but public needs to co-operate.

Name: TrailBlazer581787
Title: An experience

Review: Excellent very good.chennai excellent is very beautiful city chennai in Tamil nadu an there are place

Title: Chennai Central
Review: The Chennai Central Railway Station is the main station in Chennai. The building is quiet old and has a characteristic red colour which makes it a prominent landmark of the city.

Name: Soul and Fuel
Title: An iconic railway station
Review: The Chennai Central Railway station is an Iconic Railway station which provides travel option to almost every place. It is of great importance. The station has over 10 platforms. Neatly maintained

Name: Georgio Valentino Rayala
Title: Good Station but Very Hot and Humid
Review: I visited this station along with a friend to catch a train to Vijayawada. It is very old and constructed by British so it has a beautiful architecture with an amazing clock tower. My train was late and the station was so hot and humid that we were sweating a lot. Luckily the station contained Air Conditioned waiting hall where you can sit inside by paying their charge and showing your ticket. There are multiple outlets inside the station selling soft drinks, snacks, juices, magazines, books etc.

Name: anil k
Title: Nice station with all amenities
Review: The station supports all the basic amenities of the passengers. The resort is well connected to several Indian cities. Some of the main routes include the places of Vijayawada Jn, New Delhi and Howrah Jn. There are 3 weekly trains from Vijayawada Jn to Chennai, 2 weekly trains from New Delhi to Chennai and 4 weekly trains from Howrah Jn to Chennai.It is connected to the Moore Market Complex station, Central and Chennai Park subway stations. It is adjacent to Chennai Egmore Station. The center of Chennai connects the city with all the cities of northern India, including Kolkata, Mumbai and New Delhi.

Name: Pramod Agrawal
Title: Nicely mauntrained
Review: It is a terminal point, hence no foot over bridge to go to other platforms. All platforms are connected at the main station end towards waiting area/exit/entry points etc.

Name: Deepak C
Title: Beautiful heritage structure
Review: Its a beautiful heritage structure which houses the main railway station of Chennai. Its quite big and have all the facility. Needs some improvement in cleanliness and food option on platfroms.

Name: HappySheep
Title: Old and new
Review: Old historical building, quite nice with clocktower, and where all the trains in the region depart from

Name: Amarnath P
Title: Historical Building
Review: This is located next to Rippon building and highly crowded every time as it is the main hub for connecting the state. The cleanliness still needs to better, but it has improved quite a lot than before.

Name: Ramya S
Title: Crowd place
Review: Chennai Central is the prime transportation hub of the City. This is a heritage station that is soaked in history.

Name: babuvis51
Title: Iconic Chennai central railway station
Review: One of the most crowded places bustling with people throughout the day and night is Central station, Chennai. Trains bound to the western and northern parts of Tamil nadu depart from this station. Trains bound to the south of Chennai depart from Egmore station, which is three kms from the central station. Chennai is well connected by trains to all important cities of our country. Central station has eleven long platforms and a short one called 2A between  platforms 2 and  3. Trains with limited bogies such as Shatabthi express depart from 2A. The station has food stalls, book shops, waiting halls, rest rooms etc. Restaurants are also inside. Enquiry counter, passenger assistance booths are also situated.  Since this station is placed between North Chennai and South Chennai reaching any part of the city by bus, electric trains is very convenient.   Autos and taxis are available at prepaid counters. It  is advisable to avail the service of the prepaid counters to avoid bargaining with others who may fleece the passengers. Taxis and autos through mobile apps such as Uber, Ola etc will be a good option. Passengers are advised to be careful with their luggage, valuables as it is possible in such crowded places to lose them. Also it is advisable not to engage unauthorised porters and touts. Enjoy the stay at Chennai and visit nice tourist attractions.

Name: FrequentFlier826007
Title: good
Review: very good railways station of tamil nadu . i visited here last month , with my some teenager friends ..

Name: Priya M
Title: Huge complex
Review: Huge complex and very busy place for commuters catching long distance trains. There is an AC payable waiting hall available.

Name: shivaraikod
Title: Changed a lot
Review: Last time when I had been to Chennai , i got down here and the station was a bit tidy but things have changed a lot since then and station's cleanliness has reached altogether a different level.

Name: Suvi85
Title: Spacious Railway Station
Review: This railway station is very spacious. They arranged tracks such that no climbing of bridge is required just flat walk. We can get cabs just outside railway station left side.

Name: nageswararao g
Title: Okay Station
Review: its an okay station situated in a crowded area. Outside the station its always packed with vehicles. Station is not that clean, but better than other stations. It has AC waiting hall which we can use for a fee

Name: Ruth M
Title: Ancient & Beautiful
Review: The Chennai Central Railway Station is very crowded and very busy every moment of the day. This is one of the main and best option for locals and foreign tourists to travel comfortably and enjoy the beautiful tourits sopts in India.

Name: Puneetkumar Pattar
Title: Although old, still one of well managed railway stations
Review: I've been to the Chennai railway station, probably a hundred times, and of the view that this one of the well managed stations in India. Interestingly, this is a station where all the incoming trains go back in the same direction, as there is only the sea on the other direction.So, you'll note that moving across platforms is very easy unlike other stations where you need to take an overbridge or an underbridge. Station is often kept relatively clean but still a great deal of improvement is required. It is also adjacent to the local train station. There can be better restaurants and food joints.

Name: Anusuya D
Title: Centre to travel
Review: Very crowded place. To catch the train you have to go half an hour early. I have travelled along with my son. He saw all the train standing in the track and enjoyed more

Name: Michael Anbumani
Title: Historical Building
Review: The Chennai Central Railway Station sits tall as historical & a heritage building built during the British Colonial time. It is a very popular station for local and foreign visitors. A must see tourists attraction.

Name: j_yuvan
Title: Good show by Chennai Central Station
Review: Finding the place spic and span. A significant improvement from the past. Can do better. The food court has been closed. Why not reopen it?

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Heritage Place
Review: Chennai Central Railway Station is a fine example of British architecture and comes under heritage category. There is a constant traffic of outstation railways.Many food stalls and restaurants are there to serve the passengers.Very crowded and busy place.

Name: Alwardurai
Title: Friends visit
Review: One of the busiest place where we can see lakhs of people, including young girls and boys. Moor market is situated near central railway station where you can get all book and rare things

Name: siva200
Title: Biggest and Busiest Railway station
Review: Biggest and Busiest Railway station in India.Free wifi being offered is a welcome move.Need to maintain it so clean as Jodhpur and Jaipur are topping the charts.Its difficult to maintain it with such crowds coming in and out everyday but it needs to cleaned in the mornings and evenings.Railway Lounges needs to be set up for the passengers so that they don't sleep on platforms and near the display boards.

Name: nytikjoshi
Title: Ok so it is not bad but you to accept it is a British Raj Heritage station what more to say
Review: Now with that said it is still a good functional station, with decent directions and fairly good connection to the rest of the country. Please factor two different time frames to reach your seat, one is the huge traffic build up to reach the station, second is the distance to your coach for the 1st easily keep an extra 1.5 hrs and for the latter keep atleast 45 mts to reach you seat.Avoid buying any food from the ubranded platform vendors and second still be extra safe and carry a lock and chain to tie your luggage no matter what others think of you.Enjoy your journey after about 1 hour once the train leaves the station till then keep your eyes and if possible nose closed:) as you may have to go through the ugliest sights of people still potting near the tracks. Things have changes nonetheless, today they are much better, also if you are calling an uber or ola tell them that you are standing near the CANARA bank atm and they can easily locate you. avoid the touts and the freelance taxis as they still having the fleecing mentality .

Name: Mudit Sharma
Title: Visit
Review: Thyagaraya Nagar, commonly known as T. Nagar, and historically known as East Mambalam, is a very affluent commercial and residential neighbourhood in Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India. The stretch between Duraiswamy Road and T. Nagar Bus Stand has some of the costliest real estates in Chennai. It was constructed between 1923-1925 by the Madras Presidency government of the Raja of Panagal as a part of town planning activities initiated according to the Madras Town Planning Act of 1920. The town was named after P. Thyagaraya Chetty. The streets, parks and localities in the new neighbourhood were named after important officials in the provincial government.T. Nagar is now considered the largest shopping district in India by revenue. It is known for its plethora of saree and jewellery retailers, including Pothys, Nalli Silks and Saravana Stores. The neighbourhood is served by Mambalam railway station of the Chennai Suburban Railway Network. T. Nagar is considered one of the city's major central business districts, the other being Parry's Corner, the centre of the city. Pondy Bazaar serves as a satellite commercial hub for T. Nagar, located around the Thyagaraya Road.

Name: shankarj6
Title: Shopping area
Review: It is shopping area and is very crowded. Never seen somany people in one area. It was close to the hotel ( Accord Metropolian ) where I stayed.

Name: Sud D
Title: Shopping
Review: Nice place to shop if you are looking for sarees and other traditional wear. Large selection of stores and clothes.

Name: Ananth 727499
Title: Crowded always..
Review: This place is always filled with people and you could get almost all types of things in this area, if you are ready to visit all the shops ..Prices for the things are varied.. You could get costly items and also things for a cheaper rate..You should be very patient to come out of this place..Almost all the main shops are in this area..Do visit this area with your wallet or card and get what you need at a better cost ..

Name: Hooray H
Title: Best shopping street in India
Review: A proper old fashioned shopping street rather than an awful Air conditioned Mall!So many curious shops & very organised & clean.Must see.

Name: Ambrish L
Title: Too Crowded but pocket friendly
Review: You get almost everything , You just need the will to venture into this crowded street. It's definitely pocket friendly. I would prefer to go to other locations and buy these items rather than getting stuck in this crowd.

Name: Rohini
Title: Shopping street
Review: You will find things from small price range to big range . Clothes range has to be checked. They will not have good condition material but if you look into design it's great . You can find most of it.street food are tasty. Area back of this near to railway station you can find fresh vegetable marketOn best prices.

Name: AjitV
Title: Shopping freak
Review: If you need A-Z of anything for your family, just hit Ranganathan Street....  Saravana stores, Ratna Stores, Jayachandran textiles....from jewellery to household to durables to daily needs... you have it all...Street vendors on the road selling day to day requirements, fruit juices to tea, coffee... Have a day to spare to visit all these outlets... More than one million people travel in and out of this Street everyday...  Festive times... The crowd will carry you through the street for a km and drop you to the end... So better watch your stuff you carry.... Shop till you drop...at the only Street.... Ranganathan Street....!!!

Name: Deadman17
Title: Crowded Place to buy whatever you want
Review: T Nagar is the heart of the city, like what Dadar is to Mumbai. One can roam for hours through the narrow streets and find so many shops selling such beautiful items that one will think of buying them all. One needs to bargain hard but the quality of the products is good.

Name: Siva
Title: Busy and crowded
Review: I went during noon  time.vwry crowded area, no safety ,very hard to walk on the road. Plenty shops are there but not advisable do purchase there

Name: Anubhab Arko Dey
Title: Great Place To Shop
Review: We went to shop few things. which included Tamil Traditional clothes,  visited a large store Pothys,  Which housed every thing we  sought. days later I wanted to backpack and went to neighbouring store called Saravana.Both the places,  were extremely cheap,  choice was wide and Staff behaviour was very good.

Name: Ramesh babu D
Title: TNagar
Review: In Chennai, Tamil Nadu is one of the beautiful city T. Nagar is best way to purchase a shopping.....

Name: Suma S
Title: Budget shopping
Review: Items available in the streets are not of good quality where bargaining to be done. If we don't know the language they may cheat us.  Lot of shops are there.

Name: Mrudula
Title: Retail shops lined up
Review: This is the most crowded place and near in chennai where it is known for shopping and all retail shops are lined up with reasonable prices

Name: Immanuel R
Title: Shopping shopping
Review: Best place in Chennai for shopping good bargains all the needs you can get it here.lot of street shops.

Name: Ettienne R
Title: GREAT SHOPPING
Review: A huge variety of chain- or private stores. Saravana or Pothys definitely worth a visit. The market under the bridge is a hive of typical indian activity

Name: tsk0101
Title: A must visit street in Chennai
Review: Probably the busiest place in Chennai with crowds thronging all the shops located in this street. Just outside Mambalam railway station, it is one of the busiest streets in Chennai.

Name: satheesh
Title: Poor Infrastructure
Review: With time T nagar has become the go-to for  shopping and a must visit if you're in Chennai . But the authorities and the city planners doesn't heed to problems of the public.Roadside gawkers occupy most of the road and the traffic is hell bent to spoil your mood. If you visit the area on a rainy day , you'll be forced to think that it will be your last

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: Must try shoping in this street
Review: Though it's a bit over crowded shopping in Ranganathan Street reminds me of 2010 days again when we stayed in Chennai. Streets are so crowded. Felt little suffocation but shopping experience was good. Once you visit this place you can complete the shopping for entire family üë™ Have a nice shopping experience.

Name: #amosamiyanayeküéß
Title: Christmas Shopping
Review: lots of stores... variety of new collection as well as very affordable prices saravana stores pothys etc are there if you are not satisfied to have road side display

Name: Abhishek Abrol
Title: Good Place to visit for Shopping
Review: It is the busiest place in Chennai. You will get almost everything in this area. And even many restaurants are there. Even you can bargain in the shops as well.

Name: lakshmimenon
Title: A visit to Ranganathan Street
Review: Whenever I get a chance to visit T.Nahar,my family and I do not fail to visit Ranganathan Strre.Its a crowded place always and to get in and out is a hectic  job.There is nothing that yu dont get there,from A to Z,every single thing is available.And for the kids it's a treat,because you get the cone Icecream,juice,and what not.For young stylish girls yu get trinkets that suits your pocket.If you go further down,you reach the Mambalam station where yu can pick and choose your vegetables,lovely greens,fresh ones,and flowers of all.kinds,especially during the jasmine season ,you can grab and take it with a minimum cost.For Gold jewellery,you have Kerala jewellers,so it's a place both for the young and the old,the modern and the traditional ones.

Name: psp
Title: wide range of shops
Review: al time busiest place in chennai... u can purchase everything in this area... u hve to bargain in roadside shops for better price...

Name: Indiatravel
Title: Eye popping
Review: This place is a blast. You need a week to take it all in. Even in an hour you will love it and want more. Food, drink, shopping,  color, Indian LIFE!

Name: Anand
Title: Cramped and soulful!
Review: Possibly the most crowded place on earth! We really got some good quality products across a large shopping list at good prices and the colors and smells and of course, the warmth of the people touches the soul. And the thing which got to me was that there were so many people jostling together in such a cramped place. The thing which I did not appreciate was that there was garbage piled up too in the middle of the road and nobody seemed to mind. I do think the place needs a practical transformation while keeping its soul intact since it is crowded beyond what most humans should experience and should live with else it will deteriorate and most well-heeled travellers will simply avoid it and that will not be good for the city.

Name: buddy_2564
Title: A must for shopping
Review: Lots of varities available if you are like me. Cheap momentos and really good quality clothes available in several stores around the area.

Name: Kavita Vinod
Title: Shop till you drop!
Review: T Nagar is an ideal place for people who want to shop, shop and only shop!. It‚Äôs a very old street famous for popular gold brands, big showrooms dedicated to sarees and suits. One can also find restaurants, juice shops, tea/coffee and snack shops there. On both sides of the street, one can find local shops and famous shops heavily crowded with people. One can find jewelry of all kinds there. Be it diamonds, real gold, precious stones, semi-precious, silver, temple jewelry, and the same copies available in artificial jewelry. Famous 1 gram gold jewelry shops are available in plenty there. Pothies and Nalis are famous saree brand There. They have big showrooms having separate section price-wise, One can easily get excellent variety in all price ranges.  be it sarees or salwar suits. They not only have south variety but others as well. One can comfortably shop there. It is also a good place to shop for famous madras Steel. Many shops are selling good stainless steel utensils catering to the needs of your kitchen,Auto/Cab charges are very high there. Its always better to negotiate.I thoroughly enjoyed my visit to T Nagar and would love to come again :).

Name: Suruchi J
Title: Crowded
Review: Very crowded market but you find all sort of shops ,shopping is fun ,go and shop to your heart's content here

Name: Simis29
Title: Lot of shopping in mind
Review: Visited T Nagar during my short stay in Chennai..market not to be missed by gold n south silk lovers..other things also available..heard that visiting in evening hours is beautiful cos of lights..

Name: Gayathri Kumar
Title: Can try
Review: This is one of the most busy street in Chennai any time there will be people coming and going. And s it's one stop shop type area.though they vessels, gold, bags, footwear shops they are familiar for clothing and accessories .you can find something in all range but reliability totally depends on the price you put(sometimes you can be luckyüòâ). The ambiance is totally nasty and disgusting during rainy times. Instead of this we can consider pondybazar if you are not a big  fan of filthy ambiance and crowd.

Name: Othman S
Title: Old Market
Review: There is nothing to do there so much . Most of the shops are likely similar to others in terms of looking, prices, products.

Name: satheesh
Title: The Holy grail of shopping
Review: T nagaland has captivated the crowds from near and afar for more than a score . It is always buzzing with activity . But it definitely need some help from the authorities to ease up space and congestion . Hope it would be a reality soon

Name: Michael Anbumani
Title: Popular
Review: The T Nagar is a very popular place for shopping & purchasing anything you want for moderate price. It;s like a Broadway shopping areas. Mostly crowed with foreigners and tourists besides the normal local crowds. It's worth the price.

Name: psp
Title: good collections
Review: very busiest shopping place in chennai... no one would miss this place for shopping who visits chennai...everything is available here from rs.5 to lakhs...have to bargain in roadside shops...it is a must visit place in chennai...

Name: Passport648127
Title: Ranganathan StreetA tragic example on How to   kill a quiet residential area.
Review: This is a bustling , crowded , noisy , dusty retail " bazaar " , very near Mambalam Railway station and the Bus terminus.Scores/ hundreds of small shops/ pedlars  selling a big span of household goods, garments , fancy items , bangles , cosmetic jewellery, flowers , tea ,coffee , samosas,all varieties of edibles some  of them made  on the street itself,,You also have a few well stocked book shops which sell text books ( a rarity) And  , a few "super markets" which sell many things--vessels , furniture , steel almyrahs , food , gold jewellery , ready made garments , cloth all "under one roof "..rich onesFocus ; the middle class. ; thousands visit them , everyday, multifold on festival .days.they certainly buy a lot of things ,along with great bargainng.AND , the street is also a great haven for  a very large number of boys and girls-for jobs ( mostly Sales ) , living , learning the  art of dealing with people , of selling.and, edgewise find love , marriages,A great picture by the name of the street has been shot on their desires , ambitions, drift.No great respect here on  on safety ; an unforgettable day when a fire engulfed a :'mall' , the fire engines found it difficult to even enter the street a few,boys who were in a higher floor , with locked shutters , screaming for help which never came. It is true that it serves a commercial need--for the sellers and the vast multitude of buyers from suburbs..; a very high turnover.BUT, this WAS a great habitat ,not many years ago , of people who moved into T..Nagar from crowded areas into small but, nice independent houses, gardens , all leading a gentile cheerful life , with good school , temples , doctors in the locality ,with dreams of growing up in their own houses , continuity in life. May be this lasted for one generation. Quickly , thereafter , all houses were bought out- all replaced by trade ,greed , power.Where did the old owners go ? A change that should not have happened. There should have been well marked and obeyed zoning laws.This street has now got replicated in many areas.Well ,  you should visit Ranganathan street , for  the many household things you may need ( or not ), all in one locale ; AND , also to get amazed at the crowd that jostles here  its, entreprenuership, . activity, lives of a variety of people.Go armed with your camera , with a well guarded purse. ( the street activities include dashing men / women who pick pockets , snatch chains and make a good living. Do not look around for Restrooms , places to just sit and relax.They aren't just  there.S.SUNDAR

Name: Shankar N
Title: Must walk through this chaos
Review: This place is full of people. chaotic crowd, bumping on you, stamping your feet, crushing you in might n weight.  You could not cramp more people within one square meter as it is done here.Actually a place that no one would like to go.  But, against all odds, one must visit this place, atleast once.  You can see hundreds of street side sellers, shouting on top of their voice to attract the customers.  You can find anything and everything here.  Lots of people with lots of hope of find customers in the 1000s that take a walk in that street.  Once u r done with the walk from railway station to the usman road, celebrate it with a softy icecream at the left side corner shop in the road junction.  You can see 50 people atleast waiting there. DONT MISS IT.

Name: Srinivas S
Title: Busiest place
Review: Chennai's busiest place. Though most of the shops opened their branches across Chennai, this road continues to be the busiest place.

Name: balkivinod
Title: Aways for some quality
Review: The street is famous for its shop and brand. You need to be patient for shopping in the street. Offers varity and numerous shops across the street and neighbourhood

Name: TE K
Title: Shopping
Review: It is in Chennai only and nearest to Chennai railway station.it highly populated area in Chennai. Most of the Telugu people are living in this area only. It is very famous for garments

Name: Kaviyanathan
Title: Getting Messy ..! Beware of Thefts ..!
Review: The Chennai corporation had not made its way to clear the road side dwellers in the area and the rush is moving ahead day by day, even though the Bargain is quite good when compared to other area, now a days SARAVANA STORES and other stores which are there in the said area have their branches outside which are providing the same quality at the same price, so i will not suggest going to Ranganathan street and get stuck in that RUSH ..! Also beware that there are series of thefts which are happening in the said area.!

Name: Exploration562808
Title: party shopping
Review: Excellent place to buy almost everything at bargain prices From jewellery to clothes -all within waling distance. Lots of eateries and places to have soft drinks . Can anyone do anything to help with the Crowd?????

Name: Zinia F
Title: Shopping Capital of Chennai
Review: Has proudly been housing the best kanjibhorom sharees since as long as anything back, but it's not easy on your wallet.

Name: Rajagopalan
Title: Shopping
Review: A to Z everything is available here. Lot of road side shops are here and we can enjoy bargain shopping here. Even 50% bargain can be done in few shops. Good place for evening shopping.

Name: Ananth 727499
Title: Do you want to feel The REAL shopping experience...  Then this is the place..
Review: In simple words, many people who come to Chennai must have missed many places., but not this place.. The real. Shopping experience of people are seen here.. 01. What do you want to purchase... 02. For how much amount do you want to purchase...Dress materials, bags,  gift items, jewellery, school items, play materials, eatables, women makeup items, kids play itmes, semi precious stones, cosmetics, medicines, stationaries, soft drinks, flowers, chat items.. And what else more do you want...? Come and feel the heat of purchasing..

Name: varun v
Title: Cloth Hub of Chennai
Review: A hub for sarees  silk and Jewellery stores, many famous silk and saree  houses in T nagar. If travelling by chennai local train Mambalam railway station is the nearest one.

Name: K V K
Title: Ranganathan street
Review: Shopping at Ranganathan Street is a must for all visitors to Chennai. The hustle and bustle of this street has to be seen to believe it. Almost all things  - from house hold items, jewellery,vegetables, clothes etc are available here. You name what you want, you get it here. The cramped places or the overcrowded street does not deter a shopping lover from not going there.

Name: Abha A
Title: Shocking
Review: Shopping in India is hard work as it is.We went to Nalli's DO NOT EVER GO THERE. They are rude and the staff are not helpful at all. Also do not ever park their because you have to buy something in order to use their car park even if you do not like anything.DO go to Kumran silks they have better manners and have a huge selection of clothes to buy.

Name: Khyati
Title: Crowded street
Review: This is very famous Street in Chennai for shopping..you can get any and everything for clothes to eating to many other accessories.. but  it's too crowded..

Name: JANET S
Title: Definite Visit.
Review: Shop where the locals do (not that tourist trap where your Auto driver takes you).  Pothy's has all levels of clothes for women.  (did not look for men's clothing)  Pothy's has just about everything!  Locals who shop here are nice and are helpful to visitors.  If looking for nice clothes (not cheap quality) this is the place. Book stores. Good to go with a fellow traveler.  Be careful crossing the streets.

Name: Eimaan
Title: OMG! This is my favorite place to shop and get a cultural feel.
Review: I absolutely loved shopping here. The prices are competitive and so great! I bought the cutest outfits for my Granddaughter and they only cost like 6 us dollars each. However, it is the atmosphere and culture experience here that makes this even better. Be prepared for a crowd on weekends and heavy traffic. Take a Auto ( little yellow three wheeler type cab) Super fun.

Name: Rathikaprashanna
Title: Area needs to be fully cleaned.
Review: Like many places in India, this spot is filled with garbage all over.  Full of potholes and congested area.
