Title: One of best day outing place near chennai
Review: It's a really good place to refresh our day. Extra cost for allowing mobile camera phone and DSLR camera. We can see a lot of animals, reptiles and caged birds around this park.  Road facilities, drinking water, and toilet facilities are good. There is a lake on the left side of the park, it's really good to spend some time there. Good place for photography. We can drive using a rented bicycle throughout the park.

Name: Dhasarathy S
Title: Good Place For One Day Outing @ Chennai
Review: The Good:1. Versatile collection of animals - Lion, Tiger, Leopard, Giraffe, Zebra etc.2. Lion & Deer Safari a new experience for old timers; against the conventional "meet the animal in cage"3. Option to pick cycles (manual, electric, kids) cycle on hourly basis to roam around the huge real estate4. Banned outside food to be carried in on disposable packages (allowed me to carry my lunch in metal lunch boxes)5. Availability of golf cart like vehicles for the benefit of less fit folks such as senior citizensThe Bad:1. Quality of food available inside the zoo is not great. This even applies to the Aavin shop inside.2. The vans doing the safaris are quiet dated and don't live up to the international standardsThe Ugly:1. The maintenance of the restrooms are pathetic. It hurts more when they collect money from us to go through the experience

Name: Dhwanit S
Title: Great place! Must visit
Review: It's a big nice zoo. Visit during cloudy day to enjoy the fullest. Rent a cycle and cover more ground. They have both peddle and battery operated cycles. Also, for elders or not willing to ride have option of battery operated car.You can spend 3-4 hours easily depending on your interest and activities.Food options are limited but ok.Cycle staff if rude, you'll have to fight for good cycles. Better reach early around to get cycle of your choice.Lots of animals, birds, reptiles, flora and fauna.Enjoy!

Name: Kailash G
Title: Excellent Outing for Animal Enthusiastics and Kids in Chennai at affordable Cost
Review: We have visited Vandalur Zoo  with Kids on Jan 1st and every one enjoyed it . Parking ( 20 rs for Car ) and Tickets ( 50 for Adult ) are cheap , you can reach by buses too , Bus Stop is near the Entrance of zoo . Battery cars are available inside zoo for 100 rs. which covers the main attractions within an hour ( Helpful for Senior Citizens and Lazy folks ) . For Adults and Children Bicycles are available for Rental ( 20 - 25 Per Hour ) but you need to be in early to avoid queues . Renting a Bicycle will be the better option to roam around , it will take 3 hours to watch most of the attractions in Bicycle . And then you have Safari ( Lion and Deer alone ) for 100 rs. which takes you closer to Lions in Open Area . Lot of Tigers are there in Zoo , Huge Collection of  Birds and Snakes . Park ( Play Area ) is available for kids near the entrance for kids < 10 yrs and it has lot of equipments . wrt Facilities Water is available at lot of places , Toilets too but they are charging for Toilets . Plastics are strictly not allowed if you carry biscuit pockets they unseal the covers and put it in  reusable covers . Food and Snacks are available at three places inside the zoo . Worthy and Affordable Day out for Families with Kids and also you can breathe fresh air .  Credit Cards are allowed at entry points only , for bicycle deposits you need to pay cash 200 rs. for each bicycle . Avoid During Public Holidays .

Name: LOKESH
Title: excellent place for 1 day
Review: excellent place for a day you can spent a  full day here it is an open zoo where u will get cycles for travel inside it is very nice

Name: Yogitha K
Title: Tiring but worth it!
Review: First of all....NEVER go there on a public holiday...we went on Christmas and the crowd was too much... Because of this,all the battery cars and safari vehicles were already fully booked..And we had to walk throughout the park...We were a group of 6adults  and 6 small kids...we were told that we were not allowed to bring any snacks or food..so we went with only water...but after going inside,we saw that many of them had brought food and snacks...it's not a problem for adults,as there are snacks counters near butterfly park,tea,aavin ice-cream booth etc.,But if you are going with kids,make sure you have something for them  to eat.Because it took us Almost 5hrs for us to walk and cover the park,so we had to skip lunch...You can't cut short and go the exit halfway..But they do have almost all animals and colourful birds to excite the kids...We saw lions, tigers, white tigers, hippopotamus,otters, elephants,a giraffe,a zebras,snakes,,and lots of different kinds of monkeys and colourful birds..there is an aquarium too...but we were too tired to check it out..So if you want to show real animals to your kids,this is a great place...but remember not to go on a public holiday,..(I think it opens by 10am)and book a battery car and safari jeep...and take plenty of water with you...

Name: Mukta2016
Title: Nice Zoo
Review: The Arinagar Anna Zoological park in Chennai is a fairly decent zoo to visit especially with kids. The zoo is spread over spacious grounds and there is an option of going around with  battery operated trolleys. The animal enclosures are quiet big and the short  lion safari inside the zoo is worth the extra money and drive. Overall a good experience with kids.

Name: Q01635
Title: UK visitor - WORST ZOO - AVOID
Review: Where do I start, maybe with a positive, at 50 Rs each it's the cheapest Zoo I've been to. You need to pay for phones if you want to take pictures, there really isn't anything to take pictures of, so that's a moot point.Sad and pretty dilapidated in general, (animals have reasonable space, I'm not anti zoo). Went to aquarium first, about 20 small fish tanks with dirty glass/water, really the carp at an average UK garden centre is a better display than this.Things didn't get better when we used the toilets, we paid 10Rs each, I've no real problem with paying (although it's odd when you pay to come in already) but if you do pay, a nice experience is expected, nasty wet dirty toilets.Typically you would look at the zoo map to see where to go, indeed there is a map, on a nice big board, but unreadable due to sun damage. Lots of staff, about 4 or 5 organising lion safaris (needs 1 at most), 3 guys in nasty aquarium, so lack of staff is not an issue, it just seems that they do not understand how nice a zoo can be.If you really have nothing better to do and you do visit, pay the extra for the lion safari, it's a bit sad with a handful of lions but the best of a very very bad lot.If the proprietor reads this, I suggest you visit some foreign zoo (any country will do!) to see how zoos can be, yours is pretty sad attempt.

Name: TheHelpfulReviewer
Title: Just terrible, do not go
Review: This is the worst zoo I have ever been to. First, the toilets are terrible and you need to pay, second, you need to pay to take photos on a phone and more for a DSLR camera, and third, there is just nothing there...if you want to waste your time then look no further and come to this poor attempt of a zoo.

Name: Krishnaveni S
Title: Wonderful zoo
Review: Very huge zoo with lots of animals. The walk is tiring, but the animals make up for it. There is safari, battery operated vehicles and cycles to go if you cant walk. Come in november to january the winter of chennai. There is lion, tiger, leopard, hippo, deer, otter, giraffe, zebra, bear etc. The lion and tiger can be seen moving freely as well. The white tiger is another attraction. Also there are variety of birds including emu, ostrich, macau, peacock, phesant, etc. So colorful and chirpy. There is an aquarium section and butterfly section. 2 to 3 canteens are there, many drinking water taps were there without water. Carry water bottles. Outside food and plastic are not allowed. Visit once

Name: ChicLifeByte
Title: A massive zoo which is a must attend for kids as well as photography enthusiasts!
Review: With my key interest towards Wildlife and animals, a visit to the zoo is always on my agenda whichever city I visit. Spread across a huge area, the famous Chennai zoo houses 160 species of insects, birds and animals. One can spot crocodiles, blackbuck, lion-tailed macaque, panthers, peacocks, lions, hyenas, jaguars and much more. The place is huge, hence I recommend taking the safaris to save time and energy. There are different safaris available at this park including a lion safari and a deer safari, for which there are different costs based upon the age of a person. My recommendation is the Lion Safari in which they actually take you inside a restricted area where lions roam. If you would like to explore the zoo on your own, then you can rent a bicycle during the start of the tour so that you don‚Äôt exhaust yourself walking. Also at the zoo is a library, where one can know about the living environment and the habitat of these animals. Perfect for families who want to showcase different animals to their kids, the place is also a must visit for photography enthusiasts.

Name: Amazing Munnar
Title: Amazing Munnar visit anna zoo vandaloor zoo Chennai
Review: I headed this place and I went with my friend his home is vandaloor with his help I visited many places but don't use ordinary camera phone they charge amount for it it is best time to visit is evening or morning

Name: Krishnakumar CM
Title: A large zoo
Review: The entrance ticket costs you Rs50.It is better to use the zoo cycles on rent or electric van as walking would be  tiring.One of the best zoos in south India and houses most of the wild life.Carry your own water if you not used to Chennai weather.

Name: Dr Pritpal Singh
Title: Best zoo in South India.
Review: You can see almost all animals which other zoos might not have. The place is far off from main Chennai Central but around 15 - 16 km from airport on the GST Road. Close to SRM University. Can spend half a day with family, specially if you are with children. Couples can choose many other places instead.

Name: indian1947
Title: A zoo in the natural sorroundings.
Review: A visit to this zoo with your Children and grand Children in tow is a memorable experience.All the animals are well fed and taken care by the zoo authorities. You can see a varieties of animals and bird in their natural surroundings. Battery operated vehicles and cycles are available for those who cannot walk the long distance. Outside food is not permitted.

Name: Ashish S
Title: Many animal types are available
Review: The visit was both informative as well as exciting. Was able to see many variety of animals during this visit.

Name: ethan d
Title: One of the finnest place to visit in Chennai
Review: Zoo is very well maintained, plastics are prohibited so is food. They have a place for renting bi cycles, they also have electric ones, battery cars are available as well. You get to see some critically endangered wildlife such as Lion tailed Macaque, Bengal tiger, Asiatic lions, etc. The animals are very healthy and have spacious enclosures. If you are looking to spend a day learning about wildlife then this is the place. The Zoo also organizes programs during summer holidays for kids which is a very nice way of reaching kids. Overall an excellent place

Name: Azeez K
Title: Best place in chennai for a day long trip..
Review: Vandalur zoo, has to offer something, to every age group of people. Its a vast expanse of dry decidous scrub forest.. Covering entire zoo requires walking of around 5-6 km, but thats the real fun of it.Either go by walk, or by bicycle and enjoy the zoo in your own pace.. Never do the mistake of hiring those battery vehicles , unless you cant walk or old aged.. Its a very good experience to walk around this scrub jungle, you will feel you are inside a forest literally... Very well maintained , most of the animals are not caged.. Very good place for birding as well.Never visit in summer months.. visiting during winters will be very soothing experience..

Name: Rahul P
Title: A very very BIG Zoo
Review: Largely spread zoo with a variety of flora and fauna. A must visit for nature lovers. One can spend a complete day.

Name: Maruthu
Title: Must visit for any family with kids in Chennai
Review: It‚Äôs a must visit for anyone visiting or living in Chennai and that too with young kids. They have reopened Butterfly Park too, but it‚Äôs still a work under construction. Only thing is you get to Giraffe and Elephant from very far distance, otherwise it would have been even more good!

Name: babuvis51
Title: Visual treat for the kids and animal lovers
Review: A zoo is certainly a tourist attraction in any place. That too if it is vast and an abode for innumerable species of animals and birds, it will be worth spending time during weekend or holiday. Suffice to say that Arignar Anna Zoological park, Vandalur, Chennai is one of the biggest. Animals we find in all zoos as well as rare species are there to make our trip memorable.  The zoo is situated about 40 kms from the Central railway station/Central Bus teminus.It can be reached by buses, electric trains, partially metro and  electric trains. Ample parking for private vehicles is available.  Since the zoo is vast battery operated cars are availabe for all. We should carry some snacks and water to last for a few hours of tour. Time spent here will be cherished.

Name: Priya M
Title: Big zoo in South india
Review: Its one of the biggest zoo in south india. Kids come in large numbers here. Interesting place to find captive wild life

Name: nageswararao g
Title: Good place to visit with kids
Review: Nice place to visit with kids. Located within chennai city limits. Not that much crowded during our weekday visit.

Name: Reshma R
Title: Nice zoo with lot of things to see
Review: area of teh zoological park is so long that it is tough to walk and see the entire area. There are vehicles to take you through the zoo.

Name: Meander815973
Title: Well maintained
Review: The place is pretty well maintained. I've been here twice and it is a nice place. Do take food and water along though. It is a bit costly there and not available at frequent distances.

Name: Arpu2009
Title: Not worth the time
Review: Apart from the Chimp and Bengal Tiger, it isn't worth. Too much walk for just open barron places. hardly any animals.

Name: vidyasagar
Title: one of its kind zoo
Review: Large, spacious, green, right locality, are the pros.good for photography in aviary and animal enclosures.bird watching in the open area. there are lot of trees within the campus.even cell phone camera is charged. Nice place for family outing with children.

Name: Sunil G
Title: Good for a day outing
Review: Its well maintained zoo in Chennai and its a perfect place for day outing. Nice place to walk around greenery and animals.

Name: jasjas867
Title: Perfect for a day's picnic
Review: A vast area with variety of animals. Everytime i visit, i find something new. Thr noctural animal encounter is sefinitely worth and the big cats area is really cool. Definitely bigger than zoos found in other cities. Old people may find it difficult to walk the whole distance and can try the battery car.

Name: explorewmerajeshd
Title: Vandalur Zoo - Definitely a nice experience
Review: After long discussion on Sunday morning, planned to go to Vandalur Zoo with family. Had been there before a couple of times but never completed the trip, just would go till half way and return as it is a very long walk. Though they have bicycles, trips through their battery cars, Jungle Safari, we were interested always to walk. Today somehow made up our mind and completed the entire zoo in 4 hours time. variety of snake species was good to see. Had opportunity to see most of the animals in the close view.Bird species that you see here are really awesome to watch. I would suggest people to take a professional camera and be there in the evening to capture the pictures of these beautiful birds

Name: vmsatheesh22
Title: Good
Review: Arignar Anna park, good and beautiful to enjoy few hours, we all like and enjoy here, few animals and good for walking

Name: rvignesh1947
Title: Good
Review: We are enjoying there and saw the wild animals and we are enjoying like a child had a very nice fun.

Name: Keertan
Title: Good visit
Review: Well, if u got Kids, camera and planned for a picnic in and around Chennai, This Zoo is the place to Visit.I visited this zoo about few years ago and it was okey with few amount of animals. I could see Tigers, Chimpangee, Elephant, Deep, lots of Birds and so on.Recently, the Zoo was re modified and designed into new. The news also said that a new attachment had been done in the zoo, named as "Butterfly park".

Name: lakshmipriya j
Title: A long walk inside a forest-kind of feeling
Review: People who adore nature and would like to enjoy watching the animals and birds could visit this place. If you want to book for safari or want to rent bicycles or travel inside the zoo in a battery train, please go as early as possible. Because when you go late, u would miss to get these tickets.

Name: J J
Title: Hippo Family with baby Hippos and Bengal Tiger a must see
Review: April is hot.Yet worth it.For young children take the private shuttle if you can afford.Tickets available online or even at park.We, mother and 7 year old son, went and hired a cart. Even then one needs to walk but it surely cuts down long walks between cages.It‚Äôs a well maintained zoo.Animals like Hippos with baby Hippos, the great Bengal tiger, and  Bison makes it all worth.It‚Äôs way from Chennai and takes time But then we are a family who loves to see animals so for us it was worth it.

Name: GOPIKA J
Title: very good zoo
Review: This is a huge zoo. Lot of place to roam around and also hosts a lot of varieties of animals. You can avail cycle for hourly rental if you dont want to walk all the place. Electric vehicles are also provided based on bookings.

Name: saravanan i
Title: Lost its old beauty.
Review: Now greenery is not there. Animals are very old. Lion safari, Lion always sleeping on the vehicle path, never wake up. Couples are spreading through out the zoo. Animals and couples both starring at the visitors. Any way children enjoying their time.

Name: Prasad B
Title: Huge and wast....Enough packed with nature gifts - Flora and fauna
Review: Oldest Zoo and largest zoo in India...Well maintained in terms of facilities like drinking water after every few distances, Toilets, Cafeterias etc.

Name: Phurbu B
Title: My best trip while i was at Chennai
Review: I like the Zoo. It is clean, huge as well as filed with varieties of animals. Really, it is amazing. I would say is one of the best zoo in all India i have ever visited.

Name: Dan D
Title: Huge zoo, needs updating a little...
Review: We visited from the UK as part of a grand tour of India. First of all this zoo is not presented or maintained to western standards but we did not expect it to be. It is a vast site and i would recommend taking the buggy tour around the zoo as it is too far and likely to be too hot to walk around the site. There are some impressive animals there, there are also plenty of animals with very little space. The public areas are baron and unkempt which is not usual for India but the animals appear to be well cared for generally.There appeared to be plenty of refreshment stands around for visitors.If in Chennai this is worth a visit but it is not worth travelling that far for.Saltwater crocodiles the most impressive for me...

Name: vasan224
Title: wonderful zoo in chennai
Review: a beautiful zoo having most of the animals, in this zoo they never allow the plastic items inside the zoo which a good habit to maintain the zoo.

Name: Raul9810
Title: Nice one
Review: This was my 2 year old daughter's 1st visit to a zoo and she loved it. Such huge property and must admit they maintain it well. The only issue is that you will find most of the young couples around the zoo sitting near trees which can make you akward.

Name: SaloniGarg
Title: The Bestest Zoo‚ù§Ô∏è
Review: Oh My God!!!‚ù§Ô∏èIt's a heaven for All the Animals And Nature loverüòç it's outstanding... The experience is unexpected!You will love each corner of the zoo...There are more than 100 types animals there...Lion, tiger, Monkey, Giraffe, Zebra, Ostrich...Few of them are such which are not available in any other zoo of India! The zoo is all clean and properly maintained...‚ù§Ô∏èYou can roam inside the zoo in a vehicle or by foot.. but the best thing you can do is to hire a cycle... You will love the Experience ‚ù§Ô∏èBy foot you will take 6-8 hrsIn A long train like vehicle you will take approx 2:30 he'sN by bicycle you will take approx 4 hrs !Extra Fee To take your camera and phone inside... Worth Giving‚úåÔ∏èYou will get to see New Animals..which you may never see beforeüòçüòãFood is not allowed... But 2-3 Well Maintained Canteens are Available Where you will get Veg and Non-Veg both kind of food! ‚ù§Ô∏èA place I want to go again and again!üòãMust Visit Zoo‚ù§Ô∏è

Name: Bala
Title: A very big zoo with a variety of animals
Review: It is better to be here early , to avoid the mid day sun. And also the battery car, and cycles are easily available this time. But around 11 am , the place gets crowded and the wait could be long. The entry fee is 50 for adults and 20 for children. And battery car would cost 100 per person per hour. The place is really huge, and waking the entire distance could be very tiring , if not impossible . Cycles are also available for a cost of 15 per cycle per hour. The zoo has animals like elephant , lion, tiger , zebra , giraffe , leopard, bear, snake and crocodile park, and also many birds. There is also a butterfly park , which is not well maintained . There are few food stalls inside. And outside food is not allowed. There is a huge parking space, but again weekends could be crowded. On the other hand , during the weekdays , you may have to wait for the battery car and van ( safari) to get filled.

Name: Suhail K
Title: WORST EXPERIENCE
Review: we visit yesterday i came ther bad experience lot of gages same bird, lot of gages are empty, drinking water not good lunch not allowed first our children's  so hungry not available in single hotels in middle area snacks only good but they ask money  including plate and cup also  after the return plates cup asking any person only the give rs.10 easch plates.

Name: RAMAKRISHNAN K
Title: Calm and quit park
Review: The zoo park has various species of animals, birds, etc and there is show also given children good time . Afternoon time one would get very cool breeze and enjoy the- Place

Name: rrumakanthan
Title: A Good Zoo
Review: -We visited (with a 2 year old kid) during the second week of March, and the Chennai summer heat is picking up and hence start early and finish before noon.-This park is very large and spread out and hence it is difficult to walk around and see all the animals. Bicycles are available on rent (very reasonable cost) and even with bicycles it could be difficult to see a large area in Chennai heat.( may be November to  February will be a comfortable weather to walk around) - The best I will say is Tigers (about 7 ) and one White Tiger .This is better than Singapore and London Zoo . Lions are also good ( three, one Lion and two Lioness) when we went. These are housed in a large open enclosure.-There are Cheetas,    Hippos, Giraffes, Orangutans, Otters, A small and nice aquarium with small fish , well kept are housed in the zoo .  A large water birds enclosure with plenty of water fowls, Peacocks, Monkeys Crocodile, Bison, Deers, Snakes (a large number of Pythons are kept here) are also housed here. Many are housed in open enclosures-.The best way to see the zoo comfortably is to take the buggy (Rs 100 per person ) and takes about an hour . The driver will stop in important spots ( Tigers, Lions, Hippos, Aquarium, Snake House etc) to see the animals without having to walk a long distance between each other. If possible start the visit by first taking the Buggy trip. The Zoo opens at 9 am and the first buggy trip starts at 930 am. Each Buggy takes about 12 persons or so. There is a comfortable seating place to wait to take the Buggy trip..  - The Zoo is reasonably clean, though the car parking and surrounding areas are not kept clean and should be improved. Continuous manual sweeping is being carried out inside the zoo area to keep it reasonably clean.- Covered seating areas are available inside the Zoo to relax in between.  -  As informed everywhere, plastic packaging is not allowed inside the zoo and bags are checked at the entrance. You can take eatables in metal and other non disposable containers and water in non plastic containers. Children food is allowed to be taken.Week ends have many visitors and week days are not crowded as per the information. (number of visitors increase after 11 am ) .-It could take about an hour  to drive down to the zoo from the Chennai city when you start at about 730 am or so.  .

Name: Dr Chandru K
Title: Zoo with safari and battery car
Review: We happened to stay near vandalur and visited zoo which was close by. Entrance fee is low and u can take battery operated car to roam around which is recommended as it is very big zoo. Safari is good for children and adults alike.

Name: 592abck
Title: Nice park
Review: This park is very nice and you get to see lot of animals and species which you cannot see anywhere else.

Name: Sram81
Title: Great place to take your kid!
Review: Situated a bit outside the city limit, drive till here would easily take a hour or so. Parking is adequate though if you are late you have to park at least 1 km away. Worst part is there is no pick up and drop service and you are left at the mercy of local Auto rickshaws.There are 2 ways to explore the park, we can either hire a buggy or we can walk down. Thanks to heavy tree cover we decided to walk down and did not regret it a bit. This gives you freedom to spend as much time as want inside the Zoo. We did take good breaks and were adequately hydrated. Animals were ok, most of them were well maintained and compared to other Zoo's in India abundant space was available for the animals. Majority of the enclosures were not cramped. All in all my kid enjoyed the day out and so did we. Not sure how our experience would have been if the day had been hotter!

Name: kblakshmanan
Title: Less expectations
Review: Been with kids on 24feb. It's one of biggest zoo and you have lion,tiger and deer safari. Lots of animal to witness and good things end here.Plan properly, never visit on weekends. It's 5km walk around zoo and with Chennai weather ,you will be drained out and with elders or children it's going to be big issue.so next option is battery car or some safari,wait you will not be assured and its not available all the time. they stop if they want. In counter if you ask any clarification or suggestions,you will be met with not so friendly staff.I went inside the zoo and then I was told safari was available and was asked to go outside to counter to buy tickets, which I did.But why on Earth I should walk again to counter, can't they provide inside or can't  they give it in counter itself in first place.So it's pure luck if you get any vehicle. One suggestion plan it in morning when zoo opens, my friends told me after my disappointed trip.

Name: Jagmohan Singh D
Title: Biggest in South Asia
Review: This zoological park spread over a 1200 acre area,about 28 kms from Chennai city ,is considered to be amongst the largest in South Asia located on the erstwhile GrandSouthern Trunk Road. Easily accessible by metro/ local trains, bus, & cabs,enables visitors to see the innumerable number of animals & birds replicated to their moated natural habitat.The Lion & Bison safari parks, Toy train as we‚Äôll as nocturnal animals are amongst the attractions.The walk through Aviary is an attraction in itself. The park is closed on Tuesday‚Äôs.

Name: Abdul wahaab
Title: Gud plave to hangout with loveable ones
Review: It's a gud place to hangout with family especially families with kids ..lot variety of birds animals repltiles and knowledge can be obtained about them ..calm and clean environment makes it's perfect place for vacation planning ..even school tours ..one of the gud place for couples too to speak to their loveable one under the shadow of nature with animals

Name: denzdm
Title: Great place to spend the day
Review: Though my visit was very short, I was able to see variety of birds from macaws to peacocks to parakeets. Aquarium is shaped like a magnificent shark, however not many fish to boast of. There is a safari to watch the big cats too.

Name: Prachi A
Title: Big Zoo , Good place to visit with Kids
Review: In Entrance there is small waterfall and people were taking pics at it , it was just good for pictures.We opted for lion safari and my kid loved it however all animals were sleeping most of the time.We could see one Lion awake though.Deer safari was very good , Deer were playing , taking bath and eating so he could see more about DeerBear was also treasure as he was walking from here to there and we could have good sight of him.There are many crocodiles in this zoo and birds also.Zoo is quite big and entertaining.washrooms are ok and food was also just ok.They do not allow you to take outside food in.This Zoo is wonderful experience for kids.

Name: Mohamed F
Title: Nice
Review: Nice place for children good entertainment but not all animals only few animals available food not good

Name: IvanOravec
Title: Features a range of South Indian animals
Review: If you have some time to spend in Chennai, definitely add the zoo into your bucket list. Come early to see feeding and showering of elephants; tigers, crocodiles, snakes, bears, gaurs and many other animals.

Name: Umang A
Title: Zooooo
Review: So Chennai had a it's own zoo a well. You can visit this by walk, battery operated cars which is driven by lady drivers or rented bycycles.

Name: Shankar_Kamath
Title: Vandalur zoo
Review: This is a must visit if you are in chennai. Its very big and very well maintained. It also has a lot of animals and bird varieties. The best part is we can rent cycles inside for an hourly rate of 15 rs per hour. This is a really good option considering the size of the zoo. It also has small shop inside where you can get refreshments and water on a pay and get basis.It might take a whole day if you want to cover the whole zoo. It is really worth the visit.

Name: India Food Blog
Title: Really big Zoo but they have not maintained properly
Review: Housing as many as 138 different species of organisms. Arinagar Anna Zoological Park is home to a variety of animals such as Himalayan brown bear, lion, tiger, elephant and Indian civit cat. The zoo also has a reptile house which houses various species of reptiles including the king cobra, python, viper any much more.¬†Basic water facility is not there, we suggest to take lots of water bottle with you. Food in zoo is very bad and rates are pretty high. Zebra over here is Black and Yellow üòÇ

Name: 545mahih
Title: THE HAVEN FOR NATURE
Review: Nice place to hangout with kids and family. The walk will take nearly 4 hours to see everything. Good number of animals are there.  Tigers, lions, monkeys, deers, fishes and crocodiles. Kids would love elephants and giraffe. Snake varieties would scare them. Home food is not allowed, but hotel food seems costly. Bicycle ride is best option, and vehicle safari is also available but they stop at few places only. Nice motorable roads. Well maintained. No plastic allowed inside. So do not take chips packets in your bag. Lot of eateries inside but limited choicesNo pepsi , coke available inside BEST PLACE I HAVE VISITED,

Name: Aravind V
Title: Beware of Online Booking Issues
Review: The place is maintained neat. However, they don't allow direct entry for online booking. We need to visit a ticket counter and show them the online booking. They will verify it and provide a separate entry pass which has to be carried to the entrance. The ticketing staff asked us for hardcopy for the booking receipt even though the booking site said SMS/EMAIL copy is sufficient.

Name: ssm
Title: Do visit!
Review: Arignar Anna Zoological Park is located in Vandalur. the zoo is well maintained, the animal enclosures are spacious and clean.The weekends are usually busy with families and young kids making the best of the place. The aquarium, reptile enclosures are all quite good.Toilets and water facilities are easily available. it has options of bicycle,and battery operated vehicles for sight seeing of the major points.  a must visit place with kids

Name: Sulthan
Title: Well maintained and good collection of animal species
Review: The zoo is maintained well and there is a good collection of animal species. White tiger in the zoo attracts more visitors.

Name: Bupa
Title: Heaven for Book lovers.
Review: Amazing place with lots of books. Definitely a big salute to kalainar. Every time I feel excited when Ithe collection of books and ambience of surroundings.

Name: vijay c
Title: Best library in Chennai
Review: Anna centenary library in Chennai is the biggest library in Asia. It houses vast collections of ancient manuscripts. Good resources for students preparing for competitive exams

Name: Ansi
Title: very interesting
Review: definetely worth to visit. you can spend here a day and it seems to be minutes....We would definitely go again if we could. recommendable

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: Superb library
Review: It's an awesome library with lots of categories including children. You can study comfortably, peacefully. There is a facility for visually challenged or visually impaired. So it's a must visit place for the people who love.

Name: Sai B
Title: Excellent Library
Review: Excellent library with lots of books, Build by Former Chief Minister M Karunanithi. Now its not well maintained as it was earlier

Name: ababushankar
Title: Paradise for book lovers
Review: You can find books for all ages and interests. Children's section has books for children and teachers. The library has exclusive space for those who would like to study peacefully, with your own books and laptops

Name: nithyavasu
Title: Reader
Review: excellent collection of books, good facilities and easy to access by any mode of transportation. well maintained kids section , good collection of periodicals, comfortable seating, well ventilated , full of energy and above all excellent space for visually challenged and IAS aspirants.

Name: Arul Prakash Samathuvamani
Title: Knowledge Hub of Chennai
Review: Its one of the biggest libraries in Chennai. Other than "Read you Own Book" section, pretty much all other sections have some place for you to sit and read quietly without any disturbance. Its fully air conditioned. Engineering section could have better collection of books, most recognised author book are not available.The place does not have a canteen. It does have a caffeteria, but other than tea, there is no choice in food.

Name: Deadman17
Title: Large collection of books
Review: The library has a large collection of books and is a book lover's paradise. There are books for kids, teenagers as well as office goers. If you are studying for a competitive exam, then one should visit the place. One can study here in peace.

Name: Krishnaveni S
Title: Amazing children's section
Review: It is a vast library, the largest in South Asia. It is located in kotturpuram. It has an amazing children's section where kids will love to go. It also has own book reading section, Braille section, regional language section. You can just go and read. No need of any membership. No borrowing of books allowed

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Wow
Review: The place itself speaks of its own history and the n.number of books available mesmerize us to spend more time here.the maintenance of the place can be increased for its not as it used to be.

Name: Swami1939
Title: Book lover's paradise
Review: The Anna Centenary Library on Gandhi Mandapam Road, Kotturpuram is a place where you can see a very large collection of books on innumerable topics. The library is designed excellently and the atmosphere is conducive for calm reading. People love to visit this library to collect lots of data of their interest.

Name: Sundaram R
Title: visit to library
Review: the library has improved upon in the last one year further to meet readers needs.[qualitative]ambience included.genuine readers will be delighted after a meaningful time well spent

Name: uk555
Title: Book lovers' sojourn
Review: It's a heaven for book lovers. Has a good collection of books that you can pick, find your corner and blissfully spend as much time as you want. The search catalog computers were not working, but you can browse through the racks, find your pick and read through the day there.Milk parlor is located at ground floor for refreshment, but otherwise you need to head out for snacks/lunch. Toilets badly need maintenance.

Name: RavikumarEswaran
Title: Very nice for a public library
Review: They have modelled it on the lines of the libraries in singapore. Kids section is amazing. Lot of books for kids to read and enjoy. Even other sections are good with ample place to sit and read. There are weekly events and activities for both kids and adults. But state of the restrooms are pathetic. Very poorly maintained restrooms.

Name: DayaMass
Title: "Informastic"
Review: I visited this library on my summer vacation.This library was built as a memory of Anna's 100th birthday.This library is highly facilitated with A/C.This library has 10 floors,and each floor has different book sections.The 1st floor is for children.And the last floor contains books about history , travel and tourism.You can enjoy a lot here.The entry is free.And there is also a separate place for reading our books which we bring from home.There is also a Braille section for blinds.There is food court beyond the building and a Aavin parlour inside the building at ground floor.I hope u enjoyed this review.But I want u to experience it by visiting the library.‚ò∫‚ò∫‚ò∫

Name: Vinod500
Title: Huge Library Mismanaged
Review: My recent visit to this library was disappointing and saddening. I visited the Periodicals section on the 1st floor. The daily newspapers were current. However, I was shocked to find only June and July issues of India Today, Time etc. Magazines like Business India, Business Today, Forbes India, Open, Economist etc were nowhere to be seen. Most shelves were totally empty. I had gone to the same library a year ago, when the current issues of all these magazines were available for reading in the library. So I inquired with the staff why the deterioration in the last one year. They were apologetic, and said subscription to periodicals like India Today, Forbes India, Open etc have been renewed recently and December issues will be on the shelves. It took them 6 months to renew subscriptions! It smacks of mismanagement of this public resource at the top levels.

Name: Ashish S
Title: Nice visit
Review: It was nice to visit the library. It was a neat place. It was very peaceful as well. Very informative visit.

Name: Priya M
Title: Literature lovers paradise
Review: Massive library complex located in Chennai City. Its a literature lovers paradise and there are so many books available.

Name: nageswararao g
Title: Massive library
Review: Its a massive library, one of its kind in whole of South India. Well kept place with literature of most of Indian languages.

Name: CharmDeepak
Title: Extraordinary Collection
Review: Anna centenary Library is well organized library. it has every single feature what an ideal library has. though it is a silent library there is a room for louder section in the ground floor. this is not lending library but you can take picture of your fav books  with mobile ( in silent mode). Laptop is allowed.

Name: Anusree P
Title: Very large
Review: Anna Centenary Library is very large building.  you will get mostly all the books, silent place and very spacious location

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Good Library
Review: This is a very nice library which has a wide variety of book on different subjects. Good ambiance and silent place. Good place for book lovers.

Name: selvambikaiyali
Title: anna library
Review: big library, you will get mostly all the books, silent place and very spacious location, good for book lovers and readers

Name: worldwomantourist
Title: Wonderful collection of Books
Review: Very great library with massive collection of books. Needs to be maintained well. Lot of rare books. One of the Best Library in Chennai.

Name: vasan224
Title: all books in one place
Review: anna centenary library has all the books for the students also it provides a peaceful place for the students to read in a clam manner.

Name: ilavarasi_sm
Title: Forest of book and books
Review: Lot of books collection from kids to senior citizens of all categories. It got very big space to read comfortably whichever you would like to...

Name: vijmail99
Title: lack of attention
Review: need to improve a lot...less collections and lacking basic amenities. assistance staff not available for help

Name: Madhan K
Title: The good library
Review: The library is huge and lots of books üìö to read and study and understand.People who likes to read its a good place.Can get all types of books to boost our knowledge Must visit place for book lovers

Name: Alicia A
Title: Fun to explore
Review: Visited the Anna Centenary Library to see the palm leaf scripts, which were a unique find. We hoped to get our readings done there as well but it was more so just to see. A huge library, a great place to explore when you want a change from the busy city life.

Name: Keertan
Title: Good
Review: The Anna Centenary Library (ACL) is a newly established state library of the Government of Tamil Nadu. One of the largest libraries in Tamil Nadu, it is located at Kotturpuram, Chennai. A big boost to book lovers, it is said to be South Asia's largest and most elegantly designed library.Housing about 1.2 million books, the library is well equipped with state of the art facilities including a spacious auditorium, amphitheatre and two conference halls. The library is open to public from 9am to 8pm daily. The major attractions of the library are children's section, with fun-filled theme-based reading area with multimedia kits and storybooks. The library also has a special section for the visually-impaired, with talking books and Braille displays. ACL is often reckoned as a reader's paradise. The library is spacious and cool, and offers a calm reading environment. Moreover, it offers membership facilities, Amenity Centre and Food Court, Digital Library as well as Residential Facility for Researchers. The library is easily accessible from any part of Chennai. If you are planning your visit to Chennai, it is preferable to visit the place during the months of November to March, as the climate will be pleasant then.

Name: Raghul J
Title: A High Tech Library
Review: A Library which is really peaceful for studying...and has a good infrastructure and contains a lot of books which is useful for research people...

Name: Suresh C
Title: Good place to be - great Infrastructure
Review: Eight floors of books on various categories.  Spacious entry/exit with Parking facilities , sign boards and rest rooms shows this place as a remarkable one.  When I went, there are large number of high school or college students using the facilities in many of the "read your own book" sections.   Air conditioning was functioning excellently  when I went and this place is ideal for those who want to spend time in learning in a comfortable environment.   There is also a small auditorium and there was a literary functioning happening during the time of my visit.   Children section in first floor is spacious and lot of english kids books were present and lot families have brought their children.  Parents should move their children out of TV, iPads and other gadgets and make them spend some time amidst books - it will change their mindset and productive.   Would recommend this for everyone especially kids to atleast make one visit as trendsetting.

Name: BhaarathPhotography
Title: My Most Favourite Place in Chennai
Review: I believe this library is one of the most Peaceful and Knowledge gaining place in Chennai.The place where you can spend free time very useful. More number of books in different Language with different Authors. Kindly bring your children's once and explain them in brief about the books.

Name: RAMAKRISHNAN K
Title: It is an wonderful place to read listen
Review: The location is very central and collections are really commendable. Lots of floors for each category of readers . Children have separate floor Competitive exam preparation may be done from here because it gives calm atmosphere. Some good educational program also conducted

Name: Nirmal
Title: Excellent place for Study
Review: This place can be used by the students to study and clarify the doubts as there are large collection of books in the library. this is very usefull for the UPSC and other government exam candidated who feel some sort of disturbance at home. This is supported with AC facility so that you wont feel tired even after hours spent together in this place.

Name: keerthi2012
Title: One of the best book collections
Review: It is a very calm place in the midst of a bustling city. Best place to read and gain knowledge. Extensive collection of books. So spacious

Name: 592abck
Title: Books and books
Review: Such a collection of books, hard to find in the era of kindle and internet. However, lot of kids here.

Name: ananthakp
Title: An opportunity lost
Review: Started with a lot of publicity in one of the finest locations in Chennai. The maintenance, to say the least is far from satisfactory. It had all the good things to become one of the finest libraries at least in South.  Unfortunately, badly managed and fast losing its purpose.

Name: Krishnaveni S
Title: Heaven for book lovers
Review: It is a huge library with multiple sections. There are so many books related to every field. The children's section is very cute. There are 2 own book reading rooms as well. Very well maintained, and really awesome. Please visit

Name: scorpionchennai
Title: A delight if you are a book worm
Review: One of the best place if you loving reading,good ambiance and of-course a treat for all those who still love library.

Name: shrinikethv
Title: Book heaven in Chennai
Review: If you are a book lover and an avid reader, it is sheer injustice if you haven't been to this place. Majestic huge building with tremendous facilities, AC, canteen, self study rooms, tons and tons of books in all domains including foreign languages, center for competitive exams resource and many more. Must visit!

Name: arunkumars2013
Title: Majestic!
Review: Visited the library for first time last week. The library is huge with almost all sections I could think of, covered. Wanted to visit the library for a long time. So just checked out a couple of sections - Travel and Economics. There is enough space for two wheeler and four wheeler parking.There is an aavin milk centre in ground floor.There are no computers in the sections that I visited. Ppl are allowed to bring their own laptops and use them. There is a kids section which has play area.Overall, a very nice place with no negatives at all.

Name: harishbala
Title: Wide range of books available, can spend hours here
Review: We visited this library and were very impressed to find such a large library in Chennai. There are books for all ages and Children would have a great time visiting also.

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: must see for book lovers
Review: I am sure you will be amazed by the sophisticated facilities and the humongous size of the library.Go there if you are a book lover or not just to experience it

Name: Johnson G
Title: World Class
Review: Superb, fully air conditioned, Amazing book collections. Silent environment, Places for family and children for gain skills

Name: Angelrun29
Title: Kids and literature sections are well planned and house a wealth of information in the form of books
Review: The access was smooth. Bear in mind that you need to deposit all your bags at the entrance while getting the access. Once in, smooth approach and proper guidance on what to find on which floor. The kids section is so beautifully planned and the whole colour combinations used and the furniture and layout would just keep the kids engaged throughout. The literature section also has a huge variety of books and is vast as an ocean. The source index for books is laid out in a neat fashion thus making it easy to scroll through. Only negatives are the food range and quality available in the snacking area and the fact that they do not have any memberships and so you can not carry any boks home.

Name: tnbalaji90
Title: One of my favourite places in Chennai.
Review: One of my favourite places in Chennai. Basically you will need one day to go a book tour for this place, then following days you can visit and start reading your favourite books. Well- maintained and lifts are available. The place is well furnished to sit and read, also plugin are available to charge your laptops and mobile phones. Reading sessions happen here very often and also Braille books are available here. Staffs are courteous and helpful, and you will definitely fall in love with this place for its interiors and book collection. Amidst a busy place, you can find peace here.

Name: SIVA S
Title: Best Place to Learn
Review: Very Largest library,we have 9 floors of books with different categories.almost all the subjects.we also have digital library,you can also go with your notes and laptops to take notes.we have good speed of wifi.we can spend entire day from morning 10am  to 8pm.we can also get tea,sandwiches in cafeteria like aavin,cake cafe day.parking also very big so no worries about it.go there spend time to read, only restriction is #no rental,we won't get book outside.but you can take Xerox important content you need.

Name: Srirambalaji S
Title: Book lovers paradise
Review: Built on 8 acres of land, the 9-floor library houses a total area of 333,140 sq. ft and has a capacity to accommodate 1.2 million books. We visited the library during summer vacation and could make it only the Children's section and not to all the 9 floors due to paucity of time. The children's section had a good collection of books along with reading area for kids. Kids can read the books there itself and children's books are not rented to be taken out. The children can read as many books as they want and can spend almost the whole day there as there is a huge collection of books. School children volunteer on weekends / holidays to sort out, categorize and arrange the books properly.There is a canteen in the library campus, though it is little far behind the library building. The library is maintained better compared to other government establishments. However, the canteen needs better maintenance and air conditioning, as it gets very hotter during the summer.The overall campus is very good with very little to complain about. Since it was a long weekend on summer holidays, many of the services like Aavin parlour, ATMs, snacks & soft drinks delivery kiosks inside the library building were not working.

Name: Trendsette
Title: Awesome!!!!!Comfortable reading!!!
Review: I had been only to 3rd floor and found good interesting books on religion/philosophy. There are plenty of books on all topics and also you can search your book in the computer there.. which saves your time when you are looking for a particular book.The books can be kept on the table after reading which helps you decide on the books read by others. Since they take the responsibility of returning the books back to its place it is always in the right place!!Loved every moment there and shall be visiting this place everytime i come to chennai!!!Hats off to the kind hearted people who created this wonderful place!!!!

Name: dinesh_j84
Title: A worth visiting library
Review: It is really good library with huge collection of books. The library has 8 floors with each floor dedicated for specific section. At the ground floor, there is a common reading section, wherein we can take our books and study peacefully. This is mostly used by the students preparing for the exams. In the first floor, a separate section with cartoon theme setup and wide range of books exclusively meant for kids are available. Subject books, fiction and non fiction novels, foreign languages book etc are available in huge numbers. However the library doesn't have the book lending facility. The library has a very big 2 and 4 wheeler parking space.

Name: Gugan_Ilango
Title: Large collection of books
Review: The Anna Centenary Library at chennai is government library and have a large collection of books, a must visit to see the scale of the collection

Name: Akin A
Title: Awesome Experience
Review: Must visit place for book lovers.. People doing research and preparing for tough exams won't get a better place than this..I loved the psychology and geography division..! Lil bit maintenance needed near escalator side!

Name: Karthik V
Title: Casual Visit
Review: Since this library is on the road just near to my child s school I went in for a casual visit. But was enthralled by the very big spacious library with international standards with a very was varierty and collection of books magazines and references. A wonderful place to learn. I heard it is being upgraded to a much more better facility and collection constantly.Well maintained and upkept. Will visit again.

Name: Joji J
Title: "Library with a vast collection of books"
Review: I went to the Anna Centenary Library with my friend's son who was doing his PG and I was really amazed to find the facilities and collection of books, journals and magazines. The library is situated in a vast compound and the eight storied building is also huge. They have about 200 staff working there, the facilities in the Library apart from the books include a huge auditorium, amphitheatre, conference halls, food court, ample car parking etc. The books are properly displayed in racks and seperate section for kids on the first floor with a good collection of books, CD's, DVD's, and periodicals, a braile section, facility to read own books or use laptops - all these make this library a cut above the rest. I really wonder, how they made it possible and wish every town in India has such a good library. The idea behind this library deserves appreciation.

Name: Afrin S
Title: The best Place to study
Review: Vast book collection. I love this place so much and I feel so possesive that I dislike my fellow visitors.The best Place to study.

Name: James K
Title: Ancient and Modern Books of Indian and world war a History
Review: The largest Public Library in South India. Books stored and stacked neatly for quick identification of title and author. There are multilevel floors and guides posited to help the visitors. Ideal place for family to leisurely browse through books, magazines and periodicals. There is children's section of books which will unlock the minds of the youth.

Name: Senthil K
Title: ideal place for enhancing knowledge
Review: Ideally, such a facility should be mandatory in all Districts, if not Taluks.  We have only one and everything about it from the plush carpets to the swank interiors is international about it.  You get books just about every topic in the world and the facility also boasts of a section for reading only your books that you take which is of great help to students.  I went there to verify and do some research on International Law and was astonished by the collection of law books there.  The kids section is super.

Name: tyag_1984
Title: Good place for book lovers
Review: good decent place but lacks maintenance, cleaning and up keeping. vast place with huge number of collections specially educational books

Name: shamveelahmed
Title: Biggest library in city
Review: This is the biggest library in city situated in kotoorpuram it's a land mark now,for book lovers it's a must place to visit

Name: Nishanthini B
Title: Book lovers paradise
Review: The decent crowd in own book section tell us how popular this place is among youngsters. I was awestruck by the number of columns of book found in Tamil section. The cleaning crew are trying to keep this place at its best.The food count must be improved. We are not there to eat, but we spend a whole day there. AC in few floors must be improved.Dont miss the bird's eye view from 7th floor

Name: Shyamis
Title: Wow!
Review: The library is currently organising a summer camp for kids every single day this month and next. Was there today and I should say we had great fun and they have an amazing children's book collection. My only grouse is that we cannot borrow books. It is free of cost and there is no membership involved.

Name: gangadharankaruppan
Title: Biggest and bestest library
Review: The maintenance was good. Each and every section contains all levels of books. First time, I couldn't complete a portion(8-10 pages were left) in a book which I photo copied for free.

Name: anushaSrao
Title: Good Collection
Review: Nice place to study ... decent collection. If only wifi was there I would give it 5 stars. They have an area where you can bring your own books/notes to study .. which has been very helpful.

Name: Xe10
Title: The best place in Chennai
Review: Cannot believe the state govt can run such a efficient and wonderful library.Feel sad that it is so under-utilised.What more can one ask for! Free entry/parking/security/cloak room.a food court which serves decent meal and is very cheap.Clean well maintained.Greatly indebted to those who fought for this place ,to overcome the political drama, and keep the reading culture alive.

Name: Akila P
Title: One Stop for non stop knowledge seekers
Review: Ultimate collection of books, well maintained and courteous staff. Very silent and must go place for kids. Rare collection of books are available.

Name: mrvradhika
Title: Must visit for book lovers
Review: Has books for all ages even for the blind. Large variety of books(can find anything you are looking for) and a must visit in chennai.

Name: Sriram R
Title: Vast collection of books. reference material - Must Visit
Review: The Anna Centenary Library has been set up as a modern library catering to diverse readership and research. Spanning across 6-7 stories, the collection ranges from classics, reference material, fiction and non fiction, childrens' and academic books. Given such a unique home to treasure trove, unfortunately the library lacks the subscribers it deserves. Many of the floors are empty except for couple of research scholars referring to some material. If you are in Chennai, you must try be a regular reader at the Anna Library.

Name: padmanaban2015
Title: Big bigger but not best
Review: Good ambience and environment for active reading and to have a routine hobby as reading. Needs more development on latest books

Name: vignesh d
Title: Thanks to the Government
Review: Its a great library, think about a shopping mall instead of shops full and full of books. Great place to sit and read and roam around.

Name: pshamkuwar
Title: Most Modern Liberary
Review: International & Global standard facilities, huge collection of books on all topics from Art,Science, Engineering and well known for research in life sciences

Name: mukund s
Title: Great collections/reference materials for students
Review: One of the best facility run by a state govt. lots of educational and reference materials avaialble for students of all subjects. Particularly useful for IAS/IPS/ Civil services aspirants.

Name: Shashank
Title: Paradise
Review: A paradise if you're a book lover. Refreshing to see a library so well maintained, with an impressive collection under their belt. Easily accessible by road as well. Large, spacious and well-lit. This one is for book lovers.

Name: pchandras
Title: Excellent kids section
Review: I've been here with my family quite a few times and my daughters (8 and 6 years) love the place. Great books both in English and Tamil. Children who enjoy reading can easily spend a quality 2-3 hours browsing here. I've not yet been to the sections where they have books for adults.

Name: khan25kareena
Title: South Asia's Largest Library
Review: The Anna centenary library is eight-storey structure and is South Asia's Largest library.It is a perfect retreat for all those who look forward to take a break by simply reading a book amidst the calm and peaceful atmosphere of the library.It has more than five lakhs books on various subjects.It has a Child section.tamil nadu book section,Braille sectoin etc.

Name: balakec
Title: Fantastic Library with Great Infrastructure
Review: Anna Centenary Library is situated near the Cancer Institute Adyar. The place is calm and serene. This library is one of the largest in the city with great collections of books for all subjects. The history and economics section is quite extensive. It has a Braille section and a section for old manuscripts like palm leaf which gives us great insights into Tamil literature.

Name: ArunaSrinivas
Title: Largest library in town!
Review: Huge spacious library with enormous collection of books on literature, culture, technology etc. Ideal for research, as there are plenty of books for reference. Easily accessible on the main road in Kotturpuram.

Name: Dinesh_cbe
Title: Largest library
Review: This library is probably the biggest in the country. We decided to visit this place as we planned Chennai. Have wide range of books from science, religion, literature, career related, IT, cultural and much more. Maintenance is not so great. There is plenty of space for improvement. Knowledge hub not utilised properly.

Name: Padmanabhan
Title: Net and well maintained with a large collection of books
Review: This place is probably one of the best maintained public libraries in Chennai. They have given a corporate look and feel here with top notch security, neat and comfortable seating arrangements, bright rooms and a great collection of books.Must visit place for all bookworms.

Name: Sagar M
Title: Not worth a visit
Review: The library is in dire need of attention. The structure itself is new and spacious, however the collection of books is more suited for regional literature lovers (even there, I cant vouch for the collection). Those wanting to do some research, there are no plug points for you to plug in your laptops. Stick to pen and paper. Refreshments are not available, staff is least bothered and not friendly.Even the courts have criticised the management of this library. Such a shame.

Name: girieshm24
Title: Source of Knowldge
Review: again and again this place make me to visit it was an amazing place to spend time and to gain knowledge

Name: LeenaGS
Title: A Modern Library with a huge collection to suit everyone's choice
Review: This modern Library is one of the best additions to the Chennai's public Libraries. The building and surroundings is fantastic. The collections are great. The best part is the exclusive floor with some lovely collections for Children.A must visit place for families and also for visitors.

Name: myspaceshalini
Title: Provide open source tools like word,gmail in e-learning
Review: This is Government aided learning center.But not providing the useful access in net.Simply providing wiki information it not make sense. Even using chrome browser,accessing gmail have restriction. Then how to take notes. Always user must bring notes not necessary. I dont know as you will take steps for this. If steps has been taken can appreciate.

Name: gausan51
Title: The library abandoned
Review: In fact, Anna Centenary Library is one among the landmarks for Chennai city. However, the library has not been utilised properly. The maintenance is found to be very poor and books are not available and in case the library is utilised by providing more books, it can become one among the best libraries in the world

Name: praveenramanujam
Title: Asia's biggest library
Review: This is Asia's biggest library. The collection of books is amazing. The government of Tamilnadu should concentrate to develop the facilities in this library

Name: VivekRN
Title: The Anna of libraries!
Review: The Anna Centenary LibraryMONTH OF VISIT : March 2016.LOCATION : On the Gandhi Mandapam road, Kotturpuram, large building easily identifiable.OPENING HOURS : 8 am to 9 pm everyday except Sunday. Parking available.THE "GOOD"s : -Huge library with collections in almost every subject and study, includes a BRAILLE library.               -Also has a special section for children.              -Centrally air-conditioned and very well maintained, has elevator access.              -Provides ample number of desks and tables to sit and read, with good lighting.              -Computers at every floor to search and find any book using the search feature.              -Very less crowd during the day time.              -Has a mini food outlet. The "BAD"s : -Books cannot be borrowed. My View : A great place to sit and study. Peaceful.

Name: Nahin S
Title: a big Library
Review: A big library with variety of books and all at the main city.. and the environment is also so neat...

Name: Vinoth M
Title: Book readers don't miss out this place
Review: If you are avid book reader, just knock out the doors of this library a great collection of precious vaults which you would add to your thoughts. Absolute fantastic collection of books.

Name: SudhaGovi
Title: Good  library  poor maintenance
Review: Blame the local government  for completely  ignoring this wonderful  investment . It's still a good  place with Other of books.

Name: helpothers2016
Title: All books are there
Review: Well built, all books available and the place is well maintained and located at the centre of city, with parking facilities

Name: Srikanth R
Title: Heaven for book lovers
Review: Nothing to beat the collection of books in various specialities.  It has a huge collection of books.  Everything arranged in order and maintained well. The children section is ideally designed for parents to read out the books for them in case they want to.  The library also has a cafe in case you need a munch between your reading.  You can't lend books from here.  Only reading within premises.  Still worth it.

Name: rajshekar3597
Title: goood for reading.....
Review: I love the magazine section on the 1st floor. It has almost all the English magazines both Indian and Foreign magazines like Time, The Economist, Forbes to name a few. it's sad that even those nearby are not aware of this and all these magazines remain idle on the shelves. They have a good collection of History books of all countries on the 7th floor. I even saw Nandan Nilkeni's Imagining India. I am yet to explore the other sections. These books are much better than the rubbish optimized results that Google give us. After my first visit, I have now planned to visit the Library regularly. Moreover all the sections are air conditioned.

Name: ganeshpkumar
Title: Tons of Books
Review: This is certainly the biggest library I have ever visited. It has huge collections of books from wide range of subjects. The place in air conditioned and elegantly calm. There are many high books for references normally which one can't easily afford.

Name: arthi72
Title: temple of books
Review: awesome place.free.loads of books.all subjects reference books.braille section.self reading area.the building is cool[ac].food also inside.no entry fees.a special kids section hall.

Name: NafiRiz
Title: Peaceful
Review: Its a big place that is neatly done. They have separate area for children and my kid loves it. Its very peaceful and can spend a few hours at every visit.

Name: PraveenMax
Title: My favorite place in Chennai
Review: You can find on any topic and most of the books are imported which one cant buy in his /her lifetime. The place is well maintained with AC and it has the perfect atmosphere for book lovers to read for longer hours. I usually spend around 7 hours there. People studying for competitive exams also come here often. For lectures and research scholars, it has several publications and good books for reference too. If you cant find a book, there are computers in each floors where you can search the entire library.There is one canteen (French Loaf) at the ground floor which have limited selection of food. Small hotels are nearby the library and so one have breakfast, lunch there.Must visit place.

Name: Gokhul
Title: Must Visit
Review: A beautiful place in Chennai where you have large volumes of books in 7 floors. Sad that this is not maintained properly because of dirty politics by JJ.

Name: Tamilian S
Title: Great place.
Review: Just love it. Frequent it at least once a week. Great books in psychology and film are here. I love how they've managed to keep things consistently quiet here. But, I wish they'd put in a little more effort arranging the books. Also, a database on the internet with all of its books would be wonderful. I could look it up online and then decide whether to pay the library a visit. Very comfortable though, and I feel lucky living pretty close by.

Name: snehaavi254
Title: Best Library for all age groups!!!
Review: The library is one of best with state of the art facilities and can be a best option to inculcate good reading habits to children. The children's section is designed so beautifully. Every other section is also arranged well and has a huge collection of books.

Name: SURAJ K
Title: Kids will love!!!
Review: We visited this place with family.Really under rated place.Need more maintenance to bring crowd.Kids will enjoy toy train which runs for 10 mints.There is a museum inside which has various facts about the Railways.You will love the park.With one ticket you will get Tea and kids will get cake.Kids can gain more knowledge about the train engine.

Name: Shrikant P
Title: A must watch
Review: Awesome art gallery,.. must see for everyone.Cooperative staff.Nice garden and toy train ride.The exhibition of the History of railways is well illustrated and shows many interesting facts not known to many.Models of trains are a treat to the eye.

Name: Deependra
Title: Worth it
Review: It's really worth of paying ticket cost of rs 50/- . Specially if you have a kids. In 50. You will be getting 2 rounds of ride in toy train and 10 rs snacks in the canteen.

Name: CHENNAI RAIL MUSEUM
Title: Visit with kids
Review: Thank you for your rating and review. Please do visit again.

Name: Pradeep K
Title: Child friendly Rail museum
Review: Thank you for your rating and review. Please do visit again.

Name: CHENNAI RAIL MUSEUM
Title: Well maintained rail museum
Review: Visited in 2019 with my kids.. One of the best places to visit in chennai.Kids enjoyed a lot..Well maintainedVery informativeKids enjoyed the toy train which is actually a bonus. Didn't expect that funfilled ride..Highly suggested place to visit

Name: aditya_ravikumar
Title: Nice place to take your kids
Review: Glad that you enjoyed it in 2019 and are still enjoying it! Thank you for the excellent rating and review.

Name: CHENNAI RAIL MUSEUM
Title: Rail Historic!!
Review: Glad that you enjoyed it in 2019 and are still enjoying it! Thank you for the excellent rating and review.

Name: Deba
Title: A must visit for all children
Review: visited Chennai rail museum in October 21 with my 3 year old child and wife. > Highly under rated, but really well maintained. There are really life replicas / old steam engines and engines transformed and kept outdoors. One can click pictures and also pose in them> there is a toy train which runs through the facility which is highly a great entertainment for children who find it fascinating> there is a museum inside which has various facts about the railways and engines . Extremely insightful if one is keen to know about history> also houses a small theatre which showcases a short film about the railways and especially the Ooty Nilgiri Railway railway lineRecommend for those with children for an afternoon or morning of fun.

Name: CHENNAI RAIL MUSEUM
Title: A museum with train exhibits
Review: thank you for the patience in writing so much Review and for a wonderful rating. Much appreciated.

Name: Soupy
Review: thank you for the patience in writing so much Review and for a wonderful rating. Much appreciated.

Name: CHENNAI RAIL MUSEUM
Review: Like the engine kept in the park. Well maintained museum. Kids enjoyed the Toy train raid. The authorities allowed 2 rounds of toy train rides. It also depicted the first inception of rail factory with different kinds of coaches. Had a great time there. And for adult tickets you get snacks as well. It is kind of small feel good gesture.

Name: male591970
Review: Thank you for your review and rating, much appreciated. Glad to hear that yourl enjoyed the tour in the Museum. Please do visit again.

Name: CHENNAI RAIL MUSEUM
Review: Thank you for your review and rating, much appreciated. Glad to hear that yourl enjoyed the tour in the Museum. Please do visit again.

Name: Lakshmi Balakrishnan
Review: If you are looking for a change for your kids, this is an ideal spot to take them- lots of areas to run, different train models, toy train ride, model train, play areas.. Surprising this place is not well-known in Chennai..Also, for train enthusiasts, there are many nostalgic train facts and artefacts which take you for a trio down the memory lane..One suggestion though is cool drinks can be included given the hot weather during the day..

Name: CHENNAI RAIL MUSEUM
Review: Thank you for your review, rating and suggestion. Cool drinks in tetra packs were not considered too safe, but however, we would look into other options.

Name: chrisang
Review: Thank you for your review, rating and suggestion. Cool drinks in tetra packs were not considered too safe, but however, we would look into other options.

Name: CHENNAI RAIL MUSEUM
Review: Got spare time? Want to relax? Eat? Play? Take a joy Ride, into a dark tunnel, hear the train Hoot,Watch some video clippings in a well maintained Movie Theatre, Reminisce the rail heritage,  love Art? - witness it, delve into Sculptures, enjoy the Green cover, take a cool walk, sip a hot cup of south Indian coffee, jump on a Buggie, and finish off a good meal at a Luxury ambience Coach Restaurant,  and many more .....
Wow and thank you for the lovely rating and review. Please do visit again.
Wow and thank you for the lovely rating and review. Please do visit again.

this is a very good place for a half a day outing , kids will enjoy the toy train ride and there is so much of information which is very interestingly presented . there is a movie which is screened in regular intervals , a coach restaurant , play area , very neatly maintained and very helpful staff .
Thank you for your rating and review. Will improve further and make it more exciting.
Thank you for your rating and review. Will improve further and make it more exciting.

If you want to take kids to visit some place, Chennai rail museum is a must recommended place. The place is next to the Integral coach factory. The entry fee is 50 rs per person. It has a exhibits of train dating pre-independence era. One can climb on to some of the trains and view the inside. There is also a joy train which takes around the property. Although its a short trip, the kids will love it. There are many play areas. There is a theatre which claims to screen some shows. They screen some random videos on rail. This is the only thing that I felt that could have been better. There are lot of play areas for the kids to play. This is definitely a worth to visit area with kids.
Thank you for the lovely rating and review.  will definitely look into improving the Movie Theatre area. If you have any further suggestions on this, please be free and let us know.
Thank you for the lovely rating and review.  will definitely look into improving the Movie Theatre area. If you have any further suggestions on this, please be free and let us know.

Name: Anand M
Title: Chennai's Pride and Hidden Treasure
Review: A must visit in Chennai. Would recommend this, not just for what you would expect in a Rail Museum - coach and locomotive exhibits, celebrity jottings and photos, a documentry cinema theatre, ride on a toy train - but also for a rich collection of paintings and sculptures depicting an artist's impression and inspiration of Rail. All this for INR 50 including a Free snack. Go forit!

Name: CHENNAI RAIL MUSEUM
Title: An amazing day out in the Chennai Rail Museum
Review: thank you for your feedback and highest rating

Name: Sarath Babu S
Title: Chennai Rail Museum at a glance.
Review: thank you for your feedback and highest rating

Name: CHENNAI RAIL MUSEUM
Title: Newly added piped music
Review: This is a must visit if you‚Äôre visiting Chennai irrespective of your age. The property is next to the ICF(Integral Coach Factory) in New Avadi Road. It has ample space for parking your 2/4 wheelers. I was there today & witnessed could of school buses & couple of college buses as well. For kids, it was an excursion but for the college students, it was an industrial visit.They charge ‚Çπ50 for adults as an entry & ‚Çπ15 for kids (per person). For adults, you‚Äôre also entitled for a snack(Samosa) or drink(Tea/Coffee) which is prices at ‚Çπ10.They have massive halls which exhibits their products and the evolution of Indian railways. They also have a Park where kids can play. Water & Toilet facilities are also available.Do not miss taking the ride on a toy train which is fee of cost. It goes inside a small tunnel as well apart from taking you around the property which will last for 2-3 minutes.There is also a fully air conditioned movie theatre which shows the video(around 30 minutes) about various aspects of railways including the world‚Äôs longest & fastest trains.They also have a restaurant inside. I did not go there since this visit was a sudden one.You can spend a good 3-4 hours in this place at a nominal cost.

Title: Chennai Rail Museum

You will find vintage trains, toy trains and different types of coaches and local trains models too.You can also enjoy the best food inside the luxurious coach restraint. It's really amazing to experience. Kids really enjoy the trip and they will be so curious to know how we're the trains in ancient days and how they work.So you can spend a half day exploring the museum.

This is a great museum! They have two gallery‚Äôs full of history, pictures, and artifacts, and outside they have large grounds with old rail cars you can go inside and sculptures made from metal scraps. Don‚Äôt miss the art gallery!
Thank you for the excellent feedback and rating, we appreciate it.
