Rail is various of coaches, seats, berths, and ancient palace coach.Both of ancient and modern trains are wonderful! Collection of waste tools made into statues, They are awesome...

If you wish to relive the history of railways in India, this is the place to go. The admission is free for kids till a certain age and students. For adults one needs to buy a ticket. The ticket allows you to take a ride on the toy train in the museum.  The history of railways in the city, state and country over the past 100 years can be learnt here. A good attraction to go for kids.
This rail museum is worth avist while in Chennai which is very much a huge part of the Indian Railway history. One can see many trains and it Engines which forms an integral part of the Railway lore.

Name: Alice
Title: For people who are interested in the origins of railways. Lots of Learning!!
Review: This museum is the best place to visit for those who have some interest in the history of rails in India and how the journey of trains began. The entrance fee is reasonable and even the ticket window is also made in a small train compartment. There are so many models of old trains and steam engine trains and there are many statues made of different parts of a train.We also went for a audio visual session in the museum, where you can see videos related to the history of trains and some promotional videos. Do inquire about the timings before visiting.The outside premises are clean and does have benches and some statues made of different parts of a train. We can enjoy and pass time here too. I did not see any restaurant or snack center so i would recommend to take food along with you.

Name: muthuvel r
Title: well connected and worthy
Review: metro in chennai is a blessing for ppl like me , it connected to all basic place from airport to bus stand to railway station. and you have vry frequent trains at vry affordable price.much cheaper , comfortable & safer way of trans portion in Chennai. and they have shuttle services of cars  and auto at the very entrance

Name: Krishnaveni S
Title: World of trains
Review: A beautiful museum with lots of real engines and many boghis. There is steam, diesel and electric. Prototype of sleeper compartment, first class, seater etc. Also there is the model of accident relief boghis, crane, railbus, post carrying boghis, goods etc. You can get a complete picture of Indian railways.The other attractions are the gallery with various pics of trains, a toy train which takes you around and children's park. Also a small canteen is there. Rest room and drinking water facilities are available.You can go with small children for them to get a train experience

Name: Darshank
Title: Rail museum good place
Review: When I visited Chennai I visited Chennai rail museum at avadi it's a wonderful place to know more about Indian Railway i recommend everyone to visit once

Name: rv 8
Title: Great
Review: Fun place for children under 15.. Very thoughtfully built.. Clean. Toy train tide, old models, museum and park.. Nice open space. Canteen is ok

Name: RAMAKRISHNAN K
Title: Must visit for children and adults
Review: The place is located on new Avadi road before Padi junction.The entry is open with concessions for student and children The place houses gallery of railway networks development in India especially TAmilnadu . There is movie hall and last show at 4pm . The joy ride train is available for each ticket holder free of cost . Take time to visit each engines that would take u through year 1600 and till date .. of metro rail .. There are class of bogies used .. in indian railways safety features and must visit and if u like pl say so gentlemen üíØ‚úÖ

Name: Raghu_ambattur
Title: Very interesting place to spend half a day, with kids if you like.
Review: A very interesting and active place, where one can not only view scale models of locomotives and carriages, but also see the actual engines and bogies kept for display.  A toy train ride is offered as part of the ticket.  Beautiful art work out of scrap material will surely attract the visitors, as would the real art work by popular artists.  Overall, a must-see if you happen to be in Chennai.

Name: BhushanRangnekar
Title: Nice one to visit with your kids
Review: The rail museum in Chennai is one of the very few in India (Mysore being the other). The actual museum has a lot of historical events in the Indian railways with Photographs. A lot of actual locomotives including a Steam engine and the electric one is displayed. They also have a mini train ride and a children's park. Its a good way to spend 3-4 hours with your kids.

Name: Melissa Dsouza
Title: children's place
Review: this place has all railway train models and the history of railways then they have a toy train ride as well.

Name: Onasius Fernando
Title: It‚Äôs Indian
Review: Most of the things in the museum is belongs to Indian made one so it‚Äôs don‚Äôt have a history of a world so what ever you can see the beginning to some years now very much of cultural train involved in it.

Name: jaysheel_dani
Title: Lots of trains - but can get boring after a while
Review: This is a nice innovative place in middle of Chennai with lots and lots of (and various varieties) of trains. But the place can get a bit boring by the end as this place has not been kept upto date with the new technologies. The kids would enjoy it for a while. Plan a trip of not more than an hour!

Name: Paulus54
Title: Railway carriage restaurant a must!
Review: We visited here in Feb-19 as a group of 20+ with the very enthusiastic guide who gave us a museum tour. However, the highlight was the Chennai Express at ICF restaurant. It had been open for less than 6 months. Great ambience in the rail carriage with peacock papered ceiling. Nice, cheap food served by polite staff. Unfortunately no beer to accompany the nice food, but you must go!

Name: jayakumar
Title: Decent parking and good place for kids
Review: Toy train is a highlight and my kid enjoyed a lot. There can be an option to re-take a ride on the toy train. Staff were friendly and affordable cafeteria with decent menu to chill out but not many options though. Infact I had become a kid and enjoyed a lot. Car parking was OK.

Name: Kirantp
Title: Kids will love it
Review: The museum starts with exhibits of scaled down Bogie models, engines,History, Real model of Engine ,train parts etc.Would be good for kids >8 years.After that a small movie show which kids will enjoy.Then comes the display of actual Engines, Boggies in an open park and is allowed to climb on those.This part all will enjoy.There's a Toy train Ride in the same place.Can spend around 2 hours easily.Car parking available.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Must see place
Review: This is a most important museum of the city that's well maintained by the indian coach factory .There is a an entrance fees for visiting the place.

Name: Jamila N
Title: Good place for kids -but check before you go, it is closed on Mondays
Review: Wanted to visit this place during our chennai visit as my little one is really fond of trains. So ended up here on a monday. After reaching there we got to know that it is closed on mondays. We requested one person on the gate and he told us that you can just roam around the museum but the toy train ride wont be available. So we got inside the museum and my son was really excited watching so many trains in the same vicinity. :) Really a good place.

Name: Anusuya D
Title: Nice place for kids
Review: We have visited once again to enjoy the train museum. Kids enjoyed by boarding the train . This is very nice museum . Museum about old train

Name: Ranjani S
Title: Small but Great place to view different engines, coaches and learn about Indian railways
Review: It's a popular field trip destination for schools in and around Annanagar area. Great for young kids as they get to see all these live models and take a toy train ride. Entrance is nominal and includes drinks/biscuits and a free train ride, which is a lot of fun! The train passes through a mini tunnel too!They have two new buildings which have a green design and environmental suggestions. Also a large running toy train model which shows how trains respond to wireless signals and change tracks. Don't miss it!Also don't miss the employee art gallery, where the employees have displayed their art work canvases. Scrap sculptures made from yard scrap are displayed around the campus and the artist and the idea are displayed.There is a small children's play area for kids. Some of the equipment is broken but ok. There's a refreshment bar for snacks or water.  Rest rooms are also there for use.It's a small place main coaches and engines are displayed outdoors. Indoors is the history and parts that make the engines. Old station benches and first class seats have be displayed. Along with an yesteryear car and section of current day coaches. They have a small souvenir shop on the first floor where you can buy a small coach as a memory.

Name: vmsatheesh22
Title: Good
Review: Chennai rail museum, my first visit to this type of tourist destination, good and best to enjoy few hours

Name: anil k
Title: Grandeur
Review: Very good place and the interior galleries present an assortment of photographs that will guide you through the years of formation of the Indian Railways. Model train models remain the most popular attraction among children. The outer gallery offers many models of trains from steam engines to diesel engines. Models include the Fowler plowing engine, two-story cars for carrying British officers and Gandhiji's train. All outdoor models are accessible to visitors. This museum is an ideal place for those who wish a historical or educational circuit on the railways.

Name: Ashish S
Title: Nice Museum
Review: It is a nice museum to visit as different models are available. This also increases our knowledge. Neat and clean place.

Name: Shankar N
Title: A must visit, particularly for kids
Review: This is a very underrated attraction.  Go with your kids, show them how the rails have evolved.  All the technical details of the train and the live models of the trains and engines are kept for public view.  There is also a miniature train model, where the trains work based on the signals.  Also the way ICF is maintaining the entire place in eco friendly manner.  There is a small canteen, which serves good snacks n coffee. Also, dont miss the rail coach restaurant, which mimics the restaurants of the heritage trains.  The menu is decent and cost is decent too.  Very good place for kids.  Plan atleast 4 hours in the evening.  Also has some play area for the kids.things to improve : Not much lighting in the play area and the area where live models of coaches and engines are kept.  If maintained properly, you can spend some more time here.

Name: HappySheep
Title: Interesting
Review: If you have some time to kill and are there in visiting hours, worth checking out about the history of trains in the region

Name: Purnimaaiyar
Title: Nice place to take kids
Review: We visited this place on a weekday. There was less crowd. They have a toy train ride, and parks for children to play. The museum is good and well maintained. We missed the AV show. They have specific timings for it. Overall a good experience. Ideal for children below 10.

Name: shivaraikod
Title: Heritage trains
Review: This takes us to the ancient history of trains along with showcasing modern metro technologies from ancient british era to today's modern days.

Name: Ramaswamy N
Title: Delight
Review: It's a Traveller's delight. The restored toy track, the various meter gauge / broad gauge trains, rakes, engines are nostalgia trips. Cafe is the new reason to visit.

Name: Gopinath
Title: Good
Review: place to hangout with family., especially for kids., A much knowledge sharing place., And also to know about how all our Indian Railways got evolved

Title: Pretty Poor even for a Rail enthusiast

Nothing worth seeing and the exhibition trains are pretty rundown and not looked after.Don‚Äôt bother making the trip out there

Name: Sunil D
Title: chennai rail museum
Review: +ve nice history in pictures about the rail carriagesthere is small train ride of 10 min which is fun take lot of pictures for the things made of rail scrap-venot much to see otherwise..

Name: selvambikaiyali
Title: rail museum
Review: enjoyed the family visit to there, very nice watched many old train models and engines, good place for kids, my kids enjoyed

Name: VGF2015
Title: A learning experience
Review: A must visit for children, as the layout of the park helps individuals mentally classify the reptiles and amphibians  into venomous and non venomous in their natural environment .Besides,  the informative displays educate the reader about the reptile

Name: megu
Title: Best place for kids
Review: A vast expanse of green, Guindy National Park is a one-of-a-kind park in Chennai, which is home to many species of animals and birds. A perfect location for a picnic with family and friends, the park offers a variety of amusement for kids including slides and swings. Have a look at the green side of Chennai with the biggest diversity of plants in the city.It is located about 9 kms from Chennai Central Railway Station and houses a wide of variety of birds and animals including peacocks, swans, cranes, flamingos, owls, bears, and a whole lot of monkeys and langurs.The entry fee is reasonably low and the paths inside are wheelchair friendly

Name: Lakshminarayanan
Title: Loved the adult slideüòâ
Review: Visited Oct 21, 2021 with my 2Y old. Enjoyed watching tortoise, crocodile, Snakes, porcupine, ostrich, jackal, emu, peacock, parrots and other birds, monkeys, deers. Apart from that children park is really good. and don't miss the big slide in there. Adults can enjoy sliding along with kids.

Name: Mridul Ghosh
Title: Exciting for children
Review: This place is a must go place if you are visiting chennai with little children. They would enjoy the snakes as well as other reptiles. Seeing various snakes from close proximity would definitely make their mind curious. Also the entry ticket is very reasonable with a nominal fee for camera. The place is maintained well too.Overall a good place to spend time with family. Recommended.

Name: Wil Chung
Title: Fantastic exhibits
Review: A great place to see and learn about snakes, crocodiles, lizards and amphibians. Lots of love exhibits and you're able to get really up close and personal. No different charge for foreigners (makes a change) 100rs for adults plus there is a small charge (30rs) for using a mobile phone. A really fun and inexpensive way for spending an hour or two

Name: Deadman17
Title: Good Place
Review: The place is a good outing for kids especially as they can see some crocodiles, snakes and other animals. The cleanliness of the place can be improved . Nevertheless a very informative place to say the least

Name: Piyush Singhal
Title: A good place to visit with Kids
Review: I went there with my 9 year old and he enjoyed a lot looking at wide variety of snakes and Pythons and Crocodiles and Lizards and tortoise. They also have a small museum. Overall it was a good visit

Name: Richard7
Title: Snaksess
Review: The Snake Park is next door to the Children's Park but run by a different organisation that looks after its animals. Snakes are serious stuff here with a million snake bites and maybe 20,000 deaths a year. On a weekday morning there were lots of school groups. The exhibits are mostly well designed so you can see the animals clearly. My favourite is the chameleon at the end of the trail, which was catching insects.

Name: Bhalaji N
Title: Good place needs better maintainence
Review: Typical snake park with smell. You have a wide choice of things to see and kids will have a once in a while experience. If you ask me most of the city dwellers wont even recognize most of the snakes out there. Cleaner glasses could be of great experience.

Name: Sai B
Title: Kids will love it
Review: its nice small place with collection of snacks and crocodile and some animals. Kids will surely love this place. Good entertaining place for kids.

Name: buddy_2564
Title: Not a lot of variety of snakes
Review: I expected to see a lot of variety of snakes but I was somewhat left disappointed after the visit. I would definitely have liked to see some snake display with some shows but nothing of that sort was available

Name: Amit Rit
Title: Good place for Kids
Review: This place is quite big and has good collections, clean and well maintained place overall. Snakes varieties are less but overall its a big area

Name: Vijendra
Title: Nice small place. Kids loved it. well maintained, very cheap.
Review: Ample parking space for cars. Even Sunday was not that crowded.Evenings must be preferred.They do have some good variety of snakes and few alligators, iguana, and crocodiles.

Name: Trinetra7
Title: A vising place in Chennai
Review: A variety of snake collection with some rare species. But many snakes were not fully visible and sleeping. Interesting place to visit.

Name: Vin Dosa
Title: Good place for kids
Review: Guindy snake parks is one of the best places for kids to venture and learn. a good enough place for the family to spend a few hours and the kids to learn about the snakes.

Name: Rajjat Sabhrwal
Title: Surrounded by snakes..
Review: This was really nice experience watching so many snakes together.. usually they pick up 2 or 3 activate snakes, you can continuously listen there voice... they will also show you poison and snake skin.. the experience was just awesome..

Name: KRAMA200
Title: An Attraction For Children
Review: The best part of Guindy Snake Park is that it is located centrally and easily accessible being in proximity to IIT Madras.This is a favourite joint for most of the children in City.There are many  varieties of Snakes and there would be live demonstrations scheduled every hour.Children will enjoy.Visit.

Name: BhushanRangnekar
Title: Guindy Snake park & Crocodile park
Review: The snake park is located near Guindy right next to the IIT Madras. It houses a large number of snakes such as Vipers, Cobras, Rock pythons, etc. It should be noted that the Madras Crcodile bank on ECR road is equally good with loads of crocodile species and some snakes too. Combine both of them for a truly fascinating reptile experience.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Famous picnic spot
Review: This is one of the tourist spot that is even famous among the children of the city well preferred for a picnic.

Name: Suresh A
Title: Intriguing experience
Review: Chennai snake park has an intriguing experience. For those interested in the study of snakes it is a wonderful place. Though creepy and scary at times, it is a place worth the visit. Well maintained and scientific explanations to learn about snakes

Name: namnam75
Title: Good Snake Park
Review: I was very impressed with the Guindy Snake Park.  For Chennai, it is a good attraction.  Grounds were well kept, clean and lots of animals around.

Name: Valavanur Natar... K
Title: A write up on Guindy Snake park
Review: In continuation to my posting on crocodile zoo in Nemmeli village on ECR near Mahabalhipuram & 40 kms from.city , I thought the story and picture of Reptile parks in Chennai will be incomplete,  if I dont write about the Guindy snake park also established Mr Romulus Whitaker well with in the city , where it is easy for public especially the school children could easily visit for learning about reptiles .The¬†Guindy Snake park was established in 1972 when I was in the 4 th year at Guindy Enginnering college just opposite to my college, under the¬†aegis of Chennai Snake park Trust an NGO .Chennai can be proud, thanks to Mr Whitaker to have the proud reputation of having the first reptile park in India and it covers an area of approximately an acre of land next to the children's park in the Guindy reserve forest area .The park was recognized as a zoo from the¬†Central Zoo Authority¬†in 1995 . The idea was to establish this park, primarily to maintain and display captive collection of various species of snakes and other reptiles endemic to our native area and to kindle public interest in them while prompting the them to empathize with these reptiles and protecting them thereby our eco system itself .The main focus was to attract school children primarily to show all aspects of reptiles with the actual live species on display in order to aid research and understanding all about these reptiles in nature . It was also to dispell the notion that they are dangerous to humans and therefore has to be killed if they come close to human habitat .Going by the fact that this park over the years has been attracting 7 to 8 lakh visitors , in a year mostly school children, I must say this venture is a great success in promoting the ecology .The park produces adequate revenue by way of gate collection to maintain it in good standard .The park boasts of a huge collection of an assorted variety of 23 different snakes including adders, pythons, vipers, cobras and other reptiles housed with glass frontage .The crocodiles and large lizards are kept inOpen air enclosure that is well protected from public using parapet wall with mesh .Half a dozen turtles including black variety ,a few Tortoise Star variety included ,spotted rock gecko,and Asian chameleons completes the reptiles on display .

Name: musictraveler40
Title: Great Local Zoo
Review: Really enjoyed my time here. Lots of snakes and some crocs and wonderful grounds with jackals, monkeys and peacocks. Lots of local color, people from near and far, good parking and the biggest python I have ever seen. A great visit.

Name: Mukta2016
Title: Guindy Snake Park
Review: The Guindy Snake Park is a nice place to go with kids. The park is well maintained and has a variety of reptiles like snakes, crocodiles  and lizards. The enclosures for the animals were very clean and had natural surroundings in them to the extent possible. Overall a good outing for kids.

Name: Abhishek Kumar
Title: Beautiful place to visit
Review: Beautiful place for kids, they can enjoy and play with some non-venomous reptiles. Awareness session on venomous and non-venomous snakes and reptiles also good learning

Name: TheWorldNut
Title: Go for a big fat python
Review: Good place for a one time visit with kids. Its pretty shady so not a concern when you go. They have a decent collection of reptiles with pretty informative boards. Interesting exhibits include a fat python (like pretty fat), a huge bunch of crocodiles and they also have a live show of few snakes where in one of they employees shows the live snakes in a huge glass chambers.

Name: DayaMass
Title: "Hiss"
Review: This place is so admirable. U can see a lot of reptiles here. The most important are the snakes.The attractions here are snakes,crocodiles,tortoises,turtles,chameleons,small mueseum,gharials,lizards.üêçüêçüêçüêäüêäüêä

Name: HappySheep
Title: Snakes
Review: If you don't like snakes, not the best place to go. Near Guindy and metro station, and airport. Bring your fear

Name: nageswararao g
Title: Intresting place to see reptiles
Review: Its an interesting place to see reptiles of all kinds. Located in heart of city and its a must visit place for nature lovers.

Name: Maheshkumar N
Title: Nice park to take kids for a short trip
Review: Visited the park on 5th Sept with my 5 year old son. Nominal entry fees of INR 20 for adult and INR 10 for children. Various species of snakes and crocodiles are maintained in the park. There is also a fifteen minutes live show i believe every hour where few types of snakes are shown with explanation. Overall visiting time about 45 minutes. Ample parking space is available. Closes at about 5 pm. Few shops selling snacks, beverages and ice creams are outside the park.

Name: Amit V
Title: Decent park for small kids
Review: My kid enjoyed the park, its not very big park. Small park and having reptiles. There was one show also in which one guy was showing different kind of snakes, show was good. This park is good for 1/2Hr - 1 Hr visit with very small kid.

Name: Dilip Kumar
Title: Snake kingdom right in the city
Review: A nice place to visit along with kids. King cobra, python and wide variety of snakes and other reptiles are well displayed with brief info. When we visited one python has laid eggs. It is first time that i have seen python egss - they look like rocks. It's a good experience. The place is well maintained - unlike what we expect in G

Name: Anusree P
Title: good for one time visit
Review: Easily reachable. could seedifferent species of snakes and other reptiles . good place to spend some time with your family

Name: vasan224
Title: snake park in chennai
Review: Guindy Snake Park, formerly the location of Madras Crocodile Bank Trust, is next to the Guindy National Park. The Snake Park in Chennai gained statutory recognition as a medium zoo from the Central Zoo Authority in 1995. There one can see king cobra, pythons, vipers and other reptiles.

Name: BimalDavid
Title: Yeah, can visit once!
Review: Although not very huge as I was expecting in a city like Chennai, it has good collection of snakes. It also houses some turtles and crocodiles and alligators. Can visit once, as it has an adjacent zoo. Cafeteria serves you good coffee, ice creams, sandwiches and some other snacks.

Name: Ghiri T
Title: India's First Reptile Park
Review: Guindy Snake Park otherwise called as Chennai Snake Park is the India's First Reptile Park which is located next to the Children's Park in the Guindy National Park. Here we can find different species of snakes and other reptiles and know about them. It is one of the best place to spend some time with your family during vacation and to get knowledge about reptiles.

Name: reddi_traveller
Title: Guindy Snake Park
Review: Great place to spend time with kids. Guindy National park and Guindy Snake park is side by side. The trainers here will show all the varieties of snakes and they will provide information of those snakes as well.

Name: N7510YCsaras
Title: Visit to deserted n unattended snake part
Review: Snake park is good few good and few not so good things.1. Lots of animals2. Tiger lion monkey elephant dnakes etc are available. 3. Carry own food to eat.but following are issues1. Parking problem2. Carry paper or cloth bags no plastic bag allowed, chips packet n all are banned.3. Electric vehicle not operating, only 1or2 vehicle n hundreds of visitors.4. Less shade to rest in between.

Name: JumboMumbai
Title: A great place for kids...
Review: There is so much to learn from nature.. and wild life..this is one of the must visit places after vandalur zoothere are so many snakes here - some harmless and some heavily poisonous... the best part for kids to learn is the info on the boards next to each...nearby is the guindy national park also to visit

Name: Krishnaveni S
Title: Well maintained snake park
Review: It is very close to guindy national Park. Lots of snakes are kept in glass enclosure.    Many endagered species of snakes, crocodiles and iguanas are there. Museum with lots of preserved species of snakes, reptiles also present. Good boards with information displayed everywhere

Name: 904agnesc
Title: Crowded place with animals kept in poor conditions
Review: I was told I could visit Guindy National Park.  When I got there I was informed the NP was closed to the public.  So then I visited the Guindy (Snake) Park.Very crowded, hot and basically a poor zoo where animals are kept in small cages without any enrichment whatsoever.Can be missed.

Name: Pradip Kumar Roy Choudhury
Title: must visit
Review: Great collection of snakes.Bet is to time you visit when there is a demonstration of snake venom extraction

Name: AbelPrasad
Title: Scared me to death
Review: I am so scared of snakes and crocodiles so of course, we went here. Love every minute of it and it opened up my eyes.

Name: ASHISH S
Title: Very well managed Park
Review: I have been to Delhi Zoo, Mumbai Borivali national park but never seen such an amazing Park in India which i saw in Guindy Snake Park. You name the reptile, cats, deers and you will get it. Its a clean park and pathways are very well defined. Must visit is Snake area section which has almost all the varities of Snake. Very informative for all of us. I could see that the animals are very healthy and in good shape. Enough space has been given to each animal. Alligators, Gharials are added attraction. Must visit when you are in Chennai.

Name: Bumblebee0108
Title: Good place within the city for nature lovers
Review: Having grown up in Chennai we have fond memories of Guindy park due to the numerous school excursions and college projects that i have done around nature.... the guindy national park has the snake park adjacent to it...and it's maintenance is better than the guindy park itself. However, it's maintenance can be improved very much. The glasses of the exhibits are foggy...the boards are  broken or not available...some of the enclosures are empty. It is sad that there is very less importance given to these precious gems within the city. Hope someone in the government wakes up and does something about this place. If maintained well, it can be a top tourist attraction in the city.

Name: Sram81
Title: Good place for a day out
Review: Located near IIT Chennai is this small but well maintained snake/ crocodile park. Lots of venomous and non venomous snake are there in display. Thankfully many of them were active when we were there. The display windows can be a bit more clean. Though compared to the one near Mahabalipuram this needs to do a lot more to attract more visitors.Excellent parking facility.

Name: Sebin Benny
Title: A nice time spent
Review: A nice place which any one from any age group can visit. It will be a great exciting visit for children. Even when I viaited, I could see a lot of children and family enjoying there. A well maintained place which ensures safety of both the animals and visitors. Wide range of venomous and  non-venomous snakes, crocodiles and other reptiles as well. The giant crocodiles are a treat to watch.Mobile camera usage is also free. Make sure yo are not hurting or disturbing the animals.

Name: mkchv77
Title: interesting but no guide
Review: if you are allergic to reptiles pls avoid. otherwise good place but poor maintainance and no guide available.beaware of monkeys.

Name: indiantraveller64
Title: A Unique Snake Park unlike any in India
Review: I visited the Snake Park after more than 4 decades and it is as quaint and well maintained as I remembered. You see a wide variety of snakes from Python's to Cobras to Vipers. You also have lots of Crocodiles. A must visit for kids and Adults. What I remember from 4 decades ago was that they had attendants with live snakes then who would encourage you to actually pet the snakes so as to remove your fear of them. But this was not there now. I guess there is too much traffic now a days for this to be feasibel

Name: GOPIKA J
Title: good place..
Review: It is a good park with lots of varieties of snakes and other reptiles..children will enjoy for sure..also have lots of trees..

Name: mdkhaleel
Title: Snakes and crocodiles in captivity
Review: The snake park has varieties of snakes both poisonous and non poisonous in captivity. There are two or three Pythons also. Children particularly enjoy the visit. In addition to snakes it has some enclosures having crocodiles also. They look very scary. The area is very small and one can go round it in an hour or two. The visit can be combined with Children‚Äôs Park which is just adjacent to it . The entrance fee to both snake park and children‚Äôs park is minimal ie Rs.10 to Rs. 20. The entrance is free for children upto 4 years of age. A visit with family particularly children to these places will be enjoyable and also educative. Moreover it is in the heart of the city and easily accessible.

Name: lalitha h
Title: Entertainment for children.
Review: Nice place to go with small children. Not very crowded. Different varieties of snakes, tortoises, crocodiles, iguana, gharial and also specimens of all the above were there. Young children will definitely enjoy.

Name: Shankar_Kamath
Title: Guindy snake park
Review: It is located just next to guindy national park. It has a lot varities of snakes and crocs. One python was around 17.5 feet. It also hosts rare species like star tortoises. Also has a museum inside the park. People have option to do small shopping of wooden animal models too. Kids will love it i guess. Around 1 hour can be spent here.

Name: Peter T
Title: Snakes of every variety!
Review: If you like snakes, this is your place. This snake park houses thousands of snakes of every hue, background and variety. Situated next to a zoo/cum animal park, a visit makes for a fascinating trip round snake heaven. The Park is also home for a large number of Crocodiles. A good way to spend a spare couple of hours.

Name: Aarthi R
Title: Must-do with kids
Review: Guindy Snake-Park is a regular haunt for our family and we always recommend it to visiting family and friends. There is a lot of interesting information and insights on the snakes of India along with other reptiles. The story(fact?) of how the Anaconda got its name is particularly fascinating! A must-do with kids of all ages.

Name: ravikumartalara
Title: good for kids
Review: nice place to  hangout with kids in center of citi. all types of crocodiles available.snakes also available

Name: Lilian J
Title: All about reptiles
Review: A brain child of Romulus Whittaker the place is a must visit to learn about reptiles and especially snakes. It is also easily accessible.

Name: YashiR25
Title: For Crocodiles & Snakes
Review: There is an entrance fee. Limited species of crocodiles, tortoises and snakes. Can be avoided if already have been to Madras Crocodile Bank on ECR road. The staff, at times, shows you how to take poison out of snakes.

Name: Satyan R
Title: Hissing & Crawling...
Review: Guindy National Park is juxtaposed with Adyar Cancer Institute..on the way to Madhya Kailash Temple in Adyar. The park harbours a variety of snakes like Ophiophagus Hannah (The King Cobra), Rat snakes, Vipers, Kraits & Rock Pythons. Similar to the crocodile bank its also an asylum for a few varieties of Crocodilians. Nat Geo herpetology celebrities like Mr. Gowrishankar & 'Snake' Shyam conduct STORM workshop here to educate the society on serpent rescue & relocation! We can even find birds & other wild canines here...Children will have learning & fun. Senior citizens can relax under the green canopy....being a snake enthusiast I love this place!!

Name: Sekar A
Title: You can explore more poisonous snakes
Review: They will show how to take poison from snake. If you ask any questions about snakes they will explain you.

Name: tyag_1984
Title: great place for learning
Review: Ideal place to learn about reptiles, habitats, behavior, educate yourself by asking questions. spend decent time with each reptile to know more. friendly staff

Name: Atul Garg
Title: A Bit Disappointing Experience
Review: We travelled all the way from Chennai to see this snake park but were quite disappointed as all the snakes were hidden and lying motionless in various nooks and corners. The visitors have no way of activating the reptiles.

Name: skkkd
Title: childs thrilling place.
Review: this is childs thrilling place .so many snakes and crocodiles in this park.peacocks also here.but my self and my child likes white peacock .

Name: Shakir Sharfraz A
Title: Snakes and green iguanas!
Review: We went around lunch time. The pythons were mostly lazing around without any movements. Probably if we had been bit early we might have seen some python activity. The star of the show was green iguana brought in from the Americas! Watch my videos of the snakes and the green iguana in my youtube channel! The link to the channel is in my profile.

Name: Josephsamuelot
Title: Located adjacent to National park
Review: Must see location for the kids, they love to see snakes and crocodiles. Here they have a program to show how they catch snakes ans takes venom from snakes. Bit crowded in the evenings.

Name: daredevil31
Title: Chennai; adventure; things to do; snake; reptiles
Review: It's about 18 km from airport. Get a prepaid cab or ola/ Uber. The park is open from 9am - 4pm. The snake park is a very well maintained park. It has a interpretation centre and museum. Other than snakes they have very well displayed crocodiles, gharial and lizard. Their are plenty of live reptiles in a very good health. Plenty of mosquitoes when I went so please carry odomos. There is a very good cafeteria as well. Books and t-shirt can be brought.

Name: tnbalaji90
Title: Good place for a family outing
Review: Good place for a family outing. Enjoyable place for the kids.  Besides several snakes in cages, various birds are also on display.

Name: Rohit S
Title: Good for killing an hour
Review: Many of the cages are just empty. The whole park is not managed properly. The water in the cages looks like they haven‚Äôt been replaced since ages. Many of the cages are either too crowded or very small. Entry fee is just 20‚Çπ. They should start charging more and keep the place good for living animals there.

Name: Deepanarun
Title: Crocs yikes
Review: Its a very well maintained crocodile park. With safe enclosures, good sign boards and also kept quite clean. There is a small snake park as well and they have venom extraction at certain times. Very good place for kids as it is safe and kids can learn a lot.

Name: Praveen S
Title: Best for childrens
Review: One of the biggest park in chennai located in IIT, peaceful place next to anna zoological park, must visit

Name: Nithu J
Title: Time pass
Review: Nothing extraordinary. I'm from Trivandrum v have a snake park which is slightly better than this one . So this place don't impress me more . Can visit for spending half an hour maybe . Carry umbrella use sunscreen . It's damn hot in chennai.

Name: samvarth
Title: repetetive snakes
Review: This is a place good for people who want to see snakes .But not much variety of snakes are present .But whatever limited quantity they have will still scare you .there are a couple of crocodiles as well

Name: velayudhan
Title: Good Amusement park
Review: I have been here last week with my cousins . It was good time to spent here in the Snake Park . The Entire amusement are was enjoyable i loved the stay there . We were able to see the large variety of snakes in the national park .

Name: Afrin S
Title: crocodile park
Review: Beautiful park in the heart of Chennai! The crocodiles were majestic and take center stage at this park.Wonderful place for kids to spend some quality time.

Name: VijayDevaraj
Title: Good place to watch huge Crocs population
Review: All is well, but the parking is charged premium & you will need to pay even if you outside its official spaces.  As very little parking available & no authority has control on it. They blamed Tenderer/ Govt.

Name: rajani k
Title: Abode of the snakes - one of the finest products of Evolution
Review: This Snake Park is located close to Guindy National Park. The Park dedicated to Snakes although there are few lizards, Chameleons, Crocodiles, Aligators and Turtles as well. Several species of snakes are seen here. Russels Viper, King Cobra, Rat Snake, Boar, Python etc. are so fascinating.  This is also a breeding center for snakes.

Name: Mart152015
Title: Snakes and Crocs
Review: A great find! Lots of different snakes and crocodiles with clear and informative information. Easily accessible to get around and a range of videos and easy to view tanks / areas with the reptiles in. Excellent value for money.

Name: Narasimhananda S
Title: Snakes and Snakes
Review: Here you get all types of snakes in their full form. You can also see how poison is extracted. Be ready for a slithering experience!

Name: RAMAKRISHNAN K
Title: Children s delight snake park
Review: I would say the snake park has many type of snakes , turtles, crocodile and lots of details given about each of the species..One must carefully read at each enclosures where these are housed.Otherwise entry is next to children park and has separate ticket counter for that..Children must be taken to get to appreciate venomous and other type of snakes ..

Name: rama151
Title: Snake park must see
Review: The snake park is next to children park with a separate entry. It houses many types of Indian snakes which enthrall children and elders as well.Lots of crocodiles also housed here which is good to watch

Name: bishnu s
Title: Watch one of the best creations of evolution in action
Review: Guindy Snake Park is a separate section within the Guindy National Park dedicated to Snakes and few other reptiles. Snakes are one of the best creations of evolution on the earth. They are unique reptiles and also quite distinct from other animals.  You get to spot several species of snakes here like Python, King Cobra, Krait, Vipers, Boa, Rat Snakes etc. You get to know a lot about snakes here - their food habits, the way they reproduce, their habitats, their venom etc. Apart from snakes, you can see crocodiles, lizards, crabs, alligators etc. here.

Name: krazikams
Title: Small Snake Park
Review: Unlike zoos and crocodile bank, this small little snake park is located in Guindy and offers children a glimpse into world of reptiles and wildlife. Lots of trees are there offering shade and fresh air to inhale. Needs more maintenance to attract tourists.

Name: Angelrun29
Title: A slimy experience
Review: Having been in Chennai for so long; this was the first time I went to the Snake park and it was indeed an enlightening experience. Many of these reptiles are on the verge of getting extinct but for the efforts of national parks like these. Well maintained place and all the snakes and other reptiles are kept in their natural-like habitats. Overall, it was an enlightening and knowledgeable experience.

Name: Rajesh k
Title: Reptiles place !!!
Review: Several varieties of snakes can be seen here. You can see all dangerous snakes like Sand Boa, Pythons, King Cobra, Viper, Kraits, Rat snakes etc.  You can also see demonstration of catching snake and removal of their venom. Apart from snakes, some crocodiles can also be seen here.

Name: the_tanmoy
Title: Must see place - lot of information about Snakes
Review: Must see place - lot of information about Snakes in there. There are lot of different varieties of snakes. A few other reptiles are also there. There are videos played inside the museum and they are very informative. Just next to Guindy National Park - visit both together!

Name: Satya_Abhiram
Title: Not worth if you are a traveller and from outside
Review: Not much to see. No Snake show like before. Houses few snakes and few crocs.  Do not plan specifically for this place, unless if ur looking for places to see with in the city. Theres a children park adjacent to it. Few deers and fox put in there.

Name: Rucha121
Title: Good breathing space in City
Review: Snake park located near Guindy offers a big breathing space with lots of trees and bushes and good collection of snakes and reptiles. Frequented by school children, better to avoid summer days. There is entrance fee.

Name: Rajani K
Title: It's a Reptiles place
Review: This is located within the Guindy National Park. Crocodiles, Alligators and several species of snakes are housed here.  We got to see the python, cobra, krait,boa etc. here. Perfect place to get yourself familiar which several species of the snakes and watch them in some action in captivity.

Name: sameernandan
Title: Worth if you saw snakes only rarely
Review: Visited it thrice over the last 25 years. Pros:1. Located at the heart of city 2. Houses currently about 10-12 species of snakes including cobra, viper, boa and python among others3. Also has few species of crocodiles and alligators. 4. Has monster lizards and turtles too.5. Can spend pleasant part of an hour 6. Tickets are cheap (20/- per adult or camera)7. Generally not overwhelming crowd 8. Has a food court just across the road, though quality and pricing are not that pleasing9. Place is safe in all respects 10. Mini zoo (not Chennai Anna zoo) with children's play park (with separate tickets) right adjacent to snake park Cons:1. Losing more species every year2. No king cobra 3. Glass enclosures poorly maintained and only semi transparent at areas4. Concerned workers left a flock of live chicks within few snake enclosures. It is heart wrenching to see them cowering at a corner, mortally afraid of impending death at any moment, all the days that they live! Finally if you are a new visitor to Chennai, with not much experience of seeing snakes in real life, you will find it engaging

Name: Jothilingam E
Title: Nice place to visit
Review: Snake lovers ,you will enjoy and can view variety of species.But for others may not that much...Nicely maintained,thanks to Government & staffs.Clost to Famous Guindt engineering college and also IIT-chennai and all this situated near Governer house in Guindy

Name: WicklowEims
Title: Pleasantly surprised at how much there was to see here.
Review: As the Zoo was closed after the Cyclone - we came here to look at reptiles as were pleasantly surprised. A very good central learning zone with video's and facts. A god mix of snakes and Crocodiles and turtles. There's a kids park next door with Deer so a very easy way to spend a few hours with kids. Also they dont have foreigner prices so for 6 of us it was only 90 INR (2 kids were free) Totally recommend it for an afternoon for adults and children.

Name: Akvince
Title: Very interesting.
Review: A snake farm which extracts venom by hand from deadly snakes in order to prepare antidotes for snake bites.

Name: Vineeth K
Title: lots of snake & crocodile species, but doesnt look like its maintained well
Review: There are lots of snakes & crocodile species. But lacks good maintenance, may be because of less staff or some other reason. Place is not smelly but the cages where snakes & croc's are kept seems to bit old & showing some damages/wear & tear which creates a fear in our mind. Even saw on cage where they have kept a big python is just having a small lock similar to one we use in our normal wardrobe & even doors are having pretty gaps in between which may be enough for snake to take tour of surrounding places ;).

Name: Ravikanthvadamala
Title: Amazing Creatures
Review: Visited int he Summer and my son loved the place lot of crocodiles and just don't know till the visit on the number of types of crocs and alligators available in the world.

Name: vignesh d
Title: Worth a visit
Review: Good to see the crocodiles and snakes, its fun to see the crocodiles lying with open mouth, park also there. Good outing place.

Name: pshamkuwar
Title: Unique Place of Attraction
Review: Recommended place for a day's a Picnic !!!!!!Travelers must visit along with children and  adults as well. Good to teach children on nature, especially wide varieties of crawling species

Name: Srinivas S
Title: good park within city limits
Review: It's good place for kids to spend some time within the city limits to see animals, birds. Must watch at least once if you are around

Name: Ra_Radha
Title: Need better maintenance
Review: Compared to Madras Crocodile Bank, this is smaller. It needs good maintenance, place is smelly of animal excreta and even landscaping is not maintained. Good collection of animals for kids to show and educate them about wildlife.

Name: raja p
Title: good snake park in chennai
Review: so many crocodiles i observed here.i have seen snakes and peacocks in this park.maintenance is good.

Name: Himanshu Shekhar
Title: Good place for kids to enjoy the zoo
Review: Small but have all the animals to view. Specially for kids & Childrens to enjoy small walkable distance over all around. Good for picnic place.

Name: Nivedhitha P
Title: Worst experience in metro
Review: Worst staff in any metro station. Never act polite and very lethargic in passengers concern. We have faced Very rude behaviour many times

Name: Cyrus
Title: Very good and fast
Review: In Chennai this more affordable and comfortable transit. It covers pretty much all key areas in the city but not covers the IT corridors like OMR TAMBARAM etc..

Name: Mohamed Meeran
Title: Fast
Review: Best Transportation in Chennai City, Time Saving and cool to travel, On Time Arrival, very comfortable to Travel

Name: K S G
Title: Good metro launch by Indian government .  Good maintain , clean ,
Review: Good Service Good metro launch by Indian government .  Good maintain , clean , But most of the tkt counter employee don't understand other language , they understand only Tamil , you need to help your self if you are not from tamilnadu . Atleast Metro management should give training to atleast understand our national language Hindi or English .Or keep a signboard out side of metro we understand only Tamil, of you don't know Tamil Help your self

Name: Satish Kumar
Title: Metro ride from Alandur to Tondairpet
Review: This  is a blessing as it cuts shorts of lot of time if people need to travel to North Madras from Alandur.

Name: Asha
Title: Reliable and safe
Review: The Chennai metro rail is a complete hastle free and comfortable mode of transport when you need to reach your destination. Specially when you want to reach on time as per your plans. I had recently lost my card holder when I was getting out of the station, and the staff had actually preserved it and handed it over to me when I enquired the next day about seeing such a thing. So glad to have received such a favour. Grateful for the Chennai metro rail! :)

Name: Rakshith R
Title: Awesome
Review: amazing and well maintained metro rail..Not much rush in the metro.. little expensive compared to delhi

Name: KASI VENKOBA RAO
Title: Fantastic Metro
Review: I landed at Chennai Central on the morning of 12th March.  I had planned to proceed to Pondicherry for which I had to go to Koyambedu Bus terminal. When I came out of station, I was told that there is Metro from Central which takes to Koyambedu. I reached Metro Station. I was wondered to see the station underground. I purchased a ticket to CMBT and reached the Platform. Wow.. It was fantastic.  I was wondering whether I am in Chennai or in any International airport.  Such is the ambience.In two minutes the Metro arrived. The outer door and the Metro door opened. I made my entry into Metro.  In about 25 minutes, I reached my destination. The journey was so comfortable.   Its a really time saving journey. Thanks to Chennai Metro for wonderful  maintenance.

Name: Mohammed Shoaib
Title: I dont like it
Review: There is very low AC. The government charges high for tickets saying metro train saying it provides luxury. Is there any difference between ordinary train and metro train other than the fact that it runs underground and it has got orange lights to make it look good.

Name: travelovermom
Title: Great way to avoid the traffic and noise
Review: It‚Äôs a shame the metro is not used as much as it should be. It covers the city quite well from the airport and stations are conveniently located. Must be used by more people to reduce road use and traffic

Name: Sud D
Title: Nice asset for Chennai
Review: I use the Metro whenever I am in Chennai. Clean, efficient and comfortable. Hope they continue to maintain it

Name: Hooray H
Title: Efficient but ugly
Review: Another rail built on ugly bridges, just like in Bombay & Bangalore.Do Indians only know how to copy the Thais?I'm sure we can do better.No Aesthetic sense.

Name: Praveen James
Title: EFFICIENT AND AFFORDABLE
Review: Though the Metro service is still in it's expansion phase but it is really fast and affordable. The interesting feature of Chennai Metro is that the digital clock shows a countdown of the arrival time of every train on the respective platforms...

Name: Anand M
Title: Unsafe stations, hazardous flooring
Review: The Chennai Metro stations are completely enclosed. There is no escape route in case of an emergency - fire or terrorist attack. The flooring too is extremely slippery. Kolkata Metro, the oldest in the country, has thought about this - more than 20 years back.

Name: Frank Calberg
Title: Excellent metro
Review: The Chennai metro is excellent. It runs regularly and on time. It is based on a token system which is easy to find out. It is clean everywhere, and there are people to help at every station. There are clear signs

Name: SagarVS
Title: Neat and economical
Review: A neat and convenient option to travel in this city. I use it frequently and I have purchased the e-card  which is super cool. My only complaint is that some of the stations are not airconditioned and its difficult during hot days.

Name: PitoyAmpil1941
Title: the Chennai Metro Rail offers a comfortable ride
Review: the Chennai Metro can get one almost anywhere in Greater Chennai comfortably n quick..... if one does not mind doing a bit of walking too.... a cheap alternative to taxis to n from the airport..... some transfers at certain stations may be involved to get where you wish to go.....

Name: Ddharaniikota
Title: Best Metro
Review: The stations are super clean and well maintained. Staff is well trained and communicate well. Since I have mostly taken the metros on Saturdays and during non peak timings, I also love the fact that the trains are mostly empty:)

Name: Suresh Swaminathan
Title: Kudos Chennai Metro Rail
Review: Very cheap, comfortable and safe travel from Chennai Central to Ashok Nagar. It's eco friendly travel. The comfort of AC and low cost was remarkable. A must try on your next visit to Chennai.

Name: harish
Title: Transport facilities in Chennai
Review: Good to travel , stop to stop minimum 10/- maximum stops amount is 50/- max , Sunday is 50% offer on total amount.

Name: KARTHIKb87
Title: Chennai metro rail-boon to chennai
Review: CMRL is only clean and punctual transport in chennai. Its well maintained clean and professional manner. Its only most modern transport in Chennai. Underground stations are Air conditioned and had India's first  Platform doors which will open simultaneously with Coach doors and close again to ensure A/c wastage not happened and to avoid people access to tunnel and tracks. CMRL stations are well accessible by main roads and most of stations are located in nearby of Chennai suburban railway stations, MRTS, bus stops, Airport etc.,Its only transport connecting all Transport terminals-Airport, Chennai Egmore station, Chennai Central station, CMBT-Integerated bus terminus. Its only fastest transport in chennai. Totally running across 45Kms across chennai in both Underground and Viaduct. CMRL had Asia largest station in kitty -Chennai Central Metro station.CMRL stations  is recently well connected with neighborhoods by feeder services.

Name: Traveller G
Title: Typical Indian mainline station
Review: Easy to find your way around, big signs with the trains and platform info. Lots of food places. Toilets could be better!

Name: Explore13639
Title: Hotel to airport
Review: Cheap and efficient way to the airport from Egmore without taxi & traffic hassles!  Cost me 60 rupee plus auto rickshaw from hotel to station 50 rupee.  Clean fast and efficient.

Name: George Georgiev
Title: Metro Chennai
Review: Chennai metro will go to most of the destinations you will want, and if not so, you can take the rail trains, they will broaden your scope of places.

Name: Susanta Kumar De
Title: It was great to have a feel of Gopalpur on sea.
Review: Small but beautiful beach with water sports. From Hotel Sea Pearl first floor balcony one can get beautiful panoramic view of the sea. However services and room cleanliness needs improvement.

Name: Balasubramanian R
Title: Chennai Metro Rail
Review: Chennai metro rail limited is the owner of Chennai Metro. It is a rapid transit system providing services to the people of chennai city. There are two lines Blue and green lines operating from Air port to Washermanpet in two different routes. Chennai metro is third largest in India.

Name: tsk0101
Title: A must visit metro
Review: Connecting airport to different parts of city, Metro rail is a good way to travel. It is not crowded like in Mumbai and Delhi.

Name: #amosamiyanayeküéß
Title: üöá
Review: compare to some others state quit high about tickets rateüéüÔ∏è but technically it's good to reach at proper destination... you may have direct way from cmbtüöå to airport‚úàÔ∏è

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: Amazing journey
Review: It was amazing. As we were travelling for the first time by metro the speed really surprised us. It was an amazing experience. We enjoyed the trips. We travelled most of the chennai before in local trains. But on Metro this is the first time. It reaches the station before we feel it picks up the highest speed. Its almost like lightening speed.

Name: Jothilingam E
Title: Excellent infrastrure,service
Review: One of best infrastructures and services with all amenities in all the stations.Must travel in all routes as there is no congestion like Electric train routes.We enjoyed in less time travel.Europe,Uk,Singapore now listed with Chennai metropolitan..keep up good service

Name: Pradeep S
Title: On Time
Review: Availed this service from Airport to Vadapalani when there was big traffic snarl on Road and Cabs were not available. Metro Rails are Clean and at the hours I travelled were not crowded. Fares are very reasonable

Name: Subra
Title: Value for Money!
Review: Mount Road to airport took me 30 minutes and Rs 50 vs 90 minutes and rs. 500 by cab. Way to go...! loved the trip

Name: Vinod
Title: Travel in Chennai metro
Review: Chennai Metro does not allow carrying of scissors in your baggage. I was traveling out of Chennai to take the train from Central when security personnel at Ashok Nagar Station asked me to remove the scissors from my shaving kit. While traveling by air, you can carry such stuff in your cabin baggage. Passengers should avoid traveling by Chennai Metro when they carry such things in their baggage.

Name: mnrkrishnan
Title: Airport, Central Station & Koyembedu Bus stand well connected by Metro
Review: Chennai Metro is ideally designed to cater to the needs of passengers who come to this Metro city from all over the world.  Chennai MGR Railway station, Chennai International Airport and the Koyembedu Main Central Bus stand are all well connected by this Chennai Metro.  The metro stations are well maintained.  The ticket charges are very reasonable when compared to Mumbai and Delhi Metros.

Name: Delecta J
Title: Pleasant ride
Review: Chennai metro is super convenient, our first travel Was from Guindy to Annanagar , we bought a special ticket which was 100 rupees for a person , we were not able to find the special class, the general one was good with A/ c and clean , Overall experience was good

Name: Anandhan R
Title: Dont miss to use it
Review: Good option to use, especially if you are travelling from Airport to city  and Vice versa. Very neat and clean

Name: Bhalaji N
Title: Good for long travel in city
Review: I am not a commoner for the metro travel. But using it for my airport and railway station visits. This is a a good way to do. Your travel time is committed and you know when you will reach. No risk of missing behind or running around. Its quite empty most of the hours. I had seen its crowded when we travel during office begin and end hours. It could pick more people at a lower fare for shorter distance

Name: DRRP2014
Title: Quickest way to travel within Chennai City
Review: Metro rail is a boon to many people who want to go to a place without taking car , in order to reduce the time of travel & money .  Unfortunately only certain areas of the city are connected by Metro rail services.

Name: Krishnamoorthy G
Title: Cool Travel
Review: It is very convenient and fast to travel in Metro, in Airconditioned comfort, less than that of a cost of an auto ride. No traffic jams. you can reach at the schedulard time.

Name: Totini
Title: The best till date
Review: Chennai metro described in one word would be 'class apart'.The best metro I've boarded till date.I would suggest each and every person visiting Chennai to avail the metro atleast once even if you don't prefer public transports.I basically prefer public transportation to uber or a private car, but I hate too crowded places.chennai metro has been completely a different experience.It's frequent arrival and the high-tect coaches are commendable given the fact that it's completely manufactured in India.There aren't much commuters even during rush hours.The best thing  is it's connectivity to the airport. I don't have to hire an uber everytime I'm boarding or departing.

Name: The Indian Hobo
Title: Good Connectivity from Airport to the City
Review: Chennai Metro is well connected with the northern part and centre of chennai. it reduces the travel time,

Name: c.b.uparkar
Title: Chennai metro
Review: Good connectivity. From airport to most city area. MBT exit could be better. But some display above the doors was not working in the  coach travelled

Name: Y4world
Title: Travel to Airport
Review: Clean on time and informative. Security is good everything checked before boarding. English speaking should be good

Name: iamsvs
Title: Reduced travel time
Review: Earlier to reach places like Anna nagar from Chromepet used to take a minimum of 1 to 1.5 hours due to traffic.  Metro is a boon as I could reach there in less than 45 minutes.  Also, it is clean and on time making it easy to plan your activity.

Name: Rangakumar
Title: Speed of travel
Review: Well connected to the locations where local train is not coveredgood frequencyneed to take care of maintenance

Name: Gairik M
Title: Wonderfully maintained trains
Review: We took a metro ride from Anna Nagar to Chennai Central. The trains were small and very neat. The trains were not crowded at all. The metro services are very good as trains ply at a frequency of every 10 mins. The route entails overground and underground tracks. We enjoyed our ride.

Name: gpadmana
Title: FAst,reliable efficient,  but a bit costly, mode of transport.
Review: Pluses: 1. Fast 2. Connects Airport to Central and beyond 3. Goes through almost the entire Mount Road stretch. 4.another line connects airport to the bus stand (Koyambedu), Egmore etc. 5. One can change to the normal electric train at Guindy. 6. Now, last mile connectivity through cabs has been added. 7. overall a good addition to the already good public transport.Improvements: Reduce the fares

Name: sathish
Title: Metro - Best mode of transportation
Review: Chennai metro - one of best mode of transportation available in Chennai  for commuters. It's one of the fast transportation mode available next to suburban train. It's is the third largest metro system available in India. It covers a length of 45 kilometres. The Chennai Metro Rail Limited (CMRL), a joint venture between¬†Government of India¬†and the¬†Government of Tamil Nadu¬†built and operates the Chennai Metro. The system has a mix of underground and elevated stations and uses¬†standard gauge.¬†The network consists of two¬†colour-coded¬†lines. The services operate daily between 4:30 and 23:00 with a varying frequency of 10 to 20 minutes. There are 42 trains with four coaches each, making a total of 168 coaches, operating in the first phase. The train length is 86.5m. It's speed is about 80km/h. It's headquarter is at Koyambedu. But the price is bit costly compare to other mode of transportation. Overall it's a rapid transportation system for commuters. Happy journey.

Name: Anand
Title: Fast and safe commute
Review: Metro is relatively new in Chennai compared to other megacities. So just for the experience went with family, although a call taxi would've been cheaper and straight-forward for the same destination.  For single journey we got tokens. At the entry station we scan the token at gate, and at the exit station the gate swallows the token. The metro train itself was standing two floors above ground, reached via escalators.  At first we were confused because the train door did not open, and there were no buttons on the door to open it.  Another passenger explained that doors are closed until the last few minutes in order to save air-condition.  So, three minutes before the train starting time the doors opened automatically and we entered the refrigerator-cold compartment.The station and the train were clean and well-maintained.  The commute was mostly above the ground on a bridge, which was interesting. I can see how much Chennai has evolved in the past many years.  Metro is very much a welcome relief, at least for the sake of fresh, cool, clean and safe public transport around the city.

Name: kurien2014
Title: most comfortable commute
Review: The metro from airport to various locations is a pleasure especially during peak hours. No rush and over crowding it is yet to be fully appreciated by people who are used to driving around.

Name: SAAGOBAA
Title: smooth ride
Review: smooth ride clean and view of city and comfortable. it stop most of major attraction and most important is it stop ;near airport also

Name: reubenranjanfern2017
Title: Good Experience.
Review: It is very convenient to the metro. Very fast mode of transportation. Very economical. Stations are good well maintained.

Name: Deadman17
Title: Public Transport at its best
Review: This is the fastest mode of transport in Chennai. The coaches are clean, the tickets are cheap, the cost is modest and the speed is fast. The trains run regularly during day time while it is a bit infrequent at night. The best mode of transport to and from the airport and the train station.

Name: TravellingSands
Title: Very Convenient and quite clean
Review: Chennai Metro connects airport with the main railway stations of MGR Chennai Central and Egmore and the interstate bus terminus (CMBT) through the green and blue lines.

Name: @TraveLover
Title: Night trip and faster one ( safety )
Review: I travelled from chennai airport to vadapalani. Thpugh inam a chennaite,  i travelled for the first time as i go onlu by cab. But that day no ola ubder cab driver picked my call. So i was forced to choose metroI think it was the last trip for that day to go to central. Station staff were tired.  Station wore a deserted look.  Not very bright. I used metro at uk beijing Hk Malaysia and dubai. Definitely they are much better. May be. Over the years things might improve. I wanted to use the auto ticket issuing kiosk. But one staff guided me to the human operarating counters. I tried to forget that i am in a place where everyone speaks my language and tried to guide myself through displays and signs. Not very comfortable i would say. Finally forced to ask thw housekeeping ladies at top for a query(!). Statiom was clean and platforms were mopped even during the last trip. Train came. But started after 15 min. Waited. And atlast train started with thud. Lot of noise the train makes, which i have never noticed in other countries. Rails creeky scratching noise coach turns at the time of halts during eash stop at stsations.. quiet noisy. Few passengers only. Coach was clean.  Announcement system function well. Got down at vadapalani.station was little dark.got down through steps.little weird. Since i know chennao fear wasnt my mind. But if a foreigner or other state guys,  definitelt balls would roll under their belly. Not very clean in the station corridor. Cigrette bits papers thrashes in the parking area.  Came out near SIMS gate.  Got an auto and whizzed off

Name: Senthil K
Title: clean, comfortable and quick
Review: One of the best things to happen for commuting in Chennai.  Clean, comfortable and very quick travel.  Trains are on time (at least till now).  May seem a bit on the higher side, but is definitely much lesser than a cab or an auto.  One trip for passengers on a day visit.  Take the day pass which is priced at Rs.150/- out of which Rs.50/- is refunded at the end of the day in any of the Station.  This pass has unlimited trips for the day and is not restricted to one person.

Name: R S
Title: CONVENIENCE HAS A PRICE
Review: Very friendly service, clean platforms, very neatly maintained trains arriving just on time. Yes, the charges are not on par with the regular local trains. But, Metro is way above those pathetic trains.

Name: Krishnaveni S
Title: Good service
Review: This is a recent addition to the public transport system of Chennai. Well maintained train and stations, comfortable seats and quite economical. Fast as well.

Name: Passport648127
Title: CHENNAI'S METRO RAIL
Review: This is an excellent addition to Chennai's transport systems. Elegant , good looking , smooth , noiseless , fast. Not costly. Get a Season ticket if you are a regular user. and travel as you please. Safe as doors close automatically-. Enjoy excellent views of chennai as you travel along-Linking/  common ticketing of road transport and metro  hasn't yet happened ( as in London ), but is cards.Suggestions:1. Print and circulate freely , colorful charts , smart booklets showing routes , time schedules , ticketing ,costs.2. Improve signages inside stations with bold , clear , easily visible narrations.3. Enhance security , particularly in early morning and late hours.4 . Ensure against people defacing trains , stations : catch and punish them .5 . New routes: publicise details clearly through Media , booklets , meets. Show time schedules and keep  to them.Complete them extra quic6 Quite some damage has been done  to roads , buildings , parks etc., while laying Metro tracks; Attend to them quickly and with empathy to  make things look good;  use consultants.7. Have  periodic professional studies on Commercial viability / returns . passenger comfort ,usage, srinivasan sundarsrinivasan sundar

Name: Ganesh K
Title: Chennai s pride
Review: Metro rail is a dream come true for the people of Chennai and it has become presitiages land mark. Well maintained and easy to access to travel many parts of Chennai. Friendly staff's and easy to understand the access and routes. Time saving and comfort are the main key's. The only issue is they should extend the trains till mid night. Maybe in the future round the clock service can be helpfull.

Name: A.Thanigaivel
Title: No sign board at conspicuous spot
Review: There is no sign boards for easy identification of enroute stations at conspicuous spot make inconvenience to passengers lead to miss their appropriate train. I was misled and travelled to different destination.

Name: CK T
Title: Clean, Nice, Efficient
Review: Very new and clean subway. We travel from Parry's Corner to Anna Nagar without much trouble. The staff is very helpful in assisting the traveler to purchase the train token.

Name: Narasimhan G
Title: High Court to DMS
Review: Easy to shuttle between High Court and DMSReason One being Parking difficulties and Rush hour Traffic

Name: Srinivas S
Title: Well maintained
Review: I guess Chennai Metro is the only one in South India with underground tracks. It's well maintained though they can improve directions especially where there is a connectivity.

Name: Karuna S
Title: Clean transport
Review: Very clean. Well indicated. Good access. Negative point about staff helpfulness. Seem not knowledgeable about area.

Name: CuriousMaai.com
Title: Simply Use It: No regrets; Only Joy
Review: Especially, the one to Airport; It is a great boon to passengers with minimal luggage going to Airports.  Airport Metro Station is directly connected by walkway and walkalator to the Airport by which one can directly reach the Check-in counters!  Domestic or International!  Also to the arrivals area.  Trolley not allowed.  So beware if you are carrying heavy luggages.

Name: sanil8217
Title: Nice add on to city
Review: very clean , AC and always on time very convenient to travel in Chennai heat and avoid high price taxies and autos

Name: balkivinod
Title: Good for city
Review: The metro is well  connected in the city.  I usually take airport to ashok nagar and vice versa.  Found to be convenient and time save. Even tried teynampet to Ashok Nagar through Alandur.

Name: Suresh V
Title: Future mass commuting..!
Review: Very tidy and new - excellent timings, traveling amidst the heavy traffic routes, this will be game changer for mass commuting sooner.

Name: Sanjesh Chennai
Title: Chennai Metro
Review: Neat & clean and nice services. Travelled from thirumangalam to Chennai Airport. Good for those who travel to and fro chennai Airport. Fast and reliable .

Name: Fareeth
Title: wow journey
Review: My first jurnwy was amazing...wow experience.  Price was quiet high but the quality was there. Clean  and neat

Name: mikhailv801
Title: Great and very easy to reach the airport
Review: I have used the Chennai Metro. Very clean and confortable! very fast to reach the airport! Thank you very much for your service!

Name: nihasri
Title: Can see main city
Review: Instead of taking ola r uber, better go in metro rail to see around chenai  ,hope i maximum covered .train and station was clean and neat

Name: Rajagopalan
Title: Metro train
Review: Underground metro stations are very decent and completely air-conditioned. Trains are also very good. Chennai central railway station can be reached from any other station within 30 to 40 minutes.Maintaining the trains and stations are in the hands of commuters.

Name: Rita A
Title: Very clean and well maintained
Review: For Chennai standards the Metro stations and trains are very well maintained .On time performance every time  I travelled on the train.

Name: whirlwindexplorer
Title: TRULY WORLD CLASS
Review: Metros are a most welcome addition to the metropolis of Chennai. We feel proud to find the stations so clean and well maintained; trains running on the dot, coaches clean and comfortable, staff extremely helpful & courteous and so very affordable. Parking lots at every station, Smart bikes and feeder cab services are very thoughtful add-ons. Comparable with the best in the world.

Name: Rajagopalan B
Title: Commute in comforts and ease- Avoid traffic hassels
Review: The daily commute in Chennai Metro is getting popular with the public. With the opening of the AG_DMS to Washermanpet sector, the Chennai Metro now connects Anna Salai to Airport. The travel time has reduced considerably. When compared to MTC buses, Chennai Metro fare is slightly costly but for the time saved, it is worth. With the trip card facility availablewith 20% discount to published fare, the fare is competitive to Bus ticket.

Name: Nmukhi
Title: Clean Convenient and Cost Effective
Review: The much-needed alternative to Uber/Ola cabs.....works very convenient and cost-effective when taking a ride to the airport...the trains are very clean and arrive every 5 mins,

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Wow
Review: This is one of the pride of the city,that's newly added to.the system of maintenance of the place, comforts arranged, keeping the commuters in mind can be senced at every point.adding some shopping center at all stations that sells products at a subsidized price is the next step to be taken by the organization.

Name: Wanderer
Title: Comfy safe travel!
Review: Very easily accessible, and reasonably priced tickets are only 2 of the many reasons that is attracting the citizens of Chennai to go for Chennai Metro Rail.

Name: Shveta S
Title: Easiest &fastest mode to travel around Chennai
Review: It's the easiest & fastest. Mode to travel around Chennai, especially from airport/railway station. You end up saving time,money, & energy.

Name: Sudarson1928
Title: Nice Experience
Review: Traveled from Vadapalani to Airport, A bit on the costly side otherwise a nice experience, Especially the underground travel near Airport.

Name: Unknown
Title: Very bad experience at High court metro
Review: The staffs working there doesn't give respect to people specially who are sitting in checking counter, they are violating the rules against Muslims,at high court metro station a lady she was using unparliamentary words and arguing like anything to remove the burkha and asking to show the face... Better you attach a board at every station as "Restricted Place for Muslims". Please don't insult any religion and in our country everyone seems equal.

Name: Zinia F
Title: State of the Art Infrastructure
Review: Chennai can be very proud of itself in how organised it runs the city, and metro rail is no different!State of the art technology, infrastructure and management, squeaky clean platforms and ticketing booths in line with Chennai's culture..Special mention to the sliding doors of the platforms separating the rail tracks, and will open with the rail sliding doors allowing passengers to enter only then.  I think this is a very very good safety measure as accidents can happen to anybody.Five star experience!

Name: ranjitsrivastava
Title: Convenient
Review: Very convenient and time saving. Away from pollution and traffic jams. Airport line is very good. It directly opens to the Airport arrival/ departure.

Name: BUTHU
Title: good infrastructure!
Review: The whole city is almost covered by metro rail and there are more building in progress. The city is improving very fast.

Name: K V K
Title: Chennai metro rsil
Review: Being a resident of Chennai, I somehow did not travel by Chennai metro rail till recently. I had the opportunity to travel a few days back. It was a wonderful experience. The facilities are amazing. The maintenance is extremely good. The train and coaches are well maintained.  To popularize this mode of transportation, the end points should be well connected. Also the extra spaces in the stations should be utilized properly by allowing some shops and small malls to come up. This will attract more passengers.

Name: Shaji Joseph
Title: good mode of transport
Review: The Metro is been connected to main destinations. Air port, Central station, Egmore, Main Bus terminal, Mount road etc..

Name: Val A
Title: SANITY FROM TRAFFIC
Review: The traffic congestion is too hectic in India. Travelling by metro gives peace of mind getting to a destination on timeClean, fast, efficient and real peace of mind

Name: Bibhu_PB
Title: Rapid Transit Awesome...
Review: Chennai Metro Rail One Of The Finest Metro In India With Well Connectivity. Two Important Line Koyambedu to Alandur  & Chennai Central to Alandur. Alandur Main Hub connect to All.

Name: dr raghukirani
Title: World class
Review: It's well maintained, clean & they keep the time. I was  late by 10 seconds & they opened the door again for my family. Felt awesome. But I feel it's underutilized.

Name: Vik P.
Title: Amazing
Review: World class metro system that is on time, clean, safe, and fast! Visiting from the US, I can say that the quality of this metro is first class!

Name: Raghavan N
Title: good scenic ride in chennai
