Review: travelled from ST Thomas mount to CMBT bus terminal around 10am on a working day. you need to climb the stairs at mount station  as the electrical conveyer belt system is incomplete,althogh a lift is available for a part of the climb. and the sytem is complete and functional at CMBT terminal and Adambakkamthe ticketing system  is sometimes difficult when working entirely on automatic mode with peculiar responses after putting in cash.The lone lady assistant when available is  of great assistance.The platforms, train .seating, announcements everything is very clean and tidy.the trains are punctual.you almost get an aerial view of chennai as the train courses through smooth and swift

Name: KiritK
Title: METRO CONNECTION
Review: The best connectivity between Chennai Airport to Chennai Railway station at much cheaper rate and fastest mode of travel w/out much traffic n pollution and ample of space in Metro train,Do not exit the airport but after arrival take a right turn towards elevator to Chennai metro station and reach Chennai central within 45 minutes.

Name: shivshankarsingh
Title: SMART METRO
Review: This is very smart mode of transport in Chennai. Service is quick and frequency is commendable. Indeed clean and green.

Name: Sunil G
Title: Clean and quick
Review: Chennai metro is the best way of transportation where available. it is clean and well maintained. The frequency is good too.

Name: Jennifer J
Title: First travel experience in Chennai Metro
Review: Quite upto the standard of a metro rail. Of course cannnot compare with Foreign Metros.Convenient if your destination falls in the range covered.

Name: Sumoy Sen
Title: Ok transportation
Review: Service is good, maintenance is good but as on today covers only some areas, also cost of travel is high compared to the metro services running in other cities.

Name: faizi45
Title: Best way to commute from the airport
Review: Chennai Metro is really convenient  to travel from airport to any part in city .so next time you are in chennai try the metro

Name: Manoj Kumar C V
Title: The Chennai metro
Review: The Chennai metro was opened last year. It provides State of the art facilities to the public. It connects Airport to the Central Railway station and AG DMS in the Anna road.

Name: shankarj6
Title: Old Church
Review: Some old history about St Thomas who was killed. He was one of the apostles. The church was well kept and it is worth a visit

Name: lachmychinta-voiron-france
Title: small visit of chennai
Review: really good experience for a short visit of CHennai City with a very good driver, Mr ARUL who made me discover this cute gem of Chennai ; i m Hindu but i love this place of faith ...

Name: Rakshith R
Title: Historic Place
Review: Lovely church. U can take a trek in the early hours or you can even take your vehicle to the top..good view from here..

Name: Nick L
Title: Serenity with  a view
Review: A beautiful serene place. Wonderful views of the city on all sides. Ensure you get transport to the top of the mount as the hike up to the top in the heat can be hard going even for the fittest

Name: _ritamanning66
Title: steady walk up the hill to this shrine.
Review: very busy due to a wedding but this made it even more interesting the walk was worth while , the area around seemed to be flat so to find a hill was quite a surprise. You can take photographs and the guardians are happy to point out special items, we had our own guide so translation was easy.

Name: Dcruz10
Title: A National Shrine For Christians
Review: This place holds special religious significance for Christians in India. St.Thomas was the first Christian Evangelist to have visited a predominantly Hindu India in the first century AD.Thomas being one among the original 12 Apostles of Christ means that this is of special significance for Indian Christians considering the fact that this place holds a direct connection to the person of Christ. Pope John Paul-II came to this place on his Indian visit. But somehow, I found the place not being given its due importance unlike a place like Velankanni, for instance. The surroundings are serene and holds great viewing experience. It is a hilltop destination with a relative calm around. This is a place of Pilgrimage. A general visitor can experience  a couple of hours calm & great viewing atop the hill. Plenty of parking available at the base.

Name: ThAnUsHaNaVaS
Title: Hill top view is amazing
Review: hearing about the hill top view , we went there ...As heard ,the view was amazing ..... you can even see flights from chennai international airport taking off ....u can even see chennai city to a decent distance .....

Name: Sue
Title: Spectacular views and very peachful
Review: Climbing the hill to the top gave us the most glorious views across Chennai as a city.  But the church was just the beautiful icing on the cake.  A statue of Mother Theresa, and another of the Pope stood in the grounds.Attached to the church is a Baby Home which houses orphaned babies and small children from the age of 3 months to 5 years.  My friend and I visited and saw how well run it was and how clean, but they can always do with some donations.We walked down the steps to the street level where we took an auto rickshaw to the train station.  A great visit and one not to be missed

Name: TravellingSands
Title: Place of Martyrdom of St Thomas
Review: St Thomas Mount is one of the three places of importance associated with St Thomas located atop a small hill near Guindy in Chennai. The nearest Metro station is Alandur. Crowded on weekends

Name: Alan J
Title: Read the description beforehand
Review: A quiet place away from the rush. Has a long history, some lost in time, some in legend. Not sure of what is original and what is restored, this place needs pre-research.

Name: Elizabeth R
Title: Interesting place to visit with stunning 360 degree views.
Review: It's worth going to this Shrine to see the church and other buildings and to take in the beautiful views of this very large city.

Name: #amosamiyanayeküéß
Title: ‚õ™
Review: always beautiful to be on there calm and peaceful area for to get devine blessed... visible through this to the entire Chennai city and the runways ‚úàÔ∏è

Name: albertsebastian
Title: Nice historical Catholic church
Review: St Thomas used to be buried under the church. The original burial place is in a crypt and a chapel built around it where there is constant mass services one can attend. This trip was actually in April 2019!

Name: kungfupanda
Title: Divine and holy
Review: I visited this place in March 2019, I was astonished by the way they have created all the arts and the church which is amazing. I felt so holy and divine and in some way I found myself brought back to the history of jesus since I'm a Christian myself. I love the way they put things together.  And it felt like I'm actually going inside heaven.

Name: Fritz Peltonen
Title: Nice View and Monuments
Review: Had our last day in Chennai with not much to do so a friend suggested we visit this site.  I was tired but glad I got to visit it and see the history.  The view was amazing.

Name: Rahul Bhattacharya
Title: VISIT
Review: VERY GOOD PLACE to visit for short travel, all can watch the flights landing & take off as airport is very close. Good place to spend time.

Name: buddy_2564
Title: Nice view
Review: Just be prepared to climb some steps to get up to the church. It's well worth the effort but it's very hot all the time here so just a heads up.

Name: Rita A
Title: Visit To Saint Thomas Mount
Review: Inside the shrine it is very peaceful and you can feel the presence of the almighty.There  is lot of information on the relics preserved in the church. The hill provides very good view of the city. But being a national shrine and a tourist attraction a basic facility such as restrooms is in a very bad condition and not maintained. With so many foreigners visiting the place it creates a very bad impression.

Name: Deadman17
Title: Good views of Chennai
Review: The place is located at the top of a hill and is reachable via a road or through steps. It offers great views of chennai. There is a cave nearby. One can visit the place once.

Name: Denis P
Title: A beautiful English mass that was well animated.
Review: We attended the 9 O'clock English Sunday mass. It was very prayerful and well animated choir. We felt the presence of St. Patrick and St. Thomas.

Name: Thomas J
Title: Thank you God for your ways to send Thomas here
Review: Thank you God for your ways to send Thomas here. It was great to walk where he walked even 2000 years later

Name: Likesmifood
Title: Good view of Chennai
Review: Perhaps not the best reason to visit a historic religious site but the view over Chennai  is excellent. It gives a good indication of the size of this city and the modern buildings that are springing up.  The church, cave and spring are all worth a look and how a spring fills with water at the top of a hill is a mystery in itself.

Name: Thomas D
Title: Quiet place
Review: This is supposed to be the place where the apostle Thomas died the martyrdom. The church on top of the mountain has some relique of St Thomas. It is a quiet religious place with a great view on the city of Chennai.

Name: Mukil Ganesan
Title: A calm place with an amazing view!
Review: You need to climb a small hill to reach the shrine. You can either use an automobile or take the steps. The view from the shrine was beautiful. You could a view of Chennai city. There are small tea and coffee shops near the shrine. Well maintained and it‚Äôs a peaceful place.

Name: rsraghavan6
Title: Nice
Review: A nice peaceful place to hangout with friends and family with a very good view!! It is nice to drive 2 wheelers to the top of the hill. The place is very near to airport, so we can view the flight landing and takeoff. The city view from the hill top is very nice too. There is a church in the hill, which is very good. It is a holy place for all. The place is very well maintained. The hill top can be even reached through stairs. A good picnic spot. There is parking space available for all the vehicles.

Name: Val A
Title: EXCELLENT SITE
Review: Excellent site with loads of history. However was very disappointed seeing an inscription saying "homeless Jesus". The one who is the source of provision cannot be "homeless"But what a beautiful site and great breath taking views of the surrounding suburbs

Name: smlucas52
Title: First time visit
Review: Was born in Chennai and left at the age of 22, to live overseas. Went back numerous times to visit relatives over the years, but this was my first visit to St.Thomas Mount and the Church which was built since 1523. The Church and surroundings are well looked after, the story of Saint Thomas is a very true story. Great views of the city and airport.

Name: clausen d
Title: Nothing much to write about
Review: Took a lot of time just searching for it. From car park to the shrine, it is an easy walk just about 50-60 metres up a pucca road. Highlights:The shrineThe scenery of chennai all aroundOther than these, nothing much. Small cafe up the road available and also one in the convent. But you won't get something heavy like lunch. Need not spend too much time here.

Name: Charles W
Title: A Christian Holy site in India
Review: The "shrine" is located at the top of the hill. The area around the shrine is a military base. The church has a small slice of a finger bone and a toe bone of St Thomas. There is a stone tablet with a cross that is attributed to St Thomas who lived in the area. This stone was alleged to weep blood on Dec 18 many years ago.There are good views of Chennai from the shrine site.St Thomas is buried at a different church in Chennai.

Name: Jennifer J
Title: The location is amazing, esp if visiting in the evening time
Review: There is a religious experience because of its historical significance. Besides an evening spent sitting there & watching the take off & landing of Air crafts is  wonderful. If one wants to spend some time by themselves, its the place.

Name: LesleyAnn13_31
Title: Historical and religious
Review: St Thomas Mount is a must see when in Chennai, it is the location where St Thomas was martyred.  The guides are informative and give you all the local myths and legends around this shrine.

Name: ameeta s
Title: Holy trail
Review: Breath taking views from the top, but a huge climb. Be ready to sit down at intervals for a rest.Stunning views of Chennai. Beautiful statues of Mother Theresa, Jesus, Mother Mary and St. Thomas.Church is small and Cosy.

Name: Michelle H
Title: WOW
Review: The walk up is beauiful, but the view of the city is astounding.  THis is a peacefull and awe inspring location and a must see!

Name: sathish
Title: Good Place to connect with some History of Chennai
Review: Nice, pleasant, calm place to visit. Great views all around. Gives you a feel for the layout of the city. Must visit if one has the time.

Name: Dr Pritpal Singh
Title: Must visit for out station visitors.
Review: One of the oldest structures in Chennai. Every visitor must visit to experience the calm environment. Positive energy flows while you are inside. Over 60  % visitors are non - Christians as this place is equally revered by all.

Name: Vinod500
Title: Beautiful Historic View Point
Review: I was surprised to know that there are many long time residents of Chennai who have never visited this hill top shrine. This is definitely a place worth seeing. While there are steps on the Butt Road side, we drove up the motorable road from the GST road side. We had to inquire at a couple of points to make sure we were taking the correct fork in the road. There was sufficient parking available at the top of the hill, just below the shrine.At the top is the historic shrine of St Thomas. We get a beautiful view of the city below including Metro trains. The Chennai international airport and its runways too are nice sight to view from this height, especially when planes take off and pass just above St Thomas Mount. Google maps shows the road route up, but at some places we found our mobile could not access the maps (poor signal possibly being blocked by the hill mass), and we had to ask the locals for the right way up.

Name: Chris McGuire
Title: Impressive History
Review: Of course, the historical element of this site is profound.  It is well worth the visit to St. Thomas Mount for that alone.  As well, there is an incredible view from the top.  Be sure to check out the incredible paintings inside.  Otherwise, I feel like some of it is a bit tacky for the type of site it is.

Name: Ashish S
Title: Peaceful place
Review: I liked this place as it was very peaceful and gives you the mental peace. The place is also very neat and clean.

Name: Priyanka S
Title: Nice place within the city
Review: Had been to this serene place to celebrate children's day with apartment group...will advice to go there early in the morning...it's very near to the guindy metro station...one can see the planes landing and take off..as the runway is very near...there is a famous church here, though we couldn't enter due to rush...u can have a nice view of Chennai city from there..one can take the car up to the Church ..the other side, there are stairs ...so one can try to do a climbing exercise...it's a full green area with no commercialization..played lots of outdoors games there...so in all it was a good outing

Name: HappySheep
Title: Worth a visit
Review: NIce place to viist, with hike up a hill, to shrine overlooking airport and western parts of Chennai. Lovely quiet atmosphere.

Name: Selvakumar
Title: Trip with Friends
Review: Amazing place to visit in Chennai. It was my first visit to this place. When i reached to St.Thomas Mount National Shrine, i have seen almost entire Chennai City and the night view of the City is Fabulous. Very Interesting thing is that the take-off and landing flights at Chennai Airport can be seen from this place.

Name: MohammadFernandez
Title: Place of historical importance.
Review: St Thomas Mount, named after Apostle Thomas is place of national heritage. You can get here by bus, train, or car and is easily accessible. According to history, St Thomas reached mylapore from Kerala preaching and teaching Christianity. He faced persecution from the local ruler in Mylapore and was lanced to death . There is a catholic monastery and church at the top of the hill. You can either climb the hill on stairs that is accessible from Butt Road or drive up from the OTA  ( Defence Officers Training Academy ) side . You have to access the road from the defense camp road. There is a relic which is revered as piece of bone from St Thomas. The hill is also on the flight line from Chennai Airport, It makes a good place for plane spotting and is the direct approach to the main runway 07/25 at Chennai airport.

Name: Gnahh
Title: You walk a steep hill - the view is worth it
Review: Said to contain the bones of St Thomas - one of Jesus' disciples. Whatever your views are about this Catholic concept, once you get to the top of the (steep) hill the view is worth it. The shrine is kept nicely, and a good stop for contemplation and prayer. Plus, If you walk up during Islamic prayer times you can experience a real mix of multi-religious Tamil Nadu - the Islamic prayer carried over speakers on the wind, the Christian Shrine and also the Hindu temples in the distance.

Name: JohnsonGeorge
Title: Closest Accessible National Shrine enrroute to Chennai Airport
Review: It is a quiet place of worship and has a Roman Catholic and Christian historical sacred items.There's a quiet place for adoration in an Airconditioned ChapelHistory of St. Thomas in India can be seen here

Name: Ruth M
Title: Wonderful
Review: It;s wonderful, historical and Biblical. It tells the story of how Christianity came to India through St. Thomas. Located on top of a high hill facing the Chennai International Airport and the cith, it's view is amazing.Saint John Paul II was here at this very holy ground. Many local and foreign tourist come and go every day. Don;t miss it when you are in Chennai.

Name: Ramaswamy N
Title: Flying Visit
Review: Try two different approaches to this shrine. Go by walk through the stairs and by a car in the winding road. Don't miss the flight landing clicks (obviously apart from praying).

Name: MC-lovestravel
Title: well labeled and worth the stop if you are in the area
Review: good explanations and displays next to St Thomas‚Äôs cave/grotto, with explanations on his life and the miracles attributed to him in the location.   We stopped by on Sunday afternoon and there was a church service so we didn‚Äôt go into the church, but we did walk over to his spring, the cave, as well as the scattered spots with his hand and foot prints.   can be seen in 30 min or so

Name: janetmeachin
Title: On top of the world
Review: A lovely little chapel, a fascinating view over Chennai, a lovely little cafe with a few souvenirs to buy to remember your visit to this Christian church.

Name: Michael Anbumani
Title: Amazing & Historical
Review: The Shrine on top of the mountain is has an amazing view of Chennai city. You can see the International Airport and the planes flying by all the time. This is a historical and a Holy ground where St. Thomas, one of the 12 Apostles of Jesus was killed. Christianity came to India through the presence of St. Thomas many centuries ago. This Shrine has many historical * Biblical story to tell the visitors. Beautiful and amazing. We are blessed to have visited this Holy ground. A must visit for all tourists from all parts of the world.

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Nice View
Review: This is a very nice and holy shrine in Chennai. Peaceful ambiance and a beautiful view of the city. Worth visiting.

Name: Linda G
Title: Fascinating story and beautiful view of Chennai
Review: A great tourist spot.  The story of St. Thomas is fascinating and the view of Chennai is amazing.  You can see a full 360 view of the city.  There is a lot to learn about the area.

Name: 359anthony
Title: On high, holy ground
Review: St. Thomas, one of Jesus' 12 Apostles, was martyred at this spot in the 1st century AD and this shrine was built to commemorate the event and preserve the sanctity of the place. A church stands at the summit of this hill, simple in design but redolent with the silent, fervent urgency of the petitions of countless faith-filled pilgrims.

Name: Joshua Chin
Title: Beautiful Saint Thomas Church
Review: Reminded me of Matt 28:16. Never knew that Thomas actually came all the way to the east to realise preach the good news. Amazing. Nice place to visit. Give it a shot.

Name: vasan224
Title: nice place
Review: st. thomas mount national shrine a Holy place of international prominence, historical eminence, religious glory and tourist attraction.

Name: diva k
Title: unbelievable hillock amidst crowded chennai
Review: I love this place because of the calm location. But dont just roam around as the guards would ask you to leave if your purpose is not for prayer

Name: Praveenop
Title: One of the most hallowed place for global christians
Review: Apostle St. Thomas also known as Doubting Thomas who is the direct disciple of Jesus lived, preached and died here. So this is one of the sacred shrine for Christians from all over the world. It is part of Christian lore. So dont miss this.

Name: Keertan
Title: Good
Review: Nice placeIN THE MIDDLE OF THE CITY OF CHENNAI,THIS SACRED MOUNTAIN IS SITUATED MAJESTICALLY. This place is occupied and maintained by the Roman Catholic Christian mission.There are matriculation school, orphanage and homes for the priests and nuns. The church on the top of the mount is very beautiful and sacred. The city also looks beautiful to look from the top of the mount.

Name: Shenal F
Title: Spiritual journey
Review: St.Thomas shrine was one of the beautiful places we visited, our tour guides explain an insightful of thoughts about this holy place...Visions can buy lot of souvenirs from the shop too...

Name: jai8k
Title: Excellent top view of Chennai city
Review: It is a peaceful holy place. Good breeze and an excellent top view of Chennai city is guaranteed. We took the stairs to reach the top

Name: BhaarathPhotography
Title: Very Peaceful Place in Chennai
Review: After a long time I have visited this place, Really it's a peaceful place in Chennai.  Kindly Visit in Evening Time you can feel more peace and relax

Name: TSAMM21
Title: MarThoman Mala
Review: The ancient Syrian Christian community of India trace the origin of their church to St. Thomas the Apostle, believed to have been martyred in St. Thomas Mount.St. Thomas Mount  is a small hillock in Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India, near the neighbourhood of Guindy and very close to Chennai International Airport.During Colonial Era Portuguese captured and colonized this Holy Land from native Indian Christians.

Name: Suresh C
Title: Well maintained place with ancient connect
Review: Built in 1523, beautiful place where St. Thomas believed to have been martyred - Saint Thomas Mount, Tamil Nadu, India.  I have visited here earlier in early 1980s when my school teacher who is an anglo Indian took our class to her house in Butt road and then we went to the mount as well.   It is a well maintained place.  As I went in the early morning, crowd was not there and the place was lovely.   Also one could get beautiful views of metro trains running on the elevated tracks and also aeroplanes landing in the Meenambakkam airport.   Lovely Banyan tree was in one place and (medicinal rich) Neem trees have been planted all along the climb path - they were also well maintained.

Name: Thomas R
Title: Sacred Ground for sure
Review: There is much history on this hill.  This is place to believed that Thomas was executed.  There is a shrine in It has a great view of the city there also.  Small entrance fee.  You should visit this place if you are interested in history

Name: FaisalShb
Title: Good views!
Review: A calm hilltop with a good view of the airport. It was nice to be away from the noise of the city (if you ignore the sound of the planes).

Name: 234priyad
Title: Nice and peaceful place
Review: Evening is the best time to visit there. Peaceful place were u can enjoy the beauty of city lights and the flight takeoff and landing.

Name: Ezhilanban
Title: See the City in different angle.
Review: Apart from church, this is one place in Chennai were you can see the city from top without noise of the traffic. A good place for photo shoot, or a small out with the loved one, or just a long walk for loners who enjoy the scenic beauty and silence.

Name: Kurian_Aby
Title: Great Place to Pray and get Peace of Mind
Review: You can come and spend hours in the Holy place and pray. You get peace of mind. A true holy place in the mountain.

Name: Karthik R
Title: Nice location
Review: We visited this first time being several years in Chennai. One can reach the mount by walk by stairs or by road to the top. We went by car. The mount is approachable either from GST side by Jyothi theatre or from the Butt road. The hill ride is just around a km. Parking is available at the top for Rs.20 for cars and Rs.10 for two-wheelers.Beautiful city views are available across the church on the top. One side, one can see the tall metro routes, Guindy, Ashok pillar sides of Chennai. From the other side, one can see the airport with runway - flights taking off ! Great place and best seat in Chennai to see the creeching sound of flights take off ! One can enjoy flight spotting from here.

Name: hengky rahardja
Title: imagine how he teach back then
Review: had a 360 degree view of the city. touch my heart instantly when seeing and imagine when saint Thomas do the teaching. sit back and relax and enjoy the view...

Name: Doc_vvp
Title: Panoramic view of the city
Review: As name suggests this shrine is located on a hill. The hike is rather considerable but absolutely worth it. We get a very good view of the city. For plane spotters its a very good site as it lies exactly on the flight path. Very close to airport. Clean, decent and calm place. Drinking water, small cafeteria and decent toilets available.

Name: ashokd2007
Title: A spritual experence
Review: The shrine is such a serene place. From here, we can see the whole of Chennai. The church and the chapel are so beautiful and well maintained. It is so heartening to know that the first disciple of The Lord Jesus Christ was martryed here and we can feel the presence of The Lord

Name: Peter S
Title: Bizarre religious phenomenon
Review: St Thomas Mount is a bizarre site - an extraordinary testament to the persistence of the Christian faith in India but also a tacky sideshow of a shrine with various oddities tacked on. It is worth seeing, whether you're pious or profane, if only to experience an aspect of Catholicism in the sub-continent. But don't expect anything very profound - the enclosure full of concrete elephants and zebras had me wondering ... But I was short of time and didn't go into the chapel.

Name: Kayezad A
Title: Must see place in Chennai
Review: It's a very beautiful place to visit in Chennai. A lot of climbing to be done, but I think if you request a car drop at the top- if you have senior citizens- it may be arranged. The place is located on top of the hill and gives you superb views of the Chennai city. Very peaceful and there are many important relics here at the Church.

Name: Sanjay N
Title: Excellent Architechture and Holy place!!!!
Review: I was in Chennai for work from 27 th Nov - 30th Nov 2017.Despite my busy schedule got chance to visit few famous tourist places.St Thomas Mount was great experience.Rhe religious shrine is situated over mountain and entire city's  View can be seen from top.

Name: ashwinikrishnan
Title: Awesome view if the city
Review: The St Thomas Mount National shrine has an wonderful view of the city and the airport runway. Cars are not allowed to drop people near to the church

Name: worldwomantourist
Title: Shrine on top of mountain
Review: St. Thomas Mount National Shrine is named after the one amoung the twelve disciple of Jesus Christ who came to India to share the good news gospel to the people of India. There are steps to climb the mount. A fantastic view of the city can be seen from the top of the mount.

Name: Sangeetha Vikram
Title: St.Thomas Cathedral Basilica - Holy place of International Prominence
Review: On a fine Friday evening (24th Nov'17), myself along with my Bestie Disha Mary got to visit St.Thomas Cathedral Basilica. It was a beautiful Roman Catholic church located at the top of the small hillock St. Thomas Mount, near the neighborhood of Guindy. A shrine dedicated to "Our Lady of Expectation" (Mother Mary) was built in 1523 on top of the mount. The altar of this shrine was built on the spot where St. Thomas' death traditionally believed to have been occurred. A beautiful prayer hall was available and a separate room for doing meditation. Also, we got to see the elevated view over the city of Chennai. Offered our prayers and had wonderful blissful evening at St.Thomas Mount National Shrine.

Name: Jeannie2207
Title: Two reasons to visit
Review: The first reason is the elevated view over the city of Chennai and surrounding countryside. The second reason is to visit the shrine where St Thomas was murdered. It‚Äôs a short climb from where you get dropped by a car, but it‚Äôs worth visiting, although without a guide you‚Äôd need to read up a bit because there‚Äôs not a lot of information at the sight.

Name: 755anak
Title: beautiful church
Review: lovely church with tons of charater and tons of history - beautiful leadlight windows.  Lots of parking

Name: skkkd
Title: famous place
Review: i went to this holy place.where st thomas was murdered .one volunteer behaves rude that is main disappointment here.but this location is so beautiful

Name: BhuGonde
Title: Nice place to visit
Review: Nice place to visit if you have time. Just climb the stairs or drive up almost till the shrine. They should put-up a little more information about the place for benefit of the tourists. Reaching here is not quite convenient with heavy traffic on approach route.

Name: StephenThomas7
Title: DIVINE PLACE. BLESSED..!
Review: This is a historical place. The church is very well maintained and the place is kept clean. There is also a painting of Mother Mary which was painted by St.Luke. The painting was bought to India by St,Thomas. Really love going here. The bleeding cross of St.Thomas is also preserved and the Altar is built on that spot. Feels blessed  each and every time I go there. St.Thomas Mount Church is truly a divine place to visit.

Name: ChennaiShaji
Title: Historical location, beautiful view
Review: Christians will find this place memorable. The pictures on the wall of the church depicts the way in which each of the disciples of Jesus were killed as per historical accounts. Great way to remember our Lord and the hardships of the disciples for living for Him.

Name: tnbalaji90
Title: Peaceful Place
Review: The shrine is nestled at the top of St. Thomas Mount. Mass is offered everyday. A peaceful place to meditate and worship God and to honour St. Thomas. Please do not treat this place as a tourist attraction. It's holiness should be preserved.

Name: Lalengmawia V
Title: Good place to visit
Review: We visited on 6 Aug 2017 with 23 friends. It was a sacred place for the Christianity in India. It was an uphill task to climb the top where shrine was located. But after reaching the top, it was spectacular and offers a very good view of Chennai City. There is also a small souvenir shop.

Name: Jrdominic S
Title: Patron Saint of India and the only apostle reached the East !!!
Review: One of the smallest and culturally rich and historically very famous Syrian style  church in Chennai. Those who believe in Jesus Christ or not or even an atheist should visit this place to admire the beauty of Our Lady of Expectation shine built on the top of the mount. If you a Catholic Christian I am sure you will get goosebumps when you enter the arch which leads to the spot where St. Thomas was martyred. Don't miss to do the WAY OF THE CROSS at this church.

Name: Sreenivasu N
Title: Very good place for evenings
Review: This is very good place for evening visit.. good breeze.. and panoromic views of chennai can delight you

Name: tumbleweed_dude
Title: It's a great view of the city and a neat historical location
Review: I enjoyed seeing the old chapel and all of the historical things.  The workers were helpful and it is worth the trip.

Name: Carlos F
Title: Good to visit
Review: Good place to visit with a nice view of the city. I not spend more than 1 hr there what's allowed me to have time to go to another places.

Name: ashokaarti
Title: Visit during Christmas time
Review: You can drive up and also have steps to climb. Place is very nice and the church architecture is intricate.   Fantastic view of the entire city especially the airport.  Evening is the best time to visit.

Name: R Jun
Title: Serene place
Review: Visited this holy shrine on a solo trip... Very beautifully located atop a small hillock .. it is of one of the 12 apostles of Jesus ... Very close is St Patrick Church as well which was also one of the 12 apostles ... So must visit for everyone .. it has also a wonderful view of Chennai from top..

Name: WilliamAllb
Title: Historic place
Review: Long established as built on the place where St Thomas was killed, this small church is a place of pilgrimage; it contains many relics, and a painting of Mary and Jesus, said to have been done by St Luke. Great panoramic views of Chennai. Open every day; long opening hours, and no entrance fee or even any expectation for a donation. There are several food stalls and a nice cafe room in the convent.Easy to reach from Alandur Metro station - but don't take an auto which charged me 170 rupees from the station to the car park at the top - summon an Ola cab: I did this and it came up within 5 minutes and charged 58 rupees!

Name: Claes E
Title: Fantastic view
Review: Fantastic view over Chennai. Defiantly worth a visit if you are near by. Parking are very close to the top and gives you a perfect view over the city to all its corners. Nice little get away.

Name: Krishna Sampath
Title: A visit with friends
Review: Perched at the top of the St Thomas Mount hill the Church dedicated to St Thomas, one of the 12 Apostles of Jesus Christ, is surprisingly small in size but the ambience and sense of history is awesome. A revered site for Christians it is beautifully decked up during the period leading up to Christmas. One can either walk up by the stairs or use the road which winds up to the top. Visitors will get a fabulous 360 Degree view of Chennai from the top.

Name: sunnyk332
Title: In search of Roots
Review: It's one of the unique places of worship, adorning relics of 124 saints, at the alter of ,St Thomas crafted cross .It also houses Unique painting of Mother of Expectations.Painting of  Mother Mary with Infant Jesus also one of its kind .A must visit place along with Shrine at Little Mount where St Thomas spent  time hiding at  Cave and San Thom Basilica a National monument for St Thomas Tomb

Name: MissCPix
Title: Learned Something New!
Review: I had no idea the Apostle Thomas was buried here or that he was made a Saint. I enjoyed the rich history of the area and walking where someone who walked with the Messiah walked!

Name: Jim L
Title: Peace and Tranquility - if you time it right
Review: Get on your walking shoes - it's only a 400 metre walk to the top, but with Chennai's heat and humidity it's a bit of a workout. (so, apparently you can also drive up, but where's the fun in that?) The walk to the top is partly lined with trees and the goats and birds are a nice distraction to the climb.There are great views of the City when the haze isn't too bad. On a less busy day, this is a place of meditation and tranquility - a perfect escape from the City below you. The primary attraction is for those interested in the Catholic/Christian faith. The site is related to the tradition that St. Thomas, one of the disciples of Jesus Christ, was martyred in India. There's a modest chapel, relics, statues and monuments.  If you're not interested in the religious aspect, just respect it and enjoy the great views.

Name: vh0920
Title: Incredible Visit
Review: This area of Chennai offers breath-taking views of Chennai, and is such a tranquil place to visit for prayer and reflection. Made 2 visits there during my stay in Chennai. Had a chance to attend the one English mass on Sunday, and met the priest after the service who blessed more than 30 rosaries I purchased to bring back to children. Just seeing the relics and the history is breath-taking. There are some wonderful hosts there to assist with any questions you have about the chapel or relics or history.

Name: Ghost Story
Title: Amazing views of Chennai
Review: Wonderful shrine. Great information and history. Wonderful views of Chennai. Learned quite a bit about St. Thomas and the influence of Portuguese culture in this area of India.

Name: Andrew S
Title: A Let Down
Review: If you do not know who St Thomas is, you will not appreciate this place. It would just be another shrine on a mountain. When I came to this spot in 1993, it had a board that told a story of how Thomas, one of the disciples of Jesus Christ came to India, and was eventually speared. Today, there is no information about the place or about Thomas. What you will see is a small church, a statue of the late Pope John Paul II and the late Mother Theresa.So, unless you are on some religious pilgrimage, give this place a miss.

Name: sumathik78
Title: Mesmerizing
Review: Lost in the bazaars this temple is stunning. Its a great piece of architecture and has a serene ambience

Name: Padmapriya Gopalakrishnan
Title: My Second home-Its My Darling Amma
Review: Feel Amma's presence and soul here.I call it my second home, her smiling and loving face will make you melt and will make sure you forget all your worries,pain and sorrow here. She is love, she is bless, she is happiness, she is Amma

Name: Sud D
Title: Very Ancient Temple
Review: This is situated between two busy streets in downtown Chennai. The surroundings are a bit chaotic but the temple is special. Ancient  and beautiful.

Name: Ananth 727499
Title: Powerful ambal temple of chennai
Review: This temple is considered as the most powerful Ambal temple in Chennai..People from many parts of Chennai have their regular visit to this temple, to have their darshan and get blessings of Mother ..It is also said that Chatrapathi shivaji had his darshan in this temple ..He also gave his sword as a gift to this temple..Many VIPs come regularly to this temple ..There is also a powerful prithyangira Devi sannithi in this temple at the entrance itself..Don't miss this temple ..

Name: KARTHIKb87
Title: Famous Amman temple in Chennai
Review: It's famous old temple in Chennai near Madras High court/Chennai beach station. Temple ambal is powerful and will fulfill all our prayers. It's says that kalikambal is another form of Kanchi Kamaatchi. It was said to be built in 1678 by Shivaji, the Maratha warrior and the founder of the Hindawi-Swarajya in the 17th century,   Temple is located in Thambi chetty Street a prominent financial street at Georgetown  which is walkable at 15 mins distance from high court or Chennai beach suburban station,5 mins from Mannady Metro station.Its must visit temple in chennai

Name: %FastFlyer
Title: Tight squeeze
Review: Here during the holiday Pongol. Thousands of local tourists. Visitors are restricted to marked routes.

Name: jivpriya1101
Title: Very peacefull
Review: This is the first time i visited this temple. It's very big temple and most of all very very peaceful after went to this temple. Will definitely go again if got the chance.

Name: Sunitha Shenoy
Title: Temple amidst all the rush
Review: This temple is in Thambu chetty street which is located near the commerical place for wholesale. You would get anything and everything around this place at a great price. Despite all that chaos outside when you enter the temple you won't feel even a bit of it. The temple gets a bit crowded on the days special for devi, but on other days its manageable.

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: It was an awesome Hindu temple in Parry's area
Review: It was really nice Hindu temple located in the Parry's area near mint Street. This is the first time I visited this temple. It's big and very famous temple. Everybody must visit the temple when u visit Parry's area.

Name: KVG55
Title: Religious pilgrimage
Review: Temple recommend by Chennai based colleagues, as an ancient and popular temple. The great Indian warrior king. Shivaji Maharaj prayed  here incognito  in 1627.The festival Season added a unique dimension to the visit. The main idol was open to public view. Was fortunate to witness a live dance performance of temple students of Bharat Natyam. It is Indian opera..beautiful and artistic to behold.Spent a spiritually gratifying hour.Left for traditional Tamil dinner at my favourite local restaurant.

Name: uma89
Title: A famour temple in North Chennai which blesses the devotees with utmost concern
Review: we visited the temple today that is on Vijayadasami Day in the early morning. Not much crowd. First we had the dharshan in the opposite vinayaka temple. and then we entered into the famous kalikaambal temple, the very same temple which Maharashtra Shivaji visited this temple during 19th century before he had war with Muslim leader Aurangzeb. today we could see the saraswathi avtar in white silk saree with beautiful veena at the fully decorated pandal. very enchanting view. then we moved in towards the main deity kalikaambal. since it was early morning say 7 am not much crowd. they were allowing 10- 12 devotees to sit have aarthi. we waited and as a second batch and had nice aarthi and the nice dharshan of kalikaambal. we could see the ambal in the natural light with full of flowers and lemon garlands. nice darshan and we got really fascinated and mesmerised to see her appearence. we did not feel like getting up and come off the place as we continue to have the divine connection with ambal. we feel fully linked to the Godess. Many years of supreme and divine blessings continue to pour. and we moved towards Lord Shiva. then we had tied red sacred thread. then we had dharshan of Muruga and came out. within the vicinity of Lord Siddhi vinayagar sannidhi and murugan sannidhi. Then after we could see the golu infront of Virat brhama. beautiful golu was arranged and ayyappa predominantly occupied the rows. we also saw the Kalikaambal urchavar. we also took the blessings of prityangira devi before we complete our rounds.  one has to visit this temple in their life time. but the street was narrow and very difficult to find the parking for cars of course two wheeler no issue. you will somehow find the space

Name: Valavanur Natar... K
Title: A WRITE UP ON KALAKAMBAL TEMPLE GEORGE TOWN PARRYS CORNER CHENNAI
Review: The famous Kalikambal temple is located on Thambu Chetty street,  in george town now more known as Parry's corner. The name Parry's corner came about due to √æthe presence of an old company called M/S EID Parry & Company established in 1787, by  Thomas Parry ,  a Welsh merchantThis multistorey building was the corporate headquarters  of this company . This building called "Dare House" stands in the the corner of NSC Bose Road and First line beach Road  abutting both the roads and is  opposite to Madras high court .The  Murugappa group now owns it .Now coming back to Kalikambal temple that is located in Thambu Chetty street that perhaps derived its name from Thambu Chetty,  a merchant who worked  with the British as a Dubash.The first Hindu temples of British Madras were built  during the period of 1640 to 1680 in this neighbourhood  The prominent  merchants of the city, mostly dubashes (middlemen) of British merchants and business establishments donated liberally for building these temples .In fact several of the streets in the neighbourhood also came to be  named after these dubashes.Apart from this famous temple this street is also the main retail market for Hardware, ceramic tiles and sanitary ware.The temple was originally located closer to the sea shore in the vicinity of Fort St George and  was relocated to the current site at 1640¬†AD. and was  re built  by MuthuMari Achari in True Tamilian  Architecture abd completed iIn  1678 .This temple is dedicated to Hindu goddess  Shri Kali Kambal (Lordess Sakthi ) and Lord Kamateshwarar (Shiva).The temple has separate sannadhis for Ganesha and Prathyankara .On the 1st May of every year since 1985 , Sri Kalikambal Kodai  summer  Abhishekam is performed from 10AM to 1PM  to the Goddess by Kodai Maha Abhisheham committee praying for enough rains during the year all over the country.History tells us that The great Maratta leader Shivaji Maharaj,   the founder of the Hindawi-Swarajya in the 17th century, had worshiped in this temple incognito on 3rd October 1667.Initially the idol of Kali the Godess was in  a very  fierce form  and for reasons unknown,   this fierce form was replaced with a calmer form like shanta swaroopi resembling the  Goddess Kamakshi.The Maha kumbabishekam of this Sri Kalikambal  took place on Wednesday, January 23. 2013 .with thoudands  of devotees gathered to witness the consecration of the Rajagopuram and the vimanam of the Moolavar by the head  priests belonging to the  The Sivacharyar Trust .The first phase of the consecration took place on January 17. Grandeur marked everything associated with the occasion and the  highlight of this kumbaabhisekham was flowers were  showered from a helicopter even as  abhisekham was being carried out to  the kalasams.About 25,000 people were fed free  after the kumbabishekam. Food was served to the inmates of orphanages and homes for destitutes in the city as well by the trust.The Sivacharyar Trust who runs the temple , in fact is also engaged in several social welfare activities such as distribution of clothes, text books, medicine, etc. The physically disabled are provided with appropriate vehicles and the poor are helped with marriage expenses.

Name: Mahan3665
Title: Temple along narrow street
Review: Temple is beautiful and not commercialized.  Very popular among the folks living there and very close to a children's home which is within close proximity.

Name: reubenranjanfern2017
Title: A very old temple.
Review: Very auspicious place. Holy and sacred, this temple has a lot to do with history. Awesome place. Must visit.

Name: shiva krshy
Title: Awesome temple
Review: It's such a nice place to visit in chennai the temple is more over lot of people came to visiting in everyday

Name: chithracb
Title: A very old temple.
Review: The temple is in Thambu chetty Street, Chennai. Amidst a very busy area, one shall notice how Godess Kalikambal ...the main deity here....is been worshipped by so many people. Such a crowded area. There are regular devotees coming before they start the day. There are sannidhis for Ganesha, Gamedeswarar, Prathyankira, Gayathri, Durga. The great Maratha king,Chatrapathi Shivaji said to have visited this temple and worshipped the Mother(Kalikambal). A must visit place.

Name: Karthik R
Title: Auspicious and peaceful temple
Review: Sri Kalikambal temple is 5 minutes walk from the Chennai Beach station - we went by car around 8 AM. There was no rush on the day we went. Goddess Kali represents as Kalikambala in Shanta Swaroopa form. It is said that many sages worshipped Goddess and Maratha king Chatrapathi Shivaji visited this temple. Lord Shiva is represented as Linga and known as Sri Kamadeswarar.

Name: Ananth 727499
Title: Unmatched Powerful Amman Temple of olden days...
Review: This Temple is in thambu chetty street near parrys corner.. The main deity of this Temple is Kaalikaambal.. Swamy name is kamadeswarar.. It is said that this Amman is worshipped by the great Maratha warrior shivaji..Shivan sannithi, prathyangira Devi sannithi are also seen In this Temple.. At First, this Temple was constructed in a different place.. When the British constructed st. George fort, this Temple was in the midst of it. So, as Per the request of the British offices, Muthumaari aachari constructed this temple in this present place.. The great Tamil poet Bharathi is a devotee of this Amman.. Come, worship and feel Blessed in the mercy of Kaalikaambal...

Name: Wanderer
Title: Amman temple in the city
Review: Old temple with very powerful deity of Kalikambal, gives solace to those who visit to pray. Resolutions are evident especially for those seeking protection from various negative forces.

Name: Narasimhan G
Title: Nice and Nearer Temple !!
Review: easy to reach via Thambhu chetty street or Armenian Street , ( nearer from Broadway/High Court/Beach train station? Parry's area) ChennaiWithout discrimination all devotees coming in queue will be allowed to sit and have Arthi dharshan ( except when abhishekam is performed with curtains drawn).. This you can not see in any TN's big temple as I recallThis temple was visited with reverence by the maratta king Sivaji... Local film people also believe this temple.

Name: ushatr
Title: Faith......power of prayer
Review: A small temple nestled in the narrowest streets of chennai. Kamakshi the goddess is the main deity the consort of lord Shiva. A beautiful and stunning stone sculpture that draws thousands of people from all over everyday. Faith and belief that SHE will fulfill the wishes of every devotee. Mid mornings and early afternoon is the better time to visit and experience and feel the power of prayer.

Name: AKTHAKUR
Title: TEMPLE VISITED BY THE GREAT MARATHA RULER SHRI SHIVAJI
Review: This temple has been visited by the great Maratha ruler Shivaji, and its visibility has grown steadily in the last two decades.The Kalikambal temple located in Thambu Chetty Street in the heart of George Town in the business district of Chennai is among the most visited temples in the meteropolis.This temple enshrines Kalikambal (Kamakshi) and Kamateswarar and a host of parivara devatas. The history of the temple goes back to a few hundred years. The great Maratha ruler Shivaji is said to have visited the Kalikambal shrine in Chennai, during his tour of the southern region of the Indian subcontinent.temple address212, Thambu Chetty Street, Near DHL Express Courier, Parrys,,Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600001phone - +914425229624 +914425241122Temple Timingsmorning - 6 AM ‚Äì 1 PM evening ‚Äî 3 PM ‚Äì 9 PM

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Famous powerful goddess
Review: The temple is dedicated to goddess parvathi worshipped as kali .The place is so powerful that she protects the city and the people of the city.

Name: Manju N
Title: Chatrapati Shivaji Visit this shrine to receive blessings of Devi before his historic Battle
Review: Very pious temple with a nostalgic history and yet keeping the spiritual energy intact for each believer who comes for Devi's blessings.

Name: Harvey
Title: Divine
Review: Whenever I am in Chennai I try to visit Kaligambal Temple on a Tuesday or Sunday - either early in the morning (i.e. before 8 am) or in the evening after 8pm to avoid the nightmare traffic of Madras 1. The temple is a divine experience and has a lot of history attached to it. It is advised that you buy lime/lemon garlands as an offering (available at either entrance) whenever you visit.

Name: Sivalingam Sankar
Title: Small Powerful Temple of Ambal in fast moving chennai
Review: From velcahery took train to reach beach station(MRTS) from there with help of google maps reached the temple, it is peaceful and without much traffic during weekends, better visit at that time. Temple is small with all parivara deivathas. You can directly reach temple inside the goddess blesses all with small sannidhi with many more oil lit lamps makes her more divine. You can have a sitting and workship goddess, where they will give prasadham kumkum and other offerings made to the god, sri chakra maha meru presides before the foot of goddess which is more powerful. Siva sanidhi on both front and to left side there. Other gods like brahma, siva, ganapathy, subramaniyar are there in the temple. Two ways there inside. Feeling calm and blessed. Exploring the temples of chennai made this temple also in the list

Name: TrailBlazer581787
Title: Best temple visit
Review: Visiting with our children and we definately recommend. Probably one of the best Temple visits so far in Chennai.

Name: Lallukichi
Title: Awesome temple
Review: It's z a wonderful temple with a lot f story behind, may be one of the oldest temple there, and they are making lil changes too,when I visited last month. And good food as Prasada s also available there. But Street z bc, better go Sundays, temple itls closed at 12 noon in morning. Don't know about evening timings... Felt blessed

Name: plpalani
Title: Temple with history
Review: This temple is located in most busy and narrow streets of Chennai... hence plan on Sunday‚Äôs or holidays.The Devi is very benevolent and Maratha king Shivaji was supposed to have prayed here. The Eshwaran Sannidhi is small. There Sannidhi for Durga, Kamatchi and other GodsFelt blessed today after the visit

Name: KHBP
Title: Love this temple
Review: Love this temple, its ambience. Small temple with such a nice ambience. Like the prasadams here and especially the mysore pa sold here is v.different.

Name: Chitra K
Title: Historic temple
Review: I wasn't knowing about this temple before, so it was not on our must see list. But I  got to know about it and decided to visit it. It was a moment of proud and happiness for myself and my husband as Chhatrapati shivaji maharaja visited this place. Praying to goddess kali and seeing shivaji maharaja's photo was an emotional and offbeat moment of the whole trip.

Name: Umasudhan P
Title: Goosebumps!
Review: If you are at Chennai, dont miss to be here. A very powerful temple with great vibrations. In one word, dont miss to go this temple!

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Goddess Temple
Review: This is a nice temple dedicated to Goddess Kalikambal and situated on the Thambu Chetty street. Very busy and crowded place. Lots of devotees comes here to worship.

Name: WVR7933
Title: Ancient Ambal Temple
Review: This temple is located at Thambu Chetty Street, near to Parrys Corner Chennai. There is one more entrance from Armenian Street.. This temple is very much ancient and the Goddess is said to be very much powerful.  You can have dharshan, standing outside without going to the queue. Of course a very nice dharshan... In case you would like to sit and have a dharshan you have to come in the queue, which may not take more than 5 to 10 minutes. You can also have a darshan of Lord Ganapathy, Murugan with Valli Deivanai Veerabhadra Swamy and Maha Kali. It is a belief that your prayers will be answered soonest upon your dharshan of Kalikambal..I used to visit often this Kalikambal temple.

Name: Narayanan S
Title: A Temple which brings inner peace
Review: Located in Thambu Chetty street a busy commercial area, The temple is wonderful and certainly worth more than a visit. But for Trip advisor's reminders I would have missed the temple visit. The temple is crowded and reasonably well kept. It is said that Chatrapathi Shivaji visited and prayed Besides the main deity Kalikambal there are individual shrines for Veerabadraswamy, Maha Kali and there is a Navagraha sannidhiIt is certainly a must visit temple in Chennai

Name: sathish k
Title: Olden temple
Review: Kalikambal temple is olden and most religious temple in Chennai. Kodimaram is one of the important futures of the temple. People's used to light yeluvalaku and neitheebam is most important in these temple.

Name: sai srinivas y
Title: Reenergise our soul
Review: Ancient temple, Goddess blessing all devotees with her graceful eyes. temple organisers are also organising every devotes to sit for a minute in sanidhanam and blessing of goddess is creating by aarti.  I really felt in my life that when I go there with heavy heart by seeing the face of Ambal, I myself and heart everything will be like air (free).  That is the power of omnipresent.

Name: WVR7933
Title: Powerful Ambal Temple at Chennai George Town
Review: This temple is located at Mannady, at Thambu Chetty Street, George Town area of Chennai. The temple has other entrance at Armenian Street. The KƒÅlikƒÅmbal Temple is  dedicated to Shri KƒÅligƒÅmbƒÅl and Lord Kamadeswarar, This temple is very much ancient and said to have been built during 17th Century. We can also worship Lord Vinayaga, Subramanya, Veerabhadra and Nataraja.Here they allow you to sit and have the Darshan of Kaligambal. The queue system is good and very fast. In case you are in a hurry, you can have the Darshan from outside. I had a very nice darshan yesterday.The temple is very much clean and well maintained. It is a must to visit this temple and get the blessings of the Goddess.

Name: 839sridharn
Title: Kalikambal temple and kamateshwarar temple
Review: Very powerful Ambal and fulfills the wishes of girls in getting married. Temple is open from early morning and pooja and flowers and lemon Malas and garlands are offered to God for worshipping. People can sit in front of Praharam and have good Darshan of Goddess. Lord shiva is worshipped as Kamateshwarar and one can have Darshan leisurely. Must see temple and situated in Armenian street of Parrys Corner.

Name: Sundar V
Title: Kalikambal temple& kachchapeswarar temple visits
Review: Yesterday afternoon by 3 o‚Äôclock myself& my husband started from Thiruvanmiyur boarded 109 MTC bus bus coming from Kovalam & going to Broadway & reached Broadway by 4 o clock& we reached Kalikambal temple by hiring an auto for 40 rs . The temple was open  at that time . We had a good  Dharshan of the Amman  in half an hour. There the priests were very good. They organized very well. They made people to sit before the main dairyentering into the sanctom group by group & performed arthi for each group & dispersed quickly giving full satisfaction for the divoties . The temple is having many sannadhies for so many daites. Then we visited Kachchabeshwarar temple also which is at walkable distance from here. That temple is also very good & we had a Dharshan of the daities . It is maintained very clean  & the priests also behaved in a very pleasing manner. After finishing the Dharshan s in two temples we again went to Broadway bus stand by auto paying 40 rs. Again boarded 109 MTC bus which is starting from Broadway & going to Kovalam. We reached our Thiruvanmiyur house by 6 o clock in the evening. The temples are open from 7 AM to 12 PM & 4 Pm to 9 Pm .

Name: Umang A
Title: Maa Kali
Review: A very old and famous temple of Maa Kaalli in the most of busy streets. It is said great Maharaja shivaji used to offer his prayers before war.

Name: meghashyam
Title: Maa
Review: Very old and hallowed temple for maa Kali . Worshipped by chatrapathi Shivaji a great Sakta   temple is highly popular and always crowded , maa is a great Vara prasaddi . Sri Kachabeeswarar temple is very nearby

Name: NEPALPILGRIMTRAVEL
Title: best place for worship devi
Review: excellent management by temple staff and administration comitteedid abhishekam for devi and very satisfied

Name: GrannyMaa
Title: Old Temple
Review: In midst of the busy and commercial Parrys area is the Kalikambal temple. It is very famous temple and built long ago. The approach road to this temple is one-way and lot of traffic and congestion.

Name: Sugu_thegreat
Title: Temple Visited by Sivaji Maharaj
Review: I love this temple and am so attached to amma here. Also whenever i visit this temple i love to visit Durgai Amman behind. So sentimental and blessed to this temple

Name: Travelbug291
Title: Reverence
Review: New to India, I was very taken with the reverence and respect the local population pay to their Hindu Gods and their many incarnations. There was always a steady stream of people to the temples wherever I went, either giving thanks or asking for their divine Gods to grant their wishes. I was always made to feel welcome to join in.

Name: James H
Title: Another Must Do
Review: This is a very old temple situated in a lovely neighborhood of old shops. I had a guide for this temple and I received so much more information and came to appreciate the experience so much more. I would have been lost in the tiny lanes just leading up to the temple.

Name: j_yuvan
Title: For the spiritually inclined
Review: It is said that Chatrapati Shivaji visited this Temple and offered prayers to Kalikambal the presiding deity. Need to visit this temple to seek the blessings of the Goddess.

Name: sugumar s
Title: An amazing Chennai temple
Review: This was our second visit to Chennai and the Kalikambal Temple. We recommend that you tour this temple with the Storytrails "Peacock Trail" tour. It was so much more meaningful and interesting than the traditional fact driven typical tour guide approach.

Name: murthi
Title: A quaint and very ancient temple to Kalikambal
Review: One will be overawed by the atmosphere of godliness and holy presence at this temple. It is a tribute to Chennaiites that they have managed to preserve the temple almost in its original form despite the rapid pace of commercialisation all around.

Name: tnbalaji90
Title: Nice Temple
Review: This temple is very old..located in thambu cherry Street in Parry's..darshan is free no token..don't visit on auspicious days like Fridays or amavasya days, temple will be very crowded and congested..There are many gods to worship in this temple, though the main deity is goddess kalikambal.. another important one is prathyankaradevi near the entrance..There are also many shops near the entrance which sell puja articles, lemon garlands, etc. Fans are there in some places inside. Prasadam is sold at Rs 10 per item. Due to its significance this place will be frequented by some politicians and celebrities. Maratha king Chatrapathi Sivaji once worshipped in this temple. Worth to go.

Name: avithechamp775522
Title: Nature's beauty!!
Review: I visited here in the month of April and my experience was extremely amazing. The beauty of this temple attracts the tourist.

Name: Malarkodi p
Title: Spiritual
Review: Place which calms the mind and help to focus. Crowded but well managed. They allow you to sit for few minutes in front of the Goddess which is unique here.No parking place near by. Visit the Shiva temple near by.Must visit.

Name: rakeDelhi
Title: Centuries Old Powerful Temple
Review: The temple is situated in a busy old area Parrys but that does not stop the devotees to come and seek the blessing showered by Maa.There are regulars who come daily and get showered with all the blessings.More than a thousand year old temple and still standing strong with a positivity flowed by the Kalika Maa.Go and feel the aura of purity and serenity.

Name: Murlidhar R
Title: Kalikambal temple a gem hidden in chennai
Review: A beautiful one thousand year old temple in old chennai hidden among charming old shops on narrow roads. It is the center of Shakti worship. Go there for the sense of love and peace. Take a different look at chennai.

Name: Mahendra K
Title: Most Powerful Goddess in Parrys area
Review: I visit this temple very regularly and everytime i have a blissful experience and diving feeling. located in heart of Parrys area.

Name: Afrin S
Title: Resolve all your problems
Review: Resolve all your problems.Very good temple for viswakarma people.Very powerful Godess.I recommend for every tourist visiting chennai.Parking is a concern.

Name: Hilarian_Felix
Title: Kalikambal Temple - an Ancient Temple
Review: Kalikambal Temple is a very ancient hindu temple located in the prime location of the Chennai City in a place called Thambu Chetty Street near Parrys corner which is at the back of Rajaji Salali of Parrys corner. This temple is named after its deity goddess kali. The Maratha king shivaji has visited this place during his time. The famous Tamil Poet Bharathiyar used to come often to this temple and worship here. This temple has its origin in the late 16th century.

Name: vpnpns
Title: Amman to cure all your problems
Review: Please avoid going to temple on friday. If you go there will be rush. Go early in the morning to avoid rush

Name: Kittu33
Title: A must visit temple
Review: A very beautiful and ancient temple in the heart of the busy business centre of Chennai... Peaceful and powerful...üôèüôè

Name: PROF. TMJ INDRA... N
Title: A Power on Earth
Review: A mesmerising  divine abode once visited the power of the divine keeps a believer to keep visiting often. Divine Beauty one can absorb in when the Shri Kali is seen at the early hours.

Name: Anjal s
Title: Average
Review: It's a bit untidy in its surrounding but rest all aspects are above average .nice ambience and peace of mind guarenteed

Name: Boopalachandran G
Title: Peaceful Prayer
Review: Our Family regularly visit this Temple We visit this temple to get the Blessing and to have the good feeling that we will get good Guidance ..

Name: Anbudan P
Title: Get peace of mind...
Review: when your mind is turbulent, make a visit to this temple, leave everything with sree kaligambal amman; she will take care of your well being...

Name: Sudha
Title: Good to go back
Review: I visited this temple some years back and this time I visited with my family and it was so good visiting this temple .the old thambu chetty street and with all shops and port nearby .visit to this temple was a good feeling seeing the abishekam and prayers.....

Name: Kunja Bihari M
Title: The Kali Temple
Review: Situated in the Thambu Chetty Streets, this is one of the best temples in Chennai. This has many importance.

Name: babuvis51
Title: An iconic temple in Chennai north
Review: Kalikambal temple is situated very close to Parrys corner. It is a very serene place for worshipping Goddess Kalikambal.  Chatrapathi Shivaji is said to have visited the temple and offered prayers. The temple is surrounded by busy wholesale market dealing with textiles,  hardware, pharmaceuticals, jewellery, household goods etc. Chennai central station is just four kms away. You can also buy fruits and vegetabls on the way at flower Bazaar. Very good restaurants and eateries are also available.

Name: Swami1939
Title: VERY ANCIENT AMMAN TEMPLE IN CHENNAI CITY
Review: The Kalikambal temple located on Thambu chetty street, George Town, Chennai  is one of the ancient temples in Chennai city. This is the temple which was worshiped by CHATHRAPATHY SIVAJI the well known worrier in the Indian history. The deity is very powerful and attracts lots of devotees every day. During festival days and Tuesdays and Fridays the temple will witness very large crowed.A visit to this temple will have very satisfying divine experience.

Name: Rucha121
Title: Old Temmple
Review: We were doing shopping of ceramic stuffs in nearby market, we came across this old temple and stepped inside to offer our prayers and pay obeisance to God. Dark and smelly, needs maintenance and lighting. Peaceful and calm inside.. totally opposite to outside busy world.

Name: krazikams
Title: Place of Worship
Review: Very old temple located in buzzing Thambu Chetty Street, close to Beach Railway station. There is no rating required for a temple, as it is a place of worship. However, the maintenance needs a big boost and entrance to temple is always crowded with vendors and alms-seekers.

Name: vasan224
Title: excellent spiritual place
Review: it is a famous amman temple in chennai city. kalikambal amman is powerful goddes who gave a boon for her people who beliving her truly.

Name: 674santha
Title: sacred temple
Review: it is a famous amman temple  located in thambu chetty street chennai .the priest is very dedicated in doing poojas and even though rush is there during tuesdays and fridays everybody can worship peacefully many believe  in the power of this goddess

Name: DineshBabuPugalenthi
Title: Great Experience !
Review: Spiritual Experience Good Maintenance. Overall Experience is good.Located in hot of the city with hospitality facilities available nearby.

Name: kakp76
Title: Blessing of Maa Kali
Review: It is very old and powerful temple, You can visit on every tuesday and friday as these two days are auspicious days for Maa Kali.

Name: suseelasukumar
Title: Ancient Temple
Review: This temple is situated in Parrys. This temple is situated in busy area. The Goddess is very powerful. She blesses all for all our wishes we ask her. There will be heavy rush in Tuesday Friday and Sunday. And also in the month of adi.

Name: SShaan
Title: Very nice temple
Review: The Goddess is very powerful . The temple is simple in its architecture . The minus is that it is in a very busy and narrow lane in the Parry's area with very little parking space . The temple is well maintained and carries the legacy of Chatrapathi Shivaji having visited the place .

Name: Vidhya31
Title: Very powerful Goddess
Review: The alankaram (decoration) of goddess will be excellent. One cannot forget the image it will be the evergreen one in the minds of all the kalikambal devotees. Special days like friday, adiperku, adivelli, thaiamavasasi, one must be gifted to see her. True spiritual experience and it is great to be at least once on a special alankaram days. must see place to have blessings of Lordess Kalikambal.

Name: Lakshmi Balakrishnan
Title: historic temple
Review: situated in the busy streets of the parrys area , this temple is a big crowd puller . the main deity is goddess kalikambal. parking your cars near the temple on weekdays is impossible as the roads are congested.

Name: Akash K
Title: Popular amongst Locals but crowded
Review: This temple is auspicious and very popular amongst locals.But this place is very crowded,.No proper parking place avialable

Name: YesPeeKay
Title: Surprise to see from so Close
Review: This is one of the famous worship places in Chennai and the leading roads are always crowded, i never wanted to see the lordess  navigating crowded lanes and parking is a real nightmare. To my surprise the weekend, it  was totally free and may be due to denotification by Modi Ji. Could able to have the darshan from so close and no one was pressing us to move. A must visit place in Chennai, Plan it on Weekend (Sunday) hit early and enjoy hassle free Darshan.

Name: Balasubramanian R
Title: Kalikambal Kamateswarar Temple
Review: Kalikambal temple is situated in George town area of Chennai city. Temple is nearer to Madras Beach Railway station    in Thambu Chetty street, which is a busy market centre. Goddess Kalikambal viz.Kamakshi and Lord Kamateswarar (Lord Shiva) are main deity of the temple. Near by Madras Collectorate and Port. It is one of the oldest temple (more than 350 years) in that area.

Name: oshylu
Title: Powerful Goddess.. people are believing
Review: When I visited this place ..there was a homam called sandi yagam.. it is special for " chathru nivaranaa" .. very crowd .. parking no ..  surrounding cleanliness very worst .. inside the temple .. somewhat good .. Hindus wants to visit and very famous too

Name: Ra_Radha
Title: Very Old temple in George Town
Review: This temple is very popular among the locals. But, maintenance of temple premises is not good. They introducted token system for everything, chapals, darshan, etc.. Even entry to this temple has lot of traffic restriction, and difficult to find parking space for bike. But inside temple, it is peaceful and you can do your puja and aartis.

Name: Balasubramanian S
Title: Spiritual trip
Review: Regularly visiting the temple once in a month. Powerful deity and nice environment. Parking of vehicle like car is a huge problem. Planning for Sunday is ideal as most of the shops in the street closed and you may park your car in front of any one of the shops. Don't miss to get the Prasadam inside the temple

Name: CoralBay F
Title: Do you Need Spiritual Experience
Review: A place you need to see once. its about learning indian culture.Elephant worship , lotus flowers to god, spiritual shopping

Name: sathya1970
Title: Temple which gives Braveness & Victory
Review: This temple is located in George Town near Parrys Corner and accessible through Beach Station by Railway Network. This is temple was build by the Great Maratha Warrior, Chathrapathi Shivaji during 16th century.

Name: Praveen S
Title: Good Temple to go
Review: This is bit interior but quite powerful god, as mostly celebrities visit this temple, good place to go

Name: Chakkravarthy M
Title: Temple visit - Sri Kalikambal Temple
Review: We visited the temple on last Maha Shivarathiri night... It is a well maintained temple in North Chennai. We had a good dharshan on that day

Name: mr1946
Title: kalikambal
Review: This temple is reportedly visited by Shivaji.Though located in the oldest town of Chennai viz.George Town a large crowd gathers to worship in the evenings,especially Fridays.

Name: Viswaconsultant
Title: Kali temple..
Review: Neatly maintained.. Cultural activities.. Pujas, worshiping .. Very nice temple..Ordinary days, you can see the Deity easily with full satisfaction..

Name: Venket K
Title: devine
Review: whoever wants blessings do visit the temple, ambal is the goddess and pray sincerely, your wish comes true

Name: dilipmatrix
Title: Temple in Hottest Place of Chennai
Review: Even though this temple has good value for their religious views, it's always gets busy and tough for the clients to get their vehicles get parking space.

Name: Priya N
Title: Powerfull
Review: one of the most powerful temple and goddess i ever visited and i used to visit at least once in a week.

Name: raja p
Title: parvathi devi temple.
Review: this is goddess parvathi devi temple.locals told me that the name of the chennai came from this goddess.i visited in the morning.calm atmosphere.

Name: Aruna T
Title: Great time
Review: One of the old temple in Chennai must to visit with family members. very peaceful place to visit with family.

Name: dheepika8
Title: Divine Experience!
Review: One of the oldest temples in Chennai with a vast history. The divine feeling here is just awesome. Must visit this place if you are visiting Chennai.

Name: Srimukunth S
Title: Nice place to Visit
Review: Nice place to Visit. The temple is spiritual. If you are looking for a change from the usual beaches and restaurants. This is the place to be with family

Name: Priya_T
Title: Typical south indian temple
Review: Located in the busting by lanes of Parrys, this temple has all idols, Its quite large. And gets crowded in the evenings.

Name: Arul S
Title: powerful diety
Review: relatively small temple, however very popular. Chatrapathi Sivaji also visited. very popular amongst celebrities as well. Well maintained. People are good as well

Name: Chithranath
Title: A Kali temple visited by shivaji Maharaj
Review: Its in a very big business locality, knwon as Thambu chetty street.  A spiritual experience, where you have a great Kali dharsshan.  The great shivaji has worshipped here.

Name: Radhika Narasimhan
Title: Prayer at Marundeeshwarar temple
Review: One of the oldest temple of Chennai where the belief followed is, those who visit are cured of diseases. Today morning via adyar from the back entrance I entered the temple. Had good darshan of the legend and consort Tripurasundari Devi. Atmosphere was calm filled with lovely nature and spirituality. A must visit temple of chennai.

Name: niluanu
Title: Serene Temple
Review: Located in the Thiruvanmiyur area of Chennai, this is a very old Shiva temple dating back to the Chola period. A serene and spacious temple, it attracts a lot of devotees and is easily accessible. The temple complex also houses shrines of Ganesha, Kartik and Parvati. The temple is open from 5.30 in the morning till noon, and again from 4.30pm till 9.30pm

Name: Sud D
Title: One of the oldest temples in Chennai
Review: Paadal Petra Sthalam. One off the oldest Shiva temples in Chennai. Nice temple to visit. A lot of legends and history

Name: Devika Rani
Title: Siva devotees, answers prayers for the sick
Review: The lord siva here is known as Marundeerswara.  Devotees in ancient days believed that visiting places blessed by sages or created with a purpose  relieves certain pains and diseases.   The temple is accessible by road from Adyar.    .  A great place to spend 2-3 hours in the morning understanding the history of the temple.   This one answers the devotees.   Professionals like doctors may think religion and practices ignore them but sometimes even for a medicine to work we need some divine guidance. A miracle experience for me and hope it helps the devotees who read this .

Name: Nagarjuna
Title: Lord's blessings on MAHASHIVRATRI
Review: Great old templeGreat darshan of lord shiva and ammanGreat organization by temple volunteers.Disciplined devotees.Very easy to locateExcellent transportation facilities by mtc buses.Temple AUTHORITIES should run book stall which sells books in regional languages about temple and it's historyOM NAMA SHIVAYA

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: One of the twin temples of Thirukkachur
Review: The temple is 7th century temple dedicated to lord shiva worshipped as marundeeswarar and goddess Parvathi as irulneeki thayar. This along with the kachabeswarar temple of the Thirukkachur village is considered as twin temple of the village.

Name: Mrudula
Title: Lord Shiva
Review: This is the temple where lord shiva is worshiped and people believe that the god here is very powerful and can clear any disease upon visit

Name: sridharan2013
Title: An ancient temple in Chennai
Review: This temple located in the famous Mylapore area of Chennai is ancient with lots of history. Lord Kapaleeswara and Goddess karpagambal are the main deities in the temple. Temple has a huge area with mandapams for devotees to sit and relax/meditate. The temple has its own large temple pond. It is a divine experience visiting the temple and having Dharshan of Lord and the goddess.

Name: Gosthala
Title: A divine place for cure
Review: Marundeeswarar temple located at Tiruvanmiyur, Chennai is a Paadal Petra Sthalam since it has been mentioned in the classic tamil works by the Nayanars during 6th to 9th century CE. There is a belief that it is at this place that Lord Shiva imparted sage Agasthya about the knowledge of medicinal value of various herbs that relieve people from illness and diseases. Hence people visit the temple to get relieved from their ailments or pray for the cure of their kith and kin.People perform milk abhishekam to the Lord and consume Vibuthi to get cured of illness and relief from sins. When the wishes are fulfilled, they offer vastras to God.One could feel a difference within oneself on entering the temple and witnessing the Lord at the sanctum sanctorum.

Name: Karikalan S
Title: Hindu Temple, ancient and a holy place
Review: An ancient and holy place. Well maintained and well illustrated. People with hindu faith will relish every moment being here.

Name: reubenranjanfern2017
Title: Very old holy temple.
Review: This temple has a lot to do with history and culture. Very well maintained. Offered my prayer and ask other to visit this place.

Name: TravellingSands
Title: Self Manifested Shiv Ling!! 1300 Years of documented history
