Review: I am not a modern art fan.  The art here, however, blew me away - it was so evocative of what I believe to be India that it made me aware of the socio-political contexts of art.  The museum itself is so unassuming that it's easy to pass it by.  But it's become a highlight of my Madras experience, and I will re-visit with friends (my friends from Spain were impressed too) whenever I can.

Name: Phil H
Title: Interesting selection of local art
Review: Brave the traffic and you arrive at a small but interesting art gallery with a permanent exhibition and a gallery with art works from some noted artists for sale.  There is an interesting sculpture display in the garden and an upstairs and downstairs gallery with paintings, drawings and sculpture.  Worth the visit.  No refreshments there.

Name: WorldcitizenCH
Title: Modern Art in Chennai
Review: Art addicted should come here, there is some beautiful art pieces! Staff is very nice. Never saw till visit such a modern Buddha ! Other art pieces are amazing ! There is also a nice retrospective from Vasudev. Very nice paintings and other works...

Name: Rathish Nair
Title: Very Interesting - For ART LOVERS
Review: Forewarning - The Artists village would be a very good attraction for the ART LOVERS only.  If you have no inclination for ART- better skipLocated off the main road and on the ECR Road, it is set up in a very peaceful environment. There is a small entrance fee to the main museum.  The artifacts and paintings are worth once a look. Lot of contemporary works in display. There are some books and souvenirs that one can buy too.

Name: UtpalShah
Title: Excellent vibe and beautiful art works
Review: After visiting the museum, don't forget to take a stroll into the artist residential / work area. You will find many artists working on their next masterpieces. I bought a nice painting, which they packed very nicely for flight travel. It arrived without a scratch.

Name: Eric G
Title: A Collective Exhibition of South Indian Modern Art
Review: On my way back to Chennai from Dakshin Chitra museum, I went here. I like modern art so I did enjoy my visit. Sample works by contemporary artists are exhibited here. Almost half of the exhibit is permanent (called "the museum"), and the other half is temporary and the works are on sale (called "the gallery"). Most or some of the artists live around the gallery, within the "art village" but it is not easy to visit them. It seems there are no "open door" days and hours when the public may visit their studios.

Name: YashiR25
Title: One time visit if on ECR
Review: For those who are too much into Arts. I just liked one painting there which was on first floor right side. Well-maintained, if happens to be on ECR, worth a one time visit.

Name: Atul G
Title: For those who enjoy modern art
Review: This artists‚Äô village displays modern and abstract paintings and sculptures from India. I very much enjoyed perusing the works on displays and it is definitely worth seeing if you are interested in the art scene from India. The pieces are well-presented and there is plenty of information about the different artistic movements throughout the 20th century and some of their most prominent artists. Outside their is a small sculpture park that is less interesting as most of your time is better spent indoors. It isn‚Äôt a big complex at all and can easily be covered in around an hour if you see it comfortably. Definitely one to see for art enthusiasts.

Name: dinesh_j84
Title: Art Gallery with Decent Collection
Review: This Art Gallery is located close to the VGP Theme Park along the ECR. It displays paintings of various themes. The art gallery is well maintained. It is not usually crowded as it is away from the center of the city.

Name: Vilasitha V
Title: worst experience......nothing special to see over there...waste of time...I personally do not recommend anyone to go for
Review: nothing special to see over there...waste of time...I personally do not recommend anyone to go for this place

Name: Thusanee L
Title: A delightful sight for art lovers
Review: This museum with contemporary art is such a nice place to spend an afternoon with. I got so amused by their history. You will also have the chance to meet the artists during the morning. I strictly recommend to watch "Krishnaa" by A. Selvaraj. My absolute favourite! But i wish they had workshops for publics.

Name: Sunand S
Title: A very peaceful art gallery - A Must visit for Art lovers - A hidden gem in chennai
Review: For all those , who have interest in arts , some very beautiful art work . You can also purchase few paintings starting from 5000/- INR to 60,000/-INR  :) Not that big ,you can easily cover all in 1hrs to 2 hrs Ticket 30rs for adults and below 5 year kids are freeAbout Place-Cholamandal Artists' Village, established in 1966, is the largest artists' commune in India. Its artists are credited for the Madras Movement of Art (1950s‚Äì1980s), which brought modernism to art in South India. Their work is widely recognized as some of the best art produced in postwar India and is shown regularly in galleries across the country. Several Cholamandal artists have also shown in Europe, the United States and South America.In the village Injambakkam, 9 km from Chennai, India, it has over 20 resident painters and sculptors, who live as a community and pool their skills. They run the Artists Handicrafts Association, a cooperative which manages the village and sale of works through the permanent exhibition at the complex, which includes paintings, sketches, terra-cotta/stone/metal sculptures, batiks and handicrafts etc., making the village a self-supporting entity

Name: RAJKUMAR A
Title: Not for general public, Strictly!
Review: This place should not have been made a public attraction. Unless you have extreme interest towards art or you're an ardent artist, this place is a complete disaster. Don't waste your time and money by visiting this place. There's absolutely nothing here other than paintings and stones or statues.

Name: Krzysztof N
Title: Better than I expected
Review: It is a kind of open-air museum with many examples of Indian architecture and village houses. You can also see here how sari is made, pottery, etc. The best part for me was surprisingly short videos presented in few places. That way man can learn about ordinary life in Indian home, family hierarchy, duties, privileges, etc. The museum is not offensive regarding number of details and site layout - very friendly from that side.

Name: Dilip S
Title: Where I Learnt Lot
Review: The 10th December , 2016 is the date we will never forget . On this day we first visited Dakshin Chitra and then very fortunate to visit Cholamandal an Artists‚Äô Village brainchild of K C S Paniker , eminent painter and visionary who dreamt of an art Indian in spirit and world wide contemporary .  The place we visited was not a village , it was a multum in parvo , telling the story of the strength and the weakness of present day Indian art .  Thirty painters and sculptures acquired 3.5 ha of land 8 km south of Adyar  on then muttukadu road in 1965 to start the Village in order to rehabilitate the creative artists . Here the artists paints or sculpts through the major part of the day and earns through the sale of his art . The Village is perhaps the first of its kind anywhere in the world . On 1st feb 2009 , the Cholamandal Centre for Contemporary Art consisting of the K C S Paniker Museum of the Madras Movement , two commercial A C gallaries , Labernum and Indigo , and an open air international sculptures park surrounding the complex was inaugurated . Here we could revisit Paniker . The notion of a three dimensional linear space that the Renaissance  painters advanced and which they applied in the rule of perspective , and the pure theory of it which the cubists abstracted later on are to date the only technically sound solutions to the issue between drawing and picture . Paniker was one who would not submit his subject to received theory in its applied or pure form . Rather than relent Paniker broke off and set out arguing his own case . He made his departure in the landscape , the genre he used extensively for developing his arguments . Instead of solidifying the free space with the straight line structure of perspective or with regular blocks of colour , he made it into a fluid thing held up with a distribution of highly accented , broken and curling lines . The irregular edges of colour that one gets as a bonus when working in water colour , a medium in which Paniker excelled , might have suggested to him this very unconventional abstraction .   The second artist we studied was the sculptor Nandgopal . His sculpture looked open and perhaps continues to , probably because it Is not closed on all sides like something in the round , also because it is not spatial , I e , something fixed compositionally  in space .  We highly appreciated A Selavraj‚Äôs painting , which absorbed the rhythmic freedom that makes the dancer‚Äôs body reflect the pure joy of movement . A Selavraj is a born dancer . The dancing experience evolved his style both in painting and sculpture . It acquired a fluidity  and in painting he gets a flow of light and  shadow .  His style remains purely figurative and he felt inspired by dancers , deities , musicians and village dames .There were many inspirational sculptures around the complex , some of which were Dream of the black sun by N D Rajsekharan , the zen inspired  Emptiness by Hiroshi Mikami , Figure  by Kanyai Kunhiraman , Head by Mall Walsh , Landscape by Theo tan Have , Lord M..  by S Kannappan  , Seed by Nagji Patel from my Vadodara ,  Shape by Olaf Mooij , Temple by Cune van Groeningrn and  View by Ajit Chakravarti  .  There was painting by Dich Donker too .

Name: RAM779
Title: Artwork
Review: All it is Displays of Small to Medium size art work in 2 buildings.. Could be a Artist's haven but for everybody's best interest..

Name: ArunaSrinivas
Title: For Artists and Art Lovers!
Review: It's located on the ECR. A quiet place where artists work and their artwork is displayed both for viewing and sale.

Name: Bharatbackpacker
Title: For serious art lovers
Review: The artist village maybe more relevant to Artists themselves rather than tourists. Even though an art lover myself, was very disappointed as the museum while show casing works of the artists of the Madras Art Movement lead by Panicker, there is very little on the movement itself. I suppose that the commune still exists is an achievement by itself. Entrance to museum is ticketed.

Name: Arrul
Title: To the people who love Art
Review: I visited this place a long back in 2010 , As an art lover I always look for something like this in the city and this village is exceptional, Art contributions display works of prominent artists including M. Senathipathi, Late A.P. Santhanaraj, P.S. Nandhan, S.G. Vasudev, K.V. Haridasan, Thotta Tharani, Sculptor S. Nandagopal.

Name: Ellen C
Title: worth a visit
Review: This artist commune offers contemporary artists a place to work and display their paintings, sculpture and craft. There is a permanent gallery as well as a sales gallery. It is interesting to see how some of the ancient art influences these very modern pieces. Lovely gardens, and a sculpture park surround an old banyan tree.

Name: GRVenky
Title: Beautiful paintings, good collection
Review: On the way to Mahabalipuram, one can visit this place for a lovely experience of going through a most beautiful collection of paintings and a few metal sculptures. Time worth spending  A few of the paintings take your breath away.

Name: Shyamis
Title: Artist commune
Review: This is an artist commune and it is a beautiful place to visit. The place has resident artists and sculptors.

Name: Manash_Baruah
Title: Signifiant collection of art
Review: The art gallery has great ambiance.  Located amidst a quite locality, the building has very good collection of art since 1950s.  A visit will refresh your minds with great work by the exponents of art

Name: madhu507
Title: Great art display
Review: Don't go with any expectations...very good paintings..Adult entry ticket 10 & for kids 5 rs....this is just my opinion

Name: kevinjohn1991
Title: Great Art Variety!!!
Review: One can find many interesting paintings here. There is not a lot one can learn from here as there no proper curators around. This place on the ECR road and one can drop in on the way to Mahabalipuram. The tickets are very cheap.*Visit*

Name: Remya
Title: Great variety of art
Review: Visited it on the way to mahabalipuram from chennai Adult entry tickets for 10/- INR and kids for 5/- INR There are books, paintings and creations from metal and stone.It is a result of the Madras Movement for liberating and inspiring the Indian artists esp during the Post Freedom Era.It is a refreshing and great way to see the mix of Indian mythological with western strokes. Time _For an hour max No photography insideOutside few creations are allowed to be clicked Free parking outside Calm and colourful experience Allowed to buy t-shirt, mugs, plates for 300 and 750 INR depending on the size.  Though most books are for reference there are few for purchase. Tip_ drop in on the way from chennai to mahabalipuram

Name: Jude G
Title: Expected more
Review: Truth to say, I expected more from this place given that it pioneered a new art movement in chennai. However, I found some paintings on sale and others for display only. There were books but no artist to interact with and not much information about the movement in the museum. There are beautiful sculptures and buildings in the area. But I did not learn much as the works were not curated properly. This is just my opinion.

Name: Vijay Raj Selvam
Title: Must visit for Architecture lovers
Review: This place will be really a treat for all those who love art and architecture. To be clear, its only place for art lovers.. Others please avoid. You will be really bored here!

Name: BananaLu
Title: 4 stars for the symbol of the place! For art lovers!
Review: People can actually not exactly visit the whole Cholamandal artists‚Äô village because we are not supposed to enter the artists‚Äô houses but there is an interesting gallery split on two floors with a permanent collection and few items that can be purchased, and another gallery that seems to contain only temporary exhibitions. Though small the collection is made of paintings (oil, acrylic, and water colour), sketches, drawings, and sculptures. Sadly only few art pieces have titles and none has explanations written on the side to enlighten the visitors on the artists‚Äô messages.I would not advice to tourists who have a limited time to go there as the galleries are very small and do not contain items that will blow their mind, but I would definitely advice people who stay in Chennai to go there. It is indeed said to be the largest artists‚Äô community of India and in any case it must one of the only such communities able to survive like this today. It is also an important part of India modern art history (village inaugurated in the 60s!) and art lovers should not miss it!The artists also propose free sketches classes on weekends! A good opportunity for children and even adults if you live in this area!

Name: barry p
Title: truly wonderful array of 1960-2015 artists
Review: laid out exceptionally well, many for sale. if serious buyer can visit many artists homes also.  for any art lover, a must visit

Name: Papayaved
Title: Nice museum of modern art
Review: It's not so big museum of modern art like in Delhi, but and price is cheap. Take a walk in village among villas of artists, you will find more interesting artworks.

Name: rea2der
Title: Artist Village
Review: Recently visited the artist village with friends.It is located in Injambakkam and it is one of the  largest artists' commune in India . This place serves as a  good connection of modern Indian arts. Entry ticket amount is rs 20 and cameras are strictly not allowed.The artists live in the same village.Books are available for sale and it is little costly.On the whole a good place to learn about Indian arts.

Name: SagarVS
Title: For art lovers
Review: Here many artists live in one community. Visitors can meet various artists including painters, sculptors etc. This place has churned out many eminent artists over the years. If you are into paintings (modern and traditional) and other forms, it would be worth your time to spend some time here. This is on the way to mahabalipuram so if you can see the artists village on the way without having to make an exclusive trip.

Name: Tribhuvan J
Title: Good collection of Modern Indian arts
Review: This place has good connection of modern Indian arts. Entry ticket is negligible. The artists live in the same colony. If you are interested you can go buy their arts.

Name: Chandrasekaran N
Title: Artistic village
Review: This village is on the East Coast Road of chennai on the way to Mamallapuram. Arts in all forms can be seen. It is an artistic place. Budding artists and sesoned artists frequently visit this place. Even if we are not artists we will love this place. A nice place to spend useful time learning about Indian arts.A visit to this artistic place is really worth the time and money spent.

Name: srk800
Title: Artistic vilage
Review: Great show casing of Art and crafts of Rich country like India at one place.Worth visiting by any one who comes to chennai

Name: wanderer2174
Title: Good for visiting once atleast.
Review: Its heaven for the art connosieurs and even for people not too much into arty stuff, its good to see this place once. There are various art forms displayed here and one can only stretch one's imagination. The trees in the campus are also very beautiful and there is a small shack/ restaurant where one get's lovely cold fruit juices freshly made. It was very hot for us in October so please wear light clothes and carry sunglasses.

Name: crazyrahul78
Title: i just love this village...
Review: go with some one who really knows about the art.. then u ll come to know the beauty of this village. The world here is so calm n beautifull.. I went here for twice n every time it give me fresh experiance.

Name: Mediaplanner01
Title: Very serene
Review: Everything about the place from the art to artists to the seashore nearby was becalming and soothing. A definite stopover en route to Mahabs. Some of the sculptures were out of the world....

Name: gmj_ni
Title: An artist's paradise
Review: If you are an artist or understand art in its many forms this is one place to visit.I visited the place because one of my lecturers lived in the vicinity just to kill a couple of hours. But I ended up spending the entire afternoon and evening there. Its a great place and parking wasn't a problem.

Name: Bhramanti-Pune
Title: Not much to see than an Art Gallary...
Review: This trip was avoidable.... Not much there to look. Dakshin Chiteq, a bit more commercial was much better.

Name: Gowthami R
Title: south indians modeling Houses
Review: People of Tamil nadu,karnataka,kerala,and andhrapradesh states cultures,and the mannerism,and their Living shown as real

Name: suraghavan
Title: Artist village
Review: All travelers who would like to see how artisans work, one should visit this place lots of things for youngsters and elders alike

Name: Sudeshna G
Title: Ok.Not my type of place
Review: Its ok  ,teaches you all  about the culture of south India.But too much money for entry fees.I would better spend it iin golden beach rather than learning and  understnding the  culture.

Name: Anindia
Title: Great place and nice cafe called Shiraz
Review: Foliage of trees all around interspersed with bungalows-A very nice and p[pleasant sight to be in this village on ECR road Chennai. Cafe Shiraz is the most brilliant thing inside- A MUST Visit. The owners Nazreen and her brother Darush are awesome hosts. Anything and everything she cooks is our favourites!!

Name: vickykksa
Title: Good if you're a connoisseur of the arts
Review: We made a short stop at the Artist's Village on the way back to Chennai. It was quite late, so we were the only visitors there. We met one of the artists who had some of her paintings exhibited;  that was quite exciting, to meet a real live artist.The paintings and sculptures were interesting, but were not all 'understandable' to non-conneoisseurs like us!The banyan tree in the garden was fascinating,though. Unfortunately the cafe was not open, so we didn't get a chance to sit and enjoy a cup of tea there.

Name: rprabhoo
Title: Packaged Heritage
Review: Run behind the materialistic world. Hectic schedules and lofty targets may stress you. When you look back, you realise that you forgot where from you started. Worse still your children dont even know WHAT is that 'where from'. Cool place to remind your heritage and treasures through arts and sculpture.

Name: Ronzown
Title: Shaping up finally
Review: Have been coming her since my childhood, but finally Chalamandalam - is becoming the happening art and artists hang-out it should've always been. Try to get yourself on the invitation list of their Friday art movies club and get your palate tickled at the lovely Iranian cuisine at the Shiraz cafe. And amble around making friends with the resident artists and pick up a conversation or a piece of art.

Name: Arvind V
Title: Excellent concept
Review: it was a great idea to let know this generation of the culture that existed in the immediate previous lifetime / generation on the way of life in their own motherland. exposure to lifestyle, food habits, clothing, designs to name a few - very apt and unique

Name: 491max
Title: Good variation of Art
Review: Nice to walk around to see new art inside the well capt building. It has a outside garden with statues from Artists who came from all over the world to make art.

Name: tripfreak54
Title: Artists Village
Review: Cholamandal Artists Village was established in 1960's and has a permanent exhibition of paintings, sketches, terracotta sculptures, batiks and other crafts.Located about 20 km's from Chennai.

Name: Been2Bagan
Title: Contemporary landmark
Review: Cholamandal Artist's village has a beautiful gallery dedicated to the great artists of the Madras Movement. An atmospheric setting with a huge banyan, an Iranian cafe, and gardens make the gallery a nice outing. On the East Coast Road on the way to Dakshinachitra and Mammallapuram, Cholamandal can easily be bundled with a visit to these sites.

Name: Geo47
Title: Great fun
Review: A good initiative. Lots of do and see and a great learning opportunity too. This would be a great place to take children.

Name: G.Visukumar
Title: Every Artist should visit
Review: This place has huge collection of paintings from very popular artists'. Upcoming artists can learn more from those paintings.

Name: Resident-Non-Indian
Title: Great food at the cafe
Review: Don't miss having Sunday brunch here.  On weekdays they serve mostly snacks, but the Sunday brunch is delicious Iranian food.

Name: Ram M
Title: South Indian Contemporary Art at its best
Review: The Madras Movement... Very interesting history and beautiful museum/ gallery. The village itself is amazing with its atmosphere. Ofcourse more interesting as an art spot than a tourist spot.Has a lovely Iranian run restaurant, Shiraz, as well and the Sunday brunch is amazing. Some very good artefacts on sale - quite moderately priced for art works. The ambiance is what attracts visitors.

Name: DipuKV
Title: Prominent
Review: Vivekananda House is a prominent landmark in front of Marina Beach. The place was abuzz with activity, on the occasion of International Yoga Day.

Name: Eileen108
Title: Charming Museum with Extra Activities
Review: Museum is well done with informative displays on Swami Vivekananda and Indian spirituality. The 3D film on the Parliament of Religions was well done and charming. There was an area where you could ask questions and hear the reply from a video display of Vivekananda, it was enjoyable. And meditating in the room where he stayed was powerful. Definitely recommend this sight if you have time in Chennai.

Name: Dwightcr
Title: Famous old ice house
Review: Build in 1842 it contained Ice from far away to be used in the heat of India.  It's also known for Swami Vivekananda visit hear and thus a rename since the British were gone.

Name: Thaila S
Title: Peaceful and beautiful
Review: I'm so glad that we visited.  I took my two boys, ages 4 and 6, and we really enjoyed reading the pictures/paintings in the museum, seeing the movie, and meditating in the meditation hall.  It was incredibly tranquil and peaceful.  Highly recommend to everyone.  There is also a nice bookstore where we picked up a number of children's books in English.

Name: deshpande
Title: Inspiring place
Review: We visited this place during out tour. It is inspiring place. we were told that Vivekanand swami  stayed there for few days .  He also used to to do meditation in  that room. Very very peaceful place. One can learn many great things about him. It is worth seeing this place and spend some time in that peaceful place.

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: Must visit for youth and young children
Review: This is one of the best buildings that had ever visited in Chennai. It is located in Mareena beach road. The building structure is really good. And the gallery inside is very inspiring. It covers the complete life history of ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä Vivekananda with pictures and news articles. There are is also book store where we can buy some of the best books of swami Vivekananda.

Name: sundarjagalan
Title: House of Swami Vivekananda
Review: This place is right opposite to Marin Beach. Swamiji has stayed in this place  and did lectures too. The maintenance can be improved and general awareness can be created so the tourist don't miss this historic place at Chennai

Name: Deadman17
Title: Place of solitude
Review: the place is where Swami Vivekananda used to stay during old days. The place was actually built as a storage place for ice slabs imported from England. The place has a certain calmness about it. There are some documentaries that are screened on and off. A must visit place.

Name: TravellingSands
Title: Learn the History of Ice in India and Of course Swami Vivekananda
Review: The circular structure that resembles a well was primarily built to store Ice that was brought from UK in ships and was sold to the rich and famous of British ruled Chennai in 18 and 19 th centuries. Since Swami Vivekananda stayed in this building much later, this has now been converted into His memorial. Apart from a photo gallery depicting the life of the saint a 3D show, meditation hall, book shop and an institute that teaches Yoga and other modern skills is also run by the management.

Name: Melissa Dsouza
Title: Spiritual house
Review: This place has a meditation center and it has mentioned the life of Buddhism, the life history of Vivekananda is mentioned here. and they have also an audio clip about how was his life. You cant take photographs inside the place.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Built by the british
Review: The place is built by the British near the shore for storing large ice slabs imported from lo don for their personal use,and when saint vivekananda visited the city he stayed here for a short period and so the place is called so.now this houses the remembrance of the great saint and has an entrance fees for o e to go inside which houses a museum,

Name: JANET S
Title: Special!
Review: Very nice energy! Grounds are immaculate and flowers are beautiful. A place to be quiet and contemplative.  Allow time to relax, and have quiet meditation.

Name: Sunil G
Title: Peaceful place
Review: If you are a visitor to chennai and if you have time to spare then this is the place to visit for some relaxation.

Name: Chintan m
Title: Swami Vivekanand treasures..
Review: This house has the art gallery based on teachings of swami Vivekanand and his life. There is so much of the positive vibe ane energy into this place.

Name: Cashorcredit
Title: Interesting and informative
Review: You can spend a good 60 to 90 minutes here if you read all the displays and watch the brief 2D and 3D movies.  I had never heard of the Swami before, but I came away with a great respect for this man who lived in the late 1800s into the very early 20th century and who in many ways was way ahead of his time.   It was very interesting to read about his thoughts on education, women‚Äôs issues and humanity in general.  In today‚Äôs crazy world it is somehow comforting to read about the Swami‚Äôs philosophy!The building itself is also interesting from a historical point of view and it was nice to end the visit in the 3D theatre, which was air conditioned.A very modest entry fee is charged, and it‚Äôs one of the few places you won‚Äôt have to pay more if you are a foreigner.  The Swami would approve!

Name: Cyano Sadia
Title: Outside View
Review: Actually I saw it only from outside. The building looked stunning at evening with lights! Anyone heading toward Marina Beach will see this beauty!

Name: Praveenop
Title: A very historical Land mark
Review: This is surely one of Chennai's most historical building and a land mark. Saint Vivek Ananda has stayed here when even he visited Chennai. Besides this the building is maintained well but could been better. I hope the govt does more.

Name: TrailBlazer581787
Title: Interesting visit
Review: interesting visit and recommend for more information around an important historical change in India's culture.

Name: ChicLifeByte
Title: Beautiful Victorian architecture and a peaceful sight!
Review: A landmark in itself, Vivekananda house is an important pilgrimage and shrine for the followers of Swami Vivekananda. Known as Swami Vivekananda‚Äôs residence, the place possesses a beautiful Victorian architecture. There are fixed timings on weekdays and weekends (Monday closed). A peaceful place, where one could see different aspects of Swami Vivekananda- his speeches and photographs about his life. There is also an interesting 3D show.

Name: Devanie
Title: Very interesting
Review: An interesting and well-maintained museum about the life of Swami Vivekananda - extremely informative.

Name: CharmDeepak
Title: very Informative
Review: Very informative place if you like Vivekanada's philosophy. Well maintained house. Meditation room is available for people who wants to sit peacefully. House architecture is elegant with a sea view from First florr. Free car parking available. You can buy books at the stall next to parking.

Name: Ramya S
Title: Rocking man
Review: Saint Vivekananda's life history, photographs and speeches are on display at the Vivekananda or Ice house. It is difficult to imagine that this place was a fish preserving unit. The little park, culture centre,books,exbition centre, meditation hall 3D film etc are the attractions. The entry fee is INR 20 for adults and INR 10 for children.

Name: Aaqarsh Aiyyar
Title: Must visit
Review: The Vivekananda house or the ice House is a building soaked in a rich 128 years history. This is where the holy monkeys visited and stayed a century back. The property houses a meditation hall, the rare photo collections, the 3D movie theatre, the 2D hologram show, statues of the great Tamil Poet Thiruvalluvar and more. The location is in front of the world famous Marina beach. This is a must visit in Chennai.

Name: EnigmaticIndia
Title: Historical place
Review: Visited this place and happy that we did it. Definitely a part of history associated with Vivekanada.Lots of photos and paintings. There is a 3d show also and one can cover this place in an hours time.

Name: BhaarathPhotography
Title: Important place to visit in Chennai
Review: I suggest this place most and i request everyone should visit once, Place for all age peoples including childrens. I love the 3D show

Name: Priya M
Title: Historical place
Review: Historical place with lot of information about Vivekananda and his guru. Good place to do meditation.

Name: Mahipal B
Title: place of inspiration
Review: this is colonial building once used as storage house of ice, it was the home for swami Vivekananda during his visit to Chennai, it is now undertaken and maintained by Ramakrishna missionary and it is place where you can find inspiration and there are many inspiring things for youth too.

Name: Traveleasy15
Title: To revisit Ram Krishna Mission, and view all photographic history of Swami Vivekananda.
Review: Good place opposite Marina Beach in Chennai, can have all deatils in pictorial form, related to swami vivekananad history. Worth visit.

Name: ParthaDasIn
Title: Great place to be in
Review: Landed in Chennai for a one day trip. Straight headed to Vivekananda House from the central railway station. Took around 10 mins. I loved the place. It‚Äôs maintained well, so informational, and peaceful. Meditation room, short 3D movies, and 2 other are videos are part of this visit. One must go if really looking for Knowledge in life.

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Historical monument
Review: This is a nice monument near marina beach where Swami Vivekananda has stayed here for a while. Nice architecture and peaceful ambiance.

Name: Sunil G
Title: Peaceful place with lot of information
Review: Its a Peaceful place with lot of information about holy Vivekananda. Its serene calm and one can find inner peace in this place.

Name: Arman1842
Title: Swamiji's House
Review: Swami Vivekananda stayed in this place while he was in Madras (now Chennai). He meditated here. It is just opposite to Marina Beach. So, whenever you are in Chennai, you can pay a visit here.

Name: vasan224
Title: place for the manner man
Review: vivekananda  house is a hsitorical place for the swamy vivekananda. it‚Äôs a source of inspiration to thousands of people who visit it every year.

Name: Manjunath V
Title: Historical place
Review: This is the building in which Swami Vivekananda stayed for 9 days. It is now converted into memorial. It houses rare photographs of Swami Vivekananda along great personalities of his era. It is located opposite to Famous Marina beach. Must visit if you are near beach. The statue in front of building was inaugurated by Dr. S Radhakrishnan.

Name: Avi V
Title: Loved it
Review: It was a nice place for the followers of vivekananda.some more development can be done.and it can be a more attractive place.

Name: Keertan
Title: Good
Review: Awesome placeChennai is one of the best place to visit. The weather is very humid. The communication is awesome. People are very helpful. Most of them can understand english therefore language was not a barrier. Sea beaches, malls are must to visit. The traffic is too much so crossing the road is a bit difficult. I suggest to visit Chennai

Name: Janani P
Title: Vivekananda house
Review: Vivekananda house near marina beach is very good place for mediation,very silent place,this place tells about vivekananda life history.

Name: B R S
Title: Vivekananadar Illam - Must see in Chennai
Review: Vivekananadar Illam (House in Tamil)  is a  Must see in Chennai is a Majestic Heritage Building on the Kamarajar Salai or Marina Promenade over looking the Ocean. The Century+ old building,  is owned by the Government and administered by the Ramakrishna Mission.   It houses A Hall for Paintings & a Hall of Photographs on the Life of Swami Vivekanand. The Room where the Swamiji stayed is now a Hall for Meditation.

Name: Prasad B
Title: Simple but VIVEKful !!
Review: VIVEKful work here means full of wisdom ...Not only the walls and posters even staff working there also has a high level of wisdom.

Name: authorneelesh
Title: near the beach- spare it some time
Review: this is the place Swamiji stayed in when he came to chennai and has been preserved as a museum in his memory.has lots of rare pictures, some video shows and a lovely ultra peaceful meditation ro0m.

Name: 592abck
Title: What a place to visit
Review: Excellent architecture, divine and spiritual place which was ince used by Swami Vivekanand. It is not to miss !!

Name: ggandse
Title: Historic building and museum
Review: A disciple of Ramakrishna, Swami Vivekananda, was born into an aristocratic family in Calcutta and was inclined to spirituality from a young age. A great intellect and ability to communicate combined when he travelled to the USA to lecture on the Indian philosophies of Yoga and Vedanta to the western world. He worked at home to revive Hinduism and nationalism during the period of British colonialism.On returning to his homeland, after the epic lecture tour of America & Europe in the late 1890‚Äôs, Vivekananda moved into this large historic building on Marina Beach, Chennai. The building was also known as the ‚ÄòIce House‚Äô; so called when the East India Company stored huge chunks of Ice from America.It is open to the public everyday, except Wednesdays and for a small entry fee displays fascinating memorabilia and audio visual presentations about his life and the culture of the times. The institute also offers short courses for those wishing to learn more

Name: pnssnp
Title: majestic
Review: one cannot miss this majestic building on the way to the marina beach.  it is a white building right opposite the beach and is very well maintained.

Name: Umang A
Title: Vivekanad..
Review: Place where Vivekananda lived during his span in Chennai. Located bang on Marina beach and maintained by Ramakrishna.

Name: Jagmohan Singh D
Title: Heritage Glory
Review: It would be of interest to know that this place was known as ‚Äú Ice House ‚Äú, since it was a building used during the East India Company to store huge chunks of Ice from America. It is a circular shaped building constructed in 1842 . After his epic lecture tour of America & Europe, Swami Vivekananda nick named - ‚Äú The Wandering Monk ‚Äú stayed here in 1897.This place is open to public everyday barring Wednesday.

Name: MumbaiIndia
Title: Peaceful Place
Review: Located right on the Marina Beach.  There is a vivekananda museum attached to it, which will take about 30 minutes .  The institute conducts many short term courses which could be useful.

Name: ravikumartalara
Title: very inspirational place...don't miss it
Review: it is meomorial of vivekananda stayed place in chennai.nice viedos on  vivekandna speeches .swamy vivekananda chicago speech is special attraction which created in 3d

Name: alantan8
Title: Interesting 3D Movie
Review: Good to escape the hot sun. It have an interesting Exhibition with 3 D movie!Pay Rp20 as the entrance ticket

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: good for people with spirituality
Review: Its a pleasant place and nice to see .Meditations do happen here sometimes.One of the must see places for tourists and to be seen for people staying the city.This place is easily accessible as well

Name: worldwomantourist
Title: Historical museum related to Vivekanandar
Review: Vivekananda Museum is a historical building situated near Marina beach. The museum is a significant historical tie to Swami Vivekananda's life. It gives a glimpse of the history of Indian culture. The place is well maintained and kept clean.

Name: JoyOfTravellingIndia
Title: Must visit for the spiritually inclined
Review: A wonderful presentation of the glorious life and teachings of Swami Vivekananda that also showcases India's rich culture and heritage. Powerful messages depicted with some excellent presentations - still pictures, 2d and 3d videos add a variety and make it interesting especially for children. Located in a historic building (Called as the Ice house - where the British used to store ice in yester years), the museum is maintained very well. A visitor to Chennai must see this exhibition located on the Marina beach promenade.

Name: hareesha1
Title: Life if swami Vivekananda is depicted in a wonderful manner
Review: Vivekananda house is a must visit place in chennai.  The bullying was originally used to store ice by the British.  Swami Vivekananda lived here for nine days and now it is maintained by the ramakrishna ashram trust . You will surely be astonished at the great life swami Vivekananda lead, and it is beautifully depicted in various photographs.  There is also a 3d show. Must visit to know about swami Vivekanandas life and to get a clear idea of Hinduism.

Name: JOY_GHOSHDelhi
Title: Swami Vivekananda House in Chennai at Marina Beach
Review: It was the residence of Swami Vivekananda while he stayed there before his voyage to America. It is now a museum to portray the life and times of Swami Vivekananda.You can find several rare photographs of that time including one of Sri Ramakrishna Param Hansa and one of Sri Sarada Maa.Only drawback is that you can have a look at them but PHOTOGRAPHY INSIDE IS STRICTLY PROHIBITED.

Name: Balasubramanian R
Title: Vivekananda House
Review: Vivekananda house is one of the land mark of chennai city and also it is called Ice House. It is situated in Triplicane on the sea shore and it is a sub centre of Ramakrishna Math. Swami Vivekananda stayed here for few days.

Name: skkkd
Title: very good
Review: i felt very happy while my visit to Vivekananda house.it is opp to marina beach.the members behave with good maintanence .

Name: samadhanamhopek
Title: Tamil Nadu 2017
Review: Beautiful, interesting architecture, well located and easy to access from the centre of city.  A lovely landmark

Name: Rucha121
Title: Iconic Landmark on Kamaraj Salai
Review: Called as Vivekananda house, it is located on stretch opposite to Marina Beach. It puts on display the principles, teachings and philosophy of Swami Vivekananda. His photographs, books and other souvenirs are displayed here.

Name: Sandeep G
Title: Revival of memories of the great Vivekananda
Review: The house or building is dedicated to Vivekananda himself. His story , his achievement and all the old memories. All the pics and speeches he gave and all the memorabilia. There is also a small store which sells books and his teachings. There are specific timings as to when it will be opened and closed along with specific days. LocatedOpp to the longest beach in the world.. a sure place to visit

Name: Ghiri T
Title: A HIstoric Landmark in Chennai
Review: Vivekananda House is situated in Kamaraj Salai, facing Marina beach.It is earlier known as Ice House in Chennai which is an important place in Ramakrishna Movement in South India.This is the place where Swami Vivekananda stayed when he visited Chennai.This place is a permanent exhibition for Indian culture and Swamiji's life history. This place is maintained by Ramakrishna Math.This place is kept open from 10am to 12:30pm in morning and 3pm to 7:30pm in evening. It has two phases.First phase consists of Cultural heritage of India (Paintings), Swami Vivekananda (Photo Gallery),Swami Vivekananda's Room and Show Room. Second phase consists of Experience Vivekananda Project.

Name: iamlucky2017
Title: Vivekananda House
Review: i just visited Vivekananda house recently... its a great place to see and have experience of knowledge and devine. everybody should have an experience of this vivekanada cultural center

Name: Praveen S
Title: Nice place to visit
Review: One of the peaceful place in chennai once we visit Marina, Vivekananda house is near to it, must visit

Name: Dinesh_cbe
Title: Swamiji's Memorial
Review: This building was once used by the British to store Ice Blocks and also holds the name "Ice House". This place is a memorial for great Swami Vivekananda which showcase his rare photos and his lifestyle. A good place to learn about Swamiji.

Name: expedientnerd
Title: Picturesque Place in night
Review: I fyou are at marina beach during night do have some memorizing images clicked in front of Vivekanad memorial.

Name: Joji J
Title: "a memorial of Swami Vivekananda in Chennai"
Review: On returning from Chicago Swami Vivekanenda is believed to have (which was earlier know as the Ice House or Castle Kernan) stayed here in 1897 for nine days and gave lectures. Later Swami Ramakrishnanda who was a disciple of Swami Vivekananda founded Ramakrishna Math and functioned from here till it was moved to Mylapore. In 1963 it was renamed as Vivekanandar Illam by the Tamilnadu Government and it has become an exhibition center on Indian Culture and Swamiji's Life. It is maintained by the Ramakrishna Math and is an inspiration to many who visit the house. The room which Swami Vivekanda used is a meditation room. The majestic three storied building on the Kamarajar Salai (Marina Beach) has distinctive architectural features like the circular core, semicircular corridors, hemispherical dome et. We can visit the Building between 10.00 - 12.30 AM and from 3.00 - 7.15 PM except on Sundays and special holidays. It has  a book stall exhibiting books, CD's and DVD's on Ramakrishna- Vivekananda, Vedanta and self improvement published by theRamakrishna Math, rest rooms, lifts to the upper floor and  sufficient parking. The visit to the Vivekananda House gave us a special feeling and knowledge about Swami Vivekananda's ideology.

Name: velayudhan
Title: Enlighten Place
Review: Vivekananda house is an important pilgrimage and shrine amongst the followers of Swami Vivekananda. It is also famously known as the Ice House. This house was built in the year 1877. It is believed that Swami Vivekananda used to stay here. The house had been built in beautiful Victorian architecture. The bedroom of Swami Vivekananda where he used to stay and meditate is now a good place to meditate.

Name: sudheendrantl
Title: Vivekanandar illam
Review: Visiting the vivekananda memorial on marina was a nostalgic experience. Great to know how he garnered support from the king of ramnad and laid the ground work of his movement and even for the famous Chicago trip where he addressed Americans as "Brothers and Sisters"!

Name: Jrdominic S
Title: Great saint's small memorial
Review: For any Indian irrespective of caste, religion or creed, a name always front run in the minds whenever we think about a saint to quote, to read and to follow was, is and will be always the GIANT among the saints "SWAMI VIVEKANANDA"  and this is the small memorial for him but definitely worth a visit to understand the life of Swami's early life.There should be more visual including animated for kids to understand swami's life.Hope there will be on my next visit.

Name: rahuljena
Title: Nice and serene
Review: Good place to know about Swami Vivekananda. The house captures swami's travelling and life through pictures. It also has a 10 min 3D show on his life. Good place for people interested to know about him.

Name: Partha C
Title: Vivekananda House
Review: It is just opposite of Marina Beach Road.  Swami Vivekananda  stayed here for  few days. Ramkrishna Mission is maintaining it. Beautiful place for Meditation. Lot of things to know about Swami Vivekananda.

Name: DrMurugesan R
Title: Very peaceful place to meditate!
Review: After the hustle-bustle of mundane activities, this place is excellent to spend time very peacefully in a great aura.The famous marina beach is just opposite, across the Kamarjar Salai.

Name: WayfarerIndia
Title: Icehouse
Review: The building which used to be known as the Icehouse and looks like a gigantic cake more so in its new pink avatar. It got the name as it used to store ice that came in ships from america. Later in the end of the 19th century Swami Vivekananda lived there for a week giving its current official name. It now houses a an exhibition on Swamiji's life and teaching on Indian culture and philosophy. A great place to visit to anybody with such interests and just can be accessed by crossing the road from Marina Beach

Name: RAMAKRISHNAN K
Title: Must see place
Review: The place is known as Icehouse on the banks of marina beach road.It has been refurbished to look afresh . The place is well maintained by depicting life history of swamy vivekanda, a Hindu Monk.In between some movie clips which is also 3D with good quality movie made .Speech at Chicago is also presented . Kids of Teen age group must be taken here so that the get imbibed with some good values .There are education centre with coaching for Spoken English , painting, photoshop etc available Overall one must skip malls so as to visit here

Name: bishnu s
Title: Remembering the great Socio reformer of 20th Century
Review: Swami Vivekanand was one of the greatest socio-reformers of 20th Century in India. His fame had spread far and wide when he represented India in the Global conference of Religions in Chicago and explained to the world about vedic religion and India culture.  This Ice House helps a visitor to learn about Swamiji's life and his contribution to Indian Society.

Name: Rajesh k
Title: Learn about reforms which changed India
Review: This place tells a lot about the great Social Reformer of India of 20th Century - Swami Vivekanand. Swami Vivekanand's life, his contributions, Rama Krishna Mission etc. are covered by means of a 3D movie. Visit helps one to understand how the society of British India was reformed by Swami Vivekanand.

Name: krish862
Title: worth visit to recollect old memories
Review: it is a must watch those who visit marina beach. it is very close to marina beach and other attractions.

Name: priyadarshi s
Title: Very interesting place with a view to kill
Review: Bang on Marina Beach, facing the Bay of Bengal, pink in colour, the building looks like a Cake! Then, you enter it and have parking space for 12-15 cars. The entry tickets are nominal but then spend some time to read the wall-hangings. It is a bit verbose but also has a lot of pictures and lots of trivia is gained. How Ice was a commodity that was sold and transported from Boston to India and stored in this very building called the 'Ice House' at that time. Then, you have the Vedanta way of life, Vivekananda's life story and pics and some 3D video and Hologram. Overall, quite a little gem that can be unravelled within an hour.

Name: Rajani K
Title: Learn about the great socio reformer of India
Review: A person visiting this place learns a lot about Swami Vivekanand,his foundation of the  Rama Krishna mission and how he helped to socially reform the country during the British rule.  You can watch a 3D film on Swami Vivekanand.  This is an interesting place where one gets to know what has transformed our Indian society to bring it to the state it is in today.

Name: maryinchina
Title: Unexpected gem
Review: I went to Vivekanada house on suggestion from my driver. Miracle beach is exactly opposite the road and that was a little disappointing for all the garbage mixed into the sand and vendors everywhere. I spent an hour in the house but it easily could have been two. A lovely display of pictures and short videos about Vivekanada's amazing life and inspiring message about peace and unity. I didn't know about him until this visit and am deeply grateful I went. Small gift shop sells books about aspects of spirituality and yoga. A peaceful meditation hall was the highlight.This was the best part of my trip to Chennai and it wasn't at all planned.

Name: 435kutty
Title: Visit to the Vivekananda Illam
Review: Also known as the ice house where ice was stored many years ago. Swami Vivekananda stayed here during his visit to Chennai. Old colonial home on the beach. There is a museum explainingthe significance of the place.

Name: Marc L
Title: Fascinating
Review: This was a surprise. Really nicely laid out and with some excellent information. The architecture of the building and history of the building was also good

Name: ravi p
Title: Best place to see all of Vivekananda
Review: Thrilled to see old photos of vivekananda and also saw the room where he visited long back and got a chance to sit there for few mintues for meditation...

Name: Lakshmi Narayanan S
Title: Vivekananda just stayed here for few days
Review: Vivekananda stayed here for few days when he visited Chennai, hence the named this place in his name. There is a meditation hall where you can meditate. There will be documentary on Vivekananda which will screened in the main entrance hall. There will be many paintings by kids. Also there are painting on Hindu epics. Adults will be bored but kids may enjoy.

Name: AdishJain2014
Title: Vivekanand House a place that ignite minds for self learning & meditation
Review: The 3 D presentation of World famous Chicago address of Swami Vivekanand in 1893 was quite impressive as it may be a good learning for all, Here I quote just a small part of the speech being a wonderful doctrine preached in the Gita: "Whosoever comes to Me, through whatsoever form, I reach him; all men are struggling through paths which in the end lead to me." Sectarianism, bigotry, and its horrible descendant, fanaticism, have long possessed this beautiful earth. That is what is tolerance for all views, all opinions, all religions worldwide, that is what our culture has taught us.

Name: Rajkumar
Title: Superb
Review: Excellent is the word. the way it is maintained it is commendable. You would get to know a lot about Swami Vivekananda's life by visiting this. Rare pictures are kept here and a video show is particularly good and informative.

Name: pranab655
Title: must for Vivekananda followers
Review: Its a must see if you are a follower or lover of Swami Vivekananda. Without also you will learn lot of history and phylosophy of this great man.

Name: raja p
Title: well maintained
Review: this is maintained by ramakrishna mission.i saw  the Exhibition on Indian Culture and Swamiji‚Äôs Life in this house.good maintenance.

Name: 48aravindh
Title: Living Vivekananda's memorial..!!!!
Review: We visited this Vivekananda's memorial while visiting marina beach, it is easily approachable, located on the banks of main road, the memorial is soo beautiful, it is an architectural marvel and a heritage building, the building hosts many Vivekananda's books, sayings, mission, etc.. you can also get into the history of swami Vivekananda.. the books are very nominally charged, which goes to the charity mission, and main part is the books are soo worthy, it restrains your internal soul.. overall had a pleasant time here...

Name: None I
Title: Delve into spirituality
Review: Vivekanand Ice House is an awesome place to know about Swami Vivekanand, Rama Krishna mission and his contributions to social reforms in India.  They play a 3D short feature film which shows the complete life and works of Swamiji. The presentation is too good.  It's great to know about one of the greatest reformers of Indian Society.

Name: shymathans
Title: vivekananda house
Review: good place or history lovers, spent half day over there enjoyed the times. need more facilities like drinking water and food

Name: Venkatesh Thirupathy
Title: Must visit place Chennai
Review: The Vivekananda house (Ice House) in Chennai in well maintained by Shri Ramakrishna Mutt. Its just opposite to marina and a must visit place to know about Swami Vivekananda and His guruji Shri Ramakkrishanar. The 2d and 3D Shows are excellent and available in both languages in Tamil and English. You will fell goosebumps when you see Swami spoken in Chicago. A well maintained spiritual place. Don't miss it

Name: Miku2012
Title: Very good location
Review: I am very impressed with vivekanda House because his life has shown over shows and 3D. Dont miss to visit. Its on the main road and front of Marina Beach. They have some nominal fees for entrance.

Name: SearchingSoulDev
Title: Spiritual Place
Review: Just opposite of Marina Beach , it is a good place to visit for knowing about Vivekananda and Ramakrishna mission

Name: Kaushik G
Title: Swami Vivekananda memorial
Review: We had visited this interesting and informative tourist attraction showcasing Indian culture and life of the great saint Swami Vivekananda during our sightseeing in Chennai. We were greeted by a big life size idol of Swami Vivekananda at the entrance of the house where we clicked some selfies. We saw beautiful paintings from ancient texts like Gita, Puranas, Ramayana, Mahabharata each sharing some message of wisdom. We also saw the room where Swamiji had stayed(for 9 days after returning from historic Chicago convention) and sat in meditation. We were shown a 3d movie of Swamiji delivering speech at Chicago convention. There is also a book store in the premises. 20 rupees ticket per person was absolutely worth it.

Name: Prakash P
Title: Chennai's  one of Important Monument
Review: very interesting and especially kids and the current generation should visit this place . Well maintained by the Swamijis. Please do not miss out 3 D movie on Swami Vivekananda

Name: anupam b
Title: Must visit
Review: This is swami vivekananda memorial. When you will visit marina beach , same time you can visit this place. This is just opposite side of marina beach. Nicely maintained . Calm and quite environment . You can buy books from here to know the history and vivekananda.

Name: girieshm24
Title: Hist
Review: the place in chennai where used to call as ice house as i heard that once it was used as an ice storage for british while they ruled

Name: pushpanjalikumar
Title: meditation place
Review: I spent some time here and it is truly awesome place to meditate. However check the timings beforehand as its not open all the time

Name: Sandeep G
Title: Really a great Sanctum to the great person
Review: Here is  a great building that is built around the Great Vivekananda. It is located near to the beach, takes about 1-2 hours max to cover the building to visit all around. it also has few book stalls inside. It is a peaceful place and kind of makes you feel that inspiration,

Name: Ajishjg
Title: Ice house that got converted to Vivekananda house
Review: If you are interested in a bit of history or the life of Vivekananda, then this place is a must visit. The place is well maintained with glimpses of our glorious past (sometimes a bit over glorified though). There is a 3d show where you will find an animated Vivekananda making his speech. The meditation room was another of my favourite attraction in this place. You could spend ours in it introspecting.

Name: Karthik V
Title: Vivekananda House
Review: Vivekananda House, otherwise called the Ice house, which was used to store Ice bars in the British Era , later was turned into a house where Swamiji Vivekananda stayed on his Chennai visit. Its been turned into a memorial house for Vivekananda now. A perfect with historical importance its a must visit place on the long Marina beach road. Its beautifully illuminated and holds a perfect spot in the night.

Name: Deadman17
Title: Greenery all around - excellent education
Review: This is one of the premier colleges of India providing engineering studies. Besides various streams of engineering, there is significant research and incubation also being done here. The campus is extremely natural and green and various animals and insects and bird species can be found here.

Name: Sai Nihal
Title: Beautiful Campus üòç
Review: This is the college where I currently study my 2nd year of engineering. IITM is a serene campus occupying 620 acres with heavenly nature.This is a Black Buck habitat.Apart from them,you can witness a wide variety of bio-diversity including deerü¶å,various birds,insects.I have attached some breath-taking images of our campus.           IITM is a separate world by itself,untouched by Chennai city's noise and pollution.

Name: Soma C
Title: Simply wonderful
Review: This is the first time I have visited an Indian Institute of Technology and was amazed by their facilities and campus. The labs have all the modern equipment and are very well maintained. The campus has many deer, monkeys etc and looks like a national park. I had a great experience visitng this IIT.

Name: Bhagirath G
Title: Blissful place in a congested city
Review: We usually visit this place as we have relatives who stay here. Lush green paradise in a commotion filled chaotic Chennai. It‚Äôs usually a couple of degrees cooler than the city.Here you‚Äôll find deers and monkeys roaming around freely all around the campus.

Name: Cyrus
Title: This place is like living in middle of mini forest - very good place for natural lovers
Review: Actually, it is built-in/aside of forest. I visited this along with a friend for his interview and spent a few hours there. In the middle of a huge city build and maintaining is very good. In this place, you will see deers, monkeys and some small animals (they are friendly any way as long as you won't disturb them). But its a restricted entry place anyone can't visit simply, until you have work in IIT or visit someone who is staying there.

Name: Mithrdm
Title: Good Historical Visit
Review: We are dive of friends visited this place early in the month, The place is super inspiring for new generation.

Name: kowie55
Title: A green Oasis in concrete city
Review: I had been to their heritage centre to listen to a lecture that was open to the public. What I liked about IIT is the quite roads criss-crossing a  vast green belt. The offices, lecture halls and the staff quarters are so positioned as to avoid disturbing the flora and fauna. Every now and then Deer and Monkeys cross the roads. They are given the right of way. Fast driving is prohibited even on clear roads !

Name: diva k
Title: heaven in chennai
Review: very calm and you will never believe you are in chennai. full of trees and birds and deers. one must visit this place in their lifetime

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Vast forest with the institute
Review: The institute is maintain by and comes under the central government of india.the place has a vast forest land located at the very center of the city,and the institution well maintains the forest trees,the animals and takes numerous steps for the protection and pollution free maintenance of the place.the is one of the pride of the city.

Name: ravincarr
Title: Educational institution? Jungle?
Review: North coastal Tamilnadu is characterized by a type of evergreen forest called "scrub jungle". One of the few places in Chennai city that you can find a vast expanse of this is the IIT Madras campus. Other places that where you can experience unspoiled scrub jungles in Chennai are the Guindy Park, the Theosophical Society campus and the Madras Christian College, Tambaram. IIT Madras is the biggest and the most accessible of the lot.If you plan early morning or late evening visits you are sure to see an abundance of Spotted Deer and the rare Blackbuck in addition to hundreds of bird species.

Name: Mukta2016
Title: Nice Campus
Review: The Indian Institute  of Technology, Madras campus is one of the largest among all the IITs. The campus has a a very large green cover and one can actually sight deer roaming here in the middle of a metropolitan city.

Name: ML NARESHKUMAR
Title: DO YOU BELIEVE THERE IS A FOREST WITHIN THE HEART OF THE CHENNAI CITY! HERE IT IS!!
Review: Go for a stroll or drive during early morning or sun set time or rainy days. beautiful roads, beautiful location with more greenery and more oxygen!The entry is subject to gatekeepers

Name: Vacation831748
Title: Student at IIT MADRAS
Review: Simply great ... full of nature and one can experience a complete different side of chennai city. best place in chennai!!

Name: Priyanka S
Title: The best place in chennai
Review: I work here, it's so green fresh and peaceful....u can see deers everywhere...it has been maintained properly....no trash here and there...u can do bird watching in the early morning...nice floors and fauna but entry is restricted...

Name: Praveenop
Title: One place in Chennai where nature meets technology
Review: A great place for nature lovers. IIT is India's most prestigious institutions and Chennai has been one of the best among all of IIT institutes. This place is so huge that the institute has its own transport system. It is a great amalgamation and synergy of Green meeting exotic animals and technology.

Name: Puneetkumar Pattar
Title: An excellent campus in the heart of the city
Review: IIT Madras is one the premier technical education institutions in the world, and the campus is almost in the heart of Chennai city. Spread across over 30 acres, the campus is extremely beautiful and classified as an urban rainforest. You will never feel like you are in Chennai as the climate is altogether different. The campus is well equipped with all kinds of facilities - academic, cultural, recreational, sports, etc. And yes, you will find deers in this campus. Not one, not two, but many. They all walk around along with the humans and do no harm. They have been living this way for decades now. But then, the campus is open to members only (students, faculty, workers, etc).

Name: Priya M
Title: Big Instituion
Review: Big institution situated in Chennai. Its very famous institution for Graduate and Post graduate Engineering studies in India.

Name: shivaraikod
Title: An old and best institute
Review: This institute is pride of the country with many students generating a good number of employment apart from they themselves taking top spots in reputed organizations.

Name: nageswararao g
Title: Well maintained Insitution
Review: Its a well maintained institution in Chennai. Located in a serene location with tons of greenery. Good place to do academics.

Name: Sreeman V
Title: My wonderland at the heart of the city
Review: It has a lot of fresh air to offer ! That too in the middle of the city nd it's filled with flora and fauna if u know where to look for it. The almost extinct blackbuck deer is present in this place. The food is cheap and good too. Not many know of the things that this place holds. Just respect this place and be aware and responsible when u visit, you will enjoy the experience.

Name: Praveen Kumar
Title: Institute within the forest
Review: Certainly, IIT will always has its charm but IIT Madras is special in terms of natural view. It is located in the huge land of forest.The best thing is they still have retained the tress and you can easily locate several reindeer - which is always a treat to watch.

Name: K J
Title: Only forest left in chennai
Review: This place has maintained its charm for decades, the old world and forest conservation has been very well upkept.

Name: muthukrish2000
Title: IIT
Review: This is very big campus in the center of city. I went here for the Bio-Tech department as my friend is studying here. There are lots of trees one of the prestigious institution.

Name: kalpalatha
Title: Whata place for nature lovers
Review: Remember when i started visiting this place right from my school days... lovely close to nature and still not thronged  by the city's crowd and pollution...  The mardigras.. the deers.. My son worked here for a year.. i would keep telling him.. it would be wonderful if u even get a one room quarters here.. my life would be done.. i used to always envy the friends who stayed in their hostels and the ones who had quarters inside.. I also vividly remember that their hostels were names after the rivers and their buses named after the mountains.. and a qoute saying.. its a place where the mountains move and the rivers stay put in a place

Name: Krishnaveni S
Title: Big and huge campus
Review: I came with my cousin for certificate verification for him. It's a huge campus with bus facilities available. Lots of signboards for knowing the location are there. It's green and many animals like deers and monkeys can be spotted

Name: ilavarasi_sm
Title: Wide area of education
Review: I came for an technical discussion with Professor, its one of the pride educational institutions in India.

Name: oliver B
Title: IIT, Chennai Famous
Review: My friend son  is studying in IIT, Chennai, we had a visit with the permission of the Principal, where we obtain a pass, one of the best Institute in India, great professors, and best institution award.

Name: Ekta Khetan
Title: Nice, Green Campus.
Review: Beautiful campus, be prepared to walk a lot and spot deer.There is a lot of greenery inside, the institute opens to 2 sides- the front at the Adyar Guindy and the back at Velachery.

Name: Keertan
Title: Good
Review: There's a lot of exposure and harmony. you have to study and enjoy. college life is at its best with a beautiful campus. the faculties are not up to the mark and the compulsory attendance is a pain. hostels are good and have all the facilities. central library is the best place. there are a lot of eateries, affordable at the same time. the life is good here but people are very practical.

Name: Joseph T
Title: Institution in a forest
Review: There are deer, monkeys and many other animals that can be seen in their natural settings. This Engineering Institution is ranked No. 1 in India for 3 years running as 2017-2018.

Name: Krisvacation
Title: Get a kick every time I step in
Review: I just love this campus. My team sits here and I visit this place once a month.Love everything about it

Name: sushant singh
Title: Dream campus
Review: Indian institute of technology is one of the premium institute of india. It is one of the most famous IIT of India after IIT Bombay. I visited this campus for my PG research.

Name: Suffix
Title: Its a University.
Review: Its a university. I‚Äôm a student here. You need permission to enter this place. Generally if you know someone from inside then its very easy to get the gate pass.Very green filled with monkeys and deers and off course students!

Name: ananthakp
Title: Not a Tourist Spot
Review: The Institute is very famous and its campus is very huge. Though you can drive or take a three wheeler parked outside, being a College, unless you are a student, you will not be able to appreciate. I visited along with my son and not as a tourist, and my experience is in this context.

Name: vijmail99
Title: Interesting place
Review: lot of trees...environment friendly..Perfect to spend during summer. Had a stroll through the place with my kids. Spotted lot  of deers and birds !! Must visit if you are attracted to greenery..Well maintained and clean.

Name: Grace P
Title: Delegation visit
Review: Natural unspoiled and ultimately unique campus. Great place to study away from the hustle of the busy streets and honking of the tuk-tuks. There are 2 elephants on campus but the monkeys and the deer have a special place in my heart!

Name: Sachin Gupta
Title: one of the most reputed IIT
Review: IIT Chennai is one of the most sought after educational institute in India. The excellent cleanliness in the campus with natural environment,.

Name: DDevD
Title: Beautiful
Review: One the most famous IIT's of the country and alumni's today are who's who in various sector. Very beautiful garden as well.

Name: Venkata Shivaku... R
Title: Great place to get grounded
Review: Though IIT Madras does not qualify as a tourist attraction, it is still a great place for a group of two or less to take a quiet stroll. The ambiance is so good it can do wonders to a person who wants a little calm. Be prepared to walk at least five kilometers since it is a big campus. Avoid cellphones and business conversations. Just peace-out and walk. There are three temples inside the campus if you are a believer. It is also a good opportunity to come across some of the most hard-working students in India (at least until their schooling).

Name: mrvradhika
Title: Excellent place to study in
Review: It is just like a small city inside. You have everything available inside the campus from clinic to shops. There are deer inside too. Members also have access to the library inside the campus. However, this is not a tourist spot and hence outsiders cannot enter without knowing someone inside... Perfect place to study in

Name: 592abck
Title: This is where it happens
Review: This is where it happens. Lot of talent gets produced here. The campus is also very nice and cool. Entry is open

Name: Balasubramanian R
Title: IIT Madras
Review: Indian institute of Technology, Madras is one of the famous institue for higher technical education and it is of national importance. IIT is located in the heart of the city with vast area. This is nearer to Governor Bungalow and entire area is greenery and deers are there. Atomosophere is very nice and calm. More number of students are studying here and there is heavy demand for IITians.

Name: Umang A
Title: IIT
Review: A places famous to train maths wizards and produce great engineers. Located next to national Park where many wild animals live in their natural habitant.

Name: Ashish D
Title: The usual green campus !
Review: IIT Chennai has been maintaining its green cover over the years. It was a great feeling to visit this place during this trip to Chennai. The infrastructure and the campus has been decently maintained, especially the folliage !

Name: great81
Title: best campus in chennai
Review: Here i used to visit this campus for design approval. atmosphere is very nice and serene.lot of greenery cover is here. deers are standing while u walking..some time snakes also...ha ...ha...after seeing place, i realised i would have done it my master degree on like this place...now i can't...anyway i am very happy to go there for design approval.

Name: 674santha
Title: well known university
Review: IITis an engineering institute in Chennai since my relative studying there used to go there often .though it is in the heart of Chennai city it has its own calm premises surrounded by lustrous greeneries and deer which will be very friendly with us, a great sight to look at. the cultural programmes they conduct in a very prestigious way and colourful too where everybody used to enjoy well

Name: Kailasanath
Title: Quiet campus within the City
Review: Even if you are not on an academic visit, this campus is worth aquick tour because of it's well laid structure that preserves the natural beauty of the park within which it is located. There are lots of dear raming around peacefully among the students in one of Indian top level academic institutions

Name: Ramaswamytalari
Title: very peace full area in centre of city.
Review: dream of so many people to study.it established in around in 400 acres.we can found dears moving around campus like pets

Name: nellyhaze1000
Title: Beautiful Campus
Review: The Campus is a beautiful respite amongst the urban sprawl of Madras. It have preserved the natural resources and ensured cleanliness.It's a nice breathing space from urban life.

Name: Ankur_Rishi
Title: Greta Place to study in peace
Review: Clean green and wildlife preservation campus. you can see deer roaming around freely and people sitting around them studying in a top notch engineering institute.

Name: Vijaysekhar
Title: Deers Everywhere
Review: One of the best IIT campuses. It is very green and large with full of deer (at least three kinds). Certainly has the academic feel to it.

Name: Sanjeev H
Title: One of the best College Campuses in the country
Review: Have been there many times - as a friend lives here. It is a sprawling campus with greenery with all facilities one may require to live within the campus. Great place to head for a daily walk, and early morning bird watching.

Name: Mohan George
Title: Model education institution
Review: * The atmosphere is peaceful with deer walking around the campus.* The campus is like a forest with greenery everywhere.* Get assistance from security guard to locate the building

Name: Deepak_S_1991
Title: Best place
Review: Opposite to my college it was located. fully surrounded with trees and other natural elements. You can see deers on the way. Recently got to meet a friend here and it was amazing experience. Temple also located inside.

Name: kashgo
Title: An educational institution in a forest
Review: Having studied here I am obviously partial to IITM as it is commonly known. The beauty of this place is the flora and fauna. It is common to see spotted deer calmly meandering along the paths. They do their own things while the students feverishly bicycle to and from class.

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: mind blowingly big
Review: This is a pretty big place and it has three entrances in chennai and each very far off from each other.Went here for terry fox fun and visit a friend as well.Must see if you get a chance.Trees all around its pretty nice

Name: selvambikaiyali
Title: IIT madras
Review: one of the famous IIT in india, having very good environment and infrastructure, located in main area of the city

Name: WVR7933
Title: Well maintained
Review: Indian Institute of Technology Madras is a residential Engineering institute in Chennai. It  is one of India's most prestigious universities. This institute had been inaugurated during 1959.This institute's  campus is located in a beautiful wooded land of about 250 hectares. Very big campus full of greenery. It may take 30 to 40 minutes walk to reach the Institute from the Main Entrance. You can see good number of Deer Peacock etc...on the roads leading to the Institute..Free Institute buses are available to take you to different departments and laboratories... State bank of India and Canara Bank extends their services to the institute...They have their branches here..

Name: Ragavendra B
Title: Nice college!!
Review: Very nice college with a lot of history. Good place to have a lot of food restaurants at cheaper price.

Name: KSVelan
Title: Premier Indian Institue
Review: Heard lot about this renowned institution and wanted to see it. Large campus with lots of trees and some wild animals (Deer...)  and has good roads. it took 30 minutes to around by car. Building are little disappointment as they seemed old fashioned. inside students use only bi-cycle which is good for the environment.

Name: Rucha121
Title: Educational Hub
Review: IIT Madras is best known for their Cultural Fest - Saarang apart from the trees, deers, snakes and lots of students. One of the famed institutes for studying Engineering. Campus is located in Adyar and huge sprawling green trees greet you inside. Lot of walk is required inside. No private vehicles allowed

Name: Balasubramanian S
Title: Excellent location and surroundings
Review: THE IIT Madras now called Chennai is one of the most well developed Institutes in India.What can make this campus special is the surroundings in which it is located. Located centrally inside the Lush greenery and lot of trees in Guindy Chennai. The nearby places are Governors bunglow and Guindy park. There are a lot of deer and other small animals inside the campus. Students doing higher studies have calm and serene atmosphere to Learn

Name: sunayana139
Title: Green, quiet and beautiful
Review: IIT is open to all visitors throughout. Many times we visit this place to watch a movie in their open theatre which is an event of its own and the other times, we go there just to walk around and chat.The events they hold are fun worth visiting. The students come up with the most exciting things here and there. There are a few eateries inside where you can grab a quick bite as well. PS.. there are deers that roam freely and you can almost touch one.

Name: Arun
Title: Big college campus
Review: I have been to this campus along with my friends for a couple of cultural fests, symposiums. The campus is vast and you can see trees on road sides. If you are lucky, you might spot deer and monkeys.

Name: GVK
Title: Worth a visit
Review: The whole campus is green everywhere. There is a internal transport provided to go around from one department to the other. It is maintained very well

Name: krishna p
Title: This is 5th ranked IIT in India
