Review: This is Good place and close 1000+  acres of land occupied campus with highly skilled students who cleared their IIT(Indian institute of technology) entrance exam and placed in the campus for their education and this is central Govt body operated and maintained by Govt of India and one of the prestigious place where people get good jobs and well settle in their life if someone Achieve the seat in this institution and we can see the deer park inside the campus.

Name: ratheesh tvm
Title: Great location for an educational hub
Review: Serene environment where man and nature co-exist. Well laid roads. Monkeys and deers roam about freely amongst the trees and residential units.Great effort put in by the authorities to maintain the great habitat.

Name: naiduks24
Title: The oldest IIT, Madras
Review: This is one of the best IIT, that located SP Road, Chennai, my friend son is studying and hence we had a visit in this institution, good security, very good staff overall excellent institution.

Name: JawaDeepak
Title: Beef eaters not welcome!
Review: This place is unsafe if you are a beef-etaer! Yes, you read it right! If you are still in paranoia, please Google with the keywords: Beef, IIT MADRAS. So, please stay away from these fanatics if you are a beef-etaer.

Name: Abdul wahaab
Title: Most prestigious and top institute
Review: It's been very famous and prestigious institution IIT Madras..It has a vast area covered with nature tress and animals ..We can see wild deers crossing roads and enormous species of birds and every animals .strict penalty for disturbing them so no one will dstrb them and they are allowed freely to roam everywhere ...The atmosphere s calm and educational style s top class ..They conduct social awareness program and marathon ..Must visit once ..Entry allowed for everyone during SME programs ..

Name: Joji J
Title: "one of the most prestigious educational institution in India"
Review: Madras IIT is one of the most prestigious Institute of Technology was established in 1959 and the campus of the Institute was part of the Guindy National Park. The campus which is located about 10 Kms from the airport and Railway Station is a protected forest and home to a large number of animals like the spotted deer, monkeys, peacocks, black buck etc which roam around in the campus. The roads and buildings in th campus are well planned without disturbing the greenery and we can see a lake too in the campus. The main entrance is on Sardar Patel Road and other entrances are on Gandhi Road, Velachery and Taramani gate. The public are not allowed to enter the campus without specific reasons and permissions. I have been to the campus several times to see my relatives and also with my father who used to visit the institute. The name of Madras IIT well know due to the high quality technical education it offers and the campus is one of the most beatiful and well maintained compared to other educational institutions.

Name: Bhataria
Title: Deers roam here free
Review: It is amazing that wild deers like Chital and Black-buck roam completely free inside this campus. Nobody disturbs them, since there is stiff penalty for doing so. It is very easy to spot them while on foot or in the campus bus. However, entry to the campus is restricted to general public

Name: Karthik V
Title: Most Prestigious Institute
Review: IIT Madras is one of the best and finest and most prestigeous Institute in our country. This is my first visit inside this vast green campus of Indian Institue of Technology - Madras. The drive through is full of greenary with lots of deers roaming around. Its a treat to watch them roam so freely undisturbed by the human presence. Well laid out roads, well maintaned campus with lots of fresh and clean pure air to inhale makes this campus a wonderful place to study in.

Name: AakashT91
Title: Institute of National Importance
Review: It is among the top 5 best engineering institutions in India. It has a lush green campus where you can see variety of animals from peacocks to deer.

Name: vikasmardia
Title: IIT chennai
Review: one of the first and best IITs of country is always looked upon by science students. ALso offering mtech phd and mba courses

Name: Jikuza
Title: Great campus
Review: The lush green beautiful campus consists of a prime engineering university of India. It has been around since 1959 and has plenty of students in 17 hostels. It has all major sporting facilities such as a swimming pool, cricket chemplast ground, athletics track, basketball, football, tennis facilities.

Name: DrMurugesan R
Title: Nature at its best, in the technology campus!
Review: You can experience the prime forest feeling at many points in the spacious IIT-M campus.Deers of many species are very common sight; be careful not to tramp on any snake passing by!

Name: BharatKumarKondru
Title: " Strategically located Institute"
Review: This institute is strategically located in Chennai and is very accessible. Well maintained educational campus in India. Good Plantation.

Name: Lopaaaaa
Title: My alma mater
Review: I spent two blissful years studying here ans when I visited this place after so many years, it brought back so many memories. It is as if time has stood still in this place and nothing has changed much. Located in the heart of Chennai and yet once you enter the gates of this campus, the traffic noise will disappear and the temperature will go down by at least 5 degrees. Park your vehicle at the entrance and strt walking around this huge campus with greenery all around. If you are lucky, you will see deers and stags walking around you. There are eateries inside and do search for the lake and spend some time there.One of the premier institues of the country, it shares a boun dary wall with the Guindy National Park, hence the greenery. The stadium, Chemplast is also worth alook as it is world class!

Name: krazikams
Title: Huge Campus with lots of Trees
Review: Visited IIT for attending a seminar and this campus is huge. You may get lost in the woods. It is very calm and peaceful, with so many trees and natural flora and fauna. You may even find reptiles and deer in night time. IITs offers best education. Campus is well-maintained.

Name: Shankar1206
Title: IIT
Review: One of the most revered and premier technological Institution in India. Those who had graduated from IIT Madras is employed world wide and the quality of education is on par with global standards.

Name: tafayyaz
Title: Very good technical Institute.
Review: The campus, teaching system, facilities for the students are really very good. For South-East Asian engineering students, It is one of the best three in Asia.

Name: ramesh2712
Title: wonderful nature
Review: visited as company to someone else n most enjoyed was the scenic beauty. snacks of canteen too were good

Name: Sekhar A
Title: Dream for many to study here
Review: This is an Institute of technology. I visited this recently to see some people. It is not a tourist place. To study here is dream for young men and women. Many have become world-beaters after completing their degree here.

Name: krish862
Title: IIT chennai
Review: It is an Indian Institute of technology (Madras) .It is a public research institute in madras .It is a big campus with a lots of trees and it is one of india's most prestigious universities .

Name: Kunja Bihari M
Title: IIT Chennai
Review: This is the Indian Institute of Technology, Madras(Chennai). Many people dream to study here. One of the best institutions in India and world.

Name: worldtravellerOhio
Title: Leafy campus
Review: Spacious campus with lots of trees and greenery. Saw monkeys and deer. Need to go thru guard gate to gain access though.

Name: vamshinallan
Title: Knowledge hub...!
Review: 'Gnanam' which means knowledge is the main resource in this world class institute. Veteran professors along with younger brilliant professors and equally competent scholars make this hub more sought for. Greenery, though washed away due to natural calamities, exists enough, still as a paradise to our eyes. Deer is the awesome creatures which I have seen still. Food courts, periodic events, both cultural and technical make life exciting here.. Great Place...

Name: dippy2
Title: Refused entry - told not open to the public
Review: We were looking forward to seeing the animals but were told by security we could not enter.  They told us it is not open to the public.   Chennai has fewer attractions than most cities and we are sorry to see this one closed.

Name: Gerald J
Title: its a forest inside the concrete jungle of chennai
Review: IIT Madras is a great place to go for a run or a walk. however you need to have some known source inside for a visitor pass else they wont let you inside.... the place is well maintained and huge area.  lots of deer can be found around the campus - it has good facilities for food and water inside with many canteens....

Name: shrinikethv
Title: A landmark cum educational centre
Review: IIT is located in Adyar, near Madhya Kailash. Wonderful vast area in middle of city. So much lush green cover throughout the campus. One of the best college campus in India. I recently visited IIT for the cultural event Saarang held there. Lot of places available for dining. And if you are lucky, you may spot some animals! :D

Name: vasan224
Title: beautiful site
Review: IIT is an one of the beautiful site where i have visited. there were many greeneries across the road wich will touch your heart. amazing views

Name: msbagrodia
Title: very peaceful and tranquil
Review: natural surroundings with all amenities .Enough places  to eat and shop.very  very safe even   for ladies

Name: Rama5786
Title: A Paradise in the Heart of Chennai
Review: True to IIT standards a verdant green location with many 100 year old trees, that make the place chill thru out the day.

Name: Senthilathiban
Title: Education in a Green Environment !
Review: Vast green space in the heart of the city. Ideal place for getting educated in technology, management and humanities. Great experience to watch deers crossing the road when you are driving.

Name: pshamkuwar
Title: IIT-Guindy National Park
Review: One of the best educational Institutions in the world. Must take your kids to inspire them to learn, visit OAT, Nice place

Name: Sapna I
Title: Nostalgic trip back
Review: I lived on the IIT Campus for 22 years.  It was a trip down memory lane.  Change is inevitable - but I was sad to see that the faculty housing was not in as good a shape as it used to be.  Also there were too many trees cut down and the serenity of the old campus is no longer present.

Name: singhrohan07
Title: Not a great place to visit on a free time
Review: First of all this is a College campus not a place of attraction, you''ll be permitted inside if you are required there.PROS: very quiet place, deers are beautiful if visible, cleaned naturally.Cons: NO tourist guides, roads not paved appropriately and deers are not visible,

Name: Dj_travelfreak
Title: Study with awesome Environment
Review: I may say one of the best IIT close to nature as having a campus with Go Green theme and you can also see sometimes deer inside the campus itself.

Name: Aravind A
Title: Feels you are not in chennai
Review: Have visited IIT  chennai many times , the one striking thing which hits you as you cross the security checkpost after getting a entfy pass from them is greenery and more greenery.The temperature inside the campus will be about 2 to 3 degrees cooler than chennai temperature, which makes it a haven for walkers and joggers who are found in plenty during the earlymorning and evening hours. Well laid road with deers freely roaming about along with slithering wild life makes one feel we are not in chennai.

Name: Abhishek Gaurav
Title: An amazing Park - Must Visit
Review: Queens land is perfect destination for kids and family for 1 day complete enjoyment.Pros - (a) All kind of rides offered for all age groups(b) Economical(c) Just located 3 kms from Poonamalle junction

Name: Sherline
Title: Worst experience with crazy horses - Queensland Chennai
Review: I fell down from the crazy horses game. Please don't go for this because1. No footrest is available to place your leg 2. A Handle on each side of horse's face is the only support to hold on. The seat is a flat and lengthy one. When it lifts up from 180 to 100 degrees, the only thing you can hold on is the handle. If you are an adult/women, your weight keeps pulling you down. Now, it starts rotating when you are still hanging at the same 100 degree angle position. My experience here, My hands were already tired holding onto the handle. I couldn't balance when it started rotating fast. My legs started flying in one direction.I literally came out of the seat. I was holding onto the side of the horse. My left leg now is on the top of the seat. My right leg somewhere underneath the horse's neck.  People outside started shouting to stop the ride. But no one stopped. The controller guy said the ride is about to end so he can't stop now. I didn't know what to do. I couldn't hold on there for long. Gradually when it started slowing down, i let go and fell down. Guys, If you are obese, please please don't go for this. It seems like that particular horse on which I sat was a defective one. Also, Same thing happened for another girl on that same horse.  If it is a defective one, they should have sealed it, right? And people above 40 felt a bit of dizziness. My husband got a headache too.To sum up, Queensland is a budget friendly amusement park. But some rides are dangerous because of poor maintenance and no guidance.

Name: Mrudula
Title: park
Review: this is the best place for children to enjoy water and manual rides and food courts all over and a green area for park and play area

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: Amazing joyful visit to Queens land
Review: It was an amazing visit to Queen's Land in ECR Road Chennai. The first thing was the route was awesome. Later once we entered queen's Land kids started enjoying the rides. There were crazy rides that even made elders to forget their age and enjoy the surprises of falling from the heights almost (Just kidding) not really. It feels almost we fell. But later we find we are still alive. Crazy horse üê¥ was nice for kids it's just a horse but keeps changing its direction very often and turns around. So the rider has to sit carefully. Bumping cars will be a nice.Note: some of the rides are free and some you may need to pay extra. Exclusive attraction that I found was Ropeway inside the amusement park. Jaint wheel üé° and Columbus are common anywhere. Toy train ride allowed us to have a look around the amusement park. Artificial waterfalls are very attractive for kids. There is one more ride that looks like a round tyre with seats arranged and will be pushed into the streaming water. That takes us in crazy directions. It's a must try ride. It hits the walls and rotates and changes its direction. So it is so interesting. You must try it definitely.

Name: eeebvr
Title: Worthspending a day
Review: Price for the visit is good. They allow outside food also. One or two rides is under maintenance but the water rides and waves are very good. Can spend a day very easily. Do not miss the cable car and train.

Name: Galaxian
Title: Queensland Rope Car is not safe while getting in
Review: I had a terrible experience at Queensland while getting into the rope car with my family, there is no safety measurement while getting-in, if we skip to get-in then we will be finished by dropping from top of the tower into the lake (land) (water will not save you). How the newly travelling members know that Rope car will not stop while getting-in? There is sign board, people will have to know only from the members instructions, if they skipped to tell you, then rope car will push you into the lake and you will be finished. For my case they skipped to put the shutter and finally came and pushed the shutter at the near end. I escaped narrowly.

Name: bharathi
Title: Worst and waste of money
Review: before i go.. im so excited , but when i reached, Very very bad experience, worst maintenance of water... don't spend your money here, water rides and swimming pool will be girls boys separated. and waiting for long time. pls don't go queensland, i  suggest kishkintha its 100 times better than queensland.5/5/2019 worst day ever..... thpuuuuuu

Name: Jay
Title: Visited yesterday
Review: Doesn't really worth Rs.550 most of the raids have closed stating gone for lunch and most are not been allowed for children. No rope car functions nor booting available. VGP itself far better than Queensland. Don't spend huge money in Queensland rather VGP just cost you Rs.330 with more rides offered that that of QL

Name: Parthasarathy
Title: Worst Experience
Review: Not upto the mark. No limitations in allowing people. Not able to complete 15 rides for the whole day. Very huge crowd, some rides are faulty. Need to wait for more than 30min for each ride. Not even a single penny worth if you go with family. Called to Manager to have a word about the experience, he doesn't care about that.

Name: Natarajan K
Title: A good place for summer vacation visit
Review: This amusement park is located in Bangalore highway after Poonamallee. Its having lots of different rides for both kids and adults. Swimming pool and wave pool is good but Water rides are very less. An average price to enjoy the complete day in vacation.

Name: Yabeth Pournercase
Title: Purpose to visit
Review: Wil this open monday during summer holidays???? We eagerly want to go on monday so plz let me know if anyone know about it surely

Name: sujeejkums
Title: good
Review: really good to see this place to spent whole day with amusement park lovely and enjoyed a lot but water is not clear they should maintained to change water day by day

Name: malladimanoj
Title: Nice amusement park in chennai
Review: Nice experiance with this amusement park we can enjoy more a lot it is very nice there are more games one game we can play only once twice we cant play wave pool is timing

Name: Mohammed Fazil
Title: Wonderful theme park but lacks maintanence
Review: We went as a group of 10 members on Republic Day which was an all day event. What went good ?1. We had received a nice welcome with music and dance since its republic day. 2. All rides are good.3. Everyone will enjoy himalayan water ride. Better change your dresses before you go for this. Since those who are very conscious to remain dry will get wet at the end of ride.4. Food is good in the restaurants inside, which was very well developed when compared to older days.5. Rest rooms are quite descent.What went bad ?1.  First ride is Free Fall but it had a lot of crowd so we moved on and went for small rides. And roller coaster again had a huge crowd so we skipped again. Till then everything was good. Then we stood in queue for Pirate Ship , where a group of 20 members overtook us and went to front of queue and entered without any manners. To our disappointment there was even a security personnel. But he kept his mouth quite. 2. So Queensland needs Maintenance !  3. Queensland need to improve dressing room and shower room which is a mandatory after you soak yourself in that chlorine water.4. Niagara falls will be started in timely manner. But when you wait for it and take a bath you will feel the total Chlorine.So its not worth the wait !

Name: vijmail99
Title: Crowded theme park which needs a lot of maintenance
Review: This is one of the crowded theme park which needs a lot of maintenance. Some of the attractions wee closed. There is a long queue for most of the rides. It takes almost 1.5 hrs to get to it. Needs a lot of renovation

Name: Thanu HaRi
Title: Awesome Experince
Review: We had a wonderfull day at this place and we spend more than 8 hours inside the park.a lot of games and activities to do in the park and its a worth of money for that.the speciality is, you have to pay only once to get into the park and you can play any games and activities one time for free ! they will give you a tag to weare in your wrist (its waterproof).

Name: Mohi_India
Title: Worth to spend time
Review: Nice place to spend your time.All the rides are good.Take additional dresses if you are planning to spend your time in Artificial water falls and other water sports.

Name: neeharika b
Title: Worth Visiting!!
Review: We went to Queensland with 5 year old kid.. he enjoyed all the rides especially the cable car..The landscape and greenery are well maintained..All the rides are included with entry ticket.

Name: NiranjanKumar G
Title: Dirty Land not Queens land
Review: There‚Äôs a lot difference between Queensland in 2015 and 2018. Very worst experience. Water quality is very worst. Majority of the rides don‚Äôt have proper maintenance. Felt unsafe during rides. Crapy food. Operated the water rides only for half an hour in a day.There is no wave in the wave pool. Swimming pool is green in color. I won‚Äôt recommend it to anyone. Try something else.

Name: k2velocity
Title: Worst theme park i have seen
Review: 1. Allows only one turn per ride, no paid rides2. Crappy food3. Very bad support staff4. Limited time for those few water rides5. Fake wave pool no waves at all5. Unclean water. The water was green with alge6.  Unclean toilets7. Bad stench all around

Name: Ayushi R
Title: Friend's outing
Review: It is a nice place to hangout with friends but only one think I don't like that is girls boys cannot go in the wave pool together

Name: Ajay Rawat
Title: Overall good experience for affordable tickets
Review: Roller Coaster, Centrox and Niagra Falls are amazing. Free Fall Tower and Cable Car are joke. Need to wait a hell lot for Go Kart.

Name: Muguncjb
Title: Niagara at Chennai
Review: First of all, dont consider the negative feedbacks posted about Queensland in TripAdvisor.  It could be easily a 5 star rated attraction/theme park at Chennai. The entrance fee is Rs.550 and the ticket is a arm-paper-band with numbers printed on it tied on the visitors right hand. Its a good idea. The very first attraction welcomes is the free fall. A open area lift coming down freely at good speed. After this two or three routes takes you for different excitements. There are roller coaster, centrox, etc etc rides for all ages. Most interesting is the Niagara falls. Its an artificially created hill for about 150-200 ft, from the top of which water is made to fall. They start at 2:00pm and end at 2:30pm.  For ladies separate entry and area under the falls is provided at which the falls height may be around 75-100ft. Next is the Wavepool. This is an artificially created sea wave like water pool. It starts at 2:30pm for 30 minutes. Next is the Swimming pool which seems opened from morning itself. And then Himalayan ride. The theme park also has a cable car which takes you above the park at good height. To add to this is the theme park is full of trees. No separate tickets need to be bought for any ride or activity. Food is allowed. Lot of small eateries and two or three restaurants are there. If it is not sunny, a full day can be spent here.

Name: surkal1978
Title: NICE PLACE
Review: Games are more and one day fully we are enjoyed with ridng, boating, water ride etc. nice place to enjoy the day....

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: nice fun
Review: This is a place for fun rides at decent price but usually crowded on weekends and holidays.lockers will be provided so that we can go for water rides

Name: ankur kandoi
Title: amusement park
Review: we had gone to this place for having some fun...they have some really nice rides and we loved it..if u have time, then surely visit this place..

Name: tasneemtayee2016
Title: Awesome
Review: Awesome rides.trilling experience.Nayagara falls experience is superb,,Wave pool is great to enjoy,, authorities should clean the pools based on the visitors,,Rollercoaster is very thrilling,,fun house is good,, mirror house is enjoying,,3D show should be improved,, Himalayan ride is superb,,all the rides are enjoyable.

Name: Dilleema
Title: Awesome day
Review: The best theme park I ever seen........ I went along with my frnds created beautiful memories...... V are planning for next trip with family.... Hope my parents like ,the way I like Thank uBest place --Queens land

Name: Haridhan
Title: Nice place for a family day out...
Review: Queensland is a nice choice for a family day trip or group of friends.Dry rides is huge compared to water rides . Kids rides:Kids are not allowed in many rides-only 5 to 6 worthy exclusive rides for small kids.Ball room, swing, small wheel, train, small boat ride, horse/car ride..Adult only Rides :Specific mention rides are Free Fall, Roller Coaster, Bumper car, Centrox(circle shape and rotates in 2 axis at high speed), ship, tora tora..Family rides:Notable rides include musical ride, Himalayan ride, American wave pool, Niagara falls, cable car(rope car-only 2 in a car)- need to walk a lot to reach this place-but worth visiting-we felt the need for baggage counter in this place, but not available.safety feature could have been betterWater rides:4 games in this - (1) swimming pool with slides. Separate areas for male/female.. felt the need for a dedicated kids pool /area for families with kids. Went on a Sunday and water cleanliness is not up to the mark also lot of crowd in pool during 2nd half.Lockers are meant for small luggage to keep valuables(2) Himalayan ride - family can enjoy(3) Niagara falls( worth spending time-consuming separate area for ladies)(4) American wave pool - can enjoy with family- demarcation for gents/ladies.Canteen/food:outside food not allowed, but they never check youüòÄRestaurant/food menu not so great for the taste/price but OK OK.Not much options for veggies.Tickets: 550 for adults/450 for kids (above 2.5fts)Note: Each ride is allowed only once, they put a tick on the arm band after you enter the ride.

Name: elluru u
Title: Enjoyment n fun n games
Review: This is the one of the best place 2 enjoy everyone. So many water games is there 2 enjoy.. Even water falls also there.. It's very  superb superb.. Car games n free fall n mirror house.. It's very worth for 550... We went with office mates n enjoyed well in Queens land.

Name: Premsha
Title: A complete entertainer for any type of groupies!!!
Review: Queensland is rich in its own way, the count of dry rides is huge and each is some unique characteristics. Specific mention rides are Free Fall, Roller Coster, Centrox...Water rides are minimal but worthy, you have to wait a bit for Himalayan ride but other water rides are easily accessable and gives you a good experience too, especially the Niagara falls(Exactly like a natural one)...Most of the rides are not for children, but they allow!!!They say that no outside food allowed, but they never check you!!!Food is good only at the restaurant which is right at the centre and the only above average food is chicken biryani, sorry vegans no better options for you!!!Its a long journey which gives a good cardio exercise if you try to finish all the rides on time. Only problem is the cleanliness, could have been better!!!

Name: drpraj18
Title: Pathetic
Review: Though its an amusement park for family and kids, there are hardly 2 or 3 rides where you can go with your family as most of the rids say 'CHILDREN NOT ALLOWED ".Map which was provided at the entrance was useless   .Major problem was language barrier, rude staff.Each ride was allowed only once which was ridiculous. Park is clean with few restaurants which serve simple tasty food at reasonable price.In pool you can not enjoy with your family as it has ladies/ gents section.My 5 year old daughter was refused to accompany with her father due these sections , in absence of life guard near ladies section it was totally unacceptable.

Name: Abdul wahaab
Title: Amazing day with kids
Review: The best theme park in Chennai located in Bangalore highway . The entry ticket has been raised to 550/person. We can enjoy the whole day for that price .lot of rides .lunch is available inside the theme park both veg and non veg . We take our own food.  Kids area and adults area were seperated for convenience

Name: Priyanka S
Title: Nice place to hang out
Review: Place is really Gud.... Full of greenery... U enjoy and at the same time,  feel close to the nature... Cable car is really Gud.... Himalayan ride also worth going... The only thing they can improve is to include more rides for children.... Overall nice place to hang out with friends and families

Name: Rucha121
Title: Good Amusement Park
Review: Located on outskirts of Chennai, Queens Land is a relatively better theme park as compared to the others present in Chennai. Safety and hygiene standards are heavily compromised in theme parks in India, so we have to exercise extra attention and caution. Although, here, we mainly enjoyed swimming pool and water rides as compared to high-speed or other such snazzy rides. Far off from city, you need to go in own car or hire cab. Entry fees are higher on weekends. Best enjoyment is in groups of more than 5

Name: Lilian J
Title: Family fun
Review: Lovely place to chill out with the family. Youngsters have a lot of things to do while the older people have time to relax in a comfortable setting.

Name: akhilpaleti
Title: Awesome
Review: The best place to have fun with friends as well as with family also.  Lot of rides to ride and there is rope way which is the second largest way in south india.

Name: tyag_1984
Title: Good place for family adventure
Review: Good activity, cool location, but need to walk a lot for each and every activity. Carry caps. avoid on a sunny day

Name: KALKI
Title: Queensland
Review: Queensland is a no:1 theme park in chennai.In Queensland the entry fees for kids Rs 450 and for adults Rs 550.Both vegetarian and non-vegetarian foods are available in the food stalls at the Queensland theme park. The food is good and spicy.Snacks and cool drinks are a bit expensive there. You can also take your own food if you want to avoid buying there. Vehicle parking is free.

Name: tnbalaji90
Title: Just loved it
Review: We went as a gang of 8 people last March '17. Despite good experience could've been better in terms of water games. Only 2 water games were available with 2-3 slides and jumpers. May be the park was bit exaggerated which made our expectation levels set high. Land games was peerless. On the whole we just loved it.

Name: Madhavan Sundarraj
Title: One day trip with family
Review: Good place in chennai to have one day outing. But it's too far away (27kms) from city and you need to go with your own transportation. Don't expect any rental services nearby. Some Rides are time based which is frustrating one since the crowd is loaded due to fixed timings.  Veg and non-veg Resturant's are available but not much varieties.

Name: dinesh_j84
Title: Nice Theme Park to enjoy
Review: This is one of the biggest theme parks in Chennai city. The theme park offers variety of land and water games. There are many rides for the kids. Even elders can also while away their time with some of the activities. Eateries are available.

Name: Praveen S
Title: Crowdless place
Review: Outside of city, cost is effective compared to VGP and MGM, but only less water games and dry games, entrance is good

Name: ravikantpandey
Title: Good pkace
Review: It is located in the outskirts of chennai.. a well maintained and worth visiting place.. the rides are good and the safety is ascertained.. only issue is of the water theme section segregate male and female very rudely .. now family wants to stay together and enjoy it's not possible..  also the water are is small to accommodate the number of people visiting.. this area definitely requires thought to bring up.. overall sat place

Name: Ansar B
Title: Maintenance not good and can't enter games more than once
Review: Maintenance is very bad, many rides are under maintenance, you don't feel enjoyment, also you can enter a ride only once, staff are very aggressive. you have to pay for lunch by your self, quality of food is not good.

Name: Abdul wahaab
Title: Gud and well known theme park
Review: It's gud and will known theme park situated in Chennai- Bangalore Highway. Gud place to enjoy all kinds of rides. It is compatible for children's and adults frnds couples family and everyone .Lotof rides and fun and gaming zone too ..Cable car is the very interesting ride ... Maintained poorly s the only drawback

Name: Swetha P
Title: Poorly maintained
Review: Think twice before entering into the water games cause it's really dirty also the slide in the women section is so old that ur clothes as well as skin will get scratched and u ll end up getting hurt ... the numbers of rides are less and the duration is poor.U are allowed to sit in one ride only once .. which is so ridiculous.No new rides since ages .

Name: Gaurav
Title: Queensland is a worst amusement park in world
Review: This is very wrost park. Why a Couple will visit a amusement park? They visited for fun with their kids. But where in swimming pool or any watershower Female and male are not allowed together. IF they want to go together in Gents pool. They not allowed.. I think A couple should not visited this park if they want to enjoy in swimming pool  etc.... many ride are not operated. One Fun house is family ride but they not allowed for gents in their .

Name: Anshuace
Title: Good
Review: Good Place ...Very Nice Location........Wonderful experience to be there. ....‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏èIt's advisable to go on weekday as on weekends there's heavy rush‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏èThank You üëçüèªüëçüèª

Name: Afrin S
Title: theme park
Review: Very good theme park. Lot of rides and water themes are good.Awesome place to go with your group friends.Proper arrangement for girls and boys for water games.

Name: aiman_zakir
Title: Horrible water in the water park, pools are divided foren and women
Review: We went to Queensland as the ratings were the highest. We went just for the water park. It was summer and we walked under the scorching sun to reach the water park. Upon reaching there we were instantly disappointed with the smell of chlorine hitting our nose and the filthy water. Since we already reached we went to the changing room which was full of water and hardly any place to keep your stuff to change. THE WATER POOL WAS DIVIDED FOR MEN AND WOMEN SO IT WAS A WASTE TO GO WITH THE FAMILY. ALL THE GOOD SLIDES WERE WITH THE MEN AND WE LADIES WERE STUCK WITH CHILDREN SLIDES AND KNEE DEEP WATER.Our relief came when we went to the American wave pool which had a better quality of water. The Niagara Falls besides, which only work for half an hour is the best part of the whole amusement park.

Name: Arun Kumar N
Title: Not fit for kids
Review: There were a lot of rides where kids weren't allowed. Out of the 7 hours the theme park was open, the most of the kids rides were shut for close to 3 hours for lunch. Every time we had to walk in hot sun so that we can check if the rides were open yet. Kids were allowed in the water pool only with women. It's ridiculous for kids who come with male members of their family. On top of everything, the water was very very dirty. There were blades/sharp objects in the pool that a kid in my group got his foot cut. The only good thing, the food was not a rip off and good. If this is the best theme park in Chennai, I wonder how bad the other ones are.

Name: Arun K
Title: Good theme park
Review: A good theme park near Chennai. Most of the rides are awesome - especially the artificial waterfalls / water waves area.The rate is also nominal with good parking spaces as well.

Name: imran2004april
Title: Queensland
Review: It is a awesome place.There is a new waterfalls named nayagara waterfall.Though its artificial but the water force,the place it really very good

Name: D MOHAN
Title: Only for kids
Review: Good for children,though very crowded during holidays.They have some very good rides and water games too.Be prepared to walk long distances since it is a very vast area.You will need a full day to complete all the rides

Name: Arun
Title: Budget friendly and nice amusement park
Review: Queensland is cheapest and best amusement park in Chennai. You get to try a lot of rides. There is no extra charges for the rides unlike other amusement parks. Though you have to start early at eleven when they open and you need an entire day to go around all the rides. There is a big lake and usually in summer it is dry. They allow boating in the lake and you also can enjoy the winch ride which passes above the lake. I have been to Queensland a lot of times and enjoyed every single time.

Name: deepika d
Title: Had great time
Review: The entry for adult is now raised to 550.  But reasonable since the rides are more and has many children rides too.  The cable car and himalayan water ride is the must go here.  Water rides are less too good for adventurous people and nature lovers.

Name: bkvijay2303
Title: !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I have never seen a place like this !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Review: This is an amazing place to enjoy with our friends.., we can have all sorts of foods.........., the best one is the centrox...... and second is the niagra falls.....sooo alll of u go  and enjoy.... !!!!!!!!enjoy!!!!!!!!

Name: shanthi23sai
Title: Nice place to enjoy
Review: I have visited this place with family .my son enjoyed a lot by riding almost all rides .all people in chennai should visit this place you feel refreshed here

Name: Anand K
Title: Outstanding
Review: Wowwwwwww what an experience best theme park I have ever visited in Chennai .All people from Chennai and around should visit this park .I had a great time with my friend and family and price is also in mid range and especially centric and free fall.was too good pls visit this park

Name: Ranga E
Title: Old and tired
Review: I visited this place almost after 10 years. Good thing is almost all the rides are still there. But the place took a beating in the recent cyclone resulting in major loss of greenery. Plus there is no new addition and the rides are all old and tired stuff. Most of them are well worn out despite being functional and mechanically sound. But this is the best theme park in Chennai for kids. There are at least 20 rides for kids below 6 years age and that made it worthwhile.

Name: Deepak_S_1991
Title: Ride Along
Review: i have visited this place twice. No need to worry about the different types of rides. Water rides are also good. Food inside wont be that much good.

Name: Sunand S
Title: Memorial one Day full of excitement
Review: Very Nice , Amusement park . There is something for all , whether you are kid , couple , friends , all will enjoy this place . i think its even not possible to cover all activities in one day , they will provide Map , so follow the map or you will be lost in this huge place . Highly recommend this place , in place of words, its better if you can watch our pics, we went with all friends and family

Name: Krishna
Title: a nice fun filled experience
Review: It is really a nice place to hangout with friends, I like it because of the rides and water themes activities here. I recommend this place for a complete relaxation from your day to day busy schedule.

Name: Sushmita S
Title: go with friends and have some fun
Review: I went to this place with friends and it was really great going on all those rides. Please dont go the crazy horse ride tho.

Name: vignesh d
Title: A one day outing
Review: This is a good amusement park, it offers lots of ride and water games. At any given day they will day one or two rides is in maintenance but you can enjoy rest of things. The lake, the cable car drive are awesome. Will get a average lunch.

Name: Chandra k
Title: Fulfilled trip
Review: Hi friends, thank you for reading my review, This place really a memorable place specially for me and my friends had a great time over here, even thought the rides are very old one still hangout with friends make a place more special and memorable,  do visit it with your friends

Name: Roopak J
Title: Nice amusement park
Review: Visited this park last june. Have lots of fun. It is fully equipped interesting rides and water rides. For teens who like adventures, its a nice place. Water rides were also good. All can have a nice time there.

Name: chandurao015
Title: Good place to spend time!
Review: It was a good experience. If you are a bit scared of rides then this can a good place for you as it doesnt have that scary rides.

Name: panicker100
Title: Amazing experience!!!!!
Review: All of a sudden we came out with a plan of visiting this place and we were not disappointed at all.A very well maintained amusement park.Some exhilarating stuff like the cable car ride(suppose to be the longest in the country) and the thrilling Himalayan water ride is never to be missed.Good rides for small kids too.Wave pool and water slides are good but are open only by 2pm. Hygenic food court serving meals at reasonable cost is an added plus.Only one recommendation please start early and go in groups if you have small kids so that you can take turns to look after the lil ones and enjoy some high adrenaline  pumping  rides for which children's are not allowed

Name: khan25kareena
Title: Wonderful Amusement Park
Review: Go crazy on a roller-coaster,capture the paranomic view on a cable car,splash at the Himalayan water ride or get puzzled at the mirror house.This amusement park has nearly 50 rides.This park is must go with childrens and teenagers.

Name: Abhishek9515
Title: an amusing day with friends
Review: an amusement park on the way to sriperumbudur is an average place to go with friends. The rides are good and you woud enjoy with bunch of friends.

Name: Priyanka S
Title: Great Amusement Park
Review: Queens Land is the Great Amusement Park which is located at Chennai-Bangalore Trunk Road between Sriperumpudhur and Poonamalle. There is parking for cars. Buses are available from Guindy and T. Nagar. All buses going to Sriperumpudhur from Chennai stop at Queensland.I have went with my family members and enjoyed a lot.There are some water rides, which operate only from 2:00 pm to 5:00 pm and Food and drink are available within the park.

Name: Samson G
Title: Thrilling Amusement Park
Review: Great place to hung out on a weekend, services are well prices and not short of activity.This place is great for a fun filled day and time to mingle. The various rides make it even more fun and spacious environment.

Name: _honey_hmt
Title: Amusement with friends
Review: You can finish all the rides so will feel happy..Its a good place to enjoy with friends..The water rides are less anyways but still with a gang of friends you will enjoy the day..Is good to spend with friends..

Name: 1143guy
Title: Great place to spend a day
Review: Another Amusement Park nearby Chennai. Queens Land has some good rides. Worth a visit.Requires a lot of travelling, before you reach the place.

Name: Senthamizh Aras... G
Title: Nice Theme park
Review: One of the nice theme parks in Chennai. Nearby to porur and ponnamelle. Don't expect too much but this theme park will not disappoint u. The rides are interesting. Water sports are too cool. Please start early so that u can enjoy a lot. Also there is train station kind of thing take that as a finishing option.

Name: kutyfencer
Title: Chennai Theme Park
Review: whata place to spend a whole day with friends, family and kids. It was an lovely experience with full of fun in water games.

Name: whosanenator
Title: Average at best and ambiguous pricing- verdict poor !!!
Review: Well it was one of the regular spots for people in early days, now it seems on the decline.Too many cost cutting measures, and the waterfeatures are also timed, so one has to go as per the management's convenience.Some of the rides were rickety and felt dodgy. It has room for improvement and a lot can be expected to go well (if managed properly).They charged child price for a kid less than child age and said her height is more, so we will charge (then why mention an age limit on website).

Name: Pathik Shah
Title: Its' Ok type Experience..!!
Review: Have visited this place in group. During visit, it was afternoon time on weekdays and most of the rides are not opened. Only One ride was good which is Himalaya. Food in restaurant was good enough.

Name: Oindrila h
Title: Amusement park with entry fee
Review: there are categories for the entry free... Lots of rides, for everyone in the family,Toy train is the must ride to cover the full park,crowded always, kids enjoyed

Name: SyedIqbal123
Title: Good Place, One day is not enough to cover all
Review: I have visited Queens land in Chennai two times.  It is good amusement park, have lot of rides and games.  Good place to spend with family and friends.  Suitable for all ages from kids to Senior citizens.The rides like 'Himalaya water ride', 'winch' 'Bumper car' and other water rides must never be missed.  They will give a map at start which is also useful.There are some eat outs there for afternoon, but should get there earlier before 1 pm, other wise the food stuff will get over.  We can take home food also.The problem I faced in Queens land both the times is that they have lot of rides and one cannot complete all in a whole day, But we will pay the whole amount.  Eg: You will get queue for most of the famous rides, standing in queue will grab 2-3 hours in one day in total, and rides like Himalayan water ride, winch may take long time, so you will not have time to complete all the rides, even if you want.Swimming pool not good, with lot of dirt.The evening train for exit is also not to be missed, but the problem is, it is once in 45 minutes, and a whole bunch of people will be waiting for it, so one thing you will leave your time to stand in queue OR you will leave that train and walk for about 1 km for exit.

Name: Medagam Praveen
Title: Value for money
Review: This one, you will never forget when you visit.one of the best amusement park that you never visited,worth for money,almost 42 rides all were free,himalayan water ride, rope way is main attraction for this park.food available here is good.make an early start i.e, 10:00 AM such that each and every ride is availabe, make sure to complete rides from backwards i.e, 40th ride to 1st ride.make rope way ride between 4:00 PM - 5:00PM such that sunset view of external chennai city is just AWESOME.make himalayan water ride as early as possible other you have to wait for two stairs of quee.everything is just awesome CENTROX, ROLLER COASTER, FREE FALL, STIMULATION THEATRE.

Name: surender k
Title: Gud Amusement Park
Review: Queens Land is best amusement part in Chennai. The dry games and water games are very good. The maintenance is also gud. Food is quite costly.

Name: Cyrus
Title: Wonderful place for wholeday occupation
Review: Enjoyed the visit, played all games. Amazing and adventures games for teens and all types of games are there for entire family.

Name: Swarupc
Title: Wonderful and amazing place for a weekend Getaway with Family and friends
Review: Enjoyable placeGood Rides for both children and adults.Full day enjoyment with various indoor and outdoor activities.Best part most of the rides are maintained properly.

Name: Varun V
Title: QUEENS LAND the worst ever i visited, GENDER BIAS
Review: I HAVE VISITED MANY OF THE AMUSEMENT PARKS WHOLE OVER INDIA BUT DID NOT EVER SEE GENDER BIAS IN THE POOLS. Names are as American wave pool and no one is allowed to enjoy with their female friends and wife's. The worst experience is there are only 2 water rides in that whole park.lose of money and worst experience with the staff.

Name: bvikasnanu1810
Title: nice  water  ride
Review: amazing  games  , thriller  games  also  available  ,  roller  coaster and  tora tora was  a  favourite  games  for  all  and  excellent  place  spend  time  throughout  the  day

Name: shymathans
Title: queens land
Review: enjoyed the trip, played all the games. inside the queens land food is not tasty and its costly some what

Name: Richard R
Title: Raise in Ticket!!!
Review: Raised their prices from 350 to 550Till the month of Jan 2016 it was 350 which includes the boating..Now boating is excluded for 550 LOL(They stopped boating)Food taste and hygienic  is not up to the standard comparing to other theme parks in chennai Maintenance is good,

Name: Dj_travelfreak
Title: Average Theme park
Review: There are plenty rides and the water park is also good, just need a bit of more good maintenance...rest it is a value for money to spend a day out in Chennai

Name: Mythreyi
Title: Adventure seekers - Keep note of!
Review: I've been there multiple times with friends and I've never been bored of it yet. It's a must visit in the summer - to beat the heat thanks to the water rides. The entry fee is worth the rides inside.

Name: Madanmohan B
Title: Just Average ! and Very Bad management !
Review: 1.what would have been an average satisfying experience was ruined by bad crowd management, for families it will be a hard time waiting in lines, also i could not  found even a single security person for crowd management for hindering mischief mongers, Girls and Ladies Must be cautious. There is not even a single Contact No displayed for reporting to the management, the operators are busy with operating the rides and turn a deaf ear to peoples complaints.  2.rides like alpine blitz, ship, free fall are good ,each ride time will be 5 mins max but waiting will be atleast 40 mins to 1 hr, if there is more crowd, also for rollercoaster waiting can be upto more than 1.5 hr,3. small kids can have some fun,4. Didnt bother to enter the pool as there was too much crowd.

Name: Thamim
Title: Excellent
Review: .friends if u visit Chennai don't miss it... Queensland... its a very big theme park... my family and my self enjoyed a lot.... many rides are there... water rides also is there... but we don't have time to go all the rides... tickets only at rs350.. no extra cost for other rides..

Name: Arogya Raj
Title: Queen of water rides .
Review: Visit early morning possible to enjoy each and every rides. Most and fun filled are water rides . Don't miss any rides . Each rides have different time , so before entering take a note of 'Riding Time'. Can be enjoyed by all type of people . And guys don't waste too much time swimming pool like us ,you will miss other rides. if you visited for time passing means take Cable Car because its take more time to end ,but you will surely love the aerial view of that location . Before entering make sure to put your mobile and other stuffs in locker (When u don't have anything in your hand means lot of fun without tension to enjoy all the rides ). Reasonable rates ,thrilling rides . lot of fun . Enjoyable place .

Name: thangamani g
Title: ''good''
Review: Rides are good,especially 3d was best which was first operated in this place..himalayan water ride is also a good one..

Name: SACHINPARMAAR
Title: ENJOYING TRIP WITH FAMILY AND FRIENDS
Review: Nice place to cheer and enjoy. Economical it is. Available for full day and can enjoy until late evening. Good rides and clean water too. Food has to be better. young kids below 5 don't get a chance to enjoy rides as they are ticketless as tickets are not issued for them and they cannot accompany the elders in big rides. They can surely enjoy in the pools.

Name: Rasal
Title: Fun time
Review: Have been there with my team. And we enjoyed every single ride and started dancing on the stages which were more entertained. Even one TV have interviewed and broadcasted it. Go for it.

Name: Sangita V
Title: Fun place
Review: It is a fun filled place to enjoy in chennai with friends and family,it is very economical tooone whole day is needed to explore it fully

Name: praveenramanujam
Title: Nice place in Chennai
Review: Queen's land is a good place in Chennai for amusement. Children of all age will enjoy the variety of rides in this park.

Name: Vijay S
Title: Excellent location of the temple.
Review: Located right by the beach, this temple gives us the relaxing feelings with sound of sea waves. There is also a kids temple in the same premise which can be enjoyed by children. There are places to sit and meditate if one wishes to. It is better to go early before the scorching sun is out. Importantly photography is prohibited inside. The beach is right behind and is fairly less crowded. 2 streets away there is also a very good Puri Jagannath temple which has a beautiful architecture.

Name: ramatneethi
Title: Excellent
Review: Located near the beach. Calm and quite place. A Vishnu temple with many stone carved pollers each one with the statues of hindu deities.  Very clean and well maintained temple governed by the Chinmaya mission. Visitors can go to beach that's at walkoable distance.

Name: Raguram R
Title: Wonderful Temple
Review: Excellent temple. The ambience is wonderful. Was there during the 6PM aarathi and it was a good experience. Temple is neat and clean, almost spotless. The team that is maintaining the temple and conducting day to day activities is very good. I spent a good one hour there. Better be there at about 5pm, enjoy the aarathi and then make a move.

Name: Venkataraman R
Title: Unique temple with pillars. Visit the temple, before visiting the beach, as asked by temple authorities
Review: Very different temple with pillars. Pillars are having lots of good sayings, which is a very positive message to devotees. Open temple makes us to feel with nature with sea shore by the side. Lord Narayana is huge and blesses devotees. The temple authorities are asking not to visit temple after visiting nearby beach. So, it is better to visit temple first and then the beach.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Excellent place
Review: The place is so divine, statues are so beautiful on a vast area. Maybe a private property, we don't know but we'll maintained.

Name: QWERTY098
Title: Great place to sit and meditate
Review: Awesome open environment.Activities are less tedious.Relaxed templeClean beach next doorParking can b a bit trickyReaching here using Google not best idea. Just turn from main road into Avenue 13 and it will straight down to the temple. Other aveneues have road blocks now.

Name: mPraveenkumar
Title: Beautiful and serene temple by the seashore
Review: Must visit this temple if you are visiting Chennai, especially if you are visiting ECR/OMR. It is situated right next to the seashore and you can hear the waves.the temple is open to sky having a great ambience. The perform Sagar Aarthi (Aarthi to the ocean) every Sunday evening and that's a good time to visit the place.

Name: Venkataraman U
Title: Listen to the sound of the breeze and the sea amidst a divine atmosphere
Review: Recently built open temple, with no Gopuram or ceiling, on the sea shore. The main deity is Matsya Narayana (upper half Human, lower half Fish), over 10 feet granite, an avatar of Lord Vishnu"s  Dasavatharam as per the Hindu Mythology. The main deity stands in the centre of a round pond opposite Lakshmi Narayana. There are 108 granite pillars in the temple. There are circular benches to sit and have a peaceful meditation listening to the sound of the sea and the breeze. Remember to walk around the two walking paths, specially created,  looking around the sculptures on the path. Other Deities in the temple include Ganesha, Lord Siva and Hanuman. There is also a Surya Rath (Chariot) made of stone immediately to the left of the entrance. A must visit for the modern day youth and the elders. Unique concept by the Chinmaya Mission. Go in the evening to enjoy the Sun set as well. Pleasant memories.

Name: ramatneethi
Title: A Totally different Architecture
Review: A Hindu temple built by Chinmaya Mission. The Matsya Avatharam (Fish, reincarnation of Vishnu) in the Bhagavatham is the idol here. Located near the Uthandi Beach, Chennai, very close to Sea is a very peaceful temple unusually without roof. Very well maintained. All pillars with verses from Bhagavatham engraved will mesmerize the visitor. A beautifully created garden around the walkway inside. They didn't allow photography inside. A beautiful place to visit with family after 5 PM.

Name: Rajendran
Title: Modern beauty
Review: The temple without Roof, but pillars around, along the Utthandi Beach, has the Lord Matshya Narayana in the centre, surrounded by beautiful garden and walk ways, decorated with small stones, small and Unique , visit early morning or in the evening, since walking around in day time will be very hot

Name: Ritika A
Title: Peaceful
Review: Beautiful temple of lord Vishnu, Very clean and well maintained garden. It‚Äôs an open temple by the sea...pls visit the temple after 6 pm for Sandhya Aarti

Name: RajeeshRj
Title: Peace at its best
Review: Excellent place to take your time off of the busy city life...the sounds of the waves and the peace around the place makes it best place to medidate..very peaceful and well maintained place....Om namo narayanaya!!!!

Name: Girija Muralidharan
Title: Matsya Narayana Temple.
Review: This temple is uniquely located near the vast expanse of the sea in Uthandi, midway between Chennai and Mahabalipuram, Tamil Nadu.  Chinmaya Tarangini is the proud organisation which built  this beautiful open to the sky temple. The tall statue of the Lord is surrounded by 108 pillars inscribed with  1008 names. a very quite and serene palace to sit and meditate and enjoy the beauty of the Nature around you. This place is very well maintened. a must see temple when you are visiting Chennai or residing here.

Name: Aishwarya M
Title: Hidden gem within 30-40 mins from Chennai
Review: Lovely, quaint and peaceful temple by the sea built by the Chinmaya mission. There is a huge Mathsya avatar in the centre surrounded with big pillars in the inner ring and small pillar circling the outer ring. There are also wooden benches around the inner ring for you to sit down and meditate or just listen to the sea. Make sure to stop here on the way to Mahabalipuram or Pondicherry. It is better that you visit here on week days when there is not much crowd so you can enjoy the peaceful tranquility

Name: Rsk M
Title: Unique beach side temple with Matsya avatar
Review: Mesmerising beach side spiritual place, well maintained, midway between Chennai and Mahabalipuram. Open air deity with pillars covering hindy script ( vishnu sahasranam).. Should not miss.. difficult to find. google route is reliable. fantastic clean long beach beside...

Name: meghashyam
Title: Soulful
Review: The open to sky edifice to Lord Matsya Narayana is beautiful , the whole place is aesthetic , clean well maintained , evening Arati to the Lord n the ocean is something unique . It's just after Iskcon temple by the sea shore .

Name: Sujit Kumar
Title: Beautiful and Mesmerising
Review: Located right besides the beach, this temple is a must visit for everyone around Chennai. The architecture is very unique and not something that usually fit our mental image of a temple. Each pillar around the temple recite a hymn from the famous Vishnu Sahasranamam in different languages on each side and the quiet tranquil atmosphere takes you to a different plane altogether. A perfect place to watch the sunrise and meditate in peace engulfed in nothing but the heavenly sound of waves and a quiet breeze. Great experience!!

Name: Prasad B
Title: Unique of Its Kind !!!
Review: Absolutely distinguished and creative design!!...Only temple on the planet which standing like this - without the roof and that too on seashore.

Name: Charan B
Title: Different experience
Review: A very different kind of temple. Would suit not just for the spiritual seekers but for ppl looking for a scenic and tranquil place, just next to a clean beach. Wave sounds and calm atmosphere provide an ideal environment for those seeking to meditate!!

Name: Ray S
Title: Roofless Temple
Review: A good place to visit by the beach. It is a unique roofless temple. A series of pillars that leads you to the main shrine of MatsyaNarayana. Interesting concept of a temple.

Name: rashmi k
Title: Beautiful and peaceful
Review: Awesome location Sri Mathsya Narayana Temple. Om Namo Narayana Mantra mixed with sound of waves at the backdrop. Lovely beach with few people. Wonderful place for a silent evening.Ideal to watch Sun-rise and Sunset. It is not a commercial place. So no vendors other than one flower vendor. Temple shop has collections of devotional song cds, photos, etc.

Name: Sundar V
Title: Myself,my husband& a friend visited Mathsyanarayanar temple in Uththandi this evening. The temple opens by 5 'o clock.
Review: When we travel from Thiruvanmiyur in ECR, take 109 bus which goes to Kovalam or any other bus going to kovalam or Mahabalipuram. Get down at Nayinakuppm bus stop. From there coming back in ECR. YOU take Rajaji salai in the right & your destination is in 15 minutes walk . If you travel by share auto from Thiruvanmiyur you get down at Rajaji salai in the left. The fare is 25 Rs. Rajaji salai comes after a signal& opposite to ADHITHYARAM GROUP  of companies in the right side of ECR. THE evening aArthi is by 6'o clock . B

Name: vidya v
Title: Unique temple for meditation and silence
Review: One of its kind - sitting in silence in the background of waves sound is a divine experience to be felt in person. Visited at 5.00 pm, would like to visit again in late evening and in moonlight

Name: Chidananda K C
Title: Matsya Narayana temple by beach side on ECR
Review: Chinmaya Tarangini (Matsya Narayana Temple) is a very unique open air temple next to beach is a nice place to visit. Open in morning and evening.Every Sunday morning Gayatri Homam is performed @ 6.00 am and is free for all. Anybody who is interested can attend. A great service to the public, My sincere thanks to Chinmaya mission.

Name: Sriram_064
Title: Matsya Narayana Temple is a great temple to visit in Chennai...45 minutes away from Adyar / Thiruvanmiyur
Review: This is a quiet temple on the East Coast Road with an open air meditation centre. This is very close to the beach. Evenings are very pleasant here and the only sound you hear is the noise of the sea waves leaving you free to meditate while enjoying the cool sea breeze. The temple has 108 pillars with writings of the 1000 names of Lord Vishnu with explanations in English (Sanskrit & Tamil also used). There are also Lord Ganesha, Lord Siva and Hanumanji in the complex besides a Gita Upadesa chariot. Chinmaya Mission has created this wonderful temple and maintains it very well.

Name: gayatriPune
Title: visit to unique temple
Review: Recently I happened to visit this unique & wonderful place. Its only temple of Matsya bhagavan & that also its open temple. there are 108pillars & 12 feet tall idol of Matsyabhagavan, an avatar of Lord Vishnu. there are 10names of Lord on each pillar & its English meaning. Each pillar also have a name of Gurudev Chinmayananad. It is right on the beach & you can witness beautiful sunrise.

Name: RamGanesan
Title: A peaceful Meditation Center right on the Beach
Review: This peaceful temple dedicated to Matsya Narayana is on the East Cost Road near a place called Uthandi.  It is a relatively newly constructed temple right on the beach.  The temple has been constructed by Donors and supported by Chinmaya Mission.  The structure of the temple itself has been carefully designed in a oval shape and a raised circular structure.  The large life size idol of Lord Narayana in the form of a Matsya (fish) is in the middle of the elevated circular platform.  People who know the avatars described in Hindu tradition will understand the significance of the Matsya Avatar, the avatar that saved the world from floods.  The area around the idol is meant for meditation and visitors are asked to remain silent in that designated spot.  The entire temple sits on the shores of the sea and a gusty wind always breezes past us.  It is therefore a serene atmosphere for meditation and prayer.  The unique aspect of this place is that it is open air with a lot of beautiful pillar structures with inscriptions about several things that the temple stands for.  When the lights come out in the evening after dark it is a real treat to watch the place.  The lighting has also been carefully chosen to maintain a calm and serene atmosphere.  The floor around the temple has also been carefully laid with small marble stones that create an accu pressure on the foot.  This helps in blood circulation when one comes around the temple.  The lawn and the garden with a lot of flowers add beauty to the whole place.  There are also three other shrines inside the complex, Siva, Hanuman, Ganapthy and of course Narayana and his concert.   The book shop sells religious books.  Separate toilet and shoe keep area are maintained well.   Vehicle parking is not a problem right now as not many people are aware of this place.  I hope by this review people will get to know the place.  Do refer my photos to see the beautiful temple.  This is a Must see place if you are in the southern parts of Chennai

Name: Ananth 727499
Title: A must visit place of worship..
Review: This Temple is situated in the main part of chennai, in Adyar.. The Temple is neatly maintained and poojas are done in proper timings.. The main deity of this Temple is Anantha padmanabaswamy.. Idols of Lord Narasimma is seen majestic ..

Name: PitoyAmpil1941
Title: a nice temple near Besant Nagar
Review: the temple is near the Theosophical Society campus where the big Banyan Tree is located.... street food is available nearby...

Name: Ansi
Title: wer impressive
Review: definetely worth to visit. Very impressive and  wonderful. We would definitely go again if we could. recommendable

Name: Passport648127
Title: A GOOD TEMPLE IN ADYAR , CHENNAI
Review: The temple is a well maintained and popular one , in the good locality of Adyar.The main deity is Sri.Anantha Padbanaswamy , with shrines for  various Gods.Festivals are celebrated on all important days , with a good crowd of devotees..I suggest your visit and worship here. Well connected by Buses ; the metro station is also nearby.SRINIVASAN SUNDAR

Name: Mihir C
Title: Utter mismanagement in Padmanava Temple in Trivandum
Review: We went to the temple on the 22nd of September, 2019. There was no management to control the devotees. In fact, it was free for all. Only the mighty people can make their way to darsan. I was in the 3rd row and I could see nothing. More number of priests obstructed view. I expect local administration to take a note of that. Devotees should try toavoid going to that temple. We were very upset afterspending almost 3 hours there could see only the priests. Temple authority should arrange video screen in the temple like that in Mahakaaleswar temple in Ujjain, MP.

Name: Vasudev68
Title: A must visit
Review: A calm, serene place with divine experience. Visiting in the morning with fresh mind keeps the day going great.

Name: cool1960
Title: VERY CALM AND A NEAT TEMPLE
Review: Car parking is little difficult. I had parked the car in the side street. The temple is very neat and well maintained. There is a good silence and it was a good ambience.The diety is looking very good and we feel immensely fulfilled after coming in to the temple.

Name: DrGRajesh
Title: hitorical temple
Review: Historical templeit is worth visiting this temple in Adyarthank you Ashok for taking me to this temple

Name: reubenranjanfern2017
Title: Divine place.
Review: This temple is very crowded when we visited and definitely worth seeing. Must for people visiting this city.

Name: Ananth 727499
Title: Neat maintainance .. Calm place
Review: This Temple has its own speciality.As the name itself reveals, we could understand that the main deity is just like the same as in Trivandrum temple.. Neatly maintained and poojas are done in a good manner.. You could feel the sound of your inner mind, when you just sit here for a while and meditate..Many of your questions are answered here and you could balance yourself - whether you are correct in your decisions or not .. The only problem you could face here is parking.. But that's also arranged.. You should park your vehicles in the streets around the Temple with a minimum charge.. Don't miss this place...

Name: c krishnan
Title: Regular visits on Saturdays
Review: This is a nice temple which is generally crowded every day but more so on Saturdays since it is a Vishnu temple. The atmosphere is nice and conducive for a soulful experience.

Name: Corey E
Title: beautiful but beware
Review: The temples are definitely worth seeing however...beware of the so called "guides."  They act like they're giving you a spontaneous tour because they happen to be walking next to you and will begin to explain things.   We told our gentlemen that we were there to film and weren't really tourists.  He stood by us anyway every once in a while explaining what it was that was before us.   When we went to leave he asked for money.  $60USD.!!!!   That's more than a weeks wage for a bulk of the population.  Not gonna do it.

Name: j_yuvan
Title: A place to pray in peace
Review: For those who do not have a chance to visit Trivandrum and pray Lord Ananthapadmanabhswamy, one can have the dharshan of this Almighty who is ever willing to take everyone who seeks his refuge. Situated within Chennai is well accessible.

Name: asokanma
Title: One of the Divine place in Adyar, Chennai where God(Perumal) provide abundant wealth to devotees
Review: One can feel the vibration not only before the main deity Ananthaa Padmanabha Swamy, Narasimhar etc; before the Urchavar(s) statues also. Management and devotees are Neatly maintainingf the koil. Try sit before main deity and do mediation for bliss.Siva also here to bless the devotees.

Name: Narasimhan G
Title: Trivandrum of Chennai on Tamil Brahmin style !
Review: Ananthaa Padmanabha Swaamy Temple#2 2'nd Main Road | Adyar, Chennai 600020,it is nicely managedRun by a group devoted in the traditions of South Indian Brahmin styleThere are more concerts and discourses on religion

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Divine place
Review: The place is dedicated to lord vishnu worshipped as ananda padmanabhan,which is a an exact replica of the thirivanandapuram padmanaban samy temple. The place also has a temple dedicated to lord shiva behind.

Name: K V K
Title: A temple well maintained
Review: This temple run by dharma paripalana trust is very well maintained. When we enter the temple premises, a divine feeling envelopes us, soothing our mind and makes us to focus on The Supreme. The temple is very clean and the idols are kept in  a systematic way making it easy for us to have good darshan

Name: sbalaji2016
Title: Serene Anantha Padmanabha Swamy temple
Review: The God here is in lying posture and you would be able to see only of the three body parts from each door - so to see Ananatha Padmanabha Swamy you have to patiently move across to get a full darshan.Situated very close to Adyar Bridge / Fortis Malar hospital - 2/4 wheeler parking is available on the side roads (except on special / festive occasions)Very powerful god Dress - Normal, No headscarves required. no Shorts/ skirts

Name: PTG1976
Title: Temple visit
Review: The Ananatha Padmanabha Swamy temple is a very well built and maintained one. The idols are maintained beautifully. The poojas are done with devotion. The premises is air-conditioned; provisions have been made for the devout to sit facing the main deity and engage in prayer/ meditation. Parking is a problem as there is not even a single car parking space provided by the temple. One has to park nearby and earn the wrath of the local residents for blocking their frontage.

Name: babuvis51
Title: A serene temple for worship
Review: This is one of the most beautiful temples in Chennai.  It is situated in Gandhi nagar, Adyar. The temple is well connected by buses, MRTS trains and other transport services.  Parking for private vehicles is available on the streets around the temple.  The presiding deity is Sri Anantha padmanabhaswamy like Trivananthapuram. Other sannidanams for Sri Sudharshan, Hanuman, Navagraha are there. A good place for calm prayers.

Name: KMSMANIAN1049
Title: Vishnu temple in Adyar
Review: An excellent temple built for exclusively for Lord Vishnu in the 'Sayana ( sleeping posture), position similar to the temple in Trivandrum.

Name: Arvind
Title: Quiet and Peaceful
Review: This temple is a replica of Shri Padmanabhaswamy temple at Trivandrum and is maintained well. Nestled in a quiet residential suburb of the city, the temple is well connected by public transport (Bus and train) and private (parking space available on the side roads). The temple houses Shri Padmanabhaswamy in ananthashayana (sleeping) pose, his consorts, besides Ganpathy, Krishna, Devi, Shiva and the Navagrahas too. Saturdays are usually busy at this temple, but the other days are relatively peaceful and one could spend quality time peacefully meditating. The temple is well maintained and crowd (in case there are any), is well managed. Do pay a visit if you are in and around Adyar area of Chennai (Closer to the IT corridor).

Name: rashmi k
Title: Beautiful temple
Review: People who cannot visit trivandrum to see Anantha Padmanabha swamy, need not feel sad as this temple resembles it. Narayana is in sleeping posture with all other gods around him and hs consulates near his legs. The sannidhi gives you immense solace and you will feel peaceful on entering the same. Evening Aarthi time is at 6.30. Easily reachable. Parking 4 wheeler might be problematic, so plan accordingly.

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Lord Vishnu Temple
Review: This is a nice temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu and is situated at Adyar area in Chennai. Nice architecture and peaceful ambiance.

Name: Rajagopal S
Title: Peaceful
Review: one of our fav temples.. cant believe they have AC now in the temple... is this the first AC temple ? :)   conveniently located in adayar.. love the peace and sanctity we get when we visit this temple..  we love the narasimhar vigraham here.. its one of our "go-to" god when we are in trouble :)

Name: Savitha NK
Title: Nice visit
Review: Remember to check the timings before you go, place is clean and well organized. Good outing over the evening.

Name: lpkc
Title: Very peaceful
Review: I visit this temple every week. Very peaceful place. There are proper sitting area in front of the deity to sit and meditate. The temple is situated in Adyar. The temple is a replica of Padmanabhaswamy temple of Travancore.

Name: vijmail99
Title: Peaceful place
Review: Well maintained temple. Less crowded on regular days. Good darshan. Also good street parking facilities.

Name: oliver B
Title: Theindu God temple
Review: Shri Padmanabha swami tempelen in Adyar, this is similar to the temple that located Shri Padmanabha swamy temple in Trivandum, this temple is a famous and an ancient temple, we visited 9th december at 8 AM, a pleasant atmosphere.

Name: Keertan
Title: Amazing
Review: Ananthaa Padmanabha Swamy Temple of Chennai is the replica of original temple of Ananthaa Padmanabha Swamy Temple of Kerala which I explored in 2013 during my audit assignment visit to Chennai for four days. Visit to this temple was organized by our client for us after as a one day trip to Chennai after our audit assignment was concluded. The temple is big and widespread over a large area with open space for parking and shops around its corner. The architecture concept of the temple is exactly that of Padmanabha Swamy temple of Kerala. Even the statue of Lord Narayan is also same in the exact lying down position. The major difference is that the original statue of Kerala temple is made of pure gold while that of Chennai is stone with decoration of gold and silver metals.People visits lot here to offer their prayers. You will find accessories shops of flowers, sweets, fragrance sticks to offer prayer inside the temple. Some other shops are also there like music, clothes, wall frames, decorative pieces, toys, etc. Moreover, there is strict security checking just at the entrance of the temple. It will take around one hour to explore this temple from the time you stop at this place till you move out from this temple. On Sundays and holidays, this temple is full of rush due to which it takes more time. So, it is better to move out on weekdays.Please note that leather items, electronic devices, photography are strictly prohibited inside the temple.

Name: Sathya B
Title: One of my fav temples
Review: This temple is so good to visit at anytime of the year. Its clean, quiet, easy to reach and not too far from city.

Name: Venkata Shivaku... R
Title: Very well maintained place
Review: Like most Maha Vishnu temples, this is one is also well maintained. What is special about this temple, is the range of abhishekams, homams, and poojas that a devotee can participate in. The purohits here are very friendly and helpful. The speciality of the temple is the Shiva linga in the hands of Lord Ananthapadmanabha Swamy. I was told it wasnt there initially but was added later. The additional shrines found here are for - Garuda, Lord Krishna, Lord Rama, Lord Hanuman, Navagrahas and of course for Lord Shiva (in the form of linga).

Name: vinayan20152015
Title: Example of modern yet traditional South Indian Temple architecture and Ambience
Review: Having already visited the Original Padmanabha Swamy Temple in Triivandrum several times, I was very keen to see what the Chennai version was like. We were not disappointed.  This temple has taken the essence of the Trivandrum shrine, and has imparted the unique Tamil ambience to the Murti. The temple is centrally located , in fact with possibilities of traffic jams on key days... The Padmanabha Swamy idol is in the same reclining position, viewed through three doors....one for the feet with the Holy Consort Devi visible, the middle door for the Torso, with the Umblical Cord and Brahma seated on it; and the third door showing the head and hand drooping on the floor just above the Shiva Linga . There are other deities in the background looking on...The piety and gravitas of the atmosphere in Trivandrum is not so prominent here. Instead of being awe-inspiring, here it is more democratic or transparent(!) is the feeling we get...But either way, this place gives you the indefinable presense that electric feeling you get in places close to the devine... Visit on a non-busy day or time, if you want to actually soak in the atmosphere leisurely....

Name: Prasad B
Title: Majestic and Magnificent !!!
Review: The temple of Lord Vishnu is not only appeared alike an architectural marvel but it presents itself as an epitome of holiness and spirituality.Brahmostavam is close to March...please once during the said eve.

Name: Arun
Title: Beautiful temple with rare main deity pose
Review: It is a small but a beautiful temple located near the Adyar Bridge. The temple is a rich temple. You can find the god statues covered in gold painted plates and they maintain the temple very well. I believe the temple is maintained by the trust that maintains the main Ananthaa Padmanabha Swaamy Temple in Thiruvananthapuram. The main deity is Lord Vishnu and he is in sleeping pose and it is very rare to find Lord Vishnu in such a pose.

Name: Balasubramanian R
Title: Adyar Ananthaa Padmanabha Swamy Temple
Review: Anantha Padmanabha Swamy temple is situated in Adyar. Kasthuribai Nagar and Gandhi Nagar residents are main devotees of this temple.
