Every year, from mid-November to first week of January, is the period when devotees after observing a strict 41-days abstinence, undertake a pilgrimage to Sabarimala or the mountain of Lord Sabari.The temple in Mahalingapuram is not a replica- that is forbidden. The architecture is typically of Kerala and the sanctum follows all the tenets of temple architecture and divine rules. It is kept exceptionally clean and follows strict timings - opening, closing and observing all the poojas in correct manner at correct timings. Later a Sree Guruvayurappan Temple for Lord Krishna was added alongside and over the years new buildings, constructions and renovations have taken place. Sree Ayyappan Temple also has smaller abodes for Lord Ganesha - the elephant headed  God, Goddess Mallikapura, and Lord Muruga (Karthik, son of Lord Shiva and Godess Parvathy, as known to North India)

Name: shymathans
Title: ayyappa temple
Review: good place for all people, good temple with modern architectureenjoyed the time, little bit crowdy always

Name: Rohithmn
Title: Good place for relaxation and pray
Review: In between the busy schedule, these types of places are must. The authorities have kept the premises clean to a good extend.

Name: MadKap
Title: Simply beautiful temple !
Review: This is a lovely temple - beautifully maintained and amazing ! The black and gold combination is stunning ! Went there for an engagement ceremony and they served breakfast afterwards - great food! Don't think food is available normally though.

Name: Vidhya31
Title: Mini Kerala in Heart of Chennai
Review: Temple is well maintained and in very calm place. Inside the temple one will feel as if they are in Kerala. Traditional Kerala instruments, pooja and deity alankar everything is same as in Kerala. All seva done here. Especially i have done Anna Prasanam (first time solid introducing function) for my kid. Very good experience. Taking the small children to Kerala for that special function is very difficult and the same can be done here is the big gift. Beauty of the temple is enhanced by the lights lit in the temple. no words to explain the beauty of Lord Guruvaurappan and Lord Ayyappa. If anybody gets the chance to visit the temple please do not miss the chance. Must see temple

Name: Pradeep K
Title: Famous Ayyappa temple in Chennai
Review: This temple is situated in the adjacent lane of Mahalingapuram main road. Well maintained temple. It is situated in a peaceful location.

Name: Kannan1580
Title: Wonderful Temple and a must visit in Chennai
Review: Dedicated to lord ayyappa and lord guruvaurappan This temple is just wonderful. To see the temple with all those lamps lit in the evening is just a blissful feeling. This is one temple where you feel like you should come again and again once you have been there once.Go and visit this temple I am sure that you will be back for the next visit !!!!!!!!!

Name: APK24
Title: Heaven on Earth
Review: This a lovely temple in a quiet residential location. I visited on a weekday evening and while it was a little crowded, I had no problem getting some peace and quiet.This is not a commercial temple where people keep asking you for money for rites or prayers performed for you. That's what I liked about it a lot. I got a lot of peace of mind

Name: Sangeetha Vikram
Title: Wonderful Ayyappa temple resembles Kerala tradition..
Review: Myself with my mom visited Mahalingapuram Sree Ayyappa Temple on a Thursday morning. It was a typical Kerala Style temple. The main deities were Guruvayoorappan & Swami Ayyappan. Other deities available in the temple are Lord Ganapathy, Lord Muruga, Naagar, Navagrahas, Lord Anchaneya etc., Poojas were performed in Kerala style. Wonderful & Must visit temple for Lord Ayyappa devotees.

Name: vpas
Title: A place of worship
Review: Dedicated to Lord Ayyappan, this temple follows Kerala traditions. It is popular for performing the Anna prashanam or first solid feeding for infants . They also have thulabaram or offerings on weighing scale weighed according to one 's weight .

Name: KARTHIKb87
Title: Chennai prominent iyyappa temple
Review: Its one of the important Iyyappa temple in chennai and its old iyyappa temple in chennai and from travancore temple is receiving jewels during pongal/makara jothi like sabarimalai. Its must visit temple importantly for iyyappa devotees. It also had booking facility for sabarimalai

Name: Unnikrishnan_RP
Title: an excellent temple for south indians
Review: we visited the mahalingapuram ayyapan temple on 6 Fevruary 2016 evening. The temple has krishna also. the temple is typical kerala style. But you can wear pants and shirt. if you reach by 7pm you can see evening deeparadhana

Name: Lokesh M
Title: Good Peacful place.
Review: Kindly visit this place with your family, its very similar to the Ayyappa Temple in Sabari Malai. You can visit this temple in all days. (Temple is closed in Afternoon and opened again in Evenings)

Name: cool1960
Title: Bhakthi Place
Review: It is located in a calm place, but in a busy area. So it is easy to reach. The temple is so nice that you get the feeling of visiting a Kerala temple in Kerala. The temple is well maintained.

Name: vikash b
Title: Divine Temple
Review: Sree Ayyappa temple visit was very much peaces of mind and wish to spend all my time in said the temple,environment so calm in a week days.

Name: Karthik M
Title: Swamiye Saranam Ayyappa
Review: ayyappa season sees lots of irumadi functions in this temple. Otherwise is relatively less crowded and can peacefully have a darshan

Name: GoldenTraveller36
Title: Clean, spacious, calm Temple
Review: The architecture is classic. Place is maintained very clean. Very calm atmosphere (except during sabarimala season - December).Access is also quite good except during the season when there is absolute chaos and lack of consideration for the local residents

Name: nishkalav
Title: Well kept
Review: Nice place to be. Different architecture.  Quite different from the ya ya pan temple in adyar .  You can visit for a change.

Name: Begaraaj S M
Title: Absolutely Blissful !!!
Review: Peacefully pleasant Temple !!!In the midst of crowded environment we can find peace and eventually Bliss inside this wonderful temple, when we sit in silence after doing all the formalities we will be absolutely peaceful and feeling relaxed.Must visit for all age groups when we are in Chennai, Situated in Mahalingapuram and easily accessible from all parts of Chennai via City bus and MRTS, nearest station is Kodambakkam , 5 minutes Auto ride will cost you 40 - 50 INR.With heart swelling in Gratitude Thanks a lot for everything my dear beloved Iyyapa.Loving you so much,Peacefully yours,S M Bega Raaj.

Name: saagar49
Title: Powerful god
Review: This is temple is located in kodambakkam , best way to reach this place , take a auto from kodambakkam railway station  , it is just 1.0 km from there, best time to visit is morning.

Name: ulag63
Title: Saranam Ayyappa
Review: We use to visit this temple once in a year, a day before goes to Sabarimala. Lord Ayyappa and Lord Guruvayurappan is similar to Kerala type. Lot of devotees comes to this place to have a blessing of this two gods. Saranam Ayyappa.

Name: Mathivanan V
Title: Serenity amidst the busy city
Review: Kerala type temple architecture is a big plus to visit this god adobe.Best time to visit before or after sunset.Not a big place but a clean place.Centrally located and visitors who visits VALLUVAR KOTTAM OR TNAGAR SHOPPING can give a visit to this place.The same type of temples are in major parts of the chennai and much big in size comparatively

Name: Naveen K
Title: Mini Kerala in Chennai
Review: I felt that I'm in kerala upon my first visit. I visited this temple for 3 times. I wanted to keep visit this temple.

Name: Capri67
Title: Swamiye Saranam Ayyappa!
Review: For every Lord Ayyappa devotee this is a MUST visit place. Built in typical Kerala style architecture, this is a very well maintained temple with clean surroundings and truly spiritual!

Name: SURAJ K
Title: Swami Sarnam
Review: The temple is located in Mahalingapuram. Ayyappan Guruvayurappan Temple is dedicated to two Hindu deities, namely ‚Äì Sri Ayyappan and Sri Vishnu as Guruvayurappan. The temple was built more than thirty seven years ago. It was developed by Sree Ayyappa Bhaktha Sabha

Name: s_ramsam
Title: Very Interesting temple
Review: This being an Ayyappa temple is rather different from the other major temples in Chennai. Mainly attracting Keralites the place is clean, neat and well maintained. Easily accessible fro other parts of the city. Gets crowded during the special festival days.

Name: uday s
Title: excellent place
Review: I loved the place. The temple was great but i liked the beach more, lot fewer people than Besant nagar and the beach was clean. I also had the sea food which was available in the small shops around.

Name: diwa
Title: Divine Experience
Review: A divine experience awaits any one who visits the Sree Ayyappa / Guruvayurappan Temple in Mahalingapuram. The serene atmosphere, clean premises, devoted priests add to the mood. There are a number of poojas, which can be chosen by the devotees to participate. The temple opens quite early in the day. The prasadams offered by the temple, especially the Ghee Sweet Appam are tasty.

Name: keerthipai
Title: With soulful prayers
Review: i always love temples, the Mahalingapuram temple is my favorite because of the peace one gets there. even though it is centrally located in chennai, once u enter the temple there is no noise or crowds to distract u. the people who work there are also very friendly and willing to help u in all ways. i have never gone without getting prasadams, n every time it is yummy. the place reminds me of Gurvayur Krishna temple. Krishna and Swamy Ayapa diety give me all the peace in the world.the music played is also soothing.i recommend this place to all known to me.

Name: vidhusagar
Title: For Ayyappan fans
Review: A nicely built temple for Lord Ayyappa. It is in Mahalingapuram and pretty central to all locations in the city. Convenient for people going to Sabarimala to perform their poojas here.

Name: meghashyam
Title: Sri Guruvayurappan Temple .
Review: a well known temple for Sri Guruvayurappan and Sri Ayappa Swami in Mahalingapuram , Sri Guruvayurappan with his golden thilakam is a sight to behold , ganapathi homam is done on a daily basis bookings upto a day in advance is accepted . Almost all neivedyams available at Guruvayur is available here too . The fresco work of Sri Anatha Padmanabhaswamy behind Sri Guruvayurappan Shrine is amazing . The metallic moolavar idol of Sri Ayappan is breath taking . A must visit for any chennaite .

Name: mkmurali
Title: swamiye saranam
Review: This ayyappa temple situated near kodambakkam.Formerly there is only a temple of lord ayyappa..Before few years they also built a temple for lord guruvayoorappa,,,So many people from chennai and surroundings visits this temple,,,

Name: ramayana2013
Title: saranam iyappa
Review: This one of the old temple at chennai. The main deity is aiyappan who attracts large crowds.There are sannadhis for guruvayurappan, hayagirivar, anjaneyar, vlnayagar. Marriages are conducted here. They have a kalyana mandapam nearby. During november huge crowds come and have darsan. The temple is near kodampakkam overbridge.

Name: Prabhu Ganesan
Title: Enchanting Experiance
Review: very serene temple. Its a must visit if you are in the area. The evening song kacheri on special months are a sight to watch. The evening alangaram of visnu and ayappa are a sight to behold.

Name: VRAMESH
Title: First Sree Ayyappa Temple in the city
Review: The Mahalingapuram Ayyappan temple was the first Ayyappan temple in city. You can worship both Ayyappa and  Guruvayur√°ppan temple here. It is yet another Best Hindu temple in the city.

Name: Rubybala
Title: The Lord of the Sabari Hills
Review: Bhakthi comes with how the temple is maintained. This Ayyappa temple is well maintained and has now become a great attraction in Chennai. The pooja arrangements are good. Looking for prasad? Just buy them. There is limited parking facility in front of the temple. So, if you are planning to go in groups then plan accordingly. The sanctity of Kerala temples is visible and probably you can even meet your Keralite friends here.

Name: vprashaanthi
Title: GODS ABODE
Review: Visited this temple in Jan 2015 for an early morning darshan. Temple is very neatly maintained. Spirituality is in the air

Name: SujeshKP
Title: Kerala temple in Chennai
Review: It is the closest that you can get to a Kerala Temple experience in Chennai.  Finding a place to park your car is a nightmare, so it is adviced to take a cab or an auto to reach there as it sets you to a peaceful connect when you are inside the temple , just not worrying about the car and the small place where u would have parked it.

Name: DeeptiIngle
Title: Serene and Peaceful
Review: The Ayyappa temple is really fascinating. It is located in a peaceful residential locality. The temple is not as big as the Kapaleshwar temple, but pretty huge for normal temples. Parking is generally not an issue. I travelled on a Sunday morning, around 1030 am and was easily able to find parking in one of the nearby by lanes. There are two approach roads: one is tiny single lane road (Not advisable at all ) and other one is through the residential colony. Right opposite the temple is a lady who takes care of your footwear at a meagre cost of Rs. 5. You feel at peace, the moment you enter the temple. It is a beautiful sight to the eyes as well. The contrast of black stone and golden temple top is very pleasing and adds a different dimension altogether. Like many Kerela temples, there is a vessel filled with red and black beads, for the kids to play with (It‚Äôs a good omen). The temple is clean like most Ayyappan temples. I would surely recommend atleast one visit to this temple if you are even slightly religious.

Name: snapshot2014
Title: Mahalingapuram iyyappan temple
Review: Morning time to visit for peaceful darshan.better to give ananda am Nd lit lamps.vinayKar mudguard Anjanette Krishna guruvayurrpar magadevi navagrahastotram are worth worshiping.very neat and silent place.

Name: PremPandurangam
Title: A nice temple
Review: A nice temple in the middle of the city but tucked in amidst the bustle of Kodambakkam. The temple is clean and very well maintained. The setting is peaceful but weddings and Ayyappa Poojas can lead to more noise.

Name: Vimprash
Title: Very nice place
Review: Excellent place, well maintained temple in heart of the city. Just few hundred meters from North usman road to Nungambakkam fly over.

Name: saagar49
Title: Powerful God
Review: If you are a religious person , i will advice you to visit this temple, it is located near kodambakkam railway station , take a auto from there charges will be 40 rs , They follow traditional kerala  culture,

Name: Nskrish
Title: must visit
Review: This is a must visit temple if you are an Ayyappa devotee visiting Chennai. Nice, beautiful and clean temple. Parking not available and you will have to park in the roads around.

Name: Vijay
Title: Best Aiyappan Temple in Chennai
Review: One of the best temples in Chennai following the kerala style, Aiyyappan & Guruvayurappan are the main deities, During the

Name: ravikumartalara
Title: One of the best ayyampa temple in chenna
Review: It is replica of Kerala ayyappa temple...sabari mala  mala people will start journey from here.. temple is very clean and green

Name: jbalaji
Title: Dont miss the Panchavadhya at 6:30 pm
Review: Last month I had a music programme at this Ayyappan Temple and I was pleasantly surprised by its cleanliness and excellent puja performed by the chief there. at around 6:30 there was a panchavadhya chenda performed by the temple musicians and its one of the rarest kind you can listen in Chennai. don't miss it.

Name: Jothilingam E
Title: Must visit
Review: Situated in the heart of chennai near Famous Loyola college & T.Nagar.Must visit atleast once and offer prayer.Even though we are from Chennai,we visited off late only,since we could not make in time due to tight leave schedules.But make it positive and visit to feel the happiness

Name: PriyaV1
Title: Lovely temple
Review: Such a lovely temple. The premises is clean and the setting is divine. The prasadam is yummy. The pot with the "manjaadi" seeds is always a fav for me.

Name: Subramanian K
Title: Beautiful Ayyappa temple in Chennai
Review: The Mahallngapuram Sri. Ayyappan temple was the first Ayyappan temple in city, following the Ayyappan philosophy of universal love and brotherhood conceived with the hope that it would be an ideal place of worship for devotees.In 1972, the construction of the main temple in black granite was started and  The Prathista and Kumbhabhishekam of the temple was performed on March 1974 by the Sabarimala Priest, Sankararu Kantaru Thantri with tradition. During the prathishta at the Sree Kovll of Lord Ayyappa to the astonishment Garuda was seen circling three times over the temple. A temple for Sree Guruvayur√°ppan was built there and subsequently temples for the Navagrahams, Anjaneya, Garuda, Nagaraja and Nagayakshi were also constructed.

Name: rasa006
Title: This Ayyappa Temple is for those who can not visit Sabarimala, good environment
Review: This temple is located few kms away from my residence and I visite this temple from the time it was bulit during 1970s. BUt at that time, it was a non-descriptive place. But now, it has become a landmark in our neighbourhood Mahalingapuram.During evening time, special poojas are performed for Lord Ayyappan and also for Lord Krishnan-Guruvayurappan. A must attend poojas for any religious devote devotees. Wonderful deeparadhanai performed here during this evening poojas.Then we have Lord Murugan with Valli and Devanai, Sarwathi and Lord Ganesh sannidhi. Whenever wethink of  Ayyapan Temple, we visit here and similarly, we visited this temple during this May 2015 and had full darshan and received prasadams in leaf, unique way of giving prasadams in Kerala style. I witnessed this style during my recent Kerala visit, in almost all temples I visited. Special Pushpanjali pooja can be done here, with advance booking, for rates, etc please visit their URL.

Name: Gajarajan1947
Title: A great temple with typical Kerala style and structure
Review: This a very great temple, very well maintained. It is of typical kerala type structure and even the procedures followed are as is being done in kerala temples. You will get a nice feelings and vibration when you are inside the temple. Even though it is in the heart of the city( if you come down through the flyover from Usman road T.Nagar to loyola College, on the street to the left and the location is a quiet place surrounded by posh Bungalows.

Name: Shiva S
Title: Famous ayyappan temple in chennai
Review: Excellent maintenance, clean surroundings. Best place to pray and see ayyappan. They even perform all kind of poojas same as sabari mala. People use this temple to put mala and pray god. Most of the Indian's use this temple as starting point to reach Sabari mala kerala. Parking is not a problem. The trust is maintaining place for eating food. It is located in Nungambakkam and most of the place in chennai has transportation to this place (bus, train).

Name: Sridhar R
Title: The most well maintained temple in Chennai.
Review: It is one of the finest temples you will get to see in a Metropolitan city. They have maintained sanctum of this temple for many many years through dedication and hard work. Very few temples start with Ganapathy Homa  every day before sunrise and this temple has that distinction in chennai. The melshanthi Mr.Krishnan Nambhoodiri and other Nambhoodiris perform the pooja's with utmost dedication which is why the devotees throng to the temple all through the year with devotion. There is peace, discipline and rich culture attached to this temple.  A must visit place for Hindus in chennai.

Name: Begaraaj S M
Title: Loving you so much My Beloved Saranam Iyyapa ...
Review: With heart swelling in reverential gratitude , Thanks a lot for everything ...Loving you so much ...Absolutely blissful temple , by just entering into the temple we can feel the positive vibrations over there , Very neat and clean temple , Hats off to the maintenance team ...When we sit in silence after completing all our prayers we will be very peaceful ...Easily accessible form all parts of Chennai , located very close to kodambakkam over bridge ...Must visit for all age groups .Peacefully yours.S M Bega Raaj.

Name: Richard G
Title: long time ago but India ia always facinating
Review: A wonderful Country and I have been from North and South and East and West. Food is good and People are very friendly. Contrast between say Chenai and Delhi makes it even more worthwhile. I also have been to Leh and to Mumbai.

Name: Ravikesh P- Fiji
Title: Good shopping experience
Review: It was very ideally located as we stayed at the Grand Chennai by GRT. As the place is well known for its shopping it was a great experience as the whole street, Sir Thayagarya Road, T Nagar is full of shops.  Apart from main streets, there are smaller streets that also has shops. As it is a famous place for shopping, shop owners take full advantage and things are very expensive. Prices are same or more expensive than the shopping malls like express mall. Communication can be a problem as salespeople do not speak fluent english. Hindi too can be a problem.  Another drawback is the constant negging by the street dwellers who are either begging or selling things which they insist you to buy. Not many clean eateries except for some big restaurants like A2B and Balaji. KFC is also available.

Name: Hooray H
Title: Cleanest shopping street in India
Review: Lots of shops, well organised & busy.We went into an amazing shop full of stainless steel products of mediocre quality but very inexpensive.Fun

Name: TravelTime
Title: Lot of shops
Review: There are lot of shops to choose from with varied prices, you can get items starting from 5 rupees. Pondy bazaar is in TNagar, it is a huge street. Parking is little difficult to get during weekends especially for cars, but well organized parking throughout the area. There are lot of items to choose from based on your budget, this is heaven for girls for sure......

Name: PitoyAmpil1941
Title: Phoenix Mall at Velachery Main road
Review: the place was big, huge n large.... n very expensive..... with a 65 US dollar standard room price at Design Hotel...... one has to enter the hotel from the mall entrance....

Name: KARTHIKb87
Title: Chennai busiest Market area
Review: Pondy bazaar is chennai's one of busiest Market area since long time. Its had busiest road and lot of shops to purchase. Recently Govt made Pedestrain plaza in Pondy bazaar as part of smart city project with wider foot paths , automated parking, lot of fountains, decorated trees etc.,

Name: discerning24
Title: Amazing shopping strip
Review: We enjoyed the bargains, the ambience and the range of 'name' shops and local bazaars. The street has been made pedestrian friendly, a rarlty in this city of aggressive motorists. It is quiet with trees lining it and places to sit. Thoroughly recommended for your visit to Chennai.

Name: SAAGOBAA
Title: SAREE SARI SAREE
Review: If you want best saree with best quality and great look with budget cost then this is place to explore it and buy. they have from A to Z types of sarees available .

Name: #amosamiyanayeküéß
Title: üéÅüõçÔ∏è
Review: the newly renovated and one of the most shopping destination and busiest hub... not even only shopping including food and WiFi accessable around the street ... the best for relaxation and hangout with kids and friends

Name: tsk0101
Title: A must visit place in Chennai
Review: It is one of the busiest places in Chennai with a lot of shopping centres and shops for almost anything you want.

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: For Anything And Everything - Pondi Bazar
Review: Pondibazar is one of the best places in Chennai for shopping. The flee market is very reasonable. One more thing that is good about this place is its not too conjusted like T Nagar. That's why I prefer Pondi Bazar T Nagar. You have everything available here from fro. You flowers, footwear, clothes, toys and what not. Everything is available here.

Name: FaisalShb
Title: A happening place
Review: Quite busy but lots of options for local shopping. Seems like a popular place among the locals and some tourists.

Name: plantablok
Title: Shopping
Review: Very busy street but convenient and easily accessible from the hotel GRT Grand. Very exciting to walk through and department stores , local shops and restaurants offer excellent choices. This is a must for tourist visitig Tamil Nadu

Name: KathiraveluG
Title: Shopping
Review: One of the famous street for shopping. Convenience store to clothing to departmental stores to restaurants. Pleasant to walk along for window shopping as well.

Name: buddy_2564
Title: Lots of shopping option
Review: Very close T Nagar so if you are planning for shopping, it might take you all day as I found out. Lots of choices but do haggle as it is a must in some place.

Name: Deadman17
Title: Main market place
Review: This is one of the busiest shopping places in the whole of Chennai. One can buy good quality stuff, at good rates, especially if you are looking to buy in bulk. The area is usually crowded and one should go in the afternoon to avoid the rush.

Name: flying_girl_iya
Title: Shooping TOP
Review: You got a lot of little merchant at affordable prices you can deal with them a bit and you will pay less :)

Name: kamalakaran
Title: shopping place
Review: good to buy things like kithenware. i bought electric chappati maker.can buy ever silver things too.i bought preethi grinder there.

Name: balkivinod
Title: Heart of Chennai
Review: The location is famous for shopping.  You can find sarees and jewellery shop at pangal park. And dress material shops at pondy bazar are famous like naidu hall, flora etc.However the location is crowded in the evening and during festival timw. The traffic can be regulated, but still congested and need to think about parking before visiting as sometimes you need to walk

Name: Meezanur R
Title: Shop at chennai with tourist feel
Review: It‚Äôs a nice market place where you find some good brands and some local brands in clothing, toys, and home appliances. Enjoy shopping

Name: Wanderer
Title: Chennai high profile shopping district
Review: Pondy Bazaar is renowned as a shoppers paradise. Almost all brands of apparels  are available in the high street. Unbranded accessories stuff also available at Pondy Bazaar foot path merchant complex. Even garlands of lovely flowers are readily available for adorning couples to be married, and also for decorating our gods. It also has a number of large variety of jewelery shops for you to choose from.

Name: Zinia F
Title: Street market gem
Review: I go there for the jewelleries! Not the best finish though as one of my earrings broke off right after buying it and by then I already had come home so couldn't do the change, but overall the designs are great and the price is really cheap with the right bargain skills!

Name: Narendran J
Title: Nice to experience the atmosphere
Review: I will recommend to visit this place if you are looking for cheap and bargain goods. Many of the shops in this area offer beautiful Indian traditional clothes, right from kurti tops for ladies to children clothes but do not expect high quality stuff as this place caters more to the locals who are looking to buy knock-offs.

Name: Tina
Title: large variety
Review: Here you have such a big variety of products that you are hardly able to know what to take, and from whom! the prices are very good and competitive!

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Shopping hub of the city
Review: The place is another ancient locality of the city which is now the shopping hub of the chennaites.the places is so crowded and connected with the huge traffic that makes the shopping a hectic task around.

Name: Shaji Joseph
Title: place of shopping
Review: This is a place good for shopping. The most of the main famous are located to this place, you can also enjoy including the street purchase too.  A guest will get every thing over here but it is a crowded place. All main shops have there own parking place, also corportion is also maintaining some parking space on paid bass

Name: Narasimhan G
Title: Gold by History !!
Review: This connects T Nagar chennai to Anna salai chennaithe cinema theatres  were long demolishedBig bazaar is doin goodGarlands are reasonably priced .more choices are available

Name: Val A
Title: GREAT SHOPPING
Review: This area is really good for best quality shopping with reasonable prices.  There are a good few malls in the area as well. Eating outlets plentiful. Great value for money and lots of good choices of shops and food varieties

Name: Debasmitaghosh
Title: Shop to your heart's content
Review: Recently went to Chennai with my husband after 10 years. We had started our married life in Chennai 10 years ago so there was a lot of nostalgia attached to this trip. Hubby had work so I stepped out solo for a walk down Pondy Bazaar, one of my favourite places to shop in Chennai. It was around 12 in the afternoon, the February sun was pleasant, and I instantly felt at home under the canopy of trees that Pondy Bazaar is known for. I started off by buying a gajra for myself for 20 bucks from a street-side shop selling flowers and garlands. Got into the Chennai feel once I put the gajra on my hair. Walked a bit and stopped by this shop called Choices selling cut pieces for garments. The collection was huge, and an array of colours mesmerised me. I bought a few blouse pieces to gift my mother and mom-in-law. The prices were pretty reasonable, and I was in fact amazed that I got such a good deal. I came out of the shop happy and started walking again. There were shops lined up selling every pretty thing from copper-goldplated jewellery starting from Rs 800 to kurtas and bags priced Rs 200 onwards. I'm between there were small joints selling corn and coconut pudding. I stopped by one Amma selling fresh coconut water. At Rs 40 it was worth the price. The water was sweet and I felt satiated after a long walk in the sun. My next stop was Rathna Stores that sells everything, right from utensils to furniture. One tends to get lost inside this shop, the variety is so much. I felt excited walking in here after 10 years! Bought a few steel bowls and a couple of copper-bottom steel saucepans. Felt like buying the entire shop though. If you happen to come to Chennai, a visit to Pondy Bazaar, and most importantly Rathna Stores is a must! I walked down the entire street till I felt totally happy and done. Pondy Bazaar gives you that typical Chennai vibe, and it's always pleasant to come back here.

Name: Jennifer J
Title: A must visit shopping destination for all coming over to Chennai & those living here.
Review: This is the place where everyone can find something, they have been looking for or wanting to buy since long. Shopping is incomplete without a visit to Pondy Bazaar be it any time of the year. Kanchi plaza, Ratna Stores, Instore, are my favorites.

Name: Sundaram R
Title: recent visit to pondy bazaar
Review: the last months year end purchase experience in this popular location was really good and value based purse friendly.shops are for middle class who can enjoy and satisty their bargaining craving..a place not to be missed for casual and serious shopping

Name: Mark_Bay_64
Title: Not impressed, waist of time
Review: We went to Pondy Bazar with lots of enthusiasm only to find a the pavements more like an obstacle course. We struggled to enjoy or look at the shops for fear of falling into a hole or twisting our ankles. At the end of the road we could see the new pavements being laid which should look lovely when completed but till then be careful going there

Name: Anusuya D
Title: Place for shopping
Review: Highly crowded shopping area near t nagar. We can enjoy more snacks and bites, chats. So many big shopping shops and also small shops for bargaining is also available.

Name: TrailBlazer581787
Title: busy but worth a visit
Review: busy street but worth a visit. A bit crowded and for shopping you'll mainly find basic stuff. There's renovation work under way and the pavement is in part difficult to walk. For a chai or quick bite, use one of the side streets and not main street

Name: 1Jayanthi
Title: Fabulous shopping experience
Review: All the shopping biggies like Pothys, saravana stores, rathna stores etc are looked in this area. All food chains like murugan idli kadai, ponnusawmy etc are also located here. enjoyable shopping

Name: manoj k
Title: Best place to buy clothes
Review: Pondy Bazaar is best place to buy clothes of local brand. If you want to linen shirts you can buy from shop here. Cotton trouser and shirt can also be purchased here at very low price. Overall a good place for shopping clothes.

Name: Darshank
Title: Cheap shopping
Review: At pondy bazzar one can do shopping with lower price. Eating street foods while shopping i one of the best experience one can get here

Name: Ashish S
Title: Amazing place
Review: The place is amazing. Me and my friends enjoyed being there. Place was neat and clean and very well connected.

Name: edwinMalaysia
Title: A shoppers paradise
Review: Shopping in T Nagar must not be missed when in Chennai. Everything you want is available at this bazzar

Name: shivaraikod
Title: The local market
Review: Like every city has its own local market like Delhi has sarojini and Mumbai has one in lower parel this city has got pondy street market.

Name: MalcolmNicholas
Title: Shop till you Drop
Review: A carnival atmosphere each evening. The Shops are well stocked with a range of items and selection made so easy in the manner the goods are displayed. A fun-filled and enjoyable Shopping Experience.... with great bargains available.

Name: Swami1939
Title: ANY THINK YOU GET
Review: The Pondy Bazaar on Thyagaraya Road is a place where you can enjoy your shopping whatever may it be. Right from dresses, jewelry, household items, flowers, eateries,fancy items all are available in Bondy Bazaar.

Name: Reshma R
Title: Good place for shopping in Chennai
Review: You will get almost everything in pondy bazar. The green building near to bigbazar(there is a small restauarant in between) contains all cheap items but subject to bargaining. Many other shops are there on both sides of the road

Name: Traveloney
Title: All in one place
Review: You get everything you need in this street. The roadside shops have great collections of jewellery which comes in a good price upon bargain.

Name: worldwomantourist
Title: Road side shopping
Review: This is a best place for road side shopping. Variety of items are available here like footwears, dresses, fancy items and many more fashion products.

Name: Anusree P
Title: Budget shopping
Review: Like other streets in T nagar, this  is a shoppers area. you can buy items in cheap rate. But the quality wont be that great

Name: ZahiraAmeen
Title: Fun Street shopping
Review: Pondy bazaar has been revamped .. still its a shopper's paradise. Stand alone buildings carry both designer and budget items. Only problem is there are not enough eateries on this strip

Name: Siddhartha
Title: " A Must Visit for Budget Shopping"
Review: A Must visit for budget shopping  , has all the top retail clothing showroom's and one of the oldest utensil shop in Chennai. Has car parking , and access to the near by Natesan and Panagal Park  and the clothing chains and restaurant's.Also has one of the oldest hair dressing saloon's and pharmacy in this part of Chennai.A Must visit.

Name: vasan224
Title: one place for all things
Review: Pondy Bazaar, officially called Soundarapandian Angadi, is a market located in T. Nagar, Chennai. It is one of the principal shopping districts of Chennai.

Name: NickBaxendale
Title: Interesting
Review: Very busy interesting area with many shops selling different items. They also had street vendors in front of theshops selling fruit, costume jewellery etc. One of the older areas of Chennai (Madras) which I liked.

Name: Ghiri T
Title: A Busy Shopping Place
Review: Pondy bazaar is an old famous area for shopping which is near T.Nagar. This place is crowded all time and it is one of the busy place in Chennai.Here one can find all type of products and it is one of the good place for shopping.

Name: sridharan2013
Title: Central place for shoppers
Review: Pondy bazar is one of the old shopping areas of Chennai. A very busy street separates shops on either side of the road. Small stand alone shops to huge branded outlets can be found here in addition to eateries of all types. Shopping arcades are also available for those who prefer all shopping under single roof. This place is very close to leading textiles and jewellery outlets of T Nagar.

Name: reddi_traveller
Title: Pondy Bazaar
Review: Pondy Bazaar is famous for all the shopping only. it is near to TNagar area almost 600 meters from the main road. great place for offers and best dresses and antiques.

Name: krish509
Title: Long Street of Shopping!
Review: Very long street for shopping! Ideal for girls shopping. We entered Aurelia shop and the seller was very kind to adjust all dresses purchased by my gf within 30 minutes and free of charge.

Name: 1Jayanthi
Title: Must visit place in Chennai
Review: The shopping fistrict of cHennai is this place. Renganathan street and all famous shops like Saravana stores, Potheys, rathna stores, all are located here. All the famous restaurant chains like Saravana bhavan, A2B, Murugan idli kadai, Anjappar etc have outlets here.

Name: MariahManuel
Title: Great Shopping Location
Review: Great location that offers everything you could possibly be looking for from clothes to jewelry to antiques and even home appliances. There are money changers in the area with good rates. Famous saree shop Nalli's is walking distance. Pondy Bazaar is a must for all those looking to shop

Name: Jerod M
Title: Shopping choices.
Review: A nice selection of artisans and items for the tourist.  It was not crowed and we were able to browse. Vendors were friendly.

Name: JumboMumbai
Title: Get it all here
Review: We went to buy some fans and electricals for our new house.. had passed through the area when we moved into the city. but was pleasantly surprised by the variety of shops in the bazaar close to each other. Rathna Fan House is where our fist stop was and then we went to saravana Stores and that solved our needs totally.. fantastic experience.. also had a meal at Balaji and that was so good after a tiring shopping..

Name: Dr Javed Rasheed
Title: A Significant Shopping Destination
Review: Pondy Bazaar in T Nagar in Chennai is a very renowned place for shopping for clothes, Sarees, Utensils, As that‚Äôs the place where you get what you are looking for, the area is crowded with vendors, pavement encroachment by sellers who sell most of the cheap goods like purses, footwear, clothes, fruits and one can find beggars in plenty pestering the shoppers as they have the knack of identifying the locals and those who are from different national and international destinations especially the foreigners. One needs to be careful of pickpockets as some of them keep prowling there for an easy prey but on the brighter side shopping there can be a satisfying experience for those who go there to get what they want.Dr.Javed Rasheed

Name: psp
Title: more options
Review: one of my favorite place for shopping in chennai... u can get everything like dresses, curtains, fancy items, books, tops, bags etc at a very reasonable rate in road side shops... u have to bargain...full road was occupied by these shops on both the sides... i heard that now those shops were fully relocated to a particular complex in pondy bazaar itself...

Name: GLOBALSEAS
Title: shopping street
Review: shopping street we find every thing in this one street pondy bazaar , all nice restaurants , cheap shopping available on road side as well as in shops ..

Name: Dilshan M
Title: Evening shopping
Review: Most convenient time to shopping in this Street is in the evening. Shops are open from 10 am to 10 pm. There are every kind of shops all the way of the street. Little bit crowded

Name: Sandra NK
Title: Shopping  street.
Review: I love this place nice shopping street you can find almost every here. From dresses to food. Street good is amazing. Enjoyed a lovely madras coffee as well.

Name: spicyyy27
Title: What more could one ask for
Review: Loved the walks close to the Bazaar istelf.People around and in the area very friendly...lots of bargains and you need to have enough time to walk around and really see what you looking for.Lovely the deity jewellery stores around the area

Name: Rajasekhar M
Title: Walk in the evening
Review: Good place where you can shop for any thing and every thing. Ground the stores to gut the local and imported

Name: shrinikethv
Title: A-Z for cheap shopping
Review: Shopping zone in T Nagar. You name a product and you get it here in Pondy Bazar. The ambience isn't great and luxurious, but if you are good at bargaining, you can get very good products at very less rate here.

Name: krish862
Title: Very good place for shopping
Review: Without visiting pondy bazaar , one can't complete the Chennai sight seeing by out station people.It is one of the oldest and must visit street in t nagar, Oldest shops and famous is the family store by Naidu hall and nagesh theatre which converted into KALYANA MANDAPM and to the recently added Kalyan jewelry, apart from the oldest natesan park were some of the highlights of pondy bazaar.

Name: Punch-77
Title: Still maintains traditional values
Review: One of the few shopping zones in T.Nagar, which has not been subjected to high rise shopping malls and overcrowded parking centers.

Name: 674santha
Title: busy bazar
Review: very crowded always, all seasons all occasions. numerous shops wherein one can buy what all they want from cheap to high price depending upon their quality. famous shopping centre for bags utensils garments very colourful to go around just to kill the time for window shopping too.

Name: Balasubramanian R
Title: Chennai Pondy Bazaar
Review: Pondy Bazaar is one of the busiest area in Thyagarayanagar heart of chennai city. Hotels, Electical, Textile, vessel and other shops are there and rich people prefer to buy from these places.  Now road side hawkers/small shops are removed and the road is broad. Car parking facilities are available.

Name: vijmail99
Title: Enjoyed the shopping
Review: Worth the money for the shopping. Bit crowded but the traffic is well organized by the traffic police. The road side shops allows you to get things for the best deal.

Name: Lilian J
Title: Shopping spree
Review: So many things that you can buy. Bargain at roadside shops and grab good food, ice creams...fruits etc. Good shopping place for clothes, footwear etc.

Name: Mohamed F
Title: Nice
Review: I can buy all thing in one place what I need very crowd place be care full for your personal thing may be

Name: iftekhar ansari
Title: Good local market for shopping
Review: The market is good place for shopping, we can find from grocery to life style product in this market. specially i enjoy the tea in the local stall available in whole market.

Name: Kothandaraman P
Title: all for all
Review: we can purchase whatever we want at reasonable prices in small shops.we can bargain.we can select from clusters.best entertaining place to be visited with kids and family,for homely purchases.

Name: Aravindh R
Title: A nice place to do shopping all day!!
Review: Pondy Bazar is one of the busiest roads in chennai which is famous for shopping anything from pin to pistol.  You can find lots of branded outlets and also roadside shops where you can buy t shirt, ladies fancy items, flowers etc. There's nothing that you don't get here. This road is more famous for buying dress materials and readymades.

Name: s_ramsam
Title: Major shopping area
Review: Pndy Bazar is well known as on rhe major shopping areas of Chennai. Adjacent to T Nagar, the Panagal Park is also nearby. Parking space available in the park area. Very crowded locality only visit if shopping for something.

Name: twinkle906
Title: Get anything and everything ... from A To Z
Review: This is one of the oldest shopping areas of Chennai... Centrally located at T Nagar...Right from Flowers, garlands to Curtains.... everything available... Bargain and get the best price. Previously just 3 to 4 years back, the vendors were selling goods and articles on the platform pavements... Now the corporation had constructed a separate building wherein vendors have their shops... Organized one...On account of this, pedestrians can walk freely on the pavement and visit different shops...Adjustant and opposite to Pondy Bazaar, so many good hotels/ big shopping malls/textile shops etc are located...Unique place to visit for our shopping....

Name: Suresh B
Title: An Unique Place to Shop all Types of Goods With Cheaper Rates
Review: This is the Place always have Crowded. An Unique Place to Shop all Types of Goods With Cheaper Rates.

Name: Anusuya D
Title: crowded shopping area
Review: a very crowdy shopping area at t nagar. it is hub place of chennai for shopping with a lots of small shops. you can bargain at some shops. we can get cheaper to costlier product here.

Name: KRAMA200
Title: A Good Shopping Area
Review: This is one of the popular Shopping Areas of Chennai where you can get Jewellery ( Gold)  and Silk Sarees. The place has been spruced uip recently and is clean and devoid of Hawkers. Hawkers have moved away . But still patronized as it is difficult to buy ware they sell at their price,Certainly go for it. The shops here sell everything you need andin some shops bargaining is called for.We went for shopping on a Saturday afternoon and it was crowded. Go On week days and in the mornings as you will have time to choose and bargain.

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: crowded on weekends
Review: Since cost is less on many items it becomes crowded on weekends and bargaining is required at some of the hawkers and local language needs to be known for this for better deals

Name: samadhanamhopek
Title: TAMIL NADU MART 2017
Review: Fascinating street with a lot of small shops - you can get just about everything you looking for in this bazaarfriendly vendors, reasonable prices , you can bargain . variety of goods are sold here. Interesting visit.

Name: vijaycs11
Title: Ideal place for diwali shopping
Review: The variety in pondy bazaar is unmatched and I love to go this place for Diwali shopping. Had good choices and very happy at the end of the day. Recommended to go early morning by 9am to finish shopping by afternoon before the crowd arrives

Name: YatriForever
Title: Unless you have a reason to go here...
Review: This is definitely not a tourist attraction for the first time visitors to Chennai. This is just a market street with  hundreds of shops either side of the road teeming with thousands of people, almost all day. You don't go here unless you are looking for someone or something or some reason to be here. Not a must see attraction of Chennai.

Name: GrannyMaa
Title: Paradise for Shoppers
Review: Pondy Bazar is important locality in T.Nagar, famous for Shopping - Jewellery, Silk Sarees, Textiles, Gold, Ornaments and much more. During festival season, you will find so much crowd here and people are going shopping crazy.

Name: Dhanasekaran B
Title: shopping
Review: now this bazar is clean and tidy. pray the pavenent hawkers donot return back. can get anything if you have money here . you can bargain in some shops. moderate cost

Name: RoomA_Vanessa
Title: Discount friendly area
Review: Good shopping on the streets under the bridge. Though I must say most  sellers do not know English ..

Name: mahithaprasad19
Title: Once upon a time shopping experience
Review: Although the place is still good for a local shopping experience, used to be even better about 3 years back! Sad to see all the street shop vendors shifted to a complex now. Do not miss the tiffin at Balaji Bhavan for a mid shopping snack.

Name: Rucha121
Title: Crowded Shopping Market
Review: Ponday Bazar T.Nagar is the hub of shopping in Chennai.. from big a/c showrooms to street side hawkers, from pin to plane.. well not exactly.. you can get everything here.. bargaining is must. carry water.

Name: murthi
Title: The mecca of shopping!
Review: One will be spoilt for choice at the profusion of establishments that offer everything from diapers to diamonds, catering to the needs of all types of shoppers.Be prepared for massive crowds that can be overwhelming at times, especially during festive seasons.

Name: Arun
Title: Important place in T Nagar
Review: This place is a complete stretch of shops from low range to high range. You can find roadside shops where you can bargain and get products at a cheaper rate and there are many showrooms and big shops with branded products as well.

Name: Ra_Radha
Title: Shopping paradise
Review: T.Nagar - Pondy Bazar is shopper's paradise.. so many shops, showrooms, street-side hawkers selling variety of items from pin to gold jewellery to electronic item, sarees & textile showrooms and big multinational brands..

Name: Joji J
Title: "area where shopping can be done at cheap rates"
Review: Most people who visit Chennai visit Pondy Bazaar in T Nagar for purchasing.Cloth, Electronic items, curios, leather goods, momentos are comparatively very cheap and those who bargain will get items for very cheap rates. The area has many food outlets and Pondy Bazaar is the apt place for those who are in the look out for having variety of dishes. Fresh flowers, garlands etc for various occasions are also availible here. The area will be flooded with local and foreign tourists till mid night. One thing which we have to be careful is about replicas which is difficult to identify and once we purchase it is difficult to exchange.

Name: Praveen S
Title: one place for everything
Review: Pondy bazaar is in T Nagar, which has all level of items from kids to older ages with low budget price

Name: krishna p
Title: Good shopping spot
Review: This is good shopping spot in the city with all kinds of good in cheap and best price rates and need to grade our self the best quality and buy the products and all the variety of good available  in this T nagar which is adjacent to this pondy bazar

Name: B R S
Title: Shopper's Delight
Review: It's one of Chennai's Shopping Districts where Garments & Textiles, White Goods & Electronics, Mobile Phones. Footwear. Pots & Pans, Jewellery, Food Stuff & Home Needs, Flowers & Garlands  are available within an area of 3 Sq.km. There are several restaurants and eateries serving food to every taste. Tourists and Shoppers throng the pace from about 10.00am to Mid-night.

Name: Karthik V
Title: Pondy Bazaar
Review: Always the best for shopping, This pondy Bazaar as I mentioned before has all stores seeing all kinds of wares to dresses to just about anything. This time it was for dress. There is one shop Lal and co on this pondy bazaar road where they sell lovely dresses and my wife picked by a couple of sets of clothes . Price was nominal far better than the showrooms and the quality was at its best. Service was good. too.

Name: selvambikaiyali
Title: pondy bazar
Review: area where you will get all the items with nominal rates and will enjoy the snacks of different items

Name: Ponniveerappan
Title: Shopping Area
Review: We can find things like clothings , bangles , earings and all kind of jewelries . Price can reduce there. Too crowd.

Name: Tigerlove50
Title: A special place.
Review: We visited this spot with our guide it was tucked away in busy Chennai. It was where St Thomas hid in the cave.  The gardens showed the stations of the cross but they had a very new meditation area with a magnificent modern depiction of Christ which I found very beautiful the light was perfect in there. They also were placing some lovely mosaics into the windows.They have a toilet there but I was shown to the special seated toilet in the main hall.

Name: _ritamanning66
Title: unexpected shrine
Review: surprising visit underground to the shrine where St Thomas hid, a cave with tunnels which he used to escape. Photos are allowed but lighting is dim. can be slippy so take care

Name: BangaloreTravellernb
Title: Serene & Holistic Place for Faith
Review: Location was excellent, the ambience was holistic, wish visitors there were more sensitive as this was a holy place rather than a picnic spotIdeal place to let your thoughts flow towards a spiritual wellbeing

Name: #amosamiyanayeküéß
Title: ‚õ™
Review: blessed place to be in with family ... it's one of the most oldest holy place.. even some attractive things you can't imaging to believed

Name: Nelsonjohn P
Title: Adorable
Review: Top of mountain good place nice and clean very holy place. There is a passage which goes down where st Thomas used to pray there is also on other side is the chapel where relics of crucified cross of Jesus are kept

Name: Michael Anbumani
Title: Biblical & Historical
Review: This Little Mount Shrine is most popular with foreign tourists as well as visitors from other states of India. Many centuries old, biblical, historical and a heritage property. A must visit place for all.

Name: Thomas J
Title: little Cave but great to see
Review: Thank you God for your ways to send Thomas here. It was great to walk where he walked even 2000 years later

Name: Shaji Joseph
Title: Very old church
Review: This is a most impotent place to visit. During evening you can see most of the city covered with light including the international air port. It is an amazing seen .

Name: Siu_12
Title: History is fascinating
Review: It was very interesting to read that one of Jesus's twelve apostles had ever set foot in India and settled in Chennai, Tamil Nadu, and encounted hostility against his preaching. A small chapel built there in 1551AD is still remained.

Name: vasan224
Title: famous historical place
Review: It is believed that St Thomas who was one of the twelve Apostles of Jesus and mortally wounded took refuge here. The place is best suited for pilgrim groups as the shrine has a lot of religious importance.The underground basalt cave has a perennial spring coming out of the rocks.

Name: Anusree P
Title: Sacred place
Review: A very sacred place. Church. It is like a small cave in the banks of adayar river, If you are a chiristian you will like this place

Name: fabwrite
Title: A must-visit on the St. Thomas Trail
Review: A tiny cave here - now called the St. Thomas Cave - is believed to be the place where St. Thomas lived and preached. The cave has a small opening which once led to a tunnel through which the apostle is believed to have escaped his assailants. It's so dark and cool in here even when it's blazing hot outside.Do have a look at the palm print near the tunnel‚Äôs entrance and the footprint on the hillock - believed to be those of St. Thomas. The freshwater spring nearby is supposed to have appeared miraculously to quench the thirst of his followers.

Name: Josephsamuelot
Title: Church in the mount.
Review: This church is located in Butt road and close to the public bus stop. A small piece of St. Thomas bone is kept in this basilica for remembrance of the work of the saint in Chennai. Good location with view of the city.

Name: Praveen S
Title: Classic church
Review: Little Mount Shrine(Chinnamalai) is a small hillock that lies on the bank of river Adayar in chennai

Name: James K
Title: St Thomas Little Mount Saidapet
Review: A Catholic Church dedicated to Apostle St Thomas who was one of the twelve disciples of Jesus Christ. Famous Shrine for Catholics to honour St Thomas and seek his blessings. A wonderful place of pilgrimage. A family visit for prayer, peace and serenity.

Name: Duraisamy K
Title: Best spot for  Christian who visit chennai
Review: Taken my friend from Indonesia nad it was amazing experience. Nice and large space. Well maintained.

Name: sapharri
Title: Peaceful chruch
Review: Look like this church has been recently renovated and really peaceful to spend sometime....here you can see St.Thomas foot prints,holy water which you can fill in bottes and take home,also you have cave where St.Thomas hiden and used to do prayers

Name: sunnyk332
Title: A complementing Shrine
Review: Visit to Little Mount complement the visit to San Thom Basilica and St Thomas Mount.St Thomas hand and feet impressions are akin to Malayattoor Shrine at , Kerala.

Name: Jophy John E
Title: Must see holy place
Review: There is a small cave and there is a foot print of human. People belies that belongs to st. Thomas. and also believes he hide here at this cave. It is situated Saidapeta also known As chinna malai.

Name: Akvince
Title: Historical monument
Review: Steps leading up to the top of the mount have statues depicting the fourteen stations of the cross. St. Thomas is thought to have been murdered close by.

Name: raja p
Title: historical place
Review: this is a historical place where st thomas(one of the 12 apostles of lord jesus) was martyred.now the maitanance is going good here.photo allowed only if u give donation.

Name: Sangeetha Vikram
Title: Little Mount Shrine - Shrine with lot of religious importance
Review: Myself along with my friend (Jhansi Rani) visited Little Mount Shrine last Friday around 12.30 pm. The church was situated at Saidapet. It was a beautiful cave where St.Thomas (one of the 12 Apostles of Jesus) was hiding 2000 years ago. When we visited Prayers were going on. We felt a great inner peace after vising the place. We lit candles, prayed to Maatha and had a blissful time.

Name: CARLOS Y
Title: Sacred place
Review: This is the 3rd of St. Thomas apostle places I visited. Certainly, If you are a Roman Catholic, you should visit this little place. There will be no luxury or great construction, but a main church and a small chapel, with the cove inside were St. Thomas use to hide from prosecutors.There is not explanation guide either, this is just a place to visit and consider that 2000 years ago a Jesus disciple was there... imagine that.If you are just looking it for tourist, it will take you no more than 15 minutes to go in, take some pictures and get back to your car.

Name: Issac0616
Title: Little Mount Shrine where St.Thomas was hiding 2000 years ago
Review: The cave next to the Little Mount Shrine where St.Thomas was hiding 2000 years ago. His hand made rock cross is still found in the enclosed place. He was hiding in a rock cave and made a small exit to escape from the cave when his enemies tried to capture him.There is a stone which holds his hand impressions where he kneeled and prayed during his stay.He also tried to find water where there is no water found in the hill area. Geologists confirmed the water scarcity in the area. Because of his faith he tried to dig a water pond and a small stream of water came out of the pond( less than half  feet size). The water is still found and available even after 2000 years. His leg impression is found in a big size in the hill.His body bones are kept as relics in the church for the visitors to seeThis is one of the great place to witness the presence of St.Thomas in Chennai where he prayed, stayed for sometime.You need to stretch EXTRA to get inside the cave.

Name: Divakar08
Title: Best church
Review: This church holds an ample for history  , you can really feel the pleasant and inner peace . i attend a mass one day here

Name: joepurakel
Title: more vision required
Review: i visited the shrine a decade ago and it was a serene  place.Now the new unplanned garish structures has marred the harmony with nature and spiritulity.  construction needs to have been done in an ergonomic way and in harmony with the naure and nature of the shrine.

Name: Karthik V
Title: Awesome birds eye view
Review: This little mount Shrine located on the hill top can be accessed by car or any private vehicle. There is a small but wonderful church located on this hill. The breathtaking view of the Chennai city is just awesome and the birds eye view of the airport is simply superb. A must visit place for one and all.

Name: Bharatbackpacker
Title: Hideout for St. Thomas
Review: Little mount shrine is a cave (located near Saidapet) where St. Thomas allegedly took shelter. There are some markings within the cave and outside (like footprint/ a spring, etc) of his presence. The church built around this shrine is nothing spectacular. This place may be more suited for a christian believer rather than general tourists.

Name: Dominic2175
Title: St Thomas lived here
Review: Wonderful Shrine built on a Hillock. The oldest statue of Mother Mary brought in 1555AD is still preserved in the new church. St.Thomas cave is under ground, and one has to enter through a tiny way. A spring is on the top of the Hillock, which is believed to be miraculously hit by Apostle Thomas and water gushed out, to serve the crowds which turned to hear is preaching. New church was constructed in 1971.

Name: Teresamea
Title: Not much to see here
Review: This site has a same cave the St Thomas supposed hid in after the local Raj ordered his death for trying to convert the locals to Christianity.  The small cave has circles that supposedly call out hand and foot prints left in the stone by St Thomas.  Site is easy to get to but for me not that interesting.  You can also visit another location, St Thomas Mount which hosts a small church and a pretty view.

Name: Shane3211
Title: Must Visit Shrine in Chennai
Review: There are two entrance to this shrine, a walk up the hills or drive to the rear entrance and for a short walk.  There is a fee for parking, you get a good view of the city and the surrounding from here.  The most important thing here is the relics and a must visit place for Catholics

Name: Pal_078
Title: Quiet and scenic
Review: It is a Christian shrine, but the location, the view of the airport, planes taking off and landing, the quietness, everything is so serene here. Go here for a change, if not for religious reasons.

Name: Dr.Sathyan Gopalan
Title: Good place
Review: Great place to see . More detailed scripture if found in that place would be wonderful to know the story better. Avoid going on Sunday's due to Sunday mass. Unless you want to see the crowd :)

Name: doctor1963
Title: Lovely shrine lovely views
Review: Great place to see the shrine,make some offering ,give some masses and see he city. Lovely view of city and the airport.not to far. Parking rs 20 for cars

Name: Tapan ROY SARKAR
Title: Stunning view
Review: You have to climb a small hill through steps to reach the shrine, but at the end you will be rewarded with a beautiful view of the city. Ideal for an early morning trek. The shrine is also very nice, good ambiance. To get a good view of the city visit the place when pollution level is low.

Name: Sanusc
Title: Holy Place
Review: This wonderful Church has the blood stained bone of St. Thomas.The very beauty of the architecture and another place where you can see relics of the great christian saint st.thomas

Name: Begaraaj S M
Title: Chinna Malai !!! Brilliant Views !!!
Review: Historic place on top of a hill with stunning views, the whole atmosphere is absolutely awesome !!! early morning hiking is a very good exercise and sitting in silence give us peace of mind.Must visit for all age groups when you are in Chennai and very easily accessible from all parts of Chennai via City bus and MRTS, the nearest station is St Thomas mount.

Name: CyrilGubbi
Title: Historical church
Review: This is a popular and Historical Church where St Thomas one of the disciples had visited. is a small church and worth visiting for religious purpose

Name: VinodKV
Title: a tranquil place to seek the blessings of the Lord Jesus
Review: again a place of religious importance especially for christians of south india. St. Thomas spent some precious moments of his life at this place in india.

Name: G179
Title: Good Insight of St Thomas the Apostle in Chennai
Review: Visited this hill on a weekend, i walked up the stairs which is a nice walk and a good place to see the stations of the cross. The place is awe inspiring for people who expect the unexpected. Quite spectacular was the collection of relics from saints and locations from across the world and spanning a few centuries, including the relics of St Thomas. Walking down is worth a visit to the Garden of Gethsemane, The view from the top is also amazing, especially the view of the airport runway and the airport and on the other side of Chennai. NIce place to visit.

Name: Jay B
Title: Well Preserved Historic Place
Review: A must visit site to know the location where the Apostle St. Thomas spent his time praying.  A small mount with a Catholic Church and the cave where St. Thomas spent his time is all that is to see.  However it is well preserved by the committee and can be further improved upon to attract more tourists.Very much recommended.

Name: rotsen2015
Title: Visit to the Shrines of St Thomas the Apostle in Chennai
Review: Firstly, please be AWARE that there are three shrines to St Thomas in Chennai that have similar names. Firstly, ST THOMAS MOUNT where the saint was killed, and secondly, LITTLE MOUNT where the saint lived and spent time in prayer. Near SAN THOME CATHEDRAL is the place where the saint was initially buried before the body was exhumed and sent elsewhere.I visited only St Thomas Mount and the Little Mount shrines.Being a senior citizen I was tired climbing up the many steps of St Thomas Mount. Older people should take an autorickshaw up via a back road. Once up, apart from religious sentiments, one gets some panoramic views of certain parts of Chennai.Little Mount - known as CHINNAMALAI to the locals (important info for auto drivers) - has a few things connected to St Thomas as well as a miraculous spring, now contained in a room about 12 feet by six feet.Both shrines are very well maintained, are serene locations, and takes one away from the hustle and bustle of the city

Name: Michelle
Title: Visit only if you absolutely have to!
Review: I lived around this place many years ago and used to visit the little mount every week. A fully functional circular-domed Catholic Church exists on the mount and you need to climb quite a few stairs to get to it. Towards the side of the church exists a cave which has been credited to the apostle, St. Thomas. The claim of a hand print of the apostle imprinted on the rock is another aspect to the cave. Other than this, there is really nothing much. However, if your curiosity does get the better of you, do visit! (Not sure about the timings though as the cave is not always open to the public, so be sure to check that before getting there).

Name: OmprakashPK
Title: Place for internal peace and history
Review: When I need the internal strength and solace, I visit this shrine. I go back to the years of St Thomas who was martyred here.  When I want to appreciate the history of Chennai and Christianity, I visit this church. Church hosts the relics of many important personalities. When I just want to stroll around and view the chennai airport and the aircrafts landing and take off, I visit this place. I look for opportunities to visit St Thomas mount.

Name: lgrimaud57
Title: Amazing place to see the city.
Review: Very interesting place to visit and learn about the life of St. Thomas in India.  On the hill you can get a great view of the city on one side and the airport on the other side.

Name: Jesus777412
Title: One of the historical Church located on much above the sea Level
Review: This is also one of the famous Church in Chennai. This church is on the elevated level in comparison with other churches. People believe if there tremendous flood, one can take shelter as it is much above the sea level.The most important aspect of this Church is that, ti is a place where LORD JESUS CHRIST's disciple St.Thomas was killed. People say still his some of bones from his body and blood strain are well preserved.

Name: Kumar S
Title: Blessed to Visit these place.
Review: Here is the place St.Thomas was thirsty, he split the rocks and drank the refreshing water that gushed forth from the spring. and drinks water . i wonder still water came from the same place.

Name: MOUNTMANAGER
Title: A land mark of St.Thomas Apostle
Review: It is a very religious place as where we can see the Foot prints of the apostle. There is a small spring on the rocks which never dries even during summer days,

Name: Pulitzer1991
Title: Peaceful and serene
Review: This is one of the most beautiful churches in chennai, with the excellent view of the city and winds blowing at really high speeds this is one of the places that you must visit when you come in chennai.

Name: Jothilingam E
Title: Big Shrine
Review: Name is only Little but great Mount Shrine which is located at the junction of saidapet & Guingy on the main Mount Road junction.Transport is not a problem but avoid sunday,as it is croweded on this day

Name: Joe Vimal Raj J
Title: Cave where St Thomas offered his Prayers
Review: Little mount shrine, is the place where St. Thomas offered his prayers to the heavenly father, the impressions of his foot and his legs are still viewable in the rocks, a very small narrow entrance to the caves tells how hard it would had been to enter and offer prayers. It also has a water pit, which is believed to be created by St. Thomas himself when the people of chennai faced a severe water crises for drinking water.. and it is still a miracle that the water is coming between the rocks non stop even after 21 centuries.. a definite miracle from the Apostle of Jesus. Worth visiting for every Christian and as a tourist

Name: Clayburnmichael
Title: A place with history
Review: Worth visiting the place for its history. Loads of churches in and around the area.Can b visited any time in the calendar.

Name: Jivi_Jebaraj
Title: Place of Jesus's disciple Thomas
Review: What a place to visit where a man of Bible was.Amazing place.Easy access.See water above on the rock as amazing.

Name: fjp4564
Title: The spirit of the Chennai People
Review: A visit to this spot is encouraged  for Tourists to Chennai.   The place looks dirty, shabby and badly needs some maintenance and general cleaning.  Even the gardens supposed to be maintained by the Bank of India badly needs some maintenance work.  It is a large Hall and a roof top hall for probably cultural and relegious activities.  The most impressive item here is the relica of an ancient Chariot.  Beautifully crafted with 2 bulls is worth a second look.

Name: Ravin K
Title: on the mountain
Review: religous significance to some but otherwise also a nice plce to visit on top of the hill.. accesscible by foot also.. nice view of planes taking off

Name: Ruby S
Title: Of spiritual significance
Review: It is a religious attraction of both spiritual and religious significance. The church and surroundings are well maintained accessible by both foot as well as car. The location overlooking the airport attracts general visitors as well.

Name: KINGFIREHydrebad
Title: Monumental MOUNT
Review: The little mount shrine was once worshipped by ST.THOMAS daily and the chapel is rebuilt and has the olden architecture with modern touch. A must visit for every  lover of history.

Name: OsdenF77
Title: Very religious
Review: Liked the silence in which a Church is always surrounded. cleanliness and the atmosphere. The place is very much in the city and is one of the foundation stone monuments in the Country for the Roman Catholic faith.

Name: excellent2013
Title: Holy Shrine
Review: Little Mount Shrine is located where St.Thomas preached the Gospel to the people.It is really wonder to see the footprints of St.Thomas on the hill.God protects him from his enemies and provide everything wonderfully.The surroundings of  the Shrine may be maintained neatly which may attracts more people.It is a holy Shrine so that it may be neat and tidy.On the Main road some signs may be put to know the way correctly.It is a good chance to understand how God protects and provides His Children by visiting the Shrine Cave and the Fountain.

Name: LeenaIM
Title: The hiding cave of st.thomas
Review: There seems some confusion in the reviews of the place. The place known as little mount is locally called chinnamalai and the church is named as 'our lady of health'. This is located at Saidapet and NOT near the airport. The church or shrine near the airport is st.thomas mount. Little mount is believed to be the place where St. Thomas was in hiding. You can see the cave as an underground place attached to the church. There is a rock with a huge palm impression and it is believed that this palm impression belongs to St.Thomas. There is a spring which again is believed to have been in existence from the time of St.Thomas and many devotees carry this water back along with them. This place therefore has historic and religious importance. Just around the church there is a small garden with the depiction of the stations of the cross. Though I wasn't here for any Good Friday service, I am told it is a beautiful and meaningful service.

Name: Ravi D
Title: A view from the top
Review: Long before the sky scrapers and even LIC building, one could walk or drive up to top of St Thomas Mount and behold entire Chennai rolling out to the Bay of Bengal on one side and the broken hills in the west.

Name: SagarVS
Title: Great view
Review: Apart from the religious history, the views are great. The sight of planes taking off from the airport is breathtaking and time flies. Suggest you visit this place around 5 and leave around sunset. Nice spot without the usual traffic noise.

Name: Begaraaj S M
Title: Short trek to reach Bliss !!!
Review: Fabulous place to visit , morning shot trek to reach the peak serves as a very good exercise , many sports trainers take there students in the morning to this mount , Very well maintained neat and clean place , when we sit in silence we can feel the bliss over there,Easily accessible by city bus and Metro rail from all parts of Chennai ,Must visit for all age groups ...Loving you so much ...Peacefully yours .S M Bega Raaj .

Name: 432EmmaT
Title: Catholic Pilgrimage
Review: Interesting place do learn about St. Thomas visit to India, it is a Catholic place  where you can pray and see  the live of St. Thomas one of the Apostole of Christ

Name: Damian O
Title: Far from downtown but worth it
Review: Another spiritual must stop in Chennai. The place has an enviable view and the church is small but beautiful. The relics are wonderful.

Name: ssKishore
Title: Beatuy to watch airport from this place.
Review: You can have a beautiful view from this Shrine. Beautiful place to be during evenings where you can have a all round view of the city.

Name: Timengev
Title: Lovely
Review: A lovely shrine to visit and a genuine holy feeling about it.  I attended mass here after visiting the mount.  I also recommend St Thomas' Mount near the airport. (I think the page and some of the other reviews have mixed up these two places - they are 2 different hills).  They are both a nice break from the noise of Chennai.

Name: Shiva S
Title: Excellent church to visit
Review: Its a nice church to visit on weekends. Not only to pray it is also a kind of spot were in families, friends, couples etc can have a relaxed time from their stressful office life. Visit it and u will have a nice time.

Name: KumarJUN
Title: A bird's view of Chennai
Review: This wonderful Church has the blood stained bone of St. Thomas.A beautiful church and qualifies to be a great landmark. One can find many AngloIndians living closeby.. Pope John Paul II visited in early 1980s. One can get to see Banyan trees on top of the cliff and the wonderful view of the Kathipara, anna salai from the small mountain on which the Church is built. It is told that one can see the Mylapore Kapaleeswar temple from here in the past before the concrete jungles mushroomed..The take offs and landings from Chennai airport is also possible. But please maintain silence and discipline while you enjoy the grand happenings respecting the Church goers

Name: lixonsamuel
Title: Thomas, Why do you Doubt
Review: We traveled a long route to get here. It was a good feeling to visit the ground where this hallowed christian apostle who bought the gospel into India. spent his last few moments.

Name: rego4915
Title: ANOTHER GREAT TOURIST LANDMARK....
Review: The very beauty of the architecture and another place where you can see relics of the great christian saint st.thomas also a very peacefull and sublime place to spend a few minutes to meditate and pray..............

Name: danielvictor422@gmail.com
Title: Scenic view of Chennai city and the Airport
Review: The place to have a panoramic view of the city - place where Thomas disciple of Jesus Christ was martyred around 2000 years ago

Name: srk800
Title: Awesome
Review: Very prestigous church in chennai,little mount a small rock can be climbed by walk and also by road .Excellent place get good view of entire city of chennai

Name: girlienan
Title: Felt so Annointed
Review: Loved this place so much and felt so anointed to visit this place in Chennai where St.Thomas was killed, the disciple of Jesus , interesting to know the actual fact that happened with him....and now he is a saint...

Name: boltartas
Title: Magnificent views
Review: Even if not a Christian, the site of St Thomas' death is of interest. Extensive views across Chennai, plus many local families enjoying the spot. Interesting drive up to the area, as it winds through the army officer's training centre, plus see lots of boys playing cricket.

Name: Davindia167
Title: Quiet place to know Jesus is alive!
Review: Nice little shrine in serene locale overlooking the airport! Depicts the various pictures of the truth that St. Thomas, one of Jesus' disciples was there..

Name: gmj_ni
Title: Nice little church
Review: My ex-Boss lives in that street so each time I visit him I visit this gem of a church. Ambiance is wonderful. Parking is a minor issue.

Name: G.Visukumar
Title: Nice view of Chennai
Review: Enjoyed being there and saw the southern part of chennai in a airial view. Kids like the take off and landing of flights which can be viewed from here. Doing medidation here, gives different experience.

Name: G_Fernandes563
Title: Visit to the Shrine
Review: i was amazed to see the church. That was the first time i have visited the church. i have been there and spent enough time for praying and also to see the area completely.

Name: paribrajika
Title: Pilgrims progress
