Review: The shrine centers around the little underground basalt cave in which St thomas is said to have taken refuge to escape from his prosecutors and the perennial spring  said to have miraculously arisen to quench his thirst .The 14th century Portugese church that stands above is still in use and the local congregation gathers to celebrate mass on Sundays.It is not a touristy place but visited by streams of earnest pilgrims has an air of peace and sanctity about it.It is an amazing feeling to drink from the perrennial spring as a pilgrim pours out a tiny mugful into your cupped hands.The cave entrance is hidden by an adjacent chapel and once you have siddled inside there is hardly space to stand erect in the low basalt cave where St Thomas used to meditate. It is bare except for an altar that has been placed quite recently.you can also see the narrow (grilled) opening in the cave wall said to have opened up miraculously to allow the saint to escape from his pursuers.The entire shrine has a feeling of ascetic serenity and prayerfulnes about it along with a sense of historical drama and danger.It is highly recommended for devout Catholics as well as history buffs.Note: The locals call it Chinna malai (little mount) and is located in Saidapet. It should not be confused with the much higher and more famous Periya malai (big mount)/Firangi malai which is popularly called St thomas mount and overlooks the airport, and was the site of St thomas' Martyrdom.Several reviews on this page confuse the two, the photographs are of the little  mount shrine .

Name: Praveen S
Title: Must Visit
Review: You cannot miss the visit this Church. I went & found the peace & reassurance. Love Lord & Mother & they will love you many folds

Name: indianesj
Title: History &
Review: Before you go to this church please read a few articles about this place. You will find it interesting to witness what you have read. Otherwise all you will see is an abandoned church & its untold history. The cave in which St. Thomas was hiding before he escaped to St. Thomas Mount where he was martyred, is still preserved here. A small rock bearing his foot prints still lay here, half preserved (or should I say had survived the authorities negligence). The eternal spring (source unknown)  on top of the hill, which had quenched the thirst of St. Thomas lies as a perennial source of water even during peak summers. You can also find a cross St. Thomas had carved in a single piece of rock.

Name: Wolfsbane_12
Title: Barely anything
Review: Went there with a lot foe expectations. There was barely anything there. A church which looked abandoned. the place is poorly maintained. the only thing worth saying is that the view of the city from there is really good. nothing else. But Google earth gives a better view. Would avoid the place if i were you.

Name: Daviesmom
Title: St Thomas shrine
Review: This is a must visit for religious tourist ... If you would like to know the history of Christianity in India. St Thomas' relic is said to be here.

Name: srinivasdamodar
Title: Scenic Shrine
Review: One of my Favourite Spot in chennai and the fact is, it is very close to my place.The place is Neat and Clean now a days and has one of the Oldest Church in Chennai. One can see the Take Offs and Landings at Chennai Airport from the Mount. The Place is good for a morning walk. A very Calm Place.

Name: selection11
Title: Shrine of St.Thomas and Our lady of Good Health
Review: Welcome for the Feast on 5th and 6th May 2012. This is the only Shrine for two Saints.  This the place where St.Thomas Stayed and preached the good news of god.  The Shrine has following places to visit.Alter of St.ThomasCross carved by St.ThomasWater pond digged by St.Thomas which in the mountain which never dries

Name: dhanyamarath
Title: A must visit church - I find peace here
Review: In 2008, when I was new in Chennai I happened to see a statue in little mount (chinnamalai, Saidapet) which attracted me. I followed it and reached this church and it was wow I found peace there! No one talked much about this church, though it is one of the tourist spots in chennai. I did not know the history, I was only in search of peace and I found it there, I would say. As mentioned in the other comment, there is a small cave (a very cool place to beat the heat of chennai) which is the attraction point in this church. I find lot of crowd in and around church, but when I get into the cave and sit there for a while I will feel as if I am meditating. It's a good feeling and it is worth visiting this place in chennai.

Name: The_Pale_Ridah
Title: St Thomas the Apostle was killed in India...this is no joke!
Review: St Thomas travelled the long road to India to spread Jesus‚Äô teachings & like many of these Apostles, died a violent death. Modern day Chennai aka Madras or Mylapore was the location of his martyrdom, making the Indian Church the 2nd oldest church community in the world, next to the Catholic Church, with a direct connection to Jesus.The holy site at Little Mount or locally known as Chinnamalai comprises the cave where St Thomas lived, a holy spring, a stone carved cross & a small circular chapel. Inside the cave is a stone boulder with an imprint of a hand on it, supposedly St Thomas‚Äôs hand print or that of a large beast. Being alone in the cave I thought about this being the hand print of a bloke who hung out & drank wine with Jesus! Near the cave is a fresh water spring that miraculously appeared to quench the thirst of followers, a shame Hindus didn‚Äôt drink wine, a mysterious wine spring would create some buzz id imagine. Inside the locked shed that protects the stream is an ancient stone cross that was uncovered recently & believed to have been carved by the saint himself & on which he hugged while he was violently stabbed to death by a hating Brahmin priest.Little Mount is located in Saidapet, Chennai near the Maraimalal Adigalar bridge. The chapel is open all day & is a cool blessing from Chennai‚Äôs heat. Many auto-rickshaw/taxi drivers might not know where it is but just tell them to go to Saidapet & ask around. There are no admission fees but the old man who holds the key to the natural spring & stone cross might appreciate a small ‚Äòdonation‚Äô for unlocking the door to access the cross & spring, u can find him loitering around the place. A visit to Little Mount cannot be complete without a trip to the San Thome Basilica which is one of three places in the world where a church has been built over the tomb of an Apostle of Jesus, the others being the Cathedral of Santiago de Compostela in Spain for St James & St Peter‚Äôs Basilica at the Vatican in Rome.

Name: PitoyAmpil1941
Title: Huddleston Gardens is ALSO called the Big Banyan Tree
Review: the Banyan Tree is about a 2 kilometer walk from the two gates of the Theosophical Society campus' Main Gate and the Green Gate... within in the area is the Blavatsky Hall for conferences n meetings as well as the Leadbeater Chambers (for visiting TS members).... a big campus with some 8 other temples, churches n over a hundred structures that can house the Society's year end conventions attended by TS members from about 30 countries around the world...

Name: bjerkseth
Title: Oasis in urban jungle
Review: Had to travel nearly 40 minutes in this humongous city to reach, and came in by a back gate. The weather nice, and the garden sort of wild, with plenty of trees, a real oasis. The pride is an old Banian tree, measuring 70 x 100 meters, but it‚Äôs difficult to get a sense of it, as the Banyan is sending DOWN air roots, which will take root, and it looks like a forest by itself. However, I take them on their word. It was nearly empty, a work day - so I had the garden almost for myself. Beautiful magenta water lilies, some other lilies among the grass, and at least two tall trees full of mega bats, which I think are Flying Dogs, sort of. They made bird like sounds. It was also a loud choir of bird song.Along one of the roads were temples, and churches for different religions - a liberal Catholic Church (whatever that might be), a Hindu temple, a Singh shrine. All in all, I made the round in an hour or so, and was back in ChennI reality coming out of the main gate. Thousands of cars, scooters, tuktuks, fumes and exhaust, noise and serious pollution. Glad I went there, will I go again? Don‚Äôt think so. And I had a serious feeling that the Theosophical Society is a dying breed.

Name: roshu6682
Title: A calm and peaceful place for a good stroll.
Review: Despite being a resident of Chennai for nearly 12 years now and staying for some time close to the locality yet it took me a long while to visit the theosophical society gardens, the reason is simply due to the inconvenient timings when visitors are allowed. This place has free entry but only on weekdays from 8:30am to 10:30am and then again from 2pm to 4pm which happens to be the least favored timing for any Chennai resident to venture outdoors due to the heat. Early morning and evening walks are hence not a possibility and that is a shame because the canopy of trees and pathways are delightful and an early morning or evening walk accompanied by bird song would have been the best way to experience the place. I happened to be there in the vicinity and had 1 hour to kill as i was waiting for someone to turn up and hence decided to drop in as it was a hot but not so sunny day. A stroll of 1.2 kms was comfortable and there is good tree cover and foliage to delight the walker. Trees were named with little boards displayed but there were no proper gardens to linger on. Benches to relax were also very few. No drinking water facility hence do bring your own water if you set out to walk. The banyan tree is more like a complex of trees now and is mind-blowing to behold. The place is clean and dust bins are set up hence pls do not litter. Recommended for nature lovers. Kids would get bored. One star less due to unreasonable visiting hours and lots of scope to develop the place into a blooming garden attraction which Chennai lacks.

Name: Barbara R
Title: Beautiful Foliage
Review: Trees and bushes from all over the world are in abundance. The air was clear and the grounds were magnificent.

Name: JANET S
Title: Must visit.
Review: Nothing really fancy, just a "must visit."  The book store is well-stocked with many books by several authors.  Anyone of the 60s would have a nice time here.  Check for when flowers are blooming.  Double Check for dates closed, i.e., Christmas day is closed.  When you get dropped at one of 2 gates, just follow the road for about 20-30 minutes to get to the other gate.

Name: RavikumarEswaran
Title: Amazing plac
Review: When you are in chennai, you must take  a walk in this place. Lot of flora and fauna. Very calm and serene environment.

Name: Delaine J
Title: Heaven on Earth
Review: Staying at the Theosophical Society Grounds and Accommodation was a total treat.  The staff are most kind and helpful, the facilities though old, are beautifully catered for.. Its like being in heaven surrounded by sheer beauty and wonder.. Many old buildings representing many religions, are there to see.. The food is basic, but nice. and the staff very efficient.  We have fond memories of this place and would thoroughly recommend it.

Name: Praveenop
Title: A historical place and one of Chennai's lung space
Review: This place has a lot of history. The Banyan tree is one of the largest in the country and worth a visit just for that. Since it is a garden the place is ideal for walks in the morning or evening if the chennai weather permits.

Name: Vasu R
Title: Guards rude
Review: Extremely rude guards.i was taken aback when I found the guards not polite.place is good though.theres are no entry boards and by mistake if we walk in no entry areas guards will rudely talk to you.if you are a foreigner they don't say anything

Name: rradice123
Title: A quiet place in a busy Chennai
Review: I fully enjoyed the opportunity to visit and spend some time walking in this garden where many Theosophical primaries have walked before.  I would have liked to see more, but we had to leave for another adventure that day.  The Banyan trees here are just amazing.  There is also a museum of sorts and a library that are worth visiting.  Go if you have the chance.

Name: Anusree P
Title: Good walk through nature
Review: Should go with someone special. Good place for a peaceful walk.Can spend an evening here. have been here more that 3 times

Name: vasan224
Title: Perfect place for meditation
Review: A perfect place to take a walk peacefully. Most of the plants and trees here will be labeled here, so it will be interesting when you cross them. You can go with your friends or family to relax for a while.

Name: jensings2
Title: Peaceful stroll
Review: What a lovely oasis in the middle of Chennai! I would recommend going with someone who can explain things about the vegetation and to take the time to go into the library and see if someone will let you into the room on the 1st floor (it is locked) to see the precious books. Loved the experience! Make sure you get permission to use your camera. You may need to go to the main office to get it and you may need to pay some guards to get the permission. Bring low denominations of money to pay (like 20 rupee bills).

Name: Neervana S
Title: quite ok
Review: Was not that interesting but was good for a walk in the nature and it was also nice to learn about the great banyan tree.

Name: kim G
Title: escape the mayhem of Chennai
Review: worth a visit to find a bit of peace and quiet, not a lot in there but its free and has some interesting trees. quite a nice place just to have a walk, sooo different from the city.a nice re leaf.

Name: shrinikethv
Title: A peaceful haven in middle of bustling city
Review: Situated in Beasant nagar, near the Elliot's beach, this place is a tranquil place amidst the hustle of Adyar and Besant nagar. Forest like atmosphere, this also doubles up as a cultural center which hosts several events. Peaceful atmosphere throughout with pleasant walk.

Name: SDhar_10
Title: Green patch in the heart of the city
Review: We took a walk in the Theosophical Society. It is akin to a Botanical Garden given the variety of flora it showcases. The place is not maintained very well but it was great to see the temple/church/mosque, etc. in one space. There are good libraries on Theology too. Great place if you are interested in the subject or in simple greenery.

Name: Di-walker
Title: Forest like Environment in middle of the Metro
Review: Extremely good place.  Perfect location for self-introspection, meditation, positive vibrations and for (an internal) spiritual journey.   Stayed for 3 memorable days, enjoyed every minute of association with the nature (though walking around after Sun-set calls for extreme caution and alertness).  In case you have some little understanding of the Mahatmas associated with this Society, you will be thrilled to roam around the place, which was blessed by all time Great personalities like Jiddu Krishna Murthy, Madam Blavatsky, Annie Besant, to name a few.  Good Luck - God Bless.

Name: Praveen S
Title: peaceful place
Review: This place is located in main place of city, when we enter into here, we feel awesome and pleasant, mind peaceful

Name: Shyam C
Title: Where you are one with nature.
Review: Formally known as Theosophical Society Of India and situated on the banks of the Adyar river where the river meets the Bay of Bengal. An institution which is well over a century old and has been visited by legends from across the world.Even today the place stands out for its tranquility and greenery. Testimony is a Banyan tree over a century old and spread over almost 2 square kilometres.A library which boasts of a magnificent collection of books. A multi faith organisation housing Hindu, Buddhist temples and a Church as well . You could well spend a whole day watching the sunset into the sea in the evening.

Name: Thide
Title: Dry, not too well maintained and unfriendly staff
Review: The buildings and ground of the Theosophical Society may be interesting for adepts of this sort of religious amalgam. For others it is not worth while a visit. The personality cult of the founders, especially of Madam Blavatsky is outright annoying.

Name: Narasimhananda S
Title: The place of the Old Banyan
Review: A good stroll, these gardens have the oldest banyan tree of India, and possibly of the world. A nice stroll in a peaceful atmosphere.

Name: Ravin K
Title: Gem of chennai
Review: this is one of the best places in chennai to visit exp the banyan tree. though they have some strict timings for the same

Name: Ravi D
Title: Walk in the woods
Review: Whenever I am in the vicinity of Besant Nagar or Adyar and have time to spare before heading back home, a walk inside Theosophical Society is a must. Besides, at least once in a year I make it my destination to get away from the feeling that I live in a bustling,  noisy metro.Nothing comes close unless I hit the Western Ghats or the Forests there. Closest thin to heaven on earth in Chennai.

Name: Jaffathecat1
Title: This has to be the most peaceful place in Chennai
Review: Whilst the opening times are somewhat restrictive, the gardens & main building are magnificent. If you ask, you might even be allowed to look inside the main building which has a beautiful marble dinning area with interesting wall adornments. The gardens are extensive, although they would benefit from maybe a layout plan at the each of the entrances. Be sure to seek out several old Banyan trees which are quite a sight

Name: LataSundaram
Title: Relaxed walk
Review: A very relaxing walk through Theosophical society allows one to enjoy the peace  around. Many old trees and flowers .

Name: Karthik R
Title: WoW place in mid of the hustling city
Review: There are 2 entrances - one opposite to the Malar hospital, Adayar and the other down the Besant Nagar Avenue roads after crossing the  church. I visited this place several times as a part of CTC cleanup activities. The thick woods inside the place and the great Banyan tree with small pond and Buddha temple makes it a great place to send early mornings.There are visiting hours too and makes up a good place to visit in Chennai for a relaxed day.

Name: Bala Iyer
Title: Amazing Experience.. Peace!
Review: Get in either through the gate opposite to Malar Hospital or through Besant Avenue road. SLRs are not allowed without prior approvals, phone cams are allowed. Give a letter in writing to the managing officer if in case you need to use SLRs, if lucky you can get approvals on the same day or you would be given a different date. Banyan tree is the speciality here, spread across 1 acre, more than 400 years old, mother tree is no more.

Name: ArunaSrinivas
Title: Peaceful!
Review: If you want to visit the 450 year old Banyan Tree inside this campus, check the timings - they are open for pubic only for few hours in a day. And they are closed on all public holidays. Its a total silence zone, so be aware if you are taking kids along. The campus is totally covered in green and you wont hear a sound of the busy traffic outside the campus.

Name: ManilaKwan
Title: Besant Gardens
Review: This was renamed last year. Opening hours are rather short  to experience this vast area and it's many shrines to various religious streams. Beautiful trees and plants, not totally garden.

Name: GrandGardenia
Title: Well maintained lake within city limit
Review: Good outing spot within the city limit. Well maintained place. It's recommended for everybody.kids can play, take boating and play area.

Name: Deadman17
Title: Green Lungs of City
Review: This is a beautiful park with a lake. People come here in mornings and evenings for walking, jogging and running. The park atmosphere is peaceful to sit down with a cup of hot coffee and read books. Family picnics can be organized. The best part is it is bang in the middle of the city.

Name: Murugavel R
Title: Good time pass on this pollution free, relaxed environment at the center of the city
Review: Boating, 5D show, VR show, etc. are good.But, Aquarium is not worth to watch with money.We can spend atleast 2 to 3 hours hereIt is run by govt. fisheries dept.

Name: #amosamiyanayeküéß
Title: üèûÔ∏è
Review: best time to visit at morning and eve for jogging and walking ... as well as the best for to spend time with children and family. quit nice decoration food court available if necessary to have light foodüç∞üçï

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: Beautiful calm park with awesome lake
Review: Chetpet Park is so beautiful with the lake. Many people come here for a jog. The parj is so peaceful. Kids enjoy playing around. Good place for relaxing yourself in the nature.

Name: Lakshmi Narayanan
Title: Worth a visit
Review: A well maintained park worth visiting with children. Boat ride,an aquarium and virtual reality shows are what we visited due to lack of time.They also have fishing and other facilities.Walkers can make use of the facility on payment.A good place to pass time and enjoy.The staff were very pleasant.

Name: chrisang
Title: Well maintained park. Good visit with kids
Review: It's a well maintained park where one can walk around the lake. There's boating as well. and a kids play area. Inside the park there is an aquarium and a VR. Both have separate entry tickets. Overall, its a peaceful place to visit with kids. Although after sunset there were lot of mosquitoes

Name: amit s
Title: A overall review
Review: Everything is good when it comes to ecopark it is one of the best park in Chennai I have no negative comment as far is Park is concerned but when it comes to the management body right from the watchman to ticket counter and Management people available in ecopark terribly rude and speak very harsh

Name: Praveenop
Title: Top class park
Review: The best water park project in Chennai so far. Perfect work done by the government. Well maintained and well managed

Name: Chithranath
Title: A trip to Ecopark you should quickly forget
Review: I took my grandson to chetput ecopark and it was a really sad experience thanks to the staff working there. The place looks nicely maintained and the various activities as well but expect bad service right from the parking staff, to the ticket counter folks and the employees who operate the various activities. They are rude, clueless and downright unhelpful to people who visit.We wasted 1.5 hours because of improper communication and lack of signages. The final experience at the VR/ AR was interesting and the ONLY saving grace. If only the amount invested in landscaping and introducing state of art activities was also done on proper staff hiring and training, a visit here would have been a great experience.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: can still be better maintained
Review: There is no water due to the poor maintenance the plants in the park area has lost its bloom still can see some people trying to make this a good picnic spot

Name: Zinia F
Title: Spacious and Open
Review: I didn't find a lot of activities to do around the park except for walking a long trail, and I actually didn't mind it...Something about hte openness and vastness of the place that touched my heart..You can avail a monthly pass for a reasonabe fee if you want to go there for a regular jog...a lot of women there do the same.One of the reasons I wouldn't mind calling Chennai home.

Name: Sameeran
Title: Chetpet Ecopark-The best maintained Park in City!
Review: Chetpet Ecopark is the top-rated Ecopark in Chennai,managed by TN Fisheries Devt Corporation. Built in 2016 around a lake,over an area of 16 acres, it has an excellent paved walkway of 1.5km AMD lush green environment. With multiple entertainment and infotainment facilities,it is an ideal place to spend time with family and kids.. The following are few facilities in the Park.ÔÇ∑ BoatingÔÇ∑ Mini Forest and Herbal GardenÔÇ∑ Sports Fishing ÔÇ∑ Children Play Area ÔÇ∑ 3D Film Show ÔÇ∑ Amphi Theatre ÔÇ∑ Elevation Aquarium ÔÇ∑ Acupressure Walkway ÔÇ∑ Multi Level Car Parking ÔÇ∑ Roof Top Restaurant ÔÇ∑ Food Zone,Snacks Kiosk ÔÇ∑ Guest Rooms ÔÇ∑ Aquarium‚Äìcum‚Äì5D Virtual Reality Centre, Dome Theatre, Augmented Realty Centre

Name: Narasimhan G
Title: Good to watch !!
Review: It is around a small Lake. Beautiful to watchFrom Poonthamallee High road entry is  open..From Railway station also you can reach.Presents a good view from the Bridge built over the railway line..Hotel facility is thereGood walkers' place too

Name: RAJENDRA884 PRASAD
Title: Combine Photography and Morning Walk
Review: I always find a place to walk during early morning hours and when I went to this lovely park, I found it equally good for photography.  One can capture birds, sunrise and reflections in water.

Name: worldwomantourist
Title: Simply the Best Park
Review: Wonderful place for picnic with family and friends. Will enjoy the nature so much. The coo breeze makes your mind to relax.

Name: Sriram G
Title: Nice hideout for the City dwellers
Review: Chetpet, everyone in Chennai knows, ha been one of the prime urban areas with high rises, train station etc. Many even know the spur tank in Chetpet. But a very few have heard of this little paradise called Eco Park in Chetpet. What sounded like a refreshing change from the usual TVs and ipad tablets, turned out to be a truly good one.  Having said that this is just a good start. Cameras like slr ones had to be kept outside (this was a disappointment for me - not sure what they were hiding) and so are plastics.  The park has a lake with boating inside. Anglers can merry in the second half, though you are supposed to put the fish back into the lake. Angling kit is available on rent. Boating is reasonably priced and this where the crowd lies. You have to be patient till your chance arrives. The queues can be longer. The boating experience per se is decent and they gave life buoys to all. Some of the walls are painted with artistic sceneries etc.  The flora and fauna quotient is a bit lacking. All we could see was ducks. They can probably introduce many more species. Congratulations are due to whoever thought through this idea for an eco Park very next to the EMU train station (may be that's why less fauna). Before this eco park, I would have crossed that area a hundred times without getting amused. Now it evokes a feeling of being part of the nature amidst the other unavoidable urbanization in a city whose Air Quality Index is degrading by the day.  Kudos to those good souls to retain this green eco park.

Name: vasan224
Title: green for fitness enthusiasts
Review: the Chetpet Eco Park is ideal for fitness enthusiasts and those looking for a spot of recreation. Walkers dodge the birds and continue walking, their gazes fixed steadily on the trail beyond.

Name: PanditAnil
Title: Hidden gem with excellent food at great prices.
Review: Hidden in the center of the city is a gem for foodies. I have been going there to eat and have tried almost all the different cuisine there. The prices are reasonable and quantity generous. The food court is called food zone and offers free indoor parking making it an ideal place to catch some food in an hurry. My favorites are Mansatti serving southern cuisine, Lucknowi which has excellent Mughalai items and Sedap with Malaysian food. A must visit place if you are a foodie!!

Name: Ghiri T
Title: A Beautiful place
Review: Chetpet Eco-Park is located on P.H. Road,Chennai. This is a nice place to go for a walk to get fresh air and to have a peace of mind. Here we can go for boating. The surroundings are kept clean and well maintained. Here they also have a food court. Children will definitely love this place.

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: awesome place to walk
Review: This place is pretty good and you will feel relaxed and peaceful.Boating is available and this place is maintained very well

Name: Maruthu
Title: Very good place, but will have to spend more bucks
Review: I was here with family, especially for fishing. Although fishing was bit costly, but it was worth it considering kids get to enjoy. Parking fee is little higher here, 24 per hour, which is as good as any mall. They have a food court here, but there also items are very costly.

Name: Ritesh C
Title: good
Review: excellent for morning walk, very clean and well maintain. very soon they should add a track for cycling too which will add more value

Name: Sundarjee
Title: Excellent place for family to spend time in the evening.
Review: Excellent place for family to spend time in the evening. Hygienic and well maintained. With annual membership for Rs. 2k, value for money.

Name: ranjit a
Title: A breather for chennai
Review: Chennai's much needed lung space in city center is offered by this park. Right next to KMC hospital and an approach from chetpet Railway station makes it a convenient spot. Ample car and bike parking available to cater to weekend rush. The daily entry fee is Rs 25 and monthly pass is Rs 200. The walk/ jogging track around the lake for well over a km is well laid. There is also a boating ride for a fee. There is also a separate fishing tank for the keen anglers. Fishing tackle is available on rent and fishes so caught can be left back in water or bought at Rs 300/kg. Sit outs are all around. A small snack area near the kids play area for refreshments . Just outside the park is the ice-cream parlour.  On the top floor is the food court to cater to vegans and non vegetarians separately.  The rates at the restaurant is quite reasonable and services pretty quick.The toilet is well maintained and clean. The park is open from morning 4.30am till 8.00pm evening Overall it is one of neatest evening getaways from the humdrum of city traffic in the midst of it. A much needed relief from the concrete jungle.

Name: Anusuya D
Title: good artificial lake place
Review: well tranformed artificial lake view walk in the evening gives pleasant. food zone provides us variety of food which is tasty. my children enjoyed more

Name: Karmugil
Title: Very good
Review: nice place to spend time with family in evening time.... Kids will enjoy a lot....  Especially boating is very good

Name: Yogitauchil
Title: Food zone at Eco park
Review: I am a regular walker at Eco park and being a foodie always wished there was some good food after my walk.With varieties starting from vegetarian north indian food, to Malaysian, south indian veg and non veg to Lucknow food. You can find them all.

Name: Raghu R
Title: Good picnic spot in the middle of a concrete jungle
Review: This artificial lake has been created due to Government initiative and surprisingly a very good one! 25 years back when we walked to our college by the bridge on the side of this lake this place was filthy and the stench unbearable, it has transformed magically now.Good path  to walk around, boating in artificial lake is with pedalled boats. Has a kids play area and some eateries too. Overall a good place to spend some time with kids.

Name: krish862
Title: Excellent and for relaxing
Review: Now there's not much of water for boating in the lake.and for regular walkers, there is a separate path with monthly pass, even they have a place for birthday parties and some small gathering function for around 50 to 75 people adjacent to lake.Even tamilnadu fisheries mobile kitchen will serve fresh sea food, excellent

Name: Mohamedha R
Title: Good Place
Review: Superb to visit in evening time and relax with kids.Boating, Snacks, Walk, Children play area,Fishing.Good time to reach is 4:30 pm

Name: SagarVS
Title: Recently restored
Review: This is a recently restored artificial lake. It was dry for many years but now the place has been cleaned up and boating has been introduced. Not a spectacular spot but certainly pleasing to the eye in this concrete madness.

Name: Ra_Radha
Title: Nice restoration of Lake
Review: Govt did well to restore the lake and revive it into Tourists place with Children rides, boating and fishing and doing complete makeover of jogging track. Entry fees is nominal. Hope they maintain it well.

Name: Joji J
Title: "this oasis in Chennai is a good initiative"
Review: Rejuvenating the Chetpet Lake and developing the area into an Eco Park was a good initiative and though the developments are yet to complete the present facilities like the walkway, attractive green park with lawns, plants and trees, boating facility in the lake etc are enough for a nice outing here. Once the project is complete with the food stalls, children's play area, fishing point and other infrastructure developments as envisaged this will be one of the best attractions of Chennai. We went there and spent about three hours and the awesome atmosphere was enough to clear the fatigue of three day's continuous work. Though the work of the park is not completed we found several groups, majority were families, during our visit.

Name: vikasmardia
Title: eco park chennai
Review: newly made name similar to eco park in Kolkata but nicely done in a small area and in heart of the city.

Name: Abdul wahaab
Title: Well maintained park in heart of city
Review: Another cool park for walkers joggers and family in the middle of the busy city ..The chetpet lake is renovated and maintained as a park ..Behind chetpet station and opposite to new hope hospital .Entry fee rs 25/ head ...Very nice place to enjoy cool eveng and kids area and boating lovers

Name: Sheetal D
Title: Very good initiative
Review: I visited this park  with my family on a weekend evening and was pleasantly surprised by the beauty of the park....Nice green scenic park in a busy city of chennai.though still under construction but nice boating facility....Lot of walkway for joggers n walkers...Very very good initiative....A small food n snack area along with kids play area....Perfect for a evening break.

Name: velayudhan
Title: Eco Park @ Chennai In-skirts
Review: Chetpet EcoPark is opened newly on the PH road .I has boating . The eco-spot has good time spending activity .I loved the place here . It was worth the ride

Name: Chakkravarthy M
Title: A cool place in Central Chennai
Review: An excellent and a must visit spot in Chennai with your family. Kids love the boating. Maintained well. A walk around the lake in the evening will energize us. Plan it during June - Feb.

Name: Rucha121
Title: Nice spot for Sunday picnic
Review: Located in Chetpet, opposite to Ega theatre, this lake has been recently renovated and boats have been added and developed as tourism spot. Entry fees is nominal. Lot of trees and plants and lighting has been added and it has been regularly maintained now.

Name: PunitSampat
Title: Nice place for a morning walk ,scenic and well made.
Review: Great oasis of greenery in the middle of a manhattan ,nice place for a walk and some great landscaping adds to the beauty of your walk.Its well maintained for now with two water bodies and i am told some fishing is also permitted in the rainy season.The Pressure stone pebble walk is also a great idea.

Name: krazikams
Title: Beautiful Ecopark in hear of city
Review: Kudos to Government for reviving this lake as an Eco-Park with boating, garden, children play area, canteen and multilevel parking. It is well maintained and visited by many people, especially in summer evenings with children. There is minimal entry ticket charges.

Name: Partha C
Title: Must see place in Chennai
Review: It is a beautiful place for everyone. Boating  is enjoyable, children are very happy here. In the morning it is god walking place also. Really a good Park.

Name: krish862
Title: Excellent park
Review: Kids enjoyed the boating. And especially the morning walk it is the best place. Only thing is we have to take monthly pass, they are maintaining separate track all round the Lake.And one more feature is they are giving a hall along with open area for a small gathering of 50 to 100  for parties, it is excellent.One must visit

Name: Rajesh71Issrani
Title: Beautiful Park to Visit
Review: This is one of the new attractions which have come up in the city. It's a great place to go for a jog/walk. There's a small play area for kids. They also have fishing and boating!

Name: Prasobh K
Title: Well maintained eco park - boating and walking tracks are very good !!
Review: Chetpet Eco park post the restoration by the Govt. has become a great spot for spending evenings for us. The park is very well maintained and the area is very clean. The boating area is mostly crowded and be ready to paddle as these are the only boats allowed. The walking area has interesting animal statues, paintings, benches etc. to provide a great view. There is a small playing area for kids as well. There is a separate area for regular walkers and members. There is also a fishing spot with angling equipment available on rent. Very good place for regular walkers and for enjoying a good evening. There is also a 3D show running. Overall appreciate the effort of the local authorities in maintaining standards of the park - very much worth a visit !!

Name: Somil A
Title: Chetpet Ecopark- man made artificial lake
Review: -Good place for evening hangout.-walking track well maintained.-Very nice place for families with small kids.-The only attraction is man made artifical lake.-Car parking - Rs.20/hr which is really ver bad.-Entry fee Rs.25/adult, boating (optional)Rs.50/30mins.-Very neat and clean surroundings.-nothing to do for youngsters, lot of things for teens and kids.Overall good time pass in the heart of busy city

Name: oppraveen
Title: Great Eco Spot bang in the middle of the big bad concrete jungle called Chennai
Review: This Eco spot is on the Chetpet lake and the entry is on the west side from Poonamalee high road. The transformation of this lake from a dirty god forsaken lake into a clean and green eco park is amazing. Fantastic place for early morning walks and evening jogs and walks. Loads of green. Clean clean toilets. Nice modern boating spot. For Fishing lovers and anglers this is a great spot. A great place where the Chennaiites can be proud of.

Name: shrinikethv
Title: Excellent recreation spot
Review: Chetpet park is located just beside Chetpet Railway station. Excellent spot for recreation. Car parking facility is available. Entry fee is minimal. There is special memebrship for walkers. There is boating and fishing activites here. There are also eatable centres within the park. Great place for an evening walk with gentle breeze. Regular visitor here.

Name: Ramya S
Title: Very good park
Review: This is one of the most accessible parks with in the city, close to the Chetpet railway station. We enjoyed a lot in the park like walking,children play area  ,3d theatre and boating. we can spend more than three hours in the park. Recommended

Name: Aaqarsh Aiyyar
Title: Best recreation spot in Chennai
Review: I decided to spend a couple of hours with my family in this man-made lake and it turned out to be a golden decision. We enjoyed the stroll around the lake. The children's play area was perfect for my child. The 3d movies screened in the theatre were awesome. The icecreams from the Aavin ice cream parlour were delicious. The boating, though of short duration, was memorable. There is option for fishing also. Highly recommended.

Name: Selva G
Title: Superb...............
Review: Nice place to see all the Chennai city peoples..... Nice walking area with greenery (1.2KM), natural environmental, very clean, responsible staff and workers. angling, boating and 3D theater. its all made mostly eco friendly......

Name: behlah
Title: Very pleasant
Review: A breath of fresh air... An unexpectedly pleasant surprise... Smack in the middle of the busy Chennai city... It's worth your while.

Name: Ramkumar R
Title: Fine. Not much exciting.
Review: One time visit. Very near to chetpet railway station. Easy to reach. Pleasant place. Boating is available. Was good. nothing more exciting.

Name: Senthamizh Aras... G
Title: Chillax
Review: A artificially created lake in chetpet. Nearby to Kilpauk medical college. U have parking for two and four wheeler. The place has a boating spot. Fishing spot and a 3D theatre. Overall it's a bit costly compared to muttukadu.

Name: Manoj M
Title: Wow!!ecopark!!
Review: Woderful place it is!!! One can relax n spend peaceful time here... beautiful atmosphere in the heart of our Chennai.

Name: LostinItalyKuwait
Title: Chetput's Lungs
Review: A hidden gem tucked away beside  Chetput railway station and Kilpauk medical College. My wife and I are avid walkers so the walking track is a huge boon. It opens at 0430 in the morning  and again in the evening around 5 PM for walkers. Visitors can come between 10AM to 7 PM. The angling is fun - an activity my daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed. TIP: If you are a regular walker opt for the monthly pass for entry to the park and for your car.

Name: Arun
Title: New lake park in Chennai
Review: Chetpet Eco Park is recently built by Tamilnadu government on the Chetpet lake and they have food stalls, boating, fishing in here. You can spend a good time roaming around the lake and boating. You have separate entry fee and boating charges, for which you have to get bill from the entrance.People who like boating will enjoy in here and it is a good place in the city for tourists to visit when they come to Chennai.

Name: Prabhakar D
Title: Heart of Chennai with a lake,park, and fishing
Review: I can't believe my eyesnever thought the heart of Chennai can have thismultilevel parkingprofessional reasonable ticketing that prevents overcrowdingwell maintainedlife jackets for the boating 3D theater.. really impresseda nice snack bar that is clean and decently pricedIf you have not gone there please go

Name: Faiz A
Title: Good evening out for kids and couples
Review: Department of fishery had turned this lake into a boat house and park. Park entry fees is 25 for adults and 15 for kids. 50 for boating and 300 rupees for fishing (no time bar, u can use the ticket till u catch three fishes, but can't take the.fishes to home) a small play space for kids will entertain them. The garden and boating is good choice for couples and lovers. Camera s allowed, only mobile camera is.allowed. Camera will be allowed n future a source from management had said. A good budget outing for kids and family.

Name: NR873
Title: A very calm and nature filled place
Review: A good tourist spot in Chennai, especially for Central and North Chennai people. Neat and clean water.

Name: magneaske
Title: White man tax
Review: I want to see the lighthouse but can‚Äôt due to racism. Wondering when they will remove the white man tax.

Name: Radhika Narasimhan
Title: Jaw dropping lighthouse
Review: Seeing the lighthouse in Marina is not my first time visit. Being a Chennaite from childhood days I have been to the lighthouse many times. Still each time it appears new to me. History says to avoid crashing of ships near chennai, during British rule it was constructed. From 10am to 5pm tourist are allowed to climb the lighthouse. Views are great, sunset and sunrise are awesome while viewing the city on the other side is great. My all time favourite spot of chennai which I recently visited.

Name: Anand M
Title: Top View of a Top Beach
Review: Marina Beach, Chennai is by far among the best beaches in India. But, if you have not experienced it atop the Light House, you missed its breathtaking beauty. There is a museum there too. A very inconspicuous tower that you could easily ignore as you pass the road. And yet, as you experience its view it leaves behind an eternal impression of Chennai's uniqueness, history and beauty.

Name: %FastFlyer
Title: An easy landmark
Review: The beach here was off limits due to high surf. Many fisherman have boats along the shore. Great for photographers.

Name: 1777NT
Title: Unusual having a lift (sorry elevator for the Americans) in a lighthouse
Review: Unfortunately, not a very clear day, you could see possibly 5km and see the Marina Beach well enough

Name: Prem Kumar
Title: Amazing view to from the top
Review: I went to the light house with my friend it was really a great experience to view the city from the light house. The beauty of the marina and the road from that view was simply awesome. And the housing area view from the top as a treat to watch. And they have a charge of 20rs per person for viewing from the lighthouse. And i couldn't see the entire view since there was an issue with the honey bee in one section. The view of the chidambaram stadium and city centre was also the notable things to watch.

Name: #amosamiyanayeküéß
Title: üèñÔ∏è
Review: tiny park for kids as well as a musiuam along with the light house it is situated a with a small compound in between main road and the marina beach and very close to light  house railway station and city center mall... attractive place but be careful if you are along with kids lift facilities available if wish to visit to the top of the light house and due to croud try to visit before eve at 5.

Name: Ramya
Title: Spend an evening with kids
Review: has a lift and on the 9th floor is the viewing deck which is a bit narrow and crowded in peak times. Better to go before 5pm.

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: Great Light house to view the longest coast line &
Review: Chennai light house is a wonderful construction located at the end of Mareena Beach towards Santhome. Most of the people think its of no use going on top and there is not much to see. But it is an amazing opportunity to see the sea and the Mareena beach road from the top of the light house. It's an awesome experience that everybody should try.I strongly recommend you take your young children and explain the purpose of it. So it will be more intresting for young kids.

Name: Wil Chung
Title: Great views
Review: There is a lift to the top to see some great views. You cannot walk around the whole of the top (3 and a bit sides), but you can get a full 360 view.Very cheap - 50rs for foreigners whilst only 20 for Indians. But for 75p that's worth it.Not really anything else to do at the top so you only really spend 10 minutes or so before going back down.Well worth a visit if you're visiting the beach of the Mahata Ghandi statue at the same time.

Name: ST_INDIA
Title: One of the spot at big Marina beach
Review: This is just one of the spot at big marina beach. It‚Äôs an old light house and there is not much to do at that place other than it provide a nice view of the sea. It‚Äôs actually not a must have location to visit but still good to have.

Name: moogul818
Title: Nothing spectacular
Review: It is located at the end of Marina beach towards San Thome church. Though well maintained with an easy access, there was nothing spectacular about the lighthouse. You can stop for a few moments as you drive past.

Name: Sarma_nvny
Title: Must viist place in chennai for visitors outside from chennai
Review: A good view and nearby marina beach to enjoy with family and children can spend some quality of time with family, Evenings are good to spend

Name: Arun
Title: Beautiful view of sea from top
Review: My friend and I went on a weekend evening. It was a great experience though we had to come out quickly since we went at the closing timing. The view of the beach is spectacular and you will enjoy the scenic beauty of the beach and the road. There is also a small place at the bottom of the lighthouse that has the lighthouse museum. You can also find place to sit under tree and you have benches put in just like park. This place is a must visit for everyone who comes to Chennai.

Name: raj s
Title: LIGHT HOUSE ON MARINA BEACH
Review: Visited in march 2019 along  with family. Beautiful view from the top. Ships anchored in the sea seen. History of the light house mentioned on a tabloid.

Name: Othman S
Title: Local beach
Review: Sand beach . It's good to have a look only if you are around but not so attractive and worth to travel mileage to discover it .

Name: Deadman17
Title: Great views
Review: The Light House as the name suggests provides navigation lighting to the various ships in and around the Chennai port. The place allows visitors to have a 360 degree panoramic view of the Chennai city, the sea and the Marina beach. There is a queue to go to the top, with entry chargeable. One can go in the evening to enjoy a beautiful view of lit up Chennai city.

Name: TravellingSands
Title: Must See for Eagle's Eye View of Marina !
Review: You have to buy an entry ticket of Rs 10 for adults and Rs 5 for kids. Foreign Nationals Rs 25 per head. The topmost floor gives a panoramic view of Marina, the sea and skyline of Chennai

Name: Srinivas S
Title: Nice view
Review: It's again at the famous beach of Chennai. If you are allowed to reach the top, you can enjoy the nice view of the beach and surrounding city.

Name: Nanthakumar Ganesan
Title: Will get full marina view
Review: Will get full marina view..For adult i think cost is 40 to 50..More queue will be there..We need to wait for some time..Very good view from that light house

Name: Meharoof jaraad
Title: Light house.good for view.
Review: The light house is situated ij marina beach chennai good for high range view pf the whole chennai.many steps are there in the staircase to conquer the light house.the view is awesome.10 rupees is the entry fee.

Name: Ganga Y
Title: Chennai light house
Review: Good place to visit in the evening, as the sun is not disturbing you to have a great view of marina beach. Evening time from 3 to 6 only gates are open. Entry fee Rs20 for adults. Rs10 to children

Name: Meezanur R
Title: Have a full view of beach road
Review: Really a nice place to observe the city. You can watch the ocean till your eye reaches on one side and the city look on other side. The roads between the beach and the city looks really nice. Enjoy

Name: netovanethan
Title: A nice beach to spend a few hours
Review: close to all activities, you can see the fisherman's village, hore riding, have some local snacks. Warm water.

Name: Thomas J
Title: What a view
Review: Go up there and just enjoy the view throughout chennai and the beach. it was finally open after 2 attempts before, but worth every minute

Name: Mithu
Title: Lovely ambiance and food
Review: The place is very centrally located and beautifully done up. The service is personalised and the khowsuey is to die for!

Name: ravincarr
Title: Crowded, but the amazing views are worth the trouble
Review: I would highly recommend that you plan visit on a weekday afternoon (if possible). The views from the gallery are breathtaking and if you're a photography enthusiast, this is a great opportunity to get some great wide angle and telephoto shots! I wouldn't recommend the morning, because the sun being high in the East will ruin your beach shots.The lighthouse also has a small (air conditioned) museum in the ground floor with models of ancient and recent lighthouse instruments where you can spend a good 30 minutes.

Name: DrRakeshGandhi
Title: Best to watch beach view
Review: If someone wants to view whole of beach view from heights, then light house is perfect place to observe the same

Name: Val A
Title: ICONIC
Review: This part of the beach is so tranquil especially at night. Being February the valentine vibe was already in effect. Couples and families gather just to have a relaxing evening after a days work.   Lots of vendors selling good fresh food.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Famous beach
Review: The light house in on the marina beach,which is the longest beach of this world.people were allowed to climb up the house but has a nominal entry fees for a visit.the view from top is so beautiful.

Name: Eimaan
Title: Great beach and area to visit. Horse back riding, games and more.
Review: Great beach area with horse back riding, games and lively atmosphere. Ride the man powered carousel, its super fun.

Name: Valavanur Natar... K
Title: Write up of Chennai light house on the Marina
Review: If a visitor to Chennai or for that matter a local resident,  has never had a birds eye view or a Panaromic view of Chennai's east Coromandel coast line with  its vast beach (the 2nd longest in the world) it is best done from the watch  tower of the light house,  on Kamarajar Salai or Marina beach road as it is the closest tower nearer to the beach front .As for the purpose of the light house itself ,it may not hold great importance for providing  navigational  direction for modern ships as they  are  now equipped with  GPS, radar and other modern  electronic devises for finding directions at sea for heading to the port of Chennai .But Fishermen ,  venturing into deep  sea with trawlers with no GPS ,  would still depend on this light house beacon with unified set of  timing between two powerful beam of  revolving  light , to identify the land mark of Chennai port . Mahabalipuram  lighthouse to south of Chennai and 60 kms is the next nearest to this and has  a differential timing for light beacon.This would help Fishermen  living along the long coast to easily return to their hamlet using this beacons. It's interesting to trace  the history of light house in  Chennai. Chennai has had four light houses in the past.The history of the Madras Lighthouse dates back to 1795. In 1796, the roof of the Officers Mess in what is now known as Fort St George, was selected as the site for the first warning beacon. It was nothing more than a large lantern. To be more specific, the first Light House of Chennai functioned (1796 ‚Äì 1841) at the Building in the Fort St George where the Fort Museum is located.The second light house was erected between the 1838 and 1844 on the north side of Fort St George.Light House (Old), ChennaiThis lighthouse operated until 1894. Though its lantern room was removed long ago to fit in the third light house also located in the Madras High Court Complex, the Tower stands tall even today.The third light House was functioning from the tallest dome of the Madras High Court. It started functioning on June 1, 1894, with argand lamps and reflectors manufactured by Chance Bros, Birmingham which had originally been installed in the 160-ft-tall lighthouse tower.The present light House  is located opposite the office of the Director General of Police and was opened in January 1977. It is one of the few lighthouses in the world and the only one in India with an elevator.The Mahabalipuram  lighthouse near chennai was located in Mamallapuram and It was open to tourists since 2011. It was closed in 2001 following perceived LTTE threat. The first light was commissioned here in 1887. The lighthouse with a circular masonry tower made of natural stone became fully functional in 1904. India's oldest lighthouse, built around 640 AD by Pallava king Mahendra Pallava stands next to this modern structure. The Pallava era lighthouse is a protected monument, maintained by the Archaeological SurveyThe Chennai light house is open for tourists on all days except Mondays and the fee is very nominal Rs 10 for children Rs 20 for adults and Rs 50 for foreigners ( I wonder why this disparity) This includes a stroll through the museum in it .Camera will be charged extra at Rs 25 .It has adequate number of car parking and two wheelers parking space .I would caution visitors to gather avoid the South view as it would be a little depressing .

Name: Gene R J
Title: Easy access to a great overview of Chennai.
Review: After visiting the 1842 Ice House, we crossed the 1000' wide Marina Beach to see the wooden fishing boats. Looking south we could see the 150' Lighthouse built in 1977, just a short walk away.  After paying $3, we joined 6 locals and the elevator operator for the 3 minute lift to the 9th floor, then climbed another story to reach the viewing platform.  What a wonderful view. Quickly down, and walk to the back to see its small museum showing old lights from the previous lighthouses (1796 & 1894), where there are clean restrooms. This inexpensive activity is all good news.

Name: Anusuya D
Title: Height house
Review: Light house is located at marina beach and also near to party's corner and Chennai railway station. We can view the scenery from top. Entrance fee is collected nominally for viewing this

Name: Manoj Kumar C V
Title: The Chennai light house
Review: The Chennai light house is about 5km from the Central Railway station. The entry fee here is 20 INR. There is fee for camera also. 9 stories is covered in Lifts and one stare on foot. The view from the light house is amazing. The beauty of Marina beach is seen here right up to the Anna Square. Do not miss it when you are around. There is a small museum behind it maintained by Government which displays various lamps and other equipments.

Name: Saurabh Srivastav
Title: Imposing & eyecatching structure
Review: It is an iconic structure of town but the good part for tourists is that the entry fee is just Rs.20/- .The view from there is a treat.It's built about 42 year back and hence is modern in the sense that it has an elevator which takes you to the ninth floor - the maximum allowed for visitors.So one neednot sweat in climbing stairs all way up.It is said to be totally solar powered too.

Name: sathish
Title: One of a kind
Review: Must visit as one of a kind in India. Views from the gallery are great. Collecting tickets and moving up to the viewing platform is hassle free. Older people may need some support for the stairs leading to the viewing platform

Name: Mukta2016
Title: A Nice Light House
Review: The light house is located at the end of the Marina Beach. The light house is open to visitors and the view of the entire Marina Beach from the light house is very scenic.

Name: ARUN63512
Title: NICE
Review: It is in the corner near the marina beach, nice to spend time and have a nice view. just opposite to the beach.

Name: Ollossm
Title: amazing views
Review: You get some really amazing views from the top.Lift access to the viewing level but be warned there is some steep steps and it is very narrow on the walkway.Definitely is "must see" or "must do" when you are in Chennai

Name: TheWorldNut
Title: Very nice view
Review: You can't have a better view of Marina beach then one from the top of this light house. There is an elevator followed by fewflights of steps to reach to the top. Not much space on the top viewing platform, hence if crowded this can be not so much fun but given there were not many people on a Sunday afternoon, one can safely take a chance. Neverthless the views from the top is great and, you can see a great expanse of the sea, follwed by the sand and then a nicely urbanized stretch. Quite a good view I must say. The viewing platform is grilled but still be careful with very small kids. Just fyi - They don't allow bags inside, which has to be kept with the guard outside and cameras (even the big DSLRs) are allowed for a fee.

Name: Mukesh Asher
Title: Must visit
Review: A very good place to visit. The management is good. One has to buy a ticket of Rs 20/- to go up. The museum was closed for maintenance when I visited. The view from the  viewing gallery is very good, both of the Marina beach & Chennai City.

Name: DayaMass
Title: "Nice View"
Review: This is wonderful lighthouse in the corner of the beach.This might house has 9-10 floors.But the last floor has the best view of the city.From that u can the world's second longest beach and Coramandel queen's pride Marina beach.From there u can see the city's tallest buildings.This has an entry fee 30-50 rippers.And also u can know about the history of lighthouse in chennai at the ground floor which is printed and pasted in a banner in the wall.

Name: HappySheep
Title: Light house
Review: A prominent landmark and feature with its distinctive red and white paintwork, near the coast and beaches.

Name: Ruth M
Title: Ancient Architecture
Review: This amazing and beautiful light house stands proudly near by the world famous Marina Beach area. Built during the British Colonial era and stand still proudly high. A beauty!!

Name: EnigmaticIndia
Title: Great view
Review: Nice place to visit as the view from the 9th floor is really nice. One can see the Marina beach, further down the Port trust, the vast Bay of Bengal and parts of Chennai. Dont worry there's a lift to take you to that height. However the space at the top is less and even with less crowd it was a tight squeeze.

Name: Maruthu
Title: Very good museum
Review: You can get a very good view of Marina and the city from here that too at a reasonable fare of Rs. 20 per adult. It has got a very good air conditioned museum, which will take you back to the olden days of light house. Worst part here is restroom smells very bad and very poorly cleaned and maintained!

Name: DevinderSinghChawla
Title: Light House
Review: This is the second Light House I have visited. It is right on the Marina Beach Road, Chennai, India. It is easily approachable. from the top you can have a very beautiful view of Marina Beach. Due to its bright colour it is easily nocticeable. Nice new place to visit.

Name: FaruqFaisel
Title: Nice view of the Indian ocean.
Review: We went to the Marina beach. Visited the fish market and by chance noticed the light house. Not easy to go there as it is part of the Navy HQ.

Name: Michael Anbumani
Title: Majestic!
Review: This Light House stands majesticall along the Marina Beach and you will not miss it. Beautiful and eye catching. Amazing decades old architecture still stands strong.

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Upper View
Review: There is a light house situuated at Marina beach.We were taken there by our local friend. You get a nice aerial view of Marina beach.

Name: Pradeep K
Title: Spectacular views
Review: The lighthouse in Chennai on the Marina beach is often missed by most tourists and many locals. But if you are visiting the marina beach, it‚Äôs worth spending a few extra minutes to go up Marina to the light house for spectacular views of Chennai.  Adults pay INR 20 and children 10 for taking the lift to the 9th floor (by the way, this is the only lighthouse with a lift open to public in India). Walk up one more floor and you get a 360‚Ä¢ view of the sea and the city. Even on hot afternoons the top of the lighthouse is breezy and cool.

Name: Anusree P
Title: Good view of beach
Review: nice. You should go in an evening. with the cool breeze, you can enjoy the beauty of marina beach. Nice place to visit

Name: vasan224
Title: land mark for marina
Review: It is a famous landmark on the Marina Beach in Chennai, India. nice place to see the beach from the light house.

Name: Preeti S
Title: Sea and city view
Review: Atop the lighthouse one gets scenic view of Chennai city and Marina beach. Best time to visit is evening

Name: Praveenop
Title: Great view of the city if you go in the morning.
Review: This place is great. It ven has a lift to take you up. The view of the city was worth it. Did you know that this place has a nice airconditioned guest how in it ?!!! I was shocked to know this.

Name: ishaque
Title: Top of the chennai!
Review: I had visited this place in weekday.Its been a very nice experience to visit this heritage light house which is almost 59 meters tall above the ground.Once you reached the top floor of it you will find a wide view of marina beach and city centre.Ticket cost : 15 INR general25 INR with camera.

Name: reddi_traveller
Title: Light House Mylapore
Review: Great  view and the ticket pricing is also very cheap, affordable.. With a great amazing view of the marina beach and Elevator is available and the best time to view is evenings with good quality time,.

Name: Paloma_Rao
Title: Go to the top!
Review: Went right to the top and was certainly not disappointed by the AMAZING view! Gave me a whole different perspective of Chennai!

Name: rishabhjhawar
Title: Great view, affordable tickets,different experience, Must Visit
Review: Its one of the few lighthouses in the world with a elevator and probably the only working one in the city limits.Located on the marina beach. Its a 10 floor structure, with radar and beacon(light source) on 10th Floor. 10th floor is accessible to visitors. 9th is a viewing galary open for visitors. The viewing gallery gives a best view of sea on one side and Chennai on the other. Best time to visit would be in evening but before 6pm. The place closes on 6pm. Great photo opportunities for photo seekers with cool sea breeze to enjoy.Very affordable tickets(Rs. 20 for adult)Recommended for all age people as elevator is built in.Despite of elevator, you will need to manage 10-15 stairs.

Name: Abdul wahaab
Title: Must visit place
Review: Visitors are allowed to see the light house on timing basis. .the ticket rate is affordable . Best view of marina can be seen from its top ..the acces for the top can be through steps or lift ..must visit place

Name: Noorul Q
Title: Look of Ocean
Review: very nice view if visited at 4 to 6 in evening. Seems seeing the whole world standing and the coastal breeze is quiet awesome.

Name: Suhail Rafat
Title: Nice view
Review: Cool place to unwind in evening along with a good road to take a stroll. Nice view but should be with family or friends to enjoy

Name: Rakesh B
Title: Nice beach In Chennai
Review: Marina beach is second longest flat beach in Asia. Neat & Clean. It also has Food stalls which serve nice foodies.

Name: Hasan Khan
Title: Must visit
Review: It's a must visit place when visiting Chennai. One can also go to the upper deck to enjoy a complete city and ocean view. Open until 6:00 pm.

Name: Nirmal
Title: bird view point of chennai
Review: here you can view almost entire chennai from the top of the light house. this was closed for around 20 years, but recently they engaged more safety for the public and opened the view point from top of the satellite. a lovely experience

Name: H053R
Title: Top of the Town Feel !!
Review: Worth visiting this place, you can get tickets at the entrance for 20 INR.open from 3 to 5:30pm. the view it gurantees will be the take away. Awesome View.sea breeze will hit you hard and nice, and the beach road and coastline view till harbour is awesome, the view of sea with few ships anchored adds the beauty and other side you can see the busy chennai city buildings and if lucky sunset .At basement you have a small viewing gallery of earlier generation light houses and the technical aspects of it.

Name: B R S
Title: Old Memories
Review: Old Memories came by as we halted at this place to take a look. I recalled my visit to the Viewing Gallery way back in 1979 with a good friend of mine. We came here on our bicycles and went up by the elevator. The staff who came up with us gave us several technical details and the  only details I recalled is that this Light has a range of 32 Nautical Miles.

Name: pnssnp
Title: still working
Review: unlike many other light houses in the country, this one is still in working condition and continues to guide ships and boats

Name: Free@will
Title: Bird's eye view
Review: Ticket per adult costs 20 bucks. Worth a visit. The elevator takes one 9 storeys up. Then after a flight of stairs one can get to the top. The views are amazing. The vast and endless sea is awesome. A panoramic view of coastal Chennai can be experienced. The light house closes at 6.00 pm. The viewing platform could get crowded but then the crowd keeps moving so plenty of time to click those photos üòäüòäüòä

Name: FlyBoyBoston
Title: Good views of beach and ocean
Review: The views of the beach and ocean from the top of the light house are great, however there is not much room for tourists up in the light house, so it was very crowded when we went up.  Some of these Indian tourist sites also have annoying rules about not taking photographs - this is one of those sites, but everyone up in the light house ignored this rule.  It is relatively inexpensive to take the elevator up, so by all means take 20 minutes, check out the lighthouse, then walk the beach.

Name: MumbaiIndia
Title: Good Photostop
Review: This is located right on the Marina Beach.  Its a fairly tall structure and could be a good photo stop for you.  The Area around the lighthouse is not clean and needs maintainance

Name: scorpionchennai
Title: Have a penchant to view light house
Review: if you have a penchant for light house which are very rare and less to see then this one is worth seeing.

Name: Rohit M
Title: Adones the Beach
Review: It is indeed amazing to cover vast marina beach line .It does present a good sight to stroll down the beach in last dusk though you wont be able to do anything except walk .SO either you go evening on Marina and enjoy beach waters or you go late night to have a beautiful looking light house

Name: vibhadhamija
Title: Appears grand
Review: While I missed the top view as i hit marina beach in late  evening and was raining heavy still I made sure to reach Marina beach .It does dawn a beautiful look to Marina.IF you are visiting marina I would suggest to definitely explore this one .Marina is quite huge beach in rankings in Marina and if you want to have a good view of sea ,Chennai city its a perfect choice for family outing every once a while

Name: Hilarian_Felix
Title: The Chennai Light house
Review: The Chennai Light House is one of the oldest light houses in chennai and is located inside the Marina Beach.The Light House is open for public and this one of the most flown area of tourists from several parts of the country and world since it is located inside the Marina Beach.Its approximately 130ft to 160ft height not sure of the exact height.It has the meteorological department which is open to public for viewing now though it was restricted earlier.This Light house has an elevator.Also few tamil movies have been shot in this light house.

Name: Rachna S
Title: A nice walk to the beach!
Review: This lighthouse can make anybody‚Äôs world go round during evening especialy when it is all lit up!It came across my way when i was talking a walk to the marina beach in chennai, couldnt resist learning more about this lighthouse then!Absolutely not a must visit but absolutely shouldnt be skipped incase you are planning to go marina!

Name: Nigel G
Title: Amazing Views from the Balcony
Review: This is a modern lighthouse which will be of interest to the lighthouse buff. There is no access to the light or the top of the structure but from the balcony you get a good view of the beach.I can only imagine it's true beauty as it was a grey blustery day when I was there yesterday. Notwithstanding, an interesting place to visit with ample parking at the side opposite the beach.

Name: Nomad
Title: Good view of the beach and ocean
Review: It was breezy and free of noise from ground level. We were able to have good elevated view of the beach, beach road and Tamil Nadu state's police headquarters. We were not allowed into the top most floor that housed the lamp and its associated mechanics. There wasn't a lot of space as it was more like an 'U' shaped narrow balcony. Clear sunny day is a must for good experience. There was a small museum on the ground floor which we peeked our heads into and found unappealing so skipped to the exit.

Name: jawa13
Title: Marina beach beginning
Review: Chennai Marian beach starts here. A good place to go for a walk or run. Start from here and go all the way to Anna square for a 5k run or walk

Name: Surya Katakam
Title: Very Good View of City from this Light House
Review: I never knew about this light house before visiting to this place, that they are allowing people to top of this light House. They are charging INR 20/- per Indian Citizen as ticket and for DIGI Camera is INR 25/-. Luggage bags are not  allowed to top of this light house. We will have good view of Marina Road and Beach from this light House. Must visit this place. Either Morning or Evening will be  right time to gave good views.

Name: Lilian J
Title: Sky view
Review: Great place to get a bird's eye view of  Chennai city and the long Marina beach. You also get a lovely breeze and can access the place on a lift.

Name: Balasubramanian R
Title: Chennai Light house
Review: Light House is situated on the sea shore of bay of bengal. It is in Mylapore and on the beach road. Light house is tall and you can reach top through lift. This helps ship and fishermen to identify chennai land area. Long time back light house was in High court and the present one was constructed in the beach. it is opposite to All India radio station, Chennai and nearby Inspector General Police office.

Name: Ankur_Rishi
Title: Small lighthouse to have a view of beach and some city
Review: This is a nice tiny little building ( compared to other lighthouses) on chennai marina beach. loosely maintained and offers a view of some chennai parts and the beach across the road.

Name: YashiR25
Title: NOT SO GOOD
Review: It is just a tall well-maintained building near to sea. You don't get the hang of a light house as the lift takes you directly to the top floor from where you could see the ball-structured Marine Department Building located at Parrys.SHALL be avoided if planning to/ or have been to Mahabalipuram Light house where you climb the circular stairs.Of course, there happens to be an entrance fee to cover the operational costs.

Name: Olivier R
Title: Interesting view if sky is clear
Review: It doesn't cost much and takes half an hour at most, so I'd say to go if you want an overall view of Chennai and the Bay of Bengal. Unfortunately, when we went there, the sky wasn't clear due to a little smog so the view wasn't so great. Nonetheless it was an interesting sight.

Name: Vijay
Title: Light House Opens up Again!!!
Review: As a small kid, I had gone on top. Then it was banned. Now after almost 20 years later, on top of it again. What a charming look of Sea, the Marina, Wow. Only problem is small space to move about or take pictures. But view is spell bound. Must Visit

Name: tyag_1984
Title: very well maintained
Review: very good place. unfortunately public not allowed inside the tower. so had to spend time outside. maintained well

Name: ajcruzing
Title: If you are a Sucker for Views DON'T miss it !
Review: Hi i am AJCruz (@ajcruzing)this is the lighthouse OUTSIDER , TRAVELLER :-I Recommend going to the lighthouse and actually going "TO THE TOP"By the Evening time you can get the sunlight from in the city comeout towards the sea really a GOOD VIEW to pay your 20 Rupees (0.5 USD) There is a Lift which will take you up .If You are like me i.e. "COOL" , Then walk up if it is open .you know this is like the FAKE version of Burjkhalifa's "AT THE TOP" by the beach .INSIDER :Just go there , i know youare sitting there in yourHOME SWEET HOME knowing that the lighthouse is just here we can go anytime and , you never go there .Just go enjoy have fun .Thank You For Reading .AJCruz .

Name: hareesha1
Title: Nice experience
Review: You can enjoy a great view of chennai and the sea from the top floor of the lighthouse.  There is an entry fee of Rs. 20 per head.  A lift carries you from the ground to the top floors and vice versa.  Though the top floor gets crowded,  the experience as a whole is a great one

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: Must see
Review: Its awesome to go to the top and see things around.Easily accessible as local trains stop here and can be reached easily by bus and marina beach is near as well

Name: samadhanamhopek
Title: Tamil Nadu 2017
Review: Lovely structure just off the Marina Beach - wonderful landmark well kept and standing tall , cannot miss it.

Name: GrannyMaa
Title: Panoramic view of Beach
Review: Please check for timings before you head for the Light House near Gandhi Beach. It also has entry fees. View from top balcony is hair-blowing and simply awesome. best time 5-6pm in evening when sun is slowly setting in horizon. You can enjoy cool sea breeze and get good view of the sea-shore.

Name: Praveen K
Title: one museum too.
Review: this light house also has a museum which exhibits the equipment used during the olden days to guide ships. one can also take a life to the highest floors of the light house to get a great view of the sea.

Name: Mukund65
Title: Must Visit
Review: It is good experience to view the beach from the height of 8 floors. Nice point to see whole of the Marina beach and the road along.

Name: Praveen S
Title: visit atleast once before you leave
Review: It is the highest view point for beach, once you enter marina you can able to see this light house, when we went to top, we able to see the city

Name: krishna p
Title: Light house for Boats
Review: This is situated at the Marina beach sea bank in Chennai  this is placed only to show the direction of land for the boats and ships which are inside of the sea the light can be seen from 30-40 nautical miles inside of the sea.

Name: amohanro
Title: LIGHTHOUSE
Review: This is again an iconic landmark of Chennai.  Anyone going to the beach glances at it at least once before they leave.  It's that iconic.  There was a time when people were allowed to climb right to the top, but a few suicides in the 1970-80s put paid to that and it's next to impossible now to get a view from the top unless until you are a crow.

Name: Gugan_Ilango
Title: Symbol of marina beach
Review: the light house the symbol of marina beach. its beauty building to do some HDR photos. a must visit early morning to catch the sun rise

Name: samvarth
Title: Must watch place
Review: this place will give you goosebumps. Dont go if you have fear of heights.Easy to go via local train or bus and good to go in the evening.

Name: Baggywrinkle75
Title: Lots of history here, St Mary's has incredible memorials
Review: For those history buffs this is a must see. Muck of Britain's involvement in India can be seen in this place, lots of background the the East India Company which had the words biggest private army and trade block in its time.St Mary's is chock full of memorials to those who lived, served and died here. Some very tragic one with regards the wives of those who were here.Beware: Entrance is now by an online ticket. My driver used his phone to buy and I reimbursed him. I'm guessing this is due to security in the area as a large part of the fort is still in use by the military as well as locl Govt.

Name: Richard G
Title: Family History
Review: I wandered around there in the late 1970s when it was mainly Government Offices. At that time I was not aware that a Ggreat XXX Uncle, William Anderson, was a British Army Private there, in 1837. In the 45 Regiment. Wonderful old Buidings and nice to see some history preserved.

Name: Hooray H
Title: Superb
Review: At least they are maintaining a bit of very important History.Located in a secure Government area so your driver has to wait outside, if you have one.One of the first British Forts in India & played a very important role in the Colonial rule.The museum is closed one day a week, so do check.Behind it is a local cafe & a nice little shop selling all kinds of cotton products at ridiculously low prices.

Name: Andy_Bickley
Title: Interesting history, but lacking in facilities
Review: You have to get through government security to get into the place.  It contains some interesting things relating to the early history of the East India Company.  You have to go out into the civil service areas to get a tea or find a toilet

Name: Dwightcr
Title: Historic and worth a visit for colonial history
Review: This fort built for colonial administration and defense of Madras.  It was the first English fortress in India, founded in 1644.  It now includes state administration, a informative museum and a very old historic church.

Name: Mrudula
Title: White Town
