Review: The temple is situated on ECR, near to Mayajaal Resort (Place called Kanathur ). Almost 30 KM from Chennai Airport. This is the road which goes to Mahabalipuram and Pondicherry. Temple is close to the sea also. You can take 5 min walk from the temple to reach the sea beach. The temple is managed by a group of retried people and most of them are from Odissa.The ambience is good and very peacfull. There is one Anand Bhavan next to the temple where you can get Odiya Food. Overall a nice place to visit with family.

Name: rea2der
Title: Jagannath temple
Review: The temple is situated in the outskirt of the city.The temple is very well maintained.The ambience is good.It is the replica of Puri temple.Some nicely carved idols are also found in the temple.A small shivan temple is also located inside.The names of those who contributed to the temple are written in steps.Overall a nice place to visit with family.

Name: av apte
Title: Nice to see Orissa Culture
Review: This is a temple located a little outside Chennai and on the coast. Easily accessible by bus or own transport. It has been built in the traditional Orissa fashion and daily pujas are done by priests from Orrisa. Nicely maintained garden. Best to visit in the evening.

Name: Nisi Kant P
Title: Best place for family....
Review: Dear all,one of the best place for family. Spend time sorrounding, and dont forget to go on Rath yatra....

Name: Arnab R
Title: Well maintained temple and very peaceful
Review: The temple is very small but well maintained. The ambience is good. The temple is situated in the outskirt of the city and that's why I spent some good and peaceful time over there. Far from all the noises. It's worth visiting it.

Name: Rajesh S
Title: Good place for local oriyas.
Review: The place is managed by some retired babus.. I find them frequenting the place. You can strike good conversation with them. The odia purohita is a decent man. Visiting the place during festival time is always a pleasure.

Name: Sumithra R
Title: Small temple but is quite well-maintained and is peaceful
Review: It's a little difficult to find and it's outside city limits. It actually works in my favor, because there are rarely any visitors (except on auspicious days). It's a very small temple but if you want some peace and quiet, it's worth visiting it. (There's some construction work going on right now which makes it difficult to take nice pictures, but I think it'd be over soon)

Name: muraliaryan62
Title: Jagannath ki Jai
Review: I had the feeling of Puri temple . well maintained temple. Pity of secular India if any Hindu temple maintained well and devotees coming is heavy it will be taken by the Govt .

Name: KumarJUN
Title: Replica of Puri Jagannath temple in Chennai
Review: Regularly visit Puri Jagannath temple..well maintained and is situated in a beautiful location close to the seashore. One can enjoy the evening breeze. i was fortunate to enjoy the dance performance of the Odysey dance ( classical dance of Orissa / Odisha now)More about Lord Krishna and his tales. expressive..The temple is clean and the grass lawns too is a visual treat to our eyesThe prasadam or anna danam is also a good practice here

Name: ChinmayHota
Title: Far from the madding crowd
Review: Far from the hustle and bustle of the city, the temple complex dedicated to Lord Jagannath and his siblings Balabhadra and Subhadra, is an island of tranquility, and sheer bliss. Once upon a time there used to be only one Jagannath temple, located at the original kshetra, Puri in Odisha. Over centuries many princely states built temples for the revered deity at their capitals. Now that the royals are gone, the responsibility of building Jagannath temples at different locations have been assumed voluntarily by the common devotees. The Kanathur temple is one such attempt.The big compound is very well maintained with a mandap at the entrance, the sanctum sanctorum built in style of Puri original at the centre and lush green lawns and garden plants all around. The Garuda Pillar facing the deities is imposing and beautifully carved. There is a small structure dedicated to Kanchi Ganesh on the left of the complex, a statue of Buddha, also on left,  and a nice lotus design water tank at the back. Jagannath culture also assimilated the Buddhist philosophy, and it is said that the deity at Puri has the tooth of Buddha hidden in his naval.The priests are from Odisha and I found them to be very sincere in their worship. The temple can organize various types of pujas or rituals for you at different fees, which are displayed on a board.Not far from the temple complex is a quiet beach, which I found as peaceful as the temple with no visitors. It looked like a fishing beach with many small boats dotting the place.The place where you have to take a left turn from the ECRoad if you are coming from Chennai is easy to miss if you do not look for the traffic police signs and bikes there. The turning is near a fish market. Take flowers from here, beacuse they may not be available near the temple. The 150 metres road leading upto the next turn for the temple is crowded, rough and somewhat dirty. Ignore it and press ahead, because what awaits you will leave you cleansed internally.

Name: Aaqarsh Aiyyar
Title: South India‚Äôs own Puri
Review: This newly constructed temple, conceivably the cleanest temple of Chennai, is located at about 400 metres from Kanathur (ECR road) and is the new home of Puri Jagannath (of course along with Balabhadra and Subhadra). I had been to puri last year and had to wait for long hours in queue to meet my little friends. This temple is less explored and so getting Jagannath's appointment was much easier.The temple also houses Kasi Vishwanath (Lord Shiva), Kanchi Ganesha, Mother Basil (Tulsi or Tulasi) and navagrahas (surprisingly in human form). The atmosphere is serene and it would be nice to spend some time out in the green lawn and enjoy the sea breeze. My advice to travelers is to avoid the beach closer to the shrine (about 200 meters), for it is one of the filthiest I've witnessed and more over you stand a good chance of getting bitten by crabs.

Name: ankur007
Title: Good Replica of Original Temple
Review: Its bit far off from the city on the famous ECR road on the sea shore of Bay of Bengal. The Jagannath followers have tried to make it an exact replica of Original temple in Odisha.

Name: Raj K
Title: A very small and very clean temple
Review: Not a usual south indian temple. Feels peaceful to be in this place. Don't specifically plan and come for this temple. If you are on a ride in ECR, you can visit here for a short period of time. You can spend a max of 20mins for this temple. Clean toilets too are there. A very clean and well maintained temple.

Name: ashwinimail1992
Title: truly divine
Review: This temple is definitely on the must-visit list.The truly awesome and divine environment , the lush green lawns , the sea breeze  enables us to connect to GOD.Totally recommended to those on the spiritual search mode. Don't forget to visit Poseidon(beach :p) which is just 200 metres away!!! :)

Name: Ashwinreghu
Title: Simple yet Divine...
Review: An hours drive from Chennai city, situated close to Mayajaal complex. Take the left turn at the fish market junction before mayajaal. Ideal visiting time.. 6 30 to 7 30.... Also, can add ISKCON temple to your trip after completing pooja here.

Name: BALASHOTELREVIEW
Title: Balas Jagannath temple visit
Review: I have visited the ancient Jagannath temple in Puri, Orissa state in India and this temple in Chennai-Kanathur is a replica. This temple is located close to Mayajal a recreation center on East Coast Road.  ThisTemple is very beautifully built and well maintained. People who cannot go to Puri in the state of Orissa can visit this temple and have a dharshan of lord Jagannath.

Name: Pooja_RN
Title: Serene.... If only it was within city limits
Review: Beautiful Temple, dedicated to Lord Jagannath. Its probably the only temple in India which is completely made of granite. Clean, serene and with spacious..... The right place topause and mediate or to simply get rejuvenated. If only it was within the city, my visits would have been 10 folds.

Name: AdventuresSoul
Title: Tranquil and Serene
Review: My first stint of outing after shifting from Bangalore to Chennai.I was indeed taken aback by the fact of my friend's horrifying tales about the coastal city Chennai. Minus the heat everything seems okay for me in the first place.But I must say the place I visited with my friends worth a visit for everybody staying in Chennai.It's just a 20 Mins drive from Thiruvanmiyur on the ECR Road towards Mahabalipuram.You can go by bike, Car & as well as in busses, there are frequent buses from Thiruvanmiyur Bus Depot.The drive itself was an enjoyable one on the ECR.It was Saturday when we visited the temple, expecting a little bit more crowd than the usual days but to our shear surprise it was not that crowded.That eventually went well for the beautiful n serene place.You can feel a sense of purity & calmness.They tried to keep it simple & make it as similar to The Jagannath Temple in Puri & they successed  in that also.I wish, it could only keep an eye on the road connecting from ECR to the Temple, as that was really filthy, thanks to the local people.Apart from that everything else was divine.And of course they do have an AnandBazar preparing the famous "Abadha" (the traditional prasad).One meal per person costs 70/-. Try to book prior. As they make food only call on service basis to avoid the wastage of Prasad.Visit once in a while & I bet you'll love it.

Name: Abhik_85
Title: A little abode in tranquility !!
Review: Many people don't know about this place and probably that why this place so Calm and peaceful. I visited this temple by luck. I was on my way to Mahabalipuram and i was talking to my driver about the crowd in India. He only suggested to visit this place. The temple was built in resemblance Jagannath Temple of Puri. The Priest of the temple are mostly from Orissa. The place is less crowded and surrounded by a well-maintained garden.

Name: Neo123456
Title: Peaceful and less crowded
Review: I went there while coming back from Mutthukadu. Its a very nice and clean temple, looks like it is a newly built one...Its very clean and very well managed. You can very well sit there and pray for as much longer as you want..The nice smell of pooja material makes it feel really good...Recommended place for light headed people...

Name: suraghavan
Title: Mini Orissa
Review: All people who have not had the opportunity to visit the original,this place is very good . The priest are from Orissa and is in the sea front.

Name: Narayanan S
Title: very good and inspiring
Review: My wife and I were hunting for a house for a friend of ours - this was in June this year. The driver asked us if we would like to visit Puri Jagannath Temple. Ofcourse we were eager and he took us to the temple at Kanathur. It was near mid-day and the they were performing the pooja. It was just magnificient. Later one of the founders of the temple (Retired professor from IIT, Chennai) helped us with an archana and later explained how the temple was built and how they followed the example of the temple at Puri. It was just great. The temple was great, the deities were inspiring and the surrounding was spotlessly clean. It is a temple worth going frquently

Name: sanamis
Title: Feel the tranquility and divinity
Review: The simplicity , tranquility and spiritual atmosphere. Have a look at the intertwined trees on the left side (near ganesh temple , in front of Shiva temple) and the animal figures under the tree. the structure of the temple is also great.

Name: Manisha
Title: Wonderful Place..!!
Review: Beautiful , Peaceful, Calm and quite environment. I would love to spend anyday here. The place is little inside, but its worth a visit. Many religious gatherings happen here. The amount of crowd who visited the temple during Ratha Yatra was fabulous. There was prasad and lunch arranged for every single individual. Nobody left the tmple empty stomach. Proper security was also arranged to eep the crowd in control. Every single function is done here. Every occassion celebrated. Next to temple is the ECR beach. Excellent location to spend a day with family.

Name: RajeshKumar_V
Title: Good temple
Review: Located away from Chennai on the ECR road, way towards Mayajal or Pondicherry.  Good temple and can be accessible through public transport or share autos.  A half a kilometer distance from the main road.

Name: SRamnath
Title: A replica of Puri
Review: This shrine is a replica of the famed Puri Jagannath temple at Orissa.For those who cant make it to the temple there it is a very nice place of worship not far from the city

Name: saty427
Title: Serene and Different!
Review: I went with my little sister in the evening:) temple timings for evening is 3.30-7.30. It's great peaceful environment. While returning, we saw Owls also;)

Name: anupdey
Title: A temple you may visit
Review: A silent place, very near to the sea, few hundred meters away from the shore. People with spiritual value can visit this place.  The structure is similar to the one in Puri and Orissa. Pooja is done by Pandit. Once you enter the temple, on the left water taps have been provided for washing your hands and legs before entering the sannadhis. Every sannidhi has been provided the walking path to avoid walking on the grass.The Jagannath Temple is located in Reddy Kuppam Road, Kanathur, Chennai. The temple around 1 km away from the main road (ECR Road) and comes after the Mayajaal bus stop.Get down in Kanathur bus stand in ECR Road. Opposite to Maayajal is a roadside fish market. Take that road and on the first right you will find the sign board directing to the temple

Name: G.Visukumar
Title: Peaceful temple
Review: Very near to sea shore and architecture is excellent. you can fell cool breeze during early morning and evening prayers time. Very clean and well maintained.

Name: sugato_11
Title: Nice, peaceful place...
Review: First of all its great to have a Jaganath Temple in Chennai. The architecture is simple but beautiful. Its a very calm and peaceful place. Every evening during 6.30- 7.00 "aarti" takes place which reminds us of the abode of Lord Jaganath Temple, Puri...The temple is very well maintained and the priests and trust people must be congratulated for a commendable job..

Name: GOWRISHANKAR
Title: One with different architecture
Review: The temple is entirely different in architecture and most calm place. You have the god and goddess similar to poori temple.  They have a fish tank with lot many fishes where you can feel the fish spa experience free of cost.

Name: Indubala
Title: Replica of Puri Jaganath
Review: I was amazed to see the temple at chennai. It gives you the feeling that you went to the Puri Jagannath temple itself. Very calm place allows you to maintain your peace and medidate. This place is in Kanathur,off ECR Road.

Name: Madhumita
Title: Serene spiritual spot
Review: The temple is accessible from ECR. Right after the Kanathur sign board, on the left hand side og the road (if you are driving towards Mamallapuram)  there are directions drawn on a wall that led us to this place. What attracted me the most was the calm and peaceful environment. The temple is remarkably clean. The architecture is beautiful. The temple complex consists of a main shrine that houses Lord Jagannath, Balaram and Subhadra and several smaller shrines dedicated to deities Laxmi, Ganesha and Maa Vimala. There is a huge Yajna Mandap  as well with sitting arrangements. Gardens surround the temples. From the top of the stairs of the main shrine, the sea is visible. The priest performs puja for you if you bring along the offerings like flowers, coconut etc. There are arrangements for special pujas on payment-the different rates and charges are given on a board there. the temple officials are also present who may help you in this regard.Even if you are not spiritually inclined, you'll like the place because of its serenity and the marvelous temple architecture.

Name: therakeshcool
Title: enchating
Review: the best place to feel religious ...same feeling as puri( Odisha ) Jagannath temple. Front to mayajaal only. On advance you can go for avada. Near beach is also available.  Best time to go there at evening with family. A holy place to get some peace of mind.

Name: Maddy
Title: Nt bad
Review: Nice place to spend a few hours to relax. Staff want to make some quick money. Watch out. Ttdc should take steps to remove such spoilers.

Name: pratimagoel
Title: Sweet short boat ride for kids
Review: Simple boat ride but kids enjoyed. Very friendly staff. Neat and clean.The trip was short- just 20 minutes but enough to get the feel of it.

Name: AmuthaDinesh
Title: Enjoyable Boating
Review: We enjoyed the boating a lot. It could be a relaxation spot to get rlieved from the hustle and bustle of the city life.Time of Visit: October 2018

Name: ccbtraveller
Title: good spot for safe boat ride
Review: we can take a short boat ride in this place,   we can choose options from motor boat / paddle boat.  when we went jet ski was not operational (we went immediately after covid relaxation).  took a paddle boat.  the boat man was very friendly, took us for 30 min ride, Found few flamingos during the ride.A little tip to the boat man was well appreciated.

Name: Deadman17
Title: Beautiful Calm Boating Place
Review: Go here in the evenings, drink coffee on the banks and read a book. Take a walk. or use the boats to go boating. Great hues at sunset. On the main East Coast Road.

Name: RKV
Title: Boating trip
Review: It's good, clean place to be. Parking available inside. You have one restaurant and small shops. Quality is average. Best time to visit would be evenings. Just sit on bench, sip your tea/coffee and if u like reading, enjoy your book....

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: famous for boating
Review: The lake is situated near the city along the ecr and is famous among both the locals and the tourists for the water sports especially boating.

Name: VRAMESH
Title: Good place for boating.
Review: The muttukadu lake is actually backwaters from the sea. Good place for boating. There are pedal boats, motorised boats and row boats (either with a boatman or without). It is a pleasure to spend a couple of hours on a boat watching the migrant birds. Place is well maintained

Name: Gopalakrishnan
Title: Nice place to entertain
Review: We like this place , speciallu a boating riding. I felt safe and enjoyed. It's worth place for visit with family.Don't miss out...

Name: Chintan m
Title: Nice lake...
Review: Muttukadu lake is at the back waters of bay of Bengal. It has some relaxing aura of nature with some exciting water rides as well. Good place to visit for young to old age people

Name: Kannan R
Title: Nice place for a short outing
Review: Boating experience and facilities were good . Couple of hours can be spent here on the way to Mahabalipuram /ECR . They had enough parking space . Fares are reasonable . Speed boat and Motor boat are good choice .

Name: Ravindran_V
Title: Very nice place for family outing
Review: Have gone to this place few times earlier , recently visited it on Dec 30th 2018 Place is been well maintained and has more options now with speed boat and Water scooters.

Name: vijmail99
Title: Had Fun
Review: Thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Enjoyed every moment with the friends during boating. Queue was short when we went and the rates were affordable.

Name: Karthik V
Title: A short visit
Review: We stopped at Muttukadu on the way to Pondy. The place is now well maintained and he boat house is far cleaner than before. Although we didnt have time for a boat ride  but the pristine clear back waters from the shore was a lovely scene and to enjoy the breeze.

Name: elizabeth j
Title: Boathouse
Review: A perfect place to spend the evening with family.. Its a Boathouse with ample parking space. A hotel is also found inside.

Name: Haridhan
Title: Muttukadu boat house üëç
Review: Muttukadu Lake is backwater area Bay of Bengal.Location :  near kovalam beach..on the way to Mahabalipuram- East Coast Road. Around 40km from Chennai.Facilities: The lake offers a number of water sports like speedboat riding, rowing{not self rowing}, wind surfing and water skiing and has a boat house from where we can hire speed boats, row boats, water scooters etc.  The boathouse has a lounge where we can sit and watch the boating and there is a mini restaurant too.  went for 20 minutes/3km in motor boating. Charge 100/person or 6seater boat @‚Çπ600. Kids above 5yrs are charged same as adults.  You can spend  max2-3hrs at this place, depending upon the crowd to get into boat. Also look out for crocodile park, thiruvidanthai temple, mayajaal multiplex , mamallapuram - all very near/under 15-20mins from this place.

Name: BALASHOTELREVIEW
Title: Bala's Muttukadu backwaters visit
Review: Muttukadu is located on ECR about 40 kms from Chennai and can reach either by own vehicle or government buses. Muttukadu has a sea back water lake and there are boating available for tourists. There is a restaurant available inside Muttukadu with limited menu. Enough vehicle parking facility, washrooms, seating areas in the water front are available. Entrance is free and nice place to go with family and enjoy the beautiful backwaters, boating etc. I had Vegetable fried rice which was made fresh and served hot, tasty. I had kulfi from ice cream parlour in front of the restaurant.

Name: Bhavani N
Title: Good trip with kids
Review: It was a sunny day but was quite cold while boating. Kids enjoyed the roller coaster ride, which was made by the driver.many trees around to enjoy the shade and have food. Shops could be better.Nice break though.

Name: JumboMumbai
Title: Lovely boating
Review: Beautifully developed place to boat.. You have option of paddle boat and also motor boat. The half hour ride for 6 in motor boat cost us Rs 600 and was worth the sights we experiencedAlso available are some ice cream an snacks so kids were also happy

Name: Arun
Title: Boating spot of Chennai
Review: It is a big backwater lake in Chennai. Now due to encroachment, poor rains, the lake has shrunk and I would suggest you to visit this place during rainy seasons since the water levels will be high and it will be a beautiful scenic view. Right now, the water is lower due to Summer and high temperatures in Chennai.

Name: Sathishsana
Title: Nice trip in boating
Review: Very alterable and relax place, Family can enjoy the boating, Different types of boating available row boating, speed boating Etc...The boatman was so kind and explained about the sea.

Name: ashokd2007
Title: A pleasant ride
Review: This place is perfect to relax as a family, We went by row boat and the boatsman was so kind to take us so near the beach and we enjoyed walking on the sand from the boat.

Name: Surya Katakam
Title: Nothing much is there other than Boating
Review: This is lake located on ECR road which is near to Dakshin Chitra.Nothing much is there to enjoy other than Boating.

Name: vivek a
Title: Dirty ride
Review: Would start off by saying that I am ashamed that people in my state have damaged a pleasurable boating experience in the backwaters. There are residential places, I guess even an industrial building bordering the edges and it's obvious that they have made the backwaters a mini-dumping yard. Bottles,covers floating in the water ; garbage mounds visible within minutes of starting the ride don't really make it an enjoyable affair. I assume that the place had a sprawling fauna because even now after all the contamination I could see quite a few birds which actually is sad. Needs an overhaul badly to save this place and experience.

Name: dinesh_j84
Title: 'Excellent Place to Relax'
Review: This is an excellent place to relax amidst the hectic work schedule. It is on the ECR towards Mahabalipuram. The beach water is very clean and it takes around 15 mins to travel by boat to this place.

Name: amohanro
Title: BOATING AMONGST FLYING FISHES.....OR SO THEY SEEMED TO BE
Review: A lovely place with memories stretching back far into childhood. The boats are big and you have to wait until nearly all the seats are filled before the boat ride. It's nice. I love the sea, I love boats, and all this neatly fits in. My son loves boat rides too. The way the fishes jump out of the water make you think whether it's Barracuda hunting grounds. Pity no BRracuda has leapt out yet, ever. If you visit the restaurant, stay away from the kitchen or risk losing your appetite. Brave that and risk loosing your bowels. The kitchen area, though strictly vegetarian, is not for the faint hearted, just the fleet footed. Overall, a great way to spend a lazy Sunday evening with family.

Name: Prasanth M
Title: Service
Review: On saturday 15/07/2017 i lost my mobile in MGM beach resort. On 19/07/2017 i got a call from Mr. Mohanty he found my mobile in beach and handovered to me.. So kind of him. A good service where i never ever seen.. Thaks to u all and especially to Mr. Mohanty nd Mr. Asif Ali.. Tnks once again for good hospitality..

Name: velayudhan
Title: Eco Spot in ECR
Review: Muttukadu is one of the best ecological places in the ECR . We went there to have the boat ride . It was clearly a good enjoyable place. The boat ride was enjoyable the cost of Ride for 30 Min was just %0 Rs for per Person . We had been on the happy journey there

Name: Joji J
Title: "paradise for those who love boating or other water sports"
Review: The Muttukadu Lake is the backwater area of the Bay of Bengal and way to Mahabalipuram we can access it from the East Coast Road. The lake offers a number of water sports like speedboat riding, rowing, wind surfing and water skiing and has a boat house from where we can hire speed boats, row boats, water scooters etc. The water in the area is not so deep and hence the activities are rather safe even for children. The boathouse has a lounge where we can sit and watch the boating and there is a restaurant too. A floating boat jetty from where we can board the boats is an attraction and we went for 20 minutes boating since we had a tight schedule and was on our way to Mahabalipuram. Nice place to spent a day enjoying the water sport facilities.

Name: Traveller
Title: On the way to mahabalipuram
Review: This place is on the way to mahabalipuram from Chennai, you can stop here for a while and  enjoy the boating. This muttukadu lake is conected to sea.

Name: SyedIqbal123
Title: Nice Place for family outing in holiday
Review: This place is famous for boating experience.  Better to go as much people to enjoy the ride.  It is lot of fun, to be there as group.  They provide life jacket and it is must for our safety.  Better to go early as crowd will increase and also it may be sunny after 11 AM.  Better to avoid summer seasons.  A small restaurant is available to refresh our self.Ticketing is nominal.  Parking is available for about 15 cars.  Worth visiting once.

Name: Sambaratnam
Title: Nice Boating Experience
Review: Only boating can be enjoyed here. So not worth going to this spot exclusively for boating. If you are passing through this place, like while going to ECR or Mahabalipuram you can stop by enjoy the boating and proceed.

Name: Arun K
Title: Serene & peaceful
Review: Visited this place twice with my family for boating and both were quite good experiences. The rates are slightly high but still the experience is beautiful. You just go around the lake for 30-60 minutes - the entire experience is peaceful and beautiful.Nice outdoor activity in the ECR stretch.

Name: krazikams
Title: Serene Boating experience
Review: Located outskirts of Chennai on ECR Road, it is brimming with water and you can enjoy boating at TTDC Boat House. Do not try adventure things and risk your life. Follow safety instructions of people there. Weekends will be crowded. Best time is before 10am or evening 4-6pm.

Name: Ra_Radha
Title: Good boating experience
Review: You feel like boating out there in the Bay of Bengal ocean. Operated by TTDS folks, it offers boating in groups. Ask for safety jackets and dont try adventure things.

Name: Rucha121
Title: Good scenic boating point
Review: Although I have doubts over safety of boats and life jackets, this place offers a nice place for boating. Operated by TTDC, they charges some Rs.100/- per head for a boat ride of 10-15 mins. bets time is evening 4-5pm. wear life jacket and insist on one.

Name: Inderjit Singh
Title: Nice outing
Review: On a way towards Mahabalipuram on ECR  25 kms away from Adyar ,Chennai this Lake is located .It has a boat house  for abt 550 Rs. A boat for 6 persons can be hired for 20 min boat ride is refreshing and one can spot few birds species like cranes  Herons etc..lake seemed to be not so deep in certain areas as i saw people in waist deep water fishing there.Ideal place for quick visits it was a weekday so no rush at all.There is a resteraunt in boat house for quick bite n reasonably priced food items.

Name: the_tanmoy
Title: No water - nothing to do - only boating - boring
Review: It is a boring place. We went while going to other places nearby. There was no water - very less. Boats were not properly ready to go into the water. Saw awesome small crabs which have one big claw and other small ones. First time! I also ate Sea Shells - first time again! There were lot of birds of different species. They are developing the park/garden nearby. The crew was very rude! Didn't let us go near water when we said we will not go for boating. There are small rivers which are merging with the backwater/lake. Nice to see. Not sure what happens when it rains! OK Place...

Name: aditya_ravikumar
Title: Ideal for a relaxed evening amongst all age groups
Review: Muttukadu boat house is located on Mutukadu lake, a short detour from the ECR.we were a group of 8 ( ages 13-65) . to do - you can just walk on the periphery, short walks. take a 20 min boat ride ( approx rs 850 for a boat of 8) and birding . we spotted a few herons, pelicans and cranes.You can ask the boatman to take you towards the sea or further inside near the backwaters.there is a good breeze blowing usually in the evenings.its a 36 km from airport/ 25 km from South Chennai ( adyar) , so a good evening activity 2-3 hours to spend time and not much of physical activity.There is a restaurant for basic eats.Parking is available. Would recommend driving downcan be planned quickly and does not need too much planning.Some downsides - The scenery is just about average. If there is a big queue for the ride, You might as well evaluate if its worth the effort

Name: Sreenivas C
Title: Superb outing
Review: Nice outing don't expect much. Just chill out. We did motor ride shared with others , keep tab on the time , some may return you early

Name: K K
Title: Average boat ride
Review: We chose to take the motor boat ride along the backwaters. It felt like we were on a boat ride on the river cooum... smelly waters and not a lot to see. We spotted storks and cranes and the odd fisherman. 550 INR for a party of 3. Tipping the boatmen is a must. Very pleasant staff, no doubt about it.Would I go back? I am not sure.

Name: prithwirajsengupta86
Title: Nice evening
Review: Went for a nice evening trip with my wife, relaxing atmosphere with a cool breeze flowing. Also went for a boat ride and it was awesome. Must visit while visiting ECR or Mahabalipuram.

Name: Sowmya K
Title: Nice for a short visit
Review: We went for a 30-minute row boat ride. At 10 in the morning, it was already pretty hot, but the breeze was refreshing. Passing under the ECR was especially fun... The place is good, but facilities could be better. And it will be good if they open sooner (6 or 7AM) when it would be much more pleasant.

Name: ganeshpkumar
Title: Near Kovalam Beach
Review: This boat house is located just before the Kovalam Beach road in the ECR. This place is perfect for enjoying with kids as they would love it. The safety measures taken were good. W can opt for motor boat or paddle boat on our liking. A visit to the boat house and the kovalam beach will be engaging for a day.

Name: Meera M
Title: Nice outing for the entire family
Review: It is situated on the ecr road. Near dizzy world and crocdile bank. Has ample car parking. Have motor boats and row boat for families joy ride. Provide life safety jackets to all. Added attraction is the water scooter ride. Standing by the bank one can watch the fisher folk at work. A must visit for all kids

Name: girieshm24
Title: nice place
Review: as it was a great faclity located in chennai on the way to east cost road,here boating is main attraction

Name: BBhusanMohanty
Title: Nice place ,Must Visit place in Chennai.
Review: Must visit place in Chennai and to discover great food near by.Also can be hang out with first food and small alcohol corners to chilled of.

Name: manoj k
Title: enjoy boat ride
Review: Muttukadu Lake is is ordinary lake situated at ECR. NOTHING IS SO SPECIAL except a boat ride . professional boat owner are there. one can enjoy if have free time.

Name: kumaranwsg
Title: Once haven for Flora and Fauna, Now it become Sewage waters
Review: Untreated sewage introduction to this serene waterbody made this important ecosystem into another sewage channel of chennai. I wonder how they organise in  boat trips in this waters.Save water body and make it again a livable space for countless flora and fauna, which once flourished

Name: Sudhir
Title: Boatinggggggg
Review: This is located in between enroute to pondy or Mahabalipuram from Chennai. One can take this boat ride while travelling towards Pondicherry or Mamallapuram. It sure does worth the time spent.They do offer a lot of water sport activities and if you are person of interest of boating, go ahead without any questions.Staffs are good and helpful.

Name: Azeema A
Title: Boating
Review: One of the oldest hangout place in Chennai...every one who rides through ecr, must go on a boating at muutukadu lake.. to witness a memorable moment take a picture..

Name: Jothilingam E
Title: Fantastic for picnic spot
Review: Good place to visit on one day trip.Boat ride is of special interest and staff are good.Must try with children for day trip and enjoy ice creem in the shop

Name: Shyamis
Title: Good for water sports
Review: This one is on ECR and has water sports and boating facilities. Though accesible by public transport, go for a long drive and enjoy

Name: JumboMumbai
Title: Lake with little else..
Review: We went to Muttukadu on a weekend and started at 10 am.  Since ECR is very jammed it took us more than 2 hours to reach.  The lake is there with boats and all but there is not much else to do.  So all in all just ok time pass activity i Chennai away from the city

Name: cool1960
Title: Relax your mind with Boating
Review: A calm place away from the city. The distance to reach them is slightly far.Not much of crowd and it is very spacious. The ambience is very good for boating.Car park is plenty.As Couples and as families you get good enjoyment here as privacy is there because of the spacious

Name: Shabin S
Title: A lake connecting the buckingham canal and the bay of bengal
Review: Beautiful area but badly maintained. With the ECR new bridge it looks gross and again boating cannot be enjoyed. You have lovely back water areas, where birds can be spotted, but the boat operators don't take you to those areas. The area is full of mosquitoes

Name: MrKapoooor
Title: place for boating with nicely
Review: Nice place to go with family and friends and everyone. Boating was nice experience and also safe one,You can enjoy.

Name: Ismail_is123
Title: Good place for boating..
Review: It's on the way to mahabalipuram..They have decent staff for boatingg..If you want speed boat then the rates are little high.. 600 or something for 5min ride ..

Name: Gopal
Title: Super place for boating
Review: Nice place to go with family,friends and everyone.Boating was nice experience and also safe one,You can enjoy.

Name: Manash_Baruah
Title: Backwaters at Chennai
Review: Many people don't know that there are backwaters at Chennai at Muttukadu.  It is a lake connected to the Bay of Bengal sea.  Boat rides are organized by the government.  We took the ride during our Mahabalipuram trip in Dec'14.  Overall an enjoyable ride...

Name: ARKSait
Title: back waters
Review: Though the boating arrangements are good, the place can be utilised better with more water sports apart from the usual motorised/row boats and water scooter. A large expanse of water under utilised grossly.

Name: SagarVS
Title: Just Boating
Review: If you are on the way to Mahabalipuram then you would be crossing this spot which is popular for boating. There is normally a big line up on weekends. The back waters are shallow and murky and very popular with visitors with Children. The boats are not covered and you will fry in the hot sun in summer. And I don't trust these boat operators with safety, not that it is a huge risk if you know swimming. Skip this place.

Name: HappyTraveller
Title: Perfect spot to spend a pleasant evening!
Review: The lake is beautiful but there are constructions going on around it. The sunset was gorgeous seen from the lake. The boatsman had life jackets even one for our 3 year old. I was very apprehensive of the safety but the boating was quite good. Afternoons might not be pleasant for the boat ride because of the harsh sun. There are many types of boats catering to your needs. It's a good place to spend time, not very far from the city.

Name: manojkg_me
Title: Easy get away from the busy Chennai Life
Review: This is a nice picnic spot. You can either visit the place for a one day picnic or drop by when you are en-route to Mahabalipuram or even Pondicherry. There is a boating option. Earlier, there used to be a nice view of the sea from the place. But now due to some construction, the view has been blocked. The boating will be a nice experience.There is nothing much to spend your whole day in here. So plan wise.!

Name: Anand K
Title: Ordinary but a good getaway for Chennai folks
Review: Boating with a wait. Backwaters with a gorgeous view. For those in Chennai it is a good getaway (as well as for those who have not been near backwaters. Folks from Kerala might pass this place off as a joke but folks in interior india may love it).

Name: Mathivanan V
Title: Just another stopover
Review: This place is another stop over place while going to Mahabalipuram.It has nothing much to offer except for a boat ride.That too in summer a big NO NO.Just a relax point on your travel.

Name: wellsitekumaran
Title: Great water sports facility in algae rich waters
Review: Good things first - One of the prime attraction close to Chennai, Good and safe place for family watersports, Open throughout all the seasons.Rapid urbanisation around the backwaters, Uncontrolled dumping of sewage and garbage into backwaters system destroying the backwaters in rapid pace

Name: Vivekanandan S
Title: Boat club
Review: Beautiful place for a family to spend time for Boating, all Security arrangements are very good Very pleasant,

Name: bishwaksen
Title: Just a lake for boating
Review: The lake lies on the right side of the road while going from Chennai to Mahabalipuram. Frankly its a waste of time and nowadays the only views you get are that of multistoreyed apartment buildings. Its really not worth it unless you have absolutely nothing better to do.

Name: RahulMattackal
Title: Poorly Maintained
Review: A very poorly maintained place. Its a beautiful lake on ECR but it literally stinks. The motor boat is just a waste of time. Even the amount of migratory birds have reduced tremendously. This place needs a lot of revamp and good investment from the government.If you are looking for a motor boat ride, with kids, then yes! this is the place.

Name: Sanjeev_Sharma
Title: For Boat Ride
Review: Place is on the ECR Road when going towards mahaballipuramfor the Price you pay for a motor boat its not worth. its a 7 minute ride which you would get but going to the same route again and again for 7 min does not make sensebetter option wold be to take a row boat and enjoy the slow pace

Name: oshylu
Title: Easy approachable boating spot for chennai residents
Review: In chennai it is located on the ECR road at muttukadu.. boating experience is good but no spacious parking when compare with mudaliyarkuppam boating spot. And no activities is here ..  mostly crowded in weekend days .. u have to wait .. so go here on weekdays

Name: Suchetana G
Title: Pleasant experience
Review: We took the trip to Muttukadu Boating Club in the Chennai day trip of TTDC. We did boating for 15-20 minutes. Charge: Rs 80 for each person on motor boat. Was fun, very safe. Could spot a few migratory birds in the trees along the banks

Name: Athidots
Title: A day Family Outing @ Chennai -Muttukadu/Mahabalaipuram
Review: Start by Post Lunch..Do Visit mahabalipuram and then way back you shall plan muttukadu...Best Place for family outing for a day..

Name: BantakalDotCom
Title: Nice boating experience @ Muttukadu boat house.
Review: We had complimentary boat ride @ Muttukadu boat house. Nice place to visit after 4pm. Nice view, good ride with life jacket on. Thanks to TTDC day trip for the complimentary free ride. However we paid Rs 20 as a tip to the boat driver.

Name: Princeppra
Title: Day out at muttukadu
Review: An interesting hangout to spend a day out with friends or family. They have activities like wind surfing, boating, speed boating and swimming at the estuary. The place is cleanly maintained and there are a lot of good restaurants and hotels at the vicinity. Very close to fisherman's cove as well. The place is one just visit for beach lovers and holidaying crowd. A good place to stop by on a long drive on the ecr. The shade gives some place ti rest and chill down.

Name: RajGovindan
Title: Stinky late and a boat drive on that!
Review: Had visited the lake and took a boat drive. After paying for our own boat for carry 8 of us, when we approached the pier the smell of sewage was overwhelming. When I spoke to the person who drove the boat, the overflowing sewage from the city,due to the rain, were redirected into this lake. The boatman was complaining that it is seriously affecting his business.I can't complain about the tourist who want to give this a miss!

Name: Shiva S
Title: Boating in chennai
Review: Boating in chennai is really a nice experience. Away from chennai and it is located near kovalam in ECR road. Can see many tourist coming mostly in weekends to enjoy the ride. Its around 1hour travel from chennai to this place. This is located on the way to pondy.

Name: Jeyaprabhakar
Title: Best place for boating
Review: This is the second time, i am visiting this place and could see the "sea" change, interms of proper packing and other facilitiesWe took a boat of 8 seater and the cost is INR 600, which i found it very affordable for 30 to 45 minutes

Name: nellu r
Title: Muthukade ecr boating
Review: I have been here many times. The muthukadu is part of ECR and the area looks so beautiful, especially if you are traveling in early morning's or evening ,georgious. You have option of sharing boat or the jet ..nice, but the water in lake is pathetic.looks like all seewage water is cumulating over here. If you are looking any option for food within 800 meter taj fisherman's cove with variety restaurants or ECR daba. Over all area is super.

Name: Selva P
Title: Boating in chennai
Review: it was a fun trip with friends. the boating was fun on the lake. though the water was not that clean to have fun with in , being on water to lessen the heat was fun. they provide the life jackets and the boa drivers were friendly.

Name: MRuzal
Title: Go for Boating......
Review: It takes a nice drive from Chennai through ECR to reach Muttukadu. Boating is a decent one at Rs.80/- for 20mins. You can watch pelicans and other seabirds occasionally. Snacks are available in nearby cafe. Ample carparking space also is there. Watch out your head while boating under ECR bridge. Calm place to spend an evening. You can also visit nearby beaches like Kovalam...

Name: Anupam W
Title: Decent Place For Boating..
Review: This place is good for 1-2 hrs hangout. This place has food court, sitting area, washroom and parking. Boating cost is little bit expensive (One round takes around 15 to 20 min). Be aware that the boat driver will ask for a tip of Rs 100 for extra round. I feel crossing the ECR bridge little risky as there is very less space when the boat goes under the bridge. Overall average place for 1-2 hrs hangout.

Name: AMRaja
Title: Muttukadu Boating_Needs improvement
Review: Muttukadu lake located on the ECR needs more improvement. The lake was not clean. Not well maintained. Though the cost of boating is little bit higher, the cleanliness and the comfortableness was not upto the mark. One can go for Muttukadu boating  as a last option!

Name: shyam v
Title: Boating in OMR, Chennai
Review: My rating will be Average. Its a calm and nice place just outside Chennai. You can spend max 1 to 2 hrs here. there is a food court, washroom and parking available. Boat takes 8 people and per head costs around 75 rupees. One round takes around 15 to 20 min. Ok but i found its quite little time and I feel the lagoon should be bigger for real experience of boating.

Name: Abhijit Sarkar
Title: Evening outing
Review: Kids & Parents will love it , try visiting this place just when sun is setting.. go for a boat ride or kids can try Jet ski.. bit costly but one can enjoy the colorful sky line as the sun sets , lots of migratory birds perched on the vicinity jungle..seagulls enjoying in the lake. Good place and well maintained by Tamilnadu Tourism...Restaurant / Life Guards / Sit out in front of lake /ample parking space..Good place

Name: Arijit D
Title: Good boating experience
Review: Travel date: 5 Jan, 2014Weather : Cloudy 22-24 degree C.We started from Perungudi early in the morning (7:30 am) by bus(Kandanchavadi > Thiruvanmiyur > Muttukadu Boat House) and reached there by 9:00 am. Boating starts from 9:45 am. As we were only two, we hired a 3 seater rowing boat (30 min) @160 bucks (Rs 5 camera charge+ some tip to the rower extra). 6 and 8 seater motor boats were available within 500 bucks(20 min). Jet ski was available for Rs 600.The boating experience was OK. We saw a lot of cranes, sea gulls and a few pelicans.We spent a fair amount of time for photoshoot.Buses were frequent enough. We managed to return by 12:30 pm to Kandanchavadi.Overall, a good experience.

Name: Kavita Baluni
Title: Backwater boating..
Review: It was my first experience of boat ride on backwaters. Nice place to enjoy with your family.We choose to share boat .Most exciting feature during the whole boat ride was crossing the ECR bridge  ..In weekends,this place is bit crowdy and you have to wait for your number.

Name: Saravanan T
Title: Breezy Boating on Backwaters
Review: I have visited this boating point with my family. The location is very close to Dakshin Chitra and MGM on the East Coast Road. There is no enterance fees. But one can go for boating by paying the ticket amount. Variety of Boats like High Speed Water Bike, Peddal Boat, Motoer Boat...etc are availble to choose. We are 4 (2Adults+2Children) and selected the Peddal Boat and roam around the Back Waters, and enjoyed the Breeze in the evening..

Name: SundarTraveller
Title: Lovely boat ride
Review: For a relaxing boat ride on the backwaters in Chennai.... a quiet retreat... close to the Taj fishermans Cove... you have a choice of boats right from speedboats to paddle boats to water scooters to motor boats. Hire a whole boat for yourself and click away... wonderful experience...

Name: AbidSuhail
Title: Scenic boat ride and bird watching
Review: 45 mins drive from Chennai and you get to spend some quality time in a lake that is still not spoilt. Gud for  a family picnic or a romantic getaway.

Name: mikiatnet
Title: Good but a lot more to improve
Review: This is a nice place to kill time with your family, still few things to remember. They do/follow things only for process sake including safety. Staffs are irresponsible. The boating staffs demanding money apart from the boat hiring charge. These things have to be addressed immediately....

Name: MJRVJ
Title: For a Change
Review: For a change, escape from the normal ruckus and visit Muthukadu for a pleasant evening boat ride. There are lot many type of boats to choose from...from a motor boat to a paddle boat. Explore it to experience it...

Name: poornima r
Title: good range of boats
Review: there are not much of sight seeing spots around chennai. this one is worth visiting especially in the evening before 5pm. speed boats and waterscooters are terrific

Name: Karthick_Madurai
Title: Nice experience in the back waters
Review: Muttukadu is actually an back water situated on the East coast road (ECR). Its famous for its boating. The boat house there was maintained by Tamil Nadu tourism and offer pedal boat, Row boat and Motor boat facilities. Going under the bridge in a motor boat was an enjoyable experience. Nice place to spend few hours.

Name: Bhramanti-Pune
Title: Beautiful backwater lake with birds and boating
Review: On the way to fisherman Cove, this is really nice stop. The place has a boating dock, with full service boating, decent restaurant and nice people. The boating is good. The lake offers beautiful colonies of the birds- mostly pelican and storks. Definitely worth a visit.

Name: Narayanan S
Title: Go Boating at your own risk
Review: The hired boat with a person to take us round wouldnt care less about safety. The back water was reasonably dirty

Name: Gowthami R
Title: boating place
Review: this lake is very pleasant in evening.. many unseen birds rest here during  november to february period..kovalam beach is nearer ro this lake

Name: Vansid
Title: A bird sanctuary used as public toilet
Review: My apartment overlooks the lake so I know a thing or two about this place. Through the months of winter (or whatever November is called in Chennai) we wake to the sight ot beatiful birds on and along the lake, a sight spolt by people defecating in the open alongside the lake

Name: arul_nambi2000
Title: Unique place at least for TN
Review: The kind of ambience you get here, back water and silent , only few places in TN are worth visiting due to the facility available. Here you need to reach before late evening to enjoy the facilities. Boat ride is the main attraction other than watching the water front sipping your cup of tea.

Name: Ameya
Title: Great time to spend
Review: Excellent beach, have enough activities boring scuba diving, parasailing. clean beach. Not much crowded. We loved it and will go again.

Name: ramanathanv67
Title: Good beach outing
Review: A pleasant morning trip. Could see people trying hands on surf boards, kayaking, fishing etc. The striking thing we experienced is the clean sea- we could see the mollusks floating in and out for each wave ! Close to the Taj Fishermans cove, a good place to spend time with family. I feel morning will be light on crowd.

Name: leelaneeraj1
Title: Nice place to hangout
Review: We came to hangout with my friends we all enjoyed,sunny day weather was good , people was nice and friendly.sea water was good .

Name: Dhwanit S
Title: Decent beach to visit
Review: Beach is relatively clean but often spot various kinds of dead fishes. Parking is ample and free. Toilets are available at ‚Çπ10 but do not expect much there. Not much crowded as there is lot of space to walk around. Try fish fries if you like street food. There are many resorts around but I think only Taj has private beach.

Name: Rina Cannon (N√©e Purba)
Title: Sightseeing
Review: Nice beach. It was so windy when I was there. Relatively clean beach. Lots of fishing boats. Quite a lot of visitor as well. There is a small place like an eating joint where you can eat seafood. Nice experience

Name: TravelTime
Title: Huge beach
Review: On the way to Mahabalipuram, you can plan to visit this beach, evening times would be better, it is huge and not very crowded as well if you move a kilometer or two from Kovalam beach

Name: Cosmopolitan332905
Title: Good for groups
Review: Beautiful beach. Atmosphere is good. Best to watch sunrise. Parking will be full in the evening. Very clean but fish smell is there. Good for groups.

Name: Meeran Haja Mohideen
Title: Handsome Hamlet on the verge of being endangered
Review: For over 5 decades, I am forever enticed spending time on Kovalam beach and never ever get bored.Well, there is beast to bash the beauty as always in the form of waste water mismanagement, trash control and other needy infrastructure including roads etc.

Name: Divyangna P
Title: Serene Beach
Review: Loads of sails catching fish. Slightly smells of fish. Not too excess. Water is clean and can go for a light swim. Shore is full of shells and dead crabs :(

Name: Ahamed
Title: Very much crowded
Review: Went on Sunday...was very much crowded. Fish fries are good to eat here. I would recommend to visit this beach.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Has to improve the surrounding cleanliness
Review: This is one of the famous spot along the east coast road among the locals as well as the tourists but still the cleanliness of the place has to be improved.

Name: S.A
Title: Beach is good with limited options
Review: Beach is good with limited eating vegetarian options. No water sports available. Only speed boat is there. Speed boat is also expensive. Government should develop this beach. Sea Water is partially clean compared to other beaches in India.

Name: Ramya S
Title: Good beach
Review: The kovalam beach is a beach set in about 40 kilometers from Chennai. The water was amazing and great. Spotting some corals on the shore was a surprise. It is one of the popular beaches in Chennai. Many food stalls, especially seafood, are available in this beach.

Name: sandy s
Title: Place to enjoy with family...
Review: Here only the famous Tamim al-Ansari shrine is there and we can buy a sea foods in cheap rate also. In that beach there is a surfing school also who is having interest in surfing you can go there.

Name: lvishy
Title: Wow
Review: Hi friends kindly visit bay restaurant at kovalam Vivanta. Food is delicious. Authentic aroma and flavours . Iam sure you will not regret . Karan was helpful though he is with other restaurant. Ambiance is superb. Lovely evening

Name: Azara T
Title: Great but seems to be crowded
Review: The beach was great to look at and all but it was very crowded. There were a lot of stalls with food, items etc. You also could ride on a horse for a short distance.

Name: BBhusanMohanty
Title: Great Place for Young people.
Review: Kovalam neach bit away from Chennai zone can be hang out place for young kids who wants to roll down. But all activities can be takencare with care.

Name: Rajagopal S
Title: Didnt like it
Review: Horrible parking.. especially if u are riding ur car. There is no traffic sense. Beach also isn't that clean. I would prefer some other beaches in ECR. Overall an average experience !

Name: Vishal Balwani
Title: Great beach with less crowd than that on other beaches of chennai
Review: Just outside the beach there are too many food stalls and small restaurants that sell fresh catch of everyday. You can also experiece fine dining near by the beach or for a more cafe like atmosphere, can visit Surf Turf cafe. For more adventuurous kinds, you can jog along the shore till Mahabalipuram, 19kms in total.

Name: Rahul R
Title: Nice to walk
Review: Pretty crowded, good for night walks and sea food. Restaurant food is slightly on the higher price list. Late night transportation is hard to find.

Name: MohamedIsmail_INDIA
Title: Beach is Just OK ....Dirty and polluted  Water
Review: People visiting Ansari Dhargah Kovalam spends time here in the Beach. Beach is polluted with fish wastes, Garlands, water color turns to Black and more salty than any other beach.

Name: ramchabi
Title: Famiily Beach
Review: Chennai is blessed to have a long coastal line.  However, as in most places in India, there is always too many people...not here.Getting to Kovalam beach isnt easy and Im quite happy about this. The beach is mostly clean and we always have a great time.

Name: kim G
Title: spoilt by rubbish
Review: its the only safe swimming in that area, lots of small fishing boats there. take lots of pencils for the kids;

Name: Sameer A
Title: Nice place overcrowded!!!
Review: This place famous for Dargah which is nearby, people come all over the place, Nice place but overcrowded and shops selling fried fish which makes this place smells fish all over..

Name: ramya3101
Title: Best place for family with kids
Review: Kovalam Beach was a pleasant surprise for us.. All our kids enjoyed the beach and the rides n games like balloon shooting.. Not over crowded.. But,it was very difficult to find parking..

Name: Surya Katakam
Title: Nothing Much to View, Just Beach
Review: This is the First view point one can witness when you are reaching to ECR from Vandaluru Route. Nothing much is there to view other than Beach. One beach side temple is there to visit.

Name: Indiran_Kolappan
Title: Good for a evening visit
Review: The Kovalam beach is on the outskirts of Chennai after Muttukad. The beach is crowded on weekends and visit on the weekday evenings are a better option. Earlier it used to be frequented by few and now there is a good crowd so a lot of shops have come up on the beach spoiling the beauty.

Name: worldwomantourist
Title: Adventure beach sports
Review: Kovalam Beach is located on city outskirts near Mahabalipuram. this is the only place in Chennai were we can find some adventure sports on shore side  like surf-boarding, boat rides, banana rides, etc. A best place to relax during weekends.

Name: Joeswamy
Title: Fishing hamlet cum beach attraction
Review: It is 30 kms from Adyar Chennai on the East Coast Road. From the main Highway you have to go through winding roads through the town to reach the beach about a kilometre for the highway.The beach is a big curved one with rocky shores. Good place to visit. lots of games near the beach is another attraction.There is a fish market near the beach and you can get fresh catch every dau.. But the price is no different from the city. You have to bargain a lot to get the fish you want..A good rustic experience.

Name: Prabha K
Title: Good for half day visit.
Review: ** Best for group tour.** Nice place to enjoy with friends in weekends.** You will enjoy the surfing.** Famous Masque is here.

Name: s_ramsam
Title: Good for a visit
Review: Located on the outskirts of Chennai, this is relatively less crowded which makes it rather attractive. Otherwise like so many other beaches. Some adventure sports facilities are available for those so inclined.

Name: Arun
Title: One of the famous beaches in Chennai
Review: It is located on the outskirts of Chennai and it is also a famous spot for water sports. People who love water adventures and sports can visit this place. You will find a lot of packages online as well.

Name: JUNI-BANERJEE
Title: Sand and Serenity of Kovalam Beach
Review: Visited this beach with my friends and saw the lovely color of the sea, felt the serenity of the beach and enjoyed some pineapple juices :)

Name: krazikams
Title: Adventure Sports on Beach
Review: Only place in Chennai were you may find some adventure sports on shore side... like surf-boarding, boat rides, banana rides, so on. Located on city outskirts near Mahabalipuram, it is a perfect place to getaway on weekend from Chennai.

Name: shri047
Title: Peaceful beach !!
Review: Beach is located away from the city.Good beach for hangout with friends and family. Not much crowded and you will get your time to enjoy beach side.

Name: Arun K
Title: Decent beach
Review: Visited this beach with my family after dropping a friend at the airport. Beautiful place to visit early morning. During the second visit in the evening, the place had some fun games around - tossing a ring to collect available objects, etc.The place also has a huge collection of fish.Must visit place in the ECR stretch.

Name: Akashdx
Title: A Silent Beach away from City Rush
Review: I liked this Beach other than any beach in Chennai.The way towards it is somewwhat like a Undeveloped village but overall beach is Quite.And Gives great look of Nature

Name: dilshadkn123
Title: Beautiful "
Review: Despite the soaring heat in kovalam atmosphere was pleasant here at 12pm. Childrens enjoyed by eating prawns fry which is cooked instantly in the near by small shops. Fisherman trying to exploit the tourist by selling the fishes at a rate of unimaginable. Dont go across for this type of.

Name: Talhas
Title: Needs lot of attention from Local Authority
Review: Very crowded with hapazard parking of cars and trucks. Suggest to park your vehicle in private parking area (Rs. 30 per car) and walk few meters to the shore. local vendors litter the place and spoil the atmosphere.

Name: kashif k
Title: from main city a roadtrip rather than going to beach-still best beach of chennai
Review: this place is 56 kms from main city (anna nagar) city roads are full of traffic and ECR is good but it is only around 10 kms. there is an alternative way that was good through NH 32. you can not do anything there except swimming in a water full of filth.I liked:very low slopethats itI disliked:filth everywheresmell of fisha lot of people ruined my holiday, on holiday i want to be at peaceyou bring camera there, waterproof if possible, nice shots you can take while in the waterwe planned our visit at 03:30we left home at 04:30we reach there at 05:45we were finished at 05:50(includes swimming)and still i dont feel I missed anything thereso its rather a short visit, maximum stay there should be 2 hrs.so we spent almost 2hrs and 30 minutes at roadwe spent 1 hr at beachMY TITLE JUSTIFIES IT

Name: Ra_Radha
Title: Clean Beach
Review: Located outside city limits, this beach is frequented by foreigners and adventure enthusiasts. You can try surf-boarding here with help of coaches. Stay safe.

Name: Deevakar K
Title: Nice Beach
Review: Visited with family and kids at 4.30PM, it's was hot but when we stepped in the water it felt much better. Lot of fisherman boat near the entrance but one can walk a bit or sit in the rocks in the shore. Overall good to visit if you are visiting near by crocodile bank.

Name: Inderjit Singh
Title: Refreshing Beach
Review: Last Tuesday during my Chennai trip on way to Mahabalipuram had a chance to experience Kovalam beach which is on ECR  apprx 40 kms from Chennai.Its lovely picturesque beach not crowdy as compared to Marina beach.Its a long beach good for quite walks but waves r big sometimes.A dargah n temple nearby n few eateries mainly seafood.Parking no issues.lovely for sunsets. Ideal for daylong picnics..

Name: Sajin P
Title: Things Have Changed
Review: After almost an year, visited Kovalam Beach again. Now there are no more land rides available. Eventhough, only 2 or 3. It was fun. And now the beach is getting more crowded.

Name: cool1960
Title: Good Beach with less crowd
Review: Nice place to visit with not much of crowd. Parking of cars are available. The beach is neat and you can relax there as the crowd is not there much.

Name: Samshell2015
Title: Stinky and average beach
Review: I would definitely not suggest this beach for a visit as it is mainly a fishing beach and stinks. There were lot of fishing boats parked along the shore hence to get a proper calm place to sit, you need to walk a bit along the beach shore. I visited this beach on a Saturday evening as this was very near to my house like around 8 km. If you are new to Chennai then there are better beaches to explore like breezy beach and Elliot's beach which are more cleaner. The crowd at the beach was less and you can easily get paid parking near the beach. The sea was rough and the waves get higher and higher as the sun sets so be aware if you are not a swimmer. You can find too many fortune teller's with a cute little parrot in a cage hanging on their arm and can definitely try your luck as they charge just rs. 30/- per person. I did try it and it was not so worthy. Beware of beggars around the beach as they curse you if you don't offer them money üòúüòú. This is not the place for people who is looking to spend some peaceful and quality time with family. Worth a visit ?? definitely No.

Name: Rucha121
Title: Isolate from City.. but a lovely beach on ECR
Review: Located on ECR away from bustling noise of city, it offers recreational trip and peaceful time with family or friends on the shores.. watching Bay of Bengal in all its pomp and glory, hitting Chennai coast and beautiful waves. You can spot few adventure activities taking place here, but it seasonal, depends on wave and weather. Very peaceful and isolated beach. Not advised for girls to go alone.

Name: Lakshmi Narayanan S
Title: Clean beach but little isolated
Review: This beach is on the outskirts of Chennai. Beach is cleaner compared to the beaches inside the city. Also it is less crowded. It is not advisable to visit this beach in the late evening on weekdays as it is very deserted and not safe. On weekend beach is relatively more crowded.

Name: HASPvlogs
Title: Beautiful!!!
Review: Went to the Kovalam beach in Chennai in NOV 2016,,,its a beautiful beach.... Suggested to go early morning and see the sunrise....its awesome... :) Ideal for photography in the morning...you get fresh fish right outside the beach...

Name: Suryadip
Title: It is recreational and short evening trip
Review: I was visited that place yesterday and it is second time in last one month. This is very near to my home at padur. But as a Sunday it was a bit overcrowded but any how it was a good enjoyable. I am giving some of my snaps of yesterday which may help you to get the idea. There are not so much option of food some Street food stalls are there of sea fishes but not sure how much hygiene it maintained. Also we seen one tortoise there.

Name: @AmolAnadi
Title: Awesome
Review: My kid n my family had a lot of fun at this beach. One of the less crowded n cleaner beach in Chennai, must visit if you are on the east coast road

Name: Arun A
Title: Beach out of city
Review: Kovalam beach is located between Chennai and Mamallapuram. Its around 25 KM from Chennai. There is Darkha and a temple at Kovalam which is a tourist attraction. The beach is neat.

Name: ganeshpkumar
Title: Road less travelled
Review: Located about 50 kms from Chennai is this wonderful beach, currently being famous for surfing. Yes there is a surfing school Covelong established where we can get surfing lessons. They also organise yearly international level surfing competition and music festivals. The beach also has rocky shore lines.

Name: pushpanjalikumar
Title: hidden jewel of a beach
Review: This beach is less heard of and is 40 kms from heart of chennai. However the beauty is worth the journey. The area is swamped with sea water and creates amazing scenery in itself. The stones on the beach provide good place to sit and enjoy.

Name: Pawan G
Title: Sunrise photography trip
Review: Awesome drive via OMR which is safer than ECR. Reach this beach before sunrise! The sunrise and the sea against the rocks on the beach is such a serene view to look at!! Must visit place for trying long exposure shots

Name: akki4865
Title: Travel
Review: After midday I was looking for the good place and beach I love it I go on beach there re many people.beach is really beautiful and I also visit mgr temple

Name: kumarjayamalla
Title: Cool and Nice place
Review: Not much crowded and cool to enjoy beach view and food stalls are good transportation is availble all the time that is good part.

Name: Aishwarya S
Title: Sea Diving
Review: we around 8 people went for a mid sea diving in kovalam beach, it was a very good experience.. there local boat man are running these kind of activities, it is so safe to go. I wondered in Chennai there are these types of adventures to do :) really surprised and impressed. for going inside sea, we were given life jackets which was of good quality, and we went in in a motor boat and at one place boat man said we can jump into water, the boat had a rope tied along with it, we all get down into water and its fun was immeasurable :D we spend almost 1 hour inside water playing floating :D it was a very good experience :) even old people, kids also came there just to go for a boat ride inside sea :) but the sea shore was so dirty, they can keep it clean and improve tourism. Chennai can bring more water sports game like this and attract tourists :)

Name: Shyamis
Title: Quieter and cleaner
Review: If you are looking for something quieter and cleaner than the Marina and also don't mind the long drive on ECR then this beach is for you.

Name: Ismail_is123
Title: Must visit if you are on the way to mahabalipuram...
Review: Not very crowded beach..If you are a fish lover , then you will love this place.. You will find shops selling fried fish for a cheap price all around.. I have seen few shops allowing people to drink liquor as well..They sell fresh fish which is just out of water on the shores for a very cheap price ..

Name: Virendra Mishra
Title: A good beach with cleaned and less visitors
Review: I used to visit this place every weekend morning 6 to 8 am with my friends and used to walk without shoes between Taj Vivanta hotel to Kovlam fish market. The beach around the fish market is very dirty but after hotel Taj to toward VGP resort is very good with very few visitors.

Name: Hari P
Title: Overcrowded beach in sundays
Review: I loved here to surf. Which is so thrilling. People here are enjoying with their family. nice clouds and waves are interesting.

Name: shwetado
Title: Clean and beautiful
Review: The beach was clean. I had gone in the rains so being a weekend there was not much crowd there. That is what I enjoyed the most. Also, you will find small sea shells there which you can take back as a token of your visit.

Name: ReviewsByAZ
Title: skip, its not what it used to be years ago - its become rotten and dirty
Review: years ago, this used to be the place to go,  for a good time at the beach, but on a recent trip kovalam heavily disappointed. the approach was hard, but the driver found it. the immediate vicinity of the beach was dirty, filthy strewn with plastic bags and plastic disposable water pouches, bused everywhere with loads of travellers from other states and overall felt very unsafe and unhealthy. the beaches were equally dirty - would not recommend at all. was not expecting western standard beaches, but even this was a bit much. we ended up going to another beach up the road towards the city

Name: SagarVS
Title: Dirty beach
Review: I see no reason for you to visit this beach. Its dirty for sure and the same as any fishing hamlet down the coast from Chennai. If you go after 9 am you might see the fishermen come back from sea with their normally disappointing catch. But, that you can see in other places too. Also be careful when you swim, there are no guards, no warnings and people have drowned before. Skip.

Name: Biplab Lenin
Title: Wonderful Beach
Review: Nice beach, nice place, enjoyed a lot with fiends. love to visit again. one of the clean beach in India

Name: Nedungilli
Title: Good beach to visit
Review: I have at least visited this place 15 times in past 8 months. I usually start 6:00Am on saturdays using OMR. In OMR once you reach kelambakkam take left to reach Kovalam beach. THe main purpose I go there is to buy fresh fish. If you reach there by 6:00AM you can see 100s of boats returning with lot of fishes. If you want to buy fish directly got to fisher man and start negotiating. I wont say it would be cheap but surly fresh.For a fish worth of 300Rs . The price will start from 500. But you can ask your price. Do not hesitate to ask the lowest price. I usually ask for Rs100 for worth of Rs 300. SoI will end up paying RS 250. But its all based on your skiil to talk to them in local language.If you have the skill to identify fish name by just looking at it and familiar with its price, then you can make good buy.Those people will easily identify your knowledge on fishes. For example if you ask them , " Is this fish good for frying? " It simply shows your lack of knowledge in fish. If they find you dont know about fish then differently you will be cheated.You will also find small market and local women selling fishes there. Never buy from them. Instead you can buy spoiled fish from roadside shop at higher price. If you want to know more about this place, Please write to me.

Name: vadivel77
Title: Not good place to relax
Review: The beach is not clean and it smell bad . If you want to get fish/prawns fresh this is the place. Nothing else you could do here.

Name: Lavanash
Title: Fishermans paradise
Review: Located alittle on the outskirts, best to go by car as a group and during the day. The beach can be reached by driving through a fishing hamlet. There was direct access through a Mosque, but now as the crowds are more we have to walk or drive around the mosque. Pleasant nice beach with lots of rocks and many fisher boats. There are fish shops selling fried fresh fish. Not a very safe location for visitors in the nights.

Name: Shantanu Jalgaonkar
Title: Kovalam Beach: A good beach to spend evening in Chennai
Review: I was here in month of June. Beach was in good condition and was properly maintained. Even in June, it was very hot here hence it was difficult to walk in day time due to hot sand.One can enjoy in evening. Sea Bathing is prohibited.

Name: asp_smc
Title: Good and bad !
Review: This located on the way to mahabalipuram.. good thing about this beach is easy accessibility by road, shallow water areas to enjoy the sea.. but it's not that clean compared to other beaches in and around chennai, one should avoid rocky areas in the beach to avoid injury , also the local people. Can visit once.

Name: Kaushal16
Title: terrible and dirty beach!!!
Review: the beach is located at a fanatic location and has beautiful shape.. but it is mostly filthy and smells bad.. most of the places u will find fisherman boats and no place to really enjoy the beach..

Name: lpkc
Title: Pleasant Surprise
Review: We planned to go to Kovalam Beach when we were out of options nearby. But we were quite surprised. the beach has lot of rocky formations where we could actually climb. The place that we approach the beach might be crowded with the fisherman boats and the fish market etc. But we can walk past this and walk further right the beach will be quieter and neater. The place is not commercialized yet. It is very less crowded than other beaches of Chennai. So don't expect coffee shops/ ice cream parlors next to the beach front. The beach is at a walkable distance from the bus stop.

Name: wellsitekumaran
Title: Best beach in chennai in terms of safety and waves
Review: I am learning surfing in kovalam beach since last few months. Initially i have perception that this place is not so safe like other beaches in chennai, but everything changed in my first few visits itself. Kovalam is safe place due to its local fishermen community. Sea is more safe due to its coast shape line and rocks near south of the beach give very decent waves for surfers.Visit often kovalam beach then one can realise its beauty.

Name: Sanjeev_Sharma
Title: Dirty , Not maintained - Can be Avoided
Review: The place is dirty and full of vendors all around. you hardly get any space to walk around herenot a place where you can enjoy your time

Name: Karthik R
Title: Not a clean beach
Review: This beach has a great view and a little rocky beach with excellent views, however the approach roads and the beach are very untidy and less hygenic. The parking areas are very limited and not controlled. There are private parking slots which they rent out for Rs.30. Though they are comfortable, unsure about safety and the area is very limited.The beach is crowded on weekends and the approach is full of vendors and narrow approach.One can visit if in Chennai or pass by on ECR as a stop, other than that, a planned visit to this beach is not worth it.

Name: VALLALAAR
Title: Time and Tides wait for none
Review: This is a natural beech where the young and old could enjoy. From Broadway and from Koyambad, Thambaram there are enormous buses are plying.   You can surf here enroute to Mahabalipuram andd Pondicherry route , what is called as ECR East Coast Road.   Through this way you can reach Pondycherry shores..Avoid Sundays and national holidays.    Somewhat unclean.   Visitors..pl.  don't spoil the natural environment.   This is not a suitable place in the odd hours....

Name: Karanveer N
Title: Amazing day !!!!!
Review: If you are in chennai and are going to mahabs or pondicherry, take a left turn on the way and visit this beach.Not many touristsow about it.Its shallow clear water is marvellous.You can go upto the surf school to surf or hire a boat which will take u to the middle of the bay of bengal where you can dive into the sea (with a life jacket on) and swim.One of kind of an experience. ..... must try !!!!!!!

Name: Venu M
Title: rapid wave beach
Review: the beach is flat but not neatly maintained,,the waves are rapid so one can enjoy them to the maximum

Name: srimant2006
Title: Rushless beach
Review: Kovalam beach is nearer to Chennai City.There are so many buses plying between city and beach city,From Koyambedu Central bus stand A/C buses are available upto Kelampakkam.This beach is only about 3 k.ms from here.You can hire Autorikshaw from here at nominal tariff.The beach is unspoilt,and no crowd like famous beaches of Chennai.You can negotiate and purchase freshcach variety fishes directly from fishing boats.

Name: senthilkumar_s3
Title: avoid weekends
Review: visited the beach 4months back when the fishing season started .try to avoid the beach on weekends as it is so crowded and we find it difficult to park but luckily there was a private parking available , kovalam beach has good rocks which is so nice to sit and enjoy .you can take good snaps  standing on the  rock setting . you see lots of fish stalls cooking and serving i never tried so no comments. be extra carefull on the sand while walking  as there was no proper maintance we can see beer bottles,plastic bags , etc.

Name: smartwanderer
Title: Nice clean and serene beach
Review: Its away from the hustles of the city. Its quite clean and i liked the serenity of the place. there are some rocks also on the beach making it more beautiful. Its not commercialized yet. So there are no shops or market nearby. Overall a good place to visit on the ECR Road especially if you are travelling to Pondicherry from Chennai

Name: sreenivasaprasad
Title: Beach beautiful
Review: A beautiful beach clean & beautiful.a vast sea of water everywhere.Nice to play around in sea water & sand.

Name: Shanmuga Prakas... M
Title: If you are a Veg... Please don't visit
Review: Last month we decided to go on a evening to this beach, the place is full of bad smell and lots of shops blocking pedestrians and lot of encroachments. Not a place if you are a veggie since we are veggies too we couldn't stay beyond 5 minutes because of the bad smell.
