Hence, devotees who want to do Pradakshina , have to go around the entire small hillock. Hence, Giri Pradhakshinam is very popular hereWhile walking around the temple, one can spot an Azhinjal tree. This tree is considered most sacred and is said to have been mentioned in the ‚ÄòNaachiyaar Thirumozhi‚Äô composed by Aandaal. Devotees praying for marriage or children tie a small piece of thread from their clothes on the branches of this tree. By doing this with a wish, it is believed that their wishes are granted.

Name: rameushakris
Title: inspiring ancient temple
Review: The god is very attractiveA place worth visitingExcept the inhuman office staff,  rest all fineNo system / norms  exists and aSeem to be in placeYummy yummy Prasadam are availableImproved drinking water facility, clean toilets, improved hygiene are a must and need of the dayOverlook all this and visitIt is worth it

Name: meghashyam
Title: Lord Narasimha swami temple
Review: Very old and hallowed temple for lord narasimha , lord has three eyes third eye is shown when arati is performed , lord is highly benevolent , abisekam done to utsava murthi during pradosham is very famous . A circumbulation of the hill which takes 10 minutes is equal to a giri vala . Panakam can be offered thru temple management .

Name: WVR7933
Title: Great Ancient Narasimhar Temple
Review: This temple of Narasimha is located at Singaperumal Kovil, near to Chennai city, Kanchipuram District. Well connected by bus and EMU Trains. This temple is constructed in the Rock-cut architecture, dedicated to Lord Vishnu who is here worshipped as Lord Narasimhar. Thayar is as Ahobilavalli. Understand that this temple was built by the Pallavas during the 8th century. Such an ancient temple.This temple is open from 7 am to 12 noon and 4.30 pm to 8.30 pm.. Going around the Hill on Poornima Days is very much important. Even on other days, People take this Girivalam. This God here has 3 eyes and it is certain that your misery and worries get removed once you have the Dharshan of the third eye. The temple priest used to show this 3rd eye during Aarthi. Sundays Karthigai month is famous for worship of Narasimhar... There used to be lot of crowd during Karthigai Sundays.However Special entry Darshan is there for Rs.50 and you can have a quick dharshan within 30 minutes... You can also pay Rs.100 and Temple authorities will arrange "Panagam" (Jaggery water) and you can distribute to devotees. Apart from this, the temple has a small catering facility (Pathu Kadai).. You can get good Pepper Dosa, Tamarind rice etc... at a reasonable cost...

Name: Vijay
Title: POWERFUL ALMIGHTY!!!
Review: Temple of Lord Narasimha, located on a small hillock close to Chengalpattu, Must visit temple for absolute peace of mind, powerful deity. The Lord has three eyes.It is believed that if one gets the darshan of the Third Eye, all misery in life would be removed. Temple priest shows third eye during arathi by lifting the Thirunamam.

Name: RAMAKRISHNAN K
Title: oldest temple
Review: The Singa Perumal is a presiding deity in this temple .The temple is easily accessible from chennai as weekend gateway . The renovation work is going on. The temple also has nice mandap and on small hillock type . Lots of monkeys to keep u busy ,,

Name: Mady1818
Title: Excellent temple - a 2 hour drive from Chennai
Review: Patalathri Narasimhar temple is located at Singaperumal Koil, which is well connected from Chennai by electric trains (Suburban trains) & Buses. It is also a 1-2 hours drive from Chennai city.You can either take the Chennai beach - Singaperumal koil EMU train or get a bus from Tambaram railway station (take a bus which leaves to Mahindra City & ask to get down at Singaperumal Koil)Coming to the temple, it is easily walkable from the bus stop (hardly 150-200 mtrs). If I were to describe the temple in one word, it would be "wow". Basically the deities are located inside a cave, carved-in. The temple is around 1000-2000 years old. Patalathri Narasimhar & his consort Sri Ahobilawalli thayar amma is a great sight to see. Sthala vrichatam is Parijatham tree. Speciality is the "Podi dosa" given at nearbuy Prasadam stall.Since it is a hill temple, people go giri-valam (walkable, not much of steps). Also, you can buy "Panakam - a ginger drink" from the front office & offer as "Prasadham" to devotees.Outside flower shops & chappal stands are available.In short, A must visit temple which is a short drive from Chennai.

Name: happyking112
Title: Famous temple..must visit at least once
Review: famous temple...The temple is open from 7 a.m. to 12 p.m. and 4:30 p.m. to 8:30 p.m. and has four daily rituals at various times of the day....i saw a video in youtube which shows the torute from chennai to this temple..do watch it if you are travelling from chennai...the title of the video in youtube is "Chennai to Singaperumal Koil full road trip".......must visit...parking can be an issue during season time

Name: meghashyam
Title: Sri Padaladhri Narasimha Swami Temple .
Review: A pallava period temple , rock cut , the Moolavar is majestic , Sri Ugra Narasimha Swami , the Lord has three eyes , utsava idol is also very beautiful , every pradosham thirumanjanam is performed for utsava vigraha . Giri pradakshina is very important here , 9 times giri pradakshina is a custom . Very small temple . Sri hayagriva temple at chettipunyam is 8 kms from here .

Name: rasa006
Title: Patalathri Narasimhar or Ugra Narasimghar temple in Singaperumal koil, near Chennai. wonderful cave temple.
Review: I am really ashamed to note that I visited this temple only today-25.12.2016, even though I reside in Chennai for the past 41 years. This beautiful cave cut temple (in tamil- kudavarai koil: meaning a temple made in hillock cutting the stone). This temple dates back to around 1400 years old. Speciality of this temple is, sun rays fall on the feet of Lord Narasimha during Dec-Jan period (in Tamil month Margazi), since we visited  during this period, we were lucky enough to watch this spectre. This Ugra Narasimghar has third Eye, like Lord Siva and while making aarthi, the priest showed us the third Eye of Lord Narasimgha, by lifting the jewelled Thiruman of Lord. Oh, we felt Lord Narasimgha's blessing from His abhaya mudra hands. Another important aspect of this temple is Pradhakshanam - circumventing the Lord's  sanctum. Since the Lord's sanctum is inside the rock cut cave, we have to go around the small hillock- with convenient steps to climb and descend , making pradhakshanam easier for all. There is a Parijatham tree at the hillock, and anyone's wish is fullfilled if you tie a knot with yellow thread in the tree.Ambal, Ahibila thayar in near by separate sanctum who blesses all Her devotees. We had a wonderful darshan.

Name: Lakshmi Narayanan S
Title: One of the beautiful Cave temples
Review: This temple is dedicated for Narasimhar swamy and is located on Chennai - Chengalpet (NH 45) highway (off by 100 m). Shirne for Lord Narashimar was formed by drilling a cave under a huge rock. For relief from debt burden, success in litigation, those under adverse aspect of Mars affecting their marriage, those born of Swathi and Tiruvadirai stars, those undergoing Rahu Period (dragon‚Äôs tail) and those suffering from Saturn aspects pray to Lord Patalathri Narasimha for relief.  There is a tree called Azhinjal behind the temple with powerful effects.  Those awaiting marriage, seeking child boon and excellence in education pray on this tree applying sandal and kumkum and light lamps with ghee.

Name: Sangeetha Vikram
Title: Singaperumal temple - Powerful Lakshmi Narasimma perumal temple
Review: Myself along with mom visited 'Singapperumal Kovil' on a Saturday evening, we got down at Singapperumal Kovil station and walked to the temple.The temple opened at 4.30 pm, more crowd was there when we visited. The main deity was Lakshmi Narasimma perumal, poojas were performed well at the temple. We did girivalam around the temple, the view of the temple from back side was awesome. Must visit temple at Chennai.

Name: Karthik R
Title: A must visit in Chennai
Review: Singaperumal Koil is about 24 kms from Tambaram and the temple is just 100 meters off the GST Road on the left side towards Chengalpat. The temple is an important place for Lord Narasimma. It is believed that the prayers made at this temple are answered immediately by the lord.The temple is open as early as 5 AM and early morning visits are very auspicious. It is famous to lit deepams at this temple to get rid from bad omens and happenings. Also, there is a spiritual that the priest will splash holy water on the face on special request. Melagu Dosai and podi are very famous prasadams at this temple on the weekends.

Name: Radhika Narasimhan
Title: Gandhiji statue in Marina beach
Review: Yesterday I visited Marina beach. From Mylapore side via RK salai road, the first thing that falls in our eyes will be Gandhi thatha statue. This statue is one such landmark which paves entry to the beach. There is a walking space around the statue, seaters and view of the blue waters from the statue is mesmerising. Evenings and early mornings are ideal time to sit near the statue.

Name: Hooray H
Title: Tribute to a great Human
Review: A gentle reminder that India raised a great man- admired by all of the most intellectual people of the World.Not appreciated enough in his home land though except on the notes!

Name: AURELIO L
Title: see it
Review: it s the tribute of a country to a great man the statue itself is not so so important it s one of the verious statues of this town

Name: 1777NT
Title: Looked like Gandhi, what more could I possibly say.
Review: But if you are a Gandhi fan visit his museum, get the Indian version or the lead up to independence rather than the former colonial version!

Name: Wil Chung
Title: What a tribute
Review: Beautiful statue based on Marina Beach.very large and life-like along with a description and explanation of the father of India.

Name: Othman S
Title: Ghandi statue
Review: Good design and looks real. It's explain the story of ghandi and why he is dressing like that and what great efforts done

Name: Deadman17
Title: Statue of the father of the nation
Review: This statue is located at the Marina beach front and is the tribute to the father of the Indian nation-Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi. The place has various stalls selling food and other stuff near by. The area can be beautified further. The place has ample parking, but has no shade and hence it is preferable to visit in early morning or late evening to avoid the hard sun.

Name: TravellingSands
Title: Scenic Spot
Review: Gandhi statue is a tribute to the father of nation on the Marina Beach Front. A lot of fast food stalls, an open gym , coffee shop and a public toilet are located in the vicinity facing the beach. A good evening walk is guaranteed.

Name: Srinivas S
Title: Nice place
Review: Father of the the nation's statue was erected at the center, near the Marina beach. It's well maintained to sit and enjoy sea breeze.

Name: Praveenop
Title: A statue erected in the Marina Beach in respect to the father of the Nation
Review: This statue is situated at the Marina Beach which is one of Chennai's major tourist attraction. Marina Beach is known for many things and is near many many other landmarks of Chennai. The Marina beach like the other beaches in the western world is not known for Beach life. This beach is known for the pleasant evening breeze which releives the stifling heat of Chennai and saves the citizens of Chennai, variety it offers with its the finger foods stalls.

Name: Sadique2
Title: can be improved
Review: Cleanliness and traffic needs to be looked into with priority. more facilities to be introduced. accessible wash rooms is a must.

Name: Ananth 727499
Title: Only statue of its kind..
Review: This statue is made of bronze.  This statue was installed here in the year 1959 by Jawaharlal Nehru.. The statue stands on a 12 feet pedestal.. The statue was sculpted by " Debi Prasad Roy Chowdry"..A very notable landmark in Marina beach and for Chennai...

Name: Thomas J
Title: on the beach
Review: This magnificent Statue of Ghandi is right on the beach for everyone to see. Every time you drive past you admire it :)

Name: Aarav K
Title: Nice Statue of great man
Review: I have seen so many statues of Gandhiji but have not seen such an idol yet. This very old statue of Gandhiji is kept in a lot of mantle and hence remains beautiful. This idol reminds Gandhiji of contributing to India.

Name: Anusuya D
Title: Well maintained
Review: Landmark place of Chennai marina beach. Near Gandhi statue , we can spend time as it is well maintained, clean and neat. Though there is many gandhi statue, it is known for its located place

Name: Ron E
Title: Seen many Gandhi statues
Review: There seem to be so many Gandhi statues in India that makes none of them that unique. We saw ten or so just travelling from Kovalam to Chennai alone. Good to see the reverence though.

Name: 1Jayanthi
Title: excellently located  Mahatma's statue
Review: This Gandhji's statue has been adoring the Marina beach for years now. Well kept surroundings and you feel the gratitude to Gandhi when you visit this place

Name: Mukta2016
Title: Statue of Mahatma Gandhi
Review: This is a prominent statue of Mahatma Gandhi on a high pedestal along the Marina Beach Road. The statue is very well made and captures the great man's humility very nicely.

Name: Pradeep G
Title: Very pleasant place to visit in the evening
Review: In the evening if you like to go the marina beach, it is Very pleasant  to visit Gandhi statue with family.

Name: Nitesh Rajput
Title: Its good statue
Review: Gandhi statue at Marina beach isn't a new scenario. You can find Gandhi statue on many places within tamil nadu, some are specifically dedicated to M K Gandhi.

Name: Muguncjb
Title: will not miss
Review: When visiting Chennai, the first attraction comes to mind is Marina beach. Gandhi Statue is located close to the Marina beach on the main road. So anyone visiting the beach will have to cross and watch this Gandhi statue. So it is not a separate attraction but everyone will see it because of visiting Marina.

Name: HappySheep
Title: Statue
Review: Much loved statue, often covered in draping flowers in honour of the man, on the highway out of town by a park

Name: nageswararao g
Title: Bapu Statue
Review: Its a well made bapuji Statue. Gandhi is The freedom fighter for India and his statues are all over india and this is one amongst them.

Name: Komator
Title: A statue on the beach
Review: Gandhi's statue is on Marina Beach. It's a nice statue, but that's it. If you're walking the area or the marina, it's worth stopping and taking a look. But that's it.

Name: Puneetkumar Pattar
Title: Just a statue on the Marina beach
Review: Located on the Marina beach signal, this is just a statue of Mr Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi, who is also called as Mahatma Gandhi. Nothing much.

Name: RamGanesan
Title: Not an attraction definetly
Review: This used to be a landmark before 20 years.  Now the busy Marina road has so many attractions that this statue has got no importance.  A sad tale for such an important person. There is nothing to see here either.  While driving on the marina road, you can see if from the moving vehicle itself.  Thats about what this landmark has got.

Name: Ganesh K
Title: Once upon time it's is the well known beach
Review: But now it has lost its name. Lot of illegal activities are happening in the evening and night.  Be safe when u visit in the morning and night. Not safe to go in the night near the waves. During the day u can see lot of lovers engaged in unwanted activities. Don't buy anything in the beach. Everything is un hygienic and very expensive.sorry to tell u the truth.

Name: Anusree P
Title: Popular monument
Review: It is one of the popular monument in marina beach..  Nothing special on this. But could take a photo with it. and enjoy the sunrise if you go early morning in the marina. Marina is not a good place to visit as it is really really crowdy

Name: ramchabi
Title: Father of the nation by the beach
Review: If you like early morning or evening walks by the marina beach, you will see this statue.  It is situated right on the Marina beach and it is good place to spend the evenings.The place is always crowded and hence, not the best part of the

Name: Joshsang
Title: the view of the sea as you hit the statue lifts yr spirits
Review: I like this stretch of road - sometimes more than the actual beach, which can be very very dirty. its nice to just sit at the statue and watch passers by, maybe grab a corn on the cob, and just chill

Name: BBhusanMohanty
Title: One of the Popular Monument
Review: Gandhi Statue at Gandhi Beach or in Marina Beach. The place is So Popular an Populated during Very early Morning and Evening Hour.Need to go any where inside the city can started from Gandhi Statue near Marina Beach.

Name: reddi_traveller
Title: Gandhi Statue
Review: Gandhi Statue is exactly situated at Marina Beach and it is a very pleasant place to spend some time with friends and family during evenings. During weekends it will be so crowded..

Name: ambarksingh
Title: Visit during sunrise/sunset
Review: Just another architectural Gandhi statue - only plus point is that being situated at Marina beach, it looks good during dusk and dawn

Name: Mitesh Pathak
Title: This place on Marina Beach is Jewel in Crown
Review: Well maintained and beautiful landscaped surrounded statue of Father of nation at Marina Beach. Felt proud at this place.

Name: vikasnarayanan
Title: photo spot
Review: Right on the road and close to the beach, nice to spend few minutes and click a picture..Could be maintained a little better

Name: FaisalShb
Title: Standard thing to do
Review: The area could be maintained better & kept alot cleaner. A few other good sculptures around this site.

Name: tyag_1984
Title: Nice place for a outdoor game
Review: can enjoy outdoor games in the evening. clean and maintained well. avoid going on a sunny day or during noon

Name: StephenThomas7
Title: Well maintained
Review: Its a perfect landmark. The statue is well maintained. It really draws the attention of the public. Good one.

Name: authorneelesh
Title: the obligatory statue
Review: We have forgotten gandhi but not forgotten to put up his statues !On the main Marina beach it is at least going to remind future generations of that there was such a man

Name: 592abck
Title: Good statue
Review: Personally I am not a follower of Gandhi thoughts so I saw it purely from a architectural perspective and to me it is just another statue

Name: pnssnp
Title: well maintained
Review: it is located by the beach and thus draws the attention of hundreds of passerby. unlike the beach itself, at least it wasn't littered with garbage

Name: Zinia F
Title: Gandhi, standing tall
Review: Went to visit the famous Marina beach, but this came along the way!  Surprising yet very welcoming as the sculpture is rather impressive and well maintained.I saw another of these in Kolkata with similar build but this is far too superior to that.

Name: Rajasekhar M
Title: An evening at beach
Review: Cool breeze, tasty fish from the Tamil Nadu tourism food vendorWalk along shores and reach Gandhi statue. Sit n enjoy the beach on one side and the city on other side.Hear stories of the tsunami and the devastation

Name: MumbaiIndia
Title: Good Photo Stop
Review: This is located right on the Marina Beach and is a good Photostop.  Most of you using Ola/Uber would be conversant since this is the pick up point for Marina Beach.  Very well maintained place.

Name: hengky rahardja
Title: just a statue...
Review: i think the statue should give an educational purpose of what Gandhi have done with the 'ahimsa' way of life...

Name: rasa006
Title: Gandhi Statue in Marina is a land mark for any visitors to Chennai and a good leisure spot all Chennaites.
Review: This place was,is and will be my favourite place-whenever I visit Marina beach in Chennai. It is just 5-6 kms from my residence and I visiting this Gandhi statue area for the pas so many years, in particular during summer days. A good leisure spot, with less problems-compared to Triplicane beach ( old Kannagi statue area).Recently, surrounding areas are renovated with good stones and marbles ,with walking areas are demarcated, for walkers. One can come across lot of small bites shop near the statue and also on marina beach sands. Lot of parking facilities are created in this area,but during summer weekends, parking is a problem. During Kannum Pongal (16.01.2018) unmanageable crowd assemble here. It is same for every year during this Pongal festival time.I used t spend lot of time with my family and friends.

Name: Jeannie2207
Title: Great Statue of Great Man
Review: We could only stop a short while here (but you don't need long).  It's worth just reflecting on the life of Gandhi as you pass by.  The statue can easily get overlooked as it is on a busy road, but if you can, take 5 minutes out to take a look.

Name: 674santha
Title: landmark of chennai
Review: In 1950 Debi Roy Chowdhury, principal of Madras school of arts and crafts, constructed the labour and GANDHI STATUE. it is very close to the lighthouse and become a tourist attraction also. people come from various places just to see and honour Mahatma . recently renovation was done with beautiful landscape marble laid pathways  etc

Name: ravikumartalara
Title: very peaceful place.
Review: silent and memorable place.it remembers gandhi life style.very nice ambience.very calm and decent place

Name: jawa13
Title: Chennia Marina beach attraction
Review: Gandhi statue is on the Marina beach right next to the lighthouse. This is one of the many statues on the beach. THis is a great location for an early morning run or walk.

Name: Balasubramanian R
Title: Chennai Gandhi Statue
Review: Gandhi Statue is situated in sea shore of Bay of bengal in Chennai city and it is on the Beach road. Silent prayer, Garlanding with flowers will be held here during Gandhi Jeyanthi, Independence, Republic days. It is nearby Light house, IG Police office, queen mary college.

Name: Robert H
Title: Beach front statue
Review: We are most appreciative of the work and history of Ghandi but this statue is in a strange location to appreciate. Hard to photograph due to sun and surrounded by mess.

Name: vmtrek_travel
Title: Milestone for Marina Beach
Review: The center point for people visiting Marina Beach. A perfect landmark for the vast stretch of the beach. The area, in and around the statue, was well kept...  well lighted. A good place for Instagram upload.

Name: iftekhar ansari
Title: normal statue
Review: It is a normal statue build at entrance of Marina beach. there is sitting places built in the surrounding of statue.

Name: Bibhu_PB
Title: Statue of Mahatma Gandhi!!!
Review: One Landmark Place At Chennai Near to Marina Beach one just cannot miss this.  A great sculptured statue of the Father of the Nation.

Name: Travelbug291
Title: Tribute to The 'Father' of India
Review: Any edifice that celebrates such a wonderful man as Ghandi is  to be applauded. Placed where it must be seen by most traffic passing through the town, sadly the traffic volume is such that you are not able to stop, and have but a few seconds to take in this magnificent statue.

Name: Mehmet Konak
Title: Nice place
Review: It is at Marina beach. nice photograph point. It is crowded eveving time.Take bottled water with you.

Name: ajcruzing
Title: This is a 1:1 scale statue of GANDHI on tha beach coast of chennai .
Review: Hi i am AJ Cruz (@ajcruzing)This a Gandhi Statue it is present on the beach coast of chennai (marina beach)You'll find this closer to the lighthouse near the walkway platform by the beach .- Photographable .- watchable .- walkbyable .it is like a normal statue by the statue .As it is made from the face of GANDHI , it just represents some to it .

Name: hareesha1
Title: Nothing special with the statue itself
Review: The statue is not special in itself but adds to the attractions at and around marina beach. It is prominently visible from the road.

Name: s_ramsam
Title: Statue near Marina beach
Review: This is a statue of Gandhiji located in the Marina beach area. Not a major attraction in itself since there is nothing particularly special about this statue which is like so many others in the country.

Name: Kunal_Lalawat
Title: iconic historical figure but poor surroundings
Review: I recently visited the place where the statue was situated. The place is not well lit and neither it was clean.

Name: VRAMESH
Title: Land mark
Review: Gandhi Statue located near Marina Beach and it is also land mark for Beach. It can be viewed while travelling on beach road

Name: Kalithasan R
Title: Statue nearby Marina beach
Review: Audience who follows Indian cinema might have seen this statue, whenever Chennai is shown. One of the iconic spot of Chennai located on the roadside of Marina Beach. Tourist visiting marina beach can spare for few minutes and have a look at the statue. Maintained well.

Name: Karthik R
Title: Beachy!!
Review: Whats not to like about this place just sit there by the shore and watch the ocean for hours in the evening. When the weather is right this is the first place that I want to be in Chennai. The early morning when the air is fresh and the cool sea to wet your feet after the jogging. At evening the place transforms into the eat street for some great snack and great place to hang out with friends. But the shortfall is that the beach may be dirty at times and no shower to wash after playing in the water. so people should be prepared to wait till they get home to take a shower.

Name: MemphisZ
Title: This is a drive by...
Review: We saw the statue driving by and saw no real reason to stop.   It was nice to see, but not a major attraction. I would not plan a trip to just visit this.

Name: mahithaprasad19
Title: Iconic landmark
Review: One of the iconic landmark places in the city. The beach here is quite popular and gets quite crowded.

Name: Gaurang S
Title: Nothing to review it
Review: Simple statue; as so many statues are placed in various statues. This Statue required nigher a visit nor a review.

Name: selvambikaiyali
Title: gandhi statue
Review: located in the merina beach, need some maintenance. some resting place required for public. very hot

Name: KaranPais
Title: Statue of Father of the nation
Review: I would recommend visiting only if you are interested/ fan of Mahatma Gandhi. Its just another statue of symbolic importance. Skip it, unless you have plenty of time

Name: Ghiri T
Title: A statue of a Great Leader.
Review: The statue of Mahatma Gandhi is situated in Marina beach near lighthouse. It is erected on 14th of April 1959.It is placed in memory of Gandhi.It is one of the landmark on Marina beach.

Name: Praveen S
Title: Excellent Statue
Review: Once you enter into marina, the next thing to view is Gandhi statue, black statue with excellent design

Name: SURBHI J
Title: Patriotic
Review: It's located somewhere on the center of Marina beach, and you can easily see this when you start towards beach area

Name: Ramika
Title: This side of the beach is really nice
Review: Had a good evening. Lot of public visits it on the weekends but far less than the Besant Nagar beach.Majority of the hawkers are selling Veg foods.

Name: krishna p
Title: Father of Indian nation
Review: This is the statute near to marina beach where there different great people statues located in the beach area and this designed in good way and placed in between of the 4 road junction.

Name: B R S
Title: A Tribute to the Father of the Nation
Review: The Gandhi Statue, a Tribute to the Father of the Nation, stands on the Marina towards the Southern End at the junction of Radhakrishnan Salai and Kamarajar Promenade,  It is a must see tourist spot of Chennai,

Name: helpothers2016
Title: Real experience
Review: You do not feel exhausted when you keep watching this statue. The work involved in this, the person in the statue and the environment gives you a pleasant feeling that you keep enjoying and admiring the sculptor and the person in the statue.

Name: rakeDelhi
Title: landmark of marina beach
Review: The statue of Gandhi and a base of granite and kept clean throughout the day and in the wee hours of morning people sit around it and do their morning gupshup.A must see for visitors

Name: arunkk1
Title: A city Landmark
Review: The Gandhi Statue is situated in Marina beach near light house. It is a memorial to father of the Nation Gandhiji. Visiting is good and take photos is really worth.

Name: velayudhan
Title: Patriotic Place
Review: Gandhi Statue in Marina Beach the worlds second largest beach is really a patriotic place. When even i go towards that Marian Beach I spent Time to pay respect for our NATIONAL FATHER . It is a really patriotic place . Most of the National Functions that held here in Marina starts here

Name: sridharan2013
Title: Imposing Monument of the Father of Nation
Review: Gandhi Statue at Marina is a landmark in chennai on the busy and famous sea shore. The statue is a constant reminder of our freedom struggles and leadership of Mahatma Gandhiji. The entire area is neatly maintained and attracts lots of people who come to the beach to enjoy fresh air and do their regular exercises. The entire stretch of marina beach is visible from the statue.

Name: AakashT91
Title: Crown in the jewel
Review: Marina beach is itself beautiful and perfect for a evening stroll. Gandhi statue adds value to the place. It serves the purpose of meeting point as well.

Name: vikasmardia
Title: gandhi statue
Review: Gandhi statue located on marina beach is a hub for all activities and also landmark for meeting friends. An iconic place of Chennai.

Name: snsuma
Title: nice place to visit in the evenings ..
Review: Nice place for a evening stroll. Not advised to visit in summer as its too hot and humid. not much options for food.. Very small eateries found on the beach.

Name: Joji J
Title: "good to see Gandhiji's Statue near the Marina Beach & Light House"
Review: The Gandhi Square is in a prime location; near Marina Beach and the light house where most people visit and the statue of Gandhiji will not go unnoticed. Many foreigners also visit here and they too will see that we honour the father of our nation. The Gandhi Square area is one of the cleanest area of Marina beach.

Name: Partha C
Title: Gandhi Statue at Marina Beach.
Review: It is in Marina Beach, nice place. Beautiful Statue of Mahatma Gandhi, Father of  the Nation ( INDIA). We can see and respect the great leader.

Name: Marcus
Title: The "nice" part of Marina Beach
Review: The area with the very nice Gandhi statue is by far the nicest part of the so called Marina "beach".The statue of Gandhi is one of the best "modern" statues I have seen. Very much Gandhi; powerful simplicity!

Name: Anusuya D
Title: landmark place in marina beach
Review: it is a one place we can point out as a landmark for marina beach. somewhat cleanest place, near to light house

Name: D MOHAN
Title: Iconic land mark
Review: It is bang in the middle of marina beach and you just cannot miss it.Spend some time reflecting on the great person that Gandhiji was.Gentle but tough on suppression,quietly outspoken,patient but in a hurry for independance etc

Name: Dara-Khmer
Title: It's a small statue
Review: Look Gandhi is a revered figure of history and a great man, but this is a small statue with nothing much there and opposite the beachImportant to locals maybe but to a tourist - not worth the visit

Name: worldtraveler73_7
Title: Nice Landmark
Review: This is a typical landmark of the beach. It is a place where often people meet up. It is nicely done. The beach has a nice promenade to walk, but it is a bit smelly because of the fish market nearby

Name: Karthik R
Title: Identity at beach
Review: Gandhi statue is the identity of Gandhi beach. This is on the beach road near IG office. This is a landmark for people to go towards Marina beach or light house. This could be promoted better as a designated tourist spot.

Name: tafayyaz
Title: Must see place for tourist
Review: One of the good statue of M. Gandhi in India. Every tourist visits Marian Bay, must have a look at this statue.

Name: krish862
Title: very nice place to visit on the beach front
Review: the marina beach centre, our father of nation statue was erected. It is really very nice of honouring him in this way

Name: Anand G
Title: Nice place to be in Marina
Review: Located in the possibly cleanest area of the Marina Beach, the statue as well as the environs are fairly well maintained. Of course, seeing a Gandhi statue evokes emotions to an Indian. The place is not far from the Light House and hence the visits can be clubbed.to save time.

Name: Ramprasad b
Title: Best Part of Marina Beach
Review: Gandhi statue on the Marina is a big land mark. This is located near to the Light House.  Lawns and trees are well maintained.  Ample parking space is available on the main road and beach service road near the statue.  This area is not as crowded as other parts of Marina Beach.  Also, it has less number of shops in the beach sands.  Good place to relax on summer evenings.

Name: Rucha121
Title: Landmark point
Review: Towering statue of Gandhiji on stretch of Marina Beach is iconic and also serves as meeting point for many people. Mnay people do exercise and yoga around this place and beautiful pavement has been built around this for public.

Name: Madana A
Title: The Gandhi statue is an imposing one in such a place.
Review: No one can go to Marina Beach without noticing the great statue of Gandhi.  The place is very clean and is visited by many people.  There are also many Government buildings on the opposite side of the road.

Name: Jothilingam E
Title: The Statue in Chennai mark
Review: Famoius location in chennai beach area..must see by allOpposite Queen marys college apart from offices and Light House.One will enjoy right from Presidency college(also Madras university) close to many memorials to all along beach are till Gandhi statue.From gandhi statue further down to Besant nager beach also nice.Do not forget to taste Bajji,Bonda,Mango slice etc etc etc..in the beach..Sundal(Peas) is of another chennai beach tasty snack,which every visiter must taste.Dont go alone during odd hours or after 7Pm,as you may face

Name: YatriForever
Title: Gandhiji at a vantage point; meeting point.
Review: This is one of the well maintained statutes of Gandhiji in Chennai. The location of the statue makes it more important. It is at the intersection of beach road and Radhakrishna salai; so an obvious meeting point for people coming from different directions of the city. If you are visiting the southern end of the Marina beach, its worth looking up Bapuji !

Name: Marc L
Title: Not quite Pondicherry
Review: We walked past it and am surprised to see it being reviewed. It's just a statue of the amazing Ghandi but the one in Pondicherry is incredible

Name: RajeeshRj
Title: Nostalgic & Peaceful Place
Review: Very Nostalgic place where I grew up doing volunteering throught the school. The place has been maintained clean and always provided inner peace whenever I visit the temple.In 1956,¬†Chandrashekarendra Saraswati¬†Swamigal, a twentieth-century saint and seer of the Kanchi Mutt, visited Chromepet. On looking at the hill, he proposed that a temple be built for Murugan. The temple for Siddhi Vinayagar was built in the same year. Twenty years later, while clearing the hillside for a path, a lance, the prime weapon of Lord¬†Muruga, was found. This inspired the devotees to speed up work.¬†The consecration of the Sri Swaminathaswamy temple was performed in 1979. Slowly, more shrines were added for Shiva, Sarabeshwara, Ambal and the Navagrahas.A five tier Rajagopuram has been constructed recently. Though the spade work had commenced long ago, the actual construction work on the Rajagopuram commenced in 2011-12 and concluded in January 2014. Renovation and painting works have also been carried out in the temple in connection with the Mahakumbhabhishekam (consecration ceremony). A new Artha mandapam adjoining the Rajagopuram has been constructed. A few civil works remain to be completed(February 2014). A new Dwajasthambam (Flag Mast) has also been erected. Cultural and religious events like music, dance and discourses were held at the Arunagirinathar Hall inside the temple precincts every day for over a year in 2013-14 as a part of the Rajagopuram construction and temple renovation.

Name: Cosmopolitan332905
Title: Peaceful temple
Review: Beautiful temple on a small hill. It is located between Tambaram Sanatorium and Chrompet Railway stations. It has around 80 steps to reach the temple at hill. Best to visit in the early morning. It has lot of Sannidhis for each God. Small and peaceful temple.

Name: Sivalingam Sankar
Title: Peaceful Temple during early morning
Review: Clean temple with separate sanidhis for each lords, have to walk some way to the top of the temple. Very near by chrompet main bus stop

Name: Venkataraman R
Title: Peaceful mountain temple of Lord Murugan close to city
Review: This is a small mountain temple very near to Chennai city. Easily reachable by train, as Chromepet is having EMU station, very close to temple. Peaceful temple with Lord Murugan blessing in standing posture, and fairly big idol. There are famous murugan hymns engraved in walls in the Prakaram (circambulate path). There is a siva, parvathy, Sarabeshwarar temple on the way to eat to hill top. We can get good view of Chromepet from the top. They is a  perumal temple also, once you get down the hill, opposite to temple entrance.Overall peaceful Temple to spend time. In the evening, you get nice air at temple top.

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: Nice temple
Review: Nice temple with a lot of parking place .You can get the whole view of the nearby locality and this temple is on a rock

Name: Santhosh K
Title: Religious
Review: Excellent murugan temple. Not really an old temple. However peace and satisfaction guarantee.heart of chennai hill temple lord ganesh muruga Amman meenakshi and sundareswarar

Name: saravananjstech
Title: Peaceful hill temple
Review: Very peaceful murugan temple nearby chrompet. Well maintained and perumal temple situated nearby this temple.

Name: Lakshmi Narayanan S
Title: A peaceful temple on a small hill
Review: This temple is dedicated for Lord Murugan. Temple is built on a small hill which is in Chromepet. Temple has peaceful environment and is less crowded usually. On auspicious days for Lord Murugan, it may be little over crowded. Not sure whether frequent public transport is available to this place, better to hire a cab.

Name: Arun A
Title: Calm temple
Review: This a calm temple. Located on a small hill top. This located close to chrompet. Usually not much crowded.

Name: RAJKUMAR A
Title: Tiny hill temple - extremely clean and decent
Review: Very good maintained temple.. The silence, atmosphere are very nice.. Its a small one and it'll be liked a lot by lord shiva and lord muruga devotees...

Name: Krishna G K
Title: Nice temple on a small hillock
Review: This temple is situated on a small hillock near Hastinapuram. You can reach the temple from Chromepet using the mini-bus which goes to Sembakkam (I think bus number is S2 or S4)The temple is dedicated to Hindu god Lord Muruga. You might have to take a flight of stairs about 90 in number. It is not stressful at all. If you reach the top, there is a beautiful little temple which is well maintained. They say it is almost half a century oldYou can see Lord Murugan in the standing pose and is very cute. The hilltop provides a good view of the surroundings. The environment is peaceful and relaxing. Do visit once if you are nearby Chromepet or Hastinapuram

Name: Rajkumar R
Title: Calm and Relaxing place for a weekend evening
Review: Vehicles are not accessible to reach the temple on the small hill. We need to climb the steps (approx 100 steps). The temple is clean and cool. We can feel a good vibration being inside the temple. Suitable for a weekend evening outing with family.

Name: Karthik V
Title: Good Food - High price - Less Quantity
Review: Its a new restaurant servng authentic chettinad and madurai dishes in Vadalapani. Althout the place is neat clean and the service good...the rates were too high for that atmosphere . sow as the quantity less for that price. But the food was awesome.Worth trying once.

Name: cool1960
Title: Pazhani of Chennai
Review: It is difficult to find a shrine like this in city. You have to climb steps to get the dharsan. It is worth doing that as you get to see the surroundings and get a good breeze.It is a nice different than other shrines in Chennai.

Name: harleen_sethi
Title: Lord Murugan temple
Review: Kumaran Kundram is located at a distance of 1 km from the Chrompet railway station and is easily accessible. The temple is around 40-years old and dedicated to Lord Murugan. You need to visit this temple during your Chennai visits ‚Äì very calm and serene temple to offer your prayers to the almighty.

Name: Rajan Chopra
Title: Nice place
Review: Very nice place for the quiet and soothing environment. Number of steps to climb the mountain are a lot though.

Name: Saravana K
Title: All time favorite !!
Review: This little hill temple has been my favorite from my school time and its ten minutes away from our house. It gives me peace of mind when ever I climb this hill with my mates or uni friends. A lot of cultural and ritual activities happening all round the year. I thoroughly recommend it to anyone who fancy little peace of mind and bit of change in visiting temple on hill.

Name: Charvi O
Title: Great Place to be
Review: Love the environment and the organization of the maintenance. Great if you really belive in GOD. Dance was very adorable.

Name: mur2108
Title: Oldest temple in and around Chrompet
Review: This place is called as South chennai Swamimalai. A small hill with 100 steps to climb. Divine, Spirituality

Name: ramayana2013
Title: swami malai of chennai
Review: the temple is near chrompet on a similar hillock simillar to swamimalai. the presiding deity is suramanian.. this is a new temple aout 50 yrs old. there are aout fifty steps. 5tier rajagopuram. maintained neat.

Name: Selva P
Title: A peaceful place for the evening
Review: The shrine of Lord Muruga , the temple is on a small hill with around 100 steps to the top. Usually i enjoy a pleasure walk up and enjoy the breeze there . Sitting on the stairs and chatting with the closed one will be fun .

Name: Krishna Kumar S
Title: Gem of a temple amidst city limits.. atop a small hill
Review: First of all, visit this holy place with lot of time in hand. The moment you climb to the top of the hill, you will feel like spending some time in a relaxed manner and taking an aeriel view of chennai.This is a murugan temple that also has Sivan shrine on the way up the hill. be prepared for a small climb..not much of a climb but if you have aged people in your group, then you need to plan it properly. The deity and the poojas are very good. the temple timings are pretty much standard timings but check on those religious /auspicious dates for lord Murugan as this temple will be very crowded on those days. Do not miss the lakshmi narasimhar temple which is just opposite to this temple (at the foothill). That is also a very nice temple. There are small shops nearby for buying pooja /archana items. This is a nice place especially in the evening. Avoid afternoon time on hot days.. Have a nice trip.

Name: Karthik R
Title: Murugan temple on top of a small hill
Review: Kumarankumdram is present around 1 km from the GST road by climbing on the MIT bridge and taking a left after getting off the bridge towards Hasthinapuram. Lord Murugan in Swamimalai type gives dharshan. The hill is not difficult to climb and around 120 steps. There is Meenakshi and Eswar Sannithis also on the way.One can also visit the very famous Anjenya and Perumal temple just opposite the Kumarankundaram temple.

Name: RamyaKrishna
Title: Top of the hill view
Review: This temple is located on the hill top. I have been visiting this temple from childhood.1. Good if you can reach the top via stairs (no lift) before sunset. This will give yo both view of chennai from the top during day and aftersun set with lights.2. Approach if via train u can reach sanitorium station and a local auto, or transport of your own. While it is located in chrompet. You can also reach via bus.. Pls check the local depot where u come from for more detail on buss.3. Prayer for peace of soul, and the touch of the breeze will heal you inside out.Have a good darshan.

Name: FelSal
Title: LORD MURUGAN AT HILLTOP
Review: If you are fit to climb around 100 steps this is a place to visit eventhough it is around 15 km away from the city limits.  This temple is dedicated to Lord Murugan but there are many other idols placed inside the temple.  Other facilities such as marriage hall is also available at this location.  A view of the beautiful city is an added attraction to visit this place

Name: Unni2006
Title: Hill Top Temple
Review: The Kumaran Kundram Temple is located about 2 Kms away from Chromepet Station & MIT Chromepet Campus. As the temple is at the hill top , one has to climb the steps to reach to the top. The idol is that of Muruga and you can worship many idols placed inside the temple. On the. Temple top , the breeze one will get is very nice and has soothing effect. From the top one can see the whole Chromepet landscape. One can spent about an hour at the hill top an temple and the nice temple once visited is difficult to forget.

Name: Sriram25
Title: One of the best location in sub-urbs
Review: Kumaran Kundram is located in Chromepet, which is roughly 15KM from city limits..Nice place to visit who are interested in somethign more than visit to temple.. Now, the temple has been repaired and looks more appealing

Name: Sangeetha Vikram
Title: Excellent hillock temple !!
Review: I have visited this temple last saturday, the temple was amazing. At the entrance, the deity was "Siddha Vinagyagar", If we climb around 90 - 100 steps, at the top was present the main deity "Lord Murugan". The idol seems to be so beautiful.. In the middle, Lord shiva sannidhi in the name of "Sundareswarar" & Meenakshi amman is available. It was a pleasant visit, which really gave divine feel.Opposite to this temple, Prasanna Venkeshwara smamy temple was available. During my visit, they were doing bhajans (Hare Rama Hare Rama... - Chanting by Muralidhara swamigal). Participating in the bhajans gave an awesome feel...

Name: Shiva S
Title: Nice!!Nice!!Nice!!Nice!!Nice!!
Review: Nice temple and another good place in chennai. It has marriage hall too. The steps are easy to climb and excellent temple for Lord Murugan.

Name: rea2der
Title: Kumaran Kundram
Review: Recently visted this temple.The temple is very famous for lord muruga.The temple is located on the hill top.We have to climb nearly 90 steps to reach out.The scenic beauty attracts the travellers.The temple is open around 4.30 to 7.30 evening.Bus facilites are available there.There is a small sivan temple also located inside the temple.

Name: Arunkumaar
Title: Must visit location.
Review: I have visited several times this temple.calm and superb location in the heart of chrompet.can be reached easily from chrompet bus stand.minibus and auto are available.

Name: Shiva S
Title: Good to visit
Review: Good temple to visit the Lord Murugan in Chennai. It has steps which can be easily climbed and the lord in the temple is awesome. Marriages happen in the mandapam in the entrance. Its always to visit temple for your prayers on god.

Name: ChitraDarlzz
Title: Hill place
Review: Kumaran Kundram is situated at Chrompet, Chennai. It is a temple built in a hill for Lord Murugan. A clear view of city is observed from the top of the temple. It is a holy place too.

Name: Thiyagarajan2013
Title: My home town
Review: Though I am in Saudi Arabia a place-- earthy heaven for Islam, cannot even dream any Hindu culture., I am writing about this place Why?B'coz this is my home town.I know kumaran kind ram from my childhood. That time it was really difficult to reach this place as there were no black roads, only mud paths. It was easy to climb this mountain comparatively to travel and reach this place from shanthi nagar of Chromepet. When you climb the steps there is Adi bhavan an--- Pillayar. Do "thoppukaranam" offerings and climb up.You will reach the peak within 5 minutes. Oh God... It is a similar scenic as Madhubala(Roja) experiences withAravindaswamy in Tamil movie ROJA when she reaches Kashmir. Only difference no Aravindaswamy and no snow...but with all greener is of Chromepet, pallavaram, Trisulam hills at far... and ultimately God is next to you. When you enter you see The Lord with attractive smile.God Murugan with his Wives... Feel this divine freshness at kumaran kind ram. You will not gasp after climbing here in Kumaran kundram..Try to visit this temple once if you are in south chennai. Now this hillock adopted multiple God statues.There is a site to park two wheelers and Bi cycles.No rest room near by.

Name: N R
Title: about Lord Sri Sarabeshwarar
Review: Lord Sri Sarabeshwarar Temple in Kumaran Kundran Hill, Hastinapuram Chromepet attracts crowds every sunday between 4.30 p.m  to  6.00 p.m.   Rahukala Pooja will be performed every sunday at that time.  Devotees thronge the temple to have a darshan of Lord Sri Sarabeshwara.  It is widely believed that those who regularly offer their prayers with full confidence on the Lord Almighty by lighting lamp continuously every sunday will be rewarded as per their wish sooner or later 11th week of their visit.  Abishekam will be performed and  the devotees will definetely get HIS blessings if their prayer is full of confidence.  Expect all my friends to have darshan of Lord Sri Sarabeswarar and see the change of life style.N. RAJASEKARAN9962442480

Name: VjZen
Title: Good temple in Chrompet east.
Review: This temple is in eastern side of chrompet. About 1 km from chrompet railway stn / bus stand.The hill is not too tall, height will be about that of a 2/3 storied apartment. Siva / Meenakshi temple is in half way on the hill, on the top Swamimalai murugan temple is there. View from top will be very good, you can see airport / city & enjoy the breeze.In the foot of the hill there is a small stage, some or other event will be there during the weekend (Evenings only), mostly classical music or dance. Most of the performance are by the locals & near by school kids.Prasanna Venkatesha Perumal temple is just opposite to it. Hanuman temple within the premise is very famous and attracts a lot of crowd on saturdays.Try visiting this place if you stay in and around tambaram. I stay very near to this place and visit it atleast once in a week with my daughter. Not many know about this place and its less crowded. Parking is never a problem, cars need to drive a bit farther and park in the near by streets.No restrooms, need to get to GST road and visit a resturant / shop with restroom. (Some known ones - Adayar Anandha Bhavan / Namma Vedu Vasantha Bhavan / Shell Petrol / Balajee Bhavan)Google map link as follows.https://maps.google.co.in/maps/place?q=12.943767,80.143118&ftid=0x3a525e54d67ffbb5:0x88ef2445462a09d6Wiki link:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kumaran_Kundram

Name: Aaqarsh Aiyyar
Title: Quite hillock temple
Review: The kumaran kundram temple is quite close to my place. The temple is serene and radiant. The deity is considered to be the same powerful swaminathan in the swamimalai temple. One should not miss the panoramic view of Pallavaram and Chrompet from the temple.

Name: s_balaji_ca
Title: Very good temple to visit.
Review: The temple is awesome. The main God is Lord Murugan.There are around 50 steps to climb and that's the beauty of the temple. The auto person will charge max INR 40 from Chr Rly / Bus stand.The temple is between two other temples situated in peak like this 1. Thirunermalai and 2. Thirusulam.

Name: Khunchun D
Title: A great experience
Review: I spent 3 weeks in Chennai.I enjoyed every minute.Tasty and cheap food.Excellent cheap shopping especially in T Nagar and Ponzy Bazar.What I did not like is the pollution,cleanliness and hygiene .

Name: Cosmopolitan332905
Title: Good to hangout with friends
Review: Best place to hangout with friends and family. Very neat and clean. Food court is available with lot of food options. Big cinema hall inside. Restroom can be maintained well.

Name: Kishore
Title: Best Fun Place
Review: City centre is one of the best place in Chennai and we can get lot of fun in city centre  I enjoyed a lot there.

Name: Arogya Raj
Title: Must Visit
Review: This is one of the 2nd oldest mall in Chennai and best place to hangout with friends and family. Rooftop Dining is marvelous and the view is quite possibly one of the best reasons to come to Citi Center.When you visit here don't miss Kozzmo Goli soda, which quiet famous to refresh yourself.

Name: Sreenu
Title: Shopping Mall and Movie Theater
Review: Good for shopping but it is very small Mall.Overall Experience is good.It is very near to Marina Beach.

Name: #amosamiyanayeküéß
Title: üëç
Review: the best attarxtive architecture... i think one of the 2nd oldest mall in chennak the best place to hangout with friends and family

Name: dashfaqd
Title: Citi Mall
Review: The citi centre mall is situated on the Dr. Radhakrishna salai in Mylapore. The mall is small compared to other malls in Chennai. There are shops which sells readymade Dresses for both men and women. There is Homecentre store where you can buy household articles and furnitures at reasonable price. There is foodcourt also where you can enjoy meals from  North India fast food also.

Name: Praveenop
Title: Small Mall but we'll maintained one
Review: The mall is a good looking mall. It has big anchor stores and multiplexes. Has good basement parking.

Name: Pallavan
Title: Shopping
Review: Recently went to chennai citi entre with my family.it was an amazing experience.got everything we wanted after shopping relaxed at rooftop and had our food.awesome and enjoyed totally

Name: nytikjoshi
Title: Soon like Malls in the USA on the way to....
Review: Oth3r than a hand full of brands the other shops have pulled down the shutters thanks to the e-commerce wake physical stores are losing the foothold in customers minds. Visit if you have some spare time before or after seeing the movie in the Inox cinemas on the 4th floor. Another thing that us killing the mallw is the hourly parking ticket just to earn the parking ticket money the malls are dying on the casual shopper who is not going to idle around as it is going to cost him money

Name: Voyager33438276475
Title: Great place to hang out with my family and friends @EA
Review: It's wonderful day at EA mall especially when you bond go with your friends and family.over crowded,food stalls and branded show rooms are eye catchy ones.  Panipuri to pizza and Starbucks non stop fun with friends.

Name: anil k
Title: Good for shopping
Review: Citi Center in Chennai is an exclusive shopping center in the heart of the city.Lifestyle and Landmark, which together occupy more than half of the shopping center. The rest of the mall has designer shoe stores such as Mochi, Titan, Health and Glow, Cookie Man, Foodworld and a few accessory stores. There are many food stalls serving coffee, fresh corn, samosas and other snacks. It's a great place to take a break while shopping. There is also a food court serving various cuisines and a large playground for children. Citi Center is a one-stop shop for shopping, eating and watching a movie, or just spending time with friends. Citi Center is a unique host of flagship outlets of the biggest brands.

Name: Traveloney
Title: A small mall
Review: This s one of the very first malls in Chennai. Visited here for a movie in INOX theatre. A place to get together with friends.

Name: Ahmad Fathi
Title: An experience with the local Madras
Review: Just had a one night trip with my wife to spend at the city centre of Chennai, T. Nagar. It was crowded with people who wants to shop mostly for textiles. Can get good prices if you are walking with a local friend here, If you don't want to take risk just go to Saravana Stores. Local brands like Raymond and Indian Terrain also just along the T. Nagar street with many choices of restaurants to eat, I would prefer to have my lunch there at Nasikanda Pelita which is originated from Malaysia.

Name: ashokkl27
Title: Good weekend spot
Review: have been visiting this place for shopping , movies over last 10 years. Still remains with same charm over a decade. All major brands , most of the chain of restaurants and Inox is available along with roof top restaurant above. But feel parking is bit tough on the weekends. Rest all good

Name: vmsatheesh22
Title: Good
Review: Chennai Citi centre, our first visit here not a big but enjoy few hours here, friends all like the best from here

Name: Shivangi S
Title: Terrible
Review: There is almost nothing in this mall, except an INOX and a McDonalds. There are a few clothing stores, but some of the stores were shut despite it being a weekday evening. The place isn't very crowded, but the mall is very cramped. The food court has two functioning stores other than McDonalds, neither of which seem appetizing. There is a rooftop seating with two food stalls- a soda stall and a biryani stall. While the rooftop view of the ocean is nice, almost everything else in this mall is not.

Name: sharathr23
Title: A small mall with basic shops
Review: A relatively small shopping mall that houses shops catering from clothing items to food items. Good place to spend like an hour but nothing fancy too. Less crowded on weekends. Car park in the basement.

Name: Rucha121
Title: Nice Mall near Gandhi Beach on R.K.Salai
Review: Located nearby to Gandhi Beach, this is a medium-sized mall with big Brands and INOX multiplex inside. Parking is bit time consuming here. Beautiful decor and maintenance inside the mall. Food court is good and lot of options are available.

Name: Praveenop
Title: Small Mall but has some class
Review: The mall is pretty small.One can cover this mall in half an hour. The place is clean . It used to be one of the best mall in Chennai a decade back inspite its small size.Now bigger and better malls have come and overshadowed this mall.

Name: 771karthiks
Title: Decent visit with kids
Review: City centre has a mix for entertainment including shopping, cinemas, restaurants, and kids play area.  Ground have few toy rides for kids with decent price.  4 th floor has a fun city , the play area for kids with various activities. We need to purchase a fun city card to use inside this facility with cost a minimum. 500 rs, and can be recharged. The food court with few restaurants like mc Donald and KFC are in the same floor.  People can opt to eat here or can have the food in open air on roof top.  Roof top also has a section for playing cricket under nets . Overall a decent experience with kids.

Name: Janani P
Title: City center
Review: It's a good place for shopping and have fun with kids during weekends and watch movie with friends, happening place in Chennai

Name: Shahid L
Title: Grand from the Outside, Ordinary Inside
Review: You couldn't miss the Citi Centre whilst driving past Radhakrishnan Salai. Grand in stature and ornate in visuals from the outside, the same however doesn't translate inside. Quite a compact mall to describe it positively. A one time visit for freshers in Chennai. It doesn't offer much other apart from the cinemas which fuels the majority of the crowd coming to Citi Centre. There is no Unique Selling Point to this mall (apart from the Cinema) to be coming back to it. Heavily hit by the rise of bigger malls, its premium location will be one of the factors driving the business through this mall.

Name: YashiR25
Title: For the architecture and proximity to beach
Review: Again, it is not a mall. But a hub of shops under one roof. Avoid eating anything there; we got food poisoning. The rooftop let you have a view of the sea. Architecture of the building is good.If you happen to be near Marina Beach, then can visit. A big NO for its cinema. The seats are terrible, poorly maintained.The old charm is lost; may be because of bad maintenance.

Name: Ghiri T
Title: One of the earlier shopping mall in chennai
Review: The Chennai Citi Centre is a shopping mall  located on Radhakrishnan Salai. Mylapore, Chennai, India. It was opened in March 3, 2006.It was the one of the earlier shopping mall in chennai.One can find everything here. one can do a happing shopping here.

Name: padmanaban2015
Title: One of the grannies
Review: Becoming one of the granny mall of Chennai with elaborate and economical shops like the spencers mall.

Name: somsontravel
Title: Grand look despite losing ita sheen
Review: Citi center was among the forerunners in mall with huge layout, palace style entrance and most prominent location. Marina beach is at a walkable distance and it used to attract lot of crowd full day. But now due to other bigger better malls and speciality restaurants in proximity, Citi center has lost its crowds, it's stores and it's charisma. Beautiful entrance and architecture is still something to have a look at but as a mall, definitely a no go

Name: Nudrad N
Title: Waste  of time
Review: Seems like a haunted mall ..less shop to buy .. only home deco store is good ..or else just waste of time

Name: RamGanesan
Title: Has become quite now
Review: With a of competition this mall has lost its business.  Once a very busy mall, today it has become a quite place.  I went to the mall only for one reason.  To see a movie on the Inox screen and have some french fries at Mcdonalds.  The other reason I chose earlier to this visit was because it is very quiet on even weekends and we can have a peaceful shopping experience without too much of noise. In fact informal business meetings can be had at the food court!

Name: TSAMM21
Title: Beatifull shoping Mall at Chennai
Review: Attractive design of this shopping mall makes it unique , Located at Chennai city , Tamil Nadu , India

Name: Akashdx
Title: Traditional look with modern Amenities
Review: The mall gives Traditional looks like drawn designs over walls.But is equipped with innox and almost everything a shopping place should have.

Name: Marcus
Title: Big place - few shops
Review: The facade of Chennai Citi Center looks really impressive but the interior is not.This is more an activation center for kids with playareas and a cinema.The shopping is meager; mostly local taste. Didn't shop anything here but had lunch.

Name: Alwardurai
Title: Men's casual
Review: Good collections available here also it's situated nearby light House railway station which is very convenient for traveling..

Name: raghu854
Title: Good but not wonderful
Review: It's a good one. But this not a wonderful experience in shopping malls.in chennai comparing this so many malls are greater and super than this

Name: APK24
Title: A good option if you don't want to spend the whole day at a mall!
Review: This mall used to be one of the hot spots in Chennai about 10 years ago for people to hang out on weekends and after college. However over time and with the introduction of bigger malls , the footfall has reduced quite a bit. However it is still worth a visit as at least it wont be overcrowded like other malls and you can get in and out and do some shopping without spending the whole day walking up and down the mall. Lifestyle, Will Lifestyle, FBB and Max are some of the outlets worth checking out. Food options are limited but still available- Mcdonalds, KFC and a few others.

Name: Purav25
Title: Good place, good food options, good exterior
Review: This mall looks great from outside. Has good shopping options and lot of options for food. Couple of them are right in the ground floor. Its on main road, doesn't require much walk. Had to struggle for taxi after 10 pm.

Name: AlphaSiera
Title: Vibrant! Elegant! Lots of shopping & dining options!
Review: We stayed close to this mall and frequented it for shopping, dinning, just strolling and watching a movie! I was told this is the second best mall in Chennai, and very well so with its elegance, modern amenities, bunch of shopping and dining options and seemingly popular among the local crowd. You can find branded western clothing or Indian cultural dresses with different budget options to choose from. Lively and vibrant, close to the popular Marina beach, it's worth a visit to this mall if you're in need of some shopping or just want to stroll around for a change.

Name: shrinikethv
Title: Very good mall in Mylapore
Review: The mall is in Mylapore. Very good mall with lot of top brand shops. Great food court along with roof top(I don't know if its still in use). There is also cricket net entertainment. Inox theatre here is a very big plus. Great place for family,friends, and couples.

Name: Sunand S
Title: Good Mall
Review: we went to watch movie "Dangal" recently , Good thing about this mall is ,very near to "light house" MRTS , so very approachable and no need to give heavfty parking feeAbout Mall,Nice big paintings  on walls , only thing i feel ,that Mall walls now requires coating of Paints. If you coming out of watching movies , only one small Toilet on that floor, Toilets can be better , it will good ,if you fresh an up inside innox area only Sometimes you have to find the escalaters to go down and up (confusing) Lots of option in food, go to their terrace area, you can see the beach view from thereAll together nice place..

Name: Subhas S
Title: Food court
Review: The mall is decently maintained. However most of the counters in the food court close by 10 at night

Name: chaithu k
Title: Nice place for shopping
Review: It is near to beach. The mall is very big and there are so many shops of all verities' of garments, electrical goods and home appliances. There has a Inox theatre and food court too..

Name: BAJI_THIMMU
Title: Good Place for Shopping
Review: I have went with my friends on last month the mall was very good so many shops, restaurants are available there with high class and another one is INOX theater. I am new for chennai so that's new experience with friends on that mall. Really loved that. Good place for shoping and movie.

Name: Sudhar23
Title: Good place to stop and shop
Review: The location of the mall is great, just walkable from beach road.The lobby provides great view of the mall & good thing is there are benches for us to rest and shop. Definitely Citi Centre is better than Phoneix market city where you are not allowed to rest in the mall. Phoenix doesnt have benches

Name: SGolla
Title: Confessions of a shopaholic
Review: Ive seen a fake Rajnikanth Kabali event here - Exciting. CookieMan's good as ever. Max, Mochi, Lifestyle are all the same - good. Food court is good. I feel the mall has lost its sheen this year..More events and Sales please.

Name: VivekRN
Title: Cute little mall going down in popularity!
Review: Citi Centre MallVISITED ON : 10th July 2016OVERVIEW : Cute little mall by the beach for hangouts and shopping with a terrace overseeing the Marina, its own movie theater and Cricket nets.The "GOOD"s : -Small mall easy to navigate inside with all the necessary shops, movie etc.              -Has a food court and terrace seating overseeing the Marina beach.              -Provides cricket nets for some cricket action.              -Toy cars can be rented at the ground floor to keep the kids engaged. The "BAD"s : -Mall maintenance is going down and so are many shops quitting the mall. My View : Can be visited once for the great Marina view.

Name: Mukesh
Title: Nice Shopping Mall
Review: Good shopping mall . Very tastefully furnished its ideal for spending couple of hours. Though food court has limited food options.

Name: Ajin Reji
Title: Small mall but good ambiance
Review: I think this is the oldest mall in chennai, it's too small in look . Only few shops are here. Food court is not that much busy. I really enjoyed the open air food court . The view from this food court is superb. We can see the city including chepauk stadium and mareena beach. I'll suggest this for all families.

Name: alshukeiry
Title: not good except if you want to shop
Review: we had to enter what's so called citi center as we were looking for local shops, we found few nice shops and we had to stay in the centre as it was raining outside. so we decided to eat from one of the food court's mini restaurant, order the food and got something with awful smell and taste, looked like it was there for more than a day. i hated the whole place because of this incident.

Name: Sudhir
Title: Wonderful Mall
Review: One more mall which is located in heart of the city. Its very nearby to the Marina beach and its a walkable distance. This place is well connected by Bus, Train and Taxi. It has got everything inside like shops, movies and restaurants. Ample car and bike park is available. Lots of places can be visited from here as it is in heart of the city.

Name: Pallavan
Title: Entertainment
Review: Chennai  Citi centre is a nice place to spend a time with your kids.you can do shopping ,games, have nice food on different  restaurants and even watch movies.

Name: balaji
Title: Nice mall
Review: Most happening place of chennai located at the heart of chennai with nice shopping and movie theatres with ample car park

Name: tanjib
Title: Nothing Special
Review: Usual mall with average shops and brands. Not very crowded. McDonald's,  Kfc a cinema hall and a beach view restaurant. There is also a place for salat at basement 2 for Muslims.

Name: Pal_078
Title: Not exciting or trendy
Review: This came up as a big name but then had some mediocre brands and inox theater, and a very average food court. Go here for lifestyle sales, and that's about it.

Name: mohamed t
Title: Once only went
Review: there s nonthing to it u guys new to means just go and see for yourselfs then one can understand it's too good go and have fun!!!

Name: Senthamizh Aras... G
Title: A good place to hangout
Review: Once a famous place. But still it is good place to hang out. It is small compared to other malls like Phoenix, escape, forum but it is very much close to beach so u can opt for it If u have a plan of seeing both. It has a inox theatre inside and few shops. If u think u need a good mall to just rest or roam this can be good one :)

Name: VAS1586
Title: The first trendy mall of Chennai but now becoming a little stale, yet crowds galore
Review: When this mall was opened, it was a big talk of the town those days.  Sure it has its locational advantage, its features, its car parking areas, near the Marina, with all trendy shops inside, but of late this is becoming a little outdated and stale.  Sometimes one has opportunity to have a glimpse of celebrities and their families too.  One of the best attractions as per me is the LANDMARK shop and of course the digital theatres.  Eateries are aplenty.  A pricey place but on festive occasions you do have some good bargains.

Name: Mohammed S
Title: Very outdated mall
Review: When I was small I used to roam a lot in here this mall is very near to marina beach so whenever you visit beach can go in here it has inbox theater in it so you can enjoy movies in here

Name: NIVAS R
Title: One of the earliest malls in Chennai
Review: Chennai Citi Center is definitely one of the earliest malls in Chennai after Spencer's Plaza. A very small one compared to its counterparts like EA or Phoenix but has a good theater - INOX.

Name: DrKumaresh
Title: Wy visit
Review: This is just another shopping mall and there is nothing much to be done except for window shopping and the prices are extremely costly. Not worth wasting your money.

Name: Manash_Baruah
Title: Good time out at Mylapore
Review: Located at RK Salai, Citi Center is a big mall at Chennai.  Has many reputed brand of shops.  The food court on the 4th floor is spacious.  Crowd is less throughout the year, it also has INOX theatre.  Situated at just 10 min walk from the Marina Beach, one can have nice time out there

Name: SELVA2075
Title: shopping mall in heart of the city
Review: now this mall is very small comparing to other malls in chennai, i went for shopping for this mall, you will get many items in this malll

Name: ProfSkb
Title: A place to hang out
Review: A small mall with a collection of shops selling branded items to the local.  It has a few large standard shops which are in any large mall.

Name: Shyamis
Title: Quiet place
Review: Quieter compared to EA mall this does not have as many shops. Just enough to keep you busy for sometime, with some food available as well.

Name: cwlaw792
Title: nice place to spend time
Review: A very nice place to hangout at evening. nice places to eat in the mall , many branded shops. had a nice time .

Name: nishkalav
Title: It's a small mall
Review: Biggest attractions are lifestyle and in inox .  Some of the shops in the corridors have good stuff.. like jewellery, watch etc. For kids fun city is nice.else nothing much here.

Name: Ramkumar R
Title: Yet Another Mall in Chennai
Review: It is just yet another mall in chennai. If you want to go to mall with less crowded, then this is the mall for you. Not having more appealing things and small compared to other malls in Chennai. If you are deciding to spend one day  with shopping, movies, play around in one mall, then this would not gonna be a chance that I would recommend. Still, its good as a Mall and its located near to Marina beach.

Name: mullirikkattil
Title: Good place
Review: A very nice place to hangout at evening. But not like very new system of a mall or a shopping center. They could improve a lot

Name: senthilkumar_s3
Title: visit for windowshopping
Review: went to watch a movie at inox ,nice mall which badly needs a renovation .be the parking where there is no one to guide you ,shops doesn't attract you to enter and buy,may be you can do windowshopping .inox experience is very good .strictly go only if you want to watch a movie

Name: sreekanth1810
Title: Not the must visit Mall in CHennai
Review: Feels relatively small and old. Maintenance is pretty much on the poorer side. Lacks the charm it had a few years back. But still one among the most sought after hangout spots.

Name: girieshm24
Title: A mall after spenzer
Review: landmark store is a main thing in this mall,and the roof top at above the food court is really a great view and the best place to hangout with friends

Name: Kunja Mohan
Title: Old, un-appealing and lack of choices
Review: Went at around 6 pm. Unarguably that's the peak time for shoppers. However, the Mall was nearly empty. The building is not appealing et all. Although inaugurated in 2005-06 it looks like a 50 year old building. No. of retailers are less and the choices for purchase are really limited. Not a good destination for window shoppers and buyers alike. Not recommended.

Name: Sai
Title: a nice place to hang out with your friends.
Review: its a mall which is well organized in every way... though its small has utilized the space to the maximum... the roof top food court is a must if u visit this place. the basement car parking is of an average size over full on weekends. the inox is a well put together theater.

Name: kathiranand7
Title: Good place...
Review: Awesome place to see its placed in the city of the centre an many shopping are there and nice place to enjoy....

Name: Salaikmr
Title: Neat and less crowded
Review: Though it is a small mall compared to EA and Phoenix, it is maintained well. Less crowded shops.. I was there for a movie with family last month. Had a nice time.

Name: Poornesh Sharma
Title: Small but neatly maintained mall near Marina beach
Review: For the places we saw in Chennai, this was quite good enough as I have observed there were not too many malls as compared to Bengaluru, but whatever they had here was neatly maintained and Food court had a lot of options and since it's close to Marina beach it would be the only option for dinner for people who would like to stay back long at Marina beach

Name: sdkeskar40
Title: Attractive mall in Chennai
Review: This place is worth to visit. Either couples or families can spent their 4-5 easily. They can have a movie followed by shopping. The transportation to Chennai Citi centre is available from anywhere from chennai.

Name: Ankit
Title: It's a small place.
Review: Did not like it much for its less food options. The shops in the mall too are quite few. Don't know why is it too famous?

Name: Santhoshiyer
Title: Stylish Mall
Review: This is a mall closely located to the World 2nd longest Beach in the World , yes none other than Marina Beach . This is a mall with inox multiplex in it , and has lots of clothing shops and a big food court . A nice place to spend time with family and loved ones .

Name: Dan0609
Title: Great place for shoppers
Review: Happened to visit this when I stayed at Hotel savera for a business engagement....Has great collection of garment material, household items...great place to shop after a stroll  in the beach...Is a heaven for shoppers which can satisfy all their needs... Dont miss to visit atleast once ...

Name: Gunasekaran T
Title: movie day at Inox, City center
Review: we have been to City center multiple times, last week went to watch a movie at Inoxits a good mall, have all options and price is also moderateclean mall, food court has multiple optionsIt may not be attractive for people travel from Bangalore or Mumbai, but in Chennai, this is one of the best mall

Name: smuralidharan s
Title: Mall with excellant features
Review: Yesterday I visited this Mall for INOx.  The mall is access free for disabled people and  staff inside the mall also very nice and freindly and helpful. Especially the parking men are really kind enough to allow my retrofitted vehicle to park very close to entrance and did not collect any parking fee.

Name: Sid J
Title: Nothing great, skip it
Review: Better places around the city for one to go, rather talk a walk on Marina beach or go to the several temples and churches lining the place

Name: oshylu
Title: Once it was good ..now  INOX..is ok
Review: Earlier it was very nice .. when nothing .. It was good .. now it is dark down by EA and phonix malls .. any less crowd is advantages ..?  INOX is saves some what extend .. If u not visited so far .. go and visit once for comparison ...

Name: AshokMela
Title: One of Chennai's first few malls !!!
Review: Chennai Citi Center is one of the first few malls in Chennai. I think second mall next to Spencer's Plaza. This is located in Cathedral road and accessible through bus and also MRTS (Lighthouse station). Comparatively small in size and less shopping or dining options. It houses Inox Screens and it also has a food court and children play area.

Name: Rupesh_Mishra
Title: Nothing much to shop
Review: #NAME?

Name: Srinivasan K
Title: Good place for hanging out in Chennai
Review: This is a good place for hanging out, especially during weekends. You can find a lot of shops and there is also INOX theatre if you want to watch movies. Variety of restaurants available to give food to your taste buds.

Name: prabhuespn
Title: A Landmark of Chennai - Citi Center
