Review: Its located near to Mundakanni Amman Koil MRTS Railway Station. One had to walk through a nearby slum and can reach Cit Center. Its not a big mall compared to Phoenix Velacherry, but has its own imposing external structure along with good restaurants, apparel shops, gadget points, etc... Not to mention the only INOX screen at Chennai is in Citi Center

Name: d_world12
Title: Sort of....
Review: This one has lost it's glory quite a while back but then is an ok mall to go. It's not huge by any means so limited options, has cinema option (I don't go there usually), and a open rooftop where you can sit / eat while taking a glance at the marina (usually is hot though so good on evenings). Nothing more to say.

Name: SanthoshRajan
Title: My Favorite in Chennai
Review: Many would be disappointed calling this one as a mall. But. This is my favorite mall in Chennai due to certain factors. First of all it houses one of the few good cinemas in Chennai - The INOX. Another important factor is, it is less crowded than the other malls. And the most important factor is it is very near to the Marina beach. Who would hate a leisure time at beach after a good matinee show. You can also enjoy meal at the windy roof top.

Name: s_ramsam
Title: Very good mall
Review: This mall has all the facilities/amenities one expects from a modern mall in a big city.Plenty of shops, food court, good way to while away time window shopping and maybe some real shopping.

Name: Aayush_Bagla
Title: Okayish Mall
Review: The mall is not very huge but then this is comparitively one of the oldest in Chennai. But has all the ammenities such as a food court and movie theatre. Nice timepass.

Name: cjoshi2208
Title: Big Mall with All Facilities
Review: This mall was near to my Hotel Clarion. This mall has all facility which one should have for their families.I have visited this mall to watch movie as this mall has INOX multiplex with them.Also their Food Court is amazing as i wanted to have some Burger i tried the same with McDonalds.

Name: Raj kumar
Title: no so bad
Review: Price are done for not selling, just to see things ! Do u understand , exorbitant price, we cant buy, unless u print Gandhies ! Oh yes !

Name: Vijay Raj Selvam
Title: One of the first few malls in Chennai
Review: Long back this was the only mall in Chennai. Hence you will see that this mall is not as big as the other malls which has recently come up. Still, the place has its own crowd coming. Situated near to beach, you will see crowd walking straight from marina into this mall for having food at the food court. Well maintained mall. Shops are also good here. There is Inox theatres inside this mall too!

Name: Akshay G
Title: It's more of a shopping centre than a mall!
Review: Not many good brands and stores. The only reason why people still visit is because of the cinema theatre on the top floor. Otherwise very little reason to visit this mall. They don't have a food court, sometimes the escalators don't work. The movie hall at the top is pretty decent and that's why i visited this in the first place.

Name: SagarVS
Title: Mid sized shopping center
Review: This place is on the way to the Mylapore beach. Its mid sized with a sprinkling of local brands, cinema and cafe's. This place is meant for the people around this area and not for the ones visiting Chennai. Unimpressed.

Name: Jagan80
Title: Good Place for Shopping & Entertainment
Review: This is one of the good place in chennai. INOX is available here. Good Options for food & shopping. very near to the beach.

Name: subinjose
Title: visist chennai for a day
Review: I reach chennai central railway station at 10 am and i want to spend the day in chennai till 6 pm with my family..kindly advice me few best options and locker facilities to keep my luggage.

Name: hunter_nga
Title: Existing Trip
Review: Hi, This place is nice spend time in city center, available lot of restaurant with spicy foods the most famous named INOX which is placed in city center.

Name: osgoodk123
Title: Expensive, Great location for surrounding areas
Review: I liked the location of Chennai to see nearby pondicherry and other nice temples etc. Unfortunately accomodation was expensive as it is a city built for business and not for tourism. I would recommend booking in advance and a 2 day stay would be sufficient to see the sights

Name: Ravi K
Title: GREAT HIDEOUT
Review: I had been to M.A. Chidambaram stadium several times.   In fact most of the match days i was there, right from Ranji Trophy to Tests, ODIs, T20s, IPL.  A wonderful stadium with cool breeze from the Sea. Marina beach is also one of the attractions. I love to watch the games from galleries and enjoy the fun with spectators including dancing, whistling, mexican wave.  Since my boyhood days, i have been going to this stadium.   Those days we use to carry Curd rice, Tamarind rice, idly etc along with friends and enjoy home food.  I still cherish the great innings played by Gundappa Viswanath in 1975 against mighty West Indies.  He scored a magnificient 97 runs unbeaten. Sachin Tendulkar's century in 2008 chasing 387 runs was also special. IPL matches were delightful, colourful.  The TIE test in 1986 against Aussies.

Name: Prem Kumar
Title: Chepauk
Review: The M A Chidambaram stadium is better known as chepauk and is one of the oldest cricket stadiums in the country. Now the home ground of Chennai super kings franchise. It is known for some classic matches India vs Pakistan test match in 1998 and India vs England in 2008 and few more memorable matches are played here. The stadium got renovated lately to make sure some breeze flows though it.The crowd in chennai is known to be one of the most knowledgeable crowd in the country.

Name: Ananth 727499
Title: One of the world famous Land marks of Chennai
Review: This is the place of cricket lovers of India..This stadium bears many memorable moments of Indian Cricketers..Nothing more to be said since anything said about this place could be a drop less than the facts known to other cricket loving fans..

Name: Deadman17
Title: Chepauk
Review: The M A Chidambaram stadium is better known as chepauk and is one of the oldest cricket stadiums in the country. The stadium is also host of the Chennai Super Kings one of the biggest franchises of the IPL. The stadium has couple of new stands which are brilliant to sit and enjoy the matches. One can also go through the history of the evolution of the cricket in the region.

Name: satyajitjadhav
Title: Famous ground in India but old.
Review: The stadium is located close to the marina beach and is located in crowded place. I visited during IPL. This is an old stadium. Cricket lover will visit this CSK home ground.

Name: Pallavan
Title: ipl cricket
Review: on 9th of this month I went for an opl match with my family to this stadium.was great experience watching with 1000 of people with so much noise stadium was beautiful and pleasant. people really enjoyed and it was like a festival. like to go again.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Famous stadium
Review: The stadium is famous and loved by most of the locals since they were crazy over cricket game.this is near the famous,longest marina beach and visitors were allowed only on the match days and ofcourse the entry is by a paid ticket.

Name: Narasimhan G
Title: Stunning space for Cricket
Review: Cricketeres' paradiseVery near  to EMUChepauk  is reachable by bus as wellAwait serious cricketStadium Cricket performance is good to watch

Name: krazikams
Title: Home ground of CSK
Review: Ever since the IPL started, I try to watch atleast 1 match here featuring the local Chennai Super Kings team. The atmosphere is just electric and full of energy. Just that they need to improve facilities for public like hygienic toilets and drinking water. Also, in-house snacks are very expensive and we cannot carry food from outside. Also, big chaos and queue for parking. So, if they improve these things, it will become convenient for public and cricket lovers.

Name: kvramani
Title: Grand Old Cricket Stadium of Chennai.
Review: 1. Located in the center of Chennai, it is a historical place for the game of cricket in Chepauk.2. Many great giants and masters of Cricket have played here.3. This ground has seen some of the fine moments of the game, including clasiic Tie of a Test match.4. Green field with new modern stand can seat about 45000 spectators.5. It is a big disappointment that 3 of the new stands are not open to fans, due to illogical and unexplained reasons.6. This ground is famous for Test, one day and T20 Cricket.7. It is only 500 meters from the world famous Marina beach.

Name: Muguncjb
Title: Not an attraction
Review: It is one of the oldest stadium to host International and domestic cricket matches in India.  People interested in watching Cricket directly can go to the stadium. Otherwise it can be seen in live in TV when matches are played.  It is located near to the top attraction Marina beach in Chennai. Triplicane, Sri Parthasarathy Temple is near by too. If you take Chennai beach-Velachery local train, it will pass near to the stadium.

Name: srinath18
Title: ‚ÄúDhonis unofficial stadium ‚Äú
Review: Seen lot of matches in Chidambaram stadium especially IPl .It‚Äôs wonderful moment watching IPl here Especially for MS DhoniPeople are very nice here

Name: nageswararao g
Title: Good stadium
Review: Its a good stadium to visit. I didn't attend any match but went there on a tour with my ex colleagues. Some areas of the stadium look old and not well maintained.

Name: Ruth M
Title: Popular
Review: The Chidambaram Stadium is very popular along with Nehru Stadiums. Many wold class events takes place here. The location is in strategic position. We just drove and passed by.

Name: monish_kumar
Title: Great ground great memories
Review: Very good and amazing stadium in chennai provides a very good sight of the cricket match.It has witnessed a few of the world record at this ground like the msd 224 vs australia. was one of the biggest achievements of this ground.

Name: vinodssind
Title: Great ground great memories
Review: Great ground great memories. Excellent facilities in the pavillion end. The long queues is a put off.

Name: vasan224
Title: wonderful stadium
Review: M.A.Chidambaram Stadium most fascinating thing about the ground is the crowd support. It is common knowledge that the Chepauk crowd is the most unbiased and the most knowledgeable crowd in the country.

Name: Praveenop
Title: The Hallowed spot of Indian cricket
Review: This international cricket stadium has seen the greatest ( I mean the greatest test match) moments of history were made here. The present stadium looks truly beautiful but  it  has not been completed for a few years now. If this project is completed the stadium would be a marvel. MS Dhoni has taken active interest in designing the stadium so  that the bowlers and the batsmen could take advantage of the evening breeze. It was designed in such a way that the breeze from the Marina beach would breeze pass through the gaps in the stands to the gorund. It still has some issues with the authorities over civil permissions. In Spite of all this the stadium is one of the best looking stadium in India and internationally.

Name: ramchabi
Title: Great iconic stadium
Review: It is the oldest continuously used cricket stadium in the country. It is also the home of CSK. The place doesn‚Äôt have much parking and so it is best reached by public transport or by taxis.  The food available is okay and you can‚Äôt get alcohol at the stadium. The box is a comfortable place to watch the game but the best place is outside.

Name: reddi_traveller
Title: M.A.Chidambaram Stadium
Review: Avoid visiting a game during a sunny day because of the heat and humidity since it is near to the sea. and the stadium is renovated recently as i heard from many of my chennai friends.

Name: Paloma_Rao
Title: Super
Review: One of my favourite cricket venues in India! It may not be the fanciest but it is certainly iconic. Also since it's close to the beach, you get a nice sea breeze! Keeps things pleasant!

Name: vijmail99
Title: Awesome
Review: Lot of halls for family functions. Green lawn around the party halls. Ideal place for the hangout. Will definitely visit again !!

Name: tyag_1984
Title: renovation going on
Review: good stadium, avoid during a sunny day, painting and renovation is going on in some places which id disturbing

Name: scorpionchennai
Title: If you love cricket then this one is a delight
Review: This statidum of chennai has a history which one can be proud as this stadium has hosted some memorable matches,more than that it is a delight to be in the stands and watch a match.

Name: SrikamakshiS
Title: MA Chidambaram Cricket Stadium
Review: Chennai's Chepauk Cricket Stadium is one of the oldest stadium and most of the Cricket Matches are played here.I am regular to this stadium to watch all the Chennai Super King Matches

Name: Natarajan-R
Title: Chepauk Stadium
Review: Chennai's best Stadium to watch Cricket Matches and I always visit this place with friends and family to watch every match played in the City.Well maintained and the best place to watch Cricket Matches.Huge Parking is available

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: go only for a match
Review: This is a place to go if a cricket match is happening.Easy to reach via the local train as well as bus.Unfortunately some stands are closed for some years though it doesn't take anything away

Name: vijaycs11
Title: Nice stadium without parking
Review: Being a cricket fan cannot miss out of MAC but th e only challenge is to get a good parking and this is what the stadium really lacks.

Name: Abdefaiz
Title: Awesome place to be for a perfect International Match!
Review: I have been to this stadium like 10 times and the atmosphere to watch cricket fulfills the whole experience. Located near the Famous marina Beach, walkable distance of maximum 400-500m. Love to be here for most of the matches held!! Suggestions:D/N Match: Take F Upper!! Night Match: D,E,F Upper or lower!! Both: Pavilion Terrace( any match)

Name: GrannyMaa
Title: Chennai's Chepauk Stadium
Review: This is the home of cricket lovers and home for CSK Team. Madras Cricket Club is one of the oldest in the country and has hosted some of the most memorable cricket matches. Over the years, lot of facilities for public has been improved.

Name: mahithaprasad19
Title: Chepauk!!!
Review: There probably are better stadiums in the country but the atmosphere during a match is eclectic! Be it an IPL or an India match!

Name: CyrilGubbi
Title: Good Statdium
Review: This Chennai's premium stadium for watching matches. Nothing compared to stadiums world wide, but still good especially when there are Cricket matches...must go,

Name: selvambikaiyali
Title: MAC Stadium Chennai
Review: One of the old cricket stadium of india, having good facilities. Looks very good after the modifications

Name: Abdul wahaab
Title: Wonderful experience of tnpl finals
Review: It's the only one international stadium available in Chennai which is situated near marina beach. Seating arrangements are good and rain shelter available . Parking is a problem anyhow we can manage to park near ministers quarters. Flood lighting were provided and grounds men team is doing great ..must watch an ODI match here

Name: Ghiri T
Title: The oldest stadium in Chennai
Review: M.A.Chidambaram stadium is also known as Chepauk Stadium situated in Chepauk is the home ground for Tamil Nadu cricket team and for Chennai Super Kings(IPL).This stadium is named after M.A.Chidambaram former President of BCCI.This place is established in 1916.It can occupy more than 30,000 people.A lot of enjoyment when you see a match here.

Name: Praveen S
Title: Best entertainment
Review: The stadium ticket is low compared to other stadiums, seconds largest stadium in chennai, place is good

Name: Kiran Kumar W
Title: .The only international cricket stadium in Tamilnadu
Review: I went to see a TNPL match in M.A chidambaram stadium the seats where not as clean as I expected but it was clean. There was not much of food options for this match and a bit expensive as always with these kinds of places.

Name: BalajiSubramanian86
Title: A world class ground which needs little improvement
Review: The renovated MAC, Chennai is one of the best places to watch cricket. Beautiful lawns and chairs. The newly build tiered stands give it a MCG feel. Have watched T20, Test and ODIs. The chennai crowd is always sportive and give a standing ovation to all performers even if it is India or any other country. The mexican wave is a nice thing to experience here. Things to improve: food spread and a bit of cleanliness needs to be taken care of. The beach is close by. So the stadium might get windy at times.

Name: vikasmardia
Title: cricket
Review: cricket stadium m a Chidambaram or chepauk is located very near to famous marina beach. one of the finest cricket grounds in india.

Name: Joji J
Title: "Venue of several Cricket Matches"
Review: It's something great that such a big stadium is maintained in the city but the effort is worth since a cricket match is announced here and the stadium becomes the talk of the world. The stadium is maintained properly with all facilities and built to accomodate about 50000 people to watch a cricket test or match. The stadium is a regular venue for cricket matches and have food outlets, proper entry, rooms for players and dignitaries etc. Though I have been to the stadium several times I have just seen only an IPL Match here.

Name: Arun K
Title: Cricket at its best !!
Review: My first visit here was an India-Australia test match and it was simply awesome. The match was headed for a nail biting finish on the 5th day (which sadly got washed out).Also been here for a few IPL matches.The stadium experience is simply different with crazy shouting and cheering.However, the seating is not entirely appropriate since there is literally no ventilation. You will be left sweating profusely.

Name: Nchantedtraveller
Title: Nice grounds in the middle of busy Chennai city
Review: A stadium with a lot of cricket history. Cricket fans will enjoy a visit here even if there is no game. I watched a Test cricket game between India and England last year from air-conditioned club house. Very pleasant but the seating could have been better. Plastic deck chairs were not comfortable. The snack and lunch vendors were not good, not very organized to sell to the crowd within the allotted lunch hour. Needs a lot of improvement to belong in the upper categories of sports facilities around the world.

Name: tafayyaz
Title: Nice Place for tourist and sports lover.
Review: One of the old and famous cricket stadium of India. The overall management for players and spectators are excellent.

Name: Bob R
Title: It could be so good but..
Review: This is  a very attractive ground but, unfortunately, legal rows mean half the stands are not used. Seating was comfortable, a miracle given that just a couple of days before it had been strewn all over the stadium by a cyclone. Entry is chaotic, not helped by our gate being next to the open sewer/polluted watercourse that runs along one side of the ground - its best to breathe through your mouth. Reasonable selection of food on offer but water only available in paper cups which the vendors handle insides of with hands they use for the money. You cannot bring bottled water in yourself.There were more security and ticket checks than I have ever had including boarding international flights.

Name: Anand G
Title: Hunting Ground for Indian Spinners
Review: The stadium is one of the best cricket stadiums in the country. Famous for the spinner friendly pitch, it had traditionally been a hunting ground for Indian spinners. A visit at any point of time evokes memories of great performances by heroes of cricket, Indian or otherwise.

Name: Ra_Radha
Title: Cricketing zone
Review: Home to CSK, this ground has hosted many famous and historic cricket matches. Renovated few years back, it offers nice view of cricket action in middle even from top rows. Very near to Beach.

Name: Rucha121
Title: Awesome stadium
Review: Located within city, this cricket stadium offers best sporting entertainment during IPL and has hosted several International matches as well. Recently renovated, it looks majestic, however, due to stand-off with Corporation, few stands have been sealed off.

Name: Snowyontour
Title: Iconic ground - shame half of it was shut due to dodgy planning permission!
Review: We were there for the fifth Test and were fortunate enough to see a good part of the ground. Sadly half of the stadium was shut due to the fact (we were told) that three stands had been built without planning permission.Would recommend a visit - maybe to a Chennai Super Kings game - if they ever return to the IPL - they were banned due to "irregularities" sadly something that seems to plague cricket in the sub continent.

Name: ErnieGodalming
Title: Basic stadium
Review: Not the greatest stadium that I have been to with half the ground out of commission due to planning and construction difficulties. seating comprised old plastic bucket seats with tie straps. The ground was having to cope with a recnet cyclone but was filthy and overwhelming stench from the Buckingham canal was at times overpowering and food should be avoided as one person from our hotel ate the doughnuts on offer and was hospitalised. The cricket did provide plenty of the right runs, however.

Name: oaksfield
Title: Indian Bureaucracy at its best!
Review: Went to see the text match cricket in December 2016.  They wouldn't sell tickets to anyone until the actual day.  People were coming out at 'tea' and not being let back in despite valid ticket.  Had to queue from 6am to get ticket for 1 day.  Three sections not uses as apparently they didn't have necessary permissions to build them so couldn't use them.  The bureaucracy was diabolical, the stadium was only half full (at best) but they still didn't want to sell tickets.  Seats near the river had an over powering 'odour' ..... try to get seats up wind of these!  Such a pity they couldn't get their act together, very bad publicity for the country. Sadly England didn't do well either - but it was great watching the match.

Name: Elaine
Title: Attractive stadium but could be so much better
Review: First of all, congratulations to the ground staff who got this stadium ready to host a test match just days after the cyclone had caused such devastation.We were in the main pavilion area with views of the attractive individual stands. However three of these are not used due to a Supreme Court ruling about planning permission and therefore detracts from the overall experience of sight and atmosphere.Our seating was plastic chairs cable tied together. Quite comfortable but far to many in each row obstructing the steps and no clear path between sections and the stairs.Considering the ground was half empty there was no need for this.Leaving the stand in a hurry would be almost impossible as there's only one exit to channel through.There were plenty of food and drink stalls with good prices. But drinks were served in paper cups, no bottles allowed. I prefer a bottle so I can keep sipping rather than drinking it all in one go.Security was shambolic and inconsistent which was frustrating.A nice stadium (please open all the stands).I enjoyed my visit.

Name: shrinikethv
Title: Needs to be organized better
Review: Recently visited this stadium for 5th test, India vs England. Stadium has improved a lot, getting much better. But three stands are currently useless which is a pathetic sight. Something has to be done to ensure these 3 stands are in use. The pricing of food inside the staidum is nearly twice as the MRP, which is too much!

Name: blueandy1mac
Title: Much improved
Review: Looks a great stadium but needs to pass local planning requirements before 3 of its stands can be used again. Strangely they were in use for thee WC in 2011.

Name: APK24
Title: Enjoyed a day at the cricket!
Review: I visited recently for the India v England test match that took place here. The ground was in good condition inspite of the cyclone that lashed the city earlier in the month. I had a great fun day at the cricket. However i strongly recommend taking public transport or a cab to the ground as parking is an issue

Name: ChrisJS51
Title: Shambolic organisation and poor facilitiews
Review: We watched the Fifth Test Match between India and England. Some highlights (or lowlights):- Two huge new stands were completely empty. This apparently is because of a dispute between the owner (who believes he is a law unto himself) and the local planning authorities who want him to pull the stands down- We arrived with tickets telling us to enter at Gate 10. Stewards gate 120 told us to go to Gate 11. Stewards at gate 11 told us to go to gate 10. They eventually got this sorted out on the second day- Most days, prospective spectators were being turned away on the basis that the ground was full. In fact, not only were the stands mentioned above completely empty, but none of the others were much more than half-full either- The stadium appears to be staffed entirely by contractors who have never worked at the place before and don't know how it should be run- The TVs in our air-conditioned box were almost completely invisible as the box was south-facing and the screens were in front of us - so the glare was overpowering- Access to the box was via one lift which took 12 people, and two staircases which ran from the ground floor to the fourth. The fourth was one floor above us, and provided open seating and ad hoc catering facilities. Both staircases were almost permanently locked (except for exit at the end of the day), and lift access to the fourth floor was disabled. To support this, the lift contained an operator who sat on a stool all day (taking up two spaces in the lift) and did nothing but press the buttons, and two security guards who sat all day by the locked gates to the staircases doing nothing. This was apparently done to stop people without tickets for our air-conditioned floor gaining access to it. The consequences were that: (1) the only access during the day in or out of our box (which sat several hundred people) was via one lift which took ten people; (2) to get up one floor for the catering or for an outside view, we had to go down in the lift to the ground floor then walk up four flights; (3) there was a massive fire risk. When our tour group leader remonstrated with the authorities about the fire risk, they said it was OK because in the event of fire the man with the key would come and open the locked gates (if you believe that you'll believe anything). We suggested that the security guards on the staircases unlock the gates and actually check tickets - this would be better than having them sat down all day next to a locked gate doing nothing - but we were ignored. Our tour guide contemplated taking us all out of the box for safety reasons, but it would have been quite obvious that the authorities would have done nothing about it and we simply wouldn't have been able to watch the cricket.

Name: jaytara
Title: Pompous staff
Review: Paid Rs 4000/- for a season ticket to watch the cricket Test in Dec 2016. Seats were fine, but the security was over the top, they wouldn't allow anything in, not even newspapers, and one had to buy overpriced and mediocre stuff inside. The bigwigs sat happily in the pavilion with nary a care. Chennai should not stage Test matches, the stadium is as bad as the airport.

Name: vignesh d
Title: Lords of Tamilnadu
Review: This stadium has its own history, many remarkable matches played here, been there  once to witness a IPL match. The two tiers are not allowed some case is pending. its great experience to see the match with the whole crowd.

Name: Nathaniel
Title: Knowledgeable Cricket fans are from Chennai
Review: The atmosphere is electrifying and is a must experience if you are on vacation and in Chennai. You should count yourself lucky if your trip coincides with a cricket match taking place at this stadium. The fans cheering , the bands playing and the loud cheers when the famous stars like Kohli, Dravid come out to bat is just mind blowing. #natnzin

Name: VIVEK V
Title: World Class Stadium
Review: A regular host of Internationals, the experience here is truly awesome. The stadium is well maintained and snacks/drinks were plenty.

Name: annathurai
Title: very good cricket stadium
Review: the oldest stadium in tamilnadu. This is the first fully covered stadium in tamilnadu . Though it is big, it is neatly maintained

Name: Dilip Kumar B
Title: home to cricket maniacs
Review: one of the best cricket stadiums in india. it is highly maintained and is in the heart of the city. never miss an opportunity to visit this place

Name: kutyfencer
Title: Cricky Cricket !
Review: only place in chennai where i didnt went with my family. it's so awesome to watch match so live. watched our TNPL.

Name: Manoj T
Title: Cricket stadium
Review: Only cricket stadium here in chennai . Landmark placce near the beach .Late night stroll to be avoided

Name: EshwarSaba
Title: Flush Green Outfield
Review: With the Tamilnadu Premier League (TNPL) going on, went to watch one of the matches. Got a seat at the pavilion terrace right behind the sight screen. Hmmm! what a view one gets of the pitch, and the players with the match being played under flood lights. The ambience was electrifying what with all the cheer leaders, the music between each over and the game itself. The out field is lush green and if it is a full house then it will add to the atmosphere. Great place to watch a nice cricket match.

Name: Prabhu P
Title: Lion's Den
Review: Have been thrice to MAC for enjoying the Chennai Super Kings' roaring at the Den. Also for a great International ODI when the 2 Current best ODI batsman of the world scored centuries on the same day. Virat Kohli & ABD.

Name: Rajesh C
Title: Spectacular Stadium
Review: The MAC is a beautiful venue to watch cricket. The views are fantastic and the greens are worth the trip. It's easily one of the best stadiums to watch cricket in India. Scoreboards are well placed but there is only one big screen TV to watch the replays. Generally, snacks are served but they are not as hot/cold as you would prefer. The food court areas are always a mess and untidy and the toilets suck. Note that you would not be allowed to take any food items inside the stadium during matches - and that's just to make you buy the local fare available there at an exorbitant cost. Please be seated well in advance (30-60 mins) for the matches. In most cases, there are no seat numbers and you may end up standing for the entire duration of a match.Having said all this, there is no comparison to watching a match on TV and experiencing the match live on the grounds. It's an experience like no other.

Name: Niya1315
Title: Nice Stadium
Review: It is a big stadium and easily approachable with public transport. Marina beach is also nearby. The ground is lush green and it is having good sitting facility. A good stadium for playing cricket.

Name: raffathulla
Title: Best Stadium
Review: This is one of the best stadium in Chennai. Lots of International and Domestic matches were being played here. Easily accessible to rail and road

Name: kumarjayamalla
Title: Very big stadium
Review: Good sitting facility and clean enviornment. But one stand is empty (not accessible) mode of transportation is good.

Name: Avighna2015
Title: Vibrant atmosphere
Review: Thr atmosphere here on game days is one to beat! What a place to watch cricket at. Not very difficult to find since it's within a main part of the town.

Name: Murali M
Title: Lover of Cricket
Review: Superb Stadium to watch cricket match. The most favourite cricket stadium of foreign players. We can see the huge audience support though we are going to lose.

Name: shymathans
Title: MCA stadium
Review: enjoyed the every match, now some renovation done. attractive ground. need more spacious in entrance and exit

Name: ssiddhartha
Title: Great Stadium to witness cricket match
Review: Visited M A Chidambaram Stadium for the ICC Womens T20 World Cup and I was satisified with what was on offer. The security check at the gate was top class and inside the stadium, the atmosphere was wonderful (inspite of it being a women's match).The snacks counter had a decent variety of snacks and the service in the seating area pushed up the sales. A sore sight was that three stands in the stadium had to be empty due to an ongoing litigation with the corporation authorities.All said and done, one of the appreciated cricket stadiums in India to witness a cricket match.

Name: ivoryav
Title: Clean, compact stadium, good security
Review: The seating is great. Watch out for the sun during peak summer months, the lower stands are exposed. It is kept pretty clean and lots of nice promotion/cheering gear is sold outside just before you enter. The security is tight. Great experience to watch a match here. I hope they open all the stands as the last time i went they had blocked some stands due to no approval.

Name: ganeshpkumar
Title: Its all about cricket
Review: Also called as Chepuak stadium is located near the Marina Beach. Its one of the important international cricket venues in India. Most of the cricket lovers would have visited this stadium at least once. There is nothing much to see here when no cricket is being played. The stadium comes to life during the events

Name: ·∏∞‚ìê‚ì°·π±·∏©·∏≠·πã·∏∞
Title: Chennai Super Kings Home
Review: the so called chepauk stadium has so many records on its name. but more than anythng its a home paradise for the chennai super kings and they always made to playoffs from here. wish the controversy surrounding the stands is resolved soon for a complete stadium experience.

Name: Atif M
Title: good for cricket lovers
Review: very big and known cricket stadium in India.in the city. major cricket matches are played here and popular with local and visitors

Name: Jagan N
Title: cricket stadium
Review: the only international cricket stadium in chennai & old stadium in india. I watched five day matches of the world players  M A K Pataudi & sunil gavasker & srikanth.. We watched the matches at that time with my friends very lot fun.Now the stadium was renovated and looks very nice.

Name: KARTHIKb87
Title: Chennais cricket stadium
Review: Its premium cricket stadium in chennai and important international cricket stadium in India and chennai. Its home ground for Chennai super kings, Chennai IPL team. Lot of international matches held here

Name: Pal_078
Title: Stadium with basic requirements met
Review: For Cricket lovers, anything goes, as long as they get to see their idols live. But the stadium needs major work. They can improve the seating, the shade system, amenities inside like food and washrooms. Cricket is big in Chennai, so renovating is not a loss for the authorities.

Name: cool1960
Title: Good Stadium
Review: Think of CRICKET this STADIUM will get in MIND.Ambience during the match times start 10 km before the stadium. That is the vibrance. Ample car park, nice place to enjoy the match. View from all places are good.

Name: Karthik V
Title: Historic and a Sporty Place
Review: I had been to this historic landmark of Chennai many times. The old look was so historic that it was the Cricket temple of South India where many records were created. This stadium modified now still stands majestic in Chennai.

Name: itsjusamit
Title: an excellent atmosphere welcomes all at this place
Review: I found this cricket stadium a real nice place were people come to watch  a real good game of cricket.

Name: saagar49
Title: Excellent Match
Review: I went to the Match between india vs south africa 4th odi , it was huge crowd that day , i was standing for 30 minutes to enter in to stadium , then match started , i enjoyed virat kohli batting , he got a century , most important thing , india won that game.

Name: Begaraaj S M
Title: Stupendofantabulous Stadium !!!
Review: Hat's off to the designer for designing this wonderful Stadium with gaps in between the stands to keep the seabreez flowing through the stadium there by making the stadium pleasant for the spectators and preventing from Chennai heat.On 22 October 2015, India beat South Africa in a day and nighter which we enjoyed a lot.Must visit for all age groups when India plays any opponent, otherwise we can't go inside the stadium without the entry ticket.

Name: sandy0028
Title: CSK LIONS DEN
Review: Great place to watch cricket live with superb energetic atmosphere, Many historic matches this stadium had witnessed. After renovation, this place is lovely & seating arrangements are awesome.

Name: kathiranand7
Title: Nice stadium...
Review: Very nice stadium in chennai its look nice and big we can enjoy lot in this place very stadium best ....

Name: PremPandurangam
Title: The best cricket ground in India
Review: You can't get a better place to play or watch cricket than the MAC. The pitch is usually sporting having something for the bowlers and the batsmen. The new stands and corporate boxes are just awesome. The icing is really the knowledgeable crowd that gathers to watch cricket here. Even opponents shots and good fielding efforts are cheered. Many players like Kapil Dev, Gavaskar, Tendulkar, Hayden, Dhoni, Sehwag et al just love the MAC.

Name: AshokMela
Title: Best Cricket stadium !!!
Review: Enjoyed watching India playing South Africa at M.A.Chidambaram stadium also called chepauk stadium. Very beautiful stadium close to Marina beach. Easily accessible through MRTS train or bus. Water bottles, bags not allowed. Suitable for organizing Day and Night games.

Name: Mathivanan V
Title: Entry only for Members and Spectators
Review: This is not a Tourist attraction or a place to See.This is a Cricket stadium where world class matches are played.If you are in this city and by chance any match is played at the time of ur visit,you can pretty well go and  buy ticket (if you can get)  and enjoy.A very well maintained stadium with all amenities

Name: ROYKALYAN
Title: Awesome Stadium
Review: A great new stadium also called Chepauk Stadium , very near to Marina Beach and Chennai Central Railway Station . The popular IPL matches which are normally played in flood lights in late evenings are spectacular to view,

Name: SagarVS
Title: For Cricket lovers
Review: This stadium is the biggest in Chennai and hosts cricket matches. TN Cricket association and the Madras Cricket club are both here and entry is for members only. No need to visit unless there is a match or event happening.

Name: GrubWaz
Title: Great new stadium, awesome crowd.
Review: After the renovation, finally there is space for air to come into the stands. From being a stuffy cricket ground, MAC has become a fabulous place to watch cricket from. Add to it, the crowd touted as the most sportive crowd in the cricketing world which gave a standing ovation to Pakistan when they beat India, MAC is a blessing for cricket.

Name: Capri67
Title: Cricket - MAC Chepauk - Synonyms!
Review: Nothing to beat an International Cricket Match in Namma MAC, Chepauk Stadium! Many a nostalgic memories stand out. The 136 by great Sachin against a rampaging Pakistan is till date probably the best innings played under immense pressure and personal duress in this stadium. Over the years, this has changed with newer stands but the old nostalgia still remains whenever I visit this place!

Name: s_ramsam
Title: Excellent stadium
Review: This stadium which is an excellent piece of construction in the heart of the old city is mainly for cricket lovers since all cricket matches are held here.  Very accessible from other areas in the city, this is also probably the best sports stadium in southern India.

Name: AbhishekKalra
Title: Great experience
Review: Went to the stadium for an IPL match as part of team outing. The stadium is a gigantic structure and stands outs in its vicinity. A few pointers from my experiences1) Carefully designed stutcture with keen eye on the saftey (Multiple exits)2) Multi level Seating (With the VIP box on the lower floor)3) Well lit4) Beautifully curated field5) Multiple Exit gates6) Convenient Location (Right in the centre of the city)Despite all the ups as mentioned above the place does comes wiht its own flaws1) Disturbing Empty stands (caught up in some legal mess)2) Crowded surroundings (might hamper during emergency)Bottomline: Just go and enjoy the game (Surreal Experience (First game in a stadium))

Name: VenkyV
Title: One of the star attractions of Chennai
Review: If you are in Chennai during the IPL season or International Cricket season, checkout the MAC Stadium. This is a real concrete jungle, but the atmosphere can be electric when CSK or India plays.

Name: girieshm24
Title: Match in chennai
Review: a gift for cricket fans in chennai the IPL is the main season and the crowd is over sprited and you can enjoy the game

Name: Baskar_Raman
Title: Amazing experience
Review: The biggest cricket stadium in Chennai with good access from different roads leading to it. Watched a couple of IPL matches and enjoyed the experience

Name: ppnpower
Title: Arena  for cricket
Review: historical & well maintained, festive place for great cricket matches, international standard ground. located in city center & close to central railway station

Name: Jatin Sanghvi
Title: Good hangout spot with family...
Review: Apart from the clock tower which is centre of attraction, the park is otherwise spacious, has a good walking track, lawns, 2 skating arenas, children play area, 2 tiny lakes.  In evenings, you can spot a colony of bats perching on a tree in the eastern side of the park.

Name: Helen
Title: Outdoor concert venue
Review: Easy access. Spacious. Lakes, trees, seating, walking, tower for a wide view of the city  and a lovely outdoor stage and seating for excellent performances.

Name: #amosamiyanayeküéß
Title: üë£
Review: very close to my office so i never missed the just just to in ... greenish areas such a awesome for jogging walking and skating‚õ∑Ô∏è ! best spot to hangout with children as well as adults the main attraction in the towerüóº

Name: Nanthakumar Ganesan
Title: Good for walkers and children
Review: Having very good environment to walk.. 1 round will come around 1.5 km.. Having more space with lake.. Having more slides, swings

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: Big park in the heart of the city
Review: Annagar Park is a big park in the heart of the city. It's really great to build a park in such a big commercial area. This park is close to Ayyappan Koyal (Ayyappa Swami Temple). The best thing about the park is it has a very big tower üóº. This tower attracts most of the visitors. Overall its a must visit place for kids and parents too. You can enjoy walking in the park.

Name: Lijo
Title: 1968 tower
Review: A park for all with a tower in the Centre built in 1968.Though the tower is closed for public. Park is still assessable. A place to spent ur evening leisure time if u happen to be in Chennai

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: famous among the locals
Review: This is one of the place which is mostly sorted by the locals all through the  day, for their walking,playing,yoga,mingling with friends and neighbours, and the happening place in the city.

Name: Melissa Dsouza
Title: Tower
Review: This place is a garden to relax and there is a tower and a huge garden there which can  visited by family and friends.

Name: Narasimhan G
Title: Extra ordinary maintenance
Review: I know the Local MLA there. Place is full of people mainly because of the rich neighbourhood and the responsible population thereChildren are taught skating.Parents and kids enjoy skating , park and the Anna Nagar Tower !!Lily pond is of a great size.. You can spot turtles which eat popcorn thrown by the visitors !!

Name: Shaji Joseph
Title: good place to visit
Review: There is a long walk way across the park which is well maintained. Also can climb to the top of the tower which will give  long view of Anna Nagar area.

Name: Dinesh T
Title: Energy Redefining Park
Review: Love is this park, as this is one of the best place to relax and calm down our self. Visit this place for a walk, exercise or take your kids for play

Name: Arjun
Title: Good place for couples,friends,family and old age people.
Review: Tower park is the best place which is suited for all people. It is the best place to go with friends, family.it is also a good place for couples.kids can also enjoy here .so it is good place for all.

Name: Ramya S
Title: Relax
Review: Anna nagar tower park is a nice place to relax. There are many rides for children. we have exercise for grownups and it is spacious to walk around the park.

Name: diva k
Title: Poor maintenance
Review: I have been to this place after so many years, The maintenance is pathetic and they dont allow to go the top of the tower. T

Name: Prathitha S
Title: The Tower oh Happiness
Review: The Anna Nagar Tower is perhaps the oldest landmark here. It still has its old charm of being the most serene parks in the neighbourhood where people of all ages. The walking track reverberates with soulful melodies of Tamil film songs which makes walking the most delightful activity of the day. The gardens and fountains attract large crowds. The trees make the place very pleasant even during the hottest summer days of Chennai. The Park boasts of a good Skating rink and a meditation point too. Kids have their best times in the park here and remember their time spent here for the he rest of their lives just the way I do.

Name: Sarath Babu S
Title: Good place to hang out
Review: If you‚Äôre looking for a place to spend some quality time with our family & friends especially in the heart of the city, this is the place to go to.Anna Nagar Tower Park, as the name implies has the Tower & Park for you to walk/jog. It also has an open theatre. There are lot of snack shops just outside the compound but please ensure that the place doesn‚Äôt get untidy with all those spillovers. The park is real huge with lot of trees/plants & is ideal for a Morning/evening jog/walk.

Name: Rajeshkumar C
Title: Visit to Annanagar tower park
Review: During 2000 to 2005 I have been a regular visitor to Anna nagar tower park with my friends on weekends. After switching over to IT and job in OMR it's been long time I have forgotten this place.Recently our friends and family wanted to have a meet near Anna nagar and the first place that came to my mind is Tower park. On Friendship day , We visited the Tower park with few friends and their families. Wow,entering the park,  I really had a different feeling of meeting an lovely old friend. Tower park has lot of green covers and large spaces for visitors. Being a Sunday we could witness lot of sports in action. Lot of kids were enjoying their time in multiple small play areas. Some of us scaled the Tower peak to have a lovely view of the city. Lot of eatery shops were available around the tower park , particularly at the entrance. For the safety of the visitors, police patrolling has been put in place. Really a refreshing evening and loved the Park .

Name: K R
Title: Nice park
Review: It located heart of Anna Nagar near rountana.  It is wonderful  for time passing and attractive place .

Name: sridharan2013
Title: A well maintained garden with a landmark tower in the midst
Review: Anna Nagar tower is a famous landmark in Chennai and the authorities have built a nice garden with large trees and landscape around it. Garden is very well maintained and is a boon for the people. There is scope for more facilities for visitors. Facilities for children amusement is available.

Name: Ghiri T
Title: Most visited Site
Review: Anna Nagar Tower Park is located near Anna Nagar roundtanna Chennai. This place is well maintained by the Chennai Corp.Many people come here to do exercise and to spend time with their loved ones. this place is famous around the locality. The tower is placed in the center of the park but it is restricted for the public to enter the tower.I used to go there with my friends to spend some time in the evening Overall it was a great experience.

Name: Sagarcak
Title: Excercise
Review: Very good park for joggers, warming ups. Very interactive place.very good place in the city which we can spend time .

Name: Abdul wahaab
Title: Chilling evening with nature
Review: It's a quite good mainted park inside the hot city . Lot of people visits this place daily kids couples family joggers employees to chill out their stresses and have a get-together .. love this place with mild music being played from the tower and fountain arrangements near tower is gud

Name: clementwill
Title: The Marina of AnnaNagar
Review: This precious lung space in Anna Nagar is one of the biggest blessings of the area. This is probably the largest park in Anna Nagar at present and attracts people of all ages from children to pensioners who all find something to do in this lovely park. There are enough play equipment to keep children occupied though some are in terrible shape due to poor maintenance, there are also exercise equipment which attract large crowds. The pebble tracks and the walking lanes are usually full of people in the morning and evening.A good space to spend time with known people or simply alone in Anna Nagar and its completely free!

Name: Rucha121
Title: Anna Tower
Review: While visiting our relatives in Anna Nagar, we made it a point to spend atleast 1 hour playing in Anna Nagar Tower Park. It had small lawn and benches for elderly people to sit and chat. Small children would merrily play around the trees and fountain. Hope they maintain it well and more garden and lawn space is added and landscape can be more beautiful and needs good maintenance.

Name: Mansoor A
Title: Nice place to hang around
Review: Good for kids, couples! singles please refrain üòä. Parking is available...lots of refreshments near the entrance....Can spend some 2 hours that's it...

Name: S A
Title: Good place for morning walk
Review: It's a very good place to start the day with a peaceful walk. The outer ring is approx 1km distance. Neat and clean.  Well maintained park. Lots of sitting places inside the park.

Name: Dilip Kumar
Title: A bustling park with greenery , skating, dancing, martial arts, walking etc..
Review: In the center of the posh Anna nagar - there lies this park offering bunch of activities -1. Greenery - with proper path ways for joggers2. Kids play areas - with swings, see-saw, skids etc. Some broken - but overall ok.3. Bushes, benches and lawns for teenage couples.4. Skating ring - where kids practice skating and its a delight to see5. Dance classes - hip hop6. Martial art classes7. A big tower with steps - but doors locked. Had it would been opened  the view would be great from top up there.8....Its a good place for people to relax and for kids to play.  It is an ideal place to chill for people in and around annanagar. Those who want their kids to learn skating - it looks like an ideal place. It is a very good park but not a tourist attraction.

Name: worldwomantourist
Title: Good place to relax
Review: Anna Nagar Tower park is located in Anna nagar area. Very famous among the local residents who come there to relax. Many kids get a good place to play and to enjoy their play time with friends. Many old people come here to relax and to share their feelings and thoughts with their friends and relatives.

Name: Arun
Title: One of the biggest parks in Chennai
Review: I have been to this place more than thrice and it has always been a good place to hang out with friends/GF. The main attraction is the tower and now a days they don‚Äôt allow to access the tower since some have tried to commit suicide and do some anti-social activities. However, you can click pictures of the tower and hangout near the tower.

Name: RAMAKRISHNAN K
Title: Walkers paradise in midst of Anna nagar
Review: The park is close to Aiyappan temple on 2nd avenue ..The park can also be approached from any sides of Anna Nagar easily.The activity starts early morning itself and you will find yoga club, laughing group, serious walkers, holly walkers with lots of health quotient around the gates.These include medical test for BP and sugar test etcSome vegetables can also be bought here our side the gate Nice skating ground ,,, children play area ,, But Sunday is crowded.. in the evenings

Name: Sarma_nvny
Title: Good one to spend time with family
Review: Accessibility and safety with plenty of space for relaxing, kids playing area, walkers track, big tower only to see from outside, fountains, skating ring, spend a good time.

Name: SagarVS
Title: Oasis
Review: In a crowded polluted concrete jungle such large green parks are a treat to the eye. Popular with locals and hundreds walk around the track in the park. Many catch up here socially. There is a huge tower here built in the 1960s but no one is allowed to go up. The place is seriously crowded in the morning and the evening. While people go here wanting peace, the park plays loud music from 6 am to 9 am which is a huge irritation.

Name: Ra_Radha
Title: Tower Garden
Review: Located in the neighborhood of Anna Nagar is the iconic Anna Nagar Tower and the children's park/ garden. Many kids come and play here in evening and senior citizens or women gather to take a walk and share a lighter moments. nice place to relax.

Name: Joji J
Title: "right place for morning walk and to spend evenings"
Review: The Tower Park at Anna Nagar is a right place where we can spend time or relax in the evening breathing fresh oxygen and kids have choice for various activities. The park has everthing to make us relax -The walk way around the park, the lake, the plants and trees in the park, kids play area, benches to sit and relax, the huge watch tower, rest room etc. The authorities have managed to maintain the park well and I have been to the park several times with friends to spend some time enjoying the great atmosphere.

Name: vikasmardia
Title: anna nagar tower park
Review: Tower park having variety of activities like skating rink and very big area for walkers. Also has a bathroom for convenience. A must for all anna nagarites

Name: Mansi Reddy
Title: Great activities for all age groups
Review: The towers park always makes me nostalgic.  In most cases the place is built and then a tower, but in Anna Nagar The tower was first made and then the neighborhood developed.  Because there are activities for all age groups it is visited by thousands of people every day. There is a great place to walk, run, playground for kids, benches to relax etc. A visit with family or friends is always enjoyable.

Name: Karthik V
Title: Evening walk
Review: This is my second visit here to this tower park after nearly 15 years. Although i didnt climb the tower all the way up this time around, i took a short stroll around the park. On a visit to a relatives house nearby, my curiosity to see this tower again brought me in this time. Now its well developed neatly maintained with lots of walker and children who want to spend a clean evening in this park. Good plale always.

Name: Karthick D
Title: Maintenance perfect
Review: Perfect place walking, relaxation,yoga, children's entertainment place, very safety like child and girls,very peaceful place.

Name: Abdul wahaab
Title: Awsme park to have gettogether with frnds
Review: Gud place to visit during evening which is located in the centre of the busy city ..park maintenace and cleanliness is gud ..lot of peoples visiting daily to spend time woth frnds and family Sports court is also available for indoor games lover but played outside One of the best park to do photo shoot ..

Name: cool1960
Title: RELAXING PLACE FOR ALL AGES
Review: Very neatly maintained. A big park. Cars have to be parked at the side roads available, which is there.The walking places are well tiled. Lots of benches are there for all of us to sit. Lots of Kids playing items are there, lots of mini exercising items are there. Worth spending a good time there.

Name: Ramprasad b
Title: Good park for Walks and Jogging
Review: This park is known as TOWER PARK for locals.  This park is located at center of Anna Nagar near Ayyappan Temple close to 2nd and 3rd Avenue Junction. I visit this park at least two times a week for morning walks. The walkway for walking and jogging along the perimeter of park is about 1.4 KM.  All the walkways are paved and mostly evenly leveled. A well maintained 2 to 3 acres lake is present in the park. This lake had water through out the year in the last five years since I was visiting the park.  In the park many play zone are present for children. Park was severely affected during the Dec. 2016 "Varadh" cyclone that uprooted and broke many well grown trees. Park management has done a very good job of clearing the fallen trees and broken branches in less than ten days to make the park usable again.A tall Observation Tower constructed in mid 1960s for an international trade fare is present at center of the park. This tower is well maintained but closed for public to go up due to a few attempts for suicides Best time to use the park for walking and jogging is mornings as the park gets crowded in the evenings with children and casual visitors. There is no entry fee or parking fee for using this park.

Name: Mohanathan V
Title: Gud place to fresh breeze
Review: This place is located very close to Anna nagar ayyappa temple. Campus is filled with trees. Vast space with more children play things, sitouts, skating area and fountain. Now its not allowed to enter the tower entrance

Name: Jothilingam E
Title: Nice park for all age
Review: Superb location for spending time not only for children but for all ages.You will enjoy park with kids.Dont forget to visit nearby Iyappan temple to offer prayers.

Name: vignesh d
Title: A Big park
Review: It is the biggest park in Chennai(If i'm not wrong) situated in Anna nagar, near to Aiyyapan temple. Its a large area to jog around, lake inside it, place to play shuttle, play area for kids, scatting place and the main attraction is the tower but it is closed because of some stupids committed suicide from it, otherwise it offers the great city view from the top.

Name: ArunaSrinivas
Title: Very good park!
Review: Well maintained park in the busy neighborhood of Anna nagar. Very crowded on holidays and weekends. Kids love to play on all the swings, slides...  There is a skating rink too.

Name: chaithanya12
Title: Good park in a busy area
Review: Anna nagar has full of commercial spaces and now the Tower Park is indeed one spot where you can sit and relax. Well suited for people who want to take a walk or jog. There are also various sports activities conducted inside the park which might interest you and summer classes for kids

Name: Syed H
Title: Beautiful and well maintained
Review: The park is a good example of how an ideal park in a residential locality should be ..greenery, channel music, great tower, skating arena, benches to relax,  no littering, fountain etc. .keep up the good work on maintenance. .

Name: kabilan k
Title: Park For Walkers
Review: Inside a busy area of anna nagar, there is a place with more trees and fresh air. Inside a park there is an artificial pond. This park best suits for early morning walking. I used to go there for walking and do some yoga and breathing exercises. And many awareness programmes also takes place here. The park name is Dr. Visveswaraya Tower Park   due to the tall tower like structure which was built in 1968, which was iconic and became a popular place and simply called as tower park.

Name: Aswathy J
Title: Neat!!
Review: A neat,well maintained park. Entry to the tower is restricted though. Great place for a nice long walk. There's a park for the kids. They also have a nice little pond.

Name: Nina S
Title: An much desired green oasis in the midst of the city
Review: The Tower Park is an iconic landmark of Anna Nagar itself. Its great to visit during the early mornings for a breath of fresh air during your morning walk/jog.  Visit in the evenings along with your family members especially kids. There is lots of place to walk leisurely having a chat.  Watch the fountains around the Tower, although access to the top of the tower is restricted and enjoy the bustling noises of the people around. Kids would be busy with the play equipment set up in several areas within the park. Bring along their skates, scooters and bicycles... this is the best place to put them to use.

Name: Arogya Raj
Title: Breezy air
Review: Neat and clean. Morning and evening are good time to visit . Lots of  fun for Children's. Good time pass for all. Make a run, jog all you want. Good place to make meaningful conversations with your loved ones. Watch the kids skate ,play and practice their dance moves.

Name: helpothers2016
Title: Excellent park
Review: well maintained, big park, fully crowded with a mix of people from all sections. car park is bit difficult. lot of side shop eatery is available.

Name: Rajesh C
Title: A breadth of fresh air!
Review: A great place to relax in the midst of the concrete jungle. A well planned and neat park in the center of anna nagar. It has got something for everyone. Walking / Jogging tracks. Volley ball nets, shuttle nets, cricket, yoga, skating, boating, Open air theater, kids play area, etc... etc... to name a few. Its always crowded and why not? One round on the walking track is approx 1 km. Early morning and late evenings are great times to be in the park. Soft music is played to encourage the patrons to do their exercises.Dont miss the laughing club oldies who generally seem to be having a ball in the mornings on almost all days.

Name: Ramesh K
Title: Superb
Review: Awesome place to visit with family . Natural, playful , learning full place Children were learning skating. By seeing them we can also enjoy And play ......We enjoyed the play area because I am a kid .their were 2 play areas, which were very large..........We can visit the park for our health ...How ???? By walking.........totally I enjoyed a lot ..............

Name: Muguncjb
Title: Surprisingly clean and some how green
Review: There is no entry fee for this park. Yet the park is privately maintained almost very clean and sufficient green with several trees around.  The park has benches below trees so that people can sit in hot sunny days too yet enough shadow is there.  Lot of children play activities are there including skating.  The tower located in the middle of the park has path to go to top but it is closed for entry.  For local people its good time pass for about an hour any time in day in the park so as for any visitors.  However can't say a must attraction for visitors from out of Chennai.

Name: Saravanan G
Title: Divine Place at Nice Location
Review: An heritage divine place for worship and very peaceful location. Crowded by people but the olden day Architecture is very Pleasant. Nice Trip

Name: Wanderlust
Title: Nice and memorable experience
Review: Temple is neat and clean and has lot of positive vibes, one can sit for hours and meditate. Abuttting the Temple is river Tunga flowing gracefully with people sitting and enjoying the divineness of the place. There are groups singing Lalita Sahasranama etc. Overall a visit to the place will cleanse the mind and soul....

Name: Chinnu
Title: Hidden culture
Review: Sringeri (‡≤∂‡≥É‡≤Ç‡≤ó‡≥á‡≤∞‡≤ø) also called Sri Kshetra Shringeri is a hill town located in the state of Karnataka ,It is located on the banks of the river Tunga. It is the site of the first matha (Sringeri Sharada Peetham) established by Adi Shankara.According to legend, Adi Shankaracharya is said to have selected the site as the place to stay and teach his disciples, because when he was walking by the Tunga river, he saw a cobra with a raised hood, providing shelter from the hot sun, to a frog undergoing labour. Impressed with the place where natural enemies had gone beyond their instincts.In frame: Shringeri Sharadamba Temple. #sringer#karnataka#karnatakatourism#karnataka_focus#travelkarnataka#incrediblekarnataka#nammakarnataka#nammakarnatakaphotographers#explorekarnataka#travelling#travelislife#travelphotographer#travelwithme#travelawesome#travelling#travelblogger#travelingram#travel_eat_click_

Name: Narasimhan G
Title: Huge Hall
Review: Very pious place for worship !Silent and focus oriented...Situated in Venkatnarayana Road , T Nagar with ample road area to park your vehicle nearby....

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: a branch of the famous sringeri peedam
Review: This temple is dedicated to maa saravana and is maintained by the Sarah mutt of sringeri of karnataka, the deity is device and again one of the must visit place in the city

Name: Sivalingam Sankar
Title: Adhisankara's Divine Place of Saratha Peetam of South India
Review: Adhisankara Bhagavat patha the great Saint, the holy incarnation of Mahadeva(Siva) in earth to correct the path the way Sanathana Dharma(The Hindu Religion) was going bad. He preached many good aspects, corrected worst practices (Ex. Animal killing practices in Kanchi) and proclaimed many pooja practices in famous temples across india. He established 4 madas at 4 corners, Sirngeri is one among the four in south direction. He choosed this place where he can see a pregnant frog been guarded in sun heat by Hissing Cobra, such divinity this place have (this stone sculpture can be seen in the steps of Tungabadra river still, dont miss it to see). Saradha is the divine name of Vidhya roopa of Devi. Old statue is of Sandal wood which can be seen in the vidhya sankara temple side. Saradha devi is adorned daily with many different alagara and Maha sanithanam of Mutt performs puja in morning, We visited during Navarattri where daily procession in evening and morning pooja is done. Vidhya sankara is the oldest temple and with fine architecture. Also visit the Mutt which is to cross the river and you have small parks and other adhistanams of earlier Madathipathis. Heavy rain can be witnessed during rainly season especially during navaratri period. Darbar function is also available during nights of navaratri. Perenial river where people used to bath and then visit temple, full of fish, where you can feed with rice flakes. Visited from bangalore boarding KSRTC bus, one day trip but worth for all

Name: vasan224
Title: southern Advaita Vedanta matha
Review: One of the best religious places and I think other temple authorities should take a point or two from this temple. First the accommodation is really good, though temple maintained you get a clean room for a budget price

Name: Nirmal
Title: Temple constructed by Adi Shankaracharya...!
Review: This is the one of the 4 temples constructed by adi shankaracharya. He is the life saver of the hindu religion. His dedication towards learning all the vedas and debating as a guru who represents the hindu religion when all were converting to other religion saved us from being extinction.

Name: Prakash P
Title: Nice temple on the banks of a river
Review: A must visit temple when you are travelling in the Mangalore area. We went in the evening it was very pleasant. Had a nice peaceful Darshan and spent time near the river feeding the fishes.

Name: Shriju
Title: Historical and Spiritual
Review: Historical , Clean and well maintained temple. you feel good and happy. Stayed at Srigeri with family and friends also had the honour of seeing Sankracharya.  Would love to be there.

Name: meghashyam
Title: Maa
Review: A lovely temple for maa Sarada , an oasis of peace in t.nagar , maa is splendid , parking is an issue . Lord venkateswara swami temple maintained by TTD and this temple maintained by Sri Sringeri Math can be visited together

Name: Baburajnair
Title: Nice
Review: Wonderful ambience, my second visit, great weather, neat temple, protected monument, Anna Dana is also there.

Name: Mohan2013
Title: Serene place
Review: The mutt is 93 kms from Shimoga town. Located on the sides of Tunga river. The temples and the mutt are places of interest. The meditation place of Saint ADI Shankara is located in the hill across the river, but now connected by a bridge. The added attraction is the giant fish waiting under the river's water to feed on the puffed rice given by the pilgrims.

Name: SwaminathanTvlr
Title: Spiritual Treat....
Review: Holy place.... at least once in a lifetime one must be there to feel and cherish spiritual memories.

Name: Ra_Radha
Title: Temple in Busy TNagar area
Review: During shopping, we discovered this temple in midst of the maddening shoppers.. we took some time out and offered our prayers to God. Temple is well maintained and many devotees have been regularly coming here for ages.

Name: aski_online
Title: Abode of great spiritual/religous significance
Review: Visit their web site to know more of the place/significance. From a travelers perspective, the accommodation is booked at the building opposite the temple compound on first come first serve basis. Mere Rs 300/- for a days stay, no questions asked about checkout time etc. Rooms are basic, not very clean though. We got accommodation in the building right opposite to the temple compound which as the best. Once access the riverside from within the temple compound and also take the bridge to the go to the other side, which hosts the samdhi places, guru sannidhi , ved patasala and Kala bhairava temple etc. Was the bridge been kept closed in the early morning hours. We went to do Vidharambham for our daughter and happens here every day, till noon. No advance booking required for this, just take a Rs 150/- seva ticket and go in. Also annadhanam is there in the afternoon and night.

Name: raja p
Title: peaceful
Review: i sit in the meditation hall in this temple.what a pleasant atmosphere.this temple is dedicated to goddess sharada.

Name: EshwarSaba
Title: Calm and Serene
Review: Sringeri Sharada keeps doing a lot in my life, and the mutt here is very calm and serene. One can experience bliss as we sit at the meditation hall and look at the Ganesha, Sharada and Adi Shankara, plus Jagadguru Bharati Theerta.

Name: CMJ303
Title: Famous temple
Review: This is one of the kind temple dedicated to goddess sharada situated in Sringeri feeding of fish on the banks of river tunga is also famous here

Name: AshokMela
Title: Sringeri Saradha Temple in T.Nagar
Review: Have been to this temple which is located in Venkata narayana street in T.Nagar very close to Natesan park. This is the one of the very few Saradhambal temple in Chennai I guess. The temple is maintained neat and clean and worth a place to visit.

Name: Jagan N
Title: devotion
Review: very pleasent & calm place to worship..located centrally in chennai also near thirumal devasthanam temple.The main idol of sri saradambal is looking very pleasent .

Name: HolidaysSep2015
Title: Temple Visit
Review: Holy place managed entirely by the Sringeri mutt on the baks of Netravati river. Good atmosphere and peaceful for prayers of Eswar and Saradhambal

Name: HARI N
Title: Divine Bliss in a Divine Place
Review: Very Clean ,quiet , spiritual place to visit to recharge ones mind, find solace and above all try and reach out to God .Very friendly priests and management makes life easy and good ! A must visit place in Chennai..

Name: ChennaiFocus
Title: Modernized yet traditional temple of sringeri Saradha Peetam
Review: Beautiful Sarada Devi, Ganesha and Saint Adi Shankarar in a big hall fit for meditation with tiled flooring with traditional pooja and regular practices of celebrations and  festivities

Name: battuvp248
Title: Awesome drive, location and temple
Review: I would say everyone who are a fond lovers of driving, should go drive to this place, the sceneries surrounding you will definitely mesmerize. Coming to the temple, saradhamba shaktipeet is one of the most powerful and one of the oldest temple. Accomodations are available nearby, only problem will be you won't get proper food, and check for Accomodations prior to your journey

Name: Ravi D
Title: Sringeri Mutt presence in Chennai
Review: To avoid motorists from praying from their vehicles and thus not showing proper devotion and deference to Goddess Sarada of Sringeri Peetam, the floor of the temple is much higher than the road level. So perforce you have to get down, climb 18-20 steps before glimpsing the resplendent glory of the Goddess of learning. Worthwhile! You will leave with a sense of fulfilment and peace

Name: PB K
Title: A serene place
Review: Quiet divine atmosphere. You  are not rished to day anything.If you want you can sit and meditate. It is a must visit place for Sringeri devotees in Chennai

Name: Capri67
Title: Well-Maintained devotional place! Worth Visiting.
Review: Very well maintained property by the Sringeri Saradha Peetam. Exact replica of Saradha Devi idol at Sringeri!

Name: vinodssind
Title: Peaceful place to meditate and pray.
Review: Peaceful place right in the middle of the city. It is accessible from all areas of the city. Spacious meditation hall.The inner sanctum is maintained spic and span by the acharyas. Try not to take toddlers on infants as they try to maintain pin drop silence inside the temple.

Name: kamakshi2015
Title: The feast - divinity and the experience
Review: This temple is invokes the feeling of the devotion in people coming here . Early mornings are best time . The faithfuls and the regulars begin their day here . Beautiful . Location is easy access .

Name: ramayana2013
Title: sarada devi chennai
Review: This temple is near t t d devastanam temple at t nagar. the temple is dedicated to saradadevi. the temple is well maintained . incharge sarada peedam. the deity is similar to one ai singeri.. have shrines adi sankara, siva, ganesa. the temple is calm and quiet.

Name: Shiva S
Title: Excellent divine place
Review: Its really a divine place to be in for mind relaxation. They do services in all kind like free matrimony. Even they offer free lunches to all devotees. During Navarathri, Pongal, Aadi Pooram and other festival days, special abishegam and Alangarams are done for Goddess Sharadha Devi, Ganesh and Adi Sankarar. Special music concerts will be conducted during these special festival days.

Name: drshivaha
Title: Good one
Review: very very Authenticate place to visit. highly custom oriented one. filled with tradition and heritage.

Name: Rajaram1953
Title: Calm and Quiet Place to do Dhyan
Review: Very calm and quiet place to do Dyan in the busiest area of T.Nagar.  The cleanliness and the silence one can never forget.

Name: rea2der
Title: Saradhambal Temple
Review: I recently visited this place.It is located near Tnagar.The temple is a small one yet quite beautiful and calm.Best time to visit is around evening five.

Name: rasa006
Title: Sringeri Saradha Peetam, in Chennai-T.Nagar, it is Sringeri Bharathi Vidyashramam
Review: This Sringeri Saradha Peetam new building,was built during 1990s.Earlier, it was a dilapidated building, at the same venue, few meters away from my residence. On the other side of my residence is Tirupathi Tirumala Dewasthanam Perumal temple. During early 1980s, in the old building, my friend's father's Sadhabishegam (80th birthday) was celebrated. Then, it was demolished and this new building  was constructed.  During Navarathri, Pongal, Aadi Pooram and other festival days, special abishegam and Alangarams are done for Goddess Sharadha Devi, Ganesh and Adi Sankarar. Special music concerts will be conducted during these special festival days.New building has a spacious hall for gathering, bhajans and music concerts. I am regularon these occasions. Recently on June 1st,2015 I visited during Viagasi Visagam day. This is not a temple, in the sense, no Rajagopuram, sanctum,etc. Only Dhyana Mandapam, meditation center and Poojas for Devi Sharadambal and Lord Ganesh. But the building constructed in such a way, one can pray even from the street, since it is at a high elevated platform.For Sringeri Bhagavathpada  Guruji, this is a MUST place to visit during dhanurmashyam.

Name: Mukul M
Title: Nice
Review: I am not a religious but my wife wanted to visit. It was a good place, with nice ambiance. The preachers were nice. Place was a bit crouded but I was able to get a good time there

Name: Sushme
Title: Historic, Elegant, Beautiful
Review: Wonderful place of pilgrimage. You will be skeptical when people say you will be provided free food. But go for it. Such a well maintained place with so much crowd.

Name: shankar k
Title: Peaceful temple!
Review: It is calm and peaceful. One can definitely find peace in the premises ..Best time to visit is early in the morning.

Name: Subramanian K
Title: Calm and quiet amazning temple
Review: The Sringeri Sarada Peetam Temple is located in the Venkata Narayana Road, T. Nagar (Thyagaraja Nagar), Chennai. The temple is around 1 km from the T. Nagar bus terminus. The Sringeri Sarada Peetam Temple is dedicated to Divine Mother Shakti as Devi Sarada (Saraswati) along with Sri Ganesha and Adi Shankaracharya. MainShrine includes , Devi as Sarada (Saraswati), Sri Ganesha and Adi Shankaracharya.

Name: SBakde
Title: A peaceful oasis in the midst of a city
Review: I find this more of a meditation hall than a temple. Though with a deity and the images of earlier gurdevs, it definitely is also a place of worship. I typically go during times when there is no likelihood of a puja/aarti.It is a clean, quiet and peaceful place for dhyana. You emerge de-stressed and relaxed.

Name: SowmyHaasini
Title: Place to rejuvenate your spiritual self
Review: Ideal for meditation. As soon as you enter the premises, you find your long lost peace and calm. One temple where you would want to spend more time at.

Name: RamyaKrishna
Title: Harmony
Review: You won't find great architecture here, however an amazing place of prayer and meditation. Just as you walk up the small flight of stairs, you are cut out of the traffic sound.A place i have frequented when in and around tnagar.

Name: snapshot2014
Title: Sringeri sardadha peedam temple T nagar
Review: Regular vistor. Good place for medidation. Very charming during during navaratri with kutchery etc.Suggest timing can be extended to atleat 9pm in the night and start say from 4.30 pm.Neat and good divine place

Name: wowvijay
Title: Calm and Serene - Goddess Sharadhamba in all her glory
Review: An average temple in case temple architecture is your area of interest. However, one of the few temples across India that showcases Sanatana dharma - the crux of the Hindu philosophy in all its glory. Established nearly 1200 years ago, this temple carved out of stone on the banks of river Tunga is nestled deep within the Western Ghats. Sringeri, a simple non-descript town whose economy runs on temple tourism is usually an important stop over for pilgrims on a religious south Indian tour. The temple is managed by the Sharadha Peetham of the Shankaracharya fame. The temple got a huge gopuram in 2014 and its campus is well kept. Lunch and Dinner in the form of prasadam meals is served free to pilgrims. Huge hygienic kitchens prepare piping hot rice served with rasam and sambar to thousands of pilgrims each day. Having the meal itself is an experience not to be missed. Kids will also love the huge fish that line the banks of river Tunga who flows nearby. Tourists can feed the fish biscuits, puffed rice and rice grains thought swimming is prohibited.One can spend a good 2 days to savour Sringeri.
