There is also the nearby waterfalls of Sirimane about 16 kms from Sringeri that kids and adults could enjoy. You can hire an auto for the trip

Name: meghashyam
Title: Maa Sarada
Review: A lovely temple for Sri Saradamba , the pure and serene atmosphere is great. An amazing place for meditation . A visit to this math will bring in a lot of peace to our minds . Tirumala tirupati devasthanams is just walkable from this math . Parking not allowed inside the math.

Name: Sangeetha Vikram
Title: Tranquil & Calm temple
Review: I have visited this temple located at T.Nagar with my friend on a Pradosham day. It was so peaceful & calm temple. Poojas were performed well.

Name: nsastri
Title: Great temple
Review: This is a must visit temple if you visit Udupi.  Bus/Taxi are available from Udupi.  Temperature in Sringeri is pleasant even in the worst summer time.Easy accomodation is available in Mutt guest house just oppostie the temple complex.Vidya-aarambham (Aksharabhyasa) is done inside the temple of Sharada ambaal.Great experience.

Name: muraliaryan62
Title: Shringeri peetam-Muralitharan Darshan
Review: Although I visited many times hennaed I had the opportunity only on 7.3.14 to visit and have the dar shan of this peetam. I felt to be in shringeri. Thanks to my sister Manjula

Name: Karthik R
Title: A place of peace and serenity
Review: The temple is open until 9 PM in the night and opens by 5 AM in the morning. We had a very good dharshan and some food in the temple. In the morning, we reached the temple for another quick dharshan by 5:45. We were the only devotees in the temple. So calm, serene and super dharshan of Lord Sharadamba, we walked around the temple peacefully, near the river and came out at 6:45. One gets great satisfaction on reaching the temple and praying to the Goddess.

Name: ghatam SURESH V
Title: Serene and divine!
Review: Gives great experience. Unlike the Saradha temple on Arcot road which is also managed by the same team, it has good accessibility for old and differently abled people.

Name: Aaqarsh Aiyyar
Title: Peaceful and Powerful
Review: I visited this temple on my wedding anniversary day. It is a great place to sit and meditate. The Goddess Sarada bestows love and happiness on every being and the blessed ones relax in her presence. This temple is maintained by the Sringeri mutt.  The temple is special for me and my wife as our horoscopes were exchanged here.

Name: Narayanan S
Title: A place to visit and pray
Review: The temple invites you to offer prayers and the atmosphere is calm. The temple is kept clean. The recent visit of Jagdguru Sankaracharya added to the glory of the temple

Name: Valavanur Natar... K
Title: An interesting place to visit The Nithyakalayana Perumal temple in Thiruvadanthai Chennai
Review: A marriage in my family gave me an opportunity to visit this unique temple with my wife where marriage is conducted for perumal daily .This Nithyakalayana Perumal temple with huge temple pond is  built  in dravidian  architecture anddates back to 2000 years and is situated  in Thiruvidandai  village in¬†Chennai,¬†off the scenic  coast of ECR , near KovalamBeach in Chengalpattu district¬†of Tamil Nadu.It was built by the¬† Pallavas¬†during the 7th century CE, with later additions being  made by the¬† Cholas¬†during the 11th century.It is dedicated to¬†Varaha, the boar¬†avatar¬†of the Hindu god¬†Vishnu and  glorifies  the¬†Naalayira Divya Prabandham, the early medieval¬†Tamil¬†canon of the¬†Alvar¬†saints from the 6th‚Äì9th centuries AD. It is one of the 108¬†Divya Desams¬†dedicated to Vishnu, who is worshipped as Nithyakalayana Perumal (Varaha) and his consort¬† Lakshmi¬†as Komalavalli Thayar.This temple follows¬† Tenkalai tradition of worship with four daily rituals including his wedding.The Hindu sage Kalava,  wanted Vishnu to marry his 360 daughters.Lord Vishnu in Varaha firm marries  the 360 daughters one per day during the course of the whole year. Since he is believed to marry maidens daily, he came to be known as Nithyakalyana Perumal (meaning the deity who marries for eternity).Indeed an interesting temple to visit !

Name: Bala Sundari
Title: Beautiful vishnu temple
Review: This temple is one of 108 divya desams on ECR road on the way to mahabalipuram from Chennai.We can get down on the main road and need to walk for 0.5 km to reach the temple.There is a temple tank opp to main temple and this is vishnu temple where vishnu is worshipped as Varaha with Goddess Lakshmi on his lap.This temple seems to have been constructed during pallava period and there are nice carvings on temple pillars.

Name: plpalani
Title: Divya desam
Review: This temple is of Nithya Kalyana Perumal and Komlavalli Thayar. People come here when done one is awaiting marriage .Perumal blesses and the marriage happens soon.

Name: Ranjani S
Title: A beautiful temple
Review: It's located on East Coast Road near Kovalam. Many renovations have taken place and the entry arch and temple have been bettered. It was once very neglected abd dilapidated, about two decades back, now it's been given a fresh lease of life. People who don't get married or have kids are asked to come here and do spl Poojas. And the blessing does work! So give it a visit

Name: Sivalingam Sankar
Title: Thiruvidanthai Nithya Kalyana Perumal / Adhi Varaha Perumal Temple
Review: A divine temple and one of the abode of 108 divya desam near Mahabalipuram in ECR road. Recently main sanctum opened after few years of Samrokshanam. Varaha murthy in one in rare form where holding Thayar(Mahalakshmi) in one lap rised by having leg over Adhiseshan. Lakshmi devi incarnated as 360 women and each day Perumal marries one girl leaving only 5 days left. So its called daily marriage bride (Nithya kalyana perumal). Place is so compact temple with andal, lakshmi and perumal sanithi. Parking places available.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Well maintained temple
Review: The temple is in the village thiruvidanthai off ecr on the way to mamallapuram from chennai built by pallavas and then well maintained by cholas and now under tnhrce.org. the main deity is lord vishnu in varadhar form worshipped as nithyakalyana perumal and his consort, lakshmi as komalavalli thayar.this is one of the 108 divya desams dedicated to lord vishnu.

Name: kush M
Title: your wish become a true
Review: Once im in Chennai with my wife. i went there . it was grate experience to me , im very lucky to visit in this temple and anyone who like to god please visit this place its one of wonderful place inchennai but you have to take long drive to reach there and there near no have good hotels if some one need to stay near to thirupathi i like to give an a option that hotel name ins PLR KANDY thirupathi... anyway if some one willing to go there please go in the morning

Name: plpalani
Title: Marriage wish
Review: This recently renovated Vishnu temple is centuries old and connected to the Pallava period.This is Vaishnavaite Diya dream.The Perumal here is in the form of Buvaraha tool and the Thayar is in his lap. Also the Kayan Perumal is in front of the main idol. There is separate shrine for a Komalavalli Thayar.,Andal Aranganathar,Aranganayaki amongst others.The belief is when one visits and pray for marriage this lord gives the boon

Name: Narasimhan G
Title: Super Parihara Sthal for getting married !
Review: This is a very uniquetemple for Lord VishnuHe is called Bhuvaraha PerimalThe Deity in sanctum sanctorum is praised to be very beautiful and loving..There is a ritual for unmarried boys/ and girls  performed in this temple to get married fast...Great boon for the aspiring ready-to-marry boys/girls !!

Name: shankar G
Title: Beautiful Temple on ECR !!!
Review: This temple is one of the divya desam and located about 30+ KM from Chennai on the ECR road, Temple is maintained well. Weekends might be crowded. But a peaceful place.

Name: Balasubramanian R
Title: Nithyakalyana Perumal temple
Review: Nithya Kalyana Perumal temple is situated in the village Thiruvidanthai which is nearer to Chennai and on the ECR (East coast road). People are in belief that those who are yet to marry will soon get married after the visit. Main deity is perumal and it is one of the 108 divyadesam. Car parking facilities are available.

Name: Umasudhan P
Title: A very simple and beautiful temple
Review: Thiruvidanthai Nithyakalyana Perumal temple is famous for marriage boons. Those who are not married yet, can pay a visit to this temple and fulfill your wishes. The temple is under construction now and be careful when you walk as there are lots of small stones that might injure your leg. The moolavar is closed for now and pooja is done only for utchavar idol. I have been to the temple 2 years back for marriage prayers (you will need to buy two flower garland and one is for Perumal and the other one is for you. You will need to keep the garland and return it to the temple once you are married). I got married in March 2017 and now back to the temple to deposit my flower garland. One of 108 Divya Desam and located strategically near ECR.

Name: RamGanesan
Title: A quiet Vishnu Temple
Review: This is one of the 108 divadesam temples.  It is located on the scenic ECR, Chennai to Mahabalipuram road.  Before the ECR road was built this temple was relatively unknown and not many visited.  With ECR now full of activity, a lot more people visit the temple.  A different type of temple architecture is deployed here in contrast to most other temples in Chennai.  People go to this temple if they are unmarried for long and wish to do so.  There is a large temple tank which has been cleaned and sand removed.  Water is therefore now available in the temple tank.  It is better to avoid weekends and special occasion days. Sometimes marriages also take place here. There is also a small marriage hall adjacent to the temple.  Very peaceful and quiet on weekedays.

Name: Karthik R
Title: One of the 108 Divya Desam temples
Review: Nithyakalayana Perumal temple in Thiruvidandai is around 15 kms before Mahabalipuram on the ECR. It is located on the right side of ECR when driving towards Mahabalipuram. It is one of the 108 Divyadesam dedicated to Vishnu. This temple is known for marriages to happen successfully. Temple time - 6 AM to 12 noon; 3 PM to 8 PM. The temple sambrokshanam happened in Jul 2018. It was very crowded when we visited.

Name: abrahamsuji
Title: Historic place
Review: Historic place, under renovation, close to East Coast Road. Food options not available in near vicinity.

Name: Haridhan
Title: Destination for marriage prayers
Review: Thiruvudanthai temple hosting Nithya Katayama perumalmis a famous destination for offering prayers for marriage.Ancient Temple & renovation is going on , kumbabishekam is scheduled 5Jul2018. Located in ECR road, after the kovalam beach (very near to muttukadu boat house).Lot of unmarried people will visit the temple worshiping the lord to seek his blessing to find their life partner.Timings 6.00am to 12.00pm & 3.00pm to 8.00pm.Rituals performed  : Buy two maala and Poona items and after pooja one maala will be returned and taken back home -shouldnot be thrown away. One has to come back after marriage with old maala and put in temple..We reached after 12, hence had to spend some time nearby places like muttukadu boat house- less than 3km, mayajaal which is under 15km from this place, also mahabalipuram is around 20km from this place, also crocodile Park(closed on monday) is near to this placeNote : No nice hotels near temple , hence you have to look out for one in ECR road

Name: Kavinkumar VJ
Title: Ancient temple with cultural significance
Review: This temple is located little away from east coast road between thiruvanmiyur and mamallapuram,constructed in the era of the pallava dynasty the temple signifies ancient culture.The significance of this temple lies on the rituals which are carried out for solving marriage related issues.

Name: meghashyam
Title: Sri bhumadevi sametha Sri Varahaswami temple
Review: A divya desam , Lord is majestic , mangalasasanam by Sri Thirumangai Alwar, Lord is almost fourteen feet in height , Maa Lakshmi temple is also exquisite, very very ancient temple . Sri Sthala Sayana perumal temple is also close by .

Name: Eswarkumar
Title: Good
Review: Hi this was very nice. I like this temple and i really enjoyed. Every one should see once this temple.

Name: sunandaladia
Title: Good temple
Review: It is a nice, famous and powerful temple. It is especially famous for helping to clear hurdles in getting married.

Name: Dr Murali K
Title: Sri Varahaa swamy with Mahalakshmi on his lap
Review: This temple being one among the 108 divya desams (holiest sites of vaishnavites) is just off the East Coast Road opposite to the Bay of Bengal. . .Weekday evenings are best to visit as there won't be any crowd at all, but weekends and holidays - u ought to be ready for long queues. . The main deity is carved out of a big rock and looks like he is on the wall. . This temple is also famous for marriage prayers. .

Name: Sai Prasad D
Title: Nthya Kalyana Perumal Temple (Thiruvidanthai)
Review: It is very old Temple & the temple is very calm. Located in ECR road, after the kovalam beach It is widely believed that unmarried people who visit this temple, will get married within a short period.we can see Lot of unmarried people will visit the temple worshiping the lord to seek his blessing to find their life partner.Timings 6.00am to 12.00pm & 3.00pm to 8.00pm and they strictly follow the timings.

Name: Mathivanan V
Title: One of the 108 Divya Desam temples in the Sri Vaishnava sect of Hinduism
Review: The temple was built by Pallava King. It is near the Mahabalipuram seashore.Approx 60 kms from Chennai.This temple is widely believed to bestow good luck to those wishing to get married, and help remove obstacles that prevent marriages.

Name: BittenByWanderlust
Title: temple near  the sea
Review: if you read other reviews for this temple you will get to know about the history and significance of this temple for those who to get married or newly married. . but this temple is much more than just that. its a beautifully preserved temple of the early pallava style, by the side of the busy ECR road, some 1 1/2 hrs away from Chennai city.. it is usually quiet except for weekends and important days in hindu calendar .and its close to kovalam and hotels like taj. visit this temple to get some inner peace and tranquilty and also admire the southindian architecture. you can combine day trips to places nearby to explore ecr road.

Name: voyageurdeInde
Title: Nithya Kalyana Perumal on ECR
Review: This is a temple famous for removing obstacles before marriage and one of the 108 divya desams. once the marriage is completed the couples will surrender back the marriage garland to  perumal as completing the prayer.

Name: Shiva S
Title: Visited this temple recently
Review: Visited this temple recently and found this an awesome place. It is very old and the temple is very calm. Located in ECR road, crossing the kovalam beach junction and it will be in the right side. I suggest to visit the place in day time so that you can enjoy and it will be safe too. Archana ticket cost around rs.5 & rs.55. Timings 6.00am to 12.00pm & 3.00pm to 8.00pm and they strictly follow the timings. The lord venkateswara inside the temple looks beautiful.

Name: Aaqarsh Aiyyar
Title: Wedding boons...
Review: One of the oldest temples (dating back to 8th Century) located at Tiruvidanthai in the East Coast Road, the temple is more famous for Nithya kalyana perumal who got married everyday in his life. The presiding deity is Adivaraha swamy and this is the 62nd temple of the 108 vaishnava divya desams. It is widely believed that unmarried people who visit this temple of wild boar incarnation gets the right alliance within a short period.

Name: Prashanth R
Title: Thiruvidanthai Nithya Kalyana Perumal Temple
Review: The Moolavar of thiruvidanthai temple is Thiru AdiVaraha Perumal or Nithya Kalyana Perumal.The legend has it that the lord married 360 daughters of the Kaalava Rishi, each day of the year. Since he married each of them one by one on each day of the year, he is called Nithya  Kalyana Perumal.It is one of the 108 Divya Desam temples. One can reach the thiruvidanthai temple from Adyar or Tambaram. Lots of AC Volvo buses ply between these destinations. The temple is located on route to pondichery, after the muttukadu boat houseOne could see lots of unmarried men and women worshiping the lord to seek his blessing to find their soul mate. This holy place is next to thirumanancheri in thanjavur in showering the grace to banish any difficulties in finding one's soul mate .We also visited Thirukalukkundram which is 35km from thiruvidanthai.

Name: Sud D
Title: Ancient Temple
Review: This ancient temple is one of the Paadal Petra Sthalams and is beautiful. Not as well known as some other old temples in Chennai, it is very special. The Gajaprashta Vimanam or Thoonganai Maadam is beautiful.

Name: Maheswari N
Title: Peaceful temple
Review: Thiruvalithayam. Located in the busy area of padi. Temple is 1000 years old. Guru sthalam . Good to visit on Thursday. Guru bhagavan prayed to lord shiva here. Murugar, Vishnu also inside the temple. Very peaceful temple. The garbagraham is round shaped which is very unique. Very near to Saravana stores padi.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Guru sthalam
Review: The temple is dedicated to the lord shiva worshipped as thiruvalleswarar in lingam form.and the goddess is jagathambal.the place is a guru sthalam and guru thakchanamoorthy prarthani is famous here.

Name: Muguncjb
Title: Famous temple in the locality
Review: Went to this temple recently.  Main sanctum deity is Lord Thiruvalleswarar and in adjacent sanctum is Goddess Jagathambigai. This temple is also a Guru sthalam at Chennai. Vishnu, hanuman, Sugreeva, Ram and his sons are said to worshiped at this temple. Devotees who can‚Äôt visit the Guru temple near to Kumbakonam can visit this temple and worship.From Padi flyover go towards Saravana stores and after the stores take 2nd left small cut road (temple sign board is there). Parking is available in front of the temple.

Name: Karthik R
Title: Ancient temple for Shiva
Review: This is a very ancient temple for Lord Shiva back by more than 1500 years - main sanctum deity is called Thiruvalleeswarar. This is one of the 276 padal petra sthalams of Lord Shiva. Temple open timings - 6:30 - 12 noon; 16:30 to 20:30. The temple is popular for Guru parikarams.This temple is behind the Padi Saravana stores.

Name: rasa006
Title: Thiruvalleswarar Temple at Padi in Chennai, famous Guru sthalam in Thondai mandalam.
Review: This temple visit was on my list for some time,even though it is just 12 to 13 kms from my residence, I did not visit this temple for long. Now I had intuition to visit this temple and we, family of 3 adults and 2 children went to this temple on 15.01.2018 Monday. It was morning around10.00 am and the temple was fairly crowded and many devotees are praying and paying their abeyance to Lord Thiruvalleswarar and Goddess Jagadambigai. Goddess  is very kind to HER devotees and take care of their well beings, it is believed here.Another important aspect in this temple is a separate Guru Bhagwan sanctum, Guru Bhagwan facing West, it is unique. Hence on Thursdays, devotees offer yellow vasthram to Lord Guru Bhagwan and pray. During Guru Peyarchi, special poojas were offered. This is Guru sthalam in Thondamandalam area, like Aalangudi in Tanjore district and cholamandalam area.On inner praharam, we can see Lord Vishnu, Sri Anjaneyar praying Siva Lingam and Lord Vinayagar in married pose. Those whose marriages are delayed,pray this Lord Vinayagar who bless them for early marriage. Vishnu Durga is another attraction here and on Tuesdays and other days during ragukalam, special poojas are performed. A must visit temple for those living near Chennai.

Name: Arunkumar
Title: Sri Tiruvalleswarar temple ( Padi Sivan Temple )
Review: Excellent temple..! Never Ever MissThe temple is open from 6.30 a.m. to 12.00 a.m. and from 4.30 p.m. to 8.30 p.m.Car parking Available @ INR 20

Name: RAMAKRISHNAN K
Title: OLDEST SHIVA TEMPLE
Review: The temple is considered as one of the oldest temple.The temple presiding deity is Shiva and Karpakambal .The temple is famous since the deity GURU - where people pray for children who are going to school for better success in education.otherwise it is not very far away and spacious for evening dharshan.

Name: Angel_Traveler444
Title: Beautiful Old Temple
Review: This Temple is a very old temple located in Padi, Chennai. Walkable distance for Padi Lucas TVS. Famous for its Guru Sathalam. The temple has gone lot of renovations and changes in the past few years. There is also enough parking space in the front. Be aware of the beggars near the entrance there are too many and they keep coming around if they know you are new to that place.

Name: Sarannian
Title: Guru stalam in Chennai
Review: The temple is in Padi , take a first left after Saravana stores , Padi while going towards Ambattur . After around 500 mts , there would be a Ganesh temple of the left and opposite would be the Sivan temple . The temple is a very ancient temple and is generally crowded all days . With Thursday having the highest crowd , as there is a separate Guru Baghavan Sanithi . The temple main deity is Sivan and Ambal . Apart from which Pillayar , murugar , Navagraha , Durga , Bairavar , nayanmar and several Lingam Sanathi 's  are in the temple .

Name: Padmanabhangagan
Title: Padi Siva Temple - Pardhosha poojai every pardhosam day
Review: Very nice temple, for every pardhosam pooja is performed for the Nandhi.it starts at 4.30PM evening only on Pardhosham nalla.and after this Shiva will be decorated with flowers.

Name: Jothilingam E
Title: Famous Guru Temple in chennai
Review: One should not miss this temple,when you visit chennaiThis temple is near padi junction and easily approachable,either from anna nagar west or from maduravoil by pass road.This is lord Guru temle and special on Thusdays

Name: Sangeetha Vikram
Title: Thiruvallithayam - A Guru Stalam & Paadal petra stalam
Review: Myself along with my mom visited Sri Thiruvalleswarar temple at Padi last sunday. We got down at Korattur station and took a mini bus to reach the temple.The main deity of the temple was Thiruvalleeswarar, the other deities are Jagadambika amman, Navagrahas, Guru Bhagwan etc., Poojas are performed so well for Navagrahas, it was also represented as Guru Stalam.It also belongs to one of the famous 275 Paadal petra stalams. Had a wonderful dharshan at the temple.

Name: mnshanthi
Title: Sri Tiruvalleswarar temple, Padi, Chennai.
Review: One of the oldest temple 1000-2000 years old, One must visit, Peaceful, Jupiter (guru) Guru Bhagwan is seen here facing towards west. The main deity is known as Tiruvalleeswarar and He is facing east and to the right is the shrine for the female deity Jagathambikai. Ambal is seen here facing towards south

Name: kvin1978190
Title: Tiruvalleswarar Temple
Review: One of the Oldest temple in chennai. Very pleasant, neatly maintained. It is just 5 mins walkable from the main road to temple premises. From the Padi junction towards Ambatur before korattur signal on left side padmavathi street just 5 mins walk to the temple.

Name: Begaraaj S M
Title: Blissfully Brilliant Guru Ji !!! ‚ù§ ‚ù§ ‚ù§
Review: When we go to an astrologer, somtimes they say Guru is weak in your horoscope, So,you have to go to Guru Bhavans temple, don't worry, Padi Sivan Temple is ‚ÄúGuru‚Äôs Stalam, situated very close to Anna Nagar west and very easily accessible from all parts of Chennai via City bus.Every week I am going to this wonderful temple, today 12.11.15 Thursday at 10.30am I went to this temple and experienced the blissful Almighty, we can feed the dove‚Äôs inside the temple complex with the grains sold there.Must visit for all age groups when you are in Chennai, please experience this experience for the experience sake.

Name: Soumicruise
Title: NIce place to pray, visit for prathosham
Review: Fantastic temple. One of the old temples still to be visited in Chennai. The place carries history of the temple which is a very good read (written in tamil though).

Name: garhwaliya
Title: Just like other temple: Not worjth
Review: If you had visited other temple in south India then no need to go this place. This place is just like other temple. I went there and spend some 2-3 hour. If you have ample time then only go. THis is peaceful place.

Name: ramayana2013
Title: PADI GURU BHAGAVAN
Review: This temple is at padi near chennai near t v s.This is about 10 k m from chennai.The temple is known as thirvelleswar temple. This is one of the oldest temple. Guru sthalam.Thai , kartikai is famous. Another famous near by temple is pattavarthamman temple. Padal stalam.Jagathambika is the amman. Separate shrine for somas kandar, murugan, valli devayanai. A calm and quite temple.

Name: meghashyam
Title: Guru Sthalam
Review: Guru sthalam , of the navagraha temples situated in and around chennai this temple is dedicated Lord Shiva worshipped by planet Guru , the Sri Dakshinamurthy shrine is beautiful here .Parking facilities are available .

Name: Baskar_Raman
Title: Beautiful temple
Review: A very big and old temple in Chennai, this one gives a serene setting and great peace of mind. A must visit place

Name: madhu507
Title: Huge temple
Review: This has been my favourite temple since childhood, locating this place for new ppl will be tuff..but worth it.. i visit this place to relax my mind

Name: kevinjohn1991
Title: Ancient Siva Temple!!!
Review: This temple is located around 12 kms from the Chennai Central Railway Station in a place called Padi. The main deity here is Tiruvalleeswarar. I would recommend an early morning visit to really feel the soul of the temple.

Name: Ramesh L
Title: guru bhagavan temple
Review: A popular poet Thirungyana Sambandar has composed hymns at this temple.  The sanctum is semi-circular in shape at the back. This type of architecture is called Gaja Brishta Vimana or Thoonganai Maadam in Tamil as this resembles the back of a sleeping elephant. The main deity is known as Tiruvalleeswarar. To the right of him is the shrine for the female deity Jagathambikai. There is a separate shrine for Guru (Jupiter) - one of the Navagrahas - in the eastern outer corridor and this temple is also considered as a Guru Parikara Sthalam. Guru Bhagwan is seen here facing towards west.This temple is located at Padi in Chennai (12 Kms from Chennai Central Station) and is well connected by town buses from every part of Chennai city. One has to get down at Lucas TVS bus stop at Padi and walk ahead for about 100 meters to reach Padavattamman Temple. The perpendicular road opposite to Padavattamman Temple leads us to Tiruvalleeswarar temple.

Name: Sathya M
Title: Relaxing to mind
Review: 1000 years moreover this temple stand like  a king awesome place and thondaimandalam guru temple thats the specialty off temple

Name: RAMG
Title: Ancient Shiva temple- Padi sivan Temple
Review: You have to travel through narrow lane to reach the temple, suddenly it opens up and you have very ancient Shiva temple. Amazing experience, you should visit this temple early morning to experience the serenity of the place. Nice to do mediation and feel Shiva here.  This is also called GurusthalamMoolavar	:Tiruvalleswarar, Tiruvalitham Udaya NayanarAmman / Thayar	:	JagadambikaThala Virutcham	:	Padiri, KondraiTheertham	        :	Bharadwaj TheerthamAgamam / Pooja	:	KameekamOld year	                :	1000-2000 years oldHistorical Name	:	TiruvalithayamCity                  	:	Padi, TiruvalithayamDistrict               	:	ChennaiState                	:	Tamil NaduThe temple is open from 6.30 a.m. to 12.00 a.m. and from 4.30 p.m. to 8.30 p.m.	 Temple is praised in the Thevarm hymns of Saint Tirugnanasambandar.   This is the 21st Shiva Temple of Thondai region sung in Thevaram hymns.

Name: Emma W
Title: Just weird
Review: Terribly run-down mall with half the shops shut down or empty. A strange smell all over the place and the shopkeepers kept nagging us to come inside. Had to back away from using the bathrooms as they were the worst so far in India. Creepy place, not worth visiting

Name: Ajino Singh
Title: Sponsor Spencer Plaza! a little bit fasta people!
Review: Spencer Plaza- used to be Chennai's most famous shopping mall- It was the first one in that smart city to host millions of lovers, events, families- still it's open to host many such precious moments in people's life. The livelihood of the shop owners entirely depends upon the young customers, they have unique products and the shopping experience entirely, was new to me. All pocket friendly products- except the Jammu & Kashmir shops- despite their price, I loved their product, they are fancy, unique and alluring. I think they need our support. Show some love!

Name: Hooray H
Title: Simple Mall
Review: Apparently the first Mall in Chennai. We only went in because it was near the Hotel & we were looking for some sports shoes.Lots of cheap clothes etec available but nothing decent.A very nice coffee place though- Kaffi. Mind the pavements etc can easily fall over.

Name: Michael Anbumani
Title: Oldest Plazain India
Review: Amazing Old Architecture. I was told that Spencer Plaza is one of the first Mall in India, especially in Chennai. There is an extension to this Mall. Very convenient to us as we were staying in La Woods Hotel just opposite of this Mall. You can do a good shopping here though some of the items are a bit expensive. There is many restaurants inside, especially Saravana restaurant (Veg.) very popular with tourists.

Name: Mohammed khan
Title: Shopping üõí
Review: Very big Spencer plaza for shopping üõç canter , many shop and quality colts and delicious food cod, enjoy the trip

Name: Rajeshwari
Title: Interesting thing is there is a Virtual Gaming now
Review: I recently had a look at the mall but it now almost looks with the office structure setup. Most of the shops have gems, clothing, mobile cover shops. But interestingly, by mistake, I stepped into Phase 1 and found a corner shop which has Virtual Reality Gaming setup(VR Gaming Hub). Was shocked to see, the setup is nice and you can try once you go in there.

Name: Ragavendhran N
Title: Nice place to hangout
Review: A nice place to hangout with friends, and to cool off some leisure time. Various shops and outlets. Try third floor food area

Name: #amosamiyanayeküéß
Title: üèöÔ∏è
Review: one of the oldest mall in chennai... just visited to find out my old memories, now a days it's almost doing to down don't know about to reason behind but some times it was used to my favourite sport for shopping dinning and varieties of gift items üéÅüíù

Name: Existdarrus
Title: Modern Ruins
Review: Probably one the oldest large malls in South India - it is a shadow of its former glory. No more Landmark, Westside etc. Barely a couple of restaurants. Just an office block and few small eateries and cheap clothes stores. But still an iconic place nonetheless.

Name: Harishankar
Title: Visit
Review: Not much shops for shopping. And also not much visiter are there. Although this place is Very old and have many floors but only there or four floor are occupied.

Name: Dr Javed Rasheed
Title: Renovated and Refurnished
Review: There were two landmarks in Madras that I would love to visit as a kid and they were the :More Market The Spencer Plaza Having being born 10 years after India attained its Independence, I have been fascinated by the British architecture and the colonial structures that still exist in some places in our country like clubs,bungalows and buildings and this red building has always fascinated me when I was a kid.The history of this building is :Spencer Plaza was built in 1863‚Äì1864, established by Charles Durant and J. W. Spencer in Anna Salai, then known as Mount Road, in the Madras Presidency. The property originally belonged to Spencer & Co Ltd. Spencer & Co opened the first department store in the Indian subcontinent in 1895. It had over 80 individual departments. After a few years, Eugene Oakshott, owner of Spencer's, shifted the department store to a new building, which was an example of Indo-Saracenic style of architecture. The building was designed by W. N. Pogson. In 1983, the original building was destroyed in a fire.The present Spencer Plaza was constructed on the same site, measuring about 10 acres, and was opened in 1991.Spread across a million square feet built in three phases with parking space for 800 cars, the plaza is a major hangout for the people of Chennai. The mall was developed by Mangal Tirth Estate Limited in January 1993.It is said that the work started in 1985.One of the most sought after properties once about 38 years ago where all the main shops and showrooms were located and slowly there was a gradual deterioration in maintaining this place and then it became deserted and had a gloomy look and I was very disappointed to see this place with pigeons flying all around and I was wondering what happened to this place that I once used to visit and had such fond memories ?? Slowly it has been renovated and it‚Äôs trying to regain its past glory !!Dr.Javed Rasheed

Name: rradice123
Title: A throwback mall that's worth the visit
Review: I've come to Spencer's for years and it has held onto it's character as a mall of secret byways on each floor.  You can fins almost anything here at best prices.  Merchants will haggle the first price offered, but don't insult them by trying to get something for too low a price.  They need to make a profit and remember they will not agree to a price unless they are making some profit.  Clothing, artifacts and art pieces (if you hunt and know what you are hunting for), furniture, food, +++ can be found here.  I don't enjoy the modern malls in India as much as Spencer's  and I hope it continues for a long time to come.

Name: Gopi T
Title: Dream mall
Review: One of the oldest mall in India and dream mall from my childhood ,good place to buy cheap and best only thing is management can focus of cleaning and need attractive offer to bring more crowd .

Name: beckyjake123
Title: New facelift, new look
Review: When  I visited Spencer Plaza a couple years ago, it was dark, gloomy, and tired. With all the new malls in town, it appeared Spencer‚Äôs Plaza was a ‚Äúhas been‚Äù place. All I can say is this visit was a big ‚ÄúWow‚Äù! Many of the same businesses are there; but it‚Äôs like a fresh coat of paint made it look new. It still doesn‚Äôt have the glam of the Forum Mall, but this is the best place to find Indian crafts & souvenirs for a reasonable price. We had a bite to eat at Three Mithai,  & even found Mysore Pak, a favorite sweet to carry back to the USA.  Next time I need souvenirs to bring home, I‚Äôll make sure to stop at Spencer Plaza.

Name: Michael Anbumani
Title: Nice Mall
Review: This Mall is quite old and still very popular. Good location at the main road itself. Transportation is very easy and near to the La Woods hotel. However not many people patronize the mall. You can buy many things from here. Very nice, cool and comfortable to walk about.

Name: Praveenop
Title: A great Mall which has fallen into hard times due to trouble from its own tenants
Review: Not many know this fact. Spencer Plaza is India's first ever mall. During its hey days during the 1990s and 2000 it was a place to be seen in. It has the best shops, book stores, restaurants etc and was a haven for Indian handicrafts and products. The tourists simply loved this place for the variety it offered. During those times life in Chennai revolved around the Mall but slowly things started to decline. I would blame the shop keepers and tenants who slowly started to keep their wares outside their shops and showrooms, my friend has a shop there and he says that many of the tenants would not pay their maintenance. Due to lack of regular maintenance and acrimony among shop owners the Mall could not keep up their quality of maintenance and now hardly anyone goes to the mall. All the good anchor stores moved out and left the bad apples behind. Sad that such a great place has to die a sad. slow and painful death.

Name: Hari Shankar
Title: Good Old mall
Review: It is one of the oldest shopping mall in Chennai. Branded clothing shop are less compare to the other malls, still it's worth giving a try and buy clothes for affordable price. I visited Spencer plaza to check camera accessories, there is 4-5 camera shops. It has Domino's piza and McDonald's as well.

Name: JEEVA
Title: Time pass
Review: A building is old but u feel very nice inside mallWhen compare to other mall this has very limited store and infrastructure U can spend more time

Name: niki dee
Title: Mall not worth a visit
Review: One of the earliest malls in Chennai and now has lost its charm. Has a few eat outs and money exchangers and carpet stores. However, there is proper food court. It is more of a place where there are few enterprises and offices. Not worthy enough for shopping when there are much better options in the vicinity.

Name: Rathikaprashanna
Title: Horrible condition and extreme hassling
Review: From what we‚Äôve been told, this was the first plaza/mall built in Chennai approximately 50 years ago.  Like many structures in Chennai, this place has not been up-kept and so it‚Äôs outdated, and the the stores in there don‚Äôt have any new fashion trends.  The most annoying part is the hassling.  You can‚Äôt walk by a store without the owners continuously hassling you to come into their store.  The quality of products is poor and outdated.  Don‚Äôt waste your time.  You would rather visit Phoenix mall.

Name: thomassam
Title: mall has lost its charm..
Review: one of the best mall in chennai.but not maintained properly these days.very spacious mall.lots of shops r closed.less crowded

Name: TrailBlazer581787
Title: Practice your negotiation skills
Review: This is the oldest 'mall' in Chennai. Lots of traditional (old style) Indian shops with a not so modern touch, but the structure of the mall is worth a visit in itself. You can spend hours in there, both shopping and eating. Be prepared for all the  'barker's who tell you they have the best pashmina's (don't expect real ones) and anything else you may need. Once you're in a shop, it is expected you will buy, so don't enter just to have a look.. We found some beautiful jewelry, including antique rings. But as a general rule : don't pay too much (that beautiful ruby ring, is probably not a real one) have some tea and enjoy the bartering, which you absolutely have to do to get a good price.

Name: Mukta2016
Title: Spencer Plaza
Review: Spencer Plaza was once a major shopping mall in Chennai in the late 1990s and early 2000. A recent visit here revealed that the mall has not quiet kept up with the times. A fairly decent shopping area but doesn't have all the popular brands.

Name: URP70
Title: dud and dead
Review: I had visited this place 20 years ago and it was flourishing so i had great expectations. but now all you see is line of shops selling t-shirts and shorts from Tirupur. Spencer plaza has lost all its glory. Didn't do any shopping in Chennai this time so don't know much but this place must be the place to buy fake "branded" t shirts and track pants in chennai.didn't find anything else to buy here, nor even interesting food outlets here.give this place a skip.

Name: Tejinder S
Title: Deteriorated
Review: I had first been here in early 1990s. The place was an attraction. However, over the years, it has deteriorated in terms of shops, crowd and most importantly maintenance. Dark dingy areas, humid with no whitewash. Needs urgent attention. May be better to walk a mile for the Express Avenue.

Name: Srinivasanb2001
Title: A big shopping mall perhaps first of its kind.
Review: This is in a busy road called Anna Salai  previously known as Mount Road. All types of  goods house hold articles and other utilities , clothing etc are available as there are many shops in the premises and a good basement parking  for vehicles is available , The goods sold are a bit costlier . However quality may be good

Name: arvindgodavarty
Title: Old is gold
Review: This was the first ever mall tht was available in Chennai close to 18yrs bck....the hustle bustle...the crowd was superb...now it has lost its old charm...but still people visit this place...

Name: Rajesh K
Title: One stop shop
Review: A amazing place for anybody to spend time eating and shopping.  Though there are numerous Malls in Chennai city this oldest mall offers everything from branded wears to local wears in a most moderate cost. Food, salon, mobile accessories, clothes, üï∂ sunglasse, shoes. A complete place with lots to shop and eat. This mall does not have a cinema hall.  But it's got all that you need in a cheaper price. Oldest mall in Chennai. Still a hot place for normal folks to spend a good evening.

Name: AnanthJay
Title: Oldest Mall in Chennai
Review: This is one of the oldest shopping mall in Chennai.  It is one of the shopping iconic building in Chennai.  You should be a good bargainer to get a good deals in some of the shops.

Name: ricshanshibly1986
Title: Famous mall in Chennai
Review: landmark mall in chennai. whenever i go chennai i used to visit spencer plaza. we used to allocate one full day for spencer plaza shopping. food court will give you more food options.

Name: diva k
Title: Vanishing from people's eyes
Review: After the inauguration of express avenue this mall has seen its downfall start to begin. Noe landmark stores also moved out of this mall due to poor patronage from public. Lack of maintenance and upgrade has made people to go for other malls.

Name: jayareddy
Title: One of early days shopping mall
Review: Nice and well located very old shopping mall in center of city and accessible with good facilities for real or window shoppers.

Name: Raghul J
Title: Old Mall
Review: One of the Old Mall in Chennai, with lots of shops in it.Parking Facility Available,Shree Mithai,Saravana Bhavan and Some of the Eateries are there to have food with your loved ones..also located in Main Place....

Name: Rucha121
Title: Grand Ol'Mall of Chennai
Review: Centrally located on Anna Salai, this huge mall has 3 phases and it boasted of big brand names before newer malls came up. Lack of maintenance and big brands resulted in poor patronage oflate. Earlier, it used to be abuzz with lot of games, fun and activities. It would be difficult to find parking space.. now, even on weekends, once can find parking spot of choice..

Name: MariahManuel
Title: A beautiful quaint mall
Review: This is one of the oldest malls in Chennai but dont be so quick to dismiss it. Its a beautiful quaint mall with a tonne of shops offering beautiful pashmina shawls, Kashmiri & Indian artifects, kurtis and sarees. Good spot for bargaining and buying in bulk. Shop assistants are very helpful and even send your clothes for tailoring then and there if there are minor adjustments to be made

Name: WVR7933
Title: One of the Oldest Mall of Chennai City
Review: Spencer Plaza is one of the oldest Malls of the Chennai City. Right from the construction periods, I used to visit this famous Mall. But now it lost its value... That is because so many new malls with latest facilities to the customers had come in.. Further this Mall Spencer is not being well maintained... Some of the big shops had already closed and gone to different new malls. Needs improvement to compete with the New Malls.

Name: Jerry
Title: An iconic maze
Review: One of the oldest malls in city. A lot of shops but confusing directions and no help makes the shopping tiring. No mall map, not well maintained areas make it more worse. Needs a lot of improvement. Food options are good and reasonably priced.

Name: StephenThomas7
Title: An old mall.
Review: This mall was once a famous one in Chennai. However when new malls came to the city that couldn't keep up with the pace. They are not developing the mall. Its still the old Spencer Plaza. They could have done some renovation.However, since there are many malls in Chennai with better ambiance and facilities Spencer Plaza has to do something different.

Name: Aaqarsh Aiyyar
Title: Good old mall
Review: I visited this mall after a long time with my son on a Sunday afternoon. The mall hasn't changed much and it was relatively crowdless.

Name: M V M
Title: A lost world..one would feel in lost alone in island
Review: This was one the finest malls, unfortunately now only the structure is remaining and very few shops. All of the closed or moved out.if u want to look around you can walk but if time is a constraint then suggest not to go to this place.

Name: ACSquare
Title: An old mall with traditional items
Review: It's one of the oldest malls in India perhaps certainly the oldest in chennai. It does not have the fancy shops one sees in the new malls . However the place has lots of shops for kashmiri goods, indian traditional gift items including carpets, shawls, jewellery and marble items. Could not find a good food corner though , however there was a place for north Indian sweet shop (food was really good ) and a small chat and tea place.

Name: Anastasia B
Title: Old nice mall
Review: A big old mall in which u can find Lots of clothes and souvenir shops. This mall used to be the only one in Chennai, now u can find others which are bigger and offer more options. But u can still get good bargains on clothes. There‚Äôs only a few stalls of food there, u can find them inside the small corners.

Name: Radhi C
Title: Bargains on leather goods
Review: Old shopping center. No ambience and not modern but the best leather goods at Aalient Indian Leather Boutique. Very well priced leather jackets, bags, pants, etc. Owner Iman and salesman Sabeer are most pleasant and helpful. Take real hood care of their clients. Very good gemstones, branded sportswear, pushminas, handicrafts, Indian garments, etc. Must make a trip here for a bargain!

Name: YashiR25
Title: For the experience of Local Chennai market
Review: Located close to Express Avenue, one can get pashminas, silk stoles, embroidered kurtas at a reasonable price, provided you have great bargaining skills. Starting from a needle to antique bronze statues, you get everything here.And when you are hungry, McDonald's and Sarvana Bhawan are there to satisfy your hunger. Good place to spend sometime but you shall not expect it to be a Modern Mall.

Name: Anusuya D
Title: crowdy old shopping mall
Review: nowadays, small shops are more inside the shopping mall. very crowdy shopping mall. noeadays it is somewhat outdated. so many small shops with reasonable prizes.

Name: worldwomantourist
Title: Oldest shopping mall in Chennai
Review: Spencer plaza is the oldest shopping mall in Chennai. It has eight floors. There are many service centers for all electronic products. It was built during British period and then it was reconstructed in 1985. The place is much crowded and very famous among the local people.

Name: gita73
Title: Outdated. ..old. ..dusty..
Review: Visited this place in October...whole place was dimly lit and many shops closed cos of diwali. ..Whole place was quiet but few shops were still opened  selling sarees,wood carvings,scarves and chudithars. ..Place is a bit outdated compared to the other malls. ..

Name: Vladyrom1
Title: Authentic shopping mall in Chennai
Review: For me - one of the best place to do authentic shopping in Chennai. A lot of craft shops. with reasonable prices, and all shopkeepers are ready to bargain about the prices. Actually, in some shops you can make 50% discounts, provided one goes around before to check out prices in other shops. Don't agree for the first offer. So, if one is looking for Chennai souvenirs, the best place.

Name: RAMAKRISHNAN K
Title: Famous oldie mall
Review: Though, with changing scenarios the mall would have improved upon but shoppers may not like this small shops like Palika bazaarBut many people thong here because it is value for minu and some cheap items can be boughFleeting customers is possible be careful in some shops

Name: united87
Title: Lost its charm
Review: Used to be the most popular shopper mall in Chennai but now totally outdated.. while many malls came up across chennai, this one stood still and didn't keep upto modern times.. many shops inside are vacant and that by itself is a very negative sign..

Name: Arun
Title: Chennai‚Äôs first famous mall
Review: Chennai‚Äôs first big A/C mall; Escape owned by Sathyam Cinemas is a very famous movie destination for Chennai people. The theaters are well maintained and provide you a very good movie experience. The chaat sold by them are so good and you will find different varieties of chaats in here.

Name: Satya
Title: Nice mall
Review: It's very big mall for any type of shopping....it's very big mall with all facility... only thing is confusing of shop search and the return way for new people.have to develop way marking for free view

Name: BananaLu
Title: Famous but getting empty...
Review: I used to go there to shop in Landmark but even this one closed down and in April I felt that it was becoming like a hunted place... There are less and less shops... It's still fun to go to see an old local mall but in the end I shopped much more in Express avenue which is at a walkable distance...

Name: Balakrishnan I
Title: One of the Famous Landmarks in Chennai
Review: This place still retains its old world charm. Once you step insidde, you are confused for choices of shops that you want to visit. Just a maze of shops criss crossing each other. One can comfortably spend 4-5 hours easily in this place. You need to walk a lot within the area...

Name: Joji J
Title: "a prominent landmark and one of the best shopping malls in the city"
Review: Spencer Plaza at Anna Salai is a shopping mall cum office complex spread over about 10 acres of land with all modern facilities. The Spencer Plaza was originally constructed in 1863 which was destroyed in a fire and the new building was opened in 1991. The Mall has sufficient parking in the basement and two other floors, the shops are in first, second and third floors and offices in fourth and seventh floors of the eight storied building. Outlets of all major Indian and International brands are there in the mall and banks like HSBC, ABN AMRO, American Express, Citibank are functioning. The Food Court has outlets of many restaurant chains and restaurants serving Indian, Chinese, Continental dishes and outlets for Icecreams, juices, shakes etc. The Mall is perfect for purchases and dining since almost all items are available in the mall, has sufficient parking, the interiors are airconditioned and is a way out from the scorching atmosphere, and the kids will also enjoy since they too have option to spend their time.

Name: Narayanan S
Title: The name that ruled the roost
Review: Spencers - when I was young was synonymous with soda water and tonic water - add ons for whiskey and gin.. Over the years it grew out to be a super market and a mall. Probably they were the first to bring shopping mall concept in Chennai. Till a few years back - probably till Express Avenue and other malls oped up Spencers used to be a crowded place with many students hanging around I still like the place

Name: Shareen Laskar
Title: Cheap and best
Review: If you wanted to buy cheap then this is the best place. However quality is not bad even if it is cheap. Most of the escalator and lifts are in shabby condition due to age. I suggest haggle while shopping.

Name: Anusuya D
Title: very crowdy shopping mall
Review: nowadays, itbecomes very crowded with small shops. but we can spend very good there by wandering in that  crowded place

Name: Akthar H
Title: Busy life..
Review: I have just came back from South India, I been there for two weeks business trip. I enjoyed the local food Masala Dosa and I wanted to buy some Indian souvenir for my family.. I been to the shopping centr called Spencer Plaza.. found few souvenirs Shops but I didn't like any. Most of the store keepers r pushing me to buy or some others r nt a fix prices. Finally I found a shop called HOUSE OF CASHMERE, I found some classic Cashmere and colourful silk scarfs.. best prices, I got my complete Christmas shopping here... thanks guy's, see u again.

Name: RAMAKRISHNAN K
Title: All in one shopping mall
Review: The plaza is located on mount road and close to Devi theatre and opposite to cosmopolitan clubThe plaza is mall which is having three phases of shops in two floorsAll shops are small small and is unlike of other shopping malls in chennaiThe hotel Saravana Bhavan and srimithai are note able restaurantsYou may get lots of cloth items. This is like DELHI Palika bazaar under ground that is next to Connaught PlaceOne may love to visit this place if u do not mind bargaining / pulling shop keepers/ moderate quality items too with good shops :/

Name: sga65
Title: Past its glory
Review: Perhaps it was once the only Mall in Chennai, but today its old, and its odd to see antique shops jostling with cheap apparel shops.

Name: joedavid10
Title: Old Shopping mall... need to change with the times
Review: Experience will be better if the shops are a bit mor clean and the shop keepers dont occupy common places to display their wares..

Name: Bobby201
Title: RUN DOWN PLACE
Review: Old structure with defective lifts and escalators, most of the shops have closed down and brand shops are shifted to Express Mall.Avoidable place.

Name: arasu s
Title: Lacks entertainment
Review: Old plaza, needs to reinvent to infuse enthusiasm to the visitors. Need more attention to entertainment and excitement.can do better..

Name: vignesh d
Title: Its Obsolete now
Review: In old days its the only shopping mall and a landmark place around it. Now its lost its crowd, one good bar inside it and can get good bread omlets from a small shop.

Name: ali a
Title: Good Place
Review: This is one of the best market in Chennai . Beautiful location and very peaceful place for lovers, family and friends

Name: Happygolightly1
Title: Not much to cheer anymore
Review: Eight years after my last visit, I popped in on a Friday late morning en route to the Victoria Technical Institute. Was my memory playing tricks with me, I asked myself as I wandered lonely as a cloud around, passing many, too many, empty shops. Shops sell a wide and often nice selection of the usual fare of shawls, jewellery, elephants carved of wood, soapstone etc. It still is a good place to find cheerful souvenirs that won't blow your budget.

Name: sathish v
Title: Lost love!
Review: Spencer plaza is no more the same one i fell in live with during late 90s and 2000s before citycentres,all malls came and took the shine and attention. I still visit everytime i visit chennai to just relish the old days. Music world,landmark  - miss those old days. All the old shops are no more there or atleast most of them have shifted.  There are shops selling all kinds of stuff from antics,dress,shoes to electronics. U need more energy than money to walk through the different phase of spencer plaza.

Name: kaspeach
Title: No Cash, No shopping
Review: We went here but not much was open, but this could have been because of the currency difficulties. Beware of the roads they are very difficult to cross, due to heavy traffic and crazy driving.

Name: 48aravindh
Title: Oldest mall in chennai...!!!
Review: It is one of the oldest mall in chennai, though many bug malls are dotting the chennai city, still it didnt loose its shine, but they need to renovate to international standards, I am personally attached to this mall, the mall has a good ambience and is located in the busy stretches of chennai, it houses many foreign brands and local brands and now it houses many back offices...  But Spenser plaza should be renovated as soon as possible...!!!

Name: Aravind J
Title: Business Visit
Review: One of the oldest shopping malls of chennai. It has lost its charm by a greater extent and seeing lots of business establishments closed down their operations.  But it's still the place for lots of youngsters to hang out . Keep going .

Name: SaurabhNangia
Title: Oldest mall in India built in 1863!
Review: This is the oldest mall in india which was built during Britisher's time.I went there to have food in Sarvana Bhawan which offered tasty food.Nice, old decor of mall but looks interesting to visit oldest mall.

Name: Guillex13
Title: Inexpensive shopping, get ready
Review: This is the place to shop, is a large old fashion shopping, we arrived here because someone knew this place, a first could it be a little claustrophobic cause you'll have many people trying to get to their shop, be nice, people is friendly and good, they're just trying to sell. The environment is ok, remember to bargain every thing. Good deals and nice things. If you came as us to Oneness University mostly of the clothes you'll need you could find it here

Name: VIVEK V
Title: An Old School Mall
Review: Most of the shops were small and during my visit the big outlets like Westside weren't open. There were food outlets spread out and the carnival food court wasn't that large as they said with only a handful of outlets.

Name: Somil A
Title: Chennai's local market in mall
Review: Good place for ordinary hangouts...shops like we have in palika bazaar, delhiCarnival food court good food servedSmall local shops of arts, fashion, garments, mobile shop, etc

Name: Javed M
Title: Old Mall
Review: This is really an old Mall nothing really great here , if you want to go to a modern mall then I would recommend the Express Avenue ( very close ) or the Phoenix Mall ( a bit further away )

Name: Krishna G K
Title: The first mall in Chennai
Review: As far I can remember my childhood days, Spencer Plaza is the predecessor of all big malls in ChennaiNot just that, the shopping mall is huge, bigger than most of today's malls and is a shopper's destination for various goods - clothes, arts and collections, sports items, video and gaming accessories, you name it you get it hereNow that other malls have gained popularity, this  one has faded, but, I still like going to the mall and taking a stroll around to explore the areaI like this mall the most, actually :-)

Name: bvikasnanu1810
Title: unbelievable  place
Review: nice  place  to  spend  time  whole  day  , awesome   quality  of   product  ,  mall  contain  things  from  A to Z , nice  atmosphere

Name: fivestarholidays
Title: Lost Glory
Review: Amongst the earliest malls in Chennai but bad maintenance coupled with opening of swanky new malls led to its downfall.Has a very run down feel and but for a few stores selling kashmir carpets, shawls etc there is nothing much that would draw crowds to the mall.

Name: Mohan2013
Title: First mall of Chennai city
Review: I am a permanent resident of chennai so I know the transformations that preceded the present spencer plaza. After the launch of several malls especially the Express avenue in the vicinity of this place, the visitors have dwindled here. When I visited here recently to buy some cell phone cases, I could not restrain by my flashback about the glorious past of this mall. It's heartening to note that the property developers built a replica of the facade of the original mall inside the mall. Many of the shops and retail chains shifted to the Express avenue. By modernising the building with good facilities and addition of multiplexes, the management can attract customers again.

Name: Sanath K
Title: Very old mall but it is very good
Review: Big mall, we can feel a very good environment once we enter into the mall. Mall has more small shops were we can purchase many items at reasonable cost.

Name: tnbalaji90
Title: Good Place for Shopping.
Review: Spencer plaza is a centralized A/C mall with Ground floor, 2 shopping floors. It has escalators, lifts and huge carparking facility is available. In spencers one can get anything. All the major brands has outlets in this mall. Landmark, pantaloon, westside and all major chain stores are here.

Name: R Jun
Title: Grey Market Mall
Review: An Earstwhile look of a Modern Mall .... ofcourse spensor Plaza is one of the oldest malls in Chennai which has lost its typical modern day mall requirements....It's like a grey market where u will find some typical cheap road side stuff , wholesale items etc ... however still not bad to visit once .... u may find wat u were looking for ..

Name: IMumbaitraveller
Title: Disappointed
Review: Coming after ten years, it was really disappoint to see the price V of ChennaiThis place was the first multi shop mall. With all major brands closed now, it seems that the mall is dying Management needs to renovate and rejinuiate the place

Name: Sudhir
Title: Old Mall
Review: This is the oldest & vast mail in the chennai city. This mall has been there for almost 20 years now.While most of the malls have all sort of branded shops only, this is an exception. Even a low budget shopper can shop here.No movie theater is available here. But restaurants and shops are available for shopping.

Name: JumboMumbai
Title: Place ahead of time..
Review: ..is what I feel.  Such a large mall in almost the year 2000 was ahead of time.  And the crowds it did pull for some years but it wnet wrong in not beeing an exclusive mall like outlets and mistake to allow mundane shop keppers to ope up shop.  NOt so many large brands meant it got treated like another 200 shop arcade. And foot falls begun to fall.  But it still attracts quite a lot of people. A nd of course the office spaces above are wondeful.

Name: kittyban
Title: shopping mall since 90's!
Review: Spencer plaza has 3 phases for shopping . If you want to buy nice cashmere silk, carpets, lucknowi dresses, rajasthani, kashmiri, jaipuri styled clothing, this is the perfect place , with quite a good deal for the price ! This also has a few restaurants , where you can dine easily with your budget. Unfortunately, many stores have been closed, after the opening of express avenue mall. In my opinion, this is one of the best places for buying indian traditional attire, handicrafts, leather goods. Walk in and see by yourself !!

Name: JoshlineC
Title: Air-Conditioned Flea Market
Review: After a long day, ask your driver to drop you there to eat, because there is a good food court BUT the journey to your destination is filled with shops squeezed together to not waste space, displaying everything and anything; from leather jackets and pashmina scarfs to a brand new phone cases and handicrafts. People do try and persuade you to enter their shop if you so much as look in that direction, the goods itself are quite cheap compared to the shops some tuk tuk  drivers take you too, but you have to be careful in the scarf section since everything is pashmina even if you can swear its mixed polyester. The shops are all over the place and it's quite hard sometimes to locate where exactly you are since they are no maps around just names of shops as you go up each floor.Don't worry the shop vendors are quite helpful.But it you are looking for a good bargain, this is a good and cool place to start, just have a bit of patience and don't run on an empty stomach and this plaza will be enjoyable.

Name: pavankumarraju
Title: First mall
Review: Spencer Plaza is the first mall in Chennai situated at Annasalai. We used to visit this place regularly with friends.

Name: Arpita
Title: Bargain & Shop
Review: If you love bargaining, this is the perfect place where you can get both branded as well as non-branded items, hand looms and many other shops.Also, because of other malls in the city, this oldest shop attracts less crowd and resides fewer brands. Also, I found it very congested

Name: Teresamea
Title: The oldest mall in Chennai is still worth a visit
Review: This mall was packed on my first visit to India but it now has many empty shops...however, don't over look this as a shopping destination.  First the Jewel Mine (Phase I ground floor) has wonderful jewelry and with a little bargaining you can get awesome prices.  The staff is wonderfully friendly and they will also custom make jewelry for you.  In an annex to the jewelry store you can find other great items of good quality like pashmina or cashmere scarves and wraps, traditional carvings, and replicas of items like the old mogul knives.  Plan to be in this shop for a good while as there is plenty to see and they will want to show you everything lol...but in the nicest of manners.I also like Nuts N Spices to stock up on any hard to find items like premade spices for Masala Chai which I love.  If you live in a city where Indian ingredients are hard to find this is a great destination as they carry everything you might need to create that favorite Indian dish.  There are still additional nice shops for clothing and other goods at Spencer too.  Many of the newer malls gouge you on parking...but not this one.  Do check it out.

Name: Bijoyeta P
Title: Bringing Kolkata to Chennai:: Authentic Kolkata!
Review: Kolkata has always been famous for food. If you have missed Bengali food for a long time, then do drop in Spencer Plaza food court- Authentic Kolkata is the name! You get awesome Thali, perfect vegetable curry, dal, fish, chicken, warm just-made roti, rice. And everything that a Bengali desires to eat! Did I forget to talk about Roshogolla? Okay, then you get that even in this small hub. Price is so perfect that you would like to come back again and again. No less than "ma'r haater ranna"

Name: Vijaykumar Shamsunder
Title: The best place for Bargain Hunting
Review: Inspite of several new avenues having come up, Spencer Plaza is still a shoppers delight.Some of the big names may have left the place. But it is the ideal place for splendid bargains. The shop owners are quite friendly and hospitableFrom window shopping to bargain hunting, to munching away a few snacks at the food malls, it is still the best place to shop and relax.

Name: MBev99
Title: Some shops are still there. Can still eat food there. Can buy cheap tops for 200 rupees
Review: A lot of shops are gone but there are still some there. You can buy cheap Indian tops for bat 200 rupees in Feb. 2016. There are still some modern stores there also. Still a lot of Indian artifacts you can buy there. Kashmir shops are still there. There is about 3 fast food stores upstairs. One sells thali meals. There is still an international grocery store there where u can buy imported food items. I was able to find Indian skirts there also.

Name: Pal_078
Title: Spencers was one of the firsts, now the last
Review: Spencers used to be the first choice as kids, to go to a mall. To eat. Although through the years, competitors have come and gone, Spencers only degraded it shops, its standards and the likes.Now it is just garbage with noshing now.

Name: George J
Title: Old, Decrepit and somewhat scary
Review: We went to this mall as we were told it had the most authentic indian shops in Chennai. I'm not sure of that as we subsequently found other shops that sold authentic Indian goods at a fraction of the prices listed at shops in this mall. Would not recommend the visit

Name: bharatvaid6900
Title: Worst mall @ Chennai
Review: By far the crappiest place i have been to @ Chennai............shop owners are rude and food is pathetic............and parking is a pain.............regret visiting.

Name: Ismail_is123
Title: It's more of office space now..
Review: It's becoming office space as most of the shops are moving over to express avenue or phoenix..Only mall in chennai where I have seen, they sell cigarette and you can openly smoke in parking lots in top floor..You will not feel as if you are in a mall as if you to top floor, shopkeepers will stand outside and lure u inside which usually happens in places like t nagar..Parking is always empty.. Don't go alone if you are a female.. Not worth..

Name: Ghiri T
Title: The oldest mall in Chennai
Review: Spencer plaza located in Chennai is the oldest shopping mall in Chennai. It was built during British period and then it was reconstructed in 1985. It has eight floors in which there are many shops for shopping. Here there are many service centers for all electronic products. There are many more excitements in this mall

Name: Senthamizh Aras... G
Title: Long ago a famous mall
Review: One of the very first shopping mall in Chennai before the coming of express avenue, citi center, forum mall,grand mall,Phoenix mall etc... Once a famous shopping , if u think of shopping the first word that comes will be Spencer plaza but now it has changed either becoz other malls are good or this mall is neglected. Still this holds all most all brand of shops from small brands to international brands. You can just give a try.

Name: Cyrus
Title: One of best Balaji Temple in Chennai ( local name ranganatha perumal temple )
Review: Very nice place in hill top. No road till top but not too many steps to take.Very good place to visit, I am not orthodox kind of person still I like this place very much as its on hill top. This place is little far from regular Chennai traffic and not very far from city as well.This place have two Balaji temples, one is at bottom and other one is on hill top and the hill top one called as ranganatha perumal temple.

Name: @TraveLover
Title: Very nice dharshan at hill top
Review: Very enchanting and a mountain view of nice landscapes around western side of Chennai. On the mountain Shri Ranganath Swami give dharshan in a reclined position. Aadisheshan bed and at foot side he has boomadevi, mahalaxmi and Brahma at top. Feel like seeing him again and again. But you need to do hiking of around 150 steps. At the foot hill we have another temple where thiruneervannar. One of the speciality here is all type of perumal, nindra perumal - Thiruneervannar. Kidantha perumal-st the top of the hill. Amarntha perumal- narasimha perumal at the side of top temple.

Name: Bala Tripura S
Title: Twin temples of Lord Vishnu
Review: There are 2 temples in this place.First one is neeravarna perumal temple at the bottom of the hill where Lord vishu idol is in standing position.There is a separate temple for Goddess.Other is on top of the hill where Lord vishnu is worshipped as ranganatha and idol is in sleeping posture.We need climb at around 200 steps to reach the hill

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: vishnu temple
Review: The village is near chennai and is at foot hill of tiruneermalai.there is a temple at the foot of the hill and also one uphill which is easy to climb and a view from the top is mindblowing

Name: Narayanan V
Title: Thiruneelamalai--A Great Tetra Avathar
Review: The village of Thiruneermalai near Pallavaram is important to Vishnu devotees as ancient temples of this deity are located here.. It is also called as Nadu Naatu Srirangam and is one of the 108 divyadesam.At the base of Thiruneermalai hill is a temple for  Neervanna Perumal who is in a standing posture. The temple atop the hill which can be reached by climbing about 250 steps, and many elders also climb with spirits easilyThe main one is for Lord Ranganatha, reclining on the serpent Adisesha and facing South with  Sridevi and Bhudevi  Thayaars near the feet. The other deities on the hill-top are  Trivikrama (seen in the walking pose), Narasimha (in the seated posture) and Goddess Lakshmi, enshrined as Ranaganayaki Thayar, the consort of Ranganatha.In the base temple there is a slogan " Narayanan ingu ninraan irunthaan nadanthaan kidanthaan" implies Lord vishnu lives here in four poses.An important feature of Thiruneermalai is that Vishnu is seen here in four poses ‚Äî standing (as Neervanna Perumal), seated (as Narasimha), reclining (as Ranganatha) and walking (as Trivikrama or Ulagalanda Perumal). While the procession deity (utsava murti) in most Vishnu temples is generally worshipped in front of the main idol, in the hill-top shrine, only the large central deity is seen and His processional idol Azhagia Manavalar is inside the temple at the foothills.Moolavar (Nadandhaan) ‚Äì Thrivikraman ( Vamana) seen in standing posture facing east.Reminding the Vamanavathara (Dwarf incarnation), the Lord is in the walking order asking where to place his third step after measuring all the worlds in two steps . The left leg is lifted up to shoulder level unlike in Kanchipuram and Tirukoilur where it is the right leg lifted to 90 degrees .Moolavar (Irundhaan) - Saantha Narasimhan seen in seated posture facing east.Considering the appeal of boy Prahlada who was afraid of his fury, the Lord appears in a calm and pleasant mood as Shantanarasimha and also as Balanarasimha. (There is a small moolavar with prahaladha kept in front of the main lord about 1 foot tall) The lord is welcoming bhaktas with the left hand and the right hand shows abayam Yesterday when I visited the temple there was chariot pulling of Neervannaperumaal along the neighbouring streets.People celebrate this event welcoming Neervannaperumal by decorating their house front side with Rangoli along the streets.The local residents celebrate the event with light music and giant speakers renting the air.This temple is a divyadesam and also a swayambhu kshetram.I noted this event in my calendar with a hope to visit the temple again next year on the same day. You can also see lot of flights flying very close to the hills.

Name: Karthik R
Title: Divya Desam temple
Review: Shri Rangantha Temple at Thiruneermalai is on the 108 Divya Desam temples. The temple has 4 sanctums of Lord Vishnu as Perumal. One in the base of the hill and 3 over the hill in 3 different postures - Standing, sitting and reclining positions. It takes around 1 to 1:30 hours for relaxed visiting of all these sanctums, climbing up the hill and down. The steps are not so steep and elders can climb with patience.Parking area is available without parking fee. Small shops are available all around.

Name: SubashSL
Title: A Divyadesam you cannot miss
Review: At the outset let me inform that you need to visit the temple at the bottom of the hill (Neer Vanna Perumal, Nindran (standing pose) before climbing the hill to visit the "Svayambu Shrine" (reclining pose) where you'll also see the lord in Irundan (sitting), Nadanthan (walking) and Kadandan (crossing) poses. The temple is easily accessible from the GST Road near Pallavaram. Actually in Google Maps it looks very close to the Kundrathur Murugan temple too and so you can plan to visit both these temples in one go. The steps aren't many or very steep but do carry water as they can run you out of breath, particularly in hot summer. Watch out for monkeys though they aren't much of a bother here at this temple. On Sundays the temple is open for longer durations than other days.

Name: Sivalingam Sankar
Title: Thiruneermalai Ranganatha Neervana perumal
Review: Visited this holdy divya desam in chennai, have to take left in chrompet pallavaram flyover parallel to new chennai silk road to Thiruneermalai road. You can see the hill temple where ranganathar recide. This temple is of 2 parts above the hill is ranganthar with 2 devis in lying portion (kidantha kolam), in inner sutrupraharam you can see thiruvikramar with 2 finger showing 2 measure and one hand with 1 finger asking another measure for mahabali. Very divine sculpture, another rare sculpture is narasimhar(sitting posture-eruntha koolam) with 2 hands and calm posture. After visiting hill temple can see the below neervana perumal temple, where there is standing porture(ninra koolam). You can plan to visit in a calm rush free days. During month of karthigai till vaikunda ekadesi the idols are kept with partial close since they do thailakappu.

Name: plpalani
Title: Divya desam
Review: This temple is in two parts. There is one Perumal temple at the foot hills of the small hill.. here apart from thayar, Ramar and Andalusia Sannidhi are also there.While climbing the hill just after few steps there is Hanuman temple. On the hill top Perumal gives darshan in three posture... lying, standing and sitting.One of the 108 Divya dreams.

Name: harleen_sethi
Title: Holy place to visit
Review: Ranganatha Temple is an amazing Hindu temple in Thiruneermalai, a suburb of Chennai. Please visit for peace and calmness of mind. You will feel the holy presence of god and abundant blessings.A brief intro as told by the template priest: Sthalathipadi (presiding deity) is Neervanna Perumal, all utsavams (Celebrations) are for Lord Ranganatha. The complex is in two parts one at the base of the hill for the Staladhipadhi Neervanan (Ninran-Standing Posture), housing shrines of his consort Animamalar Mangai thayar, Kalyana Ramar and Andal. Shrine for Anjaneya (Hanuman) is to the right as one climbs up to the hill shrine. The temple complex up the hill has three shrines for Lord Ranganatha (Kidanthaan ‚Äì in reclining posture), Trivikrama (Nadanthaan ‚Äì in walking posture), Lord Narasimha (Irundhaan - sitting posture) and a Shrine for Ranaganayaki Thayar (facing East). It is a double prakaram(outer courtyard) temple. The Garuda shrine faces the Lord. The view from the top of the hill is wonderful.

Name: meghashyam
Title: Divyadesam
Review: Lord Vishnu in standing , sitting and lying pose is worshipped in three different shrines , one shrine is at ground level , two are atop a small hillock  . A Divya desam . Lord is beautiful here .

Name: Footprints727663
Title: Beautiful Architecture
Review: I went to Ranganatha Temple. The temple is also known for its beautiful architecture and exquisite carving. It houses seven gold pots adorned with huge mirrors within the temple premises. It is great place to go.

Name: ravi p
Title: 4 positions of swamy at one place
Review: You can't find 4 positions of ranganatha swamy at one place. Here you can see standing, sitting, sleeping and walking position of swamy.First have darshan of standing position downstairs and then take 100 steps up to see the other three positions of swamy.Great place to visit and not many know about this..

Name: LOVE_BEAT_LAND
Title: Best place go for once a life
Review: Took a bath from all walls. Pay the person who can drive you. No need to wait for lines. He will do all for you. At the end pay him.

Name: Sathya M
Title: Excellent view
Review: I like this temple, Nice temple, no crowd, peaceful praying. Excellent view from hill. If we need to pray on Saturday the Lord renganather this best temple.

Name: Aaqarsh Aiyyar
Title: Pleasant
Review: This temple, listed as one of the 108 divya desams, is about 4 kilometres from Pallavaram railway station in Chennai. The presiding deity is reclining ranganathar. One has to climb a few steps up the hillock to enjoy the Lord and the lovely view of the town from the top. The spirited food (prasadam) are awesome, especially the tamarind rice (puliyodharai).

Name: AshokMela
Title: Good temple on hill top!!
Review: Ranganatha temple on Thiruneermalai in Chennai is a pretty good temple and one must visit if you are a Chennaites. Not much visited by tourists or outsiders. The temple is visited more by local residents. You need walk on steps around (200) to reach the hill top. Nice picturesque view of that part of Chennai from the temple. Some times cool breeze may add value to your visit. This temple is pictured in many a movies of 70's or 80's Tamil Movies.

Name: Sai Prasad D
Title: Sri Ranganatha (Lord Vishnu )Temple....
