Review: A place to enjoy with friends and have fun with friends near by from VGP amusement park and water park.

Name: Shrenik J
Title: Horrible
Review: I visited with my family ...it was horrible experience in VGP today .....i will never go again to this place ...There is no management to maintain the park ...I feel near future there will be accident very soon ...coz i myself felt when I personally experienced one ride ...suddenly one screw has came out ....d staff was hiding there faces ....I was really scared üòß.....all rides minimum 10 to 15 years old without any proper maintenance....Nearly 50 percent of rides r not working ....I would say it‚Äôs worst park in terms of cleaning d hygiene ....coz the staff is least bothered in this matter.....staff and r very much rude to public ....they even don‚Äôt have first aid kit also ....if there any emergency.....even there is no doctor ...we have to go to ticket counter for any assistance.....Quality of served inside park is really bad ....they don‚Äôt even care for any hygiene ....taste of food is not gud ....d they even charge for snacks double to triple than MRP .....it‚Äôs really bad..we can find food every where on ground near food plaza d  there is no cleaning g at all.Water world ....is really  horrible.....I would say .....I was shocked when I saw many people d children r passing urine in pool itself ....there no staff person to look after this ....half of ride is not working in waterworld ....and there is lot repair work is pending in safety of public ....they even don‚Äôt have proper shower rooms ....in shower they don‚Äôt have any gates only  screens instead of gate ...that to broken ...I was really shocked ....zero cleaness...in bathrooms d change room ........There many problems in this park ...still pending to write ......Only one thing is gud was SNOW WORLD IT WAS REALLY WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE....I CAN SAY .....I would never again visit this park ....to risk my life ......

Name: harishmanekscorpion
Title: a outing with kids
Review: If you have young kids then this place is a good outing where children are sure to get their moneys worth.

Name: karthick_kr
Title: Enjoy the waves..
Review: It was a family weekend outing. Could have fun with lot of friends and relatives. Wait for the waves in the water gaming which is in the evening!!

Name: s_ramsam
Title: Very nice place, beach
Review: Around 20 kms away from the hustle and bustle of Chennai.  Very nice beach with all facilities. Worth a visit.

Name: Shashi K
Title: Breezy and Romantic
Review: I stayed only one day as I had to extend my stay in Chennai for a meeting.. I was licky to choose VGP Golden Beach, the place is so serene and awesome, one is left alone to his/her dreams among the manicured lawn with plenty trees off the beach.. Ideal place for readers and book lovers.. Next visit I will carry my favorite book and indulge in Tilting at windmills

Name: Suresh B
Title: One of the Magnificent Place to Visit With Family and Friends in Chennai
Review: This beach is Located on the bank of Mahapalipuram Road and Around 15 to 20 Kms away from Chennai City and 15 Kms from Mahapalipuram. Mostly Shooting will be carried out here.

Name: Ronita B
Title: Golden beach with golden sands
Review: VGP Golden Beach is a major tourist attraction in Chennai.It 's a kind of amusement park plus beach.If you are lucky you might even get to see shooting of artists in bright costumes.It is a nice place to relax and have fun.There is a statue at VGP Golden Beach, Chennai which you can see for only six hours and it then vanishes just to reappear next day. It is not that there are visiting hours of this statue, this statue is actually a living human statue whose name is Mr. Abdul Haziz.Abdul wears an Indian attire and holds a stick in his hands, dresses traditionally with a turban on his head stands here for six hours from morning till evening Non-stop without even blinking his eyes.

Name: Navi K
Title: Nice place to visit with family
Review: Located around 20kms from Chennai Central Railway station, this amusement park offers variety of activities & fun rides. Ticket prices of 3 or more categories each costing nearly Rs.400+ per person. Visit during the opening hours & spend all-day to get best of the entertainment.

Name: ArchitaRoy
Title: Thrill rides with serene sunset
Review: Vgp Golden beach surely has the best of both the worlds. One can spend the day enjoying the rides, have a nice lunch at the in house restaurant and in the evening can go to the beach to watch the serene sunset.The only drawback I felt was the water rides were not at par with the dry rides.

Name: Ra_Radha
Title: Poor Maintenance and High Ticket price
Review: It used to be the top item on every tourist in Chennai. But, oflate, these people have started charging high entry fees, but, no value or worth. Eateries inside charge 3x normal price for food items and no proper maintenance or hygiene. Rides are dangerous or not working or out of order.

Name: vikasmardia
Title: golden beach
Review: the oldest and landmark amusement park located on bay of Bengal just on outskirts of Chennai city on mahabalipuram road is a must visit tourist attraction

Name: Akila P
Title: VGP... it has grown with us....
Review: Right from our childhood..we are fasicnated by this place..cause of the statue man which is one of the highlight and Top Gun ride. must try..new addition is snow kingdom next to VGP

Name: Parthiban
Title: good entertainment
Review: good during your summer days when heat is u and you have a special attractions of snow and water rides and everything is good must try

Name: rajatravels4u
Title: Excellent Stay
Review: I had gone to the resort with family members. The resort is right on beach front. We have booked two cottages there. The rooms were cleaned.Front Staff were helpful. Food was excellent. Sea foods are awesome. In breakfast, sambhar was tasty. My family members have enjoyed at the resort. The entire staff were courteous and well behaved. Thanks to VGP management for such excellent staff.

Name: Narasimhananda S
Title: Really Golden
Review: Here there is much to see and relish. Try making the stern guards laugh!! Good place for unwinding for all.

Name: Rucha121
Title: Theme Park with many rides not functional
Review: You pay nearly 400/- for entry tickets for all rides, however, majority of rides will be closed or under maintenance. The very few rides that are open, will have big queues. Then what is use of charging such high entry fees. Food and water is very expensive inside. No longer VGP is attractive, just looting tourists.

Name: Rahul D
Title: Not very Golden
Review: The golden beach was one of the beaches which used to be clean but nowadays it has changed a lot and become dirty like many other beaches, the smell of fishes is so bad that I felt like vomiting at times. This beach also has an amusement park, which I didn't visit but from the outside, it looked just an average park. Overall, this is OK type beach and I won't say that it's a must visit, you can skip this.

Name: Amit Rit
Title: Good going towards bad
Review: Half of the rides do not work compared to the entry fees charged. Beach is clean. Overall maintenance and stuff quality can be improved. Good for Kids over 5 years.

Name: Sb R
Title: Dirty beach. Money trap
Review: I have visited this beach last week with my and friend's family. It charges handsome amount as entry fee and again collects huge charges for all important rides inside the park. The mandatory costume for water world is also chargable @ Rs 150, probably more than the amount it was purchased. The food vendors inside the park  are of the quality of footpath stalls and have no concern about hygiene. We were chosen the place mainly to introduce our kids to a friendly and clean beach. But, it was opposite. The beach was dirty like hell. It doesnot have swimming facility. There is no change room to change clothes also.

Name: rahulgautam
Title: the golden beach
Review: more than the beach the amusement park takes all the credit if this place. water slides are amazing. although a bit expensive it deserves a visit from the children. lots of swings and slides. if you go there make sure you have 4 to 6 hours of time to enjoy this place.

Name: Priyanka T
Title: Very bad experince
Review: Not a good place no management. I will suggest not to visit this place. Total waste of money. They don't deliver what the promise. No stars for this resort

Name: Sam2606
Title: Total entertainment.
Review: We visited the 3D painting studio. A total must visit.. very unique and the painter Mr. Shrethar a very humble gentleman was kind enough to offer us i for on his future exhibitions also. They also have a person to help you take your photos correctly. A must for kids for sure

Name: ReetaKarki
Title: Sun and water
Review: Had a good time going to the beach with friends. But water is not that clean and extreme hot weather of chennai makes it a little difficult to enjoy.

Name: Stevens Manuel
Title: Think twice
Review: My wife and I stayed here for 2 days and there were quite few nice things about the resort.1. Most staff were friendly2. Rooms are spacious and beds are comfortable3. The bathroom, though the Jacussi does not work is one of the best. Really big and  open to sky and 24hrs hot waterNow to negatives1. WiFi does not work at all. I had to miss two key meetings because of this. Now to their credit they did try to fix it even in rain but it just did not work.2. Over the phone I was told that my check out time of 12 can be considered and extended. But on the departure date they stood their ground and made me and my pregnant wife to depart by 12. In spite of only about 30%occupancy. They say it is because I booked through make my trip. Possibly because I got a decent offer online. I would have expected a hardly occupied resort to try and win mire customers.3. Rooms smell damp and fungal. Very little scope for air to come in.Bottom line: think twice before booking here. Not worth it

Name: pasunuri k
Title: Excellent
Review: The garden is really beautiful and visited along with my family members really had a great time being there

Name: sushil arora
Title: Avg. Park  with carelessness
Review: It has three parks in one , if any one haS to visit they have purchase 2 of them avg. Price 600 first is amusement park which includes beach second is water park and last snow park. The best one was snow park.the park authority must take care of hygiene and safety of visitor.

Name: fhanifdeen
Title: Golden Beach environment is excellent.
Review: Refresh the mind and healing and inspiration to give consistent environment philosophy. The garden has been designed more beautiful beaches and interrelated manner. South Indian films are also available images that I have heard. Biodiversity and its artistic design environment is excellent.

Name: VishwasCR
Title: Cheap and best amusement park
Review: This is an awesome amusement park, may be one of the oldest of it's kind. I remember visiting here as a kid and now I took my kid here. Many things remained same, made me feel nostalgic. A total entertainer for the entire family. You can easily spend a day for a family hangout. Trust me, you will love it!

Name: krazikams
Title: No free entry
Review: To access only beach, there is no free entry. You have to compulsorily take 250/- ticket. They have lots of combo package of Amusement rides in Universal Kingdom, Aqua World, Snow Kingdom.. all there to loot money, but many rides will be closed and not working. So ask clearly and spend money wisely. Young kids will enjoy the place.

Name: kumarjayamalla
Title: good palce to kill a weekend
Review: gang is needed to enjoy all the rides and near by beach view is cool food is availble inside and bit expensive.

Name: Abhijit_Das_Kolkata
Title: Perfect Family outing
Review: This is a perfect place for family outing. It has lots of rides, water sports as well as snow kingdom. Also not far away from Chennai. No dearth for parking.

Name: krishseshadri
Title: VGP - Very Glitched Place :(
Review: For heaven sake, don't ever visit this place. ‚ÄúHorrible‚Äù is the one word to sum it up!!Entire world has caught up with services "oriented" towards customers but sadly the VGP management is taking the other direction and critically lacks customer service or has any process in place :((Those who enjoy mediocre entertainment, basic rides and get thrilled with sloppy 80s or 90s style infrastructure, who don't care for personal hygiene, may like this resort.  These are the issues faced by my family within few hours of time spent in this resort:‚Ä¢	Some 3-4 people inside the ticketing counter are talking to themselves and they seem to not bother that the customers are standing in the line and they need to be helped with the tickets..huh?? ‚Ä¢	Most of the rides are under repair or under maintenance. There is no board or sign, we have to walk-up to the nearby ride operator to enquire/find about the status of the rides.‚Ä¢	As it rained the night before, the operator or the management didn't even care to clean the roads or seats in the rides. The operators were telling us it‚Äôs not their job and their attitude towards the customers speaks in volume about how they are being treated by the management. Poor souls they need some time-off or some change in shifts.‚Ä¢	When in the middle of the ride, the power was shut-off and we were sitting in a balloon ride for about 20 minutes and when asked to start the generator, operator told us that it will take 30 minutes to resume the operations. He said that he can‚Äôt speak to his supervisor and he doesn‚Äôt have his number. Thank God, we were not in the Ferris wheel when this happened ;)‚Ä¢	We were instructed that we can go to the water park, apparently those rides also need power for the operation. After about 30 minutes, the power got resumed, one of the ride operator told us that he is going for lunch and someone will come and operate it. Already the people were going bonkers that the power was shut-down, on top of it, the operator was now walking-out for lunch. Who in the world to question them?‚Ä¢	Worst experience is, there is no co-ordination in the water park to collect and distribute the tube floaters. When my daughter went to collect the tube near drop-off point, she slipped, fell on her back and severely injuring her hip and also got a big bump in her head.  She was suffering with headache, dizziness due to the trauma from the fall. To our surprise, there were no staff in the vicinity to assist or there is any first-aid kit available.  One has to walk to the ticket counter and took us somewhere far-off to get us some ice in a paper napkin. He is neither first-aid trained or has any experience. Surprised, why they can‚Äôt afford a Doctor in the premises? God only has to save us if any such untoward incident happens. ‚Ä¢	It‚Äôs a pure negligence of the management as the stagnant rain water wasn‚Äôt cleaned properly especially in the places where young children/teens walk-by. The algae formed in that busy junction has never been cleaned‚Ä¢	When went to the Veg restaurant near by the Horror House, the guy serving the food on an uncleansed plate (soap scum was still there). When we pointed out, he just removed the soap scum asked us to adjust as the food has been served? Who want to compromise for this? Is anyone in this place care for food hygiene?? ‚Ä¢	People who come to eat in this restaurant feed the crows and dogs and these animals come nearby to the table and also attempt to pick the left-overs from the plate. Yuck !!ÔÅåOf all the bad things happened, one good thing is their Snow Kingdom, they maintain sub-zero temperature where you can see some snow. Please keep in mind, the jackets they give really stinks ÔÅåHow many ever new rides they may introduce in future, without fixing their customer service and basic process, there is a big question mark in getting repeat customers.

Name: marenamicable
Title: WORST AMUSEMENT PARK IN EVER VISITED
Review: Last week visited VGP with family  amusement park which was bad experience in my life time .I have been visting too many places this is terrible. Everywhere Higher the cost Higher the enjoyment , but here actually reverse . And process like Queue every where , food not allowed , ticket counter waiting ,food inside park and more terrible water ride process (rental costumes smell ).My suggestion plz shut down the park and do some other business

Name: AshokMela
Title: A sought after destination for the last 3 decades !!
Review: VGP Golden Beach is a entertainment place or picnic spot for locals of Chennai not just in the last few years but for the last 3 decades. The theme park inside has been added a decade before. But the property and the beaches and the park and the gardens are very commonly noticed in the south indian movies of late 80s and early 90s.

Name: Namrata S
Title: First Beach Visit Ever
Review: This was my first ever beach visit and my first trip to South India. On a local's recommendation we went to Golden Beach and it was totally worth it. The waves are rocking, the beach is pristine and well-maintained and the premises are beautifully preserved and maintained. Absolutely love the architecture and the wonderful side-activities that are available, like palm readers, swings for both children and adults, horror house, etc. The washrooms are hygienic and well-maintained and the staff is courteous. Not a lot of variety when it comes to food but definitely enough to satisfy the post-swim hunger pangs.

Name: cool1960
Title: Full of FUN
Review: Maintained by a Private party. This Beach was very first of its kind in Chennai.To entertain people lots of fun filled dramas, music, skit are being conducted. You can find Tamil culture is bieng played and Portrayed there. Lots of eateries are there which will make to keep eating.Lots of trees are there which makes us to really relax. Beach is superb.We need to walk a lot so we have to plan the route and walk slowly.

Name: wanderlast_13
Title: STAY AT GOLDEN BEACH RESORT, HAVLOCK, ANDAMANS
Review: Conveniently located, about 3 kms from jetty.Well maintained resort with a private beach.Accommodations are very spacious and well maintained

Name: Bhalaji N
Title: Out dated
Review: Been to this place after a decade and was so disappointing in the 90s it used to be weekend leisure spot for my family and we used to stay as well. It used to be so good, now i see an aging, under maintained place with bad shape. The food has gone bad, entertainment is literally not jelling well. Its high time they renovate. Lots of space and the animals that stayed within has been lost to the divided cottage space. Inter this has shrunk the overall space for the park. The beach is the only good thing that still exists. The beach is clean, tidy and good for kids to play.

Name: Janak S
Title: It's essentially dead
Review: Came with family on the 24rd Dec 2015. Paid 300 per head only to find the entire park is like s graveyard. All the rides are empty and out of repair. The food place is like a road side outlet with two items (fast food) on the menu. We simply walked out of the park and into the hotel next door. Overall very disappointed.

Name: Deepa S
Title: Leisure visit
Review: Best beach undoubtedly!! Must go here for a visit if ur in chennai... Picturesque setting and white sandy beach... Beautiful indeed!! No wonder so many Bollywood songs have been shot here... Peaceful and tranquil... One feels happy to have been here... Best tym to go here is in the evening... Watch the sunset... Totally worth ur travel tym!!

Name: ashunatn
Title: leisure trip
Review: visited there once wn i had gone for a cousins marriage on ecr, first experience, though allergic to rides, i tried once, roller coaster,took photos. first visit after marriage.memorable. water park is super,enjoyed a lot.

Name: tinu123
Title: one of the cleanest beach of chennai
Review: This is one of the cleanest beach in Chennai. There is an entry fee which restricts the visitors so the beach is moderately populated. If you are lucky then you'll get to see some celebrities shooting a movie sequence here. I got to see Hansika Motwani here with her crew for a movie shot. I personally prefer this over Marina Beach for its add on attraction apart from the beach. Inside there is a small deer park, exotic birds, there are unlimited joy rides and food court. Overall it's a good place to enjoy on weekends.

Name: Naveed T
Title: Excellent place to be with family
Review: Nice view, cleanest beach in Chennai, great views, calm, clean and serene. Have some peanuts or some grams/corns and a bottle of water. Stay there for around 2 hours. Have sun tanning. Enjoy the beach.

Name: vidhusagar
Title: Good entertainment for first time visitors
Review: They are one of the pioneers of resorts and entertainment in the ECR area. Still basking in the glory of the old times. The place does provide entertainment value but has somehow deteriorated standard wise.

Name: K Sai Bharath
Title: Enjoyable
Review: Once we enter there will be only happiness. Won't forget and will be going back to enjoy fully. Food is extremely tasty

Name: SagarVS
Title: Faded yet popular
Review: This place gets bus loads of tourists even after all these years, Of course the film shootings are not what it used to be 2 -3 decades ago. There are many interesting settings here to interest the first timer and the entry ticket is affordable and seen as great value for the visitor. However, there are better options for similar entertainment in Chennai.

Name: AnshAgwl
Title: Good Beach
Review: It was a good beach in Chennai. The beach was well connected inside from VGP Universal Kingdom, an amusement park. You can enjoy rides and cool breeze of beach back to back. It is located nearby Iscon Temple, Chennai.

Name: Reema A
Title: Beautiful place to enjoy with family & friends..
Review: The private beach with resorts, amusement parks, lot of activities is a "must see" spot if you visit Chennai. Families, students and tourists irrespective of the age have a lot of activities for time pass and enjoyment. If you are lucky, you can watch film shooting here which happens frequently. This was one place we could really unwind and let ourselves become kids again. I really enjoyed the place along with the family and recommend to come with family. The snacks are a bit expensive for the quality. All in all well worth the effort to come & time spent.

Name: Finn J
Title: Good place for all age
Review: Small places where you can by some food,other games place to youse your money,nice beach but no swimming there.They haver a very big Swimland and there are fun for many hour's there I have been there three times with a lot of Children and parants from street in Chennai,always a success for all

Name: Manish Bansal
Title: Weekday fun at Golden Beach
Review: Had heard a lot about the Golden Beach resort. My visit here was on a weekday and hence it was very less crowded. There is this guy who stands as a statue and is interesting to see people trying hard to tease him to move or smile. The place is wide spread with many rides which are included in the entry ticket except for a few. Not happy to say that many of the rides are old fashioned and needs maintainance. There is a water park also inside the place for which a ticket can be brought separately. Dint venture there due to lack of time however appeared to be good because of the long water slides and people seemed to have fun. Less options of eating there and dint appear to be hygenic though final call may be taken by the one wanting to eat it. The escape to beach was good from there which was clean.

Name: SenthilESR
Title: Terrible .. Very bad maintenance
Review: Recently i went to this theme park with my family.We had horrible experience. The maintenance of rides were very bad, especially the dashing cars. Will not recommend for anyone

Name: Lavanash
Title: Fun for the family
Review: One of the oldest and biggest Adventure parks of Chennai. Has become a little run down, nevertheless it is being revamped and repainted slowly. Plenty of rides for adults, kids and babies. A small petting zoo, plenty of restaurants, a gaming arcade and the major attraction...the beach. Good place for kids. Can spend time with family for half the day. Better to reach there early evening. Holidays and the morning times will be fully crowded. The rides will have longer queues. By early evening the visitors who use public transport start to disperse, so the rides seem lesser crowded. Plus as Chennai is a hot and humid city the evening times are much cooler. There is a newly started Snow park. The entrance & ticket to that is separate and is through the car park.Try to visit during Pongal time (January) when you can see many ancient south indian traditions like Karakatam, Poi kal kuthirai and lots of group dances. Has a resort too for those who want to stay overnight.

Name: ankitablr
Title: wonderful beach
Review: very nice beach for morning walk , enjoyed walking here for 3 days while I was in chennai. nice place everyone should visit.

Name: MOUNTMANAGER
Title: Good place for a dayout
Review: Good place for a dayout with family  and friends. You have the beach facing architecture and a lot of entertainment activities

Name: Hariharan S
Title: Is it loosing its charm
Review: Had been to VGP golden beach with my family.... plus 1. it is a theme park not just a beach...negatives....cleanliness needs to improve, safety of the rides needs to checked,the system for the clothes at the aqua world needs to improve....still a reasonable place to be with children

Name: amrutanshue
Title: reasonably clean and secluded
Review: the beach is clean...few people.bit faraway from the city but thats what we want isn't it?? plenty of good restaurants and a drive-in-theatre around.

Name: Pratik G
Title: Beach : unique place to visit...
Review: i am writing my review only for the GOLDEN beach... not VGP resort... both are different attractions... id not been to resort... n way to beach is jus next to this resort...though its not in heart of the city, its worth to spend time for ttravel to reach there...it takes atleast 1-2 hours if travelling by local city bus... hats off to chnennai transport services... for which frequent buses are available even for this attraction located in outskirt...now coming to beach, its so calm n clean you never know when hours are spent... in taking selfies... or even sitting n chatting with ur loved ones... yes u get me right... u can include this attraction for a romantic dates... but better go in evening as sun is about to set...

Name: Sudha M
Title: Good place to time pass
Review: I guess it was the first beach resort started in Chennai with lot of games both dry and water games. Its a huge place with lot of trees around. Very good place to hang around. If you want you can go and play  or you can just relax there. Very peaceful. As the place is very big, crowd doesn't affect you much. You can enjoy with friend and family. Lot of entertainment over here. Most importantly its much cheaper compared to other places.

Name: Hemkumar G
Title: No quality
Review: Visited it after almost 25 years to show my little daughter. Should say, they have not upgraded the facility. The look and feel of the amusement park is it is very old. Though you have to pay an entry fee of Rs 200/- approx. for most of the interesting and reasonably good raids inside, you again have to shell out Rs25/- each. The rides are in very old condition. May be for someone very new to amusement park concept, it may have some interest. For others, who might have enjoyed much higher standard amusement park even within India, it is very poor cousin.

Name: Anshul0012
Title: Good One
Review: I visit the place and found attractive, i think one should go in morning and should stay till evening for proper enjoyment

Name: pksahu
Title: A full day fun
Review: Its not just a beach, its a theme park. You can enjoy the rides, you can spend your time near the beach or under the trees and take unforgettable photos around. The main attraction was the statue man standing just near the entrance. Kids just love it. I have been there for around 10 times.Hope to go there again with my family.

Name: Svetaspy
Title: good with kids
Review: the entrance costs about 320 RP including waterpark and some attractions. Also zoo. But what i didnt like was the dress for swimming which you must wear there. Also the swimming pool is not  deep  just for a kids. The water rides is cool but the water made me the allergy on the skin.. This place is for active ppl - you would't find any personal chears to stay 'n chill under the sun.

Name: ben_blr_kl
Title: good location along beach side but old
Review: it takes almost 45 minutes from city center to reach this place. built along the beach side, it has good ambience, price is also very affordable....the rides are okay but all look old and gives you a scary feeling about its functionality!!...the food is really good and the best part - it is available even at 5 pm !!....the water games are really funny...the water is warm and the slides are all literally non functional..the highlight is the beach....it looks much cleaner with less crowd and good security - they even alert you when you get high tides!!

Name: Amit G
Title: Heard Chennai is cheap but VGP makes you wrong- Its indeed a capitalist place
Review: My experience with Chennai so far has not been nice, and VGP did icing on the cake. I and my colleague reached this place in order to spend some good time on the beach as we heard very good about this beach. But on reaching there we realized that we have to shell out entry fee of Rs 225.  Entry ticket is for amusement park but you have to purchase the ticket if you wish to go to the beach. This place is more suitable for families with  kids not for couples or friends.

Name: Haider A
Title: Vgp uinversal kingdom needed
Review: It place need more care for cleaning and devlopment especially swimming pool games and cleaning for water

Name: mpsrawat83
Title: TOP BEACH
Review: This is a very good beach on the out skirt of Chennai. It opens aroung 9.30 AM and is open till evening. One can spend the entire day inside. Over a period of time lot of changes have taken place and now children fun items have been added. Terrific watre ride is one star attraction. The water on the beach is very clean. The location is ideal for movie shootind and on the day of our visit we did come across Tamil Movie Shooting. The environment is very good and much better than any other beaches I have visiten. Only Kovalam beach is as clean as this beach. On the day of our visit some south African artists performed and the performance was par excellence. Must visit place.

Name: Anjula Singh Bhadauria
Title: Nice and commercialised
Review: I liked the beach more than many of Miami and goa... It may be a little crowded but you have to do the right choice of time and point...It is commercialised unlike many I visited but I like its that aspect the most...Atleast you can keep your kids entertained...

Name: Maruthakumar
Title: Old one but nice
Review: It is said to be one of the old beach resort still it is good and one of the preferred resort.We enjoyed the beach, food, man statue etc but everywhere you can see it is old.

Name: 767fkhan1m
Title: Worst amusement park
Review: This is the worst amusement part in Chennai. The water area is very dirty. The rest rooms are badly maintained and smell like hell. The changing rooms are provided with shower cutains instead of doors. The flooring in the water pool is cement, it has bruised mine and my kids legs badly. The water is literally dirty with loads of dirt floating . Most of the rides are not functioning and the ones that are functioning are badly maintained. Though we pay an amount for entry we have to pay for each ride inside too. We were forced to buy clothing for the water area, they were pathetic. Most of the suits were torn and dirty.

Name: glenngrifton
Title: Excellent
Review: Good place full of enjoy . A man standing frent ,puting yellow colour dres . That man is a good plz cover hi with any protection . Because one time a man drunk and speaking bad words and sceraching with a blade

Name: Unni2006
Title: Neat Theme Park
Review: Visited VGP Golden Beach once along with friends during the business trip. It was once famous for Bollywood movies and some of the statues etc were reminding the old movies. However the area seems to be totally deserted are only very few people were around . Most of the joy rides were kept closed although it is maintained. The name was very famous for theme park , but except that the beach area is neat and some nice goods made out of shell available , overall it was disappointing. VGP has to ramp up and make it more more attractive so that people can have one fun and spend time over there.  Expects more....

Name: Truefeed
Title: Not Worth it
Review: Overall it is not maintained properly, given other amusement parks nearby it doesn't worth it even its entrance fee.

Name: kumar s
Title: Ok
Review: Took my wife and daughter to this place. had been to this place long ago. Not that great any more. half of the rides were not open. Thw water park experience was good though.

Name: Somasundaram G
Title: Disappointing
Review: I used to visit in my childhood that time they maintained well. now its horrible no much maintenance every thing we need to pay and use. looks like Mini Saravana Stores. The staffs are not in uniforms. lot of things missing.

Name: Ramesh L
Title: ordinary theme park
Review: we are going to this sunday.  events are same as when i lost visit 2005. the rate is also high per head 225 basic. according to safety issue the rides all are very slow no thrilling effect

Name: lsatishkumar
Title: Need for upgrade
Review: This place I used to visit with my father when I was a kid and the place hasnt changed a lot,so lots of upgradation needed,but the food is good as always,especially the famous family dosa..

Name: unnatikumar
Title: Good Place to visit with family
Review: We with family very much enjoyed the Golden Beach. However Few rides are not running. We enjoyed the Water Park and have funny moments at there.

Name: Rina C
Title: Interesting place to visit with family !!
Review: VGP Golden Beach is an amusement park at the backdrop of Marina Beach the second longest beach of the world. It holds many interesting things like thrill rides, kids rides, aqua park, restaurants, theme parks, play stations for kids etc. The most interesting thing I liked there was aqua park. You may spend hours together enjoying different rides and slides in the aqua park. I wished I had taken my kids along. They would have enjoyed a lot. Don't forget to take your kids along. They will thank you forever.

Name: aruunkumar1987
Title: Good place to see
Review: Really good place to see, nice entrance and lot of things to do, one of good experience we had there

Name: Ricky2606
Title: Good Ole Times
Review: If you want to reminisce good ole'times this is a nice place to be . Lot of 90's movies were shot here . However the place still is in its 90's and doesn't look as it has been upgraded ever since. The beach is one of the cleanest ones I have seen in Chennai , few rides were enjoyable too but very few.

Name: Vani J
Title: Reasonable and wide spread to kill a day
Review: Family Dosa about a 10 feet long is the highlight is you are going in a family of over 10 or 15 members. Place is average and quite widespread. Old people might find it difficult to walk around. Rides are normal..nothing to rave about. Just a place to hangout, if you have visited all other places in Chennai.

Name: yssubramanyam
Title: heavenly
Review: artistic..worth visiting..recommended for all. married couple have plenty of joy to go around for romance. kids too have plenty fun places..

Name: laksmi21
Title: Could maintain better
Review: I have seen this beach in so many movies that I was looking forward to seeing it one day. But was disappointed in the lack of maintenance and interest in developing the place

Name: Veepy
Title: Give it a miss..
Review: Everyone in chennai would have visited this place many times over, right from ur childhood school picnic trips... NO new attractions and this place has not been upgraded for ages. So surely skip it..

Name: AshimMitra
Title: Clean but Lack of Maintenance
Review: No doubt it is very neat & clean area including beach... various types of rides the water kingdom and park is attractable..  Its a nice place for kids. But this is my fourth time visit to VGP Golden Beach I have noticed one fact that is they are not maintaining in all way. The environment and the things are not well as earlier. Basically the Toilet is very dirty and filled with water. Almost 8-9 yrs earlier the scenic beauty was natural & excellent, but at present its in one word dramatic.

Name: ansubarik
Title: Clean but costly
Review: A clean private beach with ample security men around. Preceded by a park and water kingdom with a variety of games to suit all tastes. Comes at a cost that's on a higher side.

Name: uma29july
Title: Very Clean and Beautiful.
Review: It is the most beautiful sea beach in Chennai. Golden san makes it attractive. However the biggest attration is it's absolutely neat and clean envoirnment. Most of the popular Hindi film songs are picturised here. It is worth to visit.

Name: Abhishek
Title: Clean Private Beach
Review: Its very clean private beach. The sand color is little bit Golden. Inside there are playgrounds and Play instruments for kids. You will find Bar, Food court, Shops and few small rides inside Golden beach. Its in ECR Road. Its a Paid Beach and you have to pay ‚Çπ300/- per person to Enter the beach. In special occasions and weekends the rate may increase. The beach is clean and beautiful but there nothing so special as they charge ‚Çπ300/- for a single ticket.

Name: vinoopm
Title: fun place with kids
Review: good beach location with many amusements to keep the little ones busy . can get quite crowded & of course a little away

Name: Pradeep Aji
Title: Beach is really good, nothing else including the BAR

Name: Mohan Krishnan
Title: Nostalgic
Review: A must place to visit while in chennai and visiting this place seems very nostalgic but his demise seems like yesterday for many.

Name: TravelTime
Title: Under renovation
Review: This place is currently under renovation so we could not get to go inside but was able to view from a distance, both MGR and Jayalalitha's is together and both are being reconstructed. Check with contacts in Chennai before planning for a visit.

Name: Sreenivaasan
Title: Good place near beach
Review: Must visitable place near marina beach. It is a monument on the honour of the former chief minister Mr. MGR. It also has a museum. The place is too beautiful and well maintained.The Marina Beach is a 10 km stretch, so you can start walking from an end and reach the other, if you love walking.Besides, the beach is huge and has a wonderful aura.If anyone comes to Chennai, then this is a must visit place.This should be at the top of priority list, as this is early accessible and nearer to the city centre Mall.

Name: Jozef Horvath
Title: Closed for reconstruction
Review: The place looks nice, but it‚Äôs closed and heavy reconstruction works blocks the entrance. The monument itself is also under reconstruction and can be seen only from the street behind the fence.

Name: ST_INDIA
Title: Pay tribute to MGR
Review: This is a place which is right at the Marina beach and beside Anna memorial. You can visit this place and pay your tribute to MGR.

Name: moogul818
Title: Impressive Memorial
Review: Off the beach road in Chennai, just on the Marina beach, this impressive memorial has been raised in memory of Dr MGR, the beloved and charismatic former Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu. The entrance to the memorial has a golden winged horse ( Pegasus) set against the two-leaf symbol of his political party. A movie icon, MGR is still revered in this state and his memorial attracts sizable visitors through out  the day . It is very well maintained and worth a visit even for a tourist.

Name: Srinivas S
Title: Nice place to spend time
Review: Created in the memory of late actor and CM. Nice place to spend time, nearer to the marina beach. It's properly maintained and well decorated.

Name: Nanthakumar Ganesan
Title: Good place near marina
Review: Good place near marina..maintanence is very good..More crowd will be there..I like the place..its full of granite and parks surrounded by this

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: well maintained
Review: The place is well maintained, so beautifully decorated and was one among the happening places of the city,built in memory of the most important leader of tamilnadu.

Name: Ananth 727499
Title: No words to describe some places.  This is one among them.
Review: This is the place where makkal thilakam Dr. M. G. R lies after his death.. Even today many believe that their beloved leader is not alive.. The name MGR itself does many magic in the minds of people even today.. Wide entrance with neat maintainance.. Come and pay your respect for the leader who is taking rest after his life..

Name: varun v
Title: Matinee Idol "Makkal Thilagam"
Review: a memorial built alongside Marina beach,place generally known as Anna square.If you are travelling in a bus, take Anna square bus.Memorials of  Annadurai and Jayalalitha are also close by.

Name: ViaBen
Title: Ugly memorial, filthy, crowded
Review: The memorial to the most popular and powerful actor-turned-politician of India is very popular with locals who still worship M.G. Ramachandran, but in my opinion is of no interest to anyone else. The memorial itself is a simple, big and ugly concrete structure by Marina Beach -  there are no explanations, no history, no information and when I visited, the area was overcrowded and very, very dirty. The giant building site around it (they are extending the memorial) adds to the chaos.

Name: manoj k
Title: memories never dies
Review: MGR Memorial is emotional expression of  people of  of Tamil Nadu for  MGR, the real hero of Tamil Nadu, it show the presence of MGR in the state, every day thousand of people from  from different part of the world vising the place.

Name: rea2der
Title: MGR Memorial
Review: I recently visited this memorial.It is one of the iconic memorial of Chennai dedicated to the former chief minister of tamilnadu.The place is usually overwhelmed by people and food is available nearby for purchase.Best time to hit is evening.

Name: Muguncjb
Title: Now, its one of four memorials at Marina
Review: If any one visit Chennai, the first attraction comes to mind is Marina beach. MGR memorial is located in Marina beach. It was built in the memory of former Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu state, M. G. Ramachandran, popularly known as MGR.  The memorial is located adjacent to the Anna Memorial built for another former Chief Minister of Tamilnadu, C.N.Anna Durai. In the last two years two more memorials have been planned to come up at this site for two former Chief Ministers of Tamilnadu, namely, J Jayalalitha and M. Karunanithi. Anyone visiting the Marina beach will have to see these memorials. There are people from various parts of Tamil nadu state who visit the beach especially to offer prayer at these memorials.

Name: Anusree P
Title: Good
Review: This is good for a one time visit. It situated in marina beach itself. But always crowdy. You may hear sound of a clock if you keep your ears near to the tomb

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Nice Memorial
Review: This is a memorial build in the memory of M G Ramchandran who was great leader from Tamil Nadu. Situated on the Marina beach this memorial is a piece of art work. Worth visiting.

Name: vasan224
Title: memorial structure for MGR
Review: The memorial was built in 1988 and was inaugurated by Janaki Ramachandran, wife of M. G. Ramachandran, in May 1990. it shows the biography of MGR.

Name: Arman1842
Title: Important place for Tamilnadu
Review: The remains of key people of Tamilnadu are lying here. Among them, Ms. Jaylalita, the mother is the latest. Although her memorial is not done yet. The site is wonderfully developed, situated just beside the sea beach. It has heavy traffic during peak times. So, consider it before planning your visit.

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: well maintained
Review: This place is in very close proximity to marina beach.Good lighting and well maintained and entry to this place is free

Name: Abdul wahaab
Title: Gud place to chill during summer
Review: It's in the sea shore near marina ..people who visits marina will visit this place too .it's well designed and built architect by TN government and maintained cleaning for people's to take rest ..one museum also located inside this memorial ..most important it falls under TN govt free WiFi zone

Name: TSAMM21
Title: MGR Memorial Park
Review: Crowded with fans , Could see many admirers trying to listen the tick -tick sound from MGR‚Äôs tomb which is believed to be from MGR‚Äôs well known Seiko watch.

Name: Sebin Benny
Title: MGR memorial
Review: Nice view with a background of calm ocean. If you are planning to visit Marina beach, you can visit this place as well. Will be crowded at peak times.

Name: 592abck
Title: You can go and visit this place
Review: You can visit this place if you have ample time and nothing left to be done.Otherwise please avoid this.

Name: scorpionchennai
Title: Memorial with open sky
Review: A memorial with beach at the back-ground definitely a treat for those who understand it..worth a visit at least once if you are in the beach.

Name: Wineglass2000
Title: Visit the ex-CMs of Tamil Nadu
Review: This is the resting site of two prominent ex Tamil Nadu Chief Ministers. Firstly, you will arrive at MGR's burial site. You will find a unique practice here (sometimes funny as well). People will placed their years on the tomb as though listening to some sound from it. The story behind that is when MGR was buried, he was buried with his favourite wrist watch. So, people place their ears on the tomb to hear the ticking of the watch (eyes rolling!).It's been 30 years since MRG passed away and people still believe the watch is ticking away. Just behind his tomb, lies J Jayalalitha's burial site. Fresh flowers are laid in design each day at her tomb. Heard she did a lot of good for the people and well-liked by many.

Name: Balasubramanian R
Title: MGR Memorial
Review: MGR Memorial was constructed in memory of late Ramachandran, Chief Minister of Tamil nadu on the sea shore of Bengal sea. Nearby Annadurai  memorial is there. This year they have constructed Late Jayalalitha memorial near by. People from Tamilnadu used to visit this place.

Name: Real Indian
Title: Serene and Beautiful
Review: A lovely serene place near Marina beach. For the beautiful view, visit in the morning before sunrise and enjoy the rising sun.

Name: worldwomantourist
Title: Memorial for the past Chief minister MGR
Review: MGR Memorial was constructed in the memory of the famous actor and former Chief Minister M G Ramachandran commonly known as MGR. His body was buried here. The place is well maintained. People visit this place to pay respect to him. The place is well maintained.

Name: s_ramsam
Title: Political history
Review: This memorial near the beach is part of the political history of the city and the state. Well maintained.

Name: Gopi sankar
Title: Mgr &amma memorial
Review: Its near to beach .nearest railway  station is cheppak  .we can see mgr memorial and amma memorial. Nice place &eveningtime good.

Name: dinesh_j84
Title: 'Well Maintained Memorial'
Review: This memorial is located close to the beach. It is well maintained and is visited by people of all walks of life. People visit this memorial to pay homage to their leader (MGR).

Name: Anusuya D
Title: landmark at marina beach
Review: for travellers who visit chennai , it is a landmark place. it is a good walking place and playful place for kids during weekdays.

Name: Thoufeeque B
Title: Ok!
Review: Has a vast garden around the structure and makes the structure look greeny and fresh. Facing towards the beach makes it more interesting.

Name: Ra_Radha
Title: Memorial on Marina Beach
Review: One of so-called tourist spots in Chennai -- MGR Memorial, built in fond memory of Late CM MGR of Tamil Nadu. It is near Marina Beach and hugely popular amongst tourists, esp on weekends and holidays.

Name: selvambikaiyali
Title: MGR memorial
Review: good infra, spent some time for the cool wind and clean place.need some sitting arrangements. view is good

Name: Dinesh_cbe
Title: Memorial(s) of Ex Chief Minister(s)
Review: One of the busiest and main attraction in Chennai. Most of the people who visiting Chennai never failed to visit this memorials of Ex-Chief Ministers MGR and Jayalalithaa to pay their homage to their lovable leaders. Very well maintained.

Name: sayanjeem
Title: Busiest place in Marina Beach
Review: MGR memorial along with newly constructed Jayalalitha memorial is the busiest place in Marina Beach. Thousands of followers visit this place every day to pay respect to their loved leader. A place to visit in Chennai

Name: Ghiri T
Title: A Place That Comes In Mind In a Talk about Chennai
Review: This is the place where everyone should visit while visiting Chennai. This is the place where the famous actor and former Chief Minister was buried. This place was constructed in the memory of him. The place is well maintained. Many visit everyday to pay respect to his grave.

Name: Joji J
Title: "a memorial of the former CM & Actor Dr. M.G. Ramachandran"
Review: In memory of the former CM and Tollywood Actor Dr. M.G. Ramachandran the MGR Memorial was constructed on Marina Beach and while we are at Marina beach we can see lot of people visiting the memorial. The memorial is spread over an area of 8 acres and the entrance is in the shape of two leaves which is AIDMK's (MGR's Party) symbol and pegasus, the horse from Greek Mythology, The open space is well landscaped with grass and ornamental plants, the pathway made of granite in the shape of a huge guitar, a fountain, waterfall, decorative lamps etc make the memorial really attractive. It's a wonder that the place is crowded on weekends and how people of Tamilnadu respect and remember the great political and movie icon. Nice place to visit and spend some time.

Name: AakashT91
Title: crazy fans
Review: I did the mistake of visiting this memorial on sunday. It was crowded like anything. Construction is good and it maintained properly.

Name: Prabhakar G
Title: visit to MGR memorial
Review: visited the MGR memorial at chennai. fantastic construction. remembering the achiever. good thought.

Name: Partha C
Title: MGR MEMORIAL
Review: It is on Marina Beach. A place for all people of Tamilnadu and World. Very peaceful and quiet. Beautiful  place and maintained nicely.

Name: Latheesh C
Title: Place of MGR fans
Review: This memorial is dedicated to the late chief minister of Tamil Nadu, Dr. M.G. Ramachandran and  charming actor.This is a famous place near marina beach.Fans of MGR must visit it.

Name: YatriForever
Title: A memorial
Review: Built on the famed Marina beach, this is just a memorial for the late politician MG Ramachandran aka MGR. Nothing much exciting for those who do not know MGR or who are from other parts of India.

Name: APK24
Title: Well maintained and peaceful place to visit
Review: In the hustle and bustle of Chennai, the place is almost like an oasis and gives you a lot of peace of mind. It is quiet and well maintained and has been designed well. It is certainly worth a visit.

Name: Anand G
Title: Good Memorial to a great Mass Leader
Review: It is a lovely mmorial where the great mass leader's message, 'diligence earns eminence',  through his life is engraved on his tomb. Nice lawns and walkways give a great ambiance. however, more information on the man and his achievements in his careers in both films and politics would have added appreciable value to this edifice. Nice place to be around in Eastern Chennai. The memorial/tomb of the recently deceased political disciple of his and a successfule Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu, Ms Jayalalithaa too is nearby on the eastern side of MGR's tomb.

Name: Arun S
Title: One of the Iconic landmark of Chennai
Review: MGR Memorial is a structure built on Marina Beach in Chennai in memory of farmer chief minister of Tamil Nadu doctor MG Ramachandran. It was built in 1988 and was inaugurated by Janaki Ramachandran wife of MGR. I recommend to visit here during early morning hours to avoid the crowd if you are visiting for photography. But its good yo visit any time of the day. There is no fee for visiting this Memorial. You may need to find free parking on the beach front. Also plan to visit Dr. J. Jeyalalitha memorial (Amma Memorial) just next to MGR Memorial.

Name: Rucha121
Title: Nice memorial
Review: Dedicated to Late CM of Tamil Nadu, the memorial is beautifully built, however, lack of trees especially during scorching summer heat makes you avoid. Best timing is early morning or evening after 5pm. Gets too crowded on weekends.

Name: jayareddy
Title: Nice memorial of former CM MGR
Review: Beautiful designed memorial arch at par with other memorials structured in other countries. Nice catch up for all Marina beach visitors.

Name: Arogya Raj
Title: Best place
Review: Best place to visit with family. Not recommended for friends. As a place is memorial of MGR . It's good to remember his leadership.

Name: K K
Title: A must see for MGR fans
Review: The former Chief Minister of Tamilnadu and a charming actor laid to rest in peaceful, yet buzzing part of the city. This is a must see place for MGR fans.

Name: Krishna
Title: a memorial structure for 2 former CM's of tamilnadu
Review: MGR memorial is a memorial structure built on the Marina beach in Chennai, India. It was built in memory of former Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu, M. G. Ramachandran, Now Jayalalitha too...

Name: vignesh d
Title: Now Jayalalitha too
Review: This memorial situated near to Anna square in the marina beach, now recently deceased former CM Jayalalitha also buried inside only. Peoples are visiting this place day & night.

Name: Nrsssss
Title: Place must visit !
Review: Well maintained place. Neat & clean. when you travel to chennai you must visit this place,.awesome place for family outing..

Name: Lakshmi Narayanan S
Title: Memorial of our beloved Chief Minister
Review: This memorial is dedicated for our late chief minister Dr. M.G. Ramachandran. This is a famous landmark on marina beach and is next to Dr. Annadurai's memorial. The place is well maintained and visited by many from India. Anyone from TN who visits Chennai for the first time will visit this place for sure. M.G.R's successor Dr. J. Jayalalitha who died recently is also placed next M.G.R. Here after it may be called as M.G.R and J.J memorial.

Name: Arun A
Title: In memory of MGR
Review: MG Ramachandran an yesteryear actor and chief minister of Tamilnadu has his Memorial on Marina beach next to Anna square. It attracts lots of visitors.

Name: ganeshpkumar
Title: One of the main attractions near Marina Beach
Review: Located close to the Marina Beach, this memorial is toward the former Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu Dr.M.G.Ramachandran. He is a actor turned politician and eventually ruled the state. The area is well maintained and beautiful lighting in the evening.

Name: Sanjeev K
Title: A must visit Place in Chennai
Review: Well maintained park, near to longest beach one & only Marine beach, Alot of street food vendor around it,

Name: Niya1315
Title: A nice Place to Visit
Review: It is built for the memory of M G Ramachandran, a political supremo of Tamil Nadu. It is on one side of Marina Beach and can be reached easily by Public Transport. A must visit place if you are in Marina Beach.

Name: Karthik V
Title: In memory of Late MGR
Review: Built as the resting place of the soul of the late Chief Minister and mtinee idol of Tamilnadu, Thiru M G Ramachandran's memorial built on the place where his mortal remains were buried is a architect wonder of modern times. The 2 leaves of his party in an inverted form is the entrance arch to his memorial. A must visit place by one and all. Usually visited by all the tourists who visit Chennai and the Marina beach.

Name: Sugania
Title: Well maintained memorial
Review: We had a beautiful stroll in this memorial, on a nice walkway, well kept garden and had beautiful architecture. I recommend this place for everyone who has enjoyed his movies.

Name: Shyamis
Title: On the beach
Review: Good place for MGR fans, other than that it is just another memorial on the beach. Maintained well. If you have time to sprare and nothing else to do then stroll along.

Name: cool1960
Title: Good Memorial
Review: MGR is loved by lots of people here in Tamilnadu so this place is considered to be a temple like.Well built and it is in the centre of the city and near to the beach, which attracts lots of crowd here. Visit to this place takes you to lots of other sight seeing places nearby.

Name: Er_Maninder
Title: Beautiful Memorial
Review: It is situated on the famous Marina beach.It is a must visit place if you are  visiting for the first time and the architecture is wonderful and in the evening after lightning you can see the glimpse of wonderful art

Name: Kumar_Harshdeep
Title: Good lighting in the evenings!
Review: The first thing you notice when you reach this place is the hardly concealed AIADMK election symbol of two leaves adorning the entrance of the memorial. The place is crowded with fans and supporters paying their respects to the late actor/politician. The memorial is right next to the beach. The architecture is eclectic as well. Overall, the place can serve as a quick stopover to tick off in the list of places to see in the city.

Name: kathiranand7
Title: Wonderful Place
Review: The most important place in chennai it is located in chennai merina beach very good place and very neat ...

Name: engineer2207
Title: 10 minutes visit
Review: If it is yr first visit, then visit this place. MGR memorial is situated in the garden. You may take just 10 minutes to visit this place

Name: sugunapriya b
Title: Nice and neatly maintained memorial
Review: The memorial looks good from the beach and inside it there is a statue of late m.g.r and also akhanda Jyothi is lighted at the place where he is rested.

Name: Mathivanan V
Title: Nothing much to Offer...except some snaps
Review: Situated in Marina beach just opp to madras university next to Anna  memorial.Except the place is near the beach with some cranky architecture entrance ,there is nothing it can offer.Ex CM MGR memorial is just another land mark in Marina beach

Name: SagarVS
Title: If you are in this area...
Review: If you are in the Marina beach area, you could visit this place. A visit is recommended only if you are a fan of the movie star and politician. Otherwise it would be just another memorial for the visitor. Ten minutes is all it takes to visit and pay your respects.

Name: CyrilGubbi
Title: Popular Spot in marina Beach..
Review: This is the memorial of Earlier Chief Minister of Tamilnadu. Popular among his fans as he was also an very popular actor. Also being part of Marian beach is a good tourist spot

Name: Baskar_Raman
Title: Historic spot
Review: A great place to spend the evening, starting with the visit to the memorials and ending with the visit to the beach

Name: ravikumartalara
Title: best tribute to mgr
Review: if you visiting marina first time .you can visit mgr and anna memorial which are side by side..you cab see people from all parts of chennai

Name: seedhunter
Title: Well maintained memorial
Review: MGR was iconic figure of Tamilnadu. His memorial on Marina is also iconic. Well maintained but crowded. Better to in the morning. If want to enjoy with crowd then in the evening.

Name: jeffrey9891
Title: Lovely situated, interesting and climatic place for culture lovers.
Review: Lovely situated, interesting and climatic place for culture lovers.Memorial of legendary Indian actor,director, producer, and politician who also served as the Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu - Marudhur Gopalan Ramachandran.

Name: Somarghya D
Title: MGR
Review: Its a memorial build as a tribute to late Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu, Dr M G Ramachandran who is a legend and popularly known as MGR and the memorial is good enough to take a few pictures. Its very close to the Marina Beach so if you have time you can visit the memorial and spend a little time. Best time to visit would be in the evening.

Name: Shiva S
Title: MGR
Review: A major landmark built as a tribute to the late Former Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu, Dr M G Ramachandran - popularly known as MGR. It is right next to the memorial of another legendary leader of the state Late Shri Annadurai who led the Dravidian movement. We can enjoy the scenic view of beach as well as Memorial of this great leader in the evening time.

Name: pratiknruparel
Title: Nice Memorial at sea cost !
Review: This memorial is built near marina beach and very good place to visit and give regards to late M.G.R. At evening time the atmosphere is really nice and worth to pay a short visit.

Name: Subhashani
Title: Discovering MGR the local way
Review: As a kid had heard a lot of stories about MGR from my father. Though I did not understand the language still saw some of his movies on television. A multifaceted man with loads of charisma and talent, he was looked upon by everyone and became an iconic figure in every stream of his life.At the cost of sounding ignorant I will accept that when I landed in Chennai and decided to visit the Marina Beach, I had no clue that there was a memorial in his name. So how could I miss it?There are no entry tickets and there is a museum in the same campus which we missed due to lack of time. According to available information the memorial has undergone a lot of renovations to look like what it looks today. It is best if you read a bit about the man and the memorial before visiting it, especially if you have no idea of his cult following.The place is well kept and neat but very crowded. People throng to it like a pilgrimage site. We were there on a weekday and were told that weekends are jam packed. Spent approximately 2 hours roaming around, watching people and just chatting.There is an ever burning lamp and people make sure to bow down to it. We noticed some people putting their ears and trying to listen to something. When we enquirer they said that there is a ticking sound coming from inside the black marble/granite structure. Some said it is MGR's heart and some more reasonable ones said that when the structure was built MGR's wrist watch was buried inside and one can still hear the ticking. When we tried we could not hear anything but believers are believers.So if you stay long enough you can gather enough stories for dinner :) Either way it is a good way to spend a few hours and chat with the locals and get to know more about how the public looks at MGR.There are finger foods and snacks available and then the beach is right next door with many eating options.

Name: ChivasG
Title: Memorial of legendary leader of Tamil Nadu - Dr MGR
Review: A major landmark built as a tribute to the late Former Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu, Dr M G Ramachandran - popularly known as MGR. It is right next to the memorial of another legendary leader of the state Late Shri Annadurai who led the Dravidian movement. It is a major attraction on Chennai's famous Marina beach. A true landmark for the city and its political evolution in post-independence India.

Name: Hooray H
Title: Quaint little Museum
Review: The origins of Madras. very important to see this & to realise why foreigners came from so far away; India is so rich. It was a battle between the British, Portuguese & French, with the Russians & then Germans also wanting a piece of the action.Where has that wealth gone since independence?That is the important question.They don't want to share it with you!Alas, it was closed on the day we visited the Fort.

Name: Anand M
Title: India Story that lends a deep insight
Review: It is amazing to understand how a handful of British on lookout for business, converted the divide and vulnerability of this country into an empire without fighting any serious war by using just some hired local talent. The museum also reflects how British artists and freelancers made a career out of visiting India and applying themselves. When you are committed and love your profession, success is a natural fallout. That sums up this Museum.

Name: Deepa Moses
Title: Must Visit Museum in Chennai
Review: This Museum is a must visit one in Chennai. The Armaments section has displays of different kinds of weapons such as cannons, guns, swords and daggers in use during British rule. There is a section for uniforms worn by officers in the British army, the various medals conferred on them and the coins minted during British rule.The first floor has portraits in oil painting of the different Governers of the Fort and their wives, the Kings and Queens of England and the Arcot Nawabs. There are also aquatints of different places giving a glimpse of life in those days. The second floor houses burial urns and a sacrophagus and gives a good understanding of burial practices in South India during the Neolithic and Iron Age. The piece-de-resistance is the only surviving Indian flag that was hoisted on the First Independence Day. Loved the collection displayed in the museum and most certainly recommend this place

Name: Praveenop
Title: A small museum which shows a piece of British contributions and history of Chennai
Review: This place is located in the Fort St. George which is the office of the Tamil Nadu govt. There are a lot of excellent paintings connected to the British times which is worth seeing.The place could have been been maintained much better if the TN govt takes some interest and promote it.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: nice place
Review: This is one of the most sort after place of the city as it's speaks history of the city and it's people.this is a must see place.

Name: kathy b
Title: A dip into history
Review: I loved this museum.  It showed and told how Chennai looked during the Colonial years.  Some of it made uncomfortable reading but it was fascinating.  Huge oil paintings of the people that governed here with models and sketches of how the city used to look.  Little bit shabby in places but overall a very interesting visit.

Name: tristanr
Title: Small museum, heavy on detail
Review: Located within the Fort St George base, this museum contains an assortment of colonial-era artefacts: coins, uniforms, weapons and paintings. They serve to tell the story of the fort across its ~300 year lifespan. Be prepared for lots of reading, however - this is a traditional museum. Stairs are steep and many. As others have said, this could be so much better.

Name: Colin W
Title: Bit dull
Review: Went on Sunday, took longer to sign in than walk through the building. It is old granted, but its very dull and not well looked after. Shame, was looking to see how India evolved away from the British,  Expected more and disappointed.

Name: Chris W
Title: Could be very good
Review: Situated in the old government building by the prime minister's office it offers a glimpse into the English era in Madras. Established when artifacts could be displayed with a brief name of the item, we have moved on a good video talking about the time would help a lot.The 18th century prints of arriving and embarking at Madras were really fascinating.Even though foreigners pay 250 and locals only 30, there were hardly any visitors.A museum to see if you are in the area if you want to know more of the period.

Name: RAMAKRISHNAN K
Title: Must visit for tourist
Review: The place is located inside the fort located on beach road .. The museum has got excellent collection and well maintained..The place has got two floors of collections ranging from war memories of British era ..One remarkable item is flag hoisted on Indian independence at chennai fort..One of nice collections ..History has been depicted very nicely..Children would enjoy a lot ..

Name: Charles_and_Susan
Title: A selection of memorabilia
Review: It's not a large museum but there's snipets of all sorts. Including uniforms, guns and ammunition of the period, pottery and information about the development of the fort. Some large paintings of Kings and Queens who played a part in the British India story are also displayed. Give it a go.

Name: EnigmaticIndia
Title: Some piece of history to see
Review: Getting here needs security clearance as the fort house govt offices.The whole place has three floors and in the ground floor one can see lot of coins, armoury anf history of how the fort was built.The next floor has a lot of massive paintings of the English kings and queens and some type of painting impressions.What we liked most was the huge Indian National Flag that was hoisted on 1947 here at Fort st George.Well cant compare this to other large museums but it does its bit of addition to the historical knowledge for people like us.

Name: Rajkumar R
Title: Interesting only for History lovers
Review: The Museum has Portraits, Statues, War equipments, coins, Medals and history of the Fort. It takes less than 1 hour to visit this place. You need to go security checking before entering the campus. Car parking is free and just opposite to the site.

Name: Peter S
Title: A disgrace!
Review: It's commendable that the former British officers' mess is open to the public. I was intrigued to enter it - it was uncomfortably warm even on a January day with fans going: what might it have been like in summer heat with only punkahs? (And the punkah bars are still visible fixed to the ceilings - fascinating!)But as a museum, the Fort Museum is a complete disgrace. It comprises half a dozen room over three floors displaying a random collection of historical tat - old crockery, weapons, coins, copies of portraits of various monarchs and governors etc., and on the top floor the most negligent display on the freedom movement you've ever seen. The whole thing is a complete mess and a waste of your time and money. The only really interesting room was the display of a huge model of the fort c.1870. The rest was pointless, mouldering junk, unexplained, or poorly explained, and not worth the 200 rupee fee foreign visitors are charged. Photography is supposedly prohibited - presumably to stop the world knowing how bad the place is, a ban easily evaded. (Why would you stop people taking of photos of stuff they want to remember? I was very interested in the history of the fort: why would you want people not to take photos of the excellent model of the place?) The whole thing was as appalling as the worst historical 'museum' I've seen anywhere in India. Don't miss it!

Name: worldwomantourist
Title: Many rare artifacts on display
Review: Fort Museum is a famous Historical place. Wide variety of olden vessels and dishes kept in display. It displays paintings, guns, military items, Coins, statues of english men, their dresses, weapons and the products of their time when they lived here in India. . Fort Museum is a calm place.

Name: hollySalisbury
Title: Interesting colonial stuff
Review: Basically Chennai isn‚Äôt a tourist Mecca, but this museum did have some interesting artefacts and full length oils of monarchs, senior military and Indian moguls associated with the East India Company.  Security because the museum is inside the fort with its state government.

Name: tomasvalter
Title: No good choice
Review: It was just pure. Compare to museums at Europe there is huge gap. They have what to show but building maintenance finish yers ago. As well family decide to visit toilet and this was challenge. Close to museum is nice church. Good to see.  But as well you have to go true messy areas. As There is a lot of ministry located at old for then I Do not understand why they cannot place clean and organize. Somehow I do accept that I have to pay 200 rupiahs for entry and local 15 but do not know where money goes. And not allowing to take pictures. ????

Name: Thusanee L
Title: Historical museum
Review: Nice museum to visit for those whom are interested in the history of Fort St. George and its meaning to Chennai. The exhibition are for porcelain was beautiful. I wish they could elaborate more about history and appearance of the tablewares. I wish also that they had more artifacts about Tamilnadu freedom fighters, as well as Indian freedom fighters. The coins and oil painting exhibition was marvelous! It¬¥s worth a visit just to watch that!

Name: Carlos Scott Lopez
Title: Weak offerings given the price
Review: Notable site with several rooms of paraphernalia spread over several floors, but likely only of value to locals. Indeed, the pricing scheme where foreigners pay over 1,200% more than locals (200 versus 15 Rupees) makes the site not worth visiting unless one is a local and can pay the local price. (This said, one could envisage paying slightly more (e.g., 10%-20% more) to find the site worth the entry fee, but nothing over this.)Also, seeing wealthy Indians coming to visit - while students on small budgets were charged so much more - proved somewhat saddening to witness.

Name: Partha C
Title: Fort Museum-Historical
Review: It is a famous place and Historical.  Many Galleries are there, paintings, Guns,  Military items, Coins, Statues are very interesting.  Entry fees are there.  Lot of development needed.

Name: babarozsi
Title: If you have plenty of time
Review: Its an OK place to visit, altough I dont think its a "must-see" when in Chennai. There are some great old coins and other antiques, and the part of the exhibition which explains about the city's history is also quite interesting.

Name: Biddy50
Title: Not worth the visit
Review: There are 10 galleries spread over 3 floors. The is glass cabinets of military memorabilia, coins & artworks from colonial times.

Name: PaulW0511
Title: Could be so much better
Review: Given the significance of this fort, it was really disappointing to see such a tired place that obviously hasn't had a rupee spent on it in decades.  The displays were old, no descriptions to bring them to life.  A whole room full of coins and medals with no details of their significance.   Overall, it really needs the whole place starting again.  A big plus, however, is the little cafe round the back of the museum, the best masala tea I've ever had in India, great food at rock bottom prices and lovely people!

Name: ghosal_rg
Title: The British museum of Chennai
Review: How great and glorious were the faces of these rulers!How beautiful and immaculate were their coins(which they understood a little more than usual) and porcelains!How strong were their weapons which put any revolt for freedom in bay!What a fortification!What canons!Reminds us of Sir Robert Clive who brought civilisation to Indians!Alas,probably the sentries guarding these do not know the values of the materials,arranged shoddily and full of shadows.

Name: SyedIqbal123
Title: English Men culture revealed
Review: Fort Museum is a calm place.  It is worth visiting this place once, as it has culture of English Men, their dresses, weapons and the products of their time, when they lived here in IndiaA nice variety of olden vessels and dishes is there.  Array of out dated coins are also available.Photography is prohibited inside the museum.  Outside we can take some pictures.This Fort Museum is located inside the Tamil Nadu Secretariat campus, which requires frisking of Personnel entering in to the Campus.

Name: vasan224
Title: historical place
Review: one of the place to protect and care by chennai people, if it care it will be a good place to visit.

Name: gargamit100
Title: Not well maintained!
Review: Good collection but overall just average. Museums in India have great artifacts but the maintenance & display is pretty ordinary (sometimes outright shoddy). If it needs a higher entry fees, so be it but the state of the museums must improve.

Name: Deepak J
Title: Do visit if you are interested in history of British empire in India.
Review: You can find many interesting pre-independence things in here. One of such thing is the India's first tri-colour flag. You will get goosebumps after seeing that. Although it is nicely maintained, things can improve. It is located near Fort railway station only so you don't have to travel much,

Name: ChrisJS51
Title: Good background to hopw Chennai came to be the way it is
Review: History of the city, including the days of the Raj and leading figures who made the city what it is today. Worth a visit although it shouldn't detain you for more than an hour.f

Name: Alone_You_go
Title: Small Museum....ok ...but not great
Review: The museum is within the premises of secretariat and hence lots of security. The museum is not big and very great. The paintings at the 1st floor were good. It has some good interesting things. But the paintings are really good.

Name: SydneySchoey
Title: Not worth the effort
Review: Disappointing. Some decent artefacts but terrible presentation and very little information about the presence and influence of the East India Company.

Name: SWmuse
Title: One of the worst I have ever visited!
Review: Poorly laid out, incredibly badly lit, stairs and no lift for disabled or infirm visitors. Once more I was struck by the seeming lack of care India has for its history. The museums, which I accept most probably lack funding, are in a poor, bedraggled state. I am sure the exhibits are fascinating but they are, in the main, so badly promoted and exhibited that the effort involved in seeing them outweighs their artistic and educational value. I found the experience a little dispiriting.

Name: Eat1Drink2Travel3
Title: Interesting but not looked after
Review: It seems that India doesn't care about the first ever flag which was raised after independence. The rag is disintegrating and won't last very long. Paintings were dusty and paint peeling off. It's a nice place to get out of the sun and view old coins, arms, paintings etc but also sad to note how little it is cared for.

Name: Akash K
Title: Under cared Museum
Review: this is a small museum with sculpture and paintings used by rulers of Madras.you can find many good pieces of art to explore here.

Name: KeRa N
Title: Historic site
Review: This place is guarded by the police and they are not friendly towards tourists. The building is well maintained and houses an excellent collection of arms, uniforms, medals, coins and paintings. Halls and halls of it. If history is your thing, then this one is for you.

Name: Albia-Newton
Title: Overpriced and under cared for
Review: 200 INR to see some not very well kept artifacts.The display on Indian Independence has some interesting facts in - as does the bit on the building of the fort

Name: robcc1971
Title: Fort St George Museum
