Review: An age old university, which has given some of the best minds to the country!! Location is also very nice.. A must visit, even if u cant study here.

Name: VinodKV
Title: a good place to visit if you are interested in education in chennai
Review: this is an old institution of learning in chennai. known for its ancient culture and alumni, this institute is famed for its heritage.

Name: meghashyam
Title: Madras University .
Review: Age old institution , colonial buildings , got lots of streams of education for correspondence students also .

Name: kathiranand7
Title: Nice
Review: Madras university is one of the most important university this is nice place to study very good ....

Name: madhubarwa
Title: Beachyyyy view
Review: I just was exploring since it was close to the marina beach.....wish i was a student there. I would take my books and study sitting by the beach ...air blowing my hair......

Name: ravikumartalara
Title: old university in  madras
Review: very ancient and historical university...so many popular studied here..very near to marina..you can cool breeze of marina

Name: sundarjagalan
Title: Oldest University
Review: this place is bang opposite to MGR memorial at marina beach. U can visit this place from  outside, good British architecture style building and it is  one of the very old University in India

Name: kevinjohn1991
Title: Old University in Chennai!!
Review: It is one of the oldest universities in India. The campus is extremely beautiful and houses one of the larger libraries in Chennai. The univeristy has a host of notable alumni as well!!!

Name: mendapara
Title: OLDEST UNIVERSITY
Review: University is very old and very well maintained. Campus of University of Madras is very beautiful. Library at University of Madras is one of the large library in tamilnadu.

Name: Raju L
Title: Oldest building par excellence!
Review: Recently, I had to visit the University of Madras to obtain the transcripts of my son-in-law and I started reminiscing the beauty of the buildings. As an alumni of the same University, though I had come several times before as a student, I did not admire the excellence of the architectural aspects then & I took the opportunity to leisurely view the building during the waiting time I spent before getting the transcripts in hand.I would like to thank the University for the speedy processing of transcripts within the same day.

Name: rockspeeder
Title: must see during visit of marina beach
Review: Situated along the beach road, Huge grounds with old structures is a perfect photo place.One of several campus of University of Madras and located opposite the Marina Beach, is worth of a visit before going to the beach. Take a walk inside the campus, get a taste of the university's atmosphere, and visit the photo exhibition in the Senate building.

Name: Lakshmi R
Title: Worth Visiting
Review: It is just opposite to Marina Beach. Must visit Senat hall. The architecture of the building have a nice British touch to it.

Name: Valluri Mukesh Krishna
Title: Nice Architecture and Photographers Dream
Review: Excellent Architecture and Lovely Place for a Photoshoot.. Visitors not allowed inside..But it's a very reputed University..

Name: Ajay S
Title: Love Architecture and Knowledge. Go there
Review: If you love Architecture and Knowledge, visit this place. Excellent place to walk around and look at old schools. Eat at the canteen, for some authentic 'college students food' :)

Name: GuelphTraveller
Title: Important Architecture in Chennai
Review: You can walk onto Oxford University and Harvard and virtually any university in the world as a tourist and take pictures but not the University of Madras. You can photograph from the street but the trees make it difficult. This restriction on photography is a serious obstacle for tourists and researchers in India. However the Senate building is an important Indo-Sarcenic building which is a Victorian picturesque style with blended Italian and Sarcenic designs. It is the masdterpiece of architect Robert Chisholm and was completed in 1873. In addition the Presidency College which gave photo permission is also on site and is another good example of the style. There are other interesting buildings in the area including the crumbling remains of the Chepauk Palace (1768) once the home of the Nawab of Arcot.

Name: tsashi
Title: Old building, nice to photograph
Review: Situated along the beach road, this old establishment is a must for anyone who loves buildings. Huge grounds with old structures is a perfect photo place.

Name: Bornav
Title: Visitors not allowed inside
Review: The main university campus with historic colonial buildings located by the seaside looks impressive from outside. However, visitors are not allowed to enter the premises. This area is relatively peaceful in the evening for a walk by the sea.

Name: Mikael S
Title: Historic place of education
Review: One of several campus of University of Madras and located opposite the Marina Beach, is worth of a visit before going to the beach. Take a walk inside the campus, get a taste of the university's atmosphere, and visit the photo exhibition in the Senate building. Adjacent to the exhibition there's University of Madras' Bookshop in which a illustrative book about University's history and architecture is available.

Name: bsp2010
Title: Oldest & best
Review: I have done my MBA in Madras University (also called University of Madras) during 84-86. We have celebrated 25 years silver jubilee last year. For last 2 years, I am a regular visitor. Many of our batch students and seniors and juniors are at very high positions (directors, president, vice president, etc ) across the industries. This simply proved that the university is really excellent.

Name: dksud
Title: Senate Hall - Marvelous architect, fantastic history
Review: Madras University, established in 1857, must be one of the oldest Universities of India. I just happened to view the dome of Madras University's Senate Hall from across the MGR Samadhi at Marina Beach and was immediately attracted by beautiful domes painted with vibrant colors. I am glad that I walked through the subway to this great monument.The architect from outside is so captivating that I took numerous rounds of the Hall to capture it in my camera from various angles. From the outside the architect dominated by domes appears Islamic. But from inside, there is a complete transformation in style. With its tainted glasses, curved walls, long pillars, painted ceiling and a podium, it can pass as a beautiful Catholic church. Carvings of Hindu gods and godesses  on the columns at the entrance compliment the architect blend.Architect alone is not the only attraction. There is a permanent exhibition of documents, photographs and  paintings depicting not only the history of Madras University but also history of education institutes starting from 11th Century.Some of most important documents display the curriculum, salary paid to teachers and allowance paid to students during height of Chola dynasty in South.Building and its surroundings can do with some improvement is house keeping. I would rate it the best toursit attraction of Chennai after Mahabalipuram.

Name: Aaqarsh Aiyyar
Title: Artificially natural!
Review: The East India Company (and the British Government) should be attributed to the grand architecture that stands tall for more than a century. The University is diagonally opposite to the world-famous Marina beach. But my favourite area is the library which I've been visiting regularly for the past two decades. You can enjoy the melodious music of humming birds if you get an opportunity to sit on the corridor of the library around six in the evening. The sound of waves is also heard at times. Highly recommended for nature lovers!

Name: arul_nambi2000
Title: One of the govts. pride
Review: The buildings are quite beautiful and full of architectural marvels. The ambiance can be created only in govt. institutions with lots of trees and space to move around. The buildings stands still good with less maintenance. Govt to think of making this also as a tourist spot making the museum live

Name: Rasheed I
Title: Bureaucratic and unhelpful
Review: Typical government attitudes where the staff believe they are doing you a favour for everything. Vast campus and much walking to be done with no helpful boards or signs to indicate what is available where.

Name: Sindhu N
Title: I am student of University of Madras
Review: I am student of University of Madras, so in relation to all my degrees I used to visit this place regularly till 2005... after that also I have visited this place many times till 2010...

Name: rprabhoo
Title: Citadel of Learning
Review: Even in today's crass commercial world, University provides quality education and research facilities in all spheres of life.

Name: Abhishek
Title: Nothing to see here
Review: Its a Old Running University. If you visit this place then you can only see the Architecture, University Stuffs, a few Students and their Guardians there. Nothing more. Very close to Marina Beach and Chepauk.

Name: DrKumaresh
Title: Know the Importance of this Temple
Review: Its a must visit temple, not only is Amma Suyambu but this place has lots more history.Sage Agastiyar witnessed the Celestial Marriage from this place, Lord Murugan got his Vel from this place and the Godess Prithiyangara here is so powerful that your wishes get granted, but one needs to be careful as to what they wish for since the repercussions too will be severe.

Name: suria4u2
Title: Visited the temple with my family
Review: I visited the temple on my travel to Chennai. I have always wanted to visit the amman once in a lifetime. In my own country we have the similar amman statue. The temple is old with ancient architecture. Felt the vibration and positive energy as I entered the temple, good ambiance . Photography are not allowed.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Vaprasiddhi pettra sthalam if rahu desai in the jadagam
Review: The temple is in thiruverkadu  near chennai and is dedicated to goddess parvati worshipped as devi karumariamman.

Name: Dr. Senthil Kumar. D
Title: ARULMIGU DEVI KARUMARIAMMAN TEMPLE, THIRUVERKADU
Review: One of the sportive arts of Devikarumari. One day Devikarumari took the image of old nomadic lady and went to Sun to forecast his future. Without realising her as Devikarumari, He simply neglected her. Devikarumari immediately vanished. Sun has lost it's brightness and its glory started declining. Realising his mistake He begged Devikarumari to forgive and excuse him. Sun also requested Devikarumari to celebrate Sunday as the day of Devikarumari. Devikarumari also accepted it.He also got permission from Her to pour on her sun rays twice in a year in the month of Panguni and Purattasi. So Sunday is celebrated as the day of Karumari . We can happily witness the scene of sun rays falling on the head of Devikarumari twice in a year. Devikarumari made Narayanan Seat there.Once upon a time Lord Thirumal came to Thiruverkadu to witness the grace rule of Umadevi. When Thirumal personally met his sister Karumari, she requested him "to seat there as Srinivasan of Thirumurai and assist Her and bless the devotees who worship Navagraham and stand towards southern direction". He was happy and promised Her, that He would sit by her side and protect the position of Nine planets. Veda Viyasar was extremely happy to see Annai Parasakthi and Lord Venkatesan together.

Name: MohanaKrishnan S
Title: Peaceful place
Review: Very Old temple and Peaceful place to visit . Amman is decorated well all the time which brings you nice feel and satisfaction to worship. Near by puthu amman also a major attraction to visit. Plenty of transport facility from City and also ample space available for Car/Van/ Bus parking.

Name: Narayanan S
Title: Powerful deity
Review: Mangadu Mariamman is all that we expect of a powerful goddess. The temple is crowded but one can have a quick darshan by seeking a paid entrance. The deity is just beautiful, benevolent and commanding. I will recommend this temple to all believers

Name: plpalani
Title: Powerful Devi
Review: This temple is well known for the powerful Devi Karumariamman. On Tuesday‚Äôs it is crowded... hence go with Rs50 entry ticket or Rs20 .Free darshan takes time.

Name: saranyaupendaran
Title: An oasis of peace in the midst of chaos
Review: This is one of the most famous devi temples in Chennai, and as a result, is very crowded on Tuesdays, Fridays and Sundays.  The sanctum sanctorum houses a beautifully decorated bust of the goddess Karumariamman, and devotees are allowed to worship in small groups of 15-20 people in order to avoid congestion in the very narrow space.The streets around the temple are very crowded and traffic moves in a chaotic manner.   Better traffic regulation is definitely required.  There is no chappal stand, and footwear is left in a haphazard manner all around the entrance to the temple.   The highway leading to the temple is also in bad condition, potholed and narrow.  The temple is open on all days from 5am in the morning and closes only at 9.30pm.  On Sundays which are especially auspicious to visit the goddess, the temple opens and closes an hour earlier and later.   There are special entry tickets for Rs.50/- and Rs.20/- in addition to the free darshan queue.  The 50/- rupee entry tickets allows you a closer look at the goddess.The temple has a legend associated with the sun god.  Parvathi Devi is believed to have visited Surya in the guise of an old woman, ostensibly to forecast his future, but was not received with respect.  Furious, she cursed Surya to lose his divine radiance, and the penitent sun god is believed to have undertaken severe penance in order to have his radiance restored.   The rays of the sun also fall directly on the idol of the goddess twice in a year, during the Tamil months of Purattasi and Panguni.The temple can be covered in half a day along with the Vedapureeswarar temple, also at Thiruverkadu, and the Kamakshi amman temple at Mangadu.  The ambience would be even better if the temple was kept clean.

Name: khanakhazana
Title: Inner peace
Review: This temple is situated in the centre of cityI can feel inner peace in this place. Have been several times to this place.

Name: Ravindran N
Title: Place with divine feel
Review: U ll surely feel the divinity here. Temple is much crowded n definitely one must visit this temple as lots of people have their belief in the power of this deity.

Name: RamGanesan
Title: Powerful Devi Temple
Review: I have been in Chennai for decades but did not get the opportunity to visit this place till last week.  Though the Adi celebrations were over the streets were still crowded. The access to the temple is really congested from all sides.  Though there is a parking for vehicles getting to the parking is the biggest challenge.  The devi is in a small form and one can feel her presence the moment we near the sanctum.  Commercialization is evident and long q and paid darshan seem to have become the norm.  That is the sad part.  If one can ignore these aspects then the darshan could be peaceful.  A very famous temple that draws crowds from all over south india.  Best to avoid going on Fridays holidays and the tamil month of Aadi.

Name: Jothilingam E
Title: Famous tempke
Review: Must visit when you are in chennai.you can visit all the days but Friday will he little crowded.nice temple with ample parking and pray for all good wishes

Name: Karthik R
Title: Divine experience
Review: Divine experience guaranteed. The temple is located 5 minutes walk from the Thiruverkadu bus stand in quite narrow lanes. The parking space is very limited near the temple and even the streets around are very narrow and difficult to park. Mind it.The temple has free dharshan and paid dharshan - for Rs.20 and Rs.50. The temple is normally crowded in weekend and public holidays. It takes around 1 hour if you go on normal dharshan on weekends.

Name: segar s
Title: My calling to this temple again.
Review: Its my second visit to this temple. Starting from outside, there are rows of flower shops but the sales persons of all the shops will call out to buy from them, which can put anyone in stress to choose. This is an old temple with interesting carvings, like many huge temples it need to be taken care of. Strong vibration felt here especially at the main sanctums. Forget everything even yourself and concentrate on the deity and ou will know what I mean.If you don't like the pushing and being sandwiched by the crowd avoid Fridays, important events and festivals.There is also a small shrine outside the main temple, inside is giant puthu ( snake pit ).

Name: Prabhakaran
Title: One of the best Sakthi Sthala near Chennai
Review: This temple gives me nostalgic memories. My mother is very emotionally connected to the goddess here and have been visiting this place for 30+ years now. The temple is in tiruverkadu and you need to take a right turn after you pass underneath the outer ring road in the koyambedu poonamallee high road. The temple is crowded during holidays and if you are travelling by car then parking might be a challenge. There is a parking facility about 500metres from the temple. You can approach the parking from a parallel road if the temple street is crowded. The look of goddess fills you with lots of eternal energy. There is a special darshan tickets to be bought at the main entrance. There is a huge ant hill that is believed to be presided by the snake god. People offer egg and milk here and yes the place is low on cleanliness due to excessive egg/milk spills but beliefs are on a high!!. Visit early morning during weekdays for a good experience.

Name: meghashyam
Title: Maa
Review: Maa is verily present here , we can feel her overwhelming presence , a very powerful temple , Fridays n Tuesdays are too crowded . Mangadu kamakshi Amman temple is also nearby

Name: Ramachandran
Title: Exhilarating experience for the devout
Review: This temple situated in the outskirts of the city, is famous for Karumariamman who is kindness personified who showers the devout with kindness in all facets of their lives. In case one needs to have peaceful darshan and want to meditate in the premises they have to choose the days with no festival or week-ends or Tuesday or Friday. During festival days thousands of devotees throng to have a glimpse of the Goddess.

Name: rasa006
Title: Good Amman Temple near Chennai and famous too for pilgrims, women in particular.
Review: This temple is located West of Chennai, around 17.5 kms from Chennai. This is on Poonamalle high road near Vanagaram and around 2.5 kms from main road to temple.This temple is many years old, each one saying some years, but as per temple almanac (koil Puranam)it is more than 900-1000 years old.This amman is in suyambu form, upto waist height and this amman is very powerful. Every body pray her for prosperity and ward-off evils in one's life. Those who fix marriages in their family, pray Amman for smooth functioning of marriage and seek HER blessings for the newly married. Aadi Uthsavam (July15-Aug15) is famous in this temple and also Navrathri festivals. Vilakku Pooja (lamp pooja) by women attracts good attention and crowd.On outer pragara, Uthsava Amman is placed on palanquin ( OOnjal) and she enjoys swinging, temple priest said. A rare sight. We can see wooden Amman in glass - covered sanctum and it is believed , if we pray Her here, this Marachilai Amman (wooden Amman) will bestow all worldly benefits to Her devotees.We can also prayed Lord Srinivasa Perumal with Mahalakshmi and Lord Anjaneyar in separate sannidhi. Over all we had good dharshan on Wednesday. During Friday,Sunday and other festive days, devotees throng the temple and generally one has to wait around 50 minutes even in paid queue. There 2 paid queues-one is Rs.20/- per head and another one is Rs.50/- per head. In Rs.50/- entrance, they allow only 10-15 people at a time for dharshan. There is also free dhardhan available.

Name: VRAMESH
Title: Powerful Amman
Review: Devi Karumariamman temple is located in Thiruverkaadu, 18 kms from Chennai. Very ancient temple constructed in 1943. Devi Karumariamman is the presiding deity. Very powerful goddess. Visited this temple with family. Feel vibrant when we enter inside the temple.  The temple is open from 5.00 a.m. to 9.00 p.m.

Name: Radhu K
Title: Ancient temple
Review: This temple is a very ancient temple . Devi karumari is a very powerful goddess. She fulfills all your mannat. Early morning visit will help devotees to avoid the crowd .

Name: WVR7933
Title: Amman Temple at Thiruverkadu
Review: I used to visit this Great Amman Temple often. This is one of the ancient temples at Chennai... may be 500 to 1000 years old. Karumari Amman is a swayambu in the sanctum sanctorium under the golden vimanam tower above the sanctum. This temple opens at 5 am and closes at 9 pm without any break. Worshiping Goddess Karumariamman on Tuesdays, Fridays and Sundays said to be very Good. This Amman is a very powerful God.. All your wishes and prayers get answered at the earliest. Special entrance ticket is Rs.50/-,,, You can have a close worship of the Goddess. Apart. you can also worship Lord Vinayaka, Muruga Navagraha Srinivasa and Anjeneya.Public transport is available to this temple from all the places at Chennai. Note: Early morning Darshan is good... can avoid crowd.

Name: Sudha
Title: Thiruverkaadu temple
Review: This is one of the ancient temple in chennai. And the amman is very powerful. I visited the temple with my family members. There are few legends about this temple and it is a great temple to visit.

Name: Sangeetha Vikram
Title: Powerful Goddess - Devi Karumariamman
Review: I have been to this temple twice, once with my mom & other time with my friend Kamala & her mom. Thiruverkaadu is a significant place of worship as all the three Gods, Lord Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva are worshipped here. Ka means Brahma, Ru means Rudra or Shiva and Mari means Lord Vishnu.The presiding deity of the temple is Devi Karumariamman. The image of Karumariamman is considering as Swoyambhu (Emerged of it's own). There is an Anthill present in the temple. People do worship the Anthill. We got to see full Abhishegam & had a good dharshan at the temple. Offered our Humble Prayers to Devi Karumariamman.

Name: AJUY
Title: Pretty Organized
Review: Nicely organized as entry won't collide with exit. Chairs are beautifully put for customers to sit. Incredible collections are there.

Name: NihaPruthvi555
Title: Go to place for shopping in Tamilnadu
Review: One of the oldest and Trusted places to shop is Sarvana stores . I love that it have so many brances now and is very easy to Access.

Name: Explore13639
Title: Shopping Indian style
Review: Some really good value items, particularly clothes. Was followed by a crowd of staff and other shoppers.  Unusual to feel being a curiosity!  Plenty of staff on hand to assist

Name: Muguncjb
Title: for all home needs
Review: Visited this Saravana Stores branch once few months back. Saravana stores has several branches from the same family group but under different ownership. This particular store is located on a narrow Purasawalkam High road but buses run through the road and stop in front of the stores on one direction. Saravana stores is different from malls. Here one can buy each and every items for home needs at affordable or even cheap prices. In a mall as the shops are run by different owners or branded companies, one may not get all home needs or may not get at affordable price. This is where Saravana stores differs and pulls the crowd. All their stores are multistoryed up to 7-9 levels with each level offering different products.

Name: ST_INDIA
Title: Big store
Review: This is a very big store where you get all sorts of things of daily needs and that too also at a very nominal price. The store bus very famous in Chennai and parking also not a problem here.

Name: sathish
Title: Saravana stores - affordable price shop all daily needs
Review: Saravana stores is one of the best and affordable price shop in Chennai for all type of needs. We can buy all types of products such as household, kitchen, etc. here at very cheaper rate. There are many branches around Chennai. Some of the familier braches are at tnagar, PADI, chrompet, etc.

Name: kugen_kugendran
Title: One stop shopping experience
Review: July/August is one of the best sales season attracts the crowd. However, staff were so helpful to be with you throughout shopping to help. This department store offers almost anything that you need at fixed prices without having to bargain with street traders. Go when the shops open to avoid excessive crowds.

Name: Ruwan E
Title: Best place for shopping
Review: This is one of the best places in the city of chennai to shop for all yout family members. Clothes/ baby items/  house hold items/ stationnaries/ food and movies are available at tbis place. Sarees are cheap and you cqn have a wide range of choices starting from 150 Inr.  Atleast you have to spend 2hr here to get the best out of this. Iwill take about 45 minites to the airport during peak times.

Name: Ahamed
Title: Budget friendly
Review: I went there to purchase AC and a mattress. I found them very cheap there and highly satisfied with the quality of the product. They even offered free home delivery as well.

Name: Jivi_Jebaraj
Title: Price is not that cheap as before
Review: Those the prices were very competitive but now due to overheads and other expansion prices are not that cheap. But it is easy to get most of the stuff under one roof. Buy vegetables in the morning to avoid rush. The canteen is very cheap.

Name: AKTHAKUR
Title: NOT AS  GOOD AS POTHYS FOR VARIETY BUT DO NOT MISS THE KITCHEN SECTION FOR LARGE VARIETY OF UTENSILS
Review: They have branches all over chennai but the usman road t nagar branch is big and worth a visit.Not as big as pothys hypermarket in terms of variety but  their kitchen section is recommended for utensils and kitchen items.The variety is very good at affordable prices.Local Staff is not well versed with english as they speak only tamil language.you may contact nepali staff working there as they are conversant in tamil and english and can translate to help you.Other than english speaking issue the staff is helpful and attentive, Beware of the ladies sales staff at saree section.They are a bunch of lazy staff not interested in showing .They have very bad attitude of buy take or leave whatever is there.the men sales staff in saree section are helpful .There is only one lift so waiting time for lift is very high with crowds going there in dozens to buy groceries vegetables and kitchen items these floors are heavily crowded at all times.Still recommend a visit especially for the kitchen section.Prices are reasonable .Recommend atleast 1-2 hrs to cover all the floors.

Name: bgonner
Title: Wide variety of items
Review: Our tour group visited this store a few days before we headed back to the U. S.  The store has a lot to choose from with what seemed to me to be reasonable prices.  We recognized some of the items as being the same or similar to what we found at outside vendors, but in a more organized and tidy environment.  The elevator options are a bit confusing, with one side going to odd numbered floors and the other going to even numbered floors.  We ended up using the stairs as the elevators were often crowded and the wait time seemed long.My husband and I purchased a few hair items for our daughter, along with some earrings and bracelets.  I purchased a stainless steel masala dabba which seemed of nice quality and weight.  It included a spoon and seven containers; a cover with a clear plastic piece was nice, to be able to see the spices once they are placed in the dabba.  The checkout process was interesting.  You start at one end where someone enters all the purchases into a register, and then go to another person who seemingly checks everything and then gives you a receipt, which you hand to the next person, who seems to check everything once again, and then put the items in a bag.  I'm not clear why they employ such a labor intensive process; I guess they have their reasons.  When we arrived at a different floor with the bag containing the dabba, we were motioned over to an area where they sealed our bag shut.  Also interesting was that at a point where we were about to get our receipt, a young lady came by with a tray, some metal cups, and tea.  The check-out staff were served tea.  We knew tea time in India is very important, but had never seen it at a shopping center.  Even for people at work, everything seems to stop for tea.  The British influence is very obvious!Although our tour guide cautioned us to watch our bags, for men to put their wallet in a front pocket, and for anyone with a backpack to carry it in front of them, I didn't feel threatened in the store.

Name: Goutham Mannuru
Title: Shopping Experience A+, Delivery Experience F
Review: Shopping at this Store is great, Warm Welcoming Staff and great Support . Was very happy to shop some furniture, But was not delivered on time it has already been 2 days past the delivery time , and the numbers they provide on the Bills is a joke they would randomly direct you to someone else who does not attend the phone. Cheap to buy but the waiting time is too much, I don't think  I will ever go there again.

Name: Vinod500
Title: Great Shopping
Review: This is an amazing retail chain with several stores in Chennai and other towns in Tamil Nadu. We regularly visit their T' Nagar store on Ranganathan Street. Each store has 5 or more floors, with additional mezzanine floors.  They cover textiles, garments, household items, electronics, luggage, etc. They have a  wide range of goods and prices are usually below MRP. We go at 9.30 am when the store opens, as it gets quite crowded later. They have branded and unbranded items. Many of the sales persons are from North and East India. Speaking to them in their language or in Hindi, will illicit a better response from them. Ready made garments can be altered for free, by their tailors in the basement. They are very fast.There is a fruit section on the 5th floor with an inexpensive cafeteria too. Patience and perseverance are required if one is looking for a specific item, as there is such a variety.

Name: Kathleen P
Title: So Many Floors So Little Time!
Review: Oh what a place it is! I was looking for jewelry for a friend to dress up formally. This was the place I was brought to. Did I find what I was looking for? I sure did, plus I walked out with a couple more things that I didn‚Äôt know I needed. The store was also giving out Christmas gifts to shoppers so we waited in line and I ended up with a 2019 calendar and a mental covered pot. All for shopping there, plus a great reusable bag that will advertise for them. Unfortunately I live in Belarus so it is a distance to get there.

Name: Arjun
Title: Branded items at low price
Review: Saravana stores has a wide range of branded items at lower rate than the mrp rate.there is huge collection of product's

Name: Georgio Valentino Rayala
Title: Terrible crowds and horrible collection
Review: I was staying in a Air bnb flat for seven days. I decided to go grocery shopping and asked my host for suggestion. He suggested this place and I visited this place along with a friend at 6 pm.It looked huge from outside with many floors and only when we entered its gate did we realize the mistake we made. Every inch of the mall is filled with crazy crowds and there is no space even to walk. We saw their collection of clothes which are cheap and old style.There is a huge queue near the grocery section and we decided to skip shopping as it would have taken at least 30 minutes for us to get billing done. There is also a huge queue to get on to the lift and we decided to take stairs to rush out of this mall. It is one of my most terrible shopping mall experiences.

Name: Safari48327071874
Title: We are not going to the shop forever
Review: The worst stores I ever saw. Worst customer service they don't have anything proper. Worst worst ever

Name: Srinatha Malalasekera
Title: Must Visit Shop If You are Going for Shopping to Chennai
Review: An amazing place with 8 floors. you can buy everything in this shop. The staff are very friendly. I have to mention Miss Sarala who was with us during our entire shopping time, briefing us what to buy and providing all the information necessary. I wish the management of the stores would recognize Sarala for her outstanding customer service. You can buy any product form this store without rustifying outside at a cheaper price. A must visit for any shopper if you are visiting Chenaai. Only issue I observed was that the Restaurant area was smaller and cannot accomodate the large crowds that flock the area during the lunch time. Also kindly improve the standards of washrooms as they are in a bad status.

Name: Genie G
Title: Great place to shop and eat but big crowd on weekends
Review: The restaurant on the top floor has got good food and this place has everything, clothes, groceries, home goods, you name it! The only downside to this place is big crowds on weekends. It was pretty hard to go through the place on a saturday. But overall it gets 5 starts by me

Name: Ramakrishnan J
Title: Everythin Inside
Review: Wow ... It's an amazing place for shopping. We enjoyed the Aadi sale at Saravanan stores. Best lady staff with smile face almost in every floor.

Name: muthukrish2000
Title: Not Good
Review: You will get every items in one roof. Including there is a restaurant in the top floor.Cost of the product & Quality is average.

Name: Shiny E
Title: Worst ever shopping place..!!
Review: My experience in this place is horrible... The staff are so very rude... Left in a huff of rage.. Worst experience.. Omr Saravana Stores...

Name: BimalDavid
Title: Common Man's Shopping Mall
Review: Only one word "Super Cheap". In each and every product, be it priced at Rs 2 as MRP, Saravana will give you some discount. Some products are even cheaper than for what it is sold in streets. Range of products? Just go and see once! You are buying most affordable product in a comfortable A/c mart. You get hungry while shopping, cafeteria is also super cheap and they serve you quality food. The choice of food is wide, like from Biryanis, fried rices, chats, snacks, ice creams, sweets, tea coffee, fresh fruit juices. You get nature's call? They have well maintained restrooms. What else do you want?

Name: sanjana767229
Title: Shopping
Review: Poor quality products. Worst customer service and waste of money. There is no hospitality towards the customers. Don't waste ur tym and money by going there

Name: Abdul wahaab
Title: All things under one roof
Review: Good planning and execution from Saravana group.. it in centre of the busiest place of Chennai ..all the required things available under one roof ..u can get A-Z here at comparatively low cost ..worth shopping ..those who love window shopping must visit this place

Name: Vinoth T
Title: Lovely
Review: The structure and the environment was cool most of the guys do window shopping their but a place where we could buy a lot of materials. The lowest price.

Name: Abdul wahaab
Title: All needs under a single roof
Review: Great beginning in the peak area. Al the needs are available under one roof . Ample parking space available .parking charges will be refunded wen billing items purchased . Food court available which consists of all the items at better price and quality. Even fresh fruits and vegetables also available .

Name: worldwomantourist
Title: One of the biggest shopping centre
Review: A great shopping mall with seven floor and each floor has seperate items. Shopping from a to z of house needs from provitional items to clothes, home appliances, kids wear etc

Name: Ghiri T
Title: A best shopping place.
Review: This shopping place is located in Purasawalkam High Rd.Here one can find various products with wide collections at low costs.One can shop here with their family with lot of happiness and satisfaction.

Name: tyag_1984
Title: Multi Branded Average Store
Review: People are not friendly. need to search for what we wanted. no guidance from the staff. numorous designs, multi branded store. need to hunt for everything. clothes are good. takes lot of time to search for what you wanted

Name: mdkhaleel
Title: Shopping with a difference
Review: The newly opened Saravana store at Sholinganallur is a boon to the residents of OMR & ECR. It is on the main Rajiv Gandhi Salai and easily accessible. It gives a great shopping experience. There are six floors for shopping whatever you need. Ground Floor has gold show room. There is also a separate vegetable & Fruit Shop. In the first floor is a ladies saree and chuddidhar section. In the second floor is ladies ready made section. The third floor is earmarked for Branded cosmetics, hand bags, travel bags, school bags, gents shoes & chappals, ladies chappals & shoes etc. Fourth floor consists of all Home appliances, vessels & plastic items. Fifth floor has Gents ready made items & cloth material and lastly the sixth floor has Home appliances & furniture. There are escalators & lifts for moving to different floors. Some sections are still under construction and the shop is not fully functional. It will take some time to go for it. The items vary from budget to high end. It will definitely suit all pockets. There is shortage of staff and billing takes much time particularly during peak hour in the evenings & on holidays. Good place to shop with family & children and no doubt caters to them all. Better to avoid peak time for hassle free shipping.

Name: Arun
Title: Famous shopping destination for Chennaities
Review: Famous shopping destination for Chennai people where you can wide range of products from cheapest one to the costliest ones though you will find the store to be always crowded; they have many branches in Chennai and you can find the best products at cheaper price if you spend more time and is very choosy.

Name: hari k
Title: For purchasing house hold goods
Review: This is hyper market as all items are available here at less than MRP price. But for making bill payment at counter it will take more.

Name: Sarma_nvny
Title: All in one Place, Choices are many for most of the variants
Review: I recently visited New Saravana Stores in Padi. The experience is good. Especially for women clothing range and varieties, the choice is plenty, neatly arranged based on price range, variety,  prices are reasonable, Fruits and vegetable section, grocery requirements are also fulfilled without much burden on the pocket, In school opening season they offered good discounts on school shoes and other accessories. The food court is very goods and prices are very low when compared with outside, branded water bottles are available at huge discounted rates. Overall experience is pocket-friendly with friendly staff. Rest rooms are maintained in a descent way.

Name: Nirmala B
Title: Fantastic shopping experience,good value for money
Review: Seven floors of wonderful shopping experience all under one roof ,fabulous shopping experience and good stuff at such good rates,must visit for anybody shopping in chennai

Name: VjZen
Title: Crowded, but you get everything.
Review: Best place to buy utensils & home appliances. Sales people are much more knowledgeable than reliance digital or tata croma store, only catch is you need to know the local language.There will be lot of crowd and it may seem chaotic, but they are organized in their own way and do a brisk business.We dont buy dress materials here, as its way to crowded for my taste. Try it once you might like it.

Name: Sangeetha Vikram
Title: Famous shopping maal at Chennai, but with poor maintenance
Review: I have been to Saravana Stores at T.Nagar, Pondy Bazaar, Chrompet etc., many times for Shopping. We can purchase commodities at any rate. Separate floors were available for various sections like Clothing, Dresses for Kids, Pro-visionaries, Food Items etc., But it will be extremely crowded always, we have to rush along with the crowd to do Shopping.Billing is another tedious task. Maintenance should be improved.

Name: Radhu K
Title: Worst place for shopping
Review: Worst place for shopping. Extermely rude staff. Rudeness to the core. They cant speak any other language other than tamil. Dont expect any sort of professionallism , be it staffs dressing, language, behaviour....Food court worst.This stores is typically suitable for people who want cheaper, non brand products

Name: Michelle
Title: Enter this shopping mall at your own risk!
Review: A shopping mall with inexpensive rates: Saravana Stores is a huge mall on purasawakkam road, known for its inexpensive rates and vast range of items. There are about nine floors or more and have a variety of things ranging from appliances, groceries, furniture etc. Our Experience as a family: We visited Saravana Stores (Purasawakkam branch) as a family of four with one child after much hesitation on account of the mixed reviews we had heard - some loved the rates and recommended it and others warned us to stay away from the place.  However, we were definitely not prepared for the shopping experience. It is a known fact that the place is very crowded so we picked the afternoon so it was fairly crowded. The first thing that greets you is the absolute rudeness of the staff (imagine people herding cattle) at every point. Ignore that and there is a price to pay as we found out. The basement is where we chose to go first simply because we did not have to stand for the elevator as there were about 25 people waiting to get it. The girls and ladies in blue and white order you around telling you what to do. At one narrow passage, there was a young girl (Chandramati) who took a crumpled packed and asked that I put my bag/purse (about 6 x 4 n inches) there. This puzzled me as I could not understand why I would have to give my money and original documents (which was in the bag) to be put into a crumpled bag. No one explained but the staff opposite told her to let me go. She did and I went on only to turn back and see her venting her rage by throwing the packet on the floor in disgust. What she did not realize was that my whole family was following behind and was witness to the unprovoked rage and they objected to the display of anger for no sensible reason. It was very unsettling and quite a traumatic experience given that we come from a suburb where customers are treated with some basic dignity. A passing shopper then told me that this was the way the staff usually behaved and the attitude they displayed was as though they owned all the things in there (quite a consolation indeed!!)  We spoke to the manager, who was very polite and understanding and he called for her and spoke/reprimanded her (in private) but nevertheless, with our traumatic personal experience, it will mean that the first time we walked in there would also become our very last time. Should you shop here? If you are a person/family who is fine/comfortable with crowds, the heat (no air conditioning seemed to be on when we went) and is prepared for experiences like this, this place would be good to go to as it has all things at a lesser rate all under one roof. However, I am not sure of the quality of the items as I have never had the opportunity to enter in peace and make a purchase.

Name: Supriya
Title: Awesome customer service
Review: I have booked private screening in sathyam cinemas. Customer service was top notch and really appreciable. Big thanks and shout out to the staff Dineshwaran. He was so helpful in arranging things to us. The best service we have ever experienced

Name: Dr P Nagaraj
Title: Classic Theatre üé≠
Review: One of the finest decent theatre with ambiance and great üëç Hygienic restaurant as well Helping Staff with Concerned

Name: Jaykann
Title: Simply best in town
Review: Sathyam cinemas is always the best regardless of all other new multiplexes. It's not just movie that you watch but it's an experience there. Great quality picture and sound system. Clean, hygienic and very well maintained. Worth spending each penny there. Best hangout place in Chennai.

Name: arnold ahmed
Title: Solid Bass sound
Review: Sathyam one of the best cinemas with not much competition may be from ags and pvr. Sound is good although after you exit the streets are not pleasant.

Name: Arogya Raj
Title: Famous for Buttery Popcorn
Review: A Unique brand and it is one of the best theater in Chennai city. Well maintained Walking area, Washrooms, Cafeteria, Bike & Car Parking Places.Reasonable two wheeler and four wheeler parking rates ‚Çπ10 for bikes, ‚Çπ20 for Car. It is one of the Wonderful Place to go for movie with all types of relationship Peoples. Sound quality is excellent and Never miss to have buttery Pop Corn & cold coffee and cream donuts.

Name: Mitesh Bhandari
Title: Pride of Chennai
Review: This is the best hang out places of Chennai. Quality of Cinema to Next Level. Popcorn is a must! Obviously with some Cheese seasoning (Freeeeeeeeee)

Name: Mohammed khan
Title: Movie üé• time in Sathyam cinemas
Review: Sathyam cinemas are good choices to visit watch movies üé• in cinemas First show watch in elite B6 and 2nd show in elite c13 totally are different experience If you‚Äôre in Chennai enjoy your some time in Sathyam cinemas üé•üé•üé¨üéûüìΩ

Name: #amosamiyanayeküéß
Title: üé•
Review: my favourite always... management are perfect and professional, insight of the theatre   gaming zone own branded food court and play area for kids...

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: The best maintained multiplex in the heart of the city.
Review: It is the first multiplex I watched movie in Chennai and felt awesome. But the opinion. You will find very spacious parking area. Easily accessible from Mount Road. The food and snacks are also AWESOME. it's easily  accessible as it is close to 1000 lights mask on Mount Road. Great parking place. The entire area behind the multiplex is dedicated to parking. And it is very huge.

Name: Abdul wahaab
Title: Best theterical experience
Review: One of the most famous theater in the city which is located on the place where the traffic will be always quite high Best theterical experience and seating were very comfortableLast but not least Sathyam popcorn is the best popcorn

Name: Dr Javed Rasheed
Title: Sheer Nostalgia
Review: Though I don‚Äôt go the movies much now and when I do it‚Äôs occasionally but this theatre brings back a lot of old memories of my medical student days.I first visited this theatre in August 1975 when the iconic blockbuster movie ‚Äú Sholay ‚Äú was released and coincidentally I joined my MBBS  in Madras Medical College in the same month and have seen a lot of blockbuster movies in that theatre in my student days.Going back there was sheer nostalgia though it had three theatres then with Sathyam as the main complex.These days are days of Multiplex and complexes with a lot of focus on eatables & snacks and it‚Äôs a costly affair especially in some theatres that offer you gold class but going down the memory lane those days the ticket then seemed like pittance when compared to the present trends and changing times of availability,affordability and luxury.Those were days when home theatres were not there neither Netflix or Amazon Prime ! It was booking ( not on line ) no movie apps on cell phones ( there were no cell phones then almost 45 years ago when one went with friends or the family to enjoy a movie with ones loved ones in a movie theatre which was a sheer delightful experience especially if the movie was good as one enjoyed the ambience experience,company... it was indeed sheer delight !Dr.Javed Rasheed

Name: G Muralitharan
Title: Sathyam is Sathyam
Review: Move starts on Dot. Very comfortable in terms of seating, accessibility and ambiance.  Very good service and customer friendly staff. Centre of the city and always gives comfort when we watch movie only at Satyam.

Name: ushatr
Title: Movie mania....
Review: It's the best place in the city to watch movies....its always buzzing with crowds and loud chatter. Young, old, toddlers, babies everyone is here to watch the story unfold. Great food and popcorn in large quantities. Moviegoers ....place!!

Name: Amudhan Senthan S
Title: Always the best for an awesome movie experience
Review: The best place to go when it comes for movies. World class movie watching  experience is assured, once accustomed to this you will never be satisfied  with  any other cinema halls in the city. Don't miss the best n tastiest popcorn during the intermission break. An overall  satisfaction assured.

Name: Cyrus
Title: One of the best place for movie in Chennai
Review: I always like to go to sathyam cinemas, as its one of the good screens in Chennai. Parking is fixed not hours based like other malls. Popcorn and other food is less expensive compared to the other big screens like pvr inox etc...

Name: KS SUNDHARESUN
Title: fantastic experience
Review: nice interior, good food and ample car parking. nice interior, good food and ample car parking.nice interior, good food and ample car parking.nice interior, good food and ample car parking

Name: rajm
Title: Great cinema
Review: Its the best movie theatre in chennai and I'm sure one of the best in India.. It has great screen amazing sound great seats and also the canteen is the best in India.  It's a unique experience. Try the cake shop in the ground floor it has some amazing desserts..

Name: Salsa Praveen
Title: Amazing experience
Review: Sathyam is one of the trusted movie spaces in Chennai with over localities in different areas. Amazing popcorns

Name: Ganesh K
Title: Movies in wrong hands
Review: Since they're having name and they don't care for anything. Staff's are very rude. Parking ticketing snacks counters are not maintained properly even toilets are stinking. Very small lift to all the floors. No proper direction sign board. Don't spoil your movie experience in a wrong place.

Name: harish
Title: Snacks at theatresüé≠ = sathyam cinemas
Review: Good for watching movies Best for "Snacks at theatresüé≠ = sathyam cinemas" Aspeciall popcorn  with top loads is amazing

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: The first multiplex theatre I visited in Chennai
Review: I love this theatre. Its very close to thousand lights mosque and mount road. So there is no problem of public transport. Parking space is also very huge. Very systematic maintainance of the theatre makes your visit so memorable.

Name: Arihant Katariya
Title: Super Theater With Very Big Screens
Review: Super Theater To Watch Movies..We Visited 1st Time And Watched Kabir Singh In The Theater..The Sound Clarity & Ambience In The Theater Was Very Good..Butter Pop Corn @ The Theater Is A Must Try @ A Reasonable Price..

Name: DSKTraveller
Title: For a comfortable movie watching experience
Review: Sathyam Cinemas are meant for those looking forward to a comfortable movie watching experience. The movie halls are well maintained and the eating options are of high quality. Sathyam Cinemas in Royapettah is the parent theatre of the Sathyam group (now purchased by PVR) in Chennai. Unlike its other cinema halls located in the Express Avenue and Forum Vijaya Mall, this is located in a slightly congested locality. However, the movie halls are clean and offer a good experience for the movie goer. The food sold in the canteen is of good quality. Some of the favourite items include the cream doughnut, vegetable puffs and chat items. For those who love popcorn, their varieties are the best. Only thing is you have to buy those big tubs of popcorn unlike the earlier days when they would serve in smaller quantities. The ID restaurant is also located inside the complex. Parking of vehicles, especially cars, is quite a task though. It is generally recommended that you reach there early if you want a parking space.

Name: TE K
Title: Entertainment
Review: I visited this place with my friends. Those who want to watch Telugu movies it is one option in Chennai.

Name: Suresh V
Title: An electrifying place to enjoy a movie..!
Review: Setting standards in movie watching.. probably one of the pioneers in Chennai, has been doing a good job to maintain the class and offerings.  Very hitech and awesome experience.  The road being one way, the parking is a bit circularly confusing - keep 10mts etc for parking itself.

Name: Hari Shankar
Title: High class movie complex
Review: Nice place to watch movies with friends and family. One of the best and good theatre in Chennai. Always improving better. Good screen and sound quality. Parking facilities and arrangements are good. Highly recommend.

Name: Kandaswami Aravind
Title: Most favourite cinema hall
Review: Best cinima hall in Chennai. Good maintenance. Quality service. More comfortable place to watch cinema in city with parking.

Name: Vikram J
Title: Best theatre of city
Review: Best theatre of city. Excellent screen sound and interior. In city so cheap parking and must try their popcorn with different flavours

Name: K V K
Title: Satyam
Review: Satyam cinemas is a multiplex theatre complex. Multiple cinemas are screened at the various screens. The halls are well equipped. The sound system is indeed good. The seating arrangements are also good. The vehicle parking place is vast and can accommodate a good number of vehicles, both 4 wheelers as also 2 wheelers. The theatre complex has retained the old charm to a great extent. The only drawback is that the theater is in a small road.

Name: JumboMumbai
Title: Lovely case of rejig
Review: One has to stay with the times.. especially if in the service industry And this is a lovely exampleThe thetre leaves little from old times for good measureAnd is a throbbing successAmple parking... good food.. and of course great movies

Name: Khyati
Title: All in one
Review: This cinema has eating area along with game zone.. kids love it too.. big screen and nice seating they offer..

Name: Harshil Mehta
Title: Amazing Theatre
Review: Good experience, Good Multiplex. The popcorn always taste the best, the restroom was very neat and clean, concessions counter was really well maintained, staffs were very helpful and kind, movie experience was as always amazing

Name: SrikanthSivaraj
Title: Always a good experience
Review: Satyam is an iconic multiplex in Chennai. Good to see that the movie halls are maintained clean and the experience is still as good as it used to be.

Name: Aparna R
Title: The best place for a movie watching experience in the heart of Chennai
Review: Being not much of a movie goer, if I need to watch a movie, then  I would watch one , only if there are shows either  in Sathyam cinemas or at Escape. right from entering the car park, until you find your seat, one is always welcomed by courteous staff.  As for this particular visit, since the show had begun with the screening of advertisements, due to whihc the lights had already dimmed out, we struggled our way to our seats as there was no, numbering. Luckily we could locate our rows easily. However, one had to quickly count and check if we were going towards are reserved seats only. I wish the seats had numbers displayed and glowing in the dark.We had  in the past had  the snacks &  beverages delivered to our seats, but I dont seem to see that practice anymore, I wonder why?

Name: Harvey
Title: Very good experience
Review: Was at Sathyam Cinemas to watch the Rajinikanth starrer Pettai with a friend. I was visiting this cinema after over two decades. They have really done it up very well - the theatre has leather, spacious seats. You get good snacks (not cheap though). The restrooms are clean and well maintained. Corporatisation has done a world of good for this cinema.

Name: umang p
Title: Weekend program
Review: One of the best in Chennai. The parking is cheap as well probably because it‚Äôs their own place and they aren‚Äôt renting the place out but it‚Äôs a huge plus for people who head to the theatre a lot. The seating is good and the popcorn is the best I‚Äôve had (especially the topping flavors).The parking lot is huge which is a plus but the token system for the parking is not a good one, especially when you are heading out after the movie.There is a cafe as well within the same premise including a video arcade. Overall a very good experience, this place.

Name: Anusuya D
Title: Great Satyam cinemas
Review: Great multiplex theatre in Chennai. Excellent sound effects, good seating arrangement, cleanliness, and tasty snacks at the theatre outer places

Name: pushpa p
Title: Cinema na Sathyam cinemas!
Review: Ever since I knew what films are, it's been Sathyam cinemas.. place is tooo good to be left out... Even if there are many new cinemas coming up, Sathyam remains like a home.. the comfort that one can get here, I don't think any other theater offers such a comfortable place for family audience... People come with families, friends and kids... Comfortable and looks good.. love for the cream bun n chocolate bun never fadedüòã lovely place, but parking takes more time, so plan it accordingly!

Name: Sridhar K
Title: Great Multiplex
Review: Excellent Multiplex.  Great seating! excellent audio!  Great ambience! good food! neat and clean toilets!

Name: PTG1976
Title: A Tamil movie at Satyam cinema
Review: I visited the Satyam complex after a few years to watch a movie with colleagues. There have been good improvements. The walkway into the hall is broad; the steps are broad and well lit. The seats are comfortable. The acoustics were excellent. Only the snacks like popcorn have become expensive.  The row car park is functional but if after the movie, one car gets delayed or if a car owner wants to leave in the middle of the movie, it becomes impossible to leave.

Name: Curious793410
Title: Nice theater
Review: Theater seating is very comfortable,  but too much of crowd because of new year,  yearly three times I used to watch movies there

Name: maheshk19
Title: Cinema Heaven
Review: Close to heart theatre for all cinema lovers. Popcorn, DND and Blind date are unique features of sathyam, one should definitely try atleast once.

Name: justin s
Title: Best sound effects
Review: We have gone for a movie a while but this time we have choosed sathyam main screen, Wat a sound effect it's very clarity and surrounding perfect theatre to enjoy ur holidays.

Name: shyam K
Title: Best Cinemas in Chennai for movie , food, VR and kids care
Review: The sathyam cinemas is truly a landmark in Chennai. Not only did it revolutionize the movie effects with state of the art display and sound systems, but also redefined the movie experience with gourmet food.The Sathyam pop corn is probably the best. Best entertainment place in Chennai

Name: Sharath power
Title: Nice Sathyam cinemas
Review: Me and my family watch film nice interval foods simply good weather not bad say anything you are really enjoy this place simply

Name: VijayKB
Title: Best multiplex in city centre
Review: Conveniently located multiplex in heart of city. Very comfortable seating, good interiors and sound system. Easily accessible. Cheapest parking. Fantastic south indian eatery ID is located within the multiplex. Excellent for family outing.

Name: Thiru71
Title: Aware of Parking...
Review: All new comers to Sathyam Cinemas will have irritating experience when they are in 2 wheeler or 4 wheeler. Because they will cross the parking area in Whites road and land before the theatre in Peters Road, where the security would should to make a round about. Both Car and 2 wheeler parking are open. Snacks in the Cinemas are good with reasonable price. Must to visit place in Chennai.

Name: Karthik
Title: Main screen sound system not good
Review: I am a big fan of sathyam cinemasNow sathayam main screen they changed qsc speaker to sls speaker.Qsc is the best speaker and best low frequency effect.

Name: Jothilingam E
Title: One of best
Review: One of best cinemas in the heart of chennai..must visit and also enjoy the tasty food in nearby places

Name: venkat-Chenai
Title: Theatre with great ambience
Review: This theatre is quite centrally located with beautiful interiors, offers pleasant viewing experience and good sound systems. Truely worth

Name: Suresh M
Title: Top class cinemas
Review: Well made , comfortable seating, top class sound system . All these features make it an enjoyable experience to watch a movie.Moreover a large variety of food is available and can be served at your seat in the theater.

Name: arti b
Title: Located at whites road with a big parking ground
Review: It is a cinema hall with okayish sound system, wide seats, not too wide leg space. There is ID restaurant inside. Lift is too small. Be prepared to climb the stairs only. Or you need to wait for 10 mins at least to get into lift.

Name: nandad602
Title: Comfortable place to view movies
Review: Viewing movie at Sathyam Theatre is awesome. You can relax and enjoy the experience. More than watching movies you feel that you are in a most friendly place. The experience of watching is also so good which makes you to totally involve in the movie and you can feel it also. Happy and safe movie experience with family only at sathyam theatres.

Name: Akhil P
Title: Time to enjoy with friends
Review: Good sound system huge screen with a visual treat very enjoyable atmosphere with decent amount of food we get there

Name: Reetesh K
Title: Best Multiplex
Review: Chennai's best multiplex in all aspects be it seating or sound or screen everthing in of high standards. Don't miss the popcorn here. It is <3.

Name: kundu94
Title: Food price is very reasonable
Review: Compared to other multiplex Sathyam Cinema is so cozy and easy to park and get out from the hall at the end.

Name: Ayesha F
Title: One of the oldest in Chennai
Review: Although the Halls are not as trendy as the latest theaters, but the screens are big enough. Still one of the most popular places to catch a movie. Tip: Do cross over to the main road to check out the oldest bookstore in Chennai, now operating as Writer's Cafe.

Name: Alwardurai
Title: Couple visit
Review: One of the important place in Chennai, everyone should visit Satyam cinema's since this one have a big screen in Chennai..

Name: cinthu88
Title: Watch cinema
Review: It was really worth to watch movies in this theatre. It was really neat and clean. Parking also low price .

Name: Terence S
Title: Excellent movie ambience.
Review: Sathyam has multiple screens in a location in the heart of Chennai. Adequate parking facilities and great snack options

Name: KMJ
Title: best destination in chennai for movies
Review: One of the best theater in overall terms of a movie experiencing. I would rate this theatre as one of the best in India in terms of visual quality. Snacks are comparatively cheaper compared most of the other multiplexes esp. given the quality of food. It has amazing south Indian Restaurant ID in the same building. a place to leave toddlers safely while you have a great movie experience. very good parking mechanism. If you are in Chennai and a movie buff do not miss this theatre. I have gone here as a couple, family, friends, business partner, solo and not once have I been disappointed. if the parking is full there is an annex parking and shuttle that runs between the theatre building and the annex parking.

Name: Sandhya I
Title: The best cinema experience
Review: Have been to cinema theatres all over india and there is nothing to match satyam cinemas. The ambience, comfort, options, seating, sound, food menu, everything screams love and attention to detail. Its a movie goers dream come true and all this at extremely affordable prices. I wish satyam has cinemas all over India.

Name: Vishal Balwani
Title: A nice place to unwind after a day‚Äôs work
Review: Cinemas in Chennai are not a thing to be taken lightly because the local crowd will always be thronging over to cinema halls and you won‚Äôt find vacant seats unless you book tickets in advance. Also to be noted here is that the pricing of tickets in Chennai theatres is done by the government and the prices are moderate. So this gives another reason for the theatres to be completely booked most of the time. This one is a good theatre. The seats are comfortable and there is parking space available too.

Name: Venga
Title: Pride and proud Satyam Cinemas
Review: Non other Cinemas like PVR, INOX are after Satyam Cinemas since 1974. It was only in Chennai now it is expanded in all the south Indian states.  It is famous for sound quality auro 11.1 and dolby atmos And praise for his favorite spicy popcorn

Name: Azara T
Title: Best popcorn n amazing theatre
Review: We had gone there to watch the movie Mersal. The place has a great atmosphere and environment. The service, food and the beverages are also amazing especially the popcorn, which you can't get anywhere else except in Sathyam and the partnered theatres.

Name: Akila P
Title: A great hangout place....
Review: Sathyam is a cool place.. it is famous for the different flavored popcorn.. you can see yo yo youth crowd....

Name: movies H
Title: Great picture quality
Review: The place offers a great screen and great picture quality,this was the first multiplex I visited so enjoyed it a lot

Name: Anand K
Title: Best sound effects in Chennai
Review: Now you may see more theatres under spi but always Sathyam cinemas is best in Chennai ,the sound effects is simply out of the world must visit for all

Name: Vaibhav_1990
Title: Movie time
Review: The best place in town . Be it with your partner or your family . If you have to watch a movie in Chennai . Then think about only one place . SATHYAM CINEMAS . Everything‚Äôs perfect there .

Name: vmsatheesh22
Title: Good
Review: Sathyam cinemas, good place to visit and view cinema in beautiful atmosphere, we all like the sound arrangements and screens

Name: shantanug739
Title: Super experience
Review: Excellent experience: the ticket prices are very affordable as they are govt. regulated. The food is awesome. Do have the famous Sathyam popcorn and cream rolls. There are many screens and each one is customised with pretty cool themes. Cleanliness and staff hospitality is par excellence.

Name: Aman Gupta
Title: Good cinema hall
Review: It is one of the best cinema halls in Chennai. Screen size and sound quality are really good. You will experience great quality there.

Name: AniRanjRoh
Title: Nice Movie Experience
Review: Have been going here every time we visit Chennai. Fav theatre to go to. Movie choices are nice as well, located centrally to some shops as well. Def recommend to be cleaner.

Name: Guddu Anand
Title: Movie Nite
Review: Too Bad Air Conditioning ... And Very Expensive Eatables ... Even Water Is Priced Exorbitantly ... Parking Is Another Issue ...

Name: SubbaramDanda
Title: THE SHEEN IS DIMINISHING
Review: We were at "Six Degrees," a screen in the Sathyam cinema complex recently to watch Tamil movie "Irumbuthirai."  When we entered the hall, we were aghast to see that trash left behind by the people of the previous show was still there.  After a few minutes, janitors came in and cleared the trash.  This was not expected of a high class theatre. A word about lighting.  In the dim light before the start of the film, people especially elders, found it difficult to go to their seats.  Why not have good lights till the film starts?  And, for the people coming in somewhat early there is not much of space to sit and relax.

Name: prasannareddy
Title: Excellent place for entertainment
Review: One of best movie theatre in the world that I have seen,food was excellent.screen all language movies.

Name: Ajitku
Title: Movie
Review: it is a movie theater. Mostly all types of movies screening here. the place is clean and neat. enjoyed movie with friends.

Name: BHMDUDE
Title: Sathyam vs Santham
Review: We heard a lot about Chennai Sathyam cinema so we booked our tickets through bookmyshow. This cinema is located inside a mall type building owned by Sathyam cinema. Our theatre was screen 5. And guess what screen 5 was santham not Sathyam. And this theatre was not upto the mark as well. They should mention at the time of booking that whether we are booking for Sathyam or santham.

Name: srbkct
Title: Entertainment!!!
Review: After long time, back to Satyam. Visited Sathyam Elite. Big screen, good sound effect. only point i felt to be improve at food counters is to see other options to add the flavours to popcorn ;) it is very uncomfortable to add it once the tub is filled....

Name: ananthakp
Title: A Decent Cine Complex
Review: Originally,started with Three Screens, with Sathyam being the biggest in terms of seating capacity was purely a cinema hall.  With the advent of complex concept, added more screens and eateries making it a bit cramped in space. Said that, within the constraints, well maintained. Parking, though is huge, if all halls run full, you will have to wait for the vehicles in front to move before you can take your car.

Name: Gowri V
Title: Raazi
Review: Great movie, well taken, Excellent characterisation. All artists did justice to their role particularly the lead role Superb performance.

Name: Rucha121
Title: Best Movie-Theatre
Review: Move over Inox and PVR.. while you are in Chennai.. enjoy the best movie-watching experience only at Sathyam cinemas.. It is difficult to get hold of movie tickets of newly released or hit movies on weekend.. Other than movie, their snacks - popcorn and veg puff are really delicious. Very good maintenance and nice experience.

Name: Rohan A
Title: Rocking Sathyam
Review: Definitely it is one of the biggest theatre & visual & sound effects are really amazing.The cleanliness of the theatre is really good..

Name: Raghul J
Title: Best Theatre I have ever seen
Review: The main screen here has a capacity more than 500 seats which gives you great experience while watching movies of your favourite stars...maintainance  is very good..worth every penny you spend... great sound...i would say No 1 theatre in the city..

Name: kripa a
Title: Nice one
Review: I have been there with my collegues for a movie outing.  Well maintained place.  Nice sound facility. We enjoyed

Name: drsivakumar87
Title: The best

Name: Kirrthana
Title: Great experience
Review: Very comfortable seats... Great service by the staffs... Clean washrooms... Very good sound system... Evidently, I enjoyed watching 'Sathya' movie in sathyam cinemas... üòú

Name: Sairam R
Title: Good multiplex
Review: This is a multiplex cinema complex with car parking and snacks and in the heart of Chennai.  This is one of the oldest multiplexes in Chennai but still they are maintaining at a decent level.

Name: Sindhuja N
Title: Is there a better cinemas in town?!
Review: Satyam has created its own benchmark in this city. The sound quality, screen clarity, service, ambience.. What not, satyam brings you everything. The best part is they provide you a home feeling giving out blankets when needed, whatspp-ing them if any group or individual is creating disturbance and also have installed sanitary napkins dispenser which i would say the best move any cinemas can provide. A big thumbs up to the best cinemas!

Name: jasjas867
Title: Too crowded
Review: Though the management is trying its best, the crowd seems too overwhelming. Pushing and jumping queues is a common sight. Not much of security measures. The crowd seems a bunch of unruly college kids who do not even bother to throw the popcorn tubs or coke cups in the bin.the sign boards for different screens seem confusing. All in all, not worth for a family outing.

Name: Girija Muralidharan
Title: Enjoyed the Hindi film Hitchki.
Review: Sathyam Theatres took over the old dilapidated Thyagaraja cinema theatre in LB road Adyar some years back. Since then the theatre is well maintened , there are only two screens one in  down floor and one in 1st floor. The food counter has many delicious items to choose from. The only problem in this complex is, the washroom for ladies is upstairs. Hope the authorities do something about this.  As we live in Adyar we find this the most convenient theatre to go and watch movies at a short notice. I certainly need to mention about the efficiency and the helpful nature of the  staff who regulate the traffic inside the theatre compound. They guide you to park the car very well.  After the show the cars glide out of the compound effortlessly.

Name: Lavanya J
Title: Keeping up with Times
Review: Sathyam theatre has ensured they upkeep with customers demands. Have been in existence for more than two decades and ever since I remember this place has only gone up in standards. The food across all their chain of theaters has been excellent and they ensure cleanliness and hygiene. Recently their parking rates have come down too. There are restaurants, gaming and bowling besides cinema under one roof. Hope they continue to maintain their high standards

Name: vasuprofiles
Title: Satyam Cinemas - a lovely place to watch a movie
Review: I had been to Satyam many times. I have been going there since more than a decade. Back then the parking was different than what it is now. Anyways that is not the point of discussion now. We'll a cool place to watch a movie. There are many screens and is in the heart of the city. The seating and arrangement are good. The food and beverages are expensive but it is the same in every mall. That wouldnt be a bad idea to watch a movie there.

Name: Rahul D
Title: Best movie experience...and a gaming centre
Review: Best place in Chennai to watch a movie...a complete descent arena...lots of stuffs .many screens...a big arena..for gaming lovers.."blurr"... Its a gaming spot.. good to go..

Name: Ramaswamytalari
Title: First cinemas in Chennai.
Review: Superb cinema .nice ambient .id is place one of the best place to eat Italian food.very nice combos also available

Name: Balaji D
Title: Cozy viewing experience
Review: Seats are comfortable. Good viewing and Audio. Clean toilets with an advertisement screen on each section to make it more personal

Name: kvramani
Title: Excellent movie theatre
Review: We watched Padmavat in Satyam cinemas recently.It is a very reputed group, managing excellent theatres and multiplexes, large to mini screens with various seating capacities, with latest video and audio systems, clean ambience, good maintenance, variety of snack options, online booking including for food, ..... WoW. It is a great experience to watch a movie in Satyam group of cInemas.

Name: Shveta S
Title: Hub of movies with kids area
Review: If you love movies you will love satyam, they even have arrangements to keep kids& teenagers involved while you enjoy your movie.Famous for their popcorn& snacks.They have a restaurant name ID so 1 can enjoy  the meal with friends/family.

Name: Sadi A
Title: Very posh, fantastic experience
Review: A cinema experience like never before for me. Even the freshrooms had fittings like 5 star hotels. The screens are of the best quality and the sound experience is world class. Very very affordable pricing for tickets. A heaven for cinena lovers.

Name: Free@will
Title: Watched 15.17 to Paris.
Review: Had been here to watch an English movie, 3.30 pm show. At the booking counter one doesn't get the option to choose the seats. The girl at the counter couldn't speak or understand much English. Once inside the screening hall the ambience was nice. The sound effects were outstanding. Surprisingly, for an afternoon show English movie each ticket cost 190 bucks approx. Barely 10 people were in.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: well maintained
Review: The place is along the main road in nandambakkam area of chennai city which has n number of cementries of the worldwar hero's and is well maintained

Name: Ravi Chinnakkonda
Title: A serene memorial for the fallen soldiers
Review: Unlike commonly thought, this is not a grave yard but only a memorial place for commonwealth soldiers who perished in WWI and WW2 in South East Asia.Beautifully maintained it is located in the middle of the city and easily accessible

Name: gr0408
Title: Excellent work CWGC
Review: Always enjoy my time in Madras war cemetery. Learning history of war. Talking to staff. Committed  organization to keep it well.

Name: gr0408
Title: Keeping history alive
Review: Good work by organization in keeping the world aware of people who sacrificed there life in worl war 1,2. The place is easy to notice. Best time to visit is 8-10 morning and 3-5 evening.

Name: Anusuya D
Title: tribute to soldiers
Review: a tribute to brave soldiers who died during second word war, lies on the side of the road, located near trade center. peace ful place of memories of the soldiers

Name: Ghiri T
Title: A place in memory of soldiers
Review: Madras War Cemetery is built in the memories of the soldiers who sacrificed their lives in Second World War.Here no bodies are buried but has plaques with the names of many soldiers who died in World Wars.This place is maintained by the CWGC in partnership with Government of India.This place is located in Mount-Poonamalle High Road,Nandambakkam,Chennai.This place is maintained well and kept clean.One can visit this place to pay tribute to the wariors who sacrificed their lives for our safe future.

Name: BradleySR73
Title: Worth a visit on ANZAC Day
Review: My wife and I attended an ANZAC Day Dawn Service and it was beautifully done. The grounds are well maintained and the Indian military displayed outstanding professionalism. It is worth spending an hour of your day walking past the dedications to those who lost their lives in war.

Name: Mathews P
Title: Casual
Review: A roadside memorial space tributing to those soldiers who were killed during the 1914-1918 war period and were buried elsewhere.

Name: ShoaibJU
Title: Pay tribute to wariors
Review: The heroes of second world war, about 900 commonwealth grave more than 1000 names. Well maintained, clean and green.

Name: gr0408
Title: World war 2 "please be respectful"
Review: It contains 856 Commonwealth graves. And war memorial contain more then 1000 names. It is place of respect. Thanks to staff for information and maintenance.

Name: S_Venkatesh
Title: Cool, Green, Reverence for the Brave Departed
Review: Madras War Cemetry is an Oasis of Peace, right next to the Frenetic Pace of City life passing before it. It is easily accessed by City Bus, Share Auto, Call Taxi etc, located near Miot Hospital. The Cool, Green, Well-Tended Lawns provide a Serene setting for the All-Pervasive Calm & Quiet enveloping rows & rows of hundreds of tombstones of the Brave Fallen in World War II & other Battles of the British Indian Army. A Long, Low Sombre Wall boldly records the Names of soldiers of the British Indian Army who fell in World War I. Christians, Muslims & Others are all honoured here. A Visit to this War Cemetry is immensely Uplifting - for the Mind & the Soul & the Heart. This Vastly Silent, Timeless, Exquisite Honour of the Brave Dead is a Powerful Reminder that we stand & live today because the sea of men before us chose to die in the prime of their youth. God Bless.

Name: Ravi D
Title: Symmetry in a Cemetery
Review: Possibly the best maintained cemetery in Indi. The neat symmetrical rows, evenly spaced out with white headstones set on a green lawn reminds me of the similarity to the Arlington Cemetery, where US heroes are laid to rest.
