We had a quick look at the household section, but couldn't find exactly the copper bowls I had wanted, but settled on a couple of small copper and steel cooking pots. Very cheap.We wanted some silver jewellery, but on the jewellery floor, they only have 'imitation' - were directed to OKJ, 2 minutes up the road, and again we were satisfied and got what we wanted at a pretty good price.Definitely my way of shopping - and all done in less than an hour!

Name: dinesh_j84
Title: Huge collection of Textiles
Review: It offers wide range of collection to kids, men and women. Loaded with variety of colors and designs. Caters to the need of all budget groups. Close to West Mambalam railway station and as well as to T Nagar Bus terminus.

Name: wawweerasinghe
Title: SUPER SHOPPING MALL
Review: This is well organized and well maintained shopping mall spread over several floors.It is separately categorized eg. Mens Suiting,Kids Wear, Fashion Sarees, Ready mades  etc.etc for the convenience of the customers. You can find anything under one roof at different quality and different prices-cheap or expensive.Opened at 10am and go on till 9pm.Ample parking space and they have a very good food corner.Pothy's Hyper is located near The Residency Hotel only about 100 mtrs away and there is a free shuttle service from Pothy's Hyper to Pothys T-Nagar.

Name: JumboMumbai
Title: All in one place
Review: Searching for a half saree for my friend landed up at the HyperAnd was mighty impressed by the scale that the shop has..So many varieties across so many floors.. many lifts but so well organisedAll your needs under one roof.. Pothys

Name: jayakumar
Title: Perfect shopping place
Review: Shopped for wedding. A really great place to shop for all needs. Escalators and elevators help customers. Vast range of products.

Name: Dulmini J
Title: An Excellent place to shop
Review: Found so many nice saree's and kurthas and kurtha material there . and lot more. A very decent place to shop.

Name: anupam b
Title: Decent shopping mall
Review: Its is T nagar area. Nice mall. This mall jad 6 th floor. In each floor you will get different items . One point i didn't like that sales guy will come behind you. When you look for anything they will come and ask. Mall was clean and maintained well.

Name: JumboMumbai
Title: Must shop place
Review: If there is a place we must go for shopping in Chennai, this is it.  A hyper as called it has virtually everyhting you can care to ask for. And an affordable and possibly chapest price. Th evariety can confuse you though so keep your budget in mind

Name: niluanu
Title: Must Visit
Review: One of the historical buildings of Chennai, this place is opposite Marina Beach and easily accessible by public transport. Earlier known as Ice House, the building houses a museum which offers glimpses of Indian history, culture and the life of Swami Vivekananda., who had stayed in this place for a few days. There is a short 3D movie on Swami Vivekananda's speech at the Parliament of Religions in Chicago  Entry tickets cost Rs.20/- each and car parking is available. Highly recommended for all visitors to the city

Name: Mrudula
Title: Swami Vivekananda House
Review: Swami Vivekananda house is one of the famous place to visit in chennai and it is believed that Swami used to live in this house and entire lifestyle is depicted here

Name: Ramya S
Title: Awesome 3d and 2d shows
Review: A 2d holographic movie, a short film on confidence and a 3D movie on Swami's speech on the Chicago World religious conference could be witnessed. The 3D movie is inspiration for the children. This is a must-do activity in Chennai.

Name: Aaqarsh Aiyyar
Title: Get inspired
Review: The multimedia shows are awe-inspiring. The 3D movie on the first floor was terrific. The 2D hologram show was good too. Photography or videography is not allowed inside. The entrance fee is INR 20 for adults and INR 10 for children. This is a must visit site in Chennai.

Name: Ghiri T
Title: A place full of Swamiji"s Life
Review: Vivekananda House or Vivekananda Illam is located in Kamarajar Salai, near Marina Beach. It is one of the famous landmark in the surroundingThis place is full with the life history of Swamy Vivekananda. This place is know maintained by Sri Ramakrishna Math. One should visit this place to get inspired by Swamy Vivekananda about what is life.

Name: Kulbhushan A
Title: Must visit for people inspired by Swami Vivekananda
Review: I happen to know about this place through a random discussion with the hotel manager. Must say this was the find of my trip. Takes you through Swamiji life and help you feel more connected with him and his teachings.

Name: Kumar36
Title: Must visit
Review: Historic building, with significant historical tie to Swami Vivekananda's life. Centre gives a glimpse of the history of Indian culture, makes you realise how great our history and country has been. This is sadly what the current generation don't know of, who think aping the west is the best. I hope the work of this Math will fulfil the dreams of Swami Vivekananda, some day!

Name: Sandeep Shivhare
Title: Good experience
Review: This is situated near Marina beach. It's showcases photos of Vivekanand and his life story. All the events of his life is well presented. There is also a 3D movie which describe about his Chicago speech.

Name: Sangeetha Vikram
Title: Wonderful look back of the history of  Swami Vivekananda !!
Review: Myself along with my mom, chitti & cousin (Yamini) got to visit Vivekananda museum on a Sunday evening, the entrance ticket was Rs.20 for adults & Rs.10 for children, it was a wonderful place with a bulk collection of lot of photographs of Swami Vivekananda, along with the history of various incidents of his life.3D show was available which portrays the speech of Swami Vivekananda at Chicago, a meditation hall was available which was so peaceful for doing meditation.Worth Visiting !!

Name: DNPillai
Title: Good Place
Review: Good Place to Relax yourself and do some meditation. Its opposite to the beach. u can enjoy the breeze. Get some knowledge odn the hero.  3D show also there.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Divine
Review: The place is well maintained and has to be appreciated for the cleanliness and calmness. The buildings were mesmerising, garden was beautiful.

Name: rashmi k
Title: Pious and beautiful
Review: The architecture is beautiful. One must visit this for the beauty. God statues inside are also so real and beautiful. The place was windy and hence felt relaxed and peaceful. If informed earlier, can plan for prasadam lunch there itself. Plenty of space for parking. Follow the google maps and make sure you to take a u turn as suggested. If travelling with children, carry water and eatables as nothing is available at a close vicinity. But worth visiting. This temple is in Nemmeli, near Mahabalipuram, ECR. It is open between 7 AM to 7 PM

Name: harleen_sethi
Title: Peaceful Jain Temple
Review: One very famous and beautiful Jain temple is in GN Chetty Road. There are many others in Chennai. It‚Äôs a very calm and serene place to spend some time during your visit. One gets to feel the almighty‚Äôs presence on visiting this temple. God bless!

Name: Anand G
Title: Great ambiance and good architecture
Review: This is a lovely temple (Shanthinath Jain Temple) located in G N Chetty Road. The  main entrance is unpretentious but once you enter the courtyard you are welcomed by the statues of a pair of life sized elephants. That alone would bowl you over. Beyond that the flight of steps lead to the sanctum. As is popular with Jain temples, it is marbles all the way. The architecture is attractive. The atmosphere is  great. The silene is not deafening but pleasant and invigorating. Excellent place to visit to control stress and recharge bang within the city. Its popularity among the devotees is indicated by the number of high end cars arriving and departing the gates throughout the day.

Name: garhwaliya
Title: New and small temple
Review: This temple is very very new but not very big. It is nicely build up. Many Jain community person come here.

Name: Sangeetha Vikram
Title: Shri Shanthinath Jain Temple - Beautiful Marble temple
Review: On a fine evening, I have visited Shri Shanthinath Jain temple at T.Nagar along with my mom. It was a beautiful marble temple with lovely architecture.It was really nice to see Jain culture in South India. The 5 Anuvratas followed by Jains all over the world was really inspiring.1. Non violence - Ahimsa2. Truthfulness - Satya3. Non Stealing - Achaurya4. Chasity - Brahmacharya5. Non possession - AparigrahaThe main deity of the temple was Lord Shanthinath with 2 other shrines - Sunvrath & Shreyasanath on either sides. We participated in 6pm Aarathi and really felt so blissful.

Name: sudaramorthy91
Title: nice temple
Review: the temple is located in nice place.the structure of the building is good.nice to see in this place.

Name: AHUJADS1
Title: Magnificient Temple!!
Review: Lovely architecture , flaunt less view enjoy the beauty, the view and the greenery.Must visit place.

Name: moothayil
Title: jain temple
Review: This Jain temple  is first one in South India , and it is  known as Shree Gujarati Swetamber Jain Mandir.  ( Lord Parshwanatha, the 23rd Teerthankar is the presiding deity  ) .  The architectural principles of the famous Dilwara temples can be seen here . Only marble  is used in the construction of temple (all  architects carvers and workers were brought from Rajasthan). The  Special Green clour idol is made from the  Quartz selected from the Chellur mines in Karnataka.  Jain acharyas walk all the way to the Gujarati shwetambar Mandir from North India and stay here for 'Chatur Masa'.

Name: Parasmaljain85
Title: good
Review: good to see Good to see Jain temples in South india and specially in Tamilnadu and Chennai. This is quite good to see Jainism culture in Chennai.st Jain Temple in Porur , & ECR are Also Peacefulness at its best , Goushala in Shripermbudur is also a quiet peaceful place

Name: maulik_shah9978
Title: Jain Temple visit
Review: Good to see Jain temples in South india and specially in Tamilnadu and Chennai. This is quite good to see Jainism culture in Chennai through these temples.

Name: Deepali Shah Sarrof
Title: Jain Temple Are At Many Places In Chennai
Review: There are 5 Temples in Sowcarpet But Peaceful Ambience as per my Review is in the Morning And Avoid Going there in Paryushan Parva As there is lot of People coming to do Pooja Etc. In Evenings they do bhakti which Disturbs the peaceful ambieince of temple ( No Offense - I Dont like musical Instruments Playing Songs (Bollywood Converted Songs) for Lord in Temple) Dada Vadi Temple in Ayanavaram Is Peacefulness at its Best Jain Temple in Porur , & ECR are Also Peacefulness at its best , Goushala in Shripermbudur is also a quiet peaceful place

Name: anjujain72
Title: Jain Temple at G N Chett road, chennai
Review: beautiful and peaceful place. Nearby jain temples IN chennai are Chandraprabhu jain temple at Sahukarpet, Jain temple at mylorepur, Jain temple at saidapet .Ancient jain place with many jain temples are around 20 km from chennai at Puzhal village in red hill area , chennai.

Name: arul_nambi2000
Title: A MUST visit in Chennai
Review: I wonder why its not reflected as a attraction in trip advisor? Its worth a visit for the all in chennai and also for the tourists. The ambiance is so peaceful , you will really have the freedom for praying and meditating.

Name: Aravind A
Title: Calm and Peaceful
Review: Clean quite and made of pure white are the plus points when u enter the jain temple. One can find mental solitude on entering and meditate in silence. They are generally not crowded except during the festival season giving one plenty of time to be at mental peace.

Name: shanks123
Title: Good place in between the rush
Review: I have always wanted to visit this place, but alas I never got to visit it for a very long time, This place used to come in my evening walks when I was placed in chennai , still never managed to enter and check out what is in store, one day I just entered and was pleasently surprised by the temple .It is built in a white marble and is surrounded by lots of greenery , as it is very difficult to fathom a such a place in middle of city in T nagar , GN chetty road . I found it very clean and noise free and a good place to visit apart from the asthetic sense .

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Divine
Review: The place is well maintained and has to be appreciated for the cleanliness and calmness. The buildings were mesmerising, garden was beautiful.

Title: Pious and beautiful

Name: AHUJADS1
Title: Magnificient Temple!!
Review: Lovely architecture , flaunt less view enjoy the beauty, the view and the greenery.Must visit place.

Name: moothayil
Title: jain temple
Review: This Jain temple  is first one in South India , and it is  known as Shree Gujarati Swetamber Jain Mandir.  ( Lord Parshwanatha, the 23rd Teerthankar is the presiding deity  ) .  The architectural principles of the famous Dilwara temples can be seen here . Only marble  is used in the construction of temple (all  architects carvers and workers were brought from Rajasthan). The  Special Green clour idol is made from the  Quartz selected from the Chellur mines in Karnataka.  Jain acharyas walk all the way to the Gujarati shwetambar Mandir from North India and stay here for 'Chatur Masa'.

Name: Parasmaljain85
Title: good
Review: good to see Good to see Jain temples in South india and specially in Tamilnadu and Chennai. This is quite good to see Jainism culture in Chennai.st Jain Temple in Porur , & ECR are Also Peacefulness at its best , Goushala in Shripermbudur is also a quiet peaceful place

Name: maulik_shah9978
Title: Jain Temple visit
Review: Good to see Jain temples in South india and specially in Tamilnadu and Chennai. This is quite good to see Jainism culture in Chennai through these temples.

Name: Deepali Shah Sarrof
Title: Jain Temple Are At Many Places In Chennai
Review: There are 5 Temples in Sowcarpet But Peaceful Ambience as per my Review is in the Morning And Avoid Going there in Paryushan Parva As there is lot of People coming to do Pooja Etc. In Evenings they do bhakti which Disturbs the peaceful ambieince of temple ( No Offense - I Dont like musical Instruments Playing Songs (Bollywood Converted Songs) for Lord in Temple) Dada Vadi Temple in Ayanavaram Is Peacefulness at its Best Jain Temple in Porur , & ECR are Also Peacefulness at its best , Goushala in Shripermbudur is also a quiet peaceful place

Name: anjujain72
Title: Jain Temple at G N Chett road, chennai
Review: beautiful and peaceful place. Nearby jain temples IN chennai are Chandraprabhu jain temple at Sahukarpet, Jain temple at mylorepur, Jain temple at saidapet .Ancient jain place with many jain temples are around 20 km from chennai at Puzhal village in red hill area , chennai.

Name: arul_nambi2000
Title: A MUST visit in Chennai
Review: I wonder why its not reflected as a attraction in trip advisor? Its worth a visit for the all in chennai and also for the tourists. The ambiance is so peaceful , you will really have the freedom for praying and meditating.

Name: Aravind A
Title: Calm and Peaceful
Review: Clean quite and made of pure white are the plus points when u enter the jain temple. One can find mental solitude on entering and meditate in silence. They are generally not crowded except during the festival season giving one plenty of time to be at mental peace.

Name: shanks123
Title: Good place in between the rush
Review: I have always wanted to visit this place, but alas I never got to visit it for a very long time, This place used to come in my evening walks when I was placed in chennai , still never managed to enter and check out what is in store, one day I just entered and was pleasently surprised by the temple .It is built in a white marble and is surrounded by lots of greenery , as it is very difficult to fathom a such a place in middle of city in T nagar , GN chetty road . I found it very clean and noise free and a good place to visit apart from the asthetic sense .

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Divine
Review: The place is well maintained and has to be appreciated for the cleanliness and calmness. The buildings were mesmerising, garden was beautiful.

Name: rashmi k
Title: Pious and beautiful
Review: The architecture is beautiful. One must visit this for the beauty. God statues inside are also so real and beautiful. The place was windy and hence felt relaxed and peaceful. If informed earlier, can plan for prasadam lunch there itself. Plenty of space for parking. Follow the google maps and make sure you to take a u turn as suggested. If travelling with children, carry water and eatables as nothing is available at a close vicinity. But worth visiting. This temple is in Nemmeli, near Mahabalipuram, ECR. It is open between 7 AM to 7 PM

Name: harleen_sethi
Title: Peaceful Jain Temple
Review: One very famous and beautiful Jain temple is in GN Chetty Road. There are many others in Chennai. It‚Äôs a very calm and serene place to spend some time during your visit. One gets to feel the almighty‚Äôs presence on visiting this temple. God bless!

Name: Anand G
Title: Great ambiance and good architecture
Review: This is a lovely temple (Shanthinath Jain Temple) located in G N Chetty Road. The  main entrance is unpretentious but once you enter the courtyard you are welcomed by the statues of a pair of life sized elephants. That alone would bowl you over. Beyond that the flight of steps lead to the sanctum. As is popular with Jain temples, it is marbles all the way. The architecture is attractive. The atmosphere is  great. The silene is not deafening but pleasant and invigorating. Excellent place to visit to control stress and recharge bang within the city. Its popularity among the devotees is indicated by the number of high end cars arriving and departing the gates throughout the day.

Name: garhwaliya
Title: New and small temple
Review: This temple is very very new but not very big. It is nicely build up. Many Jain community person come here.

Name: Sangeetha Vikram
Title: Shri Shanthinath Jain Temple - Beautiful Marble temple
Review: On a fine evening, I have visited Shri Shanthinath Jain temple at T.Nagar along with my mom. It was a beautiful marble temple with lovely architecture.It was really nice to see Jain culture in South India. The 5 Anuvratas followed by Jains all over the world was really inspiring.1. Non violence - Ahimsa2. Truthfulness - Satya3. Non Stealing - Achaurya4. Chasity - Brahmacharya5. Non possession - AparigrahaThe main deity of the temple was Lord Shanthinath with 2 other shrines - Sunvrath & Shreyasanath on either sides. We participated in 6pm Aarathi and really felt so blissful.

Name: sudaramorthy91
Title: nice temple
Review: the temple is located in nice place.the structure of the building is good.nice to see in this place.

The  main entrance is unpretentious but once you enter the courtyard you are welcomed by the statues of a pair of life sized elephants. That alone would bowl you over. Beyond that the flight of steps lead to the sanctum. As is popular with Jain temples, it is marbles all the way. The architecture is attractive. The atmosphere is  great. The silene is not deafening but pleasant and invigorating. Excellent place to visit to control stress and recharge bang within the city. Its popularity among the devotees is indicated by the number of high end cars arriving and departing the gates throughout the day.

Name: garhwaliya
Title: New and small temple
Review: This temple is very very new but not very big. It is nicely build up. Many Jain community person come here.

Name: Sangeetha Vikram
Title: Shri Shanthinath Jain Temple - Beautiful Marble temple
Review: On a fine evening, I have visited Shri Shanthinath Jain temple at T.Nagar along with my mom. It was a beautiful marble temple with lovely architecture.It was really nice to see Jain culture in South India. The 5 Anuvratas followed by Jains all over the world was really inspiring.1. Non violence - Ahimsa2. Truthfulness - Satya3. Non Stealing - Achaurya4. Chasity - Brahmacharya5. Non possession - AparigrahaThe main deity of the temple was Lord Shanthinath with 2 other shrines - Sunvrath & Shreyasanath on either sides. We participated in 6pm Aarathi and really felt so blissful.

Name: sudaramorthy91
Title: nice temple
Review: the temple is located in nice place.the structure of the building is good.nice to see in this place.

Name: AHUJADS1
Title: Magnificient Temple!!
Review: Lovely architecture , flaunt less view enjoy the beauty, the view and the greenery.Must visit place.

Name: moothayil
Title: jain temple
Review: This Jain temple  is first one in South India , and it is  known as Shree Gujarati Swetamber Jain Mandir.  ( Lord Parshwanatha, the 23rd Teerthankar is the presiding deity  ) .  The architectural principles of the famous Dilwara temples can be seen here . Only marble  is used in the construction of temple (all  architects carvers and workers were brought from Rajasthan). The  Special Green clour idol is made from the  Quartz selected from the Chellur mines in Karnataka.  Jain acharyas walk all the way to the Gujarati shwetambar Mandir from North India and stay here for 'Chatur Masa'.

Name: Parasmaljain85
Title: good
Review: good to see Good to see Jain temples in South india and specially in Tamilnadu and Chennai. This is quite good to see Jainism culture in Chennai.st Jain Temple in Porur , & ECR are Also Peacefulness at its best , Goushala in Shripermbudur is also a quiet peaceful place

Name: maulik_shah9978
Title: Jain Temple visit
Review: Good to see Jain temples in South india and specially in Tamilnadu and Chennai. This is quite good to see Jainism culture in Chennai through these temples.

Name: Deepali Shah Sarrof
Title: Jain Temple Are At Many Places In Chennai
Review: There are 5 Temples in Sowcarpet But Peaceful Ambience as per my Review is in the Morning And Avoid Going there in Paryushan Parva As there is lot of People coming to do Pooja Etc. In Evenings they do bhakti which Disturbs the peaceful ambieince of temple ( No Offense - I Dont like musical Instruments Playing Songs (Bollywood Converted Songs) for Lord in Temple) Dada Vadi Temple in Ayanavaram Is Peacefulness at its Best Jain Temple in Porur , & ECR are Also Peacefulness at its best , Goushala in Shripermbudur is also a quiet peaceful place

Name: anjujain72
Title: Jain Temple at G N Chett road, chennai
Review: beautiful and peaceful place. Nearby jain temples IN chennai are Chandraprabhu jain temple at Sahukarpet, Jain temple at mylorepur, Jain temple at saidapet .Ancient jain place with many jain temples are around 20 km from chennai at Puzhal village in red hill area , chennai.

Name: arul_nambi2000
Title: A MUST visit in Chennai
Review: I wonder why its not reflected as a attraction in trip advisor? Its worth a visit for the all in chennai and also for the tourists. The ambiance is so peaceful , you will really have the freedom for praying and meditating.

Name: Aravind A
Title: Calm and Peaceful
Review: Clean quite and made of pure white are the plus points when u enter the jain temple. One can find mental solitude on entering and meditate in silence. They are generally not crowded except during the festival season giving one plenty of time to be at mental peace.

Name: shanks123
Title: Good place in between the rush
Review: I have always wanted to visit this place, but alas I never got to visit it for a very long time, This place used to come in my evening walks when I was placed in chennai , still never managed to enter and check out what is in store, one day I just entered and was pleasently surprised by the temple .It is built in a white marble and is surrounded by lots of greenery , as it is very difficult to fathom a such a place in middle of city in T nagar , GN chetty road . I found it very clean and noise free and a good place to visit apart from the asthetic sense .

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Divine
Review: The place is well maintained and has to be appreciated for the cleanliness and calmness. The buildings were mesmerising, garden was beautiful.

Name: rashmi k
Title: Pious and beautiful
Review: The architecture is beautiful. One must visit this for the beauty. God statues inside are also so real and beautiful. The place was windy and hence felt relaxed and peaceful. If informed earlier, can plan for prasadam lunch there itself. Plenty of space for parking. Follow the google maps and make sure you to take a u turn as suggested. If travelling with children, carry water and eatables as nothing is available at a close vicinity. But worth visiting. This temple is in Nemmeli, near Mahabalipuram, ECR. It is open between 7 AM to 7 PM

Name: harleen_sethi
Title: Peaceful Jain Temple
Review: One very famous and beautiful Jain temple is in GN Chetty Road. There are many others in Chennai. It‚Äôs a very calm and serene place to spend some time during your visit. One gets to feel the almighty‚Äôs presence on visiting this temple. God bless!

Title: Good place in between the rush
Review: I have always wanted to visit this place, but alas I never got to visit it for a very long time, This place used to come in my evening walks when I was placed in chennai , still never managed to enter and check out what is in store, one day I just entered and was pleasently surprised by the temple .It is built in a white marble and is surrounded by lots of greenery , as it is very difficult to fathom a such a place in middle of city in T nagar , GN chetty road . I found it very clean and noise free and a good place to visit apart from the asthetic sense .

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Divine
Review: The place is well maintained and has to be appreciated for the cleanliness and calmness. The buildings were mesmerising, garden was beautiful.

Name: rashmi k
Title: Pious and beautiful
Review: The architecture is beautiful. One must visit this for the beauty. God statues inside are also so real and beautiful. The place was windy and hence felt relaxed and peaceful. If informed earlier, can plan for prasadam lunch there itself. Plenty of space for parking. Follow the google maps and make sure you to take a u turn as suggested. If travelling with children, carry water and eatables as nothing is available at a close vicinity. But worth visiting. This temple is in Nemmeli, near Mahabalipuram, ECR. It is open between 7 AM to 7 PM

Name: harleen_sethi
Title: Peaceful Jain Temple
Review: One very famous and beautiful Jain temple is in GN Chetty Road. There are many others in Chennai. It‚Äôs a very calm and serene place to spend some time during your visit. One gets to feel the almighty‚Äôs presence on visiting this temple. God bless!

Name: Anand G
Title: Great ambiance and good architecture
Review: This is a lovely temple (Shanthinath Jain Temple) located in G N Chetty Road. The  main entrance is unpretentious but once you enter the courtyard you are welcomed by the statues of a pair of life sized elephants. That alone would bowl you over. Beyond that the flight of steps lead to the sanctum. As is popular with Jain temples, it is marbles all the way. The architecture is attractive. The atmosphere is  great. The silene is not deafening but pleasant and invigorating. Excellent place to visit to control stress and recharge bang within the city. Its popularity among the devotees is indicated by the number of high end cars arriving and departing the gates throughout the day.

Name: garhwaliya
Title: New and small temple
Review: This temple is very very new but not very big. It is nicely build up. Many Jain community person come here.

Name: Sangeetha Vikram
Title: Shri Shanthinath Jain Temple - Beautiful Marble temple
Review: On a fine evening, I have visited Shri Shanthinath Jain temple at T.Nagar along with my mom. It was a beautiful marble temple with lovely architecture.It was really nice to see Jain culture in South India. The 5 Anuvratas followed by Jains all over the world was really inspiring.1. Non violence - Ahimsa2. Truthfulness - Satya3. Non Stealing - Achaurya4. Chasity - Brahmacharya5. Non possession - AparigrahaThe main deity of the temple was Lord Shanthinath with 2 other shrines - Sunvrath & Shreyasanath on either sides. We participated in 6pm Aarathi and really felt so blissful.

Name: sudaramorthy91
Title: nice temple
Review: the temple is located in nice place.the structure of the building is good.nice to see in this place.

Name: AHUJADS1
Title: Magnificient Temple!!
Review: Lovely architecture , flaunt less view enjoy the beauty, the view and the greenery.Must visit place.

Name: moothayil
Title: jain temple
Review: This Jain temple  is first one in South India , and it is  known as Shree Gujarati Swetamber Jain Mandir.  ( Lord Parshwanatha, the 23rd Teerthankar is the presiding deity  ) .  The architectural principles of the famous Dilwara temples can be seen here . Only marble  is used in the construction of temple (all  architects carvers and workers were brought from Rajasthan). The  Special Green clour idol is made from the  Quartz selected from the Chellur mines in Karnataka.  Jain acharyas walk all the way to the Gujarati shwetambar Mandir from North India and stay here for 'Chatur Masa'.

Name: Parasmaljain85
Title: good
Review: good to see Good to see Jain temples in South india and specially in Tamilnadu and Chennai. This is quite good to see Jainism culture in Chennai.st Jain Temple in Porur , & ECR are Also Peacefulness at its best , Goushala in Shripermbudur is also a quiet peaceful place

Name: maulik_shah9978
Title: Jain Temple visit
Review: Good to see Jain temples in South india and specially in Tamilnadu and Chennai. This is quite good to see Jainism culture in Chennai through these temples.

Name: Deepali Shah Sarrof
Title: Jain Temple Are At Many Places In Chennai
Review: There are 5 Temples in Sowcarpet But Peaceful Ambience as per my Review is in the Morning And Avoid Going there in Paryushan Parva As there is lot of People coming to do Pooja Etc. In Evenings they do bhakti which Disturbs the peaceful ambieince of temple ( No Offense - I Dont like musical Instruments Playing Songs (Bollywood Converted Songs) for Lord in Temple) Dada Vadi Temple in Ayanavaram Is Peacefulness at its Best Jain Temple in Porur , & ECR are Also Peacefulness at its best , Goushala in Shripermbudur is also a quiet peaceful place

Name: anjujain72
Title: Jain Temple at G N Chett road, chennai
Review: beautiful and peaceful place. Nearby jain temples IN chennai are Chandraprabhu jain temple at Sahukarpet, Jain temple at mylorepur, Jain temple at saidapet .Ancient jain place with many jain temples are around 20 km from chennai at Puzhal village in red hill area , chennai.

Name: arul_nambi2000
Title: A MUST visit in Chennai
Review: I wonder why its not reflected as a attraction in trip advisor? Its worth a visit for the all in chennai and also for the tourists. The ambiance is so peaceful , you will really have the freedom for praying and meditating.

Name: Aravind A
Title: Calm and Peaceful
Review: Clean quite and made of pure white are the plus points when u enter the jain temple. One can find mental solitude on entering and meditate in silence. They are generally not crowded except during the festival season giving one plenty of time to be at mental peace.
